Reviews.Author: Marwan K.
Reviews.Content: This is really delicious burger. I tried #5 and #10 they both really good.everything in the place is just awesome. The services, the design, and the people who works their.

Reviews.Author: Barbara B.
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable burger.  This place is more about the toppings and less about the meat.  The meat patty is thin which allows the toppings to shine.  I had the burger with onion strings and blue cheese.  I enjoyed it but not as much as my burger at the Butcher and the Burger.  I just like biting into a big juicy burger which I did not get here.    Atmosphere is warm and kind of funky, pretty loud inside.   Had to shout to hear my date.  Minus a star for the sweet potato fries, they were really disappointing with a light lemon aioli that I did not at all care for.  Would try one of the other fries.

Reviews.Author: Jesse T.
Reviews.Content: Very creative burgers. The accessories (fries, shakes, mac and cheese) could be a successful restaurant on their own without the outstanding meat, but I'm glad they're together here.The beer list is very good, and the waitstaff are great. The place gets crowded (and loud) when the weekend rolls around, but it's worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany R.
Reviews.Content: Service was amazingly great,  Effie is super cool. I admit I am vegetarian so I only got a veggie burger which was good. They have a good number of beers and Effie will help you find the beer of your liking. I will be back with my meat eating friends.

Reviews.Author: Chelsea B.
Reviews.Content: Well I decided that since I have never ordered anything other then the lamb burger that I should branch out a bit. The last 2 times I visited DMK I ordered different things. I can happily say that the patty melt and the burger with the blueberry BBQ sauce are both just as amazing at the lamb. This is great and unfortunate news. Because now it will make deciding what to get much more difficult.

Reviews.Author: Bridgid R.
Reviews.Content: The #6 is the best burger ever, but the Parmesan fries rocked too.  This is my new favorite burger joint!

Reviews.Author: Kassidy D.
Reviews.Content: I had the lamb burger and was really pleased! The bun tasted fresh. It was delicious as were the Wisconsin cheddar and scallion fries. The service was great and it seemed like a really great place to go and hang out. I went with 3 people on a Monday and had no problem with a wait. It wasn't overpriced at all, I would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Author: Tues T.
Reviews.Content: Oh YES. These burgers are GOOD. so are the fries.The BIG salad isn't that big. 3 adults shared the salad, 2 orders of fries (Parmesan, Truffle Cream and the Amish Blue & Smoked Bacon) and we each got a burger. PERFECT. Also LOVED the pineapple basil soda!

Reviews.Author: Justin G.
Reviews.Content: Great burger fun atmosphere.  They have a rewards program which is nice.  Honestly my second favorite burger in the city, but the reality is it comes down to preference between DMK and Kuma's (my wife likes DMK better).

Reviews.Author: Emily H.
Reviews.Content: Amazing milk shakes. I got the s'more shake and it tastes just like a toasted marshmallow! I had the bartender add khalua and it was great.

Reviews.Author: Colleen T.
Reviews.Content: I'll keep it short and sweet. Not the best burger I've ever eaten, but definitely top 10. opt for their special burgers because you never you what you're going to miss out on. let me skip to the part I really care about...their fries. I'm not just talking about the stupid potatoes. but I AM going to rave about the truffle sauce it comes with. seriously people, please have a warning on the menu that states these fries may cause an orgasmic reaction. now granted, I'm pretty sure this is my first time I've had truffle oil anything.. but holy shit, it was like losing my virginity again. that is all. have a nice day.

Reviews.Author: Christina L.
Reviews.Content: Honestly it was okay. We went on a double lunch date here with some pals last week and it was good, but not worth the hype. The couple we went with ordered the salmon burger as well as the #5 (bison burger with blueberry bbq sauce).  They ordered off the segment from Diners drive ins and dives. The bison burger was up to par and was a good burger but we agreed not as good as kumas. The salmon burger was shared by my friend and I and truthfully it was a let down. On triple D, Guy was talking it up and when i got it, it was almost overwhelming fishy and way to strong on the curry aiolli. We both had a few bites but were dissatisfied with how strong the curry was.Our boyfriends enjoyed their burgers (the bison burger and the patty melt). My boyfriend upgraded his patty melt to a double and added a fried egg, and he loved it. The only complaint was the plates were too small for such a messy burger. To my dissatisfaction of my salmon burger, he ordered me the milkshake off the day (a toasted marshmallow milkshake). That was simply the best milkshake of my life. We also got the cheddar fries to share and they were good but just standard merits cheddar with scallions. But they were still good. Overall I would go to a different burger joint before this place again. It wasn't horrible by any means but it just wasn't worth all the hype.

Reviews.Author: Kate U.
Reviews.Content: I am a fan of DMK Burger bar.  Everyone knows this place from its reputation and from Diners, Drive-ins and Dives.  There are definitely some GREAT things about this place.  The burgers are probably the most unique burgers you will ever have in your life.  I highly recommend the blueberry bbq sauce (I know it sounds weird, but trust me it's really good.)  The burger buns are very different and something you won't have anywhere else, it truly is a gourmet burger.  The burger melts in your mouth, they are able to do something so unique and bring out a ton of different flavors.The fries are amazing as well, they aren't your typical standard fries and there are a variety of different types. They complement the burger really well.  In my experience, the servers have always been really knowledgeable and helpful in telling you exactly what is on each burger and helping you make a decision.However the below is what keeps me from giving 5 stars:-  You can't customize your burger really in any way,  for example I would LOVE lettuce & tomato on the #2, but you can't add it.  -  Fries do not come with the burger, you need to pay for them separately.  This makes the bill so much higher... because who doesn't get fries with a burger?  Also they come in a really large size when you order them, so a lot of them end up going to waste at the end.  Anyways, this is probably the best gourmet burger I've ever had, I just wish that for the price that you pay they would give you fries with it and let you somewhat customize the burgers.

Reviews.Author: J D.
Reviews.Content: Awesome experience. #4 burger with green chilis, fried egg and bacon on fresh made bun was fantastic. Cheddar and scallion fries were great and marshmallow milkshake was delicious. Service was fast and very nice. Best burger experience ever!

Reviews.Author: Amanda W.
Reviews.Content: Delicious burgers! I had the #2 as a turkey burger. Perfect size, deliciously juicy burger. I also kind of love that you can only delete ingredients not substitute. Had the sweet potato fries with lemon Tabasco aioli -yum! Very enjoyable atmosphere, but it is in the loud side.

Reviews.Author: Mark M.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited last night after hearing about DMK through Diners Drive-ins and Dives. We stopped by on a Saturday evening at about 8:00pm -- the place was rockin. We waited about 20-30 minutes at the bar and then were seated. The beer list offers terrific options and the bar serves some nice cocktails. The food was excellent and memorable. I had the #1 burger with cheddar, bacon, and BBQ sauce and my gf had the salmon burger. We shared and both were outstanding. We also enjoyed the salt and pepper fries with tasty spicy house ketchup. Price-wise, DMK was moderate. It's not a cheap meal but not crazy expensive either. Our meal of two burgers, fries, and a round of beer was under $50 with tip. The only downside of the evening was the service, which was a bit slow. We waited for another round of beers for too long, so that's what keeps this review from being 5 stars.We'll likely return and would definitely recommend DMK Burger Bar to other foodies that love a great burger and a lively ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Chris V.
Reviews.Content: Amazing burger and great fries! If you don't want a big meal I highly recommend coming here after your first few drinks and going to the bar and getting some fries, split them between two people enjoy a beer and move on.

Reviews.Author: Gina S.
Reviews.Content: I love DMK.  Very good burger, GREAT fries, nice servers.  It is my stand by burger place in the city.  After my last Kumas experience, I will be at DMK much more.  You cannot go wrong with anything on their menu.

Reviews.Author: Michelle B.
Reviews.Content: DMK is my go to burger joint.  One thing I love about this place is the portion size.  The burgers and fries are not ridiculously big like Kumas or lockdown.  It is also big enough that I leave feeling full.  I have had almost every burger on the menu and they are all fantastic!  My favorites are the #7 big DMK burger or the #13 crispy portobello.  All the fries are great as well but I always order the blue cheese and bacon or parmesan truffle cream.  Not only is everything on the menu amazing they also have a great alcohol selection.  If you are looking for a nice laid back burger joint with great drinks at a reasonable price I highly recommend DMK.

Reviews.Author: Mike A.
Reviews.Content: Hands down the tastiest burgers in town if are in the mood for gourmet burgers ( oxymoron?) but they pull it off well.This is good in a non five guys kind of way...it's a more refined combination of flavours ( the blue cheese chipotle burger is amazing!).I have been here at least a dozen times and really like the vibe just note that it can get a little loud which makes it hard to talk over.Beyond that, always a consistent treat! Truffle fries, sea salt and black pepper fries and Wisconsin cheddar are a must'

Reviews.Author: Britt C.
Reviews.Content: Someone has to review the veggie burger, right?  Well, it was fantastic!  Nice chew, and didn't fall apart.  The bun was truly what set this apart from other burgers, however.  It was so soft and fluffy, but REAL!  Definitely not a sticky "enriched" white bread bun.This was one of those times when I wish I drank liquor, because the cocktail list looked great, with a nice mix of herbal and (real) fruit offerings.  But, the beer list was commendable, and that always goes with a burger.FInally, the fries!  They have a varied selection of hand-cut fries, all of which looked great.  We went with the sweet potato fries that came with tabasco-lemon dip, and the parmesan-truffle fries, which were amazing!  I might go back just for fries and booze.Fun, clean atmosphere.  I will be back!

Reviews.Author: Rick T.
Reviews.Content: Maybe I'm just done with this whole burger thing or maybe my expectations are too high.So, yeah. This is a burger joint where the fries taste exactly like 99% of the other places that slice potatoes and throw them into hot oil for 3 minutes.I got an entry-level burger, which came topped with cheddar and pickled onions. My first impression: Shouldn't a burger bar give you a BURGER?  I mean, you know, a real manly half-pound minimum burger. DMK gives you--spitballing here--a one-third pound burger that doesn't exactly hide but certainly doesn't dominate the sandwich. If I want a pussy boy burger, I'd go to a pussy boy burger place. Gimme a goddam BURGER.On top of that, DMK deploys one of my least-favorite restaurant practices in the whole world: They sell soft drinks by the can in a waiter-service restaurant and charge you for each one. That's crap. If I want to overpay for soft drinks at a restaurant, I'll go to, like, Brazzaz where they sell 8-ounce bottles for $3 a piece while I chomp on an endless supply of intentionally over-salted meat.Oh, right. How was did the burger taste? Like a burger with a little too much bun. The picked onions were good.

Reviews.Author: Jacob H.
Reviews.Content: Favorite burger spot. Fries are great.  Shakes are great. Burgers are great. Atmosphere is great. Even the drinks are great. Get a DMK card to earn some points. I earned my dmk shirt and it is sooo comfy. Oh yeah- No. 5 no. 7 No. 1 add bacon. Dang. Everything is good. Enjoy!

Reviews.Author: Leah C.
Reviews.Content: Apparently I'm the minority (not the first time!) but I was less than impressed by DMK Burger Bar.  With SO many options for delicious burgers throughout the city, I expected great things from a place with "Burger Bar" in the name.First, let's discuss the drinks.  I ordered "Respect Your Elders" and unfortunately it tasted syrupy and extremely artificial.  My boyfriend ordered "The Smash" and while it was drinkable, it wasn't memorable.So, back to those burgers.  Maybe my expectations were unfounded but I was SHOCKED by the size of the burgers.  Do not go here if you're looking to bite into a big juicy burger (a la Butcher & The Burger).  In fact, my experience gave me exactly the opposite - a small, thin, slightly dry patty.  Consider your expectations forewarned.My fondest memory of the meal would definitely be the fries.  As a table we ordered the Sweet Potato Fries, Parmesan Truffle Cream fries, and Wisconsin Cheddar & Scallion fries - They were all pretty darn delicious.  They're cut a little on the smaller/thin side so don't expect any wedges or steak fries but the seasonings and dips are quite tasty.All in all, a decent place but I didn't think it lived up to the hype.  I'd only go back if someone else was dying to go there.

Reviews.Author: Mark C.
Reviews.Content: So my fiancee Sara finally moved in last weekend!   An exciting but exhausting day left us in the evening wanting to take a much needed break - from moving, from wedding planning, from kitchen planning, and what better way to take a break than to hit up one of our favorite spots - DMK burger bar.  We got there around 6pm on a Saturday night and luckily was able to snag a table within 15 or 20 minutes.DMK Burger Bar was the first of many joint projects from restauranteur David Morton and chef Michael Kornick, and while it seems like it was just recently that it opened up, DMK has been a fixture in Lakeview for almost 5 years now.To start, we got an order of the fried pickles and okra, the pickles extremely sweet and flavorful, Sara took most of the okra, but I snagged a piece - cut in longitundinal slices as opposed to the usual crosswise gives it a different texture.  And who doesn't love ranch with anything fried?#4 - Fried Egg, hatched green chile, sonoma jack, Smoked BaconFor a go-to burger, the #4 is one of my favorites.  While I'm beginning to think that a burger with a fried egg doesn't really need any cheese on it, the sonoma jack here gets a bit lost.  Not that it's a bad thing.  The flavorful, well cooked burger mixes perfectly with the fried egg, and the fresh buns soften up as it soaks up the egg yolk.   The green chile adds just the right amount of spice to the stack.  And I think one of the best parts about DMK is that they don't overpile the ingredients, and they don't try to do too much (again, a la Kuma's)  And as tempting as it to upgrade to a double, I held some restraint.Shrimp burger, ginger, cilantro, sesame ginger slawSara went with the shrimp burger - the special #15.  She loved it so much, I didn't get much of a taste, but with one bite, I could tell this was a keeper.  Very original, very tasty - her words.For sides, we went with fries over mac and cheese - got an order of sweet potato fries with a subtle lemon tabasco aioli and the fries with amish blue topped with smoked bacon.  Neither was as good as their cheddar and scallion fries or their parmesan truffle, but both were solid.  The sweet potato fries were well cooked, but not as crisp as I would have liked, and the lemon mayo was pretty subtle and didn't add much.  The blue cheese and bacon fries were heavily topped and the blue cheese doesn't spread well and makes it a bit difficult to scoop up the ingredients, but it's a solid dish.Based on the quality of the DMK Burger Bar, you can see why the DMK empire is rapidly expanding.  Good choices, solid ingredients, good atmosphere.  The beer list is formidable, and the have a decent selections of bourbon for a burger joint.   It's not the place for massive appetites, if you're looking for pure size, go somewhere else, but if you want a good, solid, well-sized burger, DMK is a great option.pics and details on my blog:eatinginchicago2014.word…

Reviews.Author: Jay S.
Reviews.Content: DMK used to be one of my favorite burger bars, but our experience last night dropped it completely off the scale for me. They've done something new with how they salt and spice their burgers and it's just bad. I had the #8 and my cousin had the bison burger - neither one of us could taste the meat or toppings apart from the salty, spice flavoring. Way too overpowering. And on a side note, maybe I'm getting too old, but having to yell at the person across from me just to hear isn't that fun. I'd consider getting take-out from these guys if I were begged, but other than that I'm done with them.

Reviews.Author: Jim S.
Reviews.Content: One of the better burgers I had ever had. The atmosphere was a bit dark and loud, but the food and beer selection were outstanding. Highly recommend eating here.

Reviews.Author: Magen R.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for DMK! This place is truly one of the gems in Lakeview as far as I am concerned. I love everything about their food and every time I come I'm overwhelmed with great choices so I'll review my most recent visit this past Saturday afternoon. After a bit of mimosa fun a girlfriend's who lives nearby we headed to DMK for some food and a beverage. We were all pretty hungry so we started out with their macaroni and cheese which was simple but delicious as was evident by the three of us basically inhaling it in less than ten minutes. For my meal I split the special, a fried shrimp burger, with one of my friends and we got the salt and pepper and sweet potato fries for the table. I've never had a shrimp burger before but DMK made me so glad I tried one. It had just the right amount of crunch and had a great flavor. As for the fries... amazing! They definitely take it to the next level with their awesome dipping sauces, the lemony one that came with the sweet potato fries was outstanding and I loved the spicy ketchup that took their salt and pepper fries to the next level. I've never had a bad experience at DMK and I doubt I ever will, it's a great spot!

Reviews.Author: Sonya L.
Reviews.Content: This is a cool place. Modern decor, nice and friendly servers, huge burgers, yummy cocktails.  We ordered the onion straws and parmesan fries to get the meal started. For vegans and vegetarians you should know the fries are fried in something with beef which our server was nice enough to inform us without asking.  But that's a bit disappointing since it was one of the reasons I went to begin with.  The Mac and cheese was very creamy which I love. The veggie patty was fine with good texture and flavor.  I highly recommend the Smash drink if you like mint, as it was very refreshing.  All in all a satisfying meal and I have nothing bad to say about the experience. I'd go back if I was in the mood for heavy food and friends were going, but I won't go back on my own since I like fries with my veggie burger.

Reviews.Author: Abby H.
Reviews.Content: Delicious burgers, but the prices were really high considering you had to order fries separately. The buns are made in house, which is extra delicious!

Reviews.Author: Kori E.
Reviews.Content: We came on a Wednesday night and we were quoted 30 minutes - I was shocked, I don't think I realized it would be this busy. We were seated within that time frame and everything came out super fast. Our waitress was great, but some substitutions that someone wanted to make to their burger were denied. He wanted the lamb burger with a portabello mushroom on top - apparently this couldn't be done. Why? I don't know. Another set back - they seemed to be out of a lot of stuff. It was kinda weird.BUT - on to the food. The burgers and fries and mac n cheese were fantastic. I had the #1 and it was great. The burgers are not huge, which I prefer. The truffle fries were my fave as were the blue cheese fries. The portions are not all that large and for 5 people we devoured all of it. We didn't have a problem with service so that was a plus. I would definitely come back here - I don't know if I would wait 2 hours, but I would come back...

Reviews.Author: Luis O.
Reviews.Content: Although the taste is good I was disappointed on the fact that the patties were rather thin. We ordered an order of fries that came with cheese. The cheese wasn't very good so we returned the fries. They were pretty cool with taking it back and bringing us a different kind. They also included a free blood orange soda for everyone at the table for our dissatisfaction. The soda was freaking amazing. I would recommend getting that drink.

Reviews.Author: Cait K.
Reviews.Content: Let it be known how much I love DMK. I love the new location in Evanston, but this space is much larger, and the menu more extensive.Came here on a whim with my fiance after seeing a show at Second City, and it was hopping at 6:30 on a Saturday. We elected to wait at the bar with drinks until our table was ready. Their draft selection was pretty awesome- I'm a pale ale girl all the way, and I had at least 4 options. We were able to get seats and the service was friendly and prompt.We got seated after about 25 (fast) minutes, and I was SO pleased with our server. He was really friendly in his interactions and pretty funny. After a string of bad service recently, it was really refreshing to go somewhere where the waiter actually seemed happy we were there. He also brought us a shamrock shake to split at the end of our meal, which was a really nice touch. I'm not super into mint, milkshakes, or dessert in general, but I thought it was nicely done for what it was, and the fiancee made quick work of both glasses. (Oh yeah- he split it into two glasses for us- SO NICE).We ordered the cheddar fries to share, and they were amazing. The scallions are a nice, fresh touch to an otherwise pretty heavy item. We seriously considered ordering the blue cheese fries, too, but decided we should save something for next time! I ordered the lamb burger (I pretty much order lamb anywhere it's an option), and it did not disappoint. I loved the salty feta, olive tapenade, creamy tzatziki, and crispy cucumbers as toppings. I would definitely order this again. My fiance ordered the big DMK, and he loved it. He's a burger purist, and this was the perfect option for him- an elevated Big Mac.Delicious food, great service, and a good beer menu- we'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Monica B.
Reviews.Content: I loooove the bison burger!  Meat is perfectly cooked and the blueberry bbq sauce, goat cheese and pickled onions create for an amazing combination.  The burgers here aren't as ginormous as Kuma's, but they are just as delicious.I've sampled the chocolate shake which is also delicious.  But the winner for me are the fries!  I looove the parmesan with truffle cream.  You need to eat these while they're hot and fresh.The rest of the menu looks great, but I can't help but stick to my favorites!

Reviews.Author: Nida K.
Reviews.Content: I really really liked my food hereI got the bison burger, the #5 No complaintswe also got the parmesan fries, sweet potato fries, and the onion strings. The first two were great, the onion strings were only okay. Too much breading, not enough onion.I want to come back here!

Reviews.Author: Lauren L.
Reviews.Content: The place was crowded but we sat down quickly and just in time for the lunch rush. The burgers were perfectly proportioned and cooked to perfection. And then the fries for the table were the delicious. We had no complaints at all and even received some free mixed shots from the bar just cause. I would love to go back and try the parmesan fries and a bison burger, we'll be back for sure!

Reviews.Author: Heather L.
Reviews.Content: Best burger in the city. For sure. Don't even say the word "Kuma." Their veggie patties are also amazing. The price is worth it for high quality food and chef-quality flavor combos. Try the salt and pepper fries or the Wisconsin cheddar. Both are incredible. It gets loud on weekend nights but it's a fun place. Go early and go often.

Reviews.Author: Taylor M.
Reviews.Content: DMK Burger was awesome.  It gives Kuma's a run for its money!  When we arrived on a Saturday night around 8 pm there was an hour wait for two people which is about what I expected.  But, we grabbed drinks at the bar and time passed quickly.  By the time we were seated our tummies were grumbling, enticed by the savory smells.Our eyes were bigger than our tummies, so we ordered the blue cheese and bacon fries, Mac and Cheese #2, Fried Okra and Pickles and each got a burger.  The Mac and Cheese was just okay, while everything else I ate was incredible.  The fried okra and pickles were a great combination.  The fries had a ton of cheese and bacon on top of them and were super rich.  I ordered what I think was called the Chipotle Burger.  It had guacamole and other deliciousness on it.  Needless to say, we were not able to finish everything!The service was fabulous and the food was great.  I am sure I will be back!

Reviews.Author: Linda B.
Reviews.Content: I thought DMK Burger Bar was okay, but Kuma's is the gold standard and I couldn't help comparing the two.  Really, I'm not sure that DMK BB was better than places like 25 Degrees or Big & Little's.  There are just so many spots in Chicago to get a really good burger that I can't imagine going back to wait in line here again.We got to DMK BB around 6:30pm on Sat night and I was hoping that would be early enough to avoid a massive wait.  No such luck.  We had been waiting about 45 minutes when seats at the bar opened up and we grabbed them.  I started with the DMK mojito with 10 cane rum.  It was not bad, but not good either.  Something was off with the mixture, maybe not enough sugar, and the drink ended up being just okay.I had burger #4 (Roasted Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack, Smoked Bacon) and I thought that the meat lacked seasoning.  I also had macaroni and cheese #2 (Gruyere, Smoked Bacon, Charred Balsamic Red Onions)...again, it was just okay.  The flavors weren't particularly good or interesting (by contrast, I have been blown away by some of the mac and cheese combos at Kuma's).  The truffle and parmesan fries were very good though.On the whole, I'm glad I tried it but a return visit is unlikely.

Reviews.Author: Bryant H.
Reviews.Content: The Burger******* I inhaled  was with aged cheddar smoked bacon, charred balsamic, red onions, rufus teague's bbq sauce was on point. The Parmesan Fries*** with truffle creamAmazing. The customer service was great because I asked for the shamrock shake and they were out. They gave me a free voucher to get the shake when it comes in the next day.

Reviews.Author: K R.
Reviews.Content: Cool burger spot. This was a cool experience. The staff was very friendly and the atmosphere was laid back. Our waiter JACK was awesome. We tried 2 different burgers, 2 different fries, 3 different dipping sauce, the mac and cheese and the peanut butter shake. None of it was disappointing. My 5yr old loved the fries and mac and cheese even though it was fancier than he normally gets it. The burgers were great, we will return.

Reviews.Author: Megan H.
Reviews.Content: Fancy fancy burgers with a side of chill vibes :) I'll definitely be back! So happy the Goldplaited Gals told me about this place....perks of working down the street on Sheffield :) plus I heard they have adult milkshakes?!?! Must try next time!

Reviews.Author: Bran G.
Reviews.Content: Burgers, beers, and atmosphere are all 5 stars at DMK! It is a crowded place so be prepared to wait but there is a long bar with an extensive beer and cocktail list, good tunes, and TVs; giddy up on a bar stool and chill with your group. For being so popular, I didn't feel overcrowded or squeezed into a waiting area. Burger was brilliant and grass-fed which only semi-paleo nerds like me care about. Basically your cow was not given steroids or drugs in order to beef it up (pun intended) meaning you are not eating steroids or drugs. Anyway, I got the #5 Bison Burger and it was awesome. The pickled onions and goat cheese were a great combo and the blueberry BBQ was not overly sweet but actually provided some tang. Had sweet potato fries too which were delicious but I don't think you can go wrong with any of the fries on the menu. Also head the chili of the day is always a sleeper that can knock your socks off.

Reviews.Author: Hallie K.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers and at a good price, but no create your own option if that's what's you're looking for. We came in around 7:30 on a Friday night and sat down at the bar. We had great service, and we were lucky enough to receive 3 free samples! We tried the rhubarb milkshake, truffle fries, and cheese fries which were all good in addition to the 2 burgers and onion strings that we ordered.

Reviews.Author: Siddharth M.
Reviews.Content: DMK is brilliant. Service is good, beer is better and the food is brilliant. I had Number 4 on the menu Roasted Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack, Smoked Bacon and boy, was it hot? The meat was supple and succulent, and the combination with the fries was fantastic.Thumbs up!

Reviews.Author: Kayleigh M.
Reviews.Content: I love DMK! The food is amazing, and the atmosphere is really relaxed and laid back. I'm not usually a "gourmet" burger kinda girl, but I adore the bison burger with blueberry barbecue sauce, and goat cheese. My only complaint would be the lack of a "normal" burger on the menu... sometimes I'm in the mood for a no-frills cheeseburger. I always make sure to order fries--they don't come included with your burger. It's always an emotional struggle to choose between the parmesan fries with truffle cream, or the sweet potato fries with lemon tabasco aioli. Great beer menu too!

Reviews.Author: Elliott M.
Reviews.Content: Head to toe, a delicious meal! Not enough great things to say about DMK. I got their veggie burger and it was everything I hoped: hot, tasty and filling! The topping combos are also to-die for. And the shamrock shake for St. Patrick's Day was out of this world good. I finished it and immediately wanted another one!The only negatives I have are that their fries aren't vegetarian. They do, however, have vegetarian onion straws and fried pickles which begs the question: why??

Reviews.Author: Mary B.
Reviews.Content: A common misconception is that I live at DMK Burger Bar. Or that I live nearby in Lakeview.  Slightly afraid to admit to the nice staff that I actually live in Hyde Park, approximately 63 minutes away on CTA. There's a reason why I keep coming back to dine at this fabulous establishment. Correction, multiple reasons. I have never tried a burger here that I wasn't thrilled with. I was given the recommendation to come here by a good friend of mine. He joined their softball team at one point because he visited there often enough. (This makes me feel slightly better about how often I'm here...)This most recent visit, I had the #1. The burger is topped with aged cheddar, smoked bacon, charred balsamic, red onions & Rufus Teague's BBQ sauce. Amazing. I admit, I am particularly fond of good BBQ sauce. The Rufus Teague's variation knocked my socks off. Combining the sweet aspects of the sauce with the savory flavors of the smoked bacon is brilliant. As far as cheddar cheese goes, the aged cheddar was delightfully melted and provided a necessary sharpness to the toppings of the burger. The red onions were sautéed and complimented the rest of the toppings well, although beware, you may end up with a couple in your lap if you aren't careful.. Other burger recommendations include the #11 which features a lamb patty and the #4, a classic combination of fried egg & bacon atop a savory burger. But honestly, you can't go wrong with any of the options. My friend (who was experiencing DMK for the first time) went with the #4 and had difficulty controlling the yolk while eating the burger. (Side note, she is in the need of a cowboy from Texas who can bridle both the fried egg on her burger and her wild, untamed heart)Now onto even more reasons why I basically live here: the sides. As a friend remarked during lunch on Sunday, the burgers get you in the door but the fries keep you coming back. My friends and I split three different sides on this visit. The sea salt & black pepper fries are great and come with the house ketchup. The sweet potato fries come with a lemon tobasco aioli which is delicious. Combining the bitter citrus taste of lemon with the richness of the sweet potatoes is bizarre but amazing. The fried okra and pickles side is also fantastic and is the perfect addition to a scrumptious burger. Overall, I love DMK Burger Bar. It's a great, casually-hip restaurant that I always recommend to friends when they are in Chicago. Definitely worth the trip. Proud to say that I am now a member of the DMK Rewards Club.

Reviews.Author: Alexandria T.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I came here after a show at the Vic on a Saturday night about a month ago.  They were able to seat us in about ten minutes because of how late in the evening it was.  We were starving and were excited to score a table so quickly.They have a fantastic beer selection and we were able to try some new brews, which as beer lovers is always a plus.  This was my second visit to DMK, but my first since Yelping.  The first time I didn't love it, but I was more than willing to give it a second go because of all of the hype.  I ordered the veggie burger without any changes.  We also ordered the Wisconsin cheddar and scallion fries.  The server immediately disclosed that the fries are not vegetarian because they are cooked in some type of animal fat.  I'm not super, super strict, so I am ok with this, and I really appreciated her honesty about the potentially questionably ingredients.Our food came out quickly which was great because I was starving.  Once again, I was very disappointed by the veggie burger.  It has a soggy consistency, and the flavor falls way too short for all of the hype this place receives.  My favorite part of my meal was the fries.  I definitely wouldn't wait to eat here for over an hour, and I probably won't be back because there are many other places in the city that have awesome veggie burgers.

Reviews.Author: Hersh A.
Reviews.Content: Go here for good tasty burgers, their nice flavored house sodas and thick, rich & creamy milkshakes. I enjoyed all of that on my 1st visit recently. If you like lamb, try their lamb burger #11. I liked the taziki sauce & feta cheese combo. Try their Pineapple+Basil soda & Espresso milkshake as well. The milkshake flavor was super delicious. I loved the drinks I had.  I also liked their sweet potato fries & onion strings. Good menu variety. The ambiance is okay.  A bit too noisy for my liking and a bit pricey as well. But it's definitely worth a visit. 3.5 stars

Reviews.Author: Liz C.
Reviews.Content: I live right by DMK and go there a bunch. Whenever I am craving a burger and fries, this is my go-to spot. I have a frequent diner card, so it is about time I write a review.  Honestly, all DMK restaurants do it right.  I specifically love Ada St. and DMK burger bar.  The staff are always attentive, knowledgeable, and honestly the shit.  They just take care of the customer and make it a good experience.My favorite burgers are probably the #5 and #6, the bison and chorizo burgers. And the fries...so damn good.  Don't go in there and not order fries.  Love the sweet potato ones and the truffle parmesan ones are amazing too.Let's not forget about those shakes.  Even when I don't think I will really like it, they change my mind.  One time, the special was a carmel corn shake (for some reason I'm not huge on carmel)...and it converted me.Even if you're not in the neighborhood, hit DMK up.  It has bangin burgers, fries, beer, and shakes.

Reviews.Author: Sylvia C.
Reviews.Content: Looks like this place has been reviewed to death, so I will say this:Amish Blue and Smoked bacon fries. That's a meal by itself and decadently heavy.Their burgers are solid. I had the lamb, bison, and one with egg. I have to say, the blueberry comes out in the bison burger, and with the goat cheese and meat, was a fantastic flavor combo.

Reviews.Author: Anthony H.
Reviews.Content: Burger #4: Roasted Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack, Smoked Bacon..... Awesome combo to say the least. I've been here multiple times and the service has always been great. This month their special was a black bean chili which you can add as a topping on anything for only a buck extra. Instinctively ordered that on their Wisconsin Cheddar & Scallion fries. Sooo gooood.

Reviews.Author: Denzell W.
Reviews.Content: DMK is without a doubt my favorite place to get a burger in Chicago. It's usually about a 25-30 minute wait to get in, but it's well worth it. The selection of beer is great, the variety of burgers is from Bison - Crab - BBQ. The music, servers, seating--- everything makes sense here.Great for a group of friends or a first date (laid-back).

Reviews.Author: Frankie C.
Reviews.Content: I have been to DMK Burger a couple times before, and the service keeps getting better!! Service: I have always had spectacular service here. Marie is my fav server, hands down! Also, the GM, Michael, is such a doll. Food: They have one burger and one beer that they rotate on the menu, so you can try something new each time you go. There is never a long wait once you place your order. Quality unmatched! Their wide beer selection is a huge bonus. Ambiance: Fantastic layout! Just want a beer, go to the bar. Want to sit down and enjoy a bison burger (nom nom), you can also do that, too. Cost Factor: On par with other burger bars. Overall: F-A-B-U-L-O-U-S.

Reviews.Author: Nicole J.
Reviews.Content: DMK just continues to get it right. This has become my favorite place in the city for a weekend meal. Burgers are delicious, quality grass fed yumminess, and on the thinner side the way I prefer. They also make their own buns (bonus points), which are perfect and thin enough to not take away from the overall burger, but also to allow you to actually take a bite without the fillings spilling out. Double bonus points for the amazing sauces and eclectic toppings, as well as the super delicious fries. (Truffle Parmesan are the bomb). We also like to order the deviled eggs as an app (ten times better than your mom makes I promise).Oh, and triple bonus points for the amazingly prompt, kind and attentive servers, they are the icing on the cake. Best burger bar hands down.

Reviews.Author: Amy W.
Reviews.Content: We had scheduled Franks 'n Dawgs for today, sadly we looked online and they are closed Mondays so we were denied.  We decided we needed a sammy or a burger and this was in the neighborhood with good reviews, so we hiked in the falling snow to get there.There were 3 burgers I was focused on - either the pastrami burger the hatch green chili burger, or the Lamb burger. I decided to go lamb only b/c it is more unusual to find on a menu.  Then we decided on a large truffle fries and the onion strings - our lovely waitress Patience (that's her name) offer to get us just a 1/2 order of the onion strings since we were ordering a lot (that is not offered on the menu - so a super nice touch).  The lamb burger was with cucumber feta and olive tapenade. It tasted like a gyro burger and a damn fine choice, loved it.  My friend got the patty melt - Really good but a bit greasy. Bacon was nice and thickly cut.  As we were finishing our meal, a nice waiter came by with a split of a strawberry shake (in 2 glasses) - saying Patience "sent this to us a a special treat"  It was the special shake of the month and it was great. I can't remember the last time I had a shake, but it sure was creamy and fresh strawberry tasting.Apparently these folks own Ada Street (which I loved) and  fish place (next door) too.

Reviews.Author: John V.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love DMK. I usually get the bacon cheeseburger with truffle fries. bartenders and wait staff are very friendly. it's sometimes pricier then other burger places but the food is top notch. I always enjoy visiting DMK with friends. Great job to all!

Reviews.Author: Miguel C.
Reviews.Content: Just another burger place, but a pretty good one.The location and decor are excellent.  I love the large chalk board letting you know what beers are available.  Nothing quite like a good beer and a good burger.  I had the big DMK burger, which I enjoyed thoroughly.  Make sure to get some fries as well, they've got a few options, all of which are delicious.

Reviews.Author: Sabra R.
Reviews.Content: 10 stars!!!  So this is actually my third review.  I was in Chicago on business and drove 25 minutes to DMK two nights in a row.  The second night, I decided to take a burger home to my other half so she could experience bliss once again (she hadn't had one in over 2 years).  I ended up ordering 4--two #10s for me and a #1 and #3 for her.  The bartender was amazing--she packed all of the wet items (condiments and lettuce and tomatoes) separately so the bread wouldn't get soggy in transit.  Oh yeah, forgot to mention that I live in DC and planned to take the burgers on my flight the following day!  I got almost all the way back to the hotel when I realized that I'd forgotten to order her burgers with turkey instead of beef.  She eats beef but the turkey is just otherworldly.  SO i actually turned around, drove 20 mins BACK on the highway, just to order a double turkey burger so she could switch out her beef.  Crazy??  No.  Obbessed?  Perhaps.  The turkey burgers are just that damn  good!  One day, one city, 615 miles and $85 dollars later, the turkey burgers are STILL the best we have ever had!   Ok, this is my last review.  But I need the Head Chef to call me or write me.  I MUST HAVE THIS RECIPE.  I promise not to share.  We just can't wait another year for this magic!

Reviews.Author: Radha K.
Reviews.Content: I love DMK! It's a great place to grab drinks and it's burgers are pretty incredible. The chorizo burger is my personal favorite but the bison burger is just as good. You really can't go wrong here...great beer and great food! The atmosphere is great...great music. Great service. I just love it.

Reviews.Author: Erica S.
Reviews.Content: I love burgers, and I love meat. At DMK I seriously had the best veggie burger of all time. Made with brown rice and veggies and cheese that melts in your mouth, this is a meal I'll have to come back for just to satisfy my craving. Even better, the prices are super decent- $9 for my burger. Fries are extra on the side, but so worth it (sweet potato are to die for).The servers are super nice and friendly, they have great beer on tap, and make their own crafty cocktails. What more could you want?

Reviews.Author: Jenny N.
Reviews.Content: The truffle sauce is a must have!Burgers were flawless...environment was nice.The place gets pack very quickly.The only flaw was not enough staff.

Reviews.Author: P T.
Reviews.Content: Burgers were ok, not the best ever and certainly not worth the price.  In addition this place is too LOUD to have any kind of conversation.  I will NOT return.

Reviews.Author: Sarah S.
Reviews.Content: Wow. Wow. Wow. My boyfriend and I visited DMK Burger Bar about a week ago during a short getaway to see the Cubs. We stopped in DMK Burger Bar after finding an ad for it in our hotel magazine. After reading some reviews we decided to go.The place was packed but conveniently enough, there were two seats at the bar. We were immediately greeted by the bartender, Andrew. He was SO knowledgable about the beers they offered AND the menu. Since we were new to the place, he had no problem tour guiding us to find something we both would love. We started off with the Fried Okra and Pickles. They were awesome. For our dinner we split the Turkey Burger and decided to pay $1 extra for an over easy egg. We were both left speechless. DMK Burger Bar offers a great young atmosphere and spectacular service & food. Oh, and not to mention, their ticket times. Our food arrived quickly and the food runner was very helpful as well. Being as though my boyfriend and I are both bartenders and servers, we couldn't get over how seamless this experience was. Everything was perfect from start to finish. We even liked it so much that on our last day there, we stopped in for a round of drinks before we ran to catch our flight. DMK Burger Bar is MUST.

Reviews.Author: Joseph D.
Reviews.Content: I guess burgers are such a personal thing that with DMK you're gonna either love it or hate it. I guess I fall on the love it side. Burgers are all interesting combos and come served patty style meaning you're not going to get the big thick honking burger you might find at the little joint down the street.  But there's nothing saying you couldn't go all double meat and load up on protein.... Just saying.The fries were pretty darn tasty. Smothered in cheese and I want to say truffle oil? Delicious. the beer selection is also quite good (has to be in a burger joint) and the service top notch. The place was jammed and yet we still had excellent service. As we were new to the place, Jack our server even gave us a free app of friend pickles. Nice tough and much appreciated. They also offer shakes in which I did not indulge as the burgers and beers had me already feeling satisfied. Next time perhaps....Try it and I'm sure you'll like it.

Reviews.Author: Mary S.
Reviews.Content: Being a non-meat eater, I was weary to try this place because of the massive amount of beef burgers floating around. The menu does claim to have "the best damn veggie burgers" so I figured I'd give them a try.With that, I tried #12, the house veggie and grain burger with eggplant. I had read a few reviews already here, saying that even for meat-eaters this was the "best" veggie burger they'd ever had. Uhhhh...I'm not sure what other veggie burgers they've tried, but this wasn't what I would consider "the best." The patty itself was ok/good but not good/great (that would have to go to Kuma's). And the eggplant that I received on the burger was two slices, the size of a silver dollar. I mean, if you're going to say the burger has eggplant on it, let me have some! It honestly kind of just tasted like something I could have made at home, with a patty out of the freezer section of Jewel. The bun was seriously sad and the burger itself wasn't anything to write home about. It was still good, but don't think I'd go back for another.I also tried to sweet potato fries, which typically I don't like sweet potato fries, but there were definitely great (I would go back just for the fries, not the burgers). Also tried the Parmesan truffle fries, equally as amazing. Unfortunately, all of their fries are made with some type of beef fat or beef butter (as we were told by the waitress, thanks for the head's up) but I figured I'd give them a try anyway. My stomach revolted later that night because of that (maybe I won't be going back for the fries then).Overall, this really is just meant for meat eaters. They are trying to meet the needs of everyone, I get it, but their veggie options fall flat.

Reviews.Author: Timothy T.
Reviews.Content: DMK is a solid spot for a beer and a burger.  The staff is very nice and knowledgable, the ambiance is relaxed, and the food is delicious.  There's something for everyone on their menu that changes frequently.  The beer list is extensive and even their house-made sodas are good.

Reviews.Author: Brian S.
Reviews.Content: Solid burger place, wait wasn't that long (10 minutes).The food came out super fast. We order the #1 and #6 with truffle fries, cheddar fries, and fried pickles.Food tasted great! Fries were fantastic as well. Afterwards,  we ordered the shamrock shake which was also amazing. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Author: Daniele N.
Reviews.Content: This is a December - Tuesday night review.People at this place was super dooooper friendly.  Fresh, young, and prompt staff - - for the guys, the waitresses are smoking hot -- girls, don't be afraid, they are hot but very professional. ;) lolNow, on a serious note I absolutely love the food.  Good, consistent, and delicious hamburger.  Not your traditional bun, but I thought it was a million times better.  I chose the #5 which comes with goat cheese, bison meat, and pickled onions.  We also had a side of sweet potato fries.  Although the burger is not huge, it was the right size for my hunger.  My husband had the #4 which I had a bite and was delicious as well.  The mix of flavor is amazing, the food just melted inside my mouth.  For now on, this will be  #1 place to go for a "healthier" version burger when I'm craving this type of food. Staff was attentive.  My burger fist came without the goat cheese, but I immediately told the smokin' hot -good- teeth-nice-smile-and-boobs waitress (lol) and within minutes she came back with my burger fixed.  Not only that, someone showed up with a complimentary peanut-butter milk shake right then.  HUmmmmm... nice way to fix up your act guys! lol I'm very satisfied with food and service, will recommend this place and will be back for sure.

Reviews.Author: Seher D.
Reviews.Content: Scene: It was Tuesday night at 11 PM. My mom and sister were visiting me and we had all just attended a story slam not too far away. To our excitement, my "sandbox sistah" and I were chosen as judges of the stories during The Moth, and used all of our energy and brain power to score semi-mediocre and not-so-clean stories (sadly, The Moth in Chicago doesn't compare to its counterpart in New York). We were starving and decided to reward ourselves with some good eats, and luckily, DMK was still open.  Before my sister's arrival, we had compiled a Google Doc of all the places we had wanted to try. However, DMK was a spontaneous destination, and it did not disappoint. We were immediately seated, and our waitress was amazingly nice. She recommended her favorite burgers and gave us a short blurb about each one - #4 and #6 were her favorites, but she continued to go on and on about DMK's veggie burger #12. Veggie burger? At a place known for its grass-fed beef? I was perplexed.  We went ahead and ordered the #6 (sans the chorizo) with guac, Sonoma Jack cheese, chipotle aioli, cilantro, and onions and the #12 veggie burger with aged cheddar, eggplant, tomato, and pesto mayo. Both were delicious!! The patty is thin, but definitely high quality. Although I'm a huge fan of thick, juicy patties, these DMK patties were still pretty good, but I still would have preferred a thicker patty. However, what really makes the burger good is the combination of toppings/ingredients. Everything went together so well and the flavors were delicious. Do not underestimate this veggie burger! Even my carnivore sister couldn't get enough of it.   We also ordered a side of mac & cheese #1 and parmesan & truffle cream fries. The mac & cheese was AMAZING!! Great combination of aged cheddar and parmesan and a great crust on top that adds some texture. It's definitely really rich, but if you're a mac & cheese fan, don't pass this up. BUT THAT TRUFFLE CREAM. OMG. When it came out, my traditional mom didn't know what was happening. White ketchup? Is this like when Heinz tried to make green ketchup? But once my mom tried it, she was basically eating it plain. It was that good.  Finally, to finish off our meal, some lovely gentleman at the bar bought everyone a small sample of their pecan pie milkshake! Was this the equivalent of getting bought a drink at da klub? Since my mom was present, I'm glad the drink was sans alcohol. And mann, was this a tasty milkshake. As a Southern girl, I love me some pecan pie, and in a milkshake?! Even better. I'll definitely be back for this cause I couldn't get enough. If only I could order it at da klub...

Reviews.Author: Daniel C.
Reviews.Content: I love DMK burger bar.They have 14 burger options with a 15th monthly special.I haven't tried EVERY burger here but I have tried a good 10 at least.The flavor combinations are really inventive. The special is usually something really out of the box.  Try the bison burger! They also have salmon, turkey, lamb and portabello as options for the "Burger".They have brunch burgers which sound amazing but I haven't made it over there to try them yet. They have a huge selection of beers and homemade sodas!They also pick a charity each month to donate to which is listed on their website under giving.

Reviews.Author: Mary L.
Reviews.Content: Went with a group of 4 after a long day out and about and everyone felt that the food here really hit the spot.  Even though we had to wait about 20-25 minutes to be seated, the host was attentive and the food came out quickly.  Burgers are great quality and simple (not overloaded with too many toppings).  Definitely one of the best burger spots in the city.

Reviews.Author: Cristina P.
Reviews.Content: This place just always nails it for me. I came back and had the brunch burger that has scrambled eggs and chilaquiles.  So dang good and just the right amount of heat.  Also ordered salt and pepper fries which were so simple but so tasty.  How can just pepper taste so good?  :-)

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: Servers are fantastic and I've never had a bad burger either. Highly recommend the mac and cheese (both) or the wisconsin cheddar fries. Great beer list.

Reviews.Author: Lisette D.
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't say the burger here was anything more than OK. How does a place that focuses on burgers not ask how you want it done? Our burgers were thin and somewhere between well done and medium well, but it was too dark to know for certain. I understand that the burgers are from all grass fed cows, but these were not worth $11 each. They had a decent beer list, but not much on tap, the best stuff was in bottles. I liked that they had fried pickles and okra, which were probably the best thing we had. The sweet potato fries were lack-luster, but the bacon and blue-cheese fries were tasty.  I did like that they donate some proceeds to different charities every month. However, it was so loud that when the waitress described what charity and what food items were involved, I couldn't hear what she said. I won't be going out of my way to go to this place again, I could get just as tasty a burger, although with less fancy toppings for half the price at Five Guys.

Reviews.Author: Kris G.
Reviews.Content: I held off on writing a review for this location, because I liked the Lombard atmosphere and staff better. Needless to say, the setup and staff have won me over at this location and now I love it! This is easily my go-to restaurant for any burger or french fry craving (my two favorite foods).I've ended up at DMK twice after going to bars. The first was after a trip to Headquarters down the street and the second time was last night after I first visited Barrelhouse Flat. My bf and I ordered the poutine at Barrelhouse Flat and my bf mentioned, "I wish DMK brought out fries in a large bowl like this." I would be lying if I said we DIDN'T spend the rest of our time at Barrelhouse waiting to finish our drinks and get the check so we could walk over to DMK.When we did make it to DMK we ordered our favorites (the #4 and salt and pepper fries) and devoured them in record time. Not only that, but we did this for a fraction of what we paid for food alone at Barrelhouse. Perfectly cooked burgers, DELICIOUS fries: I wish I could DMK every day.

Reviews.Author: Ryan M.
Reviews.Content: With nearly 1200 reviews, I don't think there is much I could say to add to the fanfare written about this lovely establishment. But here are my additional 2 cents because... well, I want to give them.I recently started eating meat again after 5+ years of being pescetarian (look it up). As a good friend describes it, I'm a "recovering vegetarian." I had a few meals at home but decided it was time to reintroduce my dining self to meat. DMK looked like the perfect place.The burgers, grass-fed and antibiotic-free, come in many varieties, as do the fries, and the milkshakes, and so on. I started things right with the Number 5 -- Bison, goat cheese, and blueberry BBQ sauce. HOLY. SHIT. My taste buds were so happy with me. I do not know if words can describe the wonderful combination of flavors. Nor will I try. But I will recommend getting the Number 5.I returned a few weeks later and tried the Number 4 (again with Bison, even though it normally is ground beef; what can I say? I'm sticking with the original) -- Roasted green chilies, a fried egg, jack cheese, and smoked bacon. HOLY. SHIT. AGAIN. Let's just say I have at least 12 more visits to go (there are that many normal options, plus specials!! Sweet Lord.)Add to that the tasty music playing not-too-loudly in the background, some DAMN tasty sweet potato fries (the lemon aioli that comes with is spectacular), and a very chill atmosphere, and you've got one of my new favorite places. And BONUS: If you do not eat meat, they have a veggie burger you can swap in for beef; same for a portobello. Stomach love.

Reviews.Author: Dave J.
Reviews.Content: While I wouldn't consider DMK among the best burgers in the city, the thin, griddled burgers are certainly a welcome change.  I've got a major bone to pick with any place that serves a 4" thick patty with a steak knife skewer.  It's a burger, not a meatball.That being said, DMK only cooks their burgers two temperatures, which equates to well and really well.  The patty melt was not lacking for flavor, but it didn't really satisfy my craving for a really good burger.  Perhaps it's unfair, but any place I have a burger will be judged against The Bad Apple, and that's a pretty tall order.The beer list was fine, and the sweet potato fries and mac & cheese were pretty stellar.  I couldn't quite get past the atmosphere and clientele, though.  It was kind of like eating at a fancy frat house... At the end of the day, I didn't feel like I'd be running back to DMK but the food still warrants four stars.  I guess you'll have to see for yourself...

Reviews.Author: Avengers M.
Reviews.Content: Totally worth the five month wait! I have been waiting to be in Chicago for a weekend to try this place and it was awesome. Great wait staff and the food was amazing. Parmesan fires were the best. They also have specials to keep it fresh.

Reviews.Author: Ali K.
Reviews.Content: Been dying to hit up DMK and finally got my way visiting my friends. A few of my friends who live in Chicago had been telling me this place along with Kuma's is one of the best burger joints around. A friend of mine who is in the hospitality industry was able to set up this dinner with a few surprise perks thrown in as well but that even if those "extra perks" didn't occur the service here was excellent. Waitress was very bubbly and talkative, gorgeous with a ton of crazy unique tattoo's I loved every second of it. A ton of people were in there and the kitchen still managed to get our food out in under 15 minutes which was awesome. I ordered the #4 Burger which had Roasted Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack, Smoked Bacon on it. Very interesting flavor profile and it tasted absolutely superb, I would have expected it to be hotter but it really wasn't bad at all. A fried egg always helps out any burger. We also got a bunch of french fries for the table, we tried the Wisconsin Cheddar Scallion, Parmesan w/ Truffle Cream and the Sweet Potato Fries. Surprisingly the best ones were the Wisconsin Cheddar Scallion they just burst with flavor and the Sweet Potato ones were pretty good. The Parmesan Fries w/ Truffle Cream was good to but didn't blow me away. Surprisingly the Mac and Cheese #2 was very very very good it has Gruyere Cheese, Smoked Bacon, Charred Balsamic Red Onions (very unique)  Also on the house we were given Peanut Butter Milkshakes were which the icing on the cake, it was so so so good. Friendly staff, great vibe, awesome food. This place should open up locations in a few major cities, I'm sure they would be successful, hell if they wanted me to be a part of the team to open multiple nationwide locations I would do it that's how good they are!

Reviews.Author: Vicki N.
Reviews.Content: Was looking online for a Burger place near me for me (mostly vegetarian) and my boyfriend (very into healthy food), and was intrigued by the fact that the beef is grass-fed.The atmosphere is a bit hipster and modern, not as cozy as I was expecting, and it was quite crowded and a little loud - but that's to be expected with a place so well-known and with so many great reviews.  The wait-staff is friendly and very casual, which was very nice, but really, the food makes the place.The fries and burgers here are amazing!  One can substitute the main component in any burger (I went with Fried Portobello in #12, with Aged Cheddar, Eggplant, Tomato, and Pesto Mayo).  He had the #4 double-stacked (Roasted Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack, Smoked Bacon), and we shared the Amish Blue & Smoked Bacon fries, which were absolutely delicious.Overall, amazing food and good price.  The atmosphere is more pub / bar-like, and while I didn't have any drinks, their cocktails sounded quite good.  I would definitely go again to try more food and drinks.  Thumbs up!

Reviews.Author: Kelly D.
Reviews.Content: Checked out this place a couple weeks ago-A-OK.We got there late night and I did like that they had a special late night menu in addition to regular menu.  Late night menu had smaller portions of a few burgers, shakes, etc. which was nice cause I wanted to try the shake, but wanted to beer to go with the burger.Ended up getting the lamb burger which was AMAZING!!! Tasted like everything you would order in greek town smashed on a bun-olives, feta, lamb, tzatziki and cukes-soooo good. We also ordered the green chile burger-meh. Not a ton of spice (which is surprising cause I figured it'd have a kick from the chiles), and the bacon was terrible-hard as shoe leather, I couldn't even tear it apart to taste it!  I also thought the burger patties themselves were a bit thin-maybe 2 sliders patties thick. Milk shakes were very tasty-personally I'd recommend the peanut butter one if you stop by.  Not expensive at all-2 burgers, 2 small shakes and a beer was like 35bucks.Would probably return, but wouldn't go out of my way.

Reviews.Author: Amanda C.
Reviews.Content: Pretty decent place. I was the first to walk in so I was in and out in 20 min. Ordered the bison burger with a fried egg. First time having a bison and as the server said, it was beefy flavored. Yum.My only gripe here are the prices. The burger is petite and didn't come with fries. With tax it was $13.14. Although I do like not walking out too full it was a bit much for the portion.

Reviews.Author: Adam E.
Reviews.Content: Happy to have this great option in my hood. Plus the staff is stellar. Seriously stellarI've had almost every burger on the menu and have yet to be disappointed.  My favorite was the 'old #5', and now the bison burger. For fries you can't go wrong with the bacon and blue cheese fries.  I think this was one of two bacon experiences that started to really get that going for me coming from my bacon-free upbringing.  (I kept kosher for 22 years, it happens)Beer selection is always good, they are always able to make good suggestions and are happy to offer small samples.  (And it never fails, which always helps)The burgers aren't as oversized and massive as some places, but I kind of like that; I feel like I don't have to be wheeled out after enjoying every last bite :-)And if you are there on a sunny afternoon for lunch, I have to suggest the peanut butter milkshakes. I took my parents there for lunch once, and the server brought them over free of charge and they were great.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay M.
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the hype.I am with my fellow Yelp love here, Brett D., I didn't love it, and I didn't hate it.  It's just kinda, meh - which is why this one is just a 3-star rating for me.I have to say, I like this location MUCH better than the location I have been to in the suburbs.The meat doesn't really taste all that great, and the burger combos are decent, but nothing to write home about. Actually, I can say that about everything here... Nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Author: Aaron Jae M.
Reviews.Content: This place really does make tasty burgers and fries.They have a selection of 15 burgers at all times and 5 types of fries.(Burgers do not come with fries)I tried the #8 burger which is just a classic burger and it was delicious.Perfectly cooked with tasty ingredients on top and a good bun.We got the classic fries with just salt and pepper and tried the Wisconsin cheddar fries with scallions. The cheese fries were good but the cheese was not very evenly distributed so some fries were all cheese and others just tasted like the regular fries.We ordered 2 larges to share between the table (5 people) and finished maybe half of each since we were all too invested in our burgers.This place also has a very good craft beer selection which we took full advantage of.I have heard great things about their milkshakes and will most likely be back to try one out along with another burger.

Reviews.Author: Hannah S.
Reviews.Content: VEGETARIANS.....BEWARE. THEIR FRIES ARE DONE UP IN BEEF FAT.Our first visit, my boyfriend and I came for dinner and loved it! I had the crispy portobello veggie burger and he had something beefy, bacon-y and smothered in onions. We shared a milkshake and the sweet potato & truffle fries in blissful ignorance. On our second visit, I tried the veggie patty and went to order some fries when our waitress KINDLY told me that they fry their fries in beef fat. This is NO WHERE on the menu. Having eaten the fries before (after ordering a veggie burger and not being informed that they are fried in fat...) I was absolutely horrified. It was a really heart-breaking experience. I am so disappointed in DMK for not being more transparent about this fact, and for inadvertently breaking my commitment. Had they told me off the bat, I would have given the restaurant 4-5 stars. Their veggie burgers are truly wonderful, but the fry incident really made me sad. Shame on you guys, DMK.

Reviews.Author: Shaye R.
Reviews.Content: I keep wanting to like this place, but I always end up being less-than-impressed by the burgers.Pros: Amazingly delicious appetizers & sides; They use grass-fed beef,; Pretty friendly staff; Cool atmosphere (although loud!)Cons: House Burgers on the menu are meh.  I've tried about 4 different kinds, and they're underwhelming.  Also, on busy nights they've messed up my order.Side note: Fish Bar next door (although small) is more my flavor.

Reviews.Author: Chris J.
Reviews.Content: One of the best burgers I had in a long time. Staff was helpful, and attentive. Christa, one of my servers was super cool too. I definitely will be back, the staff is trained , and the food was awesome, and reasonable. Thanks so much DMK!

Reviews.Author: Joe M.
Reviews.Content: Girlfriend and I visited DMK Burger bar for the first time last weekend prior to a show at the Vic.Normally I write a long-winded, detailed review to try and help paint a picture to the reader and aide them in their decision of what business to support and which to kick to the curb....not this time.I am a fish and chicken kinda guy; I am no "burger" connoisseur by any means, but I've had a lot of burgers from a lot of different places.....the burgers at DMK are in a class of their own.  Never had a burger that comes close to the awesomeness that I experienced here.  Girlfriend ordered the #4, I ordered the #1, both of which we found out after the fact....bartender said were two of the most popular (along with #5).  We also ordered the parmesan & white truffle fries.Bartender was attentive and friendly, atmosphere of restaurant was good, found some of the patrons to be a bit pretentious and casting judgy glances, but who gives a shit.  The burgers here will change all your perceptions and like a glorious miracle from the heavens.....change your life for the better.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay D.
Reviews.Content: DMK has definitely grown on me, I wasn't a fan at first but now I really enjoy going.   It is very noisy which is one of the downfalls and the wait can also be very long especially since you can't make reservations. It is best to come with 2 people and sit at the bar-  fast service, easier to talk with the person you come with and everyone who works behind the bar is very friendly.My all time favorite thing from DMK is their milkshake- it is the best I've ever had!I really enjoy the wedge salad/  The avocado salad also looks delicious.The Bears Burger with pulled pork on top was my favorite burger.

Reviews.Author: Alexandra C.
Reviews.Content: One of my favorite places to grab a burger in Chicago. Laid back, casual atmosphere and the staff is great. Their macaroni and cheese, fries and turkey burgers are the best.

Reviews.Author: Michael P.
Reviews.Content: I have zero complaints about this place FOR WHAT IT IS.  I rate places based on how successful they are at what they're trying to be.  DMK is more about the toppings and flavors than the burger.  If you want a big fat inch-think patty, that ain't what you're going to get here 'cause that's not what they're trying to do.  The patty is a vehicle for packages of flavor.  And it's not like the patties are bad.  They are fine, they're just not the star of the show, and they're not meant to be.  My visit there last Saturday was around my 10th time there.  I have never walked out unhappy.  My date and I each got a whiskey cocktail, hers a little better than mine but both were good, especially considering the price.  For eats, we ordered the #3 with pastrami, gruyere and 'kraut, the #4 with fried egg, roasted green chiles, sonoma jack, and bacon,  and the deep fried pickle spears.  As a bonus, the waitress brought us the parm truffle fries.  Don't know if they were an extra order or a mistake in the kitchen or what, and who cares.  The burgers tasted great, they are big enough to satisfy (unless you're a pig or a linebacker), the pickles are great (though I'd prefer chips), and the fries were great, free or not.  Again, I get it if you like a thicker burger.  You can go somewhere else and get that.  And you'll end up paying another $3-5 more for a burger with toppings like you get at DMK.  And you'll wait for your food longer.  And the other joint probably isn't donating a percentage of its receipts to a local charity every month.

Reviews.Author: Chris B.
Reviews.Content: Always a great meal.  We like to sit at the bar if you can grab a seat as the bartenders are great.  Very friendly and know their stuff.  Effie is a friendly face and took great care of us.  I had my go-to, the #11, and my wife tried the #1 for the first time; both were exceptional.  Love this place!

Reviews.Author: Chris J.
Reviews.Content: Consistently very good. I don't like the French fry options, but the burger and bison burgers will not disappoint. Fairly loud.

Reviews.Author: Pedro L.
Reviews.Content: It's no Kumas. I've never been to Kumas but I like saying that.  You annoying saying.  I ate the Chorizo burger shared onion strings & fried okra.  Pretty good.  Not the best burger in the city, but by no means does that mean to write-off this place.  It's basically an upscale steak and shake.  Bartender must have had an off day or was deceivingly greedy.  Kept forgetting to give change back.  I'm not tipping you $12 for 1 beer.  I'll be back here to eat if I'm in the area and the wait isn't too long.

Reviews.Author: Hannah J.
Reviews.Content: I enjoy the food here, but the atmosphere is not for people who like a quiet, well-lit dinner with personal space. It is a fun place to go for a burger and the prices are reasonable, but they could turn up the lights and put more space between tables. You have to yell to hear the person across from you and move your table to get in and out of your seat so you don't bump the table next to you. That said, I do like their burgers and the sweet potato fries were amazing!

Reviews.Author: Eric H.
Reviews.Content: They have good burgers and fries here, but the portions are kind of lacking for the price. It's a little bit overpriced, but I guess that's mainly because of the neighborhood. Service is very good, and the food comes out quickly.

Reviews.Author: A M.
Reviews.Content: 2/20: Juicy lucy - great, very rich. Ceddar fries a bit salty for my taste. Fried Dill and okra is great to start. Wife had the #2 prepared with the veggie burger patty.The bar is great with plenty of well-prepared craft cocktails.Love this place.

Reviews.Author: Chris W.
Reviews.Content: Not too bad, $35 bucks for two people, two burgers, a large fry to split (Wisconsin Cheddar, a nice choice with just enough cheese that we were able to get some on every fry on the plate) a peanut butter and oreo shake and a blood orange house soda.The blood orange soda was WAY better than I was expecting and the shake's proceeds went to charity. I was a little bummed that the burgers didn't come with fries and the plates they were on were so small that if you're a messy eater like I am it's kind of a struggle not to get food everywhere. However, the food itself made up for every little nit picking detail that I didn't like. Like how we could have used a few extra napkins, and the server didn't really attend to us very often.Pretty loud in there, and super trendy. I felt underdressed honestly. I'll be back though. They're on par with Kuma's in my opinion and their selection is extensive. They also have a changing monthly special (The number 15 I think) which last month was the fajita burger (which blew my taste buds AND my mind). 4.5 stars for DMK!

Reviews.Author: Sarah D.
Reviews.Content: Four stars for the sweet potato fries and the milkshakes, but only two stars for the burger. I had the number 5, and found it bland, despite the toppings. I had to add more bbq sauce, and even that didn't help much. I had high hopes, since one of my best friends swears by this place but, for me, it just didn't satisfy.

Reviews.Author: Amanda M.
Reviews.Content: Awesome place! Their Grass-fed, natural burgers were amazing and so were their sweet potato fries! Our waitress was super nice too! Definitely recommend!

Reviews.Author: Mike P.
Reviews.Content: It was okay, I understand the rave reviews if you're accustomed to eating fast food burgers. This place is definitely better than that. Although I feel that there are better burger places in Chicago.  Had the their Green Chile burger and the table split the fries with scallions. The burger itself was thin, and I'm guessing that's why we weren't asked how we wanted the burger cooked.  The flavor was good, but really not up to the level I would have expected. The fries were quite good, though. I'll try it again, at some point. Could have been a bad day.

Reviews.Author: Patricia K.
Reviews.Content: I've had wonderful experiences here both for lunch and dinner. Stopped in for lunch before a near by appointment and we sat at the bar, the two of us split a cider and ordered the lamb burger and patty melt as well as sweet potato fries and fried okra. As we were waiting our bartender, Parker,over heard us talking about how we worked in the service industry and brought us some French frie samples as well as some beer tastings, loved it! The sweet potato fries are AWESOME!!! We split our burgers, very happy. Super pleased with service! Came back to meet a friend for an early dinner, had to get the sweet potato fries!! Burgers were good, service was good, over all good experience!

Reviews.Author: Nikki C.
Reviews.Content: The staff is once again a shining star as in all of the DMK places I've been lucky to try.Attentive, well schooled in the menu and specials and just genuinely nice people you would enjoy to have at your next BBQ.The place itself can use a little more soft fabric or sound treatment to cut down on the loudness the place can achieve, but still a good place to take a group of friends or family you can stand.The food, is tasty. The fries (truffle oil, sweet potato, blue cheese n bacon) are awesome,but this in part to being fried in animal fat...which I much enjoy.The burgers for which this place is named is grass fed and tasty. My issue is the bun to meat ratio which is unbalanced for my taste and only corrected when  you upgrade to a double or more or just forgo the top bun and go open faced.Sometimes I'll just order a single and slice it in half, but double stack the meat from the other side making the meat to bun ratio more to my personal liking. and the veggie options of bean or portabello burgers are incredible, even for a carnivore.(I'll get a veggie burger with bacon sometimes)The beers and cocktails are awesome and well complemented by the milkshakes which finish off any carnivorous outing like OH HELL YES Goodness.Join their free DMK points program and earn enough points for freebie sides and tasty meals!

Reviews.Author: Brian K.
Reviews.Content: Best burger? Not by a longshot. The meat patty doesn't cover the bun and it's drowned with toppings. The taste of balsamic vinegar was essentially the burger ("Would you like some burger with your vinegar?").The meat patty is smashed to death, intentionally (like a Smash Burger patty). The result is a burger that isn't too moist.The sweet potato fries with spicy aioli was good as was the service and limited but curated beer selection. DMK would be a cool place to hang out with drinks but not for burgers. Save your calories and money (~$9 plus tax/tip for a burger).

Reviews.Author: Stacy S.
Reviews.Content: Loooove DMK! I could eat their turkey burgers every day of my life. Their Mac n Cheese, WI Cheddar fries, and Sweet Potato fries are also delicious. They have great seasonal drinks as well. It's great for take out. Join their rewards program, I got a free t-shirt!

Reviews.Author: Steven M.
Reviews.Content: Solid burger.  Got the number 4 and was very happy.  I was a concerned that the green chilies might be a little overwhelming but they weren't spicy so it worked out perfectly.The Amish blue and smoked bacon fries were tremendous (in taste, not size because I got the small one) and I would definitely do that again if there weren't other also good-sounding fries on the menu.  The creaminess and bacon make it feel like you're enjoying a finger-eatable baked potato...which is I guess almost exactly what it is.

Reviews.Author: Jen J.
