Reviews.Content: I ordered the #4 Roasted Hatch Green Chile with the Parmesan fries with truffle cream. The total was pricey but the burger was cheaper than Kuma's. However, I thought the burger was just okay. I wanted to try DMK because I'm a burger fan and this place had such great reviews. Maybe i'll try a different burger and see but for now, I prefer Kuma's burgers in terms of taste and quality. The fries were really good though.

Reviews.Author: Jay R.
Reviews.Content: I have been to DMK numerous times but this is my first review. After many burgers and fries eaten I have to say DMK is A-OK, and that A stands for Awesome.-The burgers are unique with a great balance of flavors and toppings.-They know how to work a fryer like they where born with one out of the womb.-Great variety of beers I had The Dogfish Head Midas Touch and Founders KBS People who like beer they will appreciate the beer list from these 2 selections alone.  -Staff and service is fabulous!!!-Contrary to earlier post they will modify one of their burger to how ever we wanted it.-Cool atmosphere inside.- Sign up for rewards program you actually get free food.-Free protected password Wi-Fi  like working from home but with a bar and restaurant in my living room.Must try!Truffle Parmesan Fries - perfectly fried, great truffle dipping sauce.Fried Pickles and Okra - again perfectly fried great flavors and dipping sauce.If you not drinking beer get a  shake - Coffee shake had texture with chopped roasted beans was to good.Big DMK was a spin on the Big Mac was really good and huge.

Reviews.Author: Meghan H.
Reviews.Content: Oh nelly, I reeeeally love DMK.I've only been there once and I am IN LOVE. Love at first bite if you will ;) Annnnyways...I got the patty melt! Let's break it down: burger (perfect thickness; thin but not too thin), big ol slice of swiss, bacon (nice and crunchy but not so much so that it falls apart into powder/crumbs as you eat it, plus good flavor; just fatty enough but not overly so, with a nice subtle peppery taste to it), AND to top it all off a fried egg that was perfectly cooked so that the burger wasn't ridiculously messy, AND burnt onions  that were so deliciously caramelized, without an overkill oniony taste-yum, all on some perfectly-toasted rye bread. Whewww! This burger warrants a grammatically incorrect, run-on sentence, I'd say!Now I also tried out their mac and cheese and found that cheeseily-moist, though in need of a bit more flavor, as the cheese taste could have been a wee-bit more pronounced. BUT the oven-baked crunchy part on top of the mac was very good.We also ordered their parmesan and truffle oil fries to share and those paired beautifully with me burger! Delish.What made this experience even more grand was when our waitress brought us complimentary blood orange sodas! :D It felt super random, but awesome nonetheless. And they were pretty good!  They definitely looked nice, color-wise, and tasted refreshing - like jazzed up seltzer water. In a good way. Loved that it was not overly sweet.Atmosphere? Decidedly a cross between urban/industrial and trendy/mod. Very niiiice. This place is generally pretty packed and not super great if you have a huge party (it'll work of course, you'll probably just have to wait because the place isn't too big and most of the tables are high-top bar-ish tables that seat like 2...) If you do end up having to wait, it'll be way worth it! I really love DMK. That is all. :)

Reviews.Author: Dennis F.
Reviews.Content: Been some time since my last visit here.....don't have an excuse didn't check in on last two visits.. Glad I returned. My friend and I were seated immediately at a great table. Being a waiter I like to watch the rhythm of other restaurants. The staff have a clean prompt relaxed manner, perfect for the venue.! Started with the Chili special enough for two to share. The food is a sweet change to the burger and fries lunch. Had to splurge and added the Gruyere mac and cheese.......damn good!! Looking forward to returning! !

Reviews.Author: Jessica E.
Reviews.Content: Do you like eating your burgers in the dark? If so, DMK is the place for you! Kidding set aside, I had an absolutely enjoyable time at DMK on my visit to Chicago. The service was spectacular, we were seated right away and the food came out so quickly (and accurately!). The seating was very "cozy"...meaning getting in and out of your seat was a little awkward as you were basically on top of the people next to you. So maybe if you have personal space issues, you might want to request a table away from the perimeter of the restaurant. The 1000+ reviews earning this a solid 4-star restaurant is not a glitch, my friends. It is well deserved! Their menu is simple and approachable. I went with the #4, it included green chile, fried farm egg and bacon. K ordered the #3, which included pastrami, french gruyere, sauerkraut and remoulade. Holy crap those burgers were delish! We split an order of sweet potato fries and a chocolate/vanilla shake and we were definitely satisfied. DMK has an upscale-feel to it without the pretentiousness you'd expect from a place with low-lighting (sorry to keep mentioning it, but it was so dark in there! (not a bad thing)). The service as top-notch and they got us in and out of there in under 45 minutes without feeling like we were getting brushed off. I prefer my cheeseburgers full and un-smashed, but I didn't have a problem with DMK's style. It was just a very, very good meal. I'm glad my research lead me to DMK, it was definitely worth it.DMK is great. It involved all my favorite things: burgers and wonderful design. Props to the people responsible for the branding and merchandising. Great experience overall!

Reviews.Author: Jeremy B.
Reviews.Content: Amazing burgers!!!  Best in the city, possibly.  Great beer selection and craft cocktails.  The service here is always top notch as well.  Be prepared to wait - I'm not a big fan of long waits for places, so a tip is to go during off hours such as early or mid afternoon on a weekend.

Reviews.Author: Michelle K.
Reviews.Content: I'm always on the hunt for a great burger and I am so glad that I finally got to come to DMK to get one. The service was great--our server was attentive and friendly but not overbearing. The atmosphere was relaxed; definitely a place I would come back with my friends for burgers and drinks. But probably not one where I'd bring my parents, obviously. Then again, I took my parents to The Publican so who knows.As for the food, it was so great. My mouth is watering thinking about the burgers. I got the #5 burger and my friend got the buffalo burger with blueberry bbq sauce. I usually don't like my patties grilled and pressed down diner style but for some reason, the burgers were so great that way here. The flavors all went together very nicely. I especially liked the way the blueberry flavor came out--sweet and a little tart--inn the buffalo burger. I honestly can't even put my finger on what about the #5 burger was so great but it was like a little piece of heaven on a plate.We also got the truffle parmesan fries but I could go without this the next time. The cheese wasn't too flavorful and was crusted onto the fries in a not melty way and the truffle mayo was pretty underwhelming. BUT the burgers. The burgers make up for it.

Reviews.Author: Marcus H.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Saturday night. There was a bit of a wait, but it was well worth it IMO. Our server Marie did a great job taking care of us. Great beer selection. Definitely coming back.

Reviews.Author: Food Junkie S.
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about. All their burgers are very good. They aren't so big that you can't get a good grip or bite of. Very flavorful. The fries are also very good. Their beer selection alone would keep me coming. Their service is on target. Most importantly, their food is always consistent. Probably one of my favorite burger joints.

Reviews.Author: Michael H.
Reviews.Content: Delicious meat, freshly-baked bread, and creative toppings make for a great burger experience.  They also have an excellent beer selection that includes Half Acre and a rotating selection of specialty drafts.  Decent cocktails are available ($7-10).  Service is fast and friendly.  I recommend getting the burger with blue cheese and crispy onion rings.The place gets packed so you may want to consider going during an off time.

Reviews.Author: Desmond W.
Reviews.Content: Been here many times before, going here later on this beautiful day so I figured it was time to write a review.  Not much to say about this lovely burger establishment than what has already been said here.  I'll try to add some nice nuggets:They have days during the week where food is discounted due to being in the "industry".  This includes medical professionals who show up in scrubs since Illinois Masonic Hospital is just down the road (FYI - you do not have to work at Illinois Masonic to get the discount, at least don't admit it...)They are always running some kind of charity drive, changing the benefactor month-to-month, which is pretty awesome that they have such a dedication to philanthropy.The burgers are excellent.  They aren't huge, if you want something like that go wait for 2 hours at Kuma's Korner.  They are slider-style patties with grass-fed beef on a delicious house-made potato bun.  All the fries are delicious, but the sweet potato fries are especially good.  I've tried most of the burgers on the menu and I can't say I've been disappointed yet.Terrific beer and liquor selection.  Most importantly - eat at the bar and you will usually walk out with "business cards" of the bartender who served you, inviting you back for a free draft beer with your next meal.  So, since my wife doesn't drink beer, that basically means 2 free beers for me every time we return.  Pure awesome.Sometimes there's a bit of a wait, all the more reason to try to snag seats at the bar.  Otherwise, the servers are very good, and often times bring out some free food for you to sample when the restaurant is a little slower.

Reviews.Author: Anna L.
Reviews.Content: Terrible disappointment. We went after reading the reviews for "out of this world delicious bison burger with blueberry BBQ." From the second they brought it out and put it on the table I knew it would be terrible. The bun was twice the thickness of the meat, there was no medium rare about it, that thing was very well done. I could not really tell how it tasted it was a mess of over peppered over salted something. The bun was like a tasteless marshmallow, I didn't even eat it. After picking at the meat I moved in to try the Parmesan fries. They were cold, not slightly warmish even, cold. The cheese just sat on top of them would not melt even a little bit. There was so much black pepper in the fries I could taste absolutely nothing but pepper. The only reason I am giving two stars is the service, which was friendly.

Reviews.Author: Hilary T.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good burger spot. The turkey burger is amazing. Best turkey burger I've had in a while. The Wisconsin cheddar fries are good as well. A bit pricey though.

Reviews.Author: M Y.
Reviews.Content: I forgot how good this place is. Was there over the weekend and reminded how uber-fabulous the food is: BURGERS, FRIES, MILK SHAKES, BEER, DRINKS, SALADS! Will please EVERYONE! Dreaming of my next visit now!I have to add that this is the place to be for some serious EYE CANDY - the waiters/bartenders!!!! HOLY SHUCKS! Not only that, but they are SO NICE, explaining every special on the menu with the most adorable smiles and coming to check in with us several times.The food is amazing, but along with the good looking and super nice staff - this place beats any other burger joints in the city!

Reviews.Author: A.J. S.
Reviews.Content: Zagat: One of the BEST BURGERS in Chicagoland! Me: Ehhh....Friend: BEST BURGER EVARRR Me: Ehhh, you still enjoy McDoubles...Yelp: AWESOME BURGER. NOM NOM BEER. GO NOW. Me: OKAY. I rallied the troops here on a Saturday night and was thrilled they had only a 20 minute wait for a table and quick bar service while we waited. Small's Gin was found here cheap and fabulous as usual, microdistilled gin makes a great start to any night. I would caps lock cheap, because it deserves emphasis, but Yelp told me my Shouting Quota has been used up early in the review already. After our juniper berry enhanced aperitifs at the bar we got a seat and checked out the menu with our server, the most patient and friendly woman ever to grace our table at DMK. Even after a lovely one in our party demanded to know what each beer on the beer page tasted like, she was a troopers and gave great recommendations. Bless her heart, it's these people that makes good tips feel extra wonderful....A word on the beer list. I would like to continue the theme of inexpensive. I'm real jealous of your MidWest booze prices, ya'll. On the West Coast we happy give our left nut for a good craft beer on tap, DMK offered a page full of awesome selections for great prices. Really shockingly low prices, alongside their alcohol selection. I don't know if its a Chicago thing or a DMK thing but I like it a lot. Back to the burger. The burger patty was a bit thinner than I expected (thinner than Kuma's and Butcher and the Burger), but a soft baked bun better than I ever thought imaginable. You can get your burger with lots of fancy shit, like chiles and fried egg and fancinesses (yeah clearly after all those cheap beers  I can't remember much else of the menu), but whatever you choose, it will be delicious. The sides are great to split and I had a hard time keeping my hands out of the fried onions and sweet potatoes sides we split. Incredible. My burger itself was juicy, perfectly cooked and flavorful, the bun wonderfully soft and the toppings fresh. In my Butcher and the Burger review, I tried to compare it to DMK, and I couldn't. I enjoyed DMKs loud scene and great beer list, but the burgers themselves were too different (B&B you make your own a la carte style, and I'm not as creative as DMK). Regardless, DMK is a must try on your Chicago burger hunt.

Reviews.Author: Jessica V.
Reviews.Content: Hello Beautiful!I am not a burger girl, but if you get some drinks in me.. I could be that girl. Let me rephrase that if you gimme craft beer I could be that girl and they have a ton of craft beer. If you come here for a burger great if you come here for beer even better.I am simple when it comes to burger because when you get crazy you might end up with some stranger danger in your mouth. I chose to get a regular burger and splurge with okra and pickles and some truffle fries cause THAT'S HOW I DO! All the plates are small, reason being they want to ONE make you feel like you are doing some sort of portion control or TWO they want you to eat after you drink. Eating sounds legit to me so I am going with the latter. I may have not written too many reviews in the past couple weeks but when it comes to eating I am too legit to quit.

Reviews.Author: Ryan E.
Reviews.Content: Great beer selection. Great burgers. Cool atmosphere. DMK Burger Bar is awesome!

Reviews.Author: Joel G.
Reviews.Content: I have seen mixed reviews on this place however I think it's a really solid hamburger joint.  Great beer selection, burgers are very good, great fries and rings.  I'm not sure what's not to like about this place.  I like the atmosphere as well, does get a bit loud but for a burger joint I think it's just right.  Love the bison and blueberry burger and the BBQ is excellent as well.  I'd skip the mac and cheese but man it never fails I have to try it every where I go and am constantly let down.  I have been here several times and will continue to go there.Tip... hit this place for dinner and have a few beers then head over to the bar Headquarters for a even better micro brew selection and video game bar that's pretty darn fun but as of late too crowded.

Reviews.Author: Brady M.
Reviews.Content: We walked in to a 45 min wait for 2 but we sat at the bar quick. Two older woman sat at the bar and were not eating and still waiting for a table is only the real complaint. Other then that  the bartender was great server as well as amazing burgers. They came out fast and fresh. The fries were awesome and to top off the meal the shake of the month. will def go back again.

Reviews.Author: EL S.
Reviews.Content: Mediocre burger, fries however were very good. Not good bang for the buck and you can go elsewhere for a better burger experience. Rowdy bar with tons of suburbanites

Reviews.Author: Andrew P.
Reviews.Content: Simple menu - burgers, fries, beer and/or milkshakes. Burgers are $9. Burgers are OK, fries are OK. Biggest value here is the ambiance: if you want a cool place to hang out, music thumping, beautiful servers, long wait time, then go here.

Reviews.Author: Deena H.
Reviews.Content: The fried okra and dill Pickles were decent. The bison burger was ordered by my buddy and he said it was great. The Greek lamb burger was really juicy and you could taste the olives. The sweet potato fries were average. This place is always crowded and service is with a smile.

Reviews.Author: Cj J.
Reviews.Content: There is hype for a reason. Great atmosphere and amazing food. There was a few bumps in the road with service and them forgetting things or taking forever bit this time around the food and company made up for it. I would come again.

Reviews.Author: Jeff S.
Reviews.Content: So the food was fantastic, service was great, so 5 stars for that.But the loud music...Minus one star.  I felt like I was in a nightclub. My friend and I couldn't hear anything the other said and my throat was hoarse by the time we left because I was screaming over the music the whole time. We also had to use flashlight apps on our phones to read the menu because it was so dark. But aside from the loudest music I've ever heard and the dimmest lighting I've ever seen, I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Alana T.
Reviews.Content: Look, don't fight me on this shit! Get the #10 (it's a turkey burger). Don't change shit on it! Add a fried egg, make sure it's nice and runny. Eat it! Enjoy it! Get the sweet potatoe spuds. Get extra sauce. DIP, consume. GLUTTONIZE yourself!Get the CHOCOLATE SHAKE. INHALE IT! Get a damn brain freeze! Leave this place. Send me a message on Yelp thanking me! You're welcome in advance. THIS PLACE IS SWOOONTASTIC!

Reviews.Author: Eric T.
Reviews.Content: I loved the veggie burger. I appreciate when burger places do not just serve a generic boca burger or some other frozen thing. Veggie burgers can be amazing! The multitude of burger options is just great. On my second trip (within 4 days of my first) I had the crispy portabella which was also really great. So fear not vegetarians, the DMK has you covered, and WITH CHOICES. DMK really crushes it with the fries. Sweet potato, truffle parmesan and the ones with melted cheddar were all amazing. The large size portions are HUGE we had two for a group of 4 and it was a lot! The second trip we did two small portions for two people and it was probably about right. I would say in a group of 4 to get 3-4 small servings, for the variety!I am a lover of fried pickles so I jumped on the chance to eat some here. They were good, not great, and come with fried okra, which I am not so much a fan of, but generally tasty. Finally, the beer! A great selection of craft beers on tap. DMK is the local burger place I wish was in my neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: Justin G.
Reviews.Content: Been here twice and absolutely no complaints. First, the atmosphere, some decent music, not too loud - great selection of beers and cocktails - so if you are waiting for a table you can hang out at the bar. Huge selection of burgers, and would be really surprised if you couldn't find something to match your taste. I went with the number 6 - chorizo burger with avocado and some chipotle mayo- highly recommend this if you like a little kick. The bun is nice and soft as well. Their hand cut fries are a big plus, good to compliment your burger too. Waiters/waitresses/bar tenders are all friendly, and nice, which always make it more enjoyable. If you are looking for a good burger place, not looking to wait hours, and have some good service, give this place a shot.

Reviews.Author: Amber S.
Reviews.Content: My possibly new favorite place for a burger. I ordered a number 6, the guacamole and chorizo burger, a lemon/blueberry pop and our table ordered bacon blue fries and parmesan/truffle fries to split. I loved my burger, I wasn't expecting it to be spicy(most places with spicy foods aren't spicy). I wasn't expecting my pop to be orange since it was blueberry but it was good although I do need to try it again to see how much I truly enjoyed it.  I loved the fries. The bacon and bleu cheese fries were the best. The sauce was creamy but not heavy and the fries were perfect. The parmesan/truffle fries on the other hand weren't the best. Only due to the fact that the cheese was hardened together and you couldn't taste the cheese with the truffle dip and the fries. I also liked the music and the atmosphere. Every song had me dancing in my chair. Overall great place and I will make sure to visit again.

Reviews.Author: Dan S.
Reviews.Content: Trendy Burger Joint where the Fries Steal the Show.The inside had a very cool vibe with rock music playing over the speakers.  Long tables lined the walls with plenty of booth and stool seating.Let me preface this with the fact that the burger was very good and beats many burgers.  However, what was billed as the star of the meal was fairly underwhelming.  The burger itself was tasty but not cooked to my desired preparation and was small for the price.  They also go extremely light on the toppings, at least on my burger, which left me wanting for more.The true shining star of the menu was the french fries.  They have several different types and they are Ah-Meh-Zang.  If you are going to skip the fries, you might as well just not even bother.The beer list consisted entirely of craft beer with a wide selection available.  They bring a glass and will offer a pairing for the burger you choose if you get the right server.My Meal:Bison burger with blueberry barbecue sauce and pickled onionsParmesan fries with truffle cream (A Must Have)Amish blue cheese and smoked bacon fries (A MUST MUST MUST HAVE!!!)

Reviews.Author: Andrew B.
Reviews.Content: Great Burgers and Fries.I've tried most of the burgers including the beef, bison, lamb, veggie and crispy portobello burgers.  All were delicious and unique.The fries themselves are average, but the toppings make them into real junk-foody goodness that fries should be.You won't find heinz or hidden valley here, they only serve their in-house chipotle ketchup and herb ranch.  Sometimes I think all a burger and fries need is regular ketchup, so sometimes this disappoints me.Very often my table is served a free side of onion straws or sweet potato fries.  Not sure if this is because they like us or they just had extras, but it's always a pleasant surprise.And the cocktails, try them.  Never been disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Chelsea E.
Reviews.Content: Always consistent. Always delicious. Always great service. Always keeps me wanting to come back for more. Thank you DMK, thank you.

Reviews.Author: Jeff P.
Reviews.Content: Bison Burger, Truffle Fries, enough said.

Reviews.Author: Jackie G.
Reviews.Content: 1,079 "4 star" reviews, it's gotta be good right??  No not at all!  I ordered the patty melt and my boyfriend ordered the #1 burger with cheddar, bacon, and BBQ sauce. I was shocked to see how extremely dry the burgers were!  The parmesan fries were just "ok". I didn't finish my burger because I didn't feel it was worth the calories.  Smash burger or even sad to say, Steak n Shake is better!Actually, we left and went next door to the Fish Bar which was 100 times better.  My recommendation is... I would skip DMK and hit up the Fish Bar next door.

Reviews.Author: Jordan M.
Reviews.Content: First, the good: the burgers here are juicy and well constructed.  Standouts include The Big DMK, basically an upscale Big Mac, and the Fresh Salmon burger (see Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives for more on this one).  Your best bet for sides are either the chili-rubbed onion strings or the sweet potato fries.  The staff is friendly, the beer list is great, and the prices are okay.Now, the bad (if you want to call it that): You can't help but compare this place to Kuma's, especially now that Kuma's Too has moved into the neighborhood.  Kuma's has a much wider and more creative selection, larger patties, and better sides.  The Wisconsin cheddar and scallion fries at DMK are far too heavy and at times the wait here is nearly as long as it is at Kuma's.If Kuma's didn't exist, this review would be far more positive than the 50-50 treatment I just gave it but the reality of the situation is that Kuma's is legendary and DMK is just very good.  Hit this place up so that you can say you've been there before but understand there's nothing they do better than Kuma's.

Reviews.Author: Cheryl B.
Reviews.Content: Another 5 star review for this place. Been here a dozen times, never a bad experience! One of my favorite go-to burger places in the city. I bring all my out of town friends here, they all love it. I love that their burgers are juicy and thin and the buns are homemade. Lots of unique toppings, my favorite is anything with cheese & friend onions on it. My husband loves the #4 with green chilies, pepperjack cheese, & fried egg. The french fries are awesome (all of them, really - Wisconsin cheddar, blue cheese, truffle, sweet potato, etc). They have a great beer selection & the bloody mary's are also top notch.My ONLY complaint is sometimes there is a huge wait (not their fault!). My other complaint is usually the music is way too loud. So not a place to have a lunch meeting, unfortunately.

Reviews.Author: Sean m.
Reviews.Content: So I saw this place on DDD (Diners, Driver-Thrus and Dives) a few weeks prior to my trip to Chicago.  I was so excited about finding this place.  We tried the Turkey Burger and the Bison Burger.  Also had the small truffle fries and a "Blood Meridian" drink.  The drink was very good.  The fries were okay (something they highlighted on DDD---they made them sound much better).  If you want to share the fries get the bigger size...the small serves one.  The burgers were okay--patties were VERY thin.  The Bison Burger was mediocre in my opinion.   Wish I had a better experience.  Kudos to the restaurant for their 365 days of giving which supports a different charity every month.

Reviews.Author: Zach O.
Reviews.Content: My first yelp review. You can't go wrong here. Fantastic service, a smooth old fashioned, unreal burger and their fries speak for themselves. I always go with a #8.

Reviews.Author: Lafe S.
Reviews.Content: This is an emotional review.We tried to eat here and were unsuccessful.  Being a holiday and closed is understandable.  What is not...not taking the time to communicate that to their customer they were going to be closed.Being from out of town DMK was a recommendation.  We had to plan and make it a point to visit.  Under my normal reviewing habits, I would not waste my time to review.  Since we are from out of town I have to write because we cannot vote with our dollars.The number one undisputed rule for the service industry is to always have your customer at top of mind.  Long story short is they do NOT!!!So I have ask myself,  what else are they doing without the customer on their mind?

Reviews.Author: Cheryl D.
Reviews.Content: Hubby took me here for date nite on Wednesday.  The place was dimly lit with a lively crowd. Good selection of beers and an interesting menu comprised of unique burgers (can get turkey burgers or portobello as a sub. if desired), shakes, fries, sides, etc. Our server was Jack - he was very good and even sent us an order of fried pickles gratis. Food was great and would definitely go back. Next time, we'll share small fries instead of large...

Reviews.Author: Dana Z.
Reviews.Content: My favorite burger place and it's because of the buns.  The proportion of meat to bread to ingredients is perfect for my liking and the buns are super duper soft. It's relatively small, but it's worth the wait. Service was friendly. Good beer selection. Fun place.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie C.
Reviews.Content: Guy's signature on the wall! This Triple D spot is a must try!  The fries and burgers are all amazing!  We had the lamb burger and truffle fries.  Great atmosphere along with craft cocktails and great beer selection!  Can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Author: Anna E.
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately I was a little hungover, so I am disappointed that I didn't try something a little more creative.  I went with the lamb burger, which had feta and tzatziki and it was pretty tasty.  The patty was well seasoned and juicy, the bun was soft and held up well with the toppings.  However, if you're expecting a super thick, juicy, oozy burger like you get at a lot of places, these are on the small size, which lends itself to being just a tad on the overcooked side.  We also tried the truffle fries, sweet potato fries and mac n cheese, all which were very good.  But I think the favorite at the table was the sweet potato fries.  Only downside was how loud it was and we were there fairly early (6:00ish) on a Saturday.

Reviews.Author: Johanna G.
Reviews.Content: These mofos know how to put together a burger.  I never, ever, ever, ever, ever get a fried egg on my burgers.  I dont know why, I just dont.  I like burgers the way they are, but I figured "hey, you're in a different state, why not give it a go?" and man... worth it.  I had a burger with jalapeno, cheese, and a fried egg on top - I can't remember what the name was, but it was effn good.  Effn good.  And their mac and cheese was fantastic - maybe because I'm going through withdrawals on the mac and cheese front, maybe not, but it was good.  The fries were good and crunchy and not greasy.  I like that they didn't have an overwhelmingly large bun or hunk of meat, you could really get into your burger...and you left full, but not "holy crap i think i'm going to puke" fat.the service, however, was not that great.  I could understand our wait if the place was mobbed, but we got there in off hours.  I think our waitress was training someone, but generally you don't want to train someone to ignore their tables...especially when they only have two.

Reviews.Author: Jim B.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers and good beer selection...fries with the different sauces/toppings are awesome!!!

Reviews.Author: Caitie E.
Reviews.Content: I love DMK! I think they're my favorite burger place in the city, mind you I enjoy thinner patties on my burger so the size isn't an issue for me. I'm a big fan of the quality of ingredients and over all flavor. I have a problem making my way down the menu, I've only tried the first 2 and find myself going back to them or trying their #15. They have a lot of other choices that I need to try! I haven't had trouble sampling each of their fries and you can't really go wrong. My favorites are the truffle parmesan and sweet potato. Two people can definitely share the small size. They have some great sides too like the wasabi coleslaw and deviled eggs. I'd like to say I've tried the salads but when I come here I know I'm going to be a fatty. They have a great beer list and cocktail menu. Also their milkshakes are fantastic, their monthly flavors are really creative.The service is good, never have had a bad experience. They play a good selection of music and they interior fits the concept perfectly! I highly recommend!

Reviews.Author: Anne T.
Reviews.Content: These are the best burgers in Chicago. I have hauntingly beautiful dreams of their burgers (nod to How I Met Your Mother). Even starring at their online menu makes my mouth drool with anticipation of the next time I will go back there. Everything is made to perfection. The burger bun has an ever-so-slight chew to it, so much better than your normal airy and flavorless burger bun. Their burger options are incredible, and so much better than anything you could ever imagine. I also love that they have options like veggie burgers and portobello burgers, as well as salmon burgers. Yum! Getting fries is a must. And don't just settle for normal fries. While those are delicious, why not try something like parmesan truffle cream fries.  Their aioli sauce that goes along with it is so good. I cannot go on. Such good burgers! Nothing has even close in comparison. Go now!

Reviews.Author: Laleh A.
Reviews.Content: A solid burger, but nothin amazing about them. Just wish that would be more veggies or give the options to add more. My boyfriend got the bison burger, which was good, but lacked flavor.I got the number one which was good but again nothing amazing. I just really wish they'd give more veggie options or sauce options or somethingBut what was awesome were the fries and the truffle oil. Holy moly that truffle oil made up for the whole meal. I also got a michelada which was flavorful. Definitely a good drink. It had a nice vibe and the playlist was good. It was a nice place place to start our evening of drinking Service was good from the bar to the waitress. If you're in the area is suggest it, but nothing to go out of the way for.

Reviews.Author: Emily H.
Reviews.Content: I want to put together a "Best Burgers in Chicago" list.  DMK would definitely be on the list.  I ate here and it was soo good.  I was completely stuffed when I left.  Like, you need to lie down and hug your stomach because you ate so much, sick.  -I had a beef burger with bacon, egg, jack cheese, and a roasted hatch chili.  I didn't even put it down.  I ate the whole thing.-I tried the macaroni and cheese with bacon and caramelized onions.  It was really good as well.  Although, I didn't taste any caramelized onions.-I have a fried okra addiction, so we tried the fried okra and fried pickles.   I think I like my fried okra chopped up, though.  -We also had the Parmesan truffle fries.  Why are truffles so good?!  I love truffle flavor.  -We tried a Cinnamon Toast Crunch milkshake for dessert.  It was tasty, of course, but you could probably make this at home yourself.

Reviews.Author: Chris J.
Reviews.Content: There are so many good things to say about DMK, but first I really have to mention the service. I was here again about a week ago on a Thursday night, and we had about a 30 min wait (normal). The server (Lauren) was awesome the entire time, and even gave us free deviled eggs before burgers arrived, and milkshakes after our we finished eating. When we were nearly finished, the GM came over and explained we had waited a few extra minutes beyond our wait time (I didn't even notice) and thanked us for our patience. Very few managers would have taken the time to come over to a table and apologize for that (honestly waiting a few extra minutes is nothing, but I really appreciated it). Now to the food. Everything I've tried here is so freakin' good. I usually go with the #1, #4, or #15 burger. The toppings are all great, but the grass-fed beef is really what sets it apart from other burgers. You can really taste the difference. All of the fries are great, and their homemade ketchup really needs to be bottled and sold. It's incredible.  DMK is also a great spot to hang out. Good beer and craft cocktail selection, great tunes, and quite an attractive staff as well.

Reviews.Author: Kelly Q.
Reviews.Content: Stopped in here en route to a flick at the Vic. Not what I expected from a burger joint... pleasantly surprised. It was crowded for a snowy Wednesday night, so luckily my hot date had already snagged a few seats at the bar. I got the bison burger which comes with pickled onion, goat cheese and blueberry BBQ sauce, asking the bartender if I should sub a turkey burger for the bison. He advised against it, for which I'm grateful. The food arrived quickly, and the bison patty was so tender and flavorful, and the toppings worked in perfect harmony. My date covered all the animal food groups with his beef burger topped with bacon and egg, and probably some other ingredients that I missed as I was busy shoving bison into my face. We also got a side of cheddar and scallion fries and fried okra and pickles, which I thought were okay but my date took the lead on and polished off fairly quickly. The beer list is solid, and we each washed our meals down with a draft (Lagunitas IPA for me).And if that wasn't enough, the bartender surprised us with some sort of chocolate/raspberry jam milkshake... so yummy and unnecessary. I'm still full 14 hours later. They also gave us cards to come back for two free drafts... sold.

Reviews.Author: Megan D.
Reviews.Content: I loved going here on a Friday night date with my boyfriend. The wait was close to 45 minutes but we enjoyed some delicious beers while we were waiting. It was a fun place to be! Our burgers were both delicious, I ordered the #12 and he ordered the #5. Interesting combos. Will definitely come back for more burger and fry combos! Also, I heavily respect their investment in the community with their charity sponsorships each month and their commitment to quality ingredients for their food.

Reviews.Author: maggie m.
Reviews.Content: Awesome place for a beer and a unique burger. This was my first time there before a Hawks game and it hit the spot. Lily was our server, and she was very friendly and an all around great server. She was knowledgable of all the different beer and menu items. I had the Mac and cheese #1 simple but very tasty! The 3 others I was with had the party melt and 2 different burgers, #4 and the special Patrick Kane burger. We split the Wisconsin cheddar fries no scallions. All the food was amazing! For drinks we all had different beers, all delicious. Last but not least pumpkin milkshakes.... can you say yum!!!! A great place, can't wait to go back and try one of the grilled cheeses!

Reviews.Author: Britni W.
Reviews.Content: There are few places in Chicago that I suggest hands down to go to but this is one of them. The place gets packed easy on a weekend night so if you aren't willing to wait but still want to have some of the food drop in for lunch. The food is still amazing and you don't have to wait forever. The burgers are amazing and creative to say the least. The fries also come in creative combination. There is literally nothing I've had from here that was bad. With all the said, it's not cheap. You're paying at least ten dollars just for your burger, but if I've got the time and money it's worth it. If you are looking for a good burger, even if you don't eat meat, try out this place. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Author: Rachel T.
Reviews.Content: Not bad for a $9 burger. I had the Lamb burger, very tasty and I love the soft bread they use for the buns. Went with my roommate, she enjoyed her turkey burger (didn't like whatever sauce they used on it though, so she dipped her burger in ketchup lol) and we shared an order of both the sweet potato fries and the truffle fries.I am a sucker for truffle fries, but at this particular spot I would sooner order the sweet potato fries. Very yummy! Maybe a little pricey for the amount of fries you actually get though.Our server was pleasant, and overall we liked the simple decor of the bar. Would go back again :)

Reviews.Author: Clayton B.
Reviews.Content: I've recently moved to Chicago and have become a regular at DMK within weeks. I have absolutely loved everything I've ordered here. This place has made me visit all other DMK owned restaurants.The decor is nicer than you'd expect for a burger bar without looking like its trying to hard. I always sit at the bar and get great service. They play funny classics like Mrs. Doubtfire on the TVs. A few of the bartenders have given me great suggestions for cocktails. They have a great selection of tequilas... Which is unique for a burger place. DMK also has a large beer selection (more bottles than draft).Recent obsession: blue cheese and bacon fries

Reviews.Author: Kyle D.
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to give DMK 5 stars, but there were just several flaws that kept it from such. First off, they have a great beer and alcohol selection. If you are looking for craft beers this is a good place. Their menu is also pretty good, though obviously anything out of the burger/fries realm is probably absent. That said, the food was great! Buffalo burger with bleu cheese and blueberry BBQ sauce was awesome, and the sweet potato fries are clutch. Their menu has so many great sounding burgers ranging from fried eggs, peppers, guac, fried goodies, and even turkey/bean/salmon/portebello burgers.However, the layout of the place is weird...waited 45 mins for our table, which the bar was handy for. But we had to stand the whole time, and the place was packed. It was also pretty loud, hard to hold conversation with all of the people and loud music. Then the food took 20ish minutes after we ordered, just a long time to wait...Overall, great burgers and drinks, just don't come starving and expect to wait awhile.Atmosphere: 7/10Service: 7/10Food: 8.5/10

Reviews.Author: Kristen D.
Reviews.Content: The service here is always really friendly. I ordered the Bison burger with goat cheese (omggoatcheese) and blueberry bbq sauce. I thought there would be a little bit more to this burger, though it was basically onion, sauce, and goat cheese. That's all it needed! It was so good and so different. Never thought I'd be a fan of bison meat, but I am! Their parmesan truffle fries are SO worth it, but the small is pretty small for two people to share. Looking forward to going back soon!

Reviews.Author: r.v. s.
Reviews.Content: Too fucking loud, even for a mid-week mid-afternoon burger. And I've been pissed at them since they unceremoniously raised the price of a burger to $9 without even a shrug-- as if I wouldn't notice.... Really? Nine bones for meat on a bun and no fries? They get the stars for good beer selection and the green chili pork stew (only during the winter). Hint...check out Indie Burger up the street (Kenmore & Belmont). At least there, you can hear your own thoughts...

Reviews.Author: Justine M.
Reviews.Content: I wasn't impressed. The burgers are super greasy and flat. The fries weren't as flavorful as the menu makes them out to be. The 2nd time I went here, I got a cripsy portabello "burger" (no meat) and it's wasn't flavorful. I got a big bite of fried portobello. I also don't enjoy the shared tables, loud music and how dark it is.

Reviews.Author: Patrick L.
Reviews.Content: Awesome! My first time at a DMK. Went with the bf & we split a number 1 with an egg, a small order of the Wisconsin Cheese Fries & the Mac & Cheese #2. All were great! The egg on the burger was cooked just right & those in-house potato buns were awesome!On top of that, even at a busy point in the night the food came quick! The service was excellent all around too. With everything listed above plus two milkshakes our bill was just over $30 which was an awesome & inexpensive dinner! I will definitely return as well as check out other of their locations.

Reviews.Author: Natasha C.
Reviews.Content: Visited DMK tonight and it was PACKED! (Good sign) I was surprised but pleasantly surprised. I was also surprised at the number of small children in the place. However, they were quickly given some French fries and were stilled for a moment. We put our name on the list and were told that we can snag a seat at the bar. We were also offered some beer samples while we waited (AWESOME!). So, we stalked the bar and in about 15 minutes 2 seats cleared and we swooped down. We were greeted by Effie who was amazing! Effie made our visit amazing! She was knowledgeable about all the beers on the menu and very patient with us because it was our first time there. She even told us the name of the other bartenders so that we can ask them for service too.(That's a first). Everyone was really nice and the food was exceptional. I really like the fact that you can substitute any of the burgers for turkey or portabella. BRILLIANT! I was in LOVE, I mean in LOVE with Epic Burger but DMK has stolen my heart. I even had a beer here and I'm not even a beer drinker. The next time we visit, I will try the shake...believe me, that will be sooner than later. I recommend the Wisconsin cheddar fries (unbelievable) and the burnt onions on your burger (amazing). Definitely worth the time and money.

Reviews.Author: Bill S.
Reviews.Content: Perhaps I had unrealistic expectations after reading The Burger Issue of Time Out Chicago and from hearing about the place from my friends, but I was not impressed by DMK. We ordered three different burgers and shared them. None of the selections were remarkable. We also tried three different fries. Better than the burgers, for sure, but also not the be-all, end-all of fries I'd heard about. Great selection of beer, although the first two we ordered were on the menu but apparently sold out. That seemed a little weird. Still, a good selection and served nice and cold.Service was friendly and fast, and they were very apologetic about the items they forgot to bring to the table. All things considered, not a bad place but frankly not in my top 10.

Reviews.Author: Seth F.
Reviews.Content: Best Burger Bar in Chicago.  Now those of you who read my Kuma's post may cry a foul at what appears like hypocrisy, but I assure you, my words have been VERY carefully chosen.Roasted Hatch Green Chile is, in my humble opinion, the best they offer.  The Grass-fed lamb is amazing too, but as far as I can tell in my visits, you can't really go wrong (even their ketchups are amazing). If you can get in without waiting more than 25 mins this is the best there is.  Aside: I went once with a large group and my friend's boyfriend ordered a plain burger.  Plain. No cheese, toppings, or condiments. Just a beef patty.  I severely discounted every dern thing the guy said from that point forward.

Reviews.Author: Jules H.
Reviews.Content: I'm quite happy with the right size blue cheese and crispy onion string burger I had here! It was very tasty. And my fellow burger gobbler really liked the patty melt he had. They serve like 9 different beef burger creations and several turkey burger cousins. Fries are creatively concocted as well. We had the sweet potato fries with alioli sauce on the side. We were teetotaling, so I can't vouch for anything other than a diet coke beverage wise.They do serve the burgers on little plates which at first struck me odd, but it was all good because everything I wanted on the burger was on it. I don't do lettuce, pickles, or tomatoes on my burger so it was nice to not have a plate piled with things I don't like on a burger.This place is on the smallish side, you might have to wait for a table when you arrive. It also looks like a great place to consume adult bevs. Huge bar menu! Very loud atmosphere though, so it's not the place for meaningful chit chat with friends, because you can barely hear each other speak. But the food makes up for it because it is really good food, arrives quickly, and when it arrives everyone shuts up and eats! Yay!

Reviews.Author: Annie H.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best veggie burger in the city. I've been twice and both times I've been blown away. I looooove their fries but beware if you're a strict vegetarian, they're beef fat fries. My one star off for that one is I was warned the SECOND time I ate there and not the first. If you're serving veggie friendly food, you need to make sure people know (on the menu or via server) that they aren't ordering vegetarian friendly foods. Otherwise, their buns are out of control and I love the blood orange soda and I'll definitely be back again and again.

Reviews.Author: Christie B.
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I don't like that there really isn't much of a waiting area since you almost always have to wait at least 20-30 minutes on a good night. It's also really loud and really dark. And some of the waitstaff acts a little too cool for school. Putting that all aside, the food is really good. The Big DMK, which is their version of the Big Mac, is so freaking good. I can never eat the whole thing, but one of these days I will defeat you Big DMK!  I also love their milkshakes that you can get boozed up if you are a big kid who still loves milkshakes with their burgers!Another cool thing about DMK is their Uniform & Industry nights. Industry night is every Sunday and gets you 50% off. WooHoo for being a bartender! And Uniform night is on various Wednesdays so check the website. This gives cops, firefighters, EMTS and nurses 25% off AND they let current military dine free. I totally respect DMK for that and that is why I think they deserve 5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Beth M.
Reviews.Content: I want to love this place more - I really do. I love the environment, the people, the free pickles, the beer list- love it.But it comes down to I'm paying $9 for a burger that's good but is it the best burger in Chicago? No. I'm usually three bites into my burger and it's just ehhhh I'll focus on my fries now. I want to say I'm ordering the wrong thing, but I've tried several different burgers. Maybe I am picking the wrong mix for ME but I should have hit that "OMG BEST BURGER EVER" moment by now.But things I totally love: their Wisconsin fries. I will so, so happily come back here just for that and everything else, minus the burger. My biggest complaint is that you can't get it cooked to order. How can a burger place only serve it one way? I prefer it medium rare and feel like the patties are a little too well cooked and dry. Also they super overdo the black pepper there. It's not a matter of if you like some kick- it's picking black pepper out of your teeth later and it's all you can taste sometimes. Really, I'd give this place 3.75 stars. I can't give it a 4 just because it is $9 down the drain knowing there are much tastier burgers in Chicago for cheaper. But all in all, I do enjoy my time there. I'm sure I will be back ever hopeful with trying a new burger and hoping this is the one.

Reviews.Author: Hillary G.
Reviews.Content: Came here with my dad on a dad-date (because burgers...) and we both really enjoyed it. We arrived at opening on a Wednesday which was prime-time for us because it wasn't busy and it wasn't noisy, two things dads tend to dislike, in my experience. Our burgers were awesome, very flavorful. We also ordered the creamy coleslaw and sweet potato fries. The coleslaw was nice and fresh (not TOO creamy) and the sweet potato fries were delicious with their lemon-tabasco aioli. Mmmm. An added bonus was that the guy that brought the food to the table was exceptionally good looking and put my plate down in front of me with a "for you, m'lady" so THANK YOU, YUM. Would definitely return to this dad-friendly establishment!

Reviews.Author: K F.
Reviews.Content: Turkey burger w/ fried egg, sweet potato fries and a $5 thin mint girl scout cookie milkshake. Mouthgasm. First off, that was thee tastiest turkey I've ever tasted on a burger. I don't know what they put in the meat but my taste buds were celebrating. I'm not a huge fan of sweet potatoes but due to the abundance in recommendations via yelp I decided to give it a try. No regrets they were quite amazing. Not too greasy and the portion of the small was perfect. I just prefer regular ketchup over the sauce it came with. The milkshake was a concoction of vanilla and mint chocolate chip icecream complimented by a generous helping of girl scout thin mint cookies...need I say more? I loved the chunks and whole pieces of cookies they included wandering in the minty goodness. Returning and dragging all of my yearning to get fat friends with me =)Service was good too btw. Food came out surprisingly quick and our waitress was friendly.

Reviews.Author: A. M.
Reviews.Content: Drinks:  Great selection of beers.  I didn't partake in any cocktails but the list looked awesome. One had rhubarb jam - so creative!  Also there was a huge selection of gin & tonic mixes.  Score!Food:  Unbelievably AWESOME.  This is probably my second favorite burger of all time.  I had the standard one and husband had the bbq one.  Both delicious.  We also had the mac & cheese with bacon and red onion as well as the fries with salt & vinegar with pepper.  All were stellar.  Even though we ate a substantial amount of food, we left feeling light as feathers.  I attribute that to the grass-fed beef.  Truly top quality and didn't leave you feeling gross and puffy like other burgers.  Service:  Bartenders were attentive even though it was busy (3pm on St. Patrick's Day).  Our waitress was equally attentive and friendly.  Really no complaints here. Ambience:  Packed but not overflowing.  It was a pretty chill crowd but all likes of people - kids and parents to older adults and all in between.  No douche bags (even on St. Patrick's Day!)Anything else worth noting:  I've been wanting to come to this place for a long time because I've heard so many great things about the burgers and how great you feel after eating them.  It really was everything I wanted it to be and more.  I will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Mark H.
Reviews.Content: Fast service..nice staff. Great beer selections.  Young crowd (20ish). Low prices. Would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Author: Claire P.
Reviews.Content: Tasty lamb burger. Really nice waitress, she have us free fried pickles!! Also best music around

Reviews.Author: Gigi E.
Reviews.Content: Hands down, best burgers. Know that it is loud and you will wait for a bit (30-60 mins on Saturday evening) but totally worth it. Awesome service.

Reviews.Author: Erich S.
Reviews.Content: DMK versus the other places that we've given 5-stars burgers has a nice balance between a straight-up burger versus fun variances on the classic.Their selection of burgers is akin to Kuma's, but I find them tastier and better executed. Their fries... damn... amazing. Seriously. It's a thinner patty, so don't expect a big honkin thick burger, but it's juicy and average sized. Where they go the extra mile (IMHO) is in the beverages - great beer selection, plus shakes. I mean, if you're doing a burger with bacon and fries with aioli, you're already going all-out, so why not have a shake?

Reviews.Author: Alejandro H.
Reviews.Content: I've been here numerous times and I am never disappointed. There is really nothing I would change about this place. The service is great, the prices aren't bad, and the environment is cool. I would recommend the Big DMK, it's a Big Mac on crack! Their sodas are awesome too! I try and take all my friends that visit Chicago here, the ones that do manage to make it here have had their taste buds changed for life!

Reviews.Author: Jeremy D.
Reviews.Content: Famous chef (Michael Kornick) and famous steak family (varying siblings of Morton's the Steakhouse as well as family) have been doing business together for several years now and mostly in "upscale" joints. Bringing things down to earth in a Burger Bar concept... And another warrior enters the Terrordome for Burger Supremacy.This place has been open for a little while, they seem to overall be holding their own against those who enter.Now... You have a "choice" of 15 burgers and their combos... So if you are someone who prefers to "build your own..."you may not like this.  See, you can "remove" ingredients from the 15 listed but; except for additional patty of beef ($3) or adding an egg ($1), you can't add nutthin'. Now, I liked the idea of the combos and so I'm overall ok with it.Went with a #4: Burger with Roasted Hatch Chilies, Over Easy Egg, Smoked Bacon and Sonoma Jack Cheese.The bun here is really good. Almost a slightly fluffier/ lighter English Muffin, so it has a bit of density but not as puffed out as a traditional Parker House Roll style Burger Bun.The beef is excellent, comes out "just under" medium (would like to see a bit more char) and VERY juicy. The #4 combo is a GOOD one... All things I like (and I really LIKE Hatch Chilies), the burger comes together in a very satisfying package. I'm also a BIG fan of Sweet Potato Fries... The Lemon and Tabasco Aioli is pretty outstanding. Not too hot at first but the tang of the chilies AND the aioli suddenly sneaks up on you. The fries themselves were good and crispy. Properly seasoned.Extensive and well priced beer list. Would like to see some more interesting choices on their wines. C'mon, this is BEEF!This place is good. Could be a touch more generous with the bacon? I'd also like to see the burger FILL the circumference of the bun and not come kinda shy of. But the flavors are good and the variety shows some creativity. I'd like to also see some "flexibility" in adding ingredients. I'm a BIG fan of a "Bleu and Bacon" with mushrooms burger.

Reviews.Author: Brian I.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here numerous times, and I typically avoid the busiest times of day (if you read my reviews, you'll notice that I don't believe in standing in lines). I enjoy the burgers and fries and have been known to make an excuse to end up walking past DMK.  I'm not a vegetarian, but I have many friends who are. When 3 people at the table order the veggie burgers , I would like to think the staff might warn us that the fries aren't vegetarian.  I mean, how often does a non-veggie order a veggie burger at a burger place, right? We had no idea (granted, we should have asked before we did on our 5 or 6th visit). But eventually we did find out that the fries are not vegetarian. Now I get the fries to myself  (which is cool for me). Overall, I'm a huge fan of the burgers and the beer list is always good (Dogfish 120 min on tap!?!?! what what!) but,  unfortunately, I'm docking a star - for what I think the quality of the food deserves - due to the somewhat deceptive fries. (BTW, the veggie patties are fried separately and are vegetarian.)

Reviews.Author: Allison S.
Reviews.Content: Boo for the wayyyyyyyyy too loud music. It's a shame because it takes away from the awesome burgers and even awesomer fries. I would go there all the time, but i've been three times and it's sort of way over the top too loud. Like can't hear the person RIGHT next to you loud.If they fixed that, it would be a whole new ballgame, and a whole 'nother star.

Reviews.Author: Karl M.
Reviews.Content: The service was very spacey. I asked the waitress if my beer came in a "bomber" and she said, "Yes!" so naturally I was expecting a nice big session brew and what showed up was a puny 16 oz bottle. I thought... "Ok... Now I have room for that awesome peanut butter chocolate malt I've been hearing about!" SO fine... small beer it is... On to the feast!!!Or.. wait... is this IT? Yep.The burger just isn't that big. I ordered the double and it still seemed kinda flimsy.The toppings were great and seemed well put together. I had the Bison burger and it was nice. juicy and thin.The fried pickles and okra were a bit heavy but they had an interesting taste. I am not a deep-fry fan anymore. The waitress just brought them out. They kinda sent my palate off and ruined my stomach. The mega-super-ridiculous IPA rounded that out though.The sweet potato fries were fries. Something truffle or whatever. Thin and crispy. Ok.The beer selection is alright. They have some nice ones in most every common style. Not a huge selection but a very nice one. Beers change all the time so I won't name names.The peanut butter chocolate malt was a big let down. It had no malty character whatsoever and they hardly blended it at all so it just had a big smear of peanut butter and chocolate-whatever-the-hell-they-use marbled on the side of the cheap to-go plastic cup... pretty and all but tasty as shit, too... AND SMALL!!!I double checked to make sure they put the malt in and they SAID they did... It was pretty much vanilla shakey until the peanut butter clogged my straw halfway through. Then I mixed it around and had a peanut butter shake with a crappy chocolate kind of colored substance but no chocolate flavor.Maybe my expectations were too high but who can I blame for that? It just seems like a shallow joint that serves over-priced, clever food but not high quality, well thought out foods.The only reason I wasn't completely throwing this place in the forget-me-pile was because my buddy got the bill. If I had to pay for this I would have hit  a brick. My stars don't come cheap and if you're charging a premium price you'd better deliver the goods.The place wasn't even busy, in fact we were the second table.The staff seem to have such a holy high regard for the place as if it were god's gift to burgers. But that's probably due to the location... it is an awesome spot.Maybe I'm just too demanding... Go judge for yourself.

Reviews.Author: Sarah S.
Reviews.Content: This place has really good burgers, but it's probably not the best choice to come here on a Friday or Saturday night at dinner time. Wait times are 2+ hours long. If you really want to try this place, grab your best guy or gal and try to wiggle your way into a bar seat. The staff was polite, the atmosphere was loud, crowded (think a bar) and probably not the best place to take parents when they are in town. Oh yea, food is a-la carte and you will definitely end up spending $30-$40 if you get a burger, fries and maybe 2 beers.Epic burger has similar food without the crowds.

Reviews.Author: Scott K.
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth the reputation. Stopped here several times while in Chicago for work. DMK is notable for not only having a great burger and bun, but also being a cool joint for unique burger toppings and a full bar that gets lively at night. The bartenders were very friendly and service was great. Their buns come from a local bakery and are awesome, and the cool sides (mac and cheese and french fry varieties) are a great addition as well. I visited a few times during my stay and each burger was excellent, but the #4 (with a fried egg!) definitely stood out as one of the best burgers I have had in my life. Would recommend this place to any Texan!I recommend: #4 with sweet potato fries or mac n cheese with bacon

Reviews.Author: T C M.
Reviews.Content: Both times, burgers have been okay. #4 needs more green chile. It's barely enough to taste. Fries too crispy. Very loud.

Reviews.Author: John F.
Reviews.Content: This place was reviewed over 1000 times?  Yelp! sure is going strong in Chicago!Solid burger, great service and classy yet cool layout made DMK an awesome place to frequent. My burger tasted a lot like a big mac, only better (order it, trust me).  I'm not super familiar with the neighborhood, but it seems nice.  Burgers were very flavorful and big.  The fries pretty much stole the show, as they were excellent and generously portioned.  If you happen to have room after your through with your meal, try their delicious shakes.The service was excellent.  Our bartender was a really nice guy and made sure our food/beers were served promptly.  Prices here are also reasonable.Looking forward to coming back soon.

Reviews.Author: Lauren S.
Reviews.Content: Okay, burgers are really, really good here!  MMMM!  Sad part?  The service kind of stinks.We came here for lunch on a weekday, a group of about 6 gals that love their burgers! The restaurant was not very crowded and it took forever to get drinks or to make an order or ask for anything.  Even though our server was very nice, they just weren't very attentive.  It actually took a long time to even get our check to pay these peeps which was a disappointment.  BUT, the burger, I enjoyed very, very much!

Reviews.Author: Anuj S.
Reviews.Content: DMK knows how to do it right.What wait... DMK is a popular place and unfortunately they don't take reservations.  I guess we were in the mood to wait.  It's a Saturday night the wait was 1hr and 45mins when we got there at like 8:15pm!!  I didn't know that until later because I went to park, or I wouldn't have stayed.  We sort of eased our way in to seats at the bar.  Eventually the entire group was seated quite comfortably at this table kind of at the end of the bar.  We got the last two seats probably an hour in.  Well... it was still a long wait, but we knew that going in.The thing that bothered me more than the wait was how rude the hostess was.  Honestly, that's probably the main reason for my hesitation to give this place the full 5 stars.  With such a long wait, I think it was normal to check on the timing after like an hour.  I didn't think that was imposing on her or anything.  She was quite rude about the follow-up.On the other hand, our server was great.  Since we ended up sitting at the bar, the bartender was also our waiter.  He was awesome.  It was one of the best service experiences after that point.  He was patient, accommodating, attentive...  He handled special requests without any hint of annoyance and even brought us out some taste portions of fries while we waited.  And this was at the bar, which was like crazy-jam-packed-busy.  It was an impressive experience.Now for the food and drink.  The fries and onion rings were great.  The veggie burger I had was also really good.  Maybe not the best I've ever had, but I liked it.  It was like fried... crispy on the outside.  Was great with onion rings and blue cheese on top.  Others tried the portabella sandwich, which they enjoyed.  Also, other variations of the veggie burger were also enjoyed by all.  Lastly, the mac & cheese and grilled cheese were all yummy (I took a bite of each for tasting).  So really food-wise, everything was great.Even though the place was packed, we noticed that the crowd really thinned out around the same time we sat at the bar.  Next time I'd definitely go at like 9:30... even 9pm.  Overall great job at DMK - I'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Brittany H.
Reviews.Content: I am not a huge burger person, but I am hooked on DMK. If you're looking for a spot for some awesome burgers and brews, dmk is the place. Not only do they have great burgers, they have an extensive list of craft beers, and their fries are delicious. My girlfriend & I always go and split the truffle fries & wisconsin cheese fries. They're both so good we can never settle on just one kind.I always get the burger with blue cheese and onion straws. It is seriously so good I can't even bring myself to try another kind. I've also gotten the same burger with a veggie patty, and it was delish. Although it is usually crowded around dinner time, the place is lively and it's not too difficult to grab a beer at the bar while you wait. This is one of my fav places to take my out of town guests, since it's both affordable and delish.

Reviews.Author: Erica K.
Reviews.Content: I really want to like DMK. Seriously. I've gone 3 times always hoping it will really knock my socks off. But it never does. My issues are as follows:It's just too loud in this place. I'm just not impressed with the food. The burgers are...trying too hard? The meat is so covered in toppings that you lose the taste of this grass fed beef they play up so much. They only have 1 bathroom each for men and women. WTH? This place is busy on a weekend evening and the bathroom line gets silly long, with no where really stand without being in the way of the kitchen. That said, Sunday we had a very nice waitress and a very handsome (like, dang gina) food runner and the bloody mary's were excellent. BUT, that doesn't make up for the fact that my $11 burger was kind of lame.

Reviews.Author: Brett G.
Reviews.Content: DMK Burger Bar is really awesome.   I've gone on an actual quest to find the best burgers in Chicago.  DMK is one of the frontrunners in this competition.   There are so many reason.  The burgers are awesome.  I really like the fries+cheese combinations that you can order.I mostly stick to the HolyGuac-aioli.  Chorizo, a bunch of other stuff, and a patty?  I'M IN!  Why would I want to try any of the other sandwiches when I already know that this one is so awesome?I'm not into beer as much, but my craft beer friend was into their selection.  They had a nice liquor selection if I recall correctly though.  The atmosphere is nice and hip. There's usually a 30 min wait whenever I go.   Definitely worth it though.

Reviews.Author: Jen L.
Reviews.Content: This place is goooood! Went there on a Saturday and they were very busy. We waited about 30 minutes to be seated, but once seated the service was very fast. The atmosphere is loud so I wouldn't recommend going here on a first date. Okay, let's talk about what really matters....the food. I had the #10 which is a turkey burger and oh my goodness was it delicious. The buns are perfect and the dijonnaise spread is yummy. My husband had the #1 and he too thought his was delicious. We split an order of the parmesan fries and those were good too. We will definitely be going here again.

Reviews.Author: Diana C.
Reviews.Content: I love everything about you.DMK is one of my favorites, and my go-to. I can't think of anytime someone has suggested and I've thought I don't feel like going there.My go-to is the Turkey Burger with Arugula, served alongside the Wisconsin Cheddar Fries. *delicious*It is ridiculous on the craving scale; I have hopped the Brown Line to go there from downtown for lunch. Bonuses: they have delicious milkshakes: (chocolate, vanilla, peanut butter) and a "special" milkshake every month. Also every month, they choose a non-profit organization to donate all proceeds of their $5 special to. Delicious do-gooders? I'm IN.

Reviews.Author: Cameron H.
Reviews.Content: After seeing this place on DDD, I could not resist.  Finally, I was able to go with a friend last night.  Upon our arrival, we were asked did we want to sit high or low.  Of course we chose high.  Then our waitress arrived with the menus.  She was very friendly and cute as well.  This is truly a burger joint.  I love the option of being able to swap any burger with either Turkey or crispy portobello (no charge) or even bison, lamb or veggie (for an up charge $2).  The only thing I don't like is that there are no substitutions on condiments or cheese.  You have the option of leaving it off but not exchanging it for something else.  Odd.We started off with a bottle of wine (red zin).  Delicious.  For our meal, I had the #4 (Roasted Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack, Smoked Bacon) but with the crispy portobello.  My friend had the #10 (Turkey, Smoked Swiss, Tomato Arugula, Dijonnaise).  For a side, she ordered the sweet potato fries and I ordered the standard cut fries with Parmesan, Truffle Cream.  Every thing was amazing!!!   Great location (Wellington and the brown/purple line), great service, great food, and great price.I will definitely go back!!!

Reviews.Author: Tabitha W.
Reviews.Content: I was all set to love this place - I had checked out the menu online and was excited to try their Peanut Butter Shake as well as some of their interesting french fry flavors - oh, and a (veggie) burger, of course.  We arrived around 1 on a Saturday afternoon and were quoted a 45-minute wait. This actually ended up being like a 30-minute wait - I always appreciate less of a wait time than estimated.  So, the wait time was fine, but there is just nowhere good to wait. Especially with the crowd that was there. A better designated wait area would work wonders.  Finally seated, we ordered that Peanut Butter Milkshake, which was super yummy.  There were 2 veggie burgers on the menu, so my husband ordered #11 with the House Veggie and Grain burger and the Wisconsin Cheese Fries and I ordered the Crispy Portobello with the Parmesan and Truffle Cream Fries...And then the waitress asked, "are you guys vegetarian?" She explained that the fries are actually cooked in beef fat, so we nixed those. Curiously, the other appetizers are cooked in canola oil, so my husband opted for the the Fried Okra & Dill Pickles. Sensing our immense disappointment, she also brought us a half-order of the Chili-Rubbed Onion Strings on the house.  My burger was good - the crispness made it less chewy and soggy than it can be at other places.  Oh, if only I could have tried those fries!  :(  I really appreciate that the waitress volunteered that information - a lot of places aren't even knowledgeable about that, but I really don't understand why they don't prepare the fries differently.

Reviews.Author: Amy X.
Reviews.Content: I was amazed. They have great burgers and sweet potato fries. I came here with a friend on a weekday afternoon. Street parking was not too bad. They have a mini bar, so you can come with a friend or two to chat and chill. Burger portions are small, so if you are a big eater, consider ordering a second or appetizers.

Reviews.Author: Heidi S.
Reviews.Content: Burgers were really large, which helps justify the price, and creative.  However, I've had more creative burgers where the ingredients worked together a little bit better.I thought the mac'n'cheese was fine, but nothing special.  We also got a side of the fries with cheddar and scallions, but the cheddar was more of a sauce than just melted cheese, and it had kind of a funky texture and after-taste that was REALLY strong.Overall, it's a fine meal, but it was a little pricey for menu items that were good, not amazing.

Reviews.Author: Thamer B.
Reviews.Content: me, my wife and another couple were at a show in the area and it was kinda late so i checked my bookmarks found DMK is nearest open so we decided to give it a shot.The area was kinda dark but did not feel unsafe that much, anyways, i ordered the turkey burger which i liked, my wife had the bison burger with goat cheese and raspberry bbq sauce which she did not like, the other couple ordered basic bison burger and they said it was just okay.their fries is a blast specially the truffle and the sweet potatoes fries.it was not a bad experience but it was not an outstanding, although the waitress was attentive and helpful pretty muchif i was in the area and i had limited choices to pick from i would consider eating here again

Reviews.Author: Chris A.
Reviews.Content: I've tried to find a better burger... in the world... but nothing has come close to DMK.  The #1 (Aged Cheddar, Smoked Bacon, Charred Balsamic Red Onions, Rufus Teague's BBQ Sauce) simply cannot be beat.  I strayed once from the #1 and got the #5 Bison Burger (Fresh Goat Cheese, Pickled Red Onions, Blueberry BBQ Sauce) and although it was delicious, it didn't match the #1.One of the most difficult things a restaurant can do is deliver a favorite dish to a loyal customer over and over again - DMK nails it in spades.Honestly, the food is so good the other pieces of the puzzle don't matter that much, but the ambiance is great, service is pretty good, and the wait is... well, worth it!

Reviews.Author: Shaina K.
Reviews.Content: This place is slightly expensive, but they're good. Their burgers are the perfect portion, and there will probably be no leftovers. I love their fries, they have some awesome truffle fries!! This place gets crowded later at night, but we went at 6, and were able to get a table with no issues. The service was great.

Reviews.Author: Jamie B.
Reviews.Content: After a few beers at the Kirkwood for the NE game, we decided to go get something to eat at DMK.  Overall they have pretty good burgers.  I like that they're on a traditional bun and are clearly handmade.  They have a couple of veggie burgers too that cater to the vegetarians, so that's nice too.  The three of us split some onion strings, which I was disappointed with.  Should have ordered the fries like everyone recommends.  We will be back to try some more things off the menu.

Reviews.Author: Justin B.
Reviews.Content: Let's keep it brief since there are hundreds of reviews for this place already--service was great, my #15 burger special was great (don't remember exactly what was in it, but there was definitely cheese, duck, and beef all over this thing with the DMK bun...tasty), my milkshake was maybe the best I've had in Chicago, and the french fries--both the Wisconsin cheddar fries and the parmesan/truffle--were pretty good.  The beer selection was hearty and had something for all four of my team members.I don't think this ranks as high for me as the triumvirate of Kuma's, Lockdown and Butcher & the Burger, but it's close.

Reviews.Author: Mandy K.
Reviews.Content: This place has an awesome ambiance, great service and even better burgers.  The beer list is pretty great as well.  Our bartender Alex was terrific,  made perfect suggestions for both beer and food. We also really liked the fact that they had charity items where all proceeds of those items went to the charity of the month. Great idea!

Reviews.Author: Kelly M.
Reviews.Content: Wonderful! Great food, friendly service, great atmosphere. So good! Had the bison burger, Parmesan fries and pineapple basil shake. Delicious on all counts!

Reviews.Author: Ben B.
Reviews.Content: DMK has the potential to be great.I kinda hate the layout of the place.  Long bench seats are on one side of each table and chairs are on the other.  This required our server to jut her entire upper torso over our table to speak to both of us.I ordered one of the temporary special burgers.  It had duck sausage, gruyere cheese and red wine caramelized onions.  Tasty, for sure.  I wish the beef patty were thicker.  Perhaps the combo was too rich.We also ordered the Parmesan fries.  Those were really good.  I would have preferred thicker-cut fries as well.I also drank a Death & Company's Whirling Tiger (bourbon, fresh apple & lemon, ginger syrup).  It was blindingly strong.I applaud DMK's creativity, and I'll be back.  I just wish the portions were a little beefier.

Reviews.Author: Meagan H.
Reviews.Content: Holy cow! Although this place was packed it was well worth the wait for a table.  It was super dark. I didn't like that because I want to see what color my burger comes out. But they did a good job cooking.I ordered my usual dog fish 90 minute. I love my strong beer.  To start off we ordered fried pickles. Yup. It was definitely deep fried to divert me to a diabetes state. But, good.  I then got my burger. A chorizo, chipotle, cilantro and guacamole hunk of heaven. I loved it!  If I had room for dessert I definitely would have taken advantage because I'm sure it would have been amazing.What can I say? The service was just ok, but it was better than most places that are that busy.  I was surprised the waitress could remember our orders off the top of her head considering all tables were full.  So I was impressed by that.  She got a hefty tip.  This place was great! I couldn't have asked for much more except for a little more light.

Reviews.Author: Lenny S.
Reviews.Content: Great Food, delicious burgers and awesome Mac & Cheese! They have a great beer and cocktail selection too. The reason I didn't give them 5 stars is the beer I ordered for $7 was teeny. Should've been a pint for 7 bucks!

Reviews.Author: Shawn K.
Reviews.Content: Parmesan truffle fries are awesome.

Reviews.Author: Ben B.
Reviews.Content: I had a little sticker shock when I saw the burgers don't even come with sides, but I quickly changed my tune once the food came out. These burgers are phenomenal, and they have Daisy cutter on tap. I was in a rush, so I sat at the bar. I was gone in less then 15 minutes, and can't wait to try more of the menu!
