Reviews.Author: Anna T.
Reviews.Content: Truffle fries were a bust.. Totally not worth the $40 for two burgers and a basket of fries. Go to other places... They will be better!

Reviews.Author: Bridget K.
Reviews.Content: It's a Tuesday night in the beginning of February and my family is out and about to celebrate the brother-in-law's birthday.  He loves burgers and so does the rest of the family.  After trying a few other famous burger places, we found out they all had an hour wait on a Tuesday.  We were super hungry so we headed off to DMK Burger Bar.  We walked in and we seated right away.  We ordered our burgers (one being vegetarian) and two orders of fries to share.  The burgers and fries came out fast which was nice considering how hungry we all were.  The fries were pretty great.  We got one order of the Wisconsin cheddar and scallion which were delish.  The other fries were the sea salt and cracked pepper which were also great.  After dinner we were getting ready for the check so we could get some desert.  When our server came over and gave us free samples of the Raspberry Linzer Shake (which happens to be the shake of the month for February 2013).  The shake was good and a nice surprise.  Thanks DMK for saving the day when it came to the brother-in-law's birthday dinner.

Reviews.Author: Klima K.
Reviews.Content: Their burger wont let you down, I guarantee, just the atmosphere take away one star from the rating cuz it's too noisy. You can't hear other's words unless they yell to you.

Reviews.Author: Jess F.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I came a time when there weren't a lot of people. I saw good reviews on yelp and decided to give it a try. It's a bit far from downtown, but very close to the subway. This place is literally all about burgers. Their menu is very small. Fries are separate from the burgers, just a FYI. I guess it's so you can focus all your attention on the burger. They have lots of burgers, so it was kind of hard to decide which one to eat.I ended up getting the special which was Santa (something). I don't remember. But it was salsa, egg and tortilla chips. It was very unique and very good. HUGE burger with very moist meat, grilled to perfection. THe only thing that was disappointing, which I know would be really hard to perfect was the fact my tortilla chips were soggy. I know, that's just being really picky, but the sides that didn't soak up the sauce were very crispy, so it left a nice sensation in my mouth. My friend ordered the double stack. It was HUGE! He had a messy time eating it. But definitely worth it. My other friend ordered the regular. Still a very big burger, but also grilled to perfection. We ordered sweet potato tots to share. Those were really good. Very sweet potatoes and very crispy. Usually sweet potato fries aren't as crispy as you'd get with regular fries, but these tots were super crispy. The sauce it came with was also really good. My friend ordered the choco banana milkshake. SO GOOD. If I had more room in my stomach, I probably would have gotten one myself. Very banana-y flavour and good hint of chocolate. VERY thick milkshake, I used a spoon to take some from my friend's drink. Hahaha. Great place for burgers and milkshakes. The only thing is it's far from the city, so for tourists like me, it would be very hard and probably would go unnoticed if I hadn't done some research ahead of time. At least we stopped by Lincoln park when we came back from this place. It's only a few bus stops away. When you go visit, be prepared to get messy. Not a place to be eating your burger with delicacy and table manners!

Reviews.Author: Taylor O.
Reviews.Content: Do not expect to have a conversation while dining here.... SO loud. The bison burger with goat cheese and blueberry BBQ is great and worth the chaos. The house veggie burger is also decent!

Reviews.Author: Paul F.
Reviews.Content: Amazing burger! Perfect size and no wastage!  The taste is just out of this world! Hostess and servers were all very attentive! 3 thumbs up!

Reviews.Author: Jennie C.
Reviews.Content: Fiiiiiinally had a chance to try this place, at the suggestion of a vegetarian friend. Huh what? Yep, this is a burger place that can sub out the patty of any burger with a fried Portobello! I was almost jealous...if my own burger weren't so good. I had burger #1 with the balsamic onions & bbq sauce AND a fried egg. Not your steakhouse big patties so no inquiries about doneness. But it was still juicy and yummy. Friend got the greek burger with Portobello and really loved it too. We shared some sweet potato fries and an espresso shake (ok, I drank most of it), which is why this review took so long because I've been trying to work off all that food! Yes it's loud, but your mouth will be too busy chewing so no need to worry about conversations! We walked right in to a mostly empty dining room around 5p on a Sunday, but there were tons of people waiting by 6:30.

Reviews.Author: Jocelyn D.
Reviews.Content: Delicious (yet different) burgers, amazing fries, awesome homemade sodas, and consistently pleasant service. Totally recommended burger spot.

Reviews.Author: Jack B.
Reviews.Content: Great Burgers/Beef, Fries are even better than the burgers.  I got the big DMK: 5 stars,  Wisconsin Cheddar scallion fries: 5 stars (I am from WI and it might of been the best cheddar i've ever had).  Parmesan fries with truffle cream sauce is probably one of the best things I've ever had.  This is not your typical burger joint that has good to great burgers and then some crappy buns and frozen fries.  Great beer selection, be prepared to wait with one.   Any burger can be made with a veggie or turkey patty. They make their burgers medium only :(  Still amazing though.

Reviews.Author: Roland C.
Reviews.Content: This place is for you if you like : - Sweet potatoes- Burgers- Cheese (too many to chose)- The Chicago Cubs

Reviews.Author: Jen P.
Reviews.Content: I had to have CHEESE FRIES!  However I didn't know where to go. So I prayed...(yes I did)  I read reviews on DMK and decided to also try a burger. I ordered #1 and happy I did! The hand cut fries w/cheddar & scallions was good however it had TOO much salt. I don't know if that's the way they serve them or someone got happy with the salt.  I understand this Establishment is a bar, whereas if your drinking beer you might not notice it.  But everyone doesn't like their food drowning in salt. Overall.. I would revisit.

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: I only ever come here on a Sunday night because after 9pm, if you work in the industry, EVERYTHING IS HALF PRICE. Great deal, I've enjoyed the bison burger, the big salad and the garlic fries on numerous occasions. They also have great, american beers... I LOVE DMK!

Reviews.Author: Francisco A.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome, their meat is amazing ! definitely on list of best burger meat I ever had. I personally tried #11 I believe, chorizo, guacamole burger..... AMAZING ! Their fries are good as well ! Waitress was always checking on us and food was served quickly. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Renee E.
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy a good burger and I always prefer mine rare to medium rare. I was a bit surprised that I was unable to order mine that way at DMK and that my waitress informed me, they're all done medium. Sadness. So, I got my burger and as it was, I was doing this paleo-challenge, i.e. no bun, so it was a wee little beef patty with pretty much no discernable seasoning, and definitely on the other side of medium, toward well. I don't know if the bun would've saved it, but I wasn't feeling it. Mustard helped salvage the dryness, but definitely not what I was looking for.DMK, however, gets an extra star for the sweet potato fries, accompanied by a delicious aioli. YUM.

Reviews.Author: Christie K.
Reviews.Content: I came here because I wanted to try a very good burger in Chicago. And this burger was definitely delicious! I have never had beef from grass-fed cows before. Maybe it's because I just assumed it tastes all the same. But it's reallllllllly different. The beef is less dense and more porous. It's just as good as other beef patties I've had, it's just different. I tried the #1 (Beef Burger w/ Cheddar, Smoked Bacon,  Charred Balsamic Red Onions, Rufus Teaguq's BBQ Sauce) and the #4 (Beef Burger with Roasted Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack, Smoked Bacon). I LOVED both burgers, but I liked the #4 because I love eating peppers and jack cheese. I love their beers on tap too. It complements the burger very well. Now I'm on the prowl for places that use grass-fed beef....

Reviews.Author: Bethany B.
Reviews.Content: I just don't get it! I love hamburgers, and had DMK on my must-try list for ages. Glowing reviews on yelp. Friends raved this is the best burger in the city...Finally had the chance to try a DMK burger last weekend, and I was left disappointed and confused. The burger was very "meh". Thin bun. Thin patty. Burger patty was cooked well done and tasted slightly burnt in places. We weren't asked how we wanted the burgers cooked. I understand some places don't do this, but I've come to expect it at places where the burger is the star of the show, and high quality meat is used. French fries were fine, but also over done. I had McDonald's fries this weekend too, and they were way better. The service was great, friendly, timely. Beer list had a decent selection. With so many amazing, juicy, well-bunned and properly cooked burgers to be had in this city, I just don't understand the hype around DMK. What am I missing?

Reviews.Author: Stephanie W.
Reviews.Content: Is this real life?These burgers are incredible. As always, I went with a fairly classic (plain) choice by ordering #8. (I said it once and I'll say it again: delicious burgers do not need a million flavors to make my taste buds water.) Although the condiments were minimal, the taste was not.And what, SIX different kinds of fries?! It's almost like they created this restaurant with me in mind. (I'm partial to Wisconsin cheddar & scallion.)As Arnold Schwarzenegger once said, I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Damian S.
Reviews.Content: The waitstaff is super nice, the beer selection is awesome, the burger list is short (but there were at least 6 of the 14 that I really wanted to try!). I also couldn't believe that they will let you sample from the bottles or cans of beer that they have available--that's unheard of--but great! I would definitely go back again!The atmosphere is really laid back, and the space is very open. I could imagine that this place gets a little crowded at night, but probably with standing patrons for the bar, as the tables are spaced nicely far apart. You shouldn't hear too much of the adjacent table's conversation.

Reviews.Author: Casie S.
Reviews.Content: DMK does not disappoint and the Chicago and Oak Brook locations are consistently delish. I've tried just about every burger on the menu and loved them all. I would say the bison burger is my favorite and the party melt an close runner up, but you cant go wrong on any of the burger items. The Parmesan truffle fries, the blue cheese bacon fries and sweet potato fries are incredible.  For drinks, the blood orange soda was refreshing and the espresso shake was probably the best coffee flavored shake I've ever had. I do wish they had some chicken options on the menu. Every now and then they do have a special turkey burger, but chances are I'd still get a beef burger.  Keep up the great work and I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Brett D.
Reviews.Content: I didn't love it. I didn't hate it. If I were Erin P. I'd 'nothing' it. Either way, I think it's plain to see I did not find the love affair I was so hungrily seeking with the newly opened DMK Burger Bar. While the modern/rustic décor, inventive concept and friendly staff appear to be a smashing success, the burgers are not. Le Exhale Noisily... er, Sigh. You can't have 'Burger Bar' in your name without really being able to produce big time on burger fabulosity. I mean, even our beloved beef Forefathers knew to keep it ambiguous... think about it; Kuma's Corner, Apple Pan, Blackie's, hell even Flub A Dub Chub's, they all manage to keep expectations in check by promising nothing - but um, floppy appendages - in their moniker. But to tout 'burger' in flashing lights (literally) and then produce a meager product on an appetizer sized plate... well, that's just bait 'n switch, my friends. They sold me a Lemon I tell ya! My slightly under-seasoned turkey burger with goopy eggplant, less-than-punchy blue cheese coleslaw and utterly boring ciabatta bun left me gobble, gobble gloomy. There was zero pizazz... literally. No wow factor, no extras... like I dunno, toppings aside from what exactly was mentioned on the menu (i.e. eggplant and coleslaw). The term 'burger bar' conjured images of multiple bun choices, a veritable cheese-a-palooza, terrific toppings galore and ooey, gooey, loveliness. Not here my moo muse, not here. While the beer selection positively rawks, the deviled eggs are tasty fun and the fries are crispy, crunchy perfect - especially the truffle and parmesan ones - the burgers were hardly worth the calorie sacrifice they without a doubt require. DMK... a bar for the recreational meat eater. You've been cow cautioned.

Reviews.Author: Stacey A.
Reviews.Content: DMK is not the same as Kuma's.You'd think this would be obvious as one place is named DMK and is in Lincoln Park, and the other place is named Kuma's and is in Avondale. OBVIOUSLY THEY ARE NOT THE SAME PLACE.So it would stand to reason that the food, crowd, decor, and general ambiance would be different at each place because they are...NOT THE SAME PLACE.Don't go to one expecting the other. The same would go for cupcake places (More & Swirlz? Not the same.) and steakhouses (Wildfire is not Primehouse). You'd think this would be a given, but people appear to be going to DMK expecting the second coming of Kuma's.DMK is NOT the second coming of Kuma's.DMK is a lovely, comfortable, minimally decorated stretch of restaurant (it's longer than it is wide) that serves up some creative options that are not insanely expensive nor too big to eat,  some really tasty sounding house drinks, a lot of *delicious* craft beer options (with a focus on local breweries in IL, WI, & MI) and some beefy red wines to go along with the burgers.Emily B. and I stopped in here for dinner tonight. We were really only intending for it to be "snacks" but I figured "What the hell, I never leave my house except to go to work, might as well eat a burger."Now, Em had been here before so she told me about all the delicious things she'd had before and I poured over the menu and drooled about things (like the LAMB BURGER with feta and Greek salad and olive tapenade).Since there were only two of us, and only one of us (me) was getting a burger, we settled on two small portions of fries - sweet potato with a lemon tobasco aioli  and regular potato with badass cheddar (that tasted like Merkts) and chives. Perfectly portioned for two people to split and not feel overly full. em told me that if you come with a big group, to basically order one small thing of fries per person in the group and everyone should be covered that way.I ordered burger #2 (they don't have names, they're numbered. duh.) - which came with chipotle ketchup, bleu cheese, and those fried onion straws.And it was delicious. And it was not Kuma's.And I will totally go back and get that lamb burger thing because it sounded fucking good.

Reviews.Author: Colleen C.
Reviews.Content: Errrrrrr. Don'tMeasure (up to)Kuma'sThe burgers? Ok. I find it very odd they serve just your burger on a smallish (think tapas shared) plate. Like, just put it on a normal plate? Then you can split the fries out? Salad (yeah, I know, so very boring), but they have ONE big one on the menu (near the bottom), and while it sounded good on paper, the execution was drowned in dressing. Fail. But, I get it. It's a salad at a burger bar, but do it well if you are gonna do it! Salad fury. Stellar beer selection. (local focus, bonus)Malts 'n ShakesLotsa Fries (truffle fries just OK)A-OK, certainly a good addition to this stretch, but I wasn't overly impressed and would not pound the pavement to hit it up again. If you are a burgers 'n fries fanatic, def give it a shot.

Reviews.Author: Jelena Z.
Reviews.Content: DMK, you're my 600th review! Only relevant to me, I know, but still felt like shouting it from the rooftops.What is relevant, is that you can see that I eat out quite a bit. A side-effect of that (besides a skinny wallet) is that my expectations have grown a bit lofty. Especially when it comes to burgers, as I really like 'em. Beef, turkey, bison, greasy, fancy, small, large-- I really don't discriminate. My only requirement? They better be good.And when the word 'burger' is part of your very name, your game best be stepped up. Ahhhh DMK... you're good, you're really good.Our server Lauren explained that the meat would be cooked all the way through. I typically order my burgers grilled to either medium rare or medium, so I was concerned that it wouldn't be as juicy as I like. I opted for the turkey burger which was topped with swiss, arugula, and dijonnaise (held the tomato) and a side of the blue cheese slaw. Verdict? Tastiest turkey burger I've ever had. Really. Juicy and tender, well-seasoned... maxed out on flavor! And don't get me started on the delightful bun... too many restaurants ignore the power of a great bun! The serving of coleslaw was huge, and also very tasty. But, if you only go with one side item, order the Parmesan truffle fries. I stole two from my colleague before cutting myself off. Gosh, they're addictive!Our server Lauren was a peach and extremely knowledgeable about their many offerings, which is a must in my book. If I could make one recommendation (okay, three), offer free refills, hot beverages, and get some Splenda for the ice tea. Otherwise, DMK is bliss indeed.

Reviews.Author: Tammy L.
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy my meals at DMK.  I try and go at off times to avoid waiting, because I just don't want to have to wait in line for a burger.  I eat veggie a lot but here I typically get the salmon burger since the veggie options are on the heavy side (fried portobello or fried veggie patty).  I looooove the sweet potato fries, but was a little disappointed to learn that they are not freshly cut--they're frozen.  They put vanilla on them or something, because they taste like dessert with the lemon aioli.  Their regular fries are good too.  Anyhow, I love to eat but I don't eat huge volumes at once, so I personally think their portions are very reasonable.  I have never, ever left hungry, that's for sure!  I really like their house-made sodas--yum.  But I tried their house margarita once and thought it was terrible, so I won't order that again.  I have always wanted to try a shake but have never had enough room after the burger and splitting a small order of fries with my dining companion.  Quality beer selection.  It's a favorite!

Reviews.Author: Andy M.
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor. The next time you hear of a place having a burger as good as Kuma's, just walk away. It's all lies. This was the case with the DMK burger bar.    Our visit came on the Saturday of Cubs-Sox weekend at Wrigley. We had a 45 minute wait to get seated, but it was a beautiful Saturday night, so we stood outside and kibitzed with our good friends. The staff actually did a nice job getting us seated in a timely manner considering how packed they were. DMK offers a nice selection of micro-brews and a wide variety of different burgers and appetizer options. The French Country Ale was a kick ass beer that I really enjoyed.  I decided to stray from their normal menu and try something different.  Being a True, Blue Cubs fan, I had to go with the special burger of the month which was the Ron Santo Burger. It was their standard burger covered with Pastrami and provolone cheese. The price for most of their burgers range from 8-11 dollars. For that price you would expect a nice chunk of meat, but I was I was amazed by how small these burgers were. Not only were these burgers as thin as a anorexic on a hunger strike, they lacked any type of flavor. The Pastrami and the over-sized bun completely overshadowed any flavor the burger had. To be honest, the Parmesan truffle fries, beer and good service were the best things about our visit. The burger was a afterthought. Seriously people, Where's the beef!!! The bottom line on DMK burger bar is a sad one. A good waitstaff, beautifully laid out bar and good selection of beers can't make up for how overpriced and bland the burgers are. I would stop in any time for a couple of brews, but I will pass on the paper thin burger.

Reviews.Author: Melanie S.
Reviews.Content: I have been anxious to try DMK since it first opened but the long waits kept me away.Last Thursday before BAS seemed like a great time to make my first visit here since it would be early enough to avoid the crowd and long wait time. And the fact that it was so close to Sheffield's made it a perfect choice.I got there before my friend who was running late and had my pick of seats. I took a two top and stared longingly at the menu. The sweet waitress, Kiley, came over and greeted me. I ordered their house cherry soda which was deliciously cold and refreshing. I don't drink a lot of soda, and this was a nice change of pace from the canned crap.I waited and Kiley came over and asked me if I wanted to order anything to nibble on before my friend arrived. Ok, twist my arm. I got the parmesan fries with truffle cream that Caroline M raved about. All I can say is that it's a good thing my friend came when she did as I had a really hard time not eating all those fries. Holy crap were they good! They were crispy and had a generous dusting of parmesan on top and the truffle cream was to die for.Since it was my first time there, I opted to just get the standard burger, with no fancy toppings. I figure that if they can get that right, I'd be back and go with a more adventurous burger.My friend must have been thinking the same thing since she ordered the same. We also got an order of sweet potato fries as we are big fans and an order of macaroni and cheese. Yes, we're pigs and we always order too much food.I don't recall being asked what temperature I wanted my burger cooked, but it came to the table medium-rare, which is my preference. The burger was perfectly adequate, but nothing crave-worthy. I think I enjoyed my burger more than friend because she left half of hers.We both agreed that the mac and cheese was a bit oily and bland, and I thought the pasta was dried out, like it had been baked for way too long.The sweet potato fries were heavenly and accompanied by a lemon tabasco dipping sauce which I still can't figure out if I liked or not. To be honest, the fries were so good that they didn't anything but a sprinkling of salt.At $8.00, the burger prices are fair, but they're offset by the prices for the fries and other sides, which I think are a bit high for the portion size.Days later, I am still dreaming and drooling over those fries, so while I may or may not go back for a burger, those fries are calling my name.3.5 stars.

Reviews.Author: Lauren D.
Reviews.Content: OK, it is with great angst that I bestow 2 stars upon DMK burger.  But I had to do it - mostly to save all the rest of y'all from losing your hearing, and maybe so that you can choose to spend 2 hours eating a burger that is at least as good if not better in a... let's just say more desirable atmosphere.I will never understand the restaurants that decide they are going to play music so loudly that you have to yell to the person sitting next to you in order to have a conversation.  The ceilings are high; the acoustics are terrible.  A restaurant-full of people screaming to their neighbors = one giant headache.  It also really prevented me from even enjoying my dinner; I couldn't wait to get out of there so I could ask my dining companion what on EARTH we were trying to talk about, because I'm pretty sure that it would not have mattered if we had both been speaking different languages.Anyway.  The Greek salad is good, as is the caesar.  The sweet potato fries are also good; as are the salt and pepper fries.  The burgers are fine.  Personally, I've tasted juicier, and bigger, and more flavorful - but I guess that's subjective.  Service and host staff = totally fine, no complaints.  For any of you who might go into DMK and ask them to turn the music down, apparently the owner WANTS it to be that loud.  (...?)I am in no rush to come back here.  I'd rather go somewhere I actually want to sit for a couple of hours; or at least Kuma's where there is an option to sit outside and NOT LOSE YOUR HEARING.

Reviews.Author: Andrea R.
Reviews.Content: When a business first opens they usually have some kinks to work out.  While free refills (um, bad economy) and hot beverages (um, it's cold in Chicago) would be some nice improvements, they've got a good thing going on here.There is a long list of burgers to choose from and if beef isn't your thing (me!) you can always substitute a turkey burger. I can't remember the name of my burger (or actually I think they are numbered), but it was topped with marinated portabello, brie cheese (yum), and a dijonaise (passed on this).  It tasted unbelievable - may just be in the top 5 turkey burgers I"ve had in my lifetime. Yeah, that good.Even better than the burger...the sweet potato fries. I ordered the small for myself, but kind of wished I ordered the large. And no, I wasn't going to share them with my fabulous colleagues Jelena Z and Johnny T.The people who work here are as cool as the burgers. Our waitress, Lauren, was a real sweetheart, super helpful and was even apologetic that she couldn't give us free refills. And the GM, Eli, was the host with the most, not to mention easy on the eyes for any of you single ladies out there.I see many turkey burgers and sweet potato fries in my future.

Reviews.Author: Derrick T.
Reviews.Content: Four of us come on a Thursday night to catch the Bears game, and we have a one hour wait.  This place is hoppin' for it's third night that it's been open, and there's no doubt why.  This burger bar is the love child of Michael of MK fame and David of Morton's fame.  No wonder the huge hype!Nice layout, two TV's above the bar, but with this kinda yuppie business crowd, no one was watching the game!  Heck, DMK wasn't even broadcasting the sound from the game, though I can't complain with the nice selection of Sam Cooke and other classic musicians.  Good selection of beers (30+ artisanal).  Nice.Customer service was phenomenal, even if my roommates attributes it to Michael and David both being there (who were playing great hosts btw).  Friendly servers with lots of smiles starting up conversation and making you feel right at home.  I'd venture to say one of the hostesses was being fairly flirty.  Onto the food:Parmesan Truffle Fries - Excellent.  What the heck is in that dipping sauce?  We could drink that stuff straight!Sweet Potato Fries - Also excellent.  Seasoned perfectly.  Another great choice.Mac and Cheese - Pretty good, but not outstanding.  If you're having trouble deciding between this and fries, go with the fries.  Much better choice.#1 Burger (aka, standard BBQ burger), Aged Cheddar, smoked bacon, balsamic red onions, bbq sauce - Good flavors, well crisped bacon, nice balance overall.  An excellent go-to burger that you know will be good. #2 Burger (aka, blue cheese burger), chilli rubbed onion strings, blue cheese, tomatoes, chipotle ketchup - Again, great balance, blue cheese had just enough kick to stand out but not overwhelm, nice.#4 Burger (aka ???), Roasted hatch green chile, fried farm egg, jack cheese, smoked bacon - This was my personal favorite of the night, as the spice was deliciously sweet and spicy at the same time.  What can I say, I'm a sucker for well made chiles.#12 Veggie (Portobello sandwich), Crispy portobello, arugula, tomatos, horseradish(?) - Only had a bite, but not bad... primary eat complained that the portobello really absorbed a lot of the oil from frying and it was a little too greasy for his tastes.And I want to end with my all time favorite part of the meal:Coffee milkshake - Homemade ice cream with chocolate nibs throughout.  I'm a huge sucker for a good milkshake, and I'm pretty ridiculously picky... I have to say I was disappointed that there was no strawberry milkshake option (my personal fave), but this coffee was really a great treat.  I would go back just for this shake alone, even if the rest of the food was that great.Verdict:Service - ExcellentFood quality - Quite goodCost vs. Value - Quite goodI don't know that I'd be willing to wait an hour for this kind of meal again, but I would be wrong in saying that this wasn't a great experience.  The burgers, a mere $8 each, are conceived well and the flavors blend nicely.  Unfortunately, this place was more of a yuppie/business bar for people last night than an actual burger bar feel.  It just seemed people were here more to be seen, than to actually enjoy the meal.Room for improvement?  Ask how customers want their burgers?  With MK and Mortons at helm, I have no doubt a rare burger would have been phenomenal here... but they do they all to a medium or medium rare across the board.4.5 stars (if only I could give it on Yelp) for being a phenomenal burger joint, but the crown of burger places still belongs to another for now.Congrats on the successful opening!  Can't wait to come back for more...

Reviews.Author: Michael G.
Reviews.Content: There are only a few skills that I picked up in student government back in college that I still use on a regular basis.  One is the ability to eat like the wind and still enjoy the taste of food.  Running late for a relaxing facial (how ironic is that?), I got to put this skill of high-stress power eating to good use at DMK.It appeared to me that, ordinarily, DMK would be extremely relaxing.  The dark interior and large tables from which easy banter floated to me at the bar seemed a counterpoint to my one-man burger eating contest.  The beer list said to me, "stop and enjoy our huge selection of American craft beers."  But my watch said, "enjoy your water and like it."  Or maybe that was just my inner voice (hopefully).  Either way, I have to say that DMK was an excellent enabler and my burger was out before I could even check my phone to do my first time check.The veggie burger I got stands on its own as meal - which was good because this place is a-la-carte and I didn't have a lot of extra money (though a Foursquare check-in is good for a free small fry of any sort here).  It was sort of a mixture between a fake meat patty and a loose veggie one.  It crumbles to the point where a fork is necessary, but I was actually able to eat it like a meat burger despite the speed I was engulfing it.  Or maybe it was helped by that fact.  And the flavors were rich.  From the cheese to the chick peas, each ingredient made for excitement in my mouth.  It was one of the best veggie burgers I've had in Chicago.My disappointment actually came with the fries (because who doesn't love a side of disappointment?).  I got the sea salt and pepper variety.  It's not one of their signature specialty fries, per se, but I figured it's the old standby so they would do them right.  They were flavorless.  I tried adding the ketchup that came with them.  Nothing.  I asked for mustard.  Nothing.  They even supplied me with Dijon mustard.  Fancy nothing.  They were free for me as I mentioned, but had they been the normal $2, it would raised my ire to the point where I would have really needed the neck massage I was about to receive up the street.I would definitely come back when I had some time to sample the beers.  But as far as this review (which I think took longer to write than it did to dine there) I'm just giving it an "a-o.k." (and not just because it's the fastest rating to write).

Reviews.Author: Liz W.
Reviews.Content: Burgers, tasty fries and great beers. What more do you people need?Started out here with beer. Yes it was barely noon. And? After talking up my love of wheats that is what we had here. I went with the smooth Allagash. Just awesome. It made me very happy. My sister went with the much zippier Gumballhead, good but I wouldn't have been as happy. The pine is a bit too much for me. My sister adored it though.It was tough picking out a burger. I wanted everything. Finally I settled on #5- bison, goat cheese, pickled onion and blueberry BBQ sauce. My sister went with the #1- beef burger with aged cheddar, smoked bacon, charred balsamic onions and Rufus Teague's BBQ sauce. I loved mine. It was truly a perfect combo of flavors. My sister's was really good but mine was the clear winner. Burgers are perfect bun/meat ratio as is, you can add a patty but I would not.The fries we selected were both awesome. I preferred my pick of sweet potato fries with lemon tobasco aioli, sweet heaven I wanted to bathe in that sauce. Together with the fries it was the ideal sweet/sour/salty/spicy feel. Oh my. The truffle cream fries are so rich with the thready parmesan and decadent sauce. Wow, are they lovely. We got greedy and added on some deviled eggs that remind me of my Gran's. We were ready to bust but man what a way to go! They were only 2 bucks so we figured what the hell.Just when we were all blissed out they threw us a couple of freebie peanut butter malts. My sister called it heaven in a cup and it was her fave part of this meal. Good lord it was deliciously evil.The vibe here is great. The server and hostess were friendly and speedy. Kelly was way on the ball and we loved her. Give this place a whirl, you will not regret it.

Reviews.Author: Carolynne M.
Reviews.Content: Hm. There seems to be a little bit of a disconnect here.  And I am pretty sure it is on DMK's end rather than mine.  If you are going to call yourself a "Burger Bar", well then holy hoppin Jesus you need the burger to be the star of the show.  After last night the burger I had was dead last, behind the fries, behind the beer, even behind a $2 plate of deviled eggs.  Did I order wrong?  I mean I tried to order what I thought would be the most flavourful burger on the menu - the #2 which was topped with Chili-Rubbed Onion Strings, Amish Blue Cheese and Spicy Chipotle Ketchup.  Except the bun was huge and overwhelmed everything. The onion strings were completely flavourless. There was a teaspoon of ketchup which tasted nothing of chipotle or spice, and a rather meager bit of blue cheese.  The meat itself was fine, but the patty was supermodel thin.  Had this been a $4 burger, or an $8 that came with a side and a drink, I would have been a lot more forgiving.  But I cannot justify $8 for that.They redeemed themselves with the fries though - we sampled both the Parmesan truffle and the sweet potato.  Both were cooked perfectly, with excellent ratios of spices and good dipping sauces that accompanied them.  I also sampled the deviled egg, which had a nice creamy filling and a firm egg white shell.  The French Country Ale that I had to drink was a good beer too, not too heavy or hoppy.Maybe DMK should nix the whole burger idea and just stick with being a bar that serves snacks. They seem to do that end really well.  And as for the idea that they are Kuma's competition?  ********Sorry, I just had a laughing fit.  I am better now.

Reviews.Author: A W.
Reviews.Content: Seriously?? Don't believe the hype. DMK = Dinky Meat Krumpets! (yes, I know it's actually 'crumpets') I don't care what kind of grass the cows they cook up eat. They are not eating enough of it or they just are being stingy with how much of that grass-fed cow they are giving me. The burgers are the thickness of what you would get at like Steak and Shake, BUT for $8. Dayuuuuuum. You don't get a side with that either. Just a really thin burger on a chewy dense bun. I got the #6: Marinated Portobello, Blue Brie, Griddled Scallions, Dijonnaise. The scallions were whole and weren't easy to bite into. I took those off. The brie, did not complement the dijionnaise at all. I tasted nothing out of the ordinary with the portobellos for them to have been marinated. And then the burger was so non-existent. What little was there was very good, but I felt like I was just having an appetizer rather than an entree. For serious?My dinner companion got the the #3: NY Pastrami, French Gruyere, Sauerkraut, Leroy's Remoulade. I liked his much better than mine, but still didn't think that much better of it. He got sweet potato fries too, tried one, and it tasted like a slightly sweet white potato fry. No, really. For serious?Oh, and drinks-wise? I saw housemade pop for $3 and the rest beer. $3 pop? You might as well just get a beer. Now, the service was great and friendly.  Our food came out in a timely manner, and was hot.  We were well attended to and our waitress had a very nice demeanor. I will say it is loud in there and not a good place to try to hold a real conversation. Often I could barely hear him, or the nice waitress, over the loud volume of the music and the other patrons trying to talk over it as well. It was like a shouting match with no prizes. Overall, meh. Cute concept, but for me it doesn't deliver much.

Reviews.Author: John B.
Reviews.Content: So I'm on the way to my dentist this morning, and the Brown Line isn't stopping at Wellington or Diversey, which means I walk down Sheffield from Belmont, which is only three blocks so I should be walking anyway. But the result of said walk is that I pass right by DMK Burger Bar. DMK's been at the back of my mind for some time, but it hasn't been in the front of my mind enough to make a special trip. But here I am with a 12:15 appointment, which means I'm out by 1, which means lunch is served.I walk in, and I like DMK. It's a little dark, and it's a little loud, but it's pretty laid back and welcoming, which is what you want a burger bar to be. First, for the bar: terrific. Nice selection of beers, a couple of big TVs, but since it's not a game day, they're playing "A Bug's Life." Interesting. It's a seat yourself place, but it doesn't seem like a seat yourself place, but the bartender catches my eye and gives me the drill, so we're all good.The tables are set with menus, and drink menus, knife and fork setups. The flatware is wrapped in what appear to be bar towels, which sets you up for a messy experience. The menus are angled, which sets up a nice tension. I like the attention to detail.I end up going with the bison burger, because it's highlighted on the menu and it sounds interesting. I'm torn between fries and the fried okra and pickles, but the server tells me she's a fan of the fried vegs, so I get them. When the food comes out, I get both the pickles and the fries -- parm fries with truffle cream. The server tells me she wanted me to try the fries, and they're on the house, so that's a bonus.So the food, which is what you came here for. The fried pickles and okra are excellent. Light crispy batter that doesn't overwhelm. Side of ranch, which works well. The fries are good, but the parm doesn't really work. It's shredded parm and not really integrated with the fries, so it's like a plate of fries wearing a cheese wig. The size of the order is perfect, though. An order for one is 2 or 3 bucks, so it's easy to get a bunch of these and share. Smart.The burger is good ... but. It's a bison burger, with blue cheese, pickled red onions, and blueberry bbq sauce. The cheese is virtually nonexistent. The sauce is a schmear. Not even a schmear. Now I don't need my burger drippings with goo, but the toppings are there to set off the burger, and my toppings set off for another burger bar.I'm gonna use the K word here. A lot of people are comparing DMK to Kuma's. I don't know if this is a rivalry DMK instigated or if it's just in the minds of the reviewers or what. But there's no point in comparing DMK to Kuma's. Not because Kuma's is so much better -- I'm not a fan of Kuma's, whose burgers *are* drippings with goo. But because they're not even trying to do the same thing. Yes, they both serve beer and specialty burgers. End of comparison.The lowdown? Three stars because I'll probably be back. There's a lot that's good about this place, but they're in their third year and I feel like they're slacking off a bit. Which would be too bad.

Reviews.Author: Richie D.
Reviews.Content: An over all "Good" for DMK.The prices: good, food: good, ambiance: good...I was happy to see some unique DMK trademarks.  Housemade sodas (blood orange, cherry and lime), lamb/turkey burgers, homemade sauces (smokey ketchup, lemon tabasco alioli and dijonnaise), the "soft porn" story on the wall of the men's washroom [HA! I bet I got all the straight guys attention]...Cool.What made my experience worthwhile were: a free ale taster in a shot glass, sweet potato fries (duh!), option of turkey/veggie/lamb burger, and our waitress.  I loved our waitress Lauren for all the attention she paid to our table, her lovely smile, outgoing personality and willingness to alter pre-made burgers.  They allow you to exchange a turkey burger for a beef burger, but not when it comes to lamb.  Thankfully they gave me permission to swap out a pre-created burger with a lamb burger.  Gyro in a patty goodness!As for any newish restaurant, a few recommendations to keep in mind: Add a few more game burgers to the menu like bison (my personal favorite) , venison, kangaroo perhaps.  Learn from The Shanty up in Wadsworth, IL.  Put on the menu the option to switch in a lamb burger and veggie burger with the pre-created creations.  The cupcakes are fairly small in size for $2.50 (but not over-priced, I guess) and the ice cream sandwiches were average.  I'm sad I didn't get a malt instead because I wasn't impressed.  I still left here with a bit of hungies, even after putting $20 down.  Arg.

Reviews.Author: Sarah B.
Reviews.Content: When I am looking for somewhere to eat out burgers are usually not my draw.  I am not a big meat eater.  But, a date suggested DMK and I had heard good things so off we went.Holy cow (or lamb, in my case), my burger was tasty.  I had the lamb burger with feta, cucumbers, tomatoes, and red onion.  I have never had a tastier burger, no joke.  So juicy, flavorful and filling.  So. Good.DMK was a bit loud for my taste and the communal tables never make me too happy but I can't stop thinking about that lamb burger so I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Melissa R.
Reviews.Content: Here it is in a nutshell: fresh and delicious burgers and fries, good and friendly service, weekend nights are very busy, reasonable prices, extremely loud. DMK is a much needed addition to this area. Surprisingly, there aren't all that many restaurants within a 1/2 mile radius but there is a brown line stop and lots of residents. I wasn't sure what to expect of this place, but it was better that what I anticipated...and now I come here fairly often. Another great thing? All ages enjoy this place. Last time I ate here there were teenagers, families, babies, senior citizens, and your typical 20-30's who live in Lakeview. The ingredients are fresh and tasty. You can tell when you dive into your meal that each burger is made to order. I always go with #8 (if it ain't broke, don't fix it) and it never disappoints. Besides tasting great, they are also pretty normal serving sizes (i.e. not the size of your head) so you can leave feeling full but not uncomfortable. The fries are fantastic with the skin on and salty, a small order can easily be split between two people. Watch out for the ketchup they serve with them...it has a little kick to it and I always end up asking for a side of regular ketchup to go with them. Here are a few reasons I know I am getting old: all of the employees look like they are in college (perhaps they are) and the volume of the music is horribly loud. I mean, I just want to eat a burger...not have a dance party. It is so loud that you have to yell to hear the person next to you, and I really hate that. Overall, I am a fan of this place. With minor improvements I would easily upgrade them to five stars.

Reviews.Author: Ryan Y.
Reviews.Content: I wanted to love this place.  When my wife and I went here last night, I foresaw visions of bragging to my friends and bringing them back to this place I hoped could compete with the burger-heavyweights of Chicago.  After all, everyone and their cousin has been raving about it.Disappointed does not begin to sum it up.  Started off fine, I thought, as we were offered a variety of seating options by the hostess and opted for the bar.  Nice beer list (though, being a frequent purchaser of such beers, many were overpriced), North Shore Distillery prominently placed on shelving.  The menu was pretty good and my wife and I made our selections (#1 and #3, Salt 'n Pepper Fries and Friend Okra and Pickles) and waited.  And waited. During this waiting, I was not offered one refill on my empty beverage (a real pet-peeve of mine).  I started off with the Blood Orange homemade, usually a favorite, but theirs was a bit lacking.  Wife had Diet Coke that was poured from a 2-Liter bottle.  I was finally able to snatch a refill (Diet Coke this time) and was told there are no free refills.  So what that translates to is $2.50 per soda being poured out of a 2-Liter bottle from Jewel that cost about $1.00 and will serve about 8 people an 8oz glass of soda.  You can finish the math and realize how ridiculous this is.Next I received my burger, or should I say their burger since you are allowed no say in the cooking of said burger.  It was good, again, even after the crap service I really wanted to like it, but it was just good.  The fries and fried okra and pickles were good too, but it was just standard.The guy behind the bar playing the part of our lackluster server clearly noticed how unhappy I was with the experience and rather than try and improve service and my experience, ignored us even more.  Thusly losing a customer and gaining a crappy Yelp review.  Even after he took our plates and brought a box for the 2nd half of my wife's burger, he didn't bring our bill.  NOTE TO ALL SERVERS: Typically, when someone is packing up  their food, they are ready to leave.  We honestly waited another 5 minutes or so hoping to catch his eye so we could get our check and leave.  I paid ($10 for 2 sodas each refilled once) an otherwise reasonable fare for what should have been better food and the worst service I've experienced in an overhyped restaurant.So long, DMK, I really really REALLY wanted to dine with you more often, but alas, your bartender/server has ensured that shall never happen.

Reviews.Author: Leanne A.
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant experience. All the employees were incredibly sweet and helpful. The room is crowded but warm and  cozy. The food was incredible. I got the turkey burger with swiss, arugula and dijon. I bit in to that thing, and I literally paused for a moment to communicate with the Gods. I even liked the sweet potato fries and rarely do. My mouth is watering thinking of the little leftovers waiting in the fridge. I can't help but compare to the Counter. Overall, the burger was better at DMK, and the place is way better. However, I like that I can get extra things like tomato and avocado at the counter. Because who can deny that avocado makes everything better? No one!I will be back. Probably soon, before the lines start forming around the block.

Reviews.Author: Beth R.
Reviews.Content: Note: this review requires a sophisticated understanding of elementary school math (specifically, averages).  This is a 4-star review, but that's because there were 5-star elements and 3-star elements to my experience.  Those numbers added together and divided result in the number 4.  If you are not too intimidated by this level of complexity, I invite you to read on.  5-star elements:The veggie burger was great - full of veggies, crumbly but crusty around the perimeter. It comes with a pesto mayo, and just enough of it.  I like pesto so so so much, but only like mayo a little.  The amount spread on the bun was perfecto.  There's a bonus veg: eggplant!  This burger rocks.  In addition to the veggie burger, there's another vegetarian option in the portabella mushroom sandwich.  I do like me some portabella on a sandwich, but at DMK, my heart belongs to the veggie burger.  Still, props.3-star elements:The fries were pretty standard.  I'm currently on a sea salt and cracked black pepper kick (thanks, Kettle Chips) so I was psyched for their fries but I couldn't get much pepper essence.  The service was a little meh.  The drinks my dining companion and I had were both mediocre: the Diet Coke is literally a can, and costs $1.75 ($.75 more than the vending machine at work).  The iced tea was a little watery, which was okay on the day in question since I was hot and schvitzy and needed to rehydrate.  Plus it was refillable, unlike the can of pop.So, all told, I'd make this a destination for the veggie burger but that's about it.

Reviews.Author: Misty S.
Reviews.Content: 2 words - TRUFFLE FRIES!!  Wow, were these amazing and why hadn't anyone told me about them??  These perfectly cooked fries were covered in parmesan and accompanied by an amazing truffle creme sauce.  My taste buds didn't know what hit them and were dizzy from rapture.  Mmmm...Even though they have an extensive beer selection, I was not in the mood for the usual libation.  Instead, I opt for a delicious blood mary which came with an okra of all things.  OKRA!  The drink was nicely spiced and was just really good.  The service was great.  There were about 10 of us and we were able to push a few tables together to accommodate the entire group.

Reviews.Author: An P.
Reviews.Content: Walking in from Sheffield's me and a buddy stopped into DMK Burger Bar to try out one of Chicago's newest and trendiest spots. I was first surprised by the large DMK sign out front and noticed the big window as I stepped in. It was around 7:30pm or so and DMK was jam packed to the brim. There was nowhere to sit and I wasn't sure if there was a line or not, but it was filled with the denizens of Wrigleyville and beyond.Fortunately for us, we landed a seat right in the back of the restaurant in the corner. It was loud enough that we didn't have to listen to the conversations of the other table although talking took a bit more volume due to the loudness of the whole place. DMK's ceiling renders the place part-dive while the new interior kind of reminded me of Simone's in Pilsen. The server came and took drink orders and came back in time for us to order. We split an order of fried okra while I went with the #1 and my buddy took a #6. The okra came out quickly but I was disappointed by the bite-sized portions. Seriously, it had the resemblance of 10-15 small pieces of the length of a toothpick with the width of a pencil. For $5, we housed through it very quickly and probably would have been better off with a $4 basket of fries seasoned with vinegar and salt.The burgers eventually came and I had a tall grass fed burger with bacon and fried egg. Like most tall grass fed burgers, the meat was tender but I was surprised that there was no trace of the flame broiled or charcoal on the burger. It really did taste like a regular bar burger and didn't impress my palette even though the bacon was very good. The meat just didn't do it for me and it lacked the smokiness or true flavor.To recap, for $32 + $6 tip we got:2 burgers1 undersized portion of fried okra1 Diet Coke1 beerThe value proposition is just not there, this is probably why I avoid trendy spots.

Reviews.Author: Ariel L.
Reviews.Content: Whoah Nelly!!!  What's with all the hype on this place?  I keep reading about it in every paper and magazine i pick up.  Find something else to write about people.  On to the goods....This place is "Average" at best.  The burger was on the normal sized size, had an average tasting bun, and was cooked to a leathery consistency.  That is not how i like my burgers.  Yes they had an excellent selection of french fry choices and and beers on tap, but if you want to call yourself a burger joint, you better make a good burger.  FAIL!  I would go to Five Guys in a heart beat over this place.  At least there you get free refills on your soda.  And whats with the mention of burgers to come on the menu???  You are advertising burgers that may or may not make the menu eventually?  I don't get it.  Save your money and go elsewhere.  I'd rather wait in line for an hour at Kuma's then eat here again.  There are just too many good burgers in the city to waste your time on a place like this.

Reviews.Author: Kathryn M.
Reviews.Content: I've been twice now, and here's what I've gathered:The Good:1) Price of burger compared to quality of ingredients.  Mmm blue brie.2) Beer list selection3) Chipotle Ketchup (5 stars just for this)4) Fried pickle/okra appetizer5) I actually liked that the burgers weren't enormous.  I only ate half my burger on both occasions (plus the fries and fried goods) and I was stuffed.For the neighborhood, I much prefer a place like this over something like the Counter.  DMK just felt warmer and cozier.The Not so Good:1) Really, you're gonna be a burger joint where everything comes cooked "Medium Plus?" (What the heck is Medium Plus anyway??  Both of my dining companions were looking for a nice medium rare, so this was a disappointment).  2 and 3) Service was extremely friendly, but we sat with empty drinks for quite awhile, and we never got that extra ketchup we requested.   Seriously, empty beverages can ruin a meal.  But I'll let it go . . . this time.

Reviews.Author: Jess P.
Reviews.Content: 0 stars...for a HORRIBLE RESTAURANT!!1.) TERRIBLE SEATING...they sit you across from you party at a crowded table where you can't even hear the person across from you and are actually closer to the stranger next to you..FUN2.) my friend ordered the milkshake...i tasted it....mcdonalds mcflurry would taste better...and FIVE dollars for that?3.) After looking at the menu and realizing that the two things that appealed to me were "coming soon" and unavailable...wth why were they even on the menu?? not good...so I had to choose from the ONLY SIX burgers that were on the menu and some fries.4.) Waited an HOUR for 2 burgers and some french fries?? It was a Sunday night....not super packed. how the hell could it take that long5.) Everyone seemed to be complaining about the horrible service (both people on each side of us--I know this since I was forced to hear their conversations bc we were seated ridiculously close)6.) FINALLY get our food---SUB-PAR...my burger was DRENCHED in bbq sauce and was served on a 4" plate? really??? Give me a plate to eat on !! 7.) French fries were gross...soggy and drenched in feta cheese.....tooooo much!8.) Don't try to serve unique contemporary dishes until you can make a simple one correct? or at least get your customer service under control??9.) VERY disappointed....we were not the only patrons that left angry...I would suggest going anywhere but here....10.) Perhaps it is the kind of place where you need to be wasted to enjoy it...well....you can enjoy a burger (that is probably better anyway) from somewhere less that EIGHT DOLLARS for a crappy burger that doesn't even include fries!!! (I believe fries were an extra 4 or 5 something).....after a milkshake, 2 burgers and an order or fries that we split our bill was 33$......GIANT WASTE OF MONEY!!

Reviews.Author: Diana R.
Reviews.Content: Never argue with the chef.  Sometimes you want a burger your way and not the way the chef has it laid out on the menu. dijonmayonnaise? I'm really not a fan of dijon so I asked for it on the side but my lovely waitress informed me that its really good on the burger and that she too, hates dijon. I decided to try it as the chef intended and I am so glad I did. It was delicious!  Turkey burger heaven! and the truffle fries were good too.So why only 4 stars? I like to have my own table, not share with two other parties... but that's just me.

Reviews.Author: Mike K.
Reviews.Content: The third time was a charm.  After finding a line and a wait on the first two attempts to dine at DMK, we have finally hit paydirt and dined at DMK.  I'll try to keep it simple since there are already 700 reviews.The burgers.  Like The Counter, they're all about the toppings, which are good, but I think the burger should be the main focus, with the accoutrements only adding to the taste.  The burger itself honestly didn't have a whole lot of taste.  I'd rate the burger about equal with Five Guys but not as good as Portillo's.  There are better sit-down burgers out there.The fries.  They have five or six varieties and two sizes.  If you're a party of two, opt for the small ($2) version.  We had the salt and pepper fries.  The fries were good, but the topping was overkill.  And I like salt and pepper flavoring on chips.  I wouldn't order this flavor again if I were to return.The drinks.  I had a blood orange pop.  Three bucks.  The flavor was extremely strong, verging on the same overkill as the salt and pepper fries.  It was served in a pint glass loaded with ice.  I was lucky if I got 12 ounces out of it.  The atmosphere.  It's loud.  The place was half full, and I still had to lean over to hear the little lovely sitting two feet away from me.  I would imagine if the place were full that everyone would practically have to scream to be heard and that the music would also be cranked.  The value.  The eight dollar burger is deceptive.  Where DMK dings you is on the fries (not included with the burgers) and drinks.  In the end, you're paying $10 for a burger and fries anyway.  I'd return if there were no wait and if the place were not packed.  It's 3-1/2 stars.

Reviews.Author: Jerry C.
Reviews.Content: So I had gravy fries, the salad with tuna, and also the bison burger.The gravy fries were awesome, and the salad with tuna was not bad, but it was more of an experimentation for me (i hadn't had tuna in awhile, and realized i still don't really like it).  The bison burger was nice, I believe mine was medium rare, though they never asked, and it tasted pretty good.I enjoy the atmosphere, and the music was excellent.My only concern was the bill.  See, the burger was about $10, and the rest of the extras were probably another $10.But my bill came out to be over $100, due to hidden charges.Hidden charges you say?  What kind of hidden charges?  Well the medical bill that came along with the meal due to food poisoning that incapacitated me for the next 4 days (and actually still counting!).  Along with only being able to eat/drink gruel, chicken broth, tea, and water for that duration.I mean if it weren't for the bill, the pain, the sacrifice of good food for several days after my DMK experience, and other unspoken additions (diarrhea!).  I might go back and I would recommend it to everyone else.To be fair, I would give it a much better review and recommend it to other people if it weren't for it promptly destroying me for several days.Though I might be the less than 1% who got it, but would you like to play food russian roullette and possibly win?

Reviews.Author: Brian M.
Reviews.Content: I have a feeling I'm going to struggle with DMK. A highly anticipated place from a respected chef that's right down the street from me AND serves classic cocktails and craft beers? I was in love with the idea of the place. The menu is superb, and the a-la-carte style allows you to easily sample a lot of their offerings in a few visits. I've been in here a few times, the first of which was for lunch on their second day open, a couple of early weekday evenings, and the most recent of which was this past Friday night, so I've seen them operate when it's slow and when it's slammed. Afternoon it clocks in at a solid 4-star spot. Busy...2. Like many restaurants opting for larger communal tables instead of the whole hostess-stand-and-small-table thing, it's often a bit confusing upon entering. On a busy Friday, I saw quite a few different parties walk in and stand confused and ungreeted because the hostess was off looking for a party whose table was ready. Our supposed hour wait turned into an hour and 45 minutes as we watched large groups seated quicker than our table for two. Afternoons though, I've always been warmly greeted upon entering. There need to be adjustments made to accommodate the busy times.  At the bar, like most of Chicago, these folks know their bourbon and classic cocktails. The bartenders are quick and attentive, know their stuff and make solid recommendations. Why do I know about recommendations? Because the last time I was there, they were out of two different kinds of bourbon, yet they were still on the menu board. You know, the menu board made of movable plastic letters that is easily changed to reflect current offerings. They try hard with the beer, but there were a few things that irked this beer nerd. First of all, a farmhouse ale poured in an oversized wine glass/globe shouldn't have a 3-finger head. 2 at most, preferably less. Secondly, if I order a bottled beer (this was at my table on a non-busy day), you should bring the bottle out to the table and pour it there. Don't just bring a glass of beer. That's a no-no in the beer world. As for the food, I can only personally comment on the vegetarian options and sides. Their homemade veggie patty has gotten better since the first time I had it, and for that I commend DMK. Spicy, thick, and (now) correctly sized for the bun, I'm a fan. The stuffed portobello is pretty much just a fried shroom. The breading is a bit thick - the outer edges are just fried breading that's a bit bland. The middle of the burger was much better just because the mushroom made up for the over-breading. Otherwise, the portobello was perfectly cooked, juicy and tender, and well enhanced by the tomato and arugula. Now, when things got busy, I don't know what happened back there. The roommate ordered the burger with bacon and an egg on it. It came out with a single strip of bacon. Huh? The fries here are solid, especially at $2 for a small plate. I've had the sweet potato fries, truffle fries, and classic salt and pepper, all of which were fresh and crisp. When it was slower, the lemon tobasco aioli that comes with the sweet potato fries was pretty good. I thought it was a bit light on the lemon, but my lovely dining partner thought it was a bit heavy. Either way, decent. But during a busy dinner hour with my buddy (who was there for the first time) it amounted to nothing more than mayonnaise. Seriously. Thinking it was a bad cup, the server brought another one. Same stuff...no bueno. Perhaps I'm being a bit picky, but Michael Kornick and David Morton are respected professionals and the bar gets set a bit higher. After my sub-par experience, DMK actually responded to my Twitter post. I'm glad they're paying attention, and I'm confident they will not be content with average reviews, even if the restaurant remains full. I know they're capable of delivering near-perfection, but I haven't seen it...yet.

Reviews.Author: Anne C.
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere is great for watching a game, or just for socializing with some friends. The menu is very limited and small. They don't have a lot of familiar burger choices, but more "interesting" combination of ingredients. I chose the #5 which was the bison burger with goat cheese, onions and blueberry BBQ sauce. The BBQ sauce tasted just like blueberries which sounds weird on a burger, but it was pretty good ( I got it on the side). I also like how the meat is grass fed and the bread is artesian (very yummy). The prices are pretty high considering it's $9 for one burger (bison was $11) and you don't get any sides with it.. The sides are all alacart. Thus, your meal can get pricey fast. The servers were down to earth and chill, and our waters were refilled right away. One downfall, is our server never asked how I wanted my meat cooked (and I, too forgot about it), so it came out medium, and I prefer well done... Also, the place had an odor of cat piss (maybe the mix from cleaning solution and vomit from the night before?) Who knows, but I did not enjoy the scent. Our server gave us the bill too early, making us feel a bit rushed... but I guess as a server you never really know when the right time is... perhaps we could have been rushing. All in all, I'd come back here again for a drink and a burger!

Reviews.Author: David R.
Reviews.Content: Back again so soon?  Sure, why not.  Just like last time, it was all about the location and circumstance.  Monday mid-afternoon on a holiday weekend?  Thank you for being open.Some of the details rubbed me the wrong way though.  Did I mention that it was a weekday mid-afternoon?  You would never know by how LOUD and dark it was in the back of the place.  Geez.  And they didn't even have any cool movies on this time.  It also annoyed me that the $1.75 soda is a 12-ounce can.  It was a hot day and I wanted to guzzle diet cola until I floated away.  Also, after being practically smothered on my first visit, this time our waitress was an absentee.  And most irksome of all:  the dish-towel napkins left little white fuzzies on my clothes (again--I just didn't mention it before).  Argh.But anyway, I enjoyed my meal more than last time.  The #6 burger was nearly perfect--marinated portobello, blue brie, griddled scallions, dijonnaise.  I ordered the macaroni and cheese #2 without the bacon (I just wanted the gruyere and balsamic onions); I'd have to give the dish a B.  But somehow, I loved the salt and pepper fries even more than last time.  I could eat those crispy little bastards until I keeled over.I am kicking myself for neglecting to order a deviled egg.  That would have been so perfectly decadent.  Next time!

Reviews.Author: Andie S.
Reviews.Content: YUM. I got the #4, which had a fried egg, bacon, and something spicy (pepper? jalapenos?) and it was AWESOME. I mean, so awesome I didn't even want to tell anyone how awesome it was so they wouldn't take bites of my awesome burger away from me. The sweet potato fries and the truffle parmesan fries were both pretty averagely good, but extra good with their sauces. But that burger...that was awesome.Take your food to go though! It's busy.

Reviews.Author: Kathleen M.
Reviews.Content: Lamb burger?  Baaaa, DMK I am so yours!This was today's destination in our Adventure Fridays quest.  We arrived about 11:45 on a Friday and snagged one of the last open tables.  We got waited on right away and amused ourselves by trying to figure out the school group that was eating there.  Field trip?  Reward?  New CPS lunch program? In moments,  our drinks arrived - Blood Orange soda was bloody brilliant.  I had the lamb burger with the olive tapenade on the side which I loved.  My sister had the veggie burger with the mayo on the side and my daughter had the cheese burger plus fried egg.  We devoured every delicious morsel and made a good dent in a plate of sweet potato fries and a cheddar cheese and scallions fries.  What a delicious meal.My only issue was that the music was VERY VERY LOUD. WHAT DID YOU SAY?  THE MUSIC WAS VERY VERY LOUD.   HUH?  DR. SEUSS WAS PLOWED?  SICK OF THE CLOUDS?Exactly.

Reviews.Author: MELEK L.
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed lunch on a weekday at DMK and it was just perfect. You'll find all kinds of folks munching on juicy burgers in this slick bar/restaurant. Mine came with cheddar and bacon! I was surprised by how much I appreciated the bun and by how I ATE THE WHOLE THING! Besides devouring the entire burger, I scarfed the Sea Salt & Pepper fries. I'm not even a fry fan usually, but these rocked my world. I also managed to find one of my favorite Stout beers available here and for a great price nonetheless.With a friendly staff and fast service (on a weekday for lunch) I will definitely be back and will continue suggesting DMK for others.

Reviews.Author: Melissa R.
Reviews.Content: DMK = Overrated. My first time here it was just eh, ok. The bf liked it. Me, not so much.First off, the servers congregated to the end of the bar and had mouths like truckers. No bueno in my book. Complaining about customers in front of other customers is not cool.The burger was ok. I mean, I wanted to add certain ingredients, but there are no substitutions. Who does that? and I wanted it medium rare. That means with a little pink in the middle. Mine was well done. Boo.One star for the sweet potato fries though. Nicely done.The next time I came in with my friend on a Thursday night. Place is packed. The waiting time for a table was quoted 30 minutes for 2 people, however we seen atleast 6 empty tables. The bar was packed with people. The bartender was not nice. She acted like we were bothering her for our order. Ewwww. So we order our drinks. A can of Brooklyn Lager and one of their specialty drinks. The bartender says to the other bartender, "like i have f*&^%*ng time for this."  Really? You are a bartender. You make drinks. I liked the beer though. And 12 dollars for a martini? really?Not a fan. Go somewhere else in the neighborhood for a burger and friendlier service.

Reviews.Author: Tina W.
Reviews.Content: Yum! This is probably the tastiest burger I have had in Chicago. Unlike Counter and Kuma's, DMK burgers did not fall apart upon connecting to my mouth. They also didn't make my stomach feel like shit afterwards. In fact I took a 12h plane ride immediately afterwards and had no adverse side effects. The personnel consisted entirely of lovely young blonds which may whet some appetites. They were very attentive, conscientious, and friendly. The music was too loud for my liking (seems to be a common complaint for me), especially at noon when I went to eat there.  I had the cheddar, bacon and onion burger and it was delicious. It didn't have too many flavors going on and the BBQ sauce was mouthwatering. My boyfriend had a spicy burger with and egg in it that he liked, but I thought was so so. They have five (!) types of fries including sweet potato fries with a lovely lemon Tabasco aioli sauce that made me swoon. The homemade sodas (cherry and blood orange) left something to be desired.

Reviews.Author: Jeff K.
Reviews.Content: This place gets lots of hype and is good, but not worth a wait though. This burger joint is solid all around from beer menu to sides and different choices.The negatives are its ALWAYS too loud to talk to one another and the beef just isn't there, and the buns are too flimsy.  Also they are touchy on their 'homemade' ketchup. Overall it's just a place to be seen, not get a top 5 burger in the city.

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: I don't know what all the hype is about this place.  The burgers reminded me of those at Steak-n-Shake--thinner and kind of "loose" for a lack of a better word.  The toppings were interesting---I got the #4 with fried egg, green chiles, and bacon and my wife got the #2 with bleu cheese and onion strips.  We had to scrape the green chiles off of my burger because the taste was so overwhelming--it tasted much better without them but was still nothing special.  My wife's burger was pretty good.  It had a nice spice to it.  We also ordered the Wisconsin cheddar fries with green onions.  They were good, but there was too much cheese on them.  By the time we neared the bottom the fries were covered in the cheddar which had thickened as it cooled.  We couldn't even eat the bottom portion of our fries there was so much cheese.  For dessert we ordered the chocolate chip ice cream sandwich and the server was kind enough to have it cut in half for us without us even asking to have that done.  The ice cream sandwich was yummy, but kind of hard to eat since the ice cream was a bit on the soft side and kept squishing out the edges.  But it had a nice "freshly made" look and taste to it which we found enjoyable.  (We actually went to DMK specifically for this dessert, which was listed in TimeOut Chicago's "Dish Wish List" of 100 best foods).We definitely won't be coming back to DMK.  We tried it because we had heard a lot of talk about it, but we've had better burgers, fries and ice cream sandwiches elsewhere.

Reviews.Author: Milly P.
Reviews.Content: (Note, this review is also a response to all the crying by other reviewers.)PEOPLE, YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR.  If you want hormone and pus infested genetically modified cheap-*ss burgers, go to McDonald's, Wendy's, or even Five Guys.  High-quality, grass-fed beef is NOT CHEAP.  DMK is my favorite burger place in Chicago.  They use high quality ingredients, and cook the burger to perfection.  I absolutely eat my steaks medium or medium-rare, my hamburger on the other hand, needs to be practically well done.  Who wants to eat bloody ground beef?!  I always get the #8, the classic burger with iceberg, tomato, and american cheese.  The bread they use is so soft but dense enough to keep all the burger juices in.  I personally enjoy the truffle Parmesan fries over the sweet potato fries. This place has some downfalls, like the overly loud music, unnecessarily dark decor, and the one time I got a margarita, it was pretty mediocre.  However, the burgers more than make up for any downfalls.

Reviews.Author: Sarah A.
Reviews.Content: Their burgers are awesome - I especially like the Bison burger with blueberry bbq sauce - a unique, but great combo. I can't seem to get enough of their parmesan truffle fries as well. I love the concept and how the menu is both simple and has a good selection. They don't take reservations, which can be both good and bad, it's not as much fun to wait for 45 minutes on a Friday night. They have a great staff though, their beer selections are limited, but I think that's partially because they are wanting to be eco-friendly. Overall: You can't beat their burgers for only $8..try it!

Reviews.Author: Heidi H.
Reviews.Content: Last Friday, after a busy day at school, the lovely Erin B. IMd me and asked if I was up for meeting her for deep-fried pickles! I mean, c'mon, Erin B, pickles, AND a burger?  Hell yeah!  So, after getting my hair did I drove right over to DMK to meet Erin for dinner.  She had been waiting for awhile at the bar seeing they wouldn't seat her without me being there, but as soon as I told the hostess that  the entire party was here we were seated right away.  We sat down and immediately went to the appetizer list to find our deep fried pickles.. but wait... okra too?  blegh.  A plate full of deep-fried pickle spears without the okra sounded so much better and our friendly waitress obliged us.  I have only had deep-fried pickle chips at the Minnesota State Fair and, albeit quite tasty, do not compare to the pickle spears at DMK.  I remember deep fried pickles as being awesome, because let's face at, anything deep fried is pretty much awesome, but most of the time they are a bit mushy and the batter comes right off.  Not the case here!  Crispy, tasty, sour, yummy, mmmmm... I want some now!Anyway, after the tasty pickles,  our burgers and fries were next.  I ordered the burger with onion strings, blue cheese, and chipotle ketchup with sweet potato fries.  Now, sweet potato fries have to be my favorite thing ever and these were great.   A lot of restaurants will make them thin and crispy but I prefer mine to be a little on the thick side, so I was happy to see that DMKs fries were cut a bit thicker.  The dipping sauce on the side had a bit of spice that totally complemented the sweet potatoes and honestly, I would go back to DMK for the pickles and sweet potato fries alone.  The burger was good and washing it all down with a Crispin cider made for a really fun night with a great friend!

Reviews.Author: Van L.
Reviews.Content: FAVORITE SPOT.i try and bring everyone here. i try to go once a month, and i could probably recite the menu.no reservations - so just wait and deal with it. grab a beer and wipe your saliva as you watch other burgers pass you by. i've had almost everything on the menu and all is great, but this is why i love DMK:their buns! toasted so amazingly.their beef! grassfed and perfect.their drinks! beer list is great and i am in love with the whirling tiger cocktail.their fries! sweet potato and parmesan truffle are my faves.their burgers! i'm a fan of #4 (green chile & egg) and holy guac-aoili (guac + chorizo, i die.)their non-beef! turkey & lamb are my faves on this part of the menu.sigh, i can't wait to go back when i'm hankering a burger next...this is hands down the best burger in chicago.the best part: you don't feel 'too full' after DMK...it's just. right.

Reviews.Author: Whitney L.
Reviews.Content: The boy and I were biking home the other night when we passed DMK, which I had heard quite a bit of buzz about. So, the following Friday afternoon I was looking for a big meal before I had to work a long night shift, so we headed into DMK after browsing their menu briefly online.Before I go much further, I'll just say this: VEGETARIANS, BEWARE.If you're going to open a burger business that you KNOW is going to compete with Kuma's...you need to be able to COMPETE WITH KUMAS.My boyfriend and I are both vegetarians...and our options were frighteningly sparse. Out of the FOURTEEN burgers they offer, only one...ONE can be enjoyed as a veggie burger. The rest are straight up beef or portabello. I really do not understand the principle of not being able to sub out any other burger for a veggie patty. Kumas: 1, DMK: 0.So, okay, whatever. If the veggie burger rules, then 1 is enough, right? Well, the burgers seem cheap enough ($8) but don't include anything. As we were drooling over french fry options our waitress informed us that those...as well...were not vegetarian. They were fried in some sort of meat by product and thus, our only option was onion straws. Alright. So, I have one burger choice and one side choice? Kumas: 2, DMK: 0.The food came out MEGA fast. Way faster than Kumas and we didn't have a wait, either. Kumas: 2, DMK: 1. The onion straws were just fine. I piled some on top of my burger. The rest were a big greasy plate of them that I'm not that stoked about as a side dish, but ate them anyway. The burger itself was decent. Very very chocked full of veggies. My boyfriend enjoyed his more than I did.Atmosphere was nice, I liked all of the exposed brick. I was a bit weirded out (after working in the service industry for the past 3 years) at the roll ups being basically sani-towels used to mop up messes around the restaurant by staff. Of course they were clean, but when I get an attachment to a restaurant item as one thing then it is used as another...strange.Overall, I was terribly underwhelmed, especially after spending $40 for lunch. I won't be planning on going back anytime soon...unless they shape up and give the vegetarians a bit of a chance.

Reviews.Author: David G.
Reviews.Content: Yes 2 stars! I am fucking asshole and terrible person, how can I say that about this awesome Place..blah blah blah... Yes I am giving this 2 stars. So shut the fuck up and read why...I am not sure if it's one of those things where it got hyped up so much that when I went there it was ruined but here is how I rate a burger...First things, first... Portillo's makes the best burger in the world according to me.
