I don't eat red meat very often so when I do it better be fucking good.Its my opinion and I could give a fuck what you think.                                                       Sidebar:(Seriously, let me know if you want a fuck...I have many fucks to give...)                                           Now back to the action:Well we have already established that in my mind Portillo's is what a burger should taste and act like when I order one. I am flexible on this to a point but it better be in that fucking league. So I finally went to DMK Burger Bar after hearing all this great stuff about the place and I was seriously underwhelmed. It gave me Burger Blue Balls and I had to eat at Portillo's the next day just to get my mind right.....So when I went here I was already biased but willing to take the chance and see what everyone was talking about.                                                 THOUGHTS:1. $8 for a burger - This shit better be fucking good. A Burger is an American tradition made for the common man with discarded beef parts that were ground up and served on a bun since their broke ass couldn't afford a steak. So I order a #8 which by all purpose is there to be the "regular" burger.Bun, Lettuce, Cheese, Burger, Pickles, Onions, Mayo.The burger is thinner than your index finger and some how they under cooked it but I was down to go with the flow and I gave it a chance. I house the thing in about :35 seconds since it was kind of small and for $8 I was expecting a "Pub Style" burger and got a greasy griddle fried burger that reminded me of a play-doh burger my daughter would make. I'm about 6'4 215lbs so I knew right away I was going to walk away hungery from this motherfucker right here, but whatever...I also got a soda and it was in a can and cost $1.75 which is hilarious. My soda did include a pint glass filled with ice so that must have been worth the extra price since the water we got was room temp and served without ice....Interesting.What is funny was my wife and I also ordered mac and cheese and we were worried that we ordered too much food (thinking that the Burger was going to be filling) and that just wasn't the case.(she doesn't eat Red Meat or Pork so she got the Veggie Burger but that disaster is a whole 'nother review all together!!)We wanted sweet potato fries but if you don't eat red meat be aware that the fries are cooked in a beef grease.  Not a surprise since I had a ton of grease on my dish....it was kind of amazing actually, how such a thin insufficient amount of meat could drip that much grease on my plate.Overall I think the place will do well since it is like "one of those places" that everyone talks about ..... then you realize these people have no fucking clue about what good shit is.So it is basically not a REAL AMERICAN BURGER place its a presumptuous wannabe hipster burger place that gets talked about way too much for what it is. I have had better burgers pretty much everywhere else I have ever eaten in my life. I guess after hearing so fucking much about this place I was going to hate it, but they really sealed the deal when I  actually sat down and eat here.Pros: Right off the Brown LineCons: Not a real dudes place for a burgerWould I go back : neverWould I recommend this place: NoFinal thought:Seriously go to Portillo's if you like this place and see if you ever go back, plus you will save a couple bucks in the process. Which you can then spend on a pair of Thick Black Frame Glasses, a plaid shirt and a stupid 10 speed that you paid $4k for but spray painted some ironic color.

Reviews.Author: Tera D.
Reviews.Content: The two stars is based solely on the burger.  I actually liked pretty much everything else about the place, but if a gourmet restaurateur and the owner of a top-of-the-line steak place open a burger joint, I'm gonna judge them on the burger.First of all, why oh why am I not asked to specify how I like my burger cooked??  And why why why why why would a chef decide on well-done as the default cooking level????  The meat isn't tender or very flavorful.  The topping options are ok, but you don't get an overwhelming amount of toppings, so they don't really stand out.  There's just too many freakishly good burgers in this town to waste time on this one.That said, the mac n' cheese is great, the atmosphere fun, service is good and the drink list unique.  Sorry to have to go 2-star with all that going for them, but for heaven's sake, it's a burger.  Get it right.

Reviews.Author: Kara K.
Reviews.Content: There is no better way to render a workout useless than to go and have burgers right afterwards. Post-grueling workout, a girlfriend suggested we go to DMK Burger Bar because she heard some great things about it. Since I was starving and hadn't had a good burger in a while, I said cool.We strolled into DMK at about noon and I wanted to run home and put on a hot outfit! I've NEVER seen a burger joint that looked as sexy as this place. This dimly lit bar with dark wood and fixtures was a totally pleasant and unexpected surprise.  A nice lunch crowd was already in place but it wasn't packed, so we were seated immediately. Our super friendly waitress came over and gave us the rundown and we placed our order. I had the # 6--the portabella with brie and scallions; my girl had the #1, which I believe was a basic cheeseburger and we shared a large order of fries.All I can say is hot damn! This burger was sooo good I ate it very slowly so I could savor every delectable, tasty bite. And the fries---we devoured every single one of them. This is the very reason I stay away from burgers--if you get a burger you have to get it with cheese, then you have to get fries with ketchup, then you have to get a milkshake, then you have to get the chocolate chip cookie ice cream sandwich. Aaagh! It's a conspiracy!I guess I have to do an extra 30 minutes on the treadmill tomorrow!

Reviews.Author: Ben K.
Reviews.Content: DMK is really really good.  Like REALLY good.  Items of note:The #1 (bacon, cheddar & grilled onions) is fantastic.  It's served on some sort of toasty rosemary bun, all the toppings fit nicely inside and go together perfectly.  I savored every last bite.  It goes well with beef or turkey.  This is a home run. The sweet potato fries with lemon tabasco aioli: WOW.  The fries are solid if unspectacular but the aioli is unreal.  I was dipping every single item on the table into it, wishing I had a cup or a pint or a quart instead of the small little metal condiment dish they give you.Last time I was there, for some reason our server gave us an order of fried pickles and okra on the house.  These were a tasty novelty, though I probably wouldn't order them myself for $5.  On that note, DMK is maybe a tiny bit more expensive than you would expect.  Burgers are $8 a la carte, and small orders of fries are $2-4.  But really when are you getting a burger w/fries at a decent restaurant in LP for under $10 anymore anyway?  If you didn't enjoy your meal because it was too expensive, perhaps you should try a little burger joint I think is called McDonalds.On the negative side, DMK is super loud.  It's usually packed, and even when it's not, the walls are very sound-reflective and there is always a cacophonous din in there.  Also, I always end up having to ask for extra ketchup (those metal condiment dishes are so small) and ice water.  A small drawback to an otherwise excellent dining experience.

Reviews.Author: Isla E.
Reviews.Content: The problem with this place is they don't do substitutions, and they only cook the meat really rare or super well-done. We asked about their meat-cooking, and the table next to us did also. They say the burgers are cooked medium, but I had a bite of one, and it was pretty damn pink. The waitress said that you can either get it "medium" or well-done. For all I know this is common practice with burgers, but if you are picky about doneness or toppings, this isn't your burger.Fries with truffle cream are addictive. The sweet potato tater tots weren't bad, either. The gruyere mac and cheese was disappointing; very bland. If you care about my greek salad I will tell you it is average.Still I would go back to this place. Really friendly staff and generally positive vibe.

Reviews.Author: David G.
Reviews.Content: I think it had been two weeks. The burger craving was going to devour me alive. I needed some place that wasn't going to make me wait two hours for a good quality burger. DMK popped out on the list. It's a burger bar which meant two things: they specialized in burgers and they had a bar. Give me an A+ for genius thinking. The bison burger was decent. A quarter pound patty slapped on a fresh baked bun. A little flimsy, though. For the price I expected a little more meat on the bun. The burgers in general are basically guilt-free grass fed beef, so I can't complain too much. My burger just didn't meet my expectations for a bar specializing in burgers. The fries were excellent. We ordered the blue cheese and smoked bacon fries, which I enjoyed more than the burger. We also received a complementary order of deep fried pickles. This was a little foreign to me, but I'll try anything. They were surprisingly good. At the time I was coming down with a cold, so I chose to go non-alcoholic, something that was difficult to do after reading their expansive beer list. I ended up getting a cherry lime soda, which is made in house from scratch. I felt a little immature getting a soda surrounded by big men drinking alcohol. But it tasted good. I would come back to DMK because of the fries and the beer, and to give them a second chance on the burger. Maybe order something different. Even a salmon burger or a lamb burger. I'll try anything!

Reviews.Author: Arash R.
Reviews.Content: The best Bison burger ever , couldn't get any better . great ambience . not to forget the sweet potato fries .

Reviews.Author: Jason H.
Reviews.Content: The short:A trendy-looking burger gastropub. It's clean, the bar is visible, and the waitstaff was pleasant. It's a decent place to bring a casual date but nothing formal. We went when it was nearly empty so I can't comment about how rowdy it might get on a busy day. It was a comfortable place to talk with my friends, but the food wasn't worth the price.The long:I was back in town for Christmas and met with some of my friends who'd wanted to check out this place, they heard it was great. My friends seemed to be more impressed with the food than I was.I don't drink so I can't comment on the alcohol quality.They have "house-made" soft drinks, I ordered the lemon-lime. It did taste sort of fresh I suppose, but it didn't taste better than Sprite. So who cares? $3 for a glass? Should have been better.All their burgers are $8. I ordered a lamb burger. It was fine, but too soft and falling apart for my preference. Maybe that's how ground lamb is I don't know, but I guess I should have asked for a firmer meat. It was ok, but it wasn't better than a Whopper. It was worth maybe $4, but not 8. The bun was fresh, but it was flimsy with no flavor or texture. Why bother? It's only been 2 days, but I can't really remember anything else about the burger. Maybe that says how bland an impression it made on me. I'm not going to complain about it, but I'm not going to praise it either.They have 5 types of french fries for $3 or $5 depending on size. I got there after the Sweet Potato fries were eaten, I heard they were good. I shared parts of the Wisconsin Cheddar fries and a couple other fries. I can't remember their names either, because they weren't that special. The Cheddar was too heavy without a real cheddar taste. It could have been stadium nacho cheese for all I care, it didn't hit me as strong cheddar. It was also too pooled at the bottom so the top/sides had no cheese and the bottom fries were drowned. Also, all the fries were too oily/greasy for my taste. I like crispy fries, which still resemble potato rather than oil-soaked shoe laces. OK, it wasn't as bad as that, but they weren't crispy even when fresh. The other two orders of fries came with some sort of zesty ketchup, but WAY too little for the amount of fries. Don't skimp on the special sauce!!!Overall, I paid $18 before tax/tip for a burger, some fries, and a glass of pop. Think to yourself how good it would have to be to be worth that much to you. Well, it wasn't worth nearly that much to me. I feel like I was paying for the OPTION of drinking alcohol more than for the quality of the food I ACTUALLY ate. And the "atmosphere" which I feel could be attained by dimming the lights in my own house. I'm not trying to knock the place, but come on, $18 for mediocre-at-best food? That's not right.It also doesn't seem right that the bathrooms are between you and the kitchen.... just weird to have to see your food being carried past the bathrooms. They were clean, but I would prefer my food is nowhere near there.In summary:if you've got money to blow and want a very average-looking and average-tasting trendy-looking restaurant, come here. If you think $20 is too much to pay for a Happy Meal without the toy, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Author: Kristine B.
Reviews.Content: It would be a disservice to say I "ate" there.  I would like to say I "experienced a meal" there.  Staff was SUPER friendly (I'm inclined to believe the owners are actually working the floor this week), and very helpful.My friend and I both had the burgers - hers was the #8 (a 'usual toppings' type burger) and mine was the #4 (chiles, fried egg, and bacon).  Both were amazing.  The bun was soft, and lovely, but stood up to the egg middles.  The beer selection is awesome (no miller lite here!) and they are going for the old-but new again cocktails.  No coke or pepsi products either - a local soda (with real cane sugar!) or their own flavored sodas.The Parmesan fries with truffle cream were good - even just on their own without the cream I was in heaven.The atmosphere was great - not too cramped, but not too spread out, music was at a good level (I love kuma's but I don't like to shout), and there was adequate space if you were to bring a large group.Needless to say, I'm a fan of DMK and will be happily recommending this place to others (as long as they promise to bring me! I want to try the milkshakes and ice cream sandwiches!)

Reviews.Author: Todd M.
Reviews.Content: I checked out the reviews of DMK Burger Bar before heading out to check it out for myself.  Seems most people either love this restaurant or hate it.  I fall in to the loved it camp.I enjoyed that in addition to an interesting selection of burgers and fries they offered a strong beer list as well. I started off with a Great Lakes Dortmunder Gold on tap.  My wife and I each tried a different burger and each ordered our own fries.  We learned when they arrived we should have split the fries as the portions are large.  We enjoyed both the Seat Salt & Black Pepper fries as well as the Wisconsin Cheddar & Scallion fries.I think I won the battle of the burgers with a Burger served with Chili Rubbed Onion Strings and a Spicy Chipotle Ketchup (I am now craving this again just thinking about it).  My Wife's was also a strong contender, it was served with aged cheddar, smoked bacon, balsamic red onions and a BBQ sauce.This place has been compared often to Kuma's.  One thing I liked about these burgers compared to the Kuma Burger was the size. I felt full after the burger but did not feel overstuffed as I often do when enjoying a Kuma burger.If you love a good burger this should be on you list to check out next.

Reviews.Author: cara y.
Reviews.Content: Why do you need two pounds of meat to make a good burger?I don't understand this. I like Kuma's and all, but eating a meat hockey puck has grown old. And this is one of the reasons why DMK blew me away.I've spent the last few weeks obsessively drooling over the menu. "When I go, I'mma get this, and this, and this, and you'll bring the wheel barrow and cart me home." My boyfriend had visited on a work lunch, and set my attention on the place and I finally found time before work to check it out.Honestly, the inside wasn't what I expected, in a good way. I expected some burger joint like The Counter, and was pleasantly surprised to find it a darker, bar atmosphere. We were quoted 20 minutes, which is beyond acceptable, and were seated within 10. Our waitress, Kiley (I think that was her name. SHE WAS AWESOME) greeted us within minutes, and I geeked out at her over my excitement. She was friendly without being wooden, and didn't seem to mind my "I want both, but which one should I get" questions.I ordered:Blueberry/Lemon SodaBreakfast Burger (Weekend special)Boyfriend:Turkey Burger (#9 I think?)Sea Salt/Black Pepper FriesThe soda was incredible. Strong flavor without being too sweet. Very refreshing on a warm day. As we waited for our burgers, a runner came up with a plate of delicious fried things, and let us know that our waitress wanted to give us something on the house.And that's when fried okra and pickle chips entered my life. They were amazing. I'm from the south, so I'm no stranger to fried pickles, but the mix with okra, and the house made ranch? Screw you, DMK. Why were they so good?Our burgers came shortly after, before I managed to decimate the fried platter, and they were once again nothing like what I expected, in a very good way. My breakfast burger was a turkey burger with a fried egg, jack cheese, bacon, hash browns with a maple aoli. I got the aoli on the side, because I'm not the biggest sweets fan, but after tasting it, I could see how it would rock the socks off someone. The burger itself was much thinner than I had grown used to at places like Kuma's, but it was so flavorful and cooked perfectly. I loved my burger. I ate half without feeling stuffed or still hungry. The fries were ridiculous. Cooked crispy, like I like 'em, and the house ketchup was a perfect compliment. All and all, I want to give them 1 star because I want everyone to go away so I can always have a seat. I give them 5 stars because that's what they deserve from the friendly staff, the delicious food, and the non-overwhelming bar atmosphere.They also involve themselves in charities. And they have a killer cocktail menu. And a bloody mary bar.I need to stop.The best part? Our okra was comped under the discount "Love."I love you, too, DMK. I love you, too.

Reviews.Author: TJ C.
Reviews.Content: I write very few reviews, but given all the publicity about DMK Burger Bar, I thought I would take a few minutes and post my thoughts.  In a restaurant that is all about burgers, an unwillingness to cook a burger to a temperature (rare, medium rare, etc.) suggests one of three things.  First we are so unsure of our product, our systems and our training that we are unwilling to cook to medium rare.  Another possibility is that the DMK team believes that they know better than the guest how the guest wants a burger.  The last possibility is that they simply want to simplify things for the line cooks. Let's discuss each in turn.  If it's the first possibility then that's truly unfortunate.  If the Counter can cook a medium rare burger, why can't DMK?  It's about a focus on food safety training, trusting your supply chain and taking the same reasonable precautions that seem to work for the other burger specialists.  If it's the second possibility it seems very out of tune with the current environment.  Being guest friendly is critical for ongoing survival in the current recession.  Lastly, if it's about ease for the kitchen then it's a case of misaligned priorities.    I had the burger with onion strings - "medium plus."  The bartender claimed that the burger would still be juicy.  Usually when I am at a place that will only cook to medium or better (Denny's for example)  I just order something else.  However, there's not a lot to choose from at DMK if you don't want a burger so with trepidation I ordered the burger with onion strings.   As I feared 'medium plus'  turned out to be well done, dry and tasteless.  Grass fed beef tends to have  lower fat content than the standard product; this makes if far more sensitive to overcooking, not less.   Okay, what I liked was the roll; not too bready and an excellent choice.  The homemade ketchup and the blue cheese fries were pretty good.  House cut fries are often tough to execute consistently and are often limp.  These were reasonably crispy.  The mac and cheese was okay but a little disappointing given MK's resume.   Maybe it's unfair, but given his resume, I would have expected more.   The beer list was okay, although skewed towards the national 'semi-crafts' (Fat Tire, Goose Island)  but that's a personal preference.  Service was good.  We sat at the bar and were waited on by a good bartender with a fast smile and fast hands (a bad thing in front of the bar - a good thing behind the bar!).  I could see him cringe when I ordered my burger 'medium-rare' but he doggedly rolled out the "we only cook to medium plus but it will still be juicy..." line, as he has no doubt been trained.  I sort of felt bad for him.  DMK is a beautiful room and is well put together.   Needless to say it was hopping and loud.   Lot's of hard surfaces make it loud but that is no doubt intentional on the part of the design team, to give the room an energy.  Most restaurants make mistakes; it's how you recover from them that matters.  They have a great team and the concept works.  They want to do only a few things and do them well.  From an industry perspective, burgers are on a tear - look at the headsnapping growth of 'better burger' concepts such as 5 Guys and Smash Burger.  In full service operations, chains such as the Counter continue to grow despite some misteps.   I wish the team at DMK luck and I would give them another chance if they rethink their decision to overcook their burgers for reasons of their own.  I gave them two stars for the concept, but as another reviewer said, an overcooked burger is a deal-breaker if the name of your restaurant isn't Denny's or Burger King.

Reviews.Author: Ritu R.
Reviews.Content: I'm a fan! Been here about 3 times.  Each time was fantastic! Tasty and clean burgers.  That is almost unheard of! They offer a variety of sides and snacks that are all delic! Truffle and the cheddar fries! Their deviled eggs are to die for too! I had the portabella burger and it was crispy and tasty.  I have no complaints! I shall return to try the other burgers ;-)    Its one of those burger places that you wanna bring your out-of-town guests too bc its so fun and good!  Our last time there was on a Sunday and are not sport-watchers and were very comfortable and enjoyed our experience! My husband says this last time was the best! Yeay for DMK!

Reviews.Author: Zo O.
Reviews.Content: I was greeted by David Morton :D +1Went there on the 3rd day of opening.. wasn't very busy.I was expecting the menu I saw online on the TOC site.. but their menu was different. No substitutes .. so try to be open to try what they offer.. I ordered #12.. the fried stuffed portobello burger ($8) :) Super yum. My meat lovin' friend thought it was just as good as his medium rare burger($8)! We both ordered the blood orange sodas and a order of two diff fries(sweet potato w/lemon tabasco aioli & regular fries w/ketchup). We also LOVED the bread for their burger buns. Super soft .. which you'd think wouldn't work as a burger bun.. but it does! Yummm...

Reviews.Author: Alysha P.
Reviews.Content: Brought a couple of friends from nyc here last Saturday.....we were hungover, hungry and ready to get busy on some burgers!Food#8: Pretty straightforward burger....lettuce....tomato....pickles....onions..­..mayo and choice of cheese....I got the aged cheddar......and since I am a straightforward kind of burger gal.....I was very very happy with my choice. Juicy and delicious.....perfect size....not too big....not too small....and it was cooked to a perfect medium.....just the way I like it....yum! #1: Bf's choice with bacon, bbq sauce, and balsamic charred red onions.....I had a few bites....thought it was good....but not as good as mine : )  bf liked it....but thought the onions were a little overwhelming....didn't stop him from eating the whole damn thing though.Mac n' Cheese #1: Soooooo creamy......soooo cheesy....soooooo frickin' good! Perfect dish for a cold hungover day.....Fries with Truffle and Parmesan: I never met a french fry I didn't like and these were no exception......flavors were beautiful....I only wish there would have been more sauceBig Salad: We got this to share so we could feel at least a little bit healthy......and it was actually a really good salad.....def enough for 4 peeps to share.....lots of veggies involved....very happy...yay!ServiceOur server was super cute, attentive and sweet....No rushing to order and lots of smiles. They were out of the wine that I wanted so she offered to bring a taste of the substitute....which I always appreciate. The host and the bus person were equally nice and attentive.....AmbianceDark and sleek but cozy at the same time.....liked it!OverallPretty damn good burgers.....I was very happy with the whole experience.....and would def pop back in.

Reviews.Author: Emily C.
Reviews.Content: I went here with the fam and the bf and ate entirely too much in the best way possible.  This means I have to do the awesome break-it-down-into-categories thing.Drinks:Cool beer list with a bunch of local brews.  I tried Crispin cider here which was cold and delicious.  Cocktails look solid too, sight unseen.  I wanted to try the one with the cool name (something about death and tigers.  I forget!), but didn't get around to it.  Next time, hopefully!Burgers:Excellent.  I had the lamb burger with tapenade, cucumber, & tzatiki, my mom had the #1 (BBQ, onion strings, cheese, & bacon), my brother had the one with a fried egg, peppers, and bacon, BF had one with a hunk of pastrami, cheese, and mustard, and sadly I can't even remember what my dad had but we passed bites around the table and I was impressed with everything I ate.  Such distinct flavors!  The only teeny-minute criticism here is that they might want to try other types of buns.  Sometimes you just can't beat a pretzel roll.  But don't let that distract you from the fact that these are some seriously delicious burgers.  A few of the ones they aren't serving yet look great too.  I'm itching to get at the one with prosciutto and fontina cheese.Sides:We had the fried pickle/okra with herb ranch as well as the chili-dusted onion straws.  These both were incredible.  The dipping sauce for the pickle/okra combo was perfect for it and whatever they do to their house ketchup that makes it taste kind of smoky makes me want to consume it by the bottle.  Mac & Cheese:We had the one with gruyere, onions, and bacon and shared it as a table.  Mmmmmm.  Fries:Because we have absoltuely no self control, we got a small plate of every type of french fry on the menu.  I was absolutely blown away by the sweet potato fries with lemon-tabasco aoli (you don't think they go together but they TOTALLY do), blue cheese fries with bacon, and the aged cheddar cheese & bacon ones. Seriously kids - Kormick & co. really know how to combine flavors to put a fresh spin on stuff you think you've eaten a million times.  This sweet little spot is likely going to be mega crowded, and deservedly so.

Reviews.Author: Linda N.
Reviews.Content: Do try grass-fed beef.  My first experience with non-cornfed beef happened in Atlanta at Farm Burger and it nearly changed my palate forever.Do not come for a meal at this restaurant during peak times.  DMK doesn't take reservations - we came here on a Sunday for a late lunch around 2pm and got a table right away.Do browse the craft beer list - I chose Dogfish Head India Brown Ale, date had the Stone IPA.Do not think that you can substitute toppings on your burger.  I had my heart set on the Patty Melt, but I was bummed that I couldn't opt for aged cheddar, as my taste buds care not for Swiss.Do try the #4 Roasted Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg,Sonoma Jack, Smoked Bacon if you like spicy - date loved it.Do not order any burger from here if you like it mooing.  Requests for burgers cooked below medium will be denied.Do try the Parmesan fries with Truffle cream - can I say, divine?Liked this place and will be back someday to try grass-fed Colorado lamb.

Reviews.Author: Mary B.
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this place got written up in the Tribune and my husband and I decided to try it out. We both had shakes, burgers and truffle fries. Shakes were Okay, nothing special. Burgers had great toppings; I had the one with the goat cheese and blueberry bbq sauce. The goat cheese was fresh and the bbq sauce was quite good. The burger itself was the size of a steak and shake burger. It tasted kinda like it too. I don't understand what is with the wimpy meat patty. If you are gonna spend 8.00 for a burger sans fries, there should be some meat in there, am I wrong? Truffle fries were great and I'd maybe go back just for those. Overall review? meh...

Reviews.Author: Susan F.
Reviews.Content: Finally got a chance to stop into DMK after about a year of wanting to go. For some reason, I never made it over here until now, and now I'm kicking myself for not have coming sooner.Walking in, I would have never expected it to look like this, it didn't feel so much like Lakeview. It was a really cool atmosphere (not to say Lakeview isn't, I mean, I live here!) but it was just a different deal. Long and narrow, brick exposed wall, some communal seating and ample bar seating, I was surprised. We actually got seated within 5 minutes, prior to being told it would be 30 minutes, wahoo 5 stars!Before coming, I perused the burger list of course and made sure to check out all the burger pics. I had made my mind up, #11, lamb burger, mmm. We split a bowl of chili as our app--it was super good and served with some toasted bread. Now was the hard part...FRIES. Up to fry-heaven: The beau and I opted for sweet potato fries and parmesan truffle fries. The SP fries were awesome, as were the truffles. The single servings were a perfect size($2) and that sauce was amazing. We weren't too thrilled with the sauce that came with the parm fries, we couldn't really place it? It was just creamy, I liked it, but it was kinda like "whatevs", in the most lamens terms.Burger run down: Honestly, I really liked the burger and the bread!(#11) It was the perfect size and was also aesthetically pleasing to my hungry eyes. The bf commented how he would have liked tomato and lettuce for the crunch, but by no means complained about his dish. Our server, Katie, was very attentive. The service was quick and friendly. The beer list is great, they have all the good stuff, running for $5.50-$6 for tap.I will come back here again. I liked the music too! Great date spot.

Reviews.Author: Ramya P.
Reviews.Content: Vegetarians are denied fries!Just like Romeo n Juliet, beer n football and wine and cheese, the obvious eternal partner of a sumptuous burger is a bunch of crispy fries. DMK has fries alright, and from what I heard, they're pretty good too. But they're all fried in beef oil and we vegetarians have to feel incomplete. There are however 3 non-meat burger options. Salmon, veggie and the crispy portobello. The crispy portobello is really good and is definitely one of the best veggie burgers I've had. The buns for the burgers were soft and felt like they were freshly baked. The beer list features all kinds of ales and the service is friendly too.

Reviews.Author: Andres D.
Reviews.Content: I have heard so much about DMK and I finally made it....better late than never. DMK tables get filled up pretty quickly unless you are a party of two. Last nite myself plus two pals grabbed a seat at the bar since we didn't want to wait. At first the menu was a tad confusing, thank goodness the lovely bartender explained everything. She had total patience and was helpful with our selections.DMK serves quality...oh yeah! Grass-fed beef, Colorado lamb, Turkey and Veggie burgers. They are covering it all whether you are a meatlover or not. Hands down my favorite was the #11 Lamb Burger w/ Feta and Tzatzki sauce. We also ordered the #1 Cheddar, Bacon, BBQ Beef Burger, #8 Basic more tradtional Beef Burger, #10 Turkey Burger with Smoked Swiss. Side choices on our table was the large order of Sea Salt & Black Pepper Fries with HOMEMADE ketchup, Wisconsin Cheddar & Scallion Fries and finally some HOMEMADE Creamy coleslaw.  I washed most if down with Three Floyds Robert the Bruce and Gumballhead.The burger patties aren't thick so there is no playing room "how would you like it cooked" preference. If you are comparing it to Kuma's Corner 10 ounce burger patty you will be disappointed. DMK will allow you to double up on the patties for an extra $3 bucks or add a fried egg on top for $1.I will be back, as well as the rest of my group. Thanks for the awesome peanut butter malted shake.

Reviews.Author: cassie r.
Reviews.Content: The food was excellent. Everything else about the experience....not so much. We arrived around 5:30ish last night, and though we sat right away, we ended up sitting an inordinately long time waiting for our waitress to greet us.Then we waited a long time to get our beer. Then our food, our bill, etc. You get the picture. I'd be a bit more understanding if everyone had been getting slow service, but that wasn't the case. The table next to us sat down near the end of our meal, and yet they were already halfway through their dinner by the time we left. Beyond that, the place is ridiculously loud. And no, I'm not a crotchedy old man  - it was just straight up noisy. And impossible to have a conversation when all you can hear is music and people yelling to be heard. Like I said though, the food was really good. I had the #12 - veggie burger with aged cheddar, eggplant, tomato and pesto mayo. The eggplant was a delicious add, and the bun was fantastically fresh.  We ordered a side of sweet potato fries (LOVE the aioli sauce) and  tried the parmesan fries with truffle cream (not bad - the cream sauce was definitely the best part of that combo). The beer list is decent (though apparently I don't like Three Floyds Gumballhead...) and the location is easily accessible from the train and parking was easily found. Not a bad spot for a burger in Lakeview.

Reviews.Author: Mihir P.
Reviews.Content: Oh hell no! My burger was nasty. Overly-gamey beef, rancid-tasting cheese, cold and soggy balsamic onions. Burger was about 1/4 lb. and it was $8 with no sides.The onion strings were ok - overly greasy and under-spiced. The service was nice but not entirely "there".I give an extra star for the blood orange soda and a solid beer list.

Reviews.Author: Amanda G.
Reviews.Content: These are fancy fast food-style burgers. Think Kuma's (I know, but you were thinking Kuma's anyway) meets Tastee Freeze or something along those lines. If it weren't for the toppings, I'd roll my eyes at the $8, but I had a number 4 (I looove eggs on burgers, because all I want in life is to die of a heart attack before I reach life expectancy) and I thought $8 was a fair price. My burger was tasty and pretty spicy -- keep in mind I am kind of a baby when it comes to spice.I love that the individual sides of fries are $2. It's great if you go with a group because everyone can order a different kind and you get to try them all. I had the parmesan truffle cream, which was heavenly. I tried the blue & smoked bacon and those were amazing as well. Basically, for $10 you get a fancified value meal, and it's delicious. Unless you order like a maniac or just ate, you probably won't take leftovers home, which for the price is fine. There's also a great beer list, which is always fun. I'll definitely be back to try other combos, and probably to try the mac and cheese as well.

Reviews.Author: Tiffany S.
Reviews.Content: I realize that fancy burgers are the all the craze right now.  I've also completely sold into the craze, and will run full speed (faster than I've ever run on a treadmill) to the closest burger joint to get my fix.DMK's food was such a disappointment.  The burger patties were so skinny and weak, it's was 90% bread and toppings.  Their fries are terrible (though I realize it's a matter of taste), but I hate being forced to eat pepper on soggy skinny overcooked fries.  I also hated their prententious "homemade" ketchup.  It was spicy! Have you guys read the Gladwell article about how ketchup is the perfect food, and to change it is actually takes away what makes our tastebuds go crazy for it?  If people wanted icky "flavored" ketchup, don't you think the idea would have caught on before now? So gross, and of course they looked at me like I was some kind of class-less vagrant when I asked for Heinz.My friend's macaroni and cheese committed the worst offense mac and cheese can do... it was severely lacking in the cheese department.  It doesn't matter if you put 5 different gourmet cheese into some noodles, if you skimp on the cheese, it's not macaroni AND cheese, it's just noodles.I can't complain about the service, our waitress was nice.  The atmosphere is also very cool, and I would totally hang out here for drinks.  The beer selection was huge, and they had a lot of local stuff that I appreciated.  That being said, they only have one-sie bathrooms, which results in such long waits for the bathroom that my order actually arrived while I was waiting in line for the bathroom (which I ran to directly after order).  So annoying.Pretty much, unless it's for beer, don't expect me back.  I don't hate you DMK, but until a massive overhaul happens, I don't think I can ever even like you.

Reviews.Author: Crista L.
Reviews.Content: Boyfriends cravin a burger & fries: DMK.At DMK, it is nearly impossible to find vegan fare, HOWEVER there are a few vegetarian options. I KNOW that I am reviewing a BURGER BAR. just sayin.I digress.The best advice I have to offer you is to skip the fries at DMK and go straight for the fried okra/pickles and onion straws.That's all.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan H.
Reviews.Content: I was happy to finally get a chance to try these burgers. I'd been hearing a lot about them, and wanted to see if it held up to the other burger joints I love.I got the Number 3. I love a good pastrami sandwich, and I also love burgers. SO this was a natural choice for me. Service was nice and pleasant and there was no line for a table. Got my burger and some fries.( We ordered the regular ones, which was lame because they had a bunch of other styles I bet I would have enjoyed.) Burger was cooked right and the pastrami, mustard and sauerkraut were a nice touch and made the burger very tasty.The only thing that keeps it from being 5 stars is just that my wife and I were not a fan of the buns. They were bitter. Not sourdough, but bitter. And the price was a little high. That will not stop me from going back, because I really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Author: Virginia T.
Reviews.Content: My friend grabbed DMK and brought it over for a quick dinner recently.I ordered the Holy Gauc-Aioli Buger (turkey). It was really tasty. The burger came with chorizo, guacamole, chipotle aioli, jack cheese. P got the Patty Melt no onions. He really liked it. The smoked swiss was especially nice. J got the #4 minus the fried egg (green chile, jack and bacon) and said it was tasty.We split a large order of the salt & pepper fries which were good, and probably are  more crisp for dine-in.One thing to note: The patties are not cooked to order, they are on the thin side. Our burgers weren't dry though.

Reviews.Author: Liz K.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE DMK! Seriously can't say enough good things about this place. The first time I went was in the fall, and had a great experience. Food:Amazing, amazing, amazing. Not totally sure what I ordered the first time I went, but I'm going to take a guess and say the #1. Whatever it was, it was delicious. I've also tried the #2...very good as well. However from what I remember the #1 was better. Last time I went my boyfriend and I had the Wisconsin chedder fries. Very good, but a little heavy. Probably wouldn't order them again. Instead I would opt for the sea salt and black pepper. It sounds so simple, but these fries melt in your mouth. And the house ketchup is a perfect dipping sauce...a little spicy, which I LOVED. Also huge beer list. The first time I went I tried the beer on special basically because it was cheap haha. Not a huge fan of it, but oh well. There are plenty to choose from!Service:Great for both visits. Moreso the first visit. I went with a group of 5 on a Friday night. The no reservations policy kind of sucks, but we didn't have to wait TOO long, so we didn't mind. Plus on a warmer evening, it's nice to wait outside and chat with your friends. When we were seated, the waitress was great. One of my friends was debating between her normal cocktail of choice and a new, more exotic looking one. The waitress recommended the exotic cocktail, and my friend agreed to order it. Unfortunately, she didn't like it, and only took a few sips. The waitress, without even asking, promptly brought over the cocktail that my friend was originally going to order, and said with an apologetic smile, "I noticed you weren't really liking your drink, so I got you what you originally wanted, and it's on the house!" After my friend thanked her, the waitress came back AGAIN with a complimentary order of fries because "they're so delicious, you guys have to try them!" We were blown away by her friendliness and attentiveness! The second time I went the service was good, nothing spectacular though.Atmosphere:Very loud. Not a good spot for an intimate date. With a group it's fun though! Also dark, but it didn't bother me at all. Very trendy, and basically just screams that the place is a good time!Price:Being a broke college student, I reserve DMK for a treat....it's kind of on the pricy side. Most burgers are $9, beers around $6-$8, fries $2-$5. And yes, it's true, the burgers do not come with fries. Kind of sucks, but the fries are worth the extra few bucks. Also get a large and share with your group! Burgers are a little small for the price, but you have to consider the atmosphere and service...not the mention the pure deliciousness. Expensive? Slightly. Worth it? Definitely.A lot of people like Kuma's better...as far as food goes, it's pretty much even for me. Kuma's definitely has bigger portions for the same price. However, I like everything else better about DMK. Sorry Kuma's! DMK wins in my book :)

Reviews.Author: Michael S.
Reviews.Content: Took a hiatus from yelp, but just couldn't resist reviewing DMK..Found out about this place in an e-mail I got and immediately contacted roomies, Derrick T. and Akash S. about going and watching the bears game. Dropping the names of Michael Kornick (chef owner of MK) and David Morton (of Morton's The Steakhouse fame) and mentioned the plethora of craft beers and we were set. Arrived around 7ish and were told it would be an hour wait. Not bad especially since it was the third night open. The location is in Lakeview right by the Wellington stop for the brown line and parking was okay to find. Inside was exposed brick and dim lighting filled with yuppies galore. Not a bad thing really.. It just wasn't as casual as I thought. Being told by Michael Kornick that our wait wasn't long was a nice touch. The hostesses were really friendly as well and the wait wasn't bad at all considering all of us had a beer while we waited.So craft beers were good. I think I had the Two Brothers Cain and Abel Red Rye Beer, Derrick T. had the Left Hand Milk Stout and Akash S. had a draft beer. We all enjoyed our beers. I especially enjoyed how the alcohol hit me as I didn't eat for a while beforehand.So we were all seated and picked our food. Not to make Derrick T.'s review redundant as we had some of everyone's burger (and also because Derrick T. is a little more detailed) I will just mention my burger. I had the #4 with the green chiles, fried egg, and bacon. Really good, but I think if I let my burger sit a little more the egg would of made the bun too soggy. The bun itself was nicely toasted and the meat was nicely prepared. I think the beef is grass-fed which had a different texture and taste, but was good. I would of wished it was a little juicier if I could of changed something. Maybe increase the fat content a wee bit? Of course we had sides too! Ordered two small fries and the first mac and cheese. For the fries we had the parmesan truffle and the sweet potato. Both were good. The sweet potato fries though didn't stand out from sweet potato fries from other places. The sauce it came with though was impressive. Just like other rave reviews for the truffle fries, I would have to say they were outstanding. The sauce with those were unbelievable. If only there was more room in all of our guts I wouldn't of minded getting a large order of that. The mac and cheese.. well it's good. Not the best I've had, but really good. I liked the crust on top of it and appreciated how it didn't feel too rich like other places, but I kind of wanted that gluttony. Really well made though.Watching the bears game here made us realize that two tv's at the bar isn't enough. I do understand that the people there weren't watching the game and that the crowd might not really care to watch a game while there, but it would of been nice for few more tv's so we could watch a game and enjoy our food. We all ended up walking over to Sheffield's after to finish the game.Overall, really good burgers. I wouldn't say like Kuma's, as they feel worlds apart (not just crowds and noise level), but really good. Kumas is more meat and well rock n' roll for their food while DMK is a more refined take on the classic burger/sides. Definitely will need to go back to try the coffee shake Derrick T. will gush about and also their ice cream sandwich!

Reviews.Author: Laura L.
Reviews.Content: I would give the burger I ate a 1, however everything else was a 5, so that's why I gave this place a 3.Why did I give the burger a 1?  First of all, they don't ask you how you want the burger cooked which is just weird for a BURGER BAR.  But, the weirder thing is that they default to medium well!  Maybe they call it medium plus or whatever, but bottom line - no pink.  It is therefore pretty dry and not tender at all.  The toppings that I chose sounded really good, but I ended up having to scrape off the hot chiles because they were overpowering the whole burger.  However, they have a great selection of fries.  I went with 3 of my girlfriends and we ordered an order of each kind of fries (the small orders are super inexpensive).  They also have a great variety of specialty drinks - the best being the Rhubarb drink (I can't remember what it was called, but Rhubarb was in the name).  They had jam at the bottom which actually ended up being quite delicious!The other really good thing is that it has a great space for a long wait.  Yes, there is a long wait, however there is plenty of room by the bar to order your drink and stand and talk with the group that you came with.  It was almost like we were just at a bar hanging out, so the hour wait didn't both any of us.Overall experience was great however the burger itself was not.  Don't you dare compare this place to Kuma's Corner as that is burger blasphemy!

Reviews.Author: Adrienne G.
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying I don't really eat beef that much.  so when I do go here I get turkey burgers, or other non-beef burgers.  The turkey burgers and good, the salmon burger disappointed me since it wasn't spicy at all.  I wish that you could have anything made into a lamb burger, that would be good.  Overall, the simple menu works for me.Sides: The fried okra and pickles once was delicious, but now I avoid it because there isn't an even ratio of okra to pickle.  The gravy fries are delicious and remind me of mashed potatoes and gravy, which is more than I could have dreamt of when it comes to gravy fries.  The other fries with truffle oil and cheese are also yummy.Staff is always fine.  The beer list is varied enough that you will always be able to try something new.  I have yet to try any cocktails here since beer goes very well with burgers.  If you get one of DMK's homemade sodas, ask for ice in a separate glass because they don't give you free refills and the glass will pretty much just be ice.Overall DMK is just a great spot to go out in small groups or on a casual date.  And I would say when you go, get the gravy fries!

Reviews.Author: Randy K.
Reviews.Content: Imagine walking into a crowded restaurant on a Sunday night to a bunch of hooligans cheering on a televised fight. No, not the UFC, but Daniel San in the final battle of Karate Kid. Crane kick to the face, call it a night. Any crowd willing to cheer on a movie fight scene is a place to call home. And any bar that takes your suggestion of playing Space Jam while you eat is worth revisiting.If you've read this far you can tell the atmosphere here is awesome. Not just the crowd or charismatic crew, but the long tables and dim lighting makes for a cozy environment.But you didn't read this review because you care about environment. You care about food. And the food was AWESOME. Holy Moses. I ordered the #4 after an informative discussion with my server (are you feeling: sweet -or- spicy. I chose spicy.). I'm not one for eggs on my burgers, but this burger was so perfectly balanced I couldn't imagine it any other way. Complemented with sweet potato fries for the table (good portion size for 2-3 people). PS - the sauce is great, not sure what it is.Come here with friends, eat a burger (a real burger), and prep yourself for addiction.

Reviews.Author: Sam K.
Reviews.Content: This is definitely one of the best burger bar in Chicago (probably rival In-n-Out in west coast). The vanilla milkshake is to die for, and I would recommend #3 for the burger (the green chille one!). Also get the truffle cream sauce fries. With those 3, you are set leaving a happy camper. A few things to beware and why 4-star. You cannot get seated till your full party arrive, so that is kind of an annoyance. They also do not take reservations, so do not be confused if they told you you are set. But other than that, you will not be disappointed with the food!

Reviews.Author: Annie W.
Reviews.Content: How coincidental, reading omnivore's dilemma and now fearing corn. So it's very timely I go to a burger joint with grass fed steers! And to tell you the truth, I actually can tell the difference!! #4: how can you go wrong with a fried egg? and bacon? no, you can't. #12: wow, one of the best veggie burgers ever! hearty, bean-y  eggplant well done. house fries were regular. the sweet potato fries were quite heavenly. mac and cheese #1 was super rich and creamy. so much in fact that my last bit i felt a bit nauseous. but then again, i had just eaten a whole burger and a ton of fries. serves me right for being greedy.

Reviews.Author: Heather K.
Reviews.Content: Three visits in and still delicious! Just a few things to add from my original review...- mac and cheese (I've tried the traditional as well as the onion/bacon varieties) is great but too rich to eat on its own as an "entree," so definitely think of it as a sharable plate- you can sub a turkey burger for any of the beef burger options if you're not a red meat eater- there isn't always enough space at the bar if you want to drink while you're waiting for a table... so just plan accordingly!

Reviews.Author: Andrew B.
Reviews.Content: Ordered the pastrami burger, which is a hamburger with pastrami, sauerkraut, and a secret sauce on top. It was pretty tasty, but I didn't stop there. Also ordered fried pickles, which were very greasy and just OK. Shared a plate of parmesan and truffle sauce fries, which were tasty and, once again, very greasy. Beer selection is solid. They had 6 drafts and about 20 different bottles. All of them are micro-brewed and the menu lists where the beer is from. Beer was $5-$6. Burger is $8. Fries were $5. Standard pricing for that area. Service was good. I will probably go back to get a burger and a milkshake(a 4-star meal?). However, I will be passing on the greasy sides because I just didn't like how they passed through me.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer B.
Reviews.Content: Wow.  These burgers are really freaking good....After two failed attempts at DMK (waits of over an hour!) we decided to stop by on a Saturday afternoon and sit at the bar.  Good thing we did b/c I think the bar is the place to be...either that or up front at the high tables.  The back of the restaurant looked kinda sad....everyone smashed against each other and right by the kitchen...Anyhoo, back to the bar.  There are a plethora of interesting and odd-ball bottled beers.  There are also signature drinks that seemed inventive; especially for a burger place.  Their menu is simple: choose from 12 different burgers.  Want fries?  Choose from 5.  I would definitely recommend the sweet potato fries....I mean....my god.  They are fantastic and much better than the normal fries on the menu.  If you are a turkey burger fan the turkey burgers are aces.  You can just tell that the meat is better quality.  Our bartender was explaining how all the meat is aged, grass-fed, etc etc.  I didn't really get it until I ate the burger...now I get it.Chicago is lucky that DM and MK decided to open this Burger Bar....they have certainly taken the standards, ingredients, and philosophy of their fine-dining restaurants and applied them to DMK Burger Bar.

Reviews.Author: Patrick P.
Reviews.Content: OMG Becky -- the guy who played Pam's fiance from The Office was sitting next to me when I last ate here. I don't know his name. I just yelled: "You're from The Office." He didn't even register a reaction. Oh well...Maybe if you come here, you will sit next to a C-level actor like I did...I liked it here cuz they have burgers for meat-eaters and options for vegetarians like me.  I had the Veggies and Grain burger and it was one of the best veggie burgers I have ever had.. Very fresh, not a Boca burger. The real deal. I also had Sea Salt & Black Pepper fries and Sweet Potato fries... both delish!My only complaint is that the music was up too high... I was eating there at 6 and there were a ton of families and they had the nob on the stereo at 11.TURN DOWN THE MUSIC a bit. It makes it hard to talk to your companions.... Just saying....

Reviews.Author: Stephanie N.
Reviews.Content: 11 stars!!This burger place is AMAZING. I got a #4 (Roasted Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack, Smoked Bacon) and let me tell you these burgers are heaven! The buns it comes in seem more like a thicker fluffier flatbread-esque "bun" which balances out the flavors of the burger. It's incredible! Between three of my friends we split 3 of the "sides": Fried Okra/Pickles, Sweet potato fries, and Garlic Parmesean truffle fries. First off we probably should have stuck splitting the "small" sides instead of the larger shared sides, we had plenty of food leftover. And i don't know if being from the south has spoiled me, but the fried okra was "meh". But the fries were amazing! They have sauces specialty made to complement the fries. The sweet potatoes came with a tabasco/lemon juice sauce which surprisingly tasted like blueberries. Went extremely well with the sweet potatoe fries! Then the truffle cream sauce for the parmesean fries didn't come in a big enough container, and lacked a straw that I could have drank that amazing sauce with!The atmosphere is great. Highly recommended for some of the most amazing burgers you'll ever have!

Reviews.Author: Laura C.
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to try DMK Burger for some time now, in part because I love a good hamburger and because I have heard great things about this place.  The burger did not disappoint...the service did disappoint.  It took over 10 minutes for the waitress to come take our drink order (the place wasn't even packed) and we ordered the mac & cheese to split for an appetizer and were sent the wrong order.  Just not a good way to start out the night.  Other then some shady service, everything else was great!  Loved the beer selection and how it explained in greater detail about each one.  I had the #2 which I would go back for, but can't wait to get back to try the others!

Reviews.Author: Claudia F.
Reviews.Content: We came to DMK for my friend's birthday and we had a good time. In a nutshell here is what I think about DMK.-Burgers were OK but overpriced-Good selection of burgers-Sweet potato fries are addicting-Staff is friendly-No fries included with the burger-If you want fries you have to order a side-Only small brewery beers-Parking can be a pain in the behind-Is always packed for dinner-Place looked clean

Reviews.Author: Tricia L.
Reviews.Content: It is my goal in life to one day sustain myself on just the truffle parmesan fries and sweet potato fries from DMK.  O.M.G.  SOOO AMAZING!The burger was pretty great too.  I had the portabella brie scallion one again; great combo of flavors, though it was a tad salty. The hostess told us the wait was an hour, but we were actually seated before this.  DMK's definitely hoppin' for a Friday night!  You'd be surprised at the number of toddlers and little ones brought in too.  Note to self: consider coming for lunch.Next time, I'm getting a shake or ice cream sammich (cookies for this pulled from the nearby Cookie Bar!).

Reviews.Author: Stephanie H.
Reviews.Content: It's ok. Meh. I've had better burgers for sure. The regular style hamburger I had the first time I went was good, but I wouldn't say it's any better than something you can get at Red Robin.What DMK does have which is b-a-n-a-n-a-s are the parmesan truffle fries. Yummy. I tried the cheedar and scallion fries too but they were awful. The vanilla shake I had was also fantastic, so thick I needed a spoon at one point. On my second visit I tried something different and did the salmon burger. Yuck. I thought it would be a salmon filet put on the bun, instead it was a salmon pattie that looked and tasted like something you would get from Costco.I would go back and try something else, but I may just stick the parmesan truffle fries and shakes.

Reviews.Author: Amy H.
Reviews.Content: Things started out so well at DMK Burger Bar with great company, a fun atmosphere, a great beer list for my friend (and Crispin cider for me), vintage American Gladiators playing on the television behind the bar, and a sweet and friendly hostess.  I was all set to fall in love with DMK, but the food really let me down.We had the fried okra and pickles as an appetizer and we both really liked them.  My lamb burger was underwhelming.  There are so many creative things that you could do with ground lamb...golden raisins, red peppers, spinach, etc.  It was a shame that the best they could come up with was a gyro in the form of a burger.  It was good, but so incredibly average and uninspired.  We also ordered the Wisconsin cheddar and scallion fries, which were covered in that weird cheese sauce that you get with your movie theater nachos.  No bueno!  Don't insult Wisconsin by using neon cheese-ooze and calling it Wisco cheddar.  The only dessert offerings were two types of cookie ice cream sandwiches.  They were good, but again, uninspired.  If you're going to go all Americana with your restaurant theme, you should maybe throw in some apple pie or a bit of variety.  While the food was a bit sad, I could see DMK as a place to grab a few drinks at the bar.  With any luck you can watch Nitro beat up Laser in the Joust.

Reviews.Author: Jeff R.
Reviews.Content: One of the most written about restaurants on my blog, DMK still remains one of the few things I miss from living in Lakeview. The burger bar is still kicking it very well and is always busy - for good reason. Erica and I were craving the tasty options and good beer of DMK so we made the trek from Wicker Park to catch a meal and watch the March Madness final four (yes that's how long ago we went and I still need to blog...). Erica loves the #10 Turkey burger and is always ordered for us to enjoy. I have many favorites but decided to go with a special burger that was delicious (and I forget what was in there, avocados, chorizo, et. al.). The fries are a mandatory addition because they're so good - I like the classic salt & pepper and the sweet potato fries.Even though I'm always interested in eating the burgers, the menu also has some other starters worth getting (if you have the room) as well as four great mac & cheese choices for main dishes. After I've had a great burger with tasty fries and one of the many craft beers offered - the only appropriate way to end the meal is with the cleaver and fun shamrock shake. It even comes with lucky charms cereal as a topping (they even split a single order for two because they are very large).DMK makes my "Current Chicago Favs" for good reason and I hope it stays there for along time since it's my favorite burger restaurant in the city.

Reviews.Author: Katie H.
Reviews.Content: I like a place that doesn't take itself too seriously, that has tongue in cheek menu descriptions, that has staff who actually seem to like their jobs and have fun at them. I like a place that only carries craft/independent beers and that picks a monthly charities to donate to. But above all that I like a place that just has really good food. And DMK does. The burgers are dressed up with toppings like proscuitto and fontina or smoked bacon and cheddar, but the toppings aren't there to hide inferior quality meat. The burgers are on the thin side and easier to eat with all the toppings, but still juicy and delicious. Fries come topped similarly, with truffle cream, blue cheese and bacon or rich cheddar and scallions. There are also salads, sandwiches, and mac n cheese. Good people, good beer, good burgers. What else do you need?

Reviews.Author: Gary C.
Reviews.Content: TGIF. And what a Friday night it was after my visit to DMK. It was a last minute rendezvous with a couple of my friends and we kinda assumed it would be packed, so we were ready to wait. But to our surprise it wasn't terrible for 7PM on a Friday. Our party of three wound up waiting for a whole fifteen minutes.I think other bars and restaurants need to take a few notes from DMK:1.) While Japanese pornography is good and all, Space Jam should be playing on your televisions.2.) Play nothing but "F*@% You" by Cee Lo Green on the speakers.3.) Hire an awesome staff.My friends and I were greeted by a hostess as soon as we stepped into the restaurant/bar. The gal was super friendly and full of smiles. As mentioned, we waited for about fifteen minutes but the hostess checked up on us and let us know the status of our table every few minutes. We were seated and met by our server, who talked about the specials [weekend bison burger, limited-time-only Texas chili burger, sweet potato tots]. She came back and took our drink order. We went with a couple Gumballhead brews and DMK iced tea. Both drinks were great.Onto the food, which was divine. We all ordered the bison burger [the waitress described it so well that we drooled all over the table], which was served with a berry-infused barbecue sauce. Holy bison, this thing tasted like heaven. Besides the burgers, we ordered a full-sized sweet potato tater tots [limited time only!!], a half order of sweet potato fries, and a half order of parmesan truffle fries. All were delicious, but there was something about the tots that tasted so awesome. Maybe because they were tots...Regardless, you really can't go wrong with any of the fries.There were two things that pushed DMK to the five star status: service and free booze. You've already heard about the service. But free beer! While we waited for our table, servers walked around with samples of beer. Additionally, I filled out the survey at the end of our meal and they emailed me the following day...saying that the next beer is on the house. I will, obviously, be returning in the very near future.

Reviews.Author: Sarah L.
Reviews.Content: DMK is probably one of my top burger joints. I had the #10 turkey burger with Smoked Swiss, Tomato, Arugula, Dijonnaise and it was out of this world! I love the buns, so light and fluffy. The turkey burger had great flavor and wasn't dried out at all. The burgers are not overly huge so you do not leave feeling stuffed to the gills. I don't understand the super small plates! Oh well, the yummy burger made up for it. We also had the sweet potato fries with Lemon Tobasco Aioli. The sauce with the fries was amazing. It had a nice kick to it. The deviled eggs were so cute. You get 3 small egg halves with fancy soufflé egg filling. They were so good and a reasonable price. My guy had the #2 Chili-Rubbed Onion Strings, Amish Blue,Spicy Chipotle Ketchup burger. He really enjoyed his as well. DMK has a huge craft beer list, sure to please any beer lover. DMK Burger Bar is a great place to grab a unique burger minus the 2+ hour wait that other popular burger joint has to offer.

Reviews.Author: Keely B.
Reviews.Content: After some encouragement from Emily B in regard to meat options and learning that 25% of all burger sales were going to benefit victims of the earthquake and Haiti, the husband and I decided to venture out.  We arrived fresh from the gym (well, we showered first) and starving.  Unlike many, we were able to be seated immediately.I got the #12, he got the #6.  I subbed turkey for veggie because I desperately needed some protein.  The eggplant could have been sliced more thinly because it was a little overwhelming, so I took it off.  Both burgers disappeared from our table (and into our very satisfied bellies) in about 46 seconds.  Followed swiftly by equal portions of parm/truffle and salt/pepper fries.  The fries were not as good as the burgers, but still tasty.I learned after I had ordered a coke that DMK has house-made sodas, so I indulged in a blood orange soda after I had gotten my caffeine fix.  It was similar to Orange Crush, but better.  The table next to us had cupcakes, and the chocolate peanut butter one looked incredible, but two sodas was enough for me.  Downside?  The place is very modern and chic, but LOUD.  I often judge a place by whether my 92 year old grandma would enjoy it, and she definitely would have had to turn off her hearing aide.  Also, the tables are super-close together, so watch your language!  Your neighbors can hear you!

Reviews.Author: Allison V.
Reviews.Content: Meh. I was seated and I ordered.I ran to the washroom and returned to food on my table....very quick.My bacon was barely there, the meat on my burger was super raw....I was never asked how I wanted it cooked now that I think about it.My fries...sea salt and black pepper had neither, but they did have some green stuff sprinkled on top.I was disappointed by the service and really disappointed by the food. I really wanted to like this place. Oh well.Bike parking on street.

Reviews.Author: Blythe D.
Reviews.Content: DMK serves up perhaps the single best beef burger in the entire city of Chicago (and very possibly many others).  Their beef is grass fed, which may sound a little hokey, but it makes all the difference in the world in terms of taste. They don't cook the burger to order because they know exactly how it should be done. My boyfriend is a well-done kinda guy and was hesitant when I steaming medium-cooked patty showed up, but it was this experience that converted him! He has never gone back to overcooked burgers since.The ingredient list and options are divine! I was told that the head chef traveled the world trying different burgers from different kitchens to get new ideas in terms of what works and what's new. Believe me, it shows.Don't forget to do yourself a favor and try the truffle fries! Absolutely heavenly.Also, the manager, Marina, is quite possibly one of the sweetest and most charming people I've ever come across. We've been in a handful of times, but she always remembers me and comes by my table just to say hello! And she has sent over some tasty goodies on the house, too.Couple a wonderful menu with the best customer service in town and there is no way you'll leave DMK feeling anything less than satisfied!

Reviews.Author: Chuck K.
Reviews.Content: Well I was going to give this place 4 Stars but had to reconsider. Went here on New Years Eve last week for their event. The party was great. They didn't oversell and it wasn't overly crowded. The service was top notch, we never waited for a drink and there was plenty of delicious food including, burgers, fries, BACON POPCORN, and milk shakes. Even though this was an unique event, two things were clear. Their servers are AWESOME and quite attentive and accommodating. The quality of food is good as well. I wouldn't call it the best burger in town but it was certainly an enjoyable burger. Now for the downgrade on the star rating: There is only one restroom for men and women. This is quite a problem and causes lines which is sort of a pain. The the big thing that happened that was a bit disturbing. DMK was advertising their NYE party tickets for $50/$75 depending if you wanted a table or standing room. All advertisement and discussions with staff indicated these prices. Well when they actually charged credit cards for these tickets after the event, they took the liberty to include tip and tax. This was not communicated effectively when purchasing tickets or discussing ticket price with staff members. This kind of turned me sour a bit on this place. But nonetheless, it couldn't hurt you to check out this place if you are in the neighborhood.

Reviews.Author: Sean F.
Reviews.Content: The short review: Kuma's without a 3 hour wait or vampire porn on the walls!The longer review: This has jumped to the top of my list of burger joints in Chicago.  That's right, I enjoyed this more than Kuma's, and I'm not ashamed to admit that.The burger selection is manageable without being limiting, and throws out some interesting combinations.  The #3 with pastrami, gruyere, and remoulade is meaty, salty, a little creamy, and a little tangy all at once.  The #5 not only pays heed to the kid in all of us by putting the potato chips right on the sandwich, but by adding pesto lets me consider the burger as healthy since something green is involved.  The burgers I've tasted have all been cooked right, none over or undercooked.The fries are excellent here.  The Amish Blue and bacon are powerful stuff and not to be trifled with by a delicate palate.  This is a strong blue flavor that will beat the hell out of your tongue and you will love it like a gimp in a leather mask.  The truffle fries are properly truffled without being so drenched in the flavor that it feels cloying or like they were uninspired and went with the "F-it, just cover it in truffle!" approach.Lastly, they had Boylan's Grape Soda there.  This is the grape soda they serve in grape soda heaven.  It is what Grape Ape drinks when he's hanging out at home.  I want to drink this until I'm the same shade as Violet Beauregarde in Willy Wonka.  In a perfect world, they would have wait times close to that of Kuma's.  In MY perfect world I'd have priority entry to get in regardless.  Until that happens, go here and eat burgers.  And drink grape soda.

Reviews.Author: Jeff W.
Reviews.Content: I've been here many times and left underwhelmed. I want to give 3.5 stars, but decided to round up based on my last night's experience. Sunday night at 9pm, no wait. Seems like most of the bad reviews deal with their customer service and wait time. Agitation leads to poor reviews, but the food speaks for itself. Got the Holy Guac-Aioli Burger... Wow this was by far the best burger I've had from DMK. A juicy grass fed burger with chorizo, guacamole, sonoma jack cheese, chipotle aioli, cilantro, and onions.  Loved the chorizo and was not overpowering. Kind of a delicious sloppy joe on top of my burger.I usually get the #4 (with Roasted Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack Cheese, Smoked Bacon)... I'm such a sucker for a fried egg on a burger but every single time I hate how messy this can get. Never again after discovering the Guac-Aioli burger! I HATE that they're $10-$11 for JUST the burger and no sides. I could eat like 3 of these. It's easy to rack up a big bill if you get a burger, fries, beer, milkshake, etc. Fries are decent. The Wisconsin cheddar and scallion is very underwhelming, I would rather get ball park fries to tell you the truth. The Parmesan, Truffle Cream fries are pretty good. The Truffle cream dipping sauce is really good. I prefer the sweet potato fries with lemon tabasco aioli. Atmosphere is great for friends or for a date. The seating is a bit close and we could hear the couple next to us arguing. Kinda weird but it's dark and intimate and the bar is fun. Seems like you're in a garage, but the 1 person bathrooms are not cool.

Reviews.Author: Dave C.
Reviews.Content: A review in 140 characters or less:Pros: No long wait, good beer list, reasonably sized patty. Cons: Burgers were fine but not exciting. You could get better elsewhere. Meh.

Reviews.Author: Michelle L.
Reviews.Content: Not to be a Debbie downer, but I really hated DMK...I'll start with the positive - the fries were amazing.  They get the only star I'm giving to this joint.  The wisconson cheddar fries were deliciously cheesy - but not in the artificial way.  The truffle/parm fries had the perfect hint of truffle oil.  YUM.  Thank goodness the fries were so good as that was all I had for dinner...I ordered the patty melt for my burger.  First off, I was surprised they didn't ask me how I wanted it.  Not a big deal, but surprising.  When the food came, the burgers arrived on a tiny plate, again not a big deal, but presentation was lacking.  My burger looked good, I cut it in half and took a big bite, and much to my dismay we didn't have paper napkins, just cheap towel napkins (that shedded all over my black pants btw), so I wasn't able to discretely spit it out.  It was hands down disgusting.  The sauce that was piled all over the darn thing had the most unpleasant tang to it, it absolutely had no place on a patty melt or a burger.  As far as I was concerned it was a super-tangy sauce sandwich that happened to have a beef patty thrown in there.  I was with a decent size party, so I didn't want to complain to the waitress that my burger was the worst thing I've eaten in a very long time, so I kept my mouth shut.  I kinda figured she would ask me about it since the whole thing was still sitting on my plate, and I would politely tell her...but no, apparently the waitstaff is used to people just eating one bit of their entrée and throwing the rest away??  It was very odd.Plus, my husband didn't like his burger either.  Just didn't taste right with all of the extra ingredients.So DMK, thanks a lot for the long wait just to eat the worst burger I've had in a long time (or ever).

Reviews.Author: Don L.
Reviews.Content: This place has had a lot of hype, and was just average. The burger I had was a #1. Tasty burger, great bun, but not the biggest burger I have eaten. The sweet potato fries were awesome with  lemon Tabasco aioli sauce. I don't understand how you can't offer different cooking temps for burgers? My girlfriend ate the Veggie, #12 I believe.  The patty tasted decent, but I think it was cooked in a deep fryer? My Blood Orange soda was refreshing, but her Mojito sucked. We sat at the bar, in which our bartender was awesome, except she didnt notice that her mojito stayed full the entire time. That would be a sign to me, that there was a problem. Oh, turn down the music from the concert levels would be a plus.

Reviews.Author: Courtney C.
Reviews.Content: Don't go here. This place is awful. At least at Burger King you can order things "your way", and you already expect the burgers to be flimsy and tasteless.I really liked the options of one of the burgers, but can't eat goat cheese, so I asked to substitute the goat cheese for  blue cheese. The waitress was so flabbergasted that I would dane to mess with the "amazing" taste profile their "chef" aka burger-flipper had designed. She said substitutions were not allowed and told me some lame story about how the "chef" created these burgers to a science. Really? Its a burger. Come on.So I ordered just a plain burger with cheddar because apparently that was the amazing taste profile the "chef" had come up with that I could actually eat. It was the most disgusting burger I have ever eaten. And for $8? White Castle does a better job, and their cashiers aren't mouthy and rude like the waitstaff at DMK.Over-priced, disgusting food served by rude and disrespectful staff.

Reviews.Author: Tina P.
Reviews.Content: I ate here on a Sunday evening and had no wait for a table. Previous reviewers mentioned loud music, but that also didn't seem to be a problem.Tip: Sunday after 9 pm is service industry night with 1/2 off burgers. Too bad working in a hospital doesn't constitute as a service industry even though it definitely feels like it!Atmosphere: spacious area with an industrial vibe. cool place to take guests and friends.Food: Burgers are 5 oz patties that are "smushed" down to be a thin patty. Interesting toppings. Nice soft bun. I tried the #2 and the #5 bison burger. Both sounded more appetizing on paper. I wish the burger would have focused more on the meat texture.     Btw, no substitutions allowed on burgers!Sweet potato fries were my favorite part of the meal! Truffle fries were lackluster. Fried pickles tasted fine. The ranch dipping sauce contained dill which was interesting. Deviled eggs were average.Drinks: A few beers on draft, a nice selection of beers in bottles. They also have a cocktail menu. And for those wanting something ETOH free, there's also different flavored sodas and milkshakes available.Price: $8-11 for the burger only. Summary: 3 1/2 stars. I wanted to like this place more with all the rave reviews, but the meat patty here is overshadowed by the toppings.

Reviews.Author: Daniel S.
Reviews.Content: As I walked in the place, my first impression would be that it's a hipster spot. It was busy even for dinner on a Sunday. Luckily I went with one person so we were seated immediately. Everything looked clean and it was not overly loud.I ordered a #4 and shared some parmesan fries. The food was good as the meat was tender and you cannot go wrong with a fried egg AND bacon! I'm not a big fan when it comes to french fries but it was good. It lives up to the hype. The waitress was nice and I do love it when your waitress is attentive and refills your water without having to ask for it. That'll always go far in my books when I'm thinking about leaving a good or bad tip.If I could, i'd give DMK a 4 1/2 stars only because the burger was kind of small. I feel that it was like a 1/4 lb and based on that price, Etno's, which is like 5 minutes away, has a 1/2 lb burger and is around the same price. Overall, I'd go back and try other items on the menu.

Reviews.Author: Julie P.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers and the Parmesan truffle fries were awesome! Just be prepared to wait if going on a weekend.

Reviews.Author: Jennie T.
Reviews.Content: I've been on a search for a good burger place, and I think I may have found it last night when my friends and I came to DMK.
