I do think that that restaurant could turn down the volume of their music a little bit though. I mean, a burger place is loud enough with everyone there, do you really feel the need to make it so loud that I have to practically yell out my dialogues to my friends sitting next to me?Tiff H. and I split our turkey burger #9 and the lamb burger #11. I think I prefer the turkey burger more. The combination of the turkey patty, eggplant and portobello was amazing. I think I could care a little less about the coleslaw on it though because I'm not that fond of the purple cabbage, or any raw cabbage unless it's drenched in nuoc mam (Vietnamese fish sauce) but that wouldn't be good on this burger so nevermind. The lamb burger had just a little too much cheese or vinegar... I couldn't really tell which, but it was too sharp and definitely did not remind me of a gyro as much as most of the Yelpers here described it. With a group of five, we ordered a basket of the regular salt and pepper fries and a basket of the Amish blue cheese and bacon fries. I liked the basket of fries with bits of bacon and blue cheese tossed on top of it. Mmm, delicious!

Reviews.Author: Anne M.
Reviews.Content: Okay DMK Burger Bar, you were good.  I like you.  Also liked the friendly and quick waitstaff and the look/feel of the place - it was hip, but not stuck up.  Also, excellent fun/laid back music. The bounty we tried: parmesan & truffle oil fries sweet potato friescreamy coleslawturkey burger, standard with tomato/greens/cheeseturkey burger, with charred onions, bbq, and cheeseANDpeanut butter/chocolate shakeThe fries were awesome - both kinds, and the sauces were good too.  Though, I'm not a fan of having to order everything a la carte - throw me a bone and give me some fries with my burger, don't make me order a separate order.  Coleslaw was good, not too heavy, and topped with green onion, but only greens in the coleslaw (i missed the colors of carrots and red cabbage).  Burgers were both great, we split them so we tried one of each.  The buns were very soft and fresh, the burger itself was juicy, and toppings were flavorful - yummy.  Finally, though we were stuffed, we split the shake and it was fabulous!  I'm glad we tried it, and by splitting it, the little glasses were the perfect amount.  I prefer Epic Burger's turkey burgers to DMK, but everything we tried here was excellent.  I'll most likely be back, and I'm getting a full shake for myself next time ;-)

Reviews.Author: Rhoda G.
Reviews.Content: I treated my friend out to dinner for her last night in Chicago, so I took her to DMK. The place was jammed pack and happening even for a Monday night., but we didn't wait too long for a table.We were excited to try out their fries, but we found out that they use beef in their oil and my friend who is a vegetarian did not like that. Instead we ordered the onion strings and deviled eggs, which we both enjoyed. For drinks, we got 2 beers on tap - Gumballhead from 3 Floyds and the White from Allgash. Refreshing. Next we got our burgers. I decided to get the bison burger which came with goat cheese, pickled red onion, and blueberry BBQ sauce. I was somewhat disappointed with my burger. The flavors were all there, but I like my beef patties more firmer and thicker. My friend really liked her vegetarian burger and she appreciated that it was homemade and not some frozen patty.  A-OK experience. I wouldn't mind coming back again to try another burger and any of those fries.

Reviews.Author: Al D.
Reviews.Content: I think 3.5 starts is fitting for DMK.It's another over-hyped hamburger stand. Chicago has enough of these.The service was attentive, but we also went early on a Saturday (St. Paddy's day to beat the usual weekend crowds). My Italian-style "Burger of the Month" was pretty bland with barely a dollop of sauce. The prosciutto slice was pretty chintzy and flavorless, too. My burger also was dangerously under-cooked in spots. The fries were good, but nothing amazing. I did enjoy the the creamy cheese with bacon. The parmigiana cheese for for parm fires kinda fell off in a fused mess. Unique beer selection at least.

Reviews.Author: Justin N.
Reviews.Content: Jen rocks! Amazing host and approachable as one of the managers. As far as the food, it definitely lives up to the hype and wait. The aioli selection that is paired with the fries are simply amazing. The burgers had lots of flavor. We finished our meal with the choc/peanut butter milkshakes. That was my highlight of the meal. Definitely going back!Advice: make sure you plan on staying a while to accommodate for the wait and digestion of your food. Thankfully there's a Bar there.

Reviews.Author: Christian H.
Reviews.Content: As a man who loves burgers and I don't mean the greasy crappy McDonald burgers, I have to say that I was very disappointed by DMK Burger Bar. I expected something amazing, but I just found a typical burger with different toppings. Not to say the whole dinner was bad, but it was not that great either. One bad thing was the service. My friend and I had to wait over an hour for a seat. When we finally got a seat, it was at the long community table. I don't mind sitting with others, but the table was so wide that I could hardly hear my friend. And, the music and people were so loud that I was glad to leave. Our server wasn't all the friendly, but at least the hostess was nice. As stated before, the food was just okay. The burger wasn't amazing and the fries were good, but not anything that I couldn't just make at home. Though, the dipping sauce was delicious. I'm not a huge beer drinker, so I'm looking for a beer that I can drink. The beers that I tried didn't do the trick for me. I had to force myself to finish them. The only reason, I'm give this place a three instead of a two is due to the price and the fact that DMK cannot control all the complaints that I spoke about. Would I go here again? Only if someone forced me or I got a gift certificate.

Reviews.Author: Rich T.
Reviews.Content: Loved the sides, but the main attraction was not what I was expecting...in a bad way.  The fries are hauntingly good and I've rarely, if ever had a better mac and cheese at a restaurant.  However, my portabella burger was a bit of a cheap shot, in my opinion.  It was tasty, no doubt, but I tend to eat healthier when I go out, and was annoyed when my seemingly healthy choice arrived deep fried.  A little heads up that the healthiest-seeming option on the menu was going to come to you fried would have been nice.     I would go back for sure, but a little transparency goes a long way with me, as I'm sure it does a lot of people in the "trying to lose weight, but don't want to sacrifice going out" crowd.

Reviews.Author: Christina P.
Reviews.Content: For a girl that loves her stilettos as much as her Puma's, DMK Burger Bar is a love child of all things somewhat slummy, somewhat classy and all around delicious. Head here on a Friday night and you will expect a wait. But, that's part of the fun. Grab a beer, catch up with your crew and prepare to have your taste buds wowed. Order up the cheddar fries, pair it with some wasabi slaw and make the main event any of the burgers. Personally I loved the turkey burger but you can't go wrong. I dig on the bartenders and kind of want whoever created their playlist to make me a mixed tape. From Pete Yorn to Rolling Stones, they play some jams.

Reviews.Author: Jenni Q.
Reviews.Content: We split a #1 burger which came topped with grilled onions, bacon and bbq sauce ($8).  I really liked the bread and the burger itself was really juicy and tasty.  We also got an order of the sea salt and black pepper fries ($4/large) which were just okay - we couldn't really see or taste any of the salt or pepper and the fries could have been a little hotter and fresher.  Definitely not on my list of favorites.  The fried okra and fried dill pickles ($5) were a little too sour for me - I was excited to try my first fried pickle but the breading came off pretty easily so most of the time I was left with just the pickle itself.  Service was great and the atmosphere was very trendy but laidback.  Prices were pretty reasonable except for the sodas - I did not enjoy paying almost $2 for a can - if you are going to charge that price then it should be fountain soda with free refills.  I would probalby come back here again just for the burgers but skip out on the appetizers and drinks.

Reviews.Author: Katie T.
Reviews.Content: I had to try the standard cheese burger #8. I'm an american cheese girl so I got that on it and it came with lettuce, tomato, onions, and mayo. I liked it but I nothing I would rush out to try again...The fries were really good. We tried the standard salt and pepper ones and the sweet potato fries. We also tried the onion strings which were also very good. I had a couple of bites of the other burgers and I liked the toppings on all. Compared to the standard burger they didn't really stand out and they had a great flavor but left you wanting more... I would have to make sure I had fries with these burgers because alone, the flavor needs to be broken up.. make sense????I also had an ice cream sandwich that was made with chocolate cookies and coffee ice cream! I really like it! Next time, I may just ask for a scoop of coffee ice cream because it was so good.

Reviews.Author: Deena D.
Reviews.Content: Veggie fed beef, amazing burger combos, and a wicked nice staff. I've had the lamb burger as well as the burger with portobella and have loved them both. I like the fact how you don't feel guilty after eating it because it's the perfect size. Fries with the truffle dipping sauce are deelish as well as the sweet potatoes. You're best bet is to go in later if you plan on going on the weekend since they get so busy. But hey, why not turn that wait time into a pregame? Especially with a kick ass beer list!

Reviews.Author: Molly L.
Reviews.Content: I'm a little upset with myself that it took me 5-ish times of dining at DMK to come around and write a review in their honor. Better late than never right? I've been on a quest to try the best burger joints in the city of Chicago and DMK is my favorite - thus far. DMK is an all around knock out - from the delicious and perfectly sized burgers which many before have mentioned to their massive/unique beer list (which is greatly appreciated) to their AMAZING staff. Apps/sides - Get the macaroni & cheese #2 w/ baconAnd/or sweeeet potato fires - I can die a happy ladyBurgs - Wide variety for whatever tastes you may have. Whether you're tried and true - I've gotten the one with blue cheese and onion straws 4 out of 5 times. Or out of the box;  they're always pushing the envelope with new tastes and burgers of the month - ie my boyfriend got "I don't remember the clever name" burger which was a beef patty topped with a Chicago style dog....veryyy good. Beer - We get a new one each time. I've never been disappointed. Mostly enlightened.Staff - Ask for DREW. He's the best. Literally. Tip - While this joint is crowded EVERY time, we've been able to squeeze in at the bar, quickly, almost every time with a party of 2.Get outta here. Go.

Reviews.Author: Eugene C.
Reviews.Content: 2.5 because the interior of the place is nice, the service is pretty solid and prompt however I don't see the fuss about the burgers. In a city where designer burgers are trendy as hell DMK's burger reminds me if Steak and Shake became a hip urban chain with booze, this would be the result. If you're going the way of the designer burger joint you need to have the option to cook the burger to the customer's liking. At a steep 8+ per burger the price does not reflect this option unfortunately. The fries are decent but nothing special. You can put a bunch of toppings on it to mask it's mediocrity but I suppose you can do that with pretty much anything.

Reviews.Author: Amanda R.
Reviews.Content: I went here on a Sunday night, it was busy but not packed where you couldn't move or get a table. I waited for about 10 minutes chatting with the hostess about the newly opened restaurant and then our table was ready. They have a good selection of specialty beers on tap, so it was fun to try a new wheat beer. The staff was very knowledgeable and informative for first timers to the burger bar, they are not trying to be the counter, the counter is a build your own burger place, this is not. The burgers are cooked all the way through which I was scared of at first because I like my burgers med rare but it was juice and not over cooked or dry. The burgers are a decent size so you can actually finish it and try other appetizers like the mac and cheese which was good or the truffle or sweet potato fries. The sweet potato fries were my favorite, I also had the burger with the portabello mushrooms and chives. It was good, I will go back to this place to try the other burgers, it was a nicely decorated and would be fun to hang out and have a cocktail or beer after a nice meal. It would be a nice jump off point to a Friday or Saturday night. I sat in the front and it was a nice view and great seating in the big red booth but I was a little chilly because it was right by the door, as I walked to the back of the restaurant to go to the bathroom I noticed it was warmer, so that might affect your seating preference.

Reviews.Author: Rachel R.
Reviews.Content: Deviled Eggs as a side dish? OMG SUPER AWESOME.however, as much as I love the food at DMK (well, everything but the burgers, I have yet to actually eat a burger there) ... it just feels like they made the seating as uncomfortable as possible.  The tables are way too close to each other for in the winter (no coat check? ew) and the tall tables are just, difficult for eating. but the bar is nice, and everyone is friendly, and DEVILED EGGS.but, minus one star because of the cramped eating space.

Reviews.Author: Tabitha G.
Reviews.Content: Yum, yum, give me some!  You know a place is going to be good when you have a hard time deciding not only what to eat, but to drink.  My friend and I went to DMK on a Friday night, roughly about 6:45pm, and easily got a table.  The place wasn't packed yet and there were plenty of open tables.  Immediately as we sat down, the first thing I noticed was the plethora of beer options on their menu.  Even if you're not a beer drinking, I'm pretty sure you'll find something you like.  It took us a while to figure out a beer to order because of the large selection, but our waitress' recommendation is what sold us on what we got.Choosing a burger was no different.  There were so many fantastic options but couldn't just pin point one.  It was a game time decision for me between the veggie burger and a chili rubbed burger.  After close to 10 minutes of figuring out what to get I ended up with the veggie burger and it was the best decision.  Even if you're not a veggie burger fan, this is the one that would convince you otherwise.  It's a bold statement, but I am confident when I say that it was probably one of the, if not only, best veggie burgers I've ever had.  The patty was so crisp and the toppings were icing on the cake.  However, the piece de resistance?....Their bun.  It's fantastic and so incredibly soft.  It really makes the burger.The sides were also fantastic.  We had fried okra and pickles, which were scrumptious, and also ordered the parmesan and truffle cream fries.  Our waitress was so fantastic that she also sent over some cheddar fries as well.  The small sides were the perfect size and totally innexpensive at $2/each.  Every bite of our meal was fantastic.I would be remisced to not say how wonderful our waitress was.  She not only was extremely patient with how slow it took us to order, but she had great recommendations - and was very knowledgeable.  Not to mention that she also sent us a fries. :)Lastly, as if I wasn't already sold on this place.  One thing I love is that their beef is grassfed - which is a big deal for me.  Considering that all their burgers are $8/each, serving grassfed beef just makes it that much better.  I'm particular about my meats by trying to eat organic and DMK just makes it that easy.I highly recommend this place - I just can't wait to try their other burgers.

Reviews.Author: Shang S.
Reviews.Content: I've been pretty excited for DMK and ordered #4 burger based on the below reviews. I definitely think that the grass fed beef is worth it, the texture just feels more defined, flavorful. I was a little too engrossed in my conversation to be able to fully judge the burger. It's certainly not the best burger I've eaten, I can't even customize it, and being the klutz I am, the egg exploded over my plate as I bit into it (augh no the yolk!) However, I thoroughly did enjoy the burger, there aren't too many complaints about it from my end. It's not the world's biggest burger, but it is satisfying for the average person.We also got the truffle fries. I wish the fries didn't taste as dry as they did, I think that the fries could have been better, but the truffle mayo, oh yeah, that was totally worth it.I didn't quite like my DMK Manhattan, but I think that's mostly due to personal preference.Also, one thing I didn't like about DMK are the cloth napkins that didn't feel so... sturdy to me. They reminded me of my mother's kitchen towelettes that she'd use to wipe the countertop.The service was prompt, friendly. We went on a Tuesday night and even then there were many people in this place, so I can't imagine how crowded it must be during the weekend.

Reviews.Author: Brian S.
Reviews.Content: I am not particularly a strict burger connoisseur but I was rather disappointed with DMK.. I got the #2, The patty was pretty pathetic if you're as hungry as a bear. However if you suffer from bulimia or wish to eat a make believe burger it might satisfy you. The thing I thought was silly was the separate order of fries for $2-$4 depending on size. Ok... So my burger was $8 to begin with now I have to push it up to $10-$12 to feel somewhat full. The beer selection is decent and the service is ok. I don't understand how this place is considered to be one of Chicago's finest for burgers.I'll give you a recommendation for a solid burger at an appropriate cost...  The Big Square  @ Square Bar on Belmont.  $10 and worth every cent.

Reviews.Author: k e.
Reviews.Content: The good: great burgers, great beer selection, great friesThe bad: every time I've been there, it's super crowded and incredibly loud

Reviews.Author: Deepika T.
Reviews.Content: DMK was a great burger place.. Be prepared to wait, unless you come in at around 10pm over the weekends. Much can be said about that great bread, the sweet potato fries with the lime tabasco aioli, and the veggie grain burger. But they're pretty particular about not giving you the veggie burger on anything but their #12. A big downer, if you ask me. They do have a #13 which is a fried crispy portabello version, umm, not the best or worst I've had. My meat-eating friends did love their beef versions though. Be prepared to fork over mega bucks for the alcoholic beverages though. The desserts were very unimpressive: I can do cookie-ice cream sandwiches myself, thank you. Also, don't drive over, parking in the neighborhood is a serious pain!

Reviews.Author: Gary R.
Reviews.Content: I have to say, this place was good as hell! I had a lunch there on a Saturday afternoon, and you might be astonished to learn I purchased a cheeseburger. This wasn't your run of the mill McDonald's burger, oh no. It contained Pesto, Prosciutto, and meat. McDonald's doesn't have anything like that at their stores.They also put salt and vinegar chips on the burger, which was awesome as heck. The fries were good, and really aren't all fries good? The burger also came with a little Italian flag. I think it was meant to make the customers feel like they were in Florence. Unfortunately, they were in Chicago instead. I went with a small child who when asked about her Mac and Cheese stated "Its yummy." Small children are always saying shit like that. My only real issue with this place is that I want to call it the BTK burger bar. I suppose it might as well be called that in the cow community, but in the human community that is a worse connotation. The price was pretty reasonable as well. I didn't feel like a giant held me upside down and shook all the change from my pockets after the meal, so that was a plus. In addition- if that were to have happened, I'd likely have barfed. Not because the food wasn't good, but rather because I was being held upside down by a giant.

Reviews.Author: sheena r.
Reviews.Content: i like the idea of this place, more than i like their burgers. BUT, i do like their burgers. =] the fact that they use grass fed beef for their burgers is what wins me over. their sweet potato fries are tasty, and it may have something to do with the aioli. i will be back to try their truffle fries and shakes.

Reviews.Author: Ellen D.
Reviews.Content: Eh, this place was not as good as I was hoping it would be. I guess I thought it would be similar to The Counter where you can build your own burger, but it's not... Oh, and there are no substitutions which kind of blows. The fries are really good and the turkey burger wasn't bad either. I guess I was just expecting more. Overall, not bad, but not amazing.

Reviews.Author: Matt H.
Reviews.Content: I try every burger joint that rolls through town and this is without question my favorite. I keep my burger simple and usually go with the No. 8. The DMK 8 reminds me of an uppity single layer 5 Guys burger and I consider that to be a compliment.DMK has really good fries and onion strings for sides. I haven't tried some of the more rich menu items (bleu cheese and bacon burgers/fries) but I plan on going back to try them all eventually.Killer beer list but not an overly complicated menu and once you get the hang of it, it all makes sense.Wish there was one in my W Loop hood.

Reviews.Author: Sarah L.
Reviews.Content: I've been here twice and both times received superb service. Once on an extremely busy Friday night the host offered to move us to a new table after we were sat next to an an extra loud speaking patron...not DMK's fault at all. Then on top of it they gave us a complimentary mac and cheese. Well above expectations! On top of this, great beer selection.  They even had the rare game of thrones edition of ommegang beer on tap. Finally, of course, burgers had unique toppings,  cooked perfectly, and flavorful. If you're debating between DMK and Kumas,  pick DMK.

Reviews.Author: Jaime G.
Reviews.Content: Really good burger place. In a cluttered part of town (lakeview) but def worth coming. I've got to admit, the thing that attracted me the most about this place is the beer selection. Wide variety of beer from all over the country. On tap and in bottles.  I tried the great lakes porter and the left hand milk stout.Good for kids too. They gave my son a little cup of fries as soon as we walked in. Great service all around and everyone is really friendly. A little loud - it's more of a bar that restaurant.Burgers are super good. We tried the green chili burger and the lamb burger. Both excellent. Have to admit that the green chili burger is really hot so not for the faint at heart. I really like the burger build. They let the burger meat and the fine ingredients shine because the bum is so soft and light. Love that. They get 5 stars for the combination of beer selection, excellent service, and burgers.

Reviews.Author: Rick M.
Reviews.Content: OH EM GEE! DEE EM KAY IS THE BEST.I came here on the 18th of April (my birthday) and cannot believe I haven't written a review yet. This place is AWESOME.I am so serious, these are some of the best burgers in the Chicagoland area that I have ever tasted. The service is great and their Cokes with Cherry grenadine were just sweet enough it made me super happy (yeah I had to add that). The decoration of the place was nice. Black and red always go nicely together. There's a big bar in the center of the restaurant and it was pretty busy even during a weekday. Yes, the place is loud as many have said, but it didn't detract from our experience at all. It's loud because it's busy. It's busy because it's good. See??Anyway, looking at their menu, I was completely flabbergasted - and when I use big words on Yelp, you know it's truly amazing.Their burger combinations were great and they seriously had something for everyone - even vegetarians!!! I'm not a vegetarian, though, and stuck with some delicious, juicy, decadent meaty-meat meat. When we were waiting for our burgers to come out, we were given free deviled-eggs which were seriously fantastic. We were going to order them anyway, so it was a nice little birthday surprise. When the food came, both of us were blown away by how delicious it was and how much food came on our plates. Oh yeah and the Wisconsin cheese fries were freakin' great. If I remember correctly, we were both stunned by the good price and exceptional quality of the food we ordered.Surprised we haven't been back since. After dissecting our last experience, I can absolutely promise you we will be back, again, and again. Absolutely delicious food, good service, fantastic prices. All the right ingredients in a place to make you WANT to keep coming back.

Reviews.Author: Juliana R.
Reviews.Content: Our server CARLY was great! When we arrived it was busy and she was just on top of it! Besides that...this place is OVERRATED, go to Kuma's instead! The seating here is AWKWARD, I am *definitely* not into the last supper kind of tables! And the burgers were the size of a burger you get from Culvers! And they DON'T include fries..what??!! Stupid. No thx.

Reviews.Author: nancy r.
Reviews.Content: Best deal in town during Industry night on Sundays!I ordered their local beer Goose Island Matilda.Along with the Patty Melt and added a fried egg, which blew the burger out of ranks.When I recieved my burger, it was perfectly cooked medium and super juicy with a nice over easy egg which ran down my burger after the first bite. It was love at first bite and I didn't want to finish it because after I was done I wanted another one. =\Along with the burger I ordered the parm cheese fries that were great too. No ketchup! Served with a super yummy aoli that I forget because it was done in mere minutes.Had an order of deviled eggs too which were BOMB. Super simple with a a nIce little kick -a bit of cayenne kick.Super impressed with the food.The service was okay, the server messed up a couple of times and apologized.We got our deviled eggs a bit late as well as a wrong order of fries but the manager stopped by to only give us FREE dessert. I was so full and stuck in a food coma that I could only eat several bites.Our bill afterwards was DIRT cheap with the Industry discount. So if you or any of your friends work in the Industry, stop by. Great food!

Reviews.Author: Kevin W.
Reviews.Content: We had a bunch of burgers that were not meat and they were fantastic. I had the veggie burger, and the Big Salad. Yummy. My mom had the portebello mushroom burger which is flash fried in panko. Really good. Fries are great. Try the basis salt and pepper with the homemade spicy ketchup. Also, Wisconsin Cheddar and scallion. Really good. Great beer list. Half Acre is always a hit. Only complaint is the noise level in this place. It is insane due to the construction. They need to add some sound buffers or rugs. Service was phenomenal. Servers are young, bright and cheery.

Reviews.Author: Brian E.
Reviews.Content: I think Yelp's 3 star rating describes DMK pretty well. "A-OK". It's not mindblowing but it's not bad.I decided to do some research on our visit to Chicago and DMK seemed to get pretty high remarks from the various comments sections that I viewed. So it was planned to end our trip with a late afternoon stop here before heading back.Ah Chicago how your parking is atrocious. Not a knock against DMK but this city needs Jetpacks.We timed it perfectly. While DMK was packed at around 4:45 a spot cleared up for my small group straight away. We were seated and soon there after we had the attention of our waitress whos name eludes me. She did a great job from beginning to end and really made us feel welcome.It's really a mixed bag here. It's rather loud and pretty dim. Reviews citing the use of cell phones to read menus makes sense. On the plus side Top Gun was being played on the TVs!When you look over the menu they definitely have some creative burger ideas. I kept it simple and ordered the #1 which was aged cheddar, smoked bacon, charred balsamic red onions and Rufus Teague's BBQ sauce.The burger itself done properly but the balsamic was overwhelming. It really sounded like it had potential but the execution wasn't there. I could almost swear there was marmite in there. The fries are a side note really. It's fries.Everyone else in my group enjoyed their meals. Though similar comments were made about the #1 by a friend. If i am in the area again they do deserve another visit. Though Chicago seems to have plenty of other choices when it comes to burgers.  DMK comes in at slightly above average.

Reviews.Author: Samantha L.
Reviews.Content: It's a little hard to review, because I split a fifth of vodka with a friend shortly before coming here. Yes, I mean we finished the bottle. Aka, I was SUPER drunk when I got here. Hopefully my drunk taste buds weren't too deceiving.Their truffle fries were DELICIOUS, and I was craving them throughout the following day. Their burger with egg and peppers on it was fairly good, but too much flour was on the bun, and it comes with NO sides, despite being $8-9. I had some special mac and cheese with bacon and grilled onions that was also delicious.The combination of all the great greasy food and the waiter keeping up with refilling my water magically prevented me from getting sick or hungover, so I am grateful! All my friends were surprised I wasn't hungover the next day, so thank you DMK! I will try you again sober, and hopefully like you just as much!

Reviews.Author: Cara T.
Reviews.Content: I have to go back here at least 13 more times, because I only had one burger and I need to try every other burger/sandwich on DMK's menu. I wanted to try the Salmon Burger, but they were sold out. Not a problem..I would eat any of those burgers they put in front of me. I ended up with the Bison burger. The combinations on this burger are out of this world. You can taste each flavor in each bite. Mind blowing. As a table, we shared the onion strings and the Parmesan fries.  That truffle cream is to die for. Just give me a spoon... DMK is guaranteed my business for at least 13 more trips. For sure. And probably long after that...

Reviews.Author: Andy S.
Reviews.Content: Going into DMK, I wasn't sure what to expect.  Bits and pieces of information about it have been leaking out for the past several months, all contributing to a fair bit of hype from Timeout to The New York Times.  For some reason I hadn't quite bought into the hype, but at the same time was really looking forward to going, as I can't turn down a good burger.And you know what?  I didn't turn down a good burger, I ate it right up.  I had a burger with NY Pastrami, Grand Cru Gruyere Cheese, Sauerkraut, Leroy's Remoulade, and it was delicious, and so were the sweet potato fries (some of the best I've had in the city).  At $10 for the burger and fries combo, I was pleasantly surprised.  So why the two stars?  The service and the drinks.  Our server, while nice, belied a fair bit of passive-aggressiveness with us, and was a more than a little pushy regarding drinks (It actually seemed the only time she paid us any attention was to ask if we wanted more drinks, beyond that the service was slow and not very attentive).  Additionally, the man who I can only assume was the manager was unpleasant in his own way, constantly glaring over at us as we ate and talked, with a look that was unmistakable for "hurry up and leave," while coming over at regular intervals to move our unused seats to other tables, seemingly randomly (granted shortly thereafter the place did start to pick up, but his behavior was odd, uncomfortable, and unfriendly).Onto the drinks, oh my.  While I suppose DMK stems from some nicer places, I still expect drinks to be a bit more reasonable when you're operating a "burger bar."  Please don't offer me a $12 bar-created cocktail that is fairly weak and nothing save for average...for the same price you could go to one of several bars around Chicago that have incredible mixologists, making amazing original drinks.  And while I don't drink beer (allergies!), my friends scoffed at the beer prices for the most part, not a good sign.I REALLY wanted to have a great experience at DMK, and a REALLY hate writing overly negative reviews when nothing overly horribly occurred, but sadly DMK has found its way into rarefied air in terms of my reviews.  I intend to go back though, and if things are any different, I'll be sure to update.

Reviews.Author: Jon E.
Reviews.Content: As trendy Chicago burger joints go, I really enjoy DMK as a riposte to the Kumas love. For starters their angle is different, and executed well along that axis. They use grass-fed beef which is pricier, easier to dry out, and less forgiving of massive patties - yet the burgers themselves are always excellent. The menu is neater, rather limited but has a full range to satisfy most appetites. Except maybe vegetarian, but c'mon why would a vegetarian expect that much out of a burger joint? The fried sides are great, as are the spread of burger toppings. Some have said they don't care for the bread much, but I personally enjoy the rolls they use.  There's a french place I loved in San Francisco that did stellar burgers this way, same bread - so I gotta give props to DMK for continuing that. For those who insist on standard (aka boring) ketchup in bottles/lettuce/tomato/onion burgers, than DMK is not for you. If size of portions/sandwich is your primary motivation for rating food highly, then again, DMK is not for you. I think DMK has successfully created an alternative burger bar experience that doesn't have to compete with Kumas. I enjoy both, but for totally different reasons.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey W.
Reviews.Content: BEST VEGGIE BURGER IN CHICAGO! I love DMK for it's veggie burgers and greek salads.  BEST i've had in chicago and recommend this to any vegetarian!! NOTE VEGETARIANS - do not eat the (amazing looking) french fries, they are cooked in our animal friend's fat :(

Reviews.Author: Steve T.
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what I was going to think of DMK... yet another restaurant trying to cash in on the 'burger bar' craze as of late.  I've been a few times and had been waiting to review because I was curious of consistency and overall experience.  It's pretty good, but I don't ever find myself thinking, wow, I want a burger, I'm going to go to DMK.  There are a lot of other restaurants with just as many, good options for a burger.  It has an upbeat atmosphere, but can be pretty loud.  The proximity of some of the tables to the door can be troublesomely cold during winter, and there isn't much waiting space inside for those lurking for tables other than the bar.  I also find there is an odd amount of children in the restaurant in the early evening which was a bit shocking for me, but I guess it could have just been the luck of the draw for me during the few times I've been.  Nothing against kids, but the tables are sometimes shared with your neighbors (think dining european style with a large table of 12 that can be split up with multiple seating arrangements immediately next to each other)... and unless you had been geared up for dining with the family next to you, your evening might have become a little more interesting/annoying.  Overall it's an OK experience and you won't hate your burger.  The parmesan fries are somewhat addicting and will probably make you fat if you keep eating them every time you come in and don't follow them up with 2 hours of cardio.  The beer list is pretty large, and has a lot of unique options.  Though, I'm not a beer drinker and would much rather prefer a vat of Belvedere, so I can't vouch for the selection being great but my friends tell me it's quite good.

Reviews.Author: Livvy O.
Reviews.Content: This burger has to be one of the best burgers I've had. I loved the idea of the fried egg....When I heard they put fried egg on their burgers I was intrigued by it and couldn't wait to try it! It was brilliant! The only con about this place is that it is extremely loud...both people and music and of course parking is always a hassle in this area. But, I would definitely go back! WAY better than Kumas Corner (Over-rated and pretentious crowd)! This is a much more mixed crowd.

Reviews.Author: Ehrin S.
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to like this place. I did. Truly. And I hate to say the previous because it's so cliche. But, it is what it is, and I just can't give this place more than two stars. Honestly, I've had much much better, much less expensive burgers (Epic Burger, for one). I was expecting a thick, juicy patty with top-shelf "toppings", but what I got was just a mediocre sized burger on a way too thick bun. It was a little dry, a bit too covered in the condiment, and just disappointing. Plus sides? Very nice space, nice bar, plenty of flat screens to catch a game, great sides (truffle fries are tasty), and nice beer selection. Other than that, if you're in the mood for a great burger, try Kuma's Corner.

Reviews.Author: Riz A.
Reviews.Content: I'm only giving this place 3 stars because the drinks were strong , i love the neighborhood, and i really liked the simple bar type decor. the food however, not all that great. the parmesan truffle fries were good....the burgers, ehh. i hate to be one of the people that always compares restaurants - but this place holds no flame to kuma's....i mean, actually, i  think rock bottom has better burgers, honestly. 8 bucks for a gourmet burger isn't that bad of a price...but the burger just wasn't all that great....it had some gross cheese that was way overpowering and just overtook the taste of the meat....the portions are pretty tiny as well...for 12 bucks ( cost of burger, toppings and fries...) i expect a bigger burger than a big mac.not really worth a return, there are much better burger spots in this town.

Reviews.Author: Francis K.
Reviews.Content: A burger bar? Say wha? Okay seriously a burger bar?Good thing it works otherwise it is too easy to mock this place. For starters what on earth does DMK stand for anyway? Oh the food, you ask? The burger list is impressive. I will have to return because a lamb burger was beckoning but started "easy" by choosing their #1 instead. This was an Aged Cheddar, Smoked Bacon, Charred Balsamic Red Onions (took a pass on the BBQ Sauce) burger was was out of this world good. The burger bar also has an equally impressive beer menu. The location of the bar is in the high rent part of Chicago which means it is accompanied by the inevitable above 90% hipster quotient. I cannot hold that against them but consider this fair warning.

Reviews.Author: Donna C.
Reviews.Content: All burgers at DMK are grassfed so it can be a little pricier than what people normally expect out of the size of those burgers. I don't have a problem with that since a grassfed burger simply tastes BETTER. They have 8 options (well, one is actually "coming soon"). I ordered #5 and husband had the #8. #5 comes with brie and portabella and #8 is a straight up classic. I have to say that having tried both, you need to experience #8 for a true taste of the burger. It's simple deliciousness at its best without all the fancy cheeses and savoury toppings. Of course, we love that it was made with love!Our waitress was great and we loved the variety of beers they have on tap. Allagash wheat was awesome.We'll be back!

Reviews.Author: Erica S.
Reviews.Content: I moved. (That's where I've been guys!) I moved on the first day of an internship and also had class. Because I moved on this day, I had to "hire out" my boyfriend and his brother to move me. Which they were ok with until it actually happened. Then they were mad. I needed to make it up to them.Enter DMK Burger Bar.My boyfriend loves burgers-he hates steak, but he loves burgers. His brother is a vegetarian. I've wanted to try DMK Burger Bar. I live around the corner. This. was. the. time.We walked in pretty late for a Wednesday and were seated right away. We wanted water-and nothing else at this point, so we asked for water. It was filled up continuously throughout the night. We were never without water, and it was great.The food was also great. I got the #3-anytime you put pastrami on a burger, I"m there. I didn't share, it was so good. And grass fed! My boyfriend got the #2 and also didn't share. He ate it slowly, savoring it. That's a signal. The brother got the vegetarian burger, which he then proclaimed "the best he's ever eaten," which made me feel good, because I was paying and because I'm glad he had food to eat.We also got two kinds of fries-truffle and wisconsin cheddar and scallion. They were both good and because we shared, I didn't feel like such a fat ass eating them.What really did it for me, and this is not a lie, was the fried okra and pickles. Really, it was the pickles. In the herb ranch. Did I mention the fried pickles? Blow your mind amazing; I will go back to eat those over and over.4 stars cause I'm a broke ass graduate school ho, but if I wasn't, I'd eat all of this as much as I could.

Reviews.Author: Jane L.
Reviews.Content: A for effort.B for the onion rings.C for the taste.D for the loud atmosphere.F for the fact that the waitress didn't taste all the items in the menu.  Isn't that part of training?

Reviews.Author: Samantha H.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic lunch or dinner spot! I had the veggie burger, something I NEVER order over red meat, but I absolutely loved it! We also ordered four different types of fries for the table and they were all incredible - parm, sweet potato, and cheddar fries are all must haves! The only bad thing was no free refills on soda and they could have been more watchful of our empty water glasses - we were all parched because we loved the food so much. I will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Author: Dina G.
Reviews.Content: BISON BURGER- what's a bison?........google it!Sweet potato fries with cheese dip and a fat american burger..hats off to america. I salute thee. I mean, why is it so hard to find stuff like this at home? Im either eating at the wrong joints or blind and missing the good stuff. This place is small but full of flavour, full of soul and drink! A great hang out! Just opposite the VIC theatre, what more can you ask for? Ever since I left the place, Ive craved the burger, just to feel the burger touch my lips and take in its scrumptious self.... =( someone take me back please.

Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: I finally fell to the hype that surrounds DMK Burger Bar. I'm convinced they are good friends to 90% of food bloggers. The place is cool, has the hipster beer menu that's becoming a must for local stops. I don't mind communal tables that much but maybe the issues is that you're in the deep end of pretentious conversations, such as but not limited to the guy next to me wishing his pregnant wife has a boy. To the food. The menu is very compelling but falls short. I ordered the #4 and the the 1 piece of bacon broken into 3 doesn't make it a bacon burger. Using the freshest bread for buns is great but when you're a 'high end' burger joint why do you smash a burger like a Steak and Shake? The burger's dryness rivals that of the artisan bread they tout. This is the 3rd burger I've eaten this week with essentially the same ingredients and I'd rank it third. Monk's on Lake St was better, hell even Bar Louie. Why? The burgers there are juicy and they ask how I'd want my food cooked. DMK Burger bar falls into the - been there, done that category of Chicago burger joints.

Reviews.Author: Anh N.
Reviews.Content: I came here with 3 other people, so each of us ordered different things in order to try them all. We got the parmesan truffle fries and the Wisconsin cheese fries, which was on the house! Both were good, but not very memorable to me. I personally prefer crispy fries, but they got a bit soft under all the toppings.  It's also a huge serving, so I would order it in a big group!We tried the Bison burger, the bacon fried egg burger, and the lamb burger.  All were great because of their soft and savory patties.  The lamb burger especially tastes like a greek gyro.  The burgers are all $10 give or take, so it's a bit on the pricey side. The BEST thing to get here though, is the espresso shake! Rich in coffee flavors with little bits of chocolate crushed in it.  Probably the best shake ever--at $5 a pop, it's pricey, but it's a must try.

Reviews.Author: Cam M.
Reviews.Content: Twas a great date destination!  Location/AtmosphereThe atmosphere was nice.  I liked the vibe of the joint, all of the staff members were extremely friendly-they seem to enjoy their jobs, food was great, beer was awesome, and it seemed to work. The location-I don't get to that neighborhood much, so it was great.  Trendy/rich enough to feel safe after several drinks, but wasn't so wreaking of hipsters that I need to walk around with a sign that says, "TAKE A SHOWER".  Food/DrinksBurgersI got a #1 (aged cheddar, charred balsamic red onions, Smoked Bacon, and Rufus Tegaue's BBQ Sauce-description c/o their site) with an added fried egg.  I know that sounds odd, but it works.  They use grass-fed beef, and I never realized the difference that that makes.  My grandpa raises black angus cattle (aka awesome beef cattle) and this burger rivals the fresh from the butcher beef.  I forget what my date ordered...it looked good, but between the conversation and the food/drinks, I don't remember that part.  FriesWe got an order of Amish Blue & Smoked Bacon fries for the table (large order).  We didn't finish half of them.  They were great, the fries are fairly standard seasoned fries, but the toppings were great.  DrinksBeer....hmmmm, beer.  Their beer list is nice.  I had 2 of Victory's Golden Monkey.  The last time I had it was back in Virginia where it was on tap.  It was equally good out of the bottle.  If I lived closer, I could see myself going there just to sample the variety of beers. So, I liked it.  I plan on going back (bringing the same company along).

Reviews.Author: Julie B.
Reviews.Content: I like this place and would definitely come here again.  I came on a thursday night around 8 so it was pretty busy.  We had to wait about 20 minutes for a table but we got 2 seats at the bar so it wasn't bad.Ordered the deviled eggs (delish) and I had the burger with green chilis and a fried egg (yum). My dinner companion had the blue cheese burger which he refused to share.  They have different fries to choose from and the ones we shared were great.I left off a star because the ambience is a little weak.  The lighting is weird along with the decor. Is it trying to be a sports bar? Trendy? Upscale?  I definitely do not get it, but enjoyed the food so I will take that sacrifice.

Reviews.Author: Heather M.
Reviews.Content: Kinda pricey, good burgers but nothing I can't live without.  I've tried the #1 and the #2 very pleased, but I was expecting more considering it was a burger bar.  There is a must try: the wasabi coleslaw....omg.....amazing

Reviews.Author: Nicole H.
Reviews.Content: I live on the Southside but I get around. I have no problem traveling to try new spots. I actually enjoy exploring. However, it saddens me when they aren't really worth the trip but hey, I guess that's part of the experience. I came here on a Thursday night and it was packed. That's not a problem for me. It is a problem when you are directly in my face ignoring me. How many people are going to look at me and walk off? Seriously?!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!  When I finally was able to order, I decided on a patty melt, sweet potato fries and one of the house sodas. I really enjoyed the soda. My food tasted okay but the service was definitely lacking. I probably wouldn't return.

Reviews.Author: Donnie B.
Reviews.Content: I am giving this place 2 stars - not for quality of food, but for quality of comfort and service. I accompanied my girlrfiend there (we are neighbors of the joint) and were told it'd be a 45 minute wait on a Tuesday at 8pm. Once I gave a "let's go somewhere else" the host said "Actually, let me check the back." Sure enough we were immediately seated - great service right? Wrong. The seating in the place is like a high school cafeteria. You can hear a person's conversation from three tables down. I felt cramped and distracted. When a server walks by with orders, s/he has to squeeze in-between tables. I watched a server dump some water on a customer because it was so hard for her to get by. I don't blame the server, I blame the owners for designing it so poorly. DMK would be unable to accomodate any obese couple from eating here (discrimination?) Lastly, It took us 20 minutes for 2 glasses of water (alcohol came right away) and 25 minutes to get a server's attention to get our check. We weren't the only one's waiting on service, I noticed many heads looking around for their servers. This is poor because there were over 15 people working at the time. Food - Awesome! Really enjoyed the portion sizes and the tastes. I enjoyed the number 1 and did not feel too full.But the hype should die down. Just because some trendy rich restaurant owners open up a new one, doesn't mean it's gonna be the best. I say re-do the entire set up, give people privacy, and we will have a 5 star restaurant!

Reviews.Author: Matt K.
Reviews.Content: Visited DMK in the first couple days of their hard opening. The interior is a bit dark with most of the light coming from a few plasmas on the wall. There are a couple high top bar tables and some standard 4 top tables in the rear. We were greeted and our name was taken for a table. Perfect time to check out the bar. Love the whiskey and micro heavy beer options. It takes guts to do it in this area.We were seated at a low 2 top in the rear of the restaurant. The tables are way too close together. Literally 4 inches apart. They really need to sacrifice a few tabs to increase the comfort level back there. As for the food, hit and miss. Calling yourself a burger bar in a burger loving city like Chicago is risky business if you don't have a great burger. Their burger was not great. The beef portion was on the small side, and the flour based bun can't compete with the pretzel rolls of competitors. Very average at best. The mac and cheese was better than the burger and the fries were the stand out item. We had the sweet potato fires. They were very good although the lemon aioli was an odd and unsuccessful pairing. I realize the place just opened, but if I go back it will be through a friends request and not my own.  Really wanted to love it, but many better burger options exist.

Reviews.Author: Pat D.
Reviews.Content: Full disclosure: I am a vegetarian.This place has the best veggie burger in Chicago, hands down. Anyone who says otherwise is a fool. Great beer selection too.

Reviews.Author: Roxanne P.
Reviews.Content: BRING AIR PLUGS!  I saw this burger joint on Diners, Drive-Ins and Dives and have wanted to check it out for months.  On the program they had a salmon burger stacked high and looked very appetizing to me.Wasn't worth the wait.  skinny, dry, and fishy.But that is not why it received the low rating. The low rating was issued because the sound system was set to eleven!   The music and the people screaming were so loud I think the staff must need to read lips.  Forget about having any conversation with your friends.  The hostess stands up front with a clipboard and takes your name but you need to keep going back to check with her.  It was odd seating too. My friends I was with liked their food - bison burger and regular beef burger.  The onion rings are the string onion rings.Put it this way, bait and switch.  It was not at all like they showed on DDD :(

Reviews.Author: Jason W.
Reviews.Content: I hit up burger bar last night with a few people and came away pleasantly surprised, but with a few minor disappointments.The wait was only 45 minutes for a saturday night which is pretty good for a new restaurant, especially one that has been hyped/marketed as much as this one. We started off with 4 different beers and all were really nice craft beers and the overall selection is very good.For our meal we ordered 4 small orders of french fries so we could try the different flavors.  We all decided that the sweet potato fries won with the salt and pepper fries coming in a close second.  The parmesan with truffle oil were good as well, but the bleu cheese were disappointing.I had the #1 and was very pleased with the burger, it was flavorful, cooked well, on the amount of toppings were just enough.  They portions are just right as well, not too big, not too small.My friends had a #4 and a #8 and all came away happy as well.We all decided that we should try desert and the cupcakes were very underwhelming.  The carrot cake was moist, but the frosting was lacking in flavor, and the Chocolate PB frosting cupcake was very dry.  So I'd say skip dessert there, you can do better.The high point for me though was the cocktail that I  ordered while eating.  I had the Death and Company's Whirling Tiger and it is amazing.  The base of this drink is bourbon, which I'm not a huge fan of, but this drink may start changing my mind since it was so smooth I could have had a few more easily.I'm sure people are going to want to compare this place to Kuma's Corner because they're both burger joints.  But I'd avoid that comparison since they each have a distinct vibe and point of view that they are going for. Overall I'd like to give DMK a 3.5 but can't so I'm going to go with a 3 to start and see if it stay's consistent.  If it does, then a 4 will be in it's future.

Reviews.Author: Ryan K.
Reviews.Content: I order the #1 and was satisfied, not the best burger I've had but it was above average.  The people I was with ordered the Veggie burger (quite bad, she didn't finish it because it tasted like it was a breaded deep-fried mess), and I tasted my friend's turkey burger which I thought was good but he didn't. The sweet potato fries were meaty and good, better than Rock It.  The mac & cheese was too oily.Overall I think it is a good addition to the scene.  The beer selection is good and the atmosphere of a bar is cool.  Burgers go great with beer.

Reviews.Author: Kimberly S.
Reviews.Content: I really don't like burgers but I actually enjoy them at this place. My favorite is the lamb burger, but I have even tried the beef ones and they're great. They have an awesome late night menu where you can get a few sliders to try. The bacon and blue cheese fries are incredible. They also have a nice beer selection.

Reviews.Author: Patrick G.
Reviews.Content: I have been here a few times now and can conclude that this is a very solid 4 star (pushing 5) restaurant. One can definitely make a case that this is the best burger in the city and should at least be considered to be in the "best of" category. I really enjoy the blue cheese, fried onion strings, and chipotle ketchup burger. The beer selection is very good and they try to focus on having local (Chicago & Midwest) beers on tap. The fries are very good all around. I personally like the parmesan and truffle fries the best followed by the sweet potato fries and then finally the blue cheese and bacon fries.This place can get a bit busy and the wait can be longer than an hour but you can usually hop on the bar and eat if there's only two in the party. A number of the tables are like communal seating so if you don't want to be at a table with other people this place might turn you off. Also slight minus points for having 1 person at a time bathrooms for such a large place. The location is really close to the Wellington brown line stop so it should be pretty easy for most people to go to. So go get yourself a yummy burger at DMK.

Reviews.Author: Diane G.
Reviews.Content: The first time I came here, they were SOLD OUT of the House Veggie & Grain Burger. I had the Crispy Portobello burger, which was good but I've had so many portobello burgers that they've lost all meaning to me. But...I came back just to try the HOUSE VEGGIE & GRAIN BURGER (can you tell I'm excited?) and it was WORTH THE WAIT! Soo moist, flavorful (smothered in pesto mayo klsdfjsd), and the bread had that perfect crispy factor! one of my top veggie burgers for sure. Kind of pricey at $8 +tax, but baby girl deserves a treat every once in awhile. Sweet potato fries were good but you really can't screw up swt potato fries. And if you did I'd judge you.Pumpkin ale also a win. *Warning to vegetarians/vegans: their fries are cooked in beef fat :( I know, I shed a tear when I found out, too.

Reviews.Author: Kaitlin M.
Reviews.Content: Well I had high hopes for this new age burger bar and they miserably failed me in a couple of areas. To start off I will state that they did not fail in the food area so I might be back to give the rest of the place a second shot. A friend and I wanted to get some unhealthy grub after a couple of hours of drinking down the street. DMK seemed to be perfect because the menu had vegan options for myself and good old beef burgers for my friend! Not to mention we could keep our high class beer drinking going! We walked in and were immediately told that we could sit anywhere we liked. So we planted ourselves at a large communal table across from the bar. There were a couple of different groups already sitting at the opposite end of the table. I think we waited almost 20 min before anyone acknowledged our presence. When our server finally did she took our drink orders and dropped off menus. Probably another 20 min later we actually got our beers and were able to order. I ordered the homemade veggie patty with no cheese and sweet potato fries. The server did ask if I was vegan and confirmed that they wouldn't put butter on the bun either after I told her yes!!! This was a very exciting surprise to me! My friend ordered his fish burger and cheddar fries. Our food came out in a decent amount of time and we both thoroughly enjoyed it. My burger was well made with some great spicy flavor to it. Unfortunately I was told by the server about halfway through my fries that they were cooked in beef oil/ fat. Totally annoyed I stopped eating them and knew I would pay the price for her lack of information transfer later. My friend enjoyed his entire meal... especially the cheese fries. Sadly we still walked out of the place frustrated that burgers and beer took so long... It took us hunting down our server to actually get our check too. Like I said... might be back to give the service another chance.

Reviews.Author: Steven W.
Reviews.Content: Pastrami with a full burger? I'd like to think I inception-ed it with my own dreams. We came here because their fries were featured as one of the "best fries in America," so we actually decided get more plates of fries than the number of people we had. Unfortunately, they were relatively underwhelming. While they were seasoned well and had a good texture, it was nothing spectacular. Certainly nothing to rave about nor should it be featured on any best of lists...The burgers, however, were prepared to perfection. The ingredients were portioned really well, and my mouth is watering just thinking about them. Prepare for a long wait, and grab a couple beers while oogling other patrons' food.

Reviews.Author: Vivian H.
Reviews.Content: Severely disappointed. We stopped by around 10pm and the place was packed.. we got seated after a little wait and a peek into its neighbor Fish Bar (also packed). We tried the salmon burger -- kinda bland for such a yummy-sounding dish. The hatch green chili -- better but still underwhelming.. had a much more delicious version at Umami. Burgers were also kinda small. Parmesean/truffle fries were good though, and the lemon meringue special shake was to-die-for.As for the scene, obviously the type of hoppin' place that's packed with burger-mongers at 10pm, dim lighting, exclusively hipster chick staff. Which is fun and stuff but doesn't make up for disappointing food.

Reviews.Author: Grey W.
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good burger place. They place a lot of emphasis on toppings, and they do not disappoint. They come up with some exceptionally creative burgers. I got the #4 with Hatch Green Chile. It is really hard to find good green chile outside of the southwest, and DMK did well. Also a super good beer selection.The burgers are all cooked the same (medium I believe). This is a HUGE downside. Also, the amount of meat is small compared to similar places (The Butcher and the Burger, the (now closed) Counter). There are better burgers in Chicago, but it is hard to go wrong here.It was somewhat crowded when I came here, but that was after a Cub's day game, and we were seated really quickly which was very nice!

Reviews.Author: Eric V.
Reviews.Content: The burgers are ok, but it's the fries and shakes that bring me back.  Burger wise, I usually get the #2 sans BBQ sauce.  Definitely not as beefy or juicy as the better burgers I've had, perhaps due in part to their smaller 5 oz. patty.  I appreciate their use of environmentally responsible grass-fed beef, but I just can't say it's in the ballpark of my top burger options.  Whereas I find the burgers a little lacking, the fries are straight up redonkulous.  Perfectly crisp exteriors, pillowy soft interiors, and a tasty dipping sauce to complement your fry of choice.  I'm partial to the sweet potato fries with lemon tabasco aioli, and my wifey can't get enough of the parmesan and truffle cream.  To wash down your meal you could easily choose from their extensive beer list, but I personally can't leave without a milkshake.  The chocolate shake is the best I've had in recent memory, and the peanut butter shake is like drinking down icy cold reese's pieces candy.  As many people have mentioned, they don't take reservations and wait times can get rather lengthy.  The wife and I were able to grab bar seats pretty easily on two separate occasions, so I'll just consider myself lucky for that.  I don't think the burgers merit a long wait, but I'll gladly nosh on the sidewalk with my bag of fries and shake to go.

Reviews.Author: Joel M.
Reviews.Content: I heard some great buzz about this place and decided to check it out.  The location is perfect - the heart of Lakeview and steps away from the Wellington CTA stop.    The atmosphere is modern, open, and up-beat.  We came in on a Sunday night and were seated within 10 minutes.  The service was solid, out waiter was friendly and recommended some good dishes.  We ended up going with the # 1 (Aged Cheddar, Smoked Bacon, Charred Balsamic Red Onions, Rufus Teague's BBQ Sauce) and the # 10 (Grass-Fed Lamb / Sheep's Milk Feta, Olive Tapenade, Tomato & Onion Salad, Tzatziki) burgers.  Both were great - the meat, bun, toppings, everything worked together and made a perfect sandwich.  My only compliant might be that it was a little small - I honestly could have devoured another one immediately after I finished my first burger.We had 2 sides - the parmesan fries (with truffle cream) and deep fried pickles and okra (with a side of some sort of ranch).  The sauces might have been the best part - the truffle cream was AMAZING.  I also ordered a side of chipotle ketchup which was a great dipping sauce for the burgers and fries.  Definitely order a couple beers when you are here - we got sodas and soon realized there weren't free refills.  This was probably our mistake - a beer would have complimented the burger perfectly.  Otherwise, this was an awesome dinner for around $35 dollars - I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Jessica K.
Reviews.Content: I live right around the corner from DMK, and have been wanting to try it for about five months now...aka when I got here.  I decided to get dinner to go (HIGHLY RECOMMEND because this place is insanely packed all the time, it seems), and well...it wasn't bad, but...Let me start by saying I don't eat beef.  I've been slowly un-vegetarianing, but I opted for the crispy portabello burger instead of the turkey, veggie or salmon options.  I love mushrooms, and all of the ingredients sounded pretty rad.  But for some reason, my brain didn't put two & two together and equate "crispy" with "FRIED".Lightly fried, I guess, really?  But friend nontheless.  I hoped grilled.  No.  The sandwich got pretty soggy about halfway through, too.  But it was pretty decent up until the middle.  Nothing really to write home about, though.It wasn't a bad burger, but this is a place where I think I'll read their menu, then go to the store and figure out how to make my own.  The fries were really great.  I got the Wisconsin cheddar and scallion stuff on the side (that's how it comes with take away) and barely used that because it was too salty for my liking.The closeness in proximity (and longing for a milkshake) is what will cause me to go back here, but probably not until 2012, what with the delicious holiday time upon us.

Reviews.Author: Marisa A.
Reviews.Content: I checked out DMK over the weekend for lunch. It was a lot more of a dark, lounge-y type place than I was expecting. I love me some dark wood and all, but it was kind of gloomy on such a beautiful summer day. Anyways, my boyfriend and I walked in and there was a guy standing at a dining table to our left. He looked at us for a few seconds, and we looked at him. He finally asked us how many, and that's when we realized he was the host. Mmmkay. Our waitress was much friendlier and professional. She explained the menu to us, made some recommendations, always had our drinks filled, and the food got to us super fast. I got the #6 burger, which was topped with marinated portobellos, blue brie, grilled scallions, and dijonnaise. My boyfriend got the #8, which comes with all of your basic burger toppings. I was pleasantly surprised at the patty-- thin, uneven, dare I say... like Steak 'n Shake's patties. I love the hulk patties at Kuma's but I really feel like that's comparing apples and oranges. The plus side to DMK's patties is that they make eating a whole burger feasible for me (please don't judge me. I normally have the eating habits of a morbidly obese man but something about burgers fill me up fast). My burger was pretty dang awesome. I'm fan of the ciabatta bun. As a rule, I love everything that was piled on it. It was also SUPER buttery and juicy, and when is buttery bad? Well, unfortunately I think that the butter took the salt content over the top. Mushrooms were salty, brie was super salty, and the dijonnaise was salty. The burger was delicious, yes, but it was making my mouth pucker it was so salty. My boyfriend said his was a little less salty. We also got the salt and pepper fries, which were tasty.Would I do it again? Probably. The host needs to check his attitude and I'd probably order something with more veggies on it to soak up the salt, but I see the potential for a great burger.

Reviews.Author: Patricia K.
Reviews.Content: Between raindrops, David R and I scooted over to DMK for a post-comedy show dinner on Friday night.  The place was close to full but certainly not "packed."  I'm unsure if this is typical or if we lucked out due to the weather report but we were seated right away.I ordered the #1, loaded with bbq sauce, bacon and balsamic onions.  It was delicious!  It was hard to put it down, even when I was totally full!  We split an order of fries, which I know David enjoyed more than I did.  I thought that while they were decent, they didn't possess quite the flair I was expecting.  I also tried a forkful of the cole slaw which I thought was a bit boring.The service was quick and friendly.  However, within a ten minute period of time, our waitress asked if we needed anything four times.  It seemed a bit overboard to me.The place itself is not at all what I expected - in a good way.  They are certainly playing to a specific audience - feeding high end burgers in an upscale, trendy bar.  In fact, walking in, it feels far more like a bar than a restaurant.Overall, I enjoyed my experience and would consider a return visit.

Reviews.Author: Andrew S.
Reviews.Content: Good. Very good. Great even in some ways. But......A burger bar may be chic nowadays, but even then the best burgers are the most unpresumptuous ones most of the time. I did not have anything close to a "great" burger by my standards. Give me In'N'Out anyday over their foodie'd up burgers...Again, kudos for what they make and the ingredients they use but there's nothing to write home about here...

Reviews.Author: Angelique R.
Reviews.Content: After looking at one too many burger ads in the Red Eye left me with an urge to get my burger one. Being a vegetarian, I am left with only a few options. Kuma's just takes too damn long to get into, so I went for something new and Googled "Best Veggie Burger in Chicago". Lo and behold a new restaurant.The wait wasn't too bad for a Saturday, and though it took longer than usual for our server to come over, she was all apologies and gave us free deviled eggs :)The burgers were delish! The fries were crispy! The soda was yum! Why 3 stars? It was just really loud and dark, which was kind of a bummer. Not quite sure I'm return. Maybe a seat by the window would make a difference? Or maybe not a Saturday?

Reviews.Author: Alejandro T.
Reviews.Content: Holy wow. Do yourself a favor and try one of 'em burgers. Patties so juicy and yummy. Pure deliciousness. Only thing I would argue is their prices to quantity ratio. You certainly pay a lot for one hell of a delicious tiny burger. That said, I think you should still come out and try it...even writing a review about it makes me wanna go back and eat one.Remember this place is also a bar, with a good brew that changes depending the day. Great for beer lovers or for a much desired escape from the usual suspects at your local pub.Their service was stellar when I was there, and I have no reason to believe it would ever be considered bad. Both the hostess and bartender were super friendly, and we even got an appetizer on the house because it was our first time there, oh yeah! Good stuff.

Reviews.Author: B.D. K.
Reviews.Content: I really liked DMK. No complaints. Burger was awesome, and definitely not as expensive as Counter Burger. I would say they could only make it better by dishing out fries with the burgers, but then they would probably just charge $10 for a burger making it the same price as everywhere else. In any case, a side of sweet potato fries is only $2 and my girl and I shared it and it was a decent amount if you're not ravenous. I did see the $4 plate of fries and didn't think that was worth it. They should up the fry count on the bigger plate a little.  Great burgers, looks like they've got awesome drinks (which I really need to go back and check out), the sweet potato fries were A+++ (exactly how they should always be made), and prices are better than I expected - hope they keep it that way!

Reviews.Author: kiley w.
Reviews.Content: After seeing some pictures on a friends blog and reading Johnny T's review, I just had to give this place a try myself.I got here right before they were about to close, but the girls still welcomed me with opened arms.I had a #4, it had a fried egg ontop. I never had a egg in my burger but I loved it!!! The bun was the softest bun I ever had, my teeth sinked right into it. The burger was cooked to perfection.I also had a order of Wisconsin cheddar and scallion fries which was really good. But after eating the burger I was pretty full and didn't finish the fries. But I do want to try their fried pickles and okra next time.I also had their homemade lemonade soda which was pretty good and not overly sweet.Service was one of the best. I will definitely return.

Reviews.Author: Francesca L.
Reviews.Content: Finally got to have a burger at DMK after hearing tons of good reviews from friends. I am really not picky but this place was just ok to me. I was really impressed with the prices. I felt that $8.00 for a grass fed beef burger is good. However, I thought the burger was super greasy and really thin. The fries was also just ok. I wasn't a big fan of the noise level. My friend and I were screaming to one another across the table and still lost out on much on the conversation. With the tv(s) on and the music so loud, it just felt like there was way too much going on. It took away from being able to enjoy the food and the company. Why not let people enjoy their beers and burgers and chat with their friends at the same time?

Reviews.Author: Brett P.
Reviews.Content: What I had: Salmon burger with sweet potato fries.The Good:                - The patty was delicious, fresh, and handmade.                - The sauces and accompanying condiments were especially good. Notably, chipotle ketchup, truffle creme, and lemon tobasco aioli.                - Many of the other burgers looked delicious as well.                - Prices were fairly reasonable.The Bad:               - The sweet potato fries were just not that great. They were served rather cold and didn't seem to have any appreciable flavor by themselves.               -It was very loud, making it pretty difficult to talk without yelling.               -Where we were sitting, it was so dark I had a little trouble seeing what I was eating.               -The waitress dumped half my plate of fries on the table and didn't really seem to care.Bottom line:                 -Was it the best burger I've ever had? No. Was it good? Yes.                       I wouldn't mind going back to try some of the other burgers, but I'm not in a hurry.

Reviews.Author: Lala S.
Reviews.Content: I can't imagine that I haven't written a review for DMK, but Yelp is telling me that I haven't. So here goes...This place is pretty amazing. Unlike some other burger joints in the city these burgers are a lot easier to handle and the chances of finishing your burger in one sitting is very likely. Don't get me wrong, I still love Kuma's but DMK is also spectacular in it's own way.I recommend their take on the Big Mac, the name escapes me, but you can't miss it. The Bison burger is also exceptional and while the Green Chile Cheeseburger is very good, it just didn't pack in the heat like I had expected.The fries here are also delicious. You can't go wrong with Truffle Cream and hey, if the 86 the frites at MK, just mosey on over here and get your fix.They also have some tasty cocktails. I like that they aren't overly sweet.

Reviews.Author: Taylor D.
Reviews.Content: DMK is a must-try burger joint in Chicago.Try the #4. It has green chili, bacon, jack cheese, and a friend egg. The bun is just perfect. It is incredibly soft, but it holds up. The beef is grass-fed cow and you can really tell it is high quality meat. Do not expect to get a huge 10oz burger. They are the perfect size to full you up with a side of fries.The salt and pepper fries are really good, but only if they come out piping hot. I have got them when they were sitting out for some time and they were not good at all.The parmesan truffle fries were just okay. I would stick with the original or sweet potato fries.Also, the mac and cheese is pretty good for a burger joint! The only real complaint about this place is the service from the waitstaff. They are always hanging out by the service area chit-chatting and they take a long time to get to your table. I was sitting for about 6 minutes before anyone even came up. Also, there really is no host/hostess so it can be kind of confusing and awkward when you walk in.On a positive note, the food does come out fast thanks to the runners.One of my favorite burger places in Chicago.PS: ask for the rewards card if you like it and want to come back. It can also be used next door at Fish Bar.

Reviews.Author: Christa R.
Reviews.Content: Really, Really good. I would recommend everything I had. Definitely try the deep fried okra pickles. Surprisingly delicious and relatively light. I tried the Crispin Apple Cider which was really refreshing. Perfect for an end of summer into the fall type drink. And ofcourse, I had the best patty melt of my life. It was a little small and a very loud.Went in for lunch on a Friday and there were plenty of seats at the bar which is just fine with me. Service was decent, prices....a little high.

Reviews.Author: Pamela P.
Reviews.Content: Amazing. Out of this world. Hands down, the best.The veggie burger is just beyond words. I used to think that Bandera had the best veggie burgers. Nope. I was wrong. Must, must, must eat here if you love yourself some veggie burgers.The sweet potato fries disappeared in mere minutes. The deviled egg appetizer was sinful and delicious at the same time.Will most certainly be back many times over.

Reviews.Author: AJ P.
Reviews.Content: Seriously, this is one of the best burgers in the city. Do not come here expecting a gigantic, too big to hold burger - but expect gourmet ingredients and terrific flavor. The parmesan truffle fries are OUT OF THIS WORLD. So good! If only we could petition for the old #6 to come back - the portabella and brie was my favorite!

Reviews.Author: Ann C.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here twice now for lunch.  No wait. Good service.  Attentive.I've sampled 4 of the burgers and haven't been disappointed yet.They don't ask how you want your burger cooked because the patties they use are too thin to do so.  That's fine by me because I like a thin patty.  They have a decent beer selection and there were blue cheese olives in my dirty martini.  I love the fact that they have deviled eggs on the menu.  You really don't see that anywhere.  The fries are awesome and the small portion is big enough for two people.  I personally love the cheddar fries and truffle fries the best.  If you like burgers, this place won't disappoint.

Reviews.Author: Annie G.
Reviews.Content: There are some things that, no matter how much you hate the neighborhood and 90% of this place's clientele, you just can't deny. And here they are: 1. hot sauce -- DMK makes there own hot sauce; I wish they sold it, but our waitress had to tell us they didn't....the red stuff...it's spicy and smokey and enduring. Hell yes. I put this on everything I got. 2. Fried pickles. That needs no further explanation. 3. Simple, wonderful menu -- all burgers $8. All are turkey-burger-capable -- music to my ears. 4. Fabulous ingredients. 5. Awesome, unexpected beer selection (though a lacking wine-by-the-glass selection) 6. Fries that make you want to sleep with them the first time they meet your eyes. Our server, who's name I wish I could recall, was wonderful. So helpful, knowledgeable about their beers, and really, really great. They'd probably get A-OK, but I thought she was the tops...

Reviews.Author: Elle M.
Reviews.Content: I'd really like to give DMK 2.5 stars, but I'll round up on this one. Three of us got there around 5pm on a Sunday and the place was pretty empty (perfect timing on our part- the rush started shortly thereafter). Service was friendly and prompt and I liked the menu.
