The burgers are inventive and there's a good variety of different preparations and meats.The fries were great. Very happy with those. But to be honest, I was pretty underwhelmed by my burger. The first thing that made me nervous was when our server didn't ask us how we wanted our burger done. I like my burgers rare to medium rare, end of story. If you're going to serve me a well done burger I'll just skip it. They cook all the burgers past medium. As it turns out, it wasn't much of a problem because the toppings completely mask the taste of the meat anyway. It was sort of just a filler to add height. It was thin and dry and kind of boring. However- the buns were lovely and fresh and their drink selection is very cool. I had the Death & Company Whirling Tiger. Delicious. And the prices are completely reasonable. The three of us ate and drank very well for under $100. I'd probably go back, but I wouldn't have a burger. Maybe next time I'll try the mac & cheese.

Reviews.Author: Andrew M.
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed the burger, the room was nice as well, waited over a hour for a table then another 30 minutes for the food, put my wife in a really good mood, I love when she's pissed......I can live with waiting as long as I have some cocktails to play with, I did, my problem is  they forgot about us and we watched 5 groups of people eat and leave before we were even seated, Incuding a self centered fat couple that thought it was funny sitting real fast as seats opened before us (maybe Daley is right about the gun thingy, kuz Eyeda shot that bitch) the staff was very apologetic but also very young and inexperienced, I was expecting more from a world renowned chef, but hey they gave us a round of drinks and some fries, aology accepted, we'll be back, saw a few more burgers that sounded good.That is all, Andy

Reviews.Author: caroline k.
Reviews.Content: Showed up ~7pm on Friday night expecting to have an incredible wait -but had got there just before the rush.  Cool, trendy, but casual, good atmosphere as a bar and resto.  We chose to sit at the bar rather than elbow-to-elbow at one of the communcal tables. I was craving a burger, and this place just hit the spot.  We had the # 1 beef burger (cheddar, bacon, onions, bbq sauce), # 12 lamb burger (tsaziki/Greek style), sweet potato fries w/ tobasco aioli, truffle fries with parmesan, and all were great.  The burger menu had plenty of creative beef, lamb, turkey, and even veggie burger options (many also included blue cheese), and several varieties of fries.    Would definitely come back to try the rest of the menu.

Reviews.Author: Erin V.
Reviews.Content: I am a vegetarian and I absolutely love veggie burgers. Yeah,fine, I know they are not really "burgers". They're patties. Non-meat. Made from veggies and grain and blah blah blah. I get it. But I like them so stop arguing with me about what they are called. And I like burger bars that serve them even more. DMK's take on a veg burger (yup, i said it) is pretty stellar. While I tend to prefer mine a little firmer than their creation, the taste is definitely delicious and unique. It has a good blend of spices that doesn't try to trick you into thinking you're eating a burger (vegetarians, you know what I mean), It's its own tasty sandwich and I was entirely pleased.Now for my one issue: This place is praised for their sweet potato fries. My roommate legitimately has a semi-serious relationship with them. Half the reason I went was for these dropped-from-heaven treats. But guess what their secret to awesomeness is: beef fat. or bacon fat. or some sort of meat, non vegetarian friendly fat. I can't remember exactly. So I had to settle for onion strings. Which were good. Don't get me wrong. But after all the hype and build up of these colossal fries that I'd added to my bucket list, I couldn't even eat them. (ok, all you non vegetarian people who will argue my wording there: i COULD eat them but because of my life style choice i CHOSE not to.......... same thing. whatever.)So, what I am saying is: meat eaters, go! duh. vegetarians, you should go too. and I won't judge what you decide to eat while you are there. wanna try a sweet potato fry? go to. chances are the veggie burgers are made one the same grill as the meaty ones anyway.

Reviews.Author: Richard A.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Friday for lunch.  We ordered two burgers:#1 (Aged Cheedar, Smoked Bacon, Charred Balsamic Red Onions, BBQ Sauce) #6 (Marinated Portobello, Blue Brie, Scallions, Dijonnaise) Also had a order of the fries with Parmesan and Truffle Cream.The fries were amazing!  The truffle cream tastes awesome.My wife had the #6 and enjoyed it very much.  As for my burger, I felt the meat patty which should be the star of the show failed to impress.  The patty itself is thin and not very tasty.  I also felt the BBQ sauce overpowered the burger.

Reviews.Author: laela l.
Reviews.Content: Judging from the menu, this place looked schnazzy and sounded absolutely delicious. Unique meats, deep-fried pickles, and beer. The outside and interior really makes this place look like something special. We expected a wait (group of 6 on a Saturday night, i know), and it was fine since there are TVs. And we waited, and waited....20-40 minutes we were told, by the waitress who looked so out of place with Forever 21 gear (in a sports bar). The young people were out in full force - I didn't see a soul who looked like they were over 30. Nearly 2 hours later, we got to sit down. The menu and style of this place really made me think the food would be amazing, especially because there are so many reviews. The burgers were pretty bland and extremely flimsy. Really, it's just a burger on a plate. Call me a presentation lover, but it didn't look that awesome. We all had a variety of burgers - bison, lamb, etc..- and we all agreed the burgers didn't stand out above others in the city. If you want a true burger experience, there's this place called Kuma's.I get it, we're at a bar...a bar. So it's cut and dry, nothing fancy. But they shell out this image that it's fancy, and the burgers weren't. I will give points on the fries though. Those were great. This is a place you go to watch a game, meet with friends, and drink...maybe order fries, and only a burger when you're trashed. Seriously, DMK, market yourself as a trendy sports bar.

Reviews.Author: Mike K.
Reviews.Content: We were here on a Saturday afternoon and the wait was very long - longer than we were quoted. But they play great music and the hostess kept us updated.The beer list is wonderful, but I really wanted a chocolate shake so I asked for one with a shot of Maker's Mark. Get this! Their shakes are nicely thick without an overbearing chocolate richness, which lets the bourbon shine through. Burgers, except for specials, are only $9, but you have to get fries separately. We had the truffle fries which were the best I've ever had. The truffle was not cloying or fake-tasting, the fries were crispy on the outside and pillowy in the center, and the sauce was understated. The deviled eggs were way too salty. The burgers were delicious and well-cooked. The only one I would not get was (I believe) the turkey burger, which my friend had. It had so many strong flavors that my mouth and tongue hurt. My other friend had the portobello burger which she really enjoyed. Next time I want to try the bison burger.Stick with the classics, because DMK does them well - burgers, fries, and shakes.

Reviews.Author: Grace G.
Reviews.Content: Good burgers, fun atmosphere, and a good craft beer selection. Service was fine, took a while to get our check but it was very busy so we understood the delay.

Reviews.Author: Mike P.
Reviews.Content: The ball and chain and I went here on a random Sunday to satisfy a burger craving.Burgers: 4 star.  I actually got a turkey burger, which goes against my entire philosophy on burgers.  It totally exceeded expectations.  Juicy, flavorful and hit the spot. Frankly, the burger was a bit small, but in this case it was ok as I wasn't looking for a pound of meat.Fries: exceptional sweet potato fries - crunchy, most likely twice fried. The regular fries were crunchy and well seasoned as well.Drinks - we had the house made colas, which were delicious.  Frankly, I was very unimpressed with the beer list. My will is VERY weak if there's a good tap list.  It speaks volumes that I didn't order anything.Service - well, meh. We sat for 20 minutes before our waitress greeted us. During our meal, she never asked how our food was.  Another waitress had to come by to drop the check, after we waited for 10 minutes.  I know the restaurant is relatively new and figuring our their service process, but come on now.  There are basic elements of food service missing that were missing, and I got the feeling other customers were noticing it as well.  It's obvious they are hiring eye candy that lack developed service skills.Overall, the food and pricing was very good.  Service, tap list, atmosphere, meh.  Doubt I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Jessica B.
Reviews.Content: Went for the first time today and I absolutely know I will go back.To start, it has a great beer list and atmosphere with communal and bar seating, along with individual tables. I had the #4 beef burger with fried egg, bacon and jack cheese, along with the Parmesan truffle fries and was in heaven. The portion size was perfect and I didn't feel ridiculously full after.The burger list is pretty eclectic and has interesting pairings, including teasing a few coming up. I already have my eye on the upcoming prosciutto burger (no more details provided) and I am dying to try the sweet potato fries, a weakness for me.I heard they have good milkshakes but I didn't have room for one and the side of deviled eggs are supposed to be great too. I cannot wait to try them.Plus, the food prices were really reasonable too for the great ingredients and presentation. I was shocked that my burger was only $8. Be aware though that seating fills up fast and it's notoriously crowded, especially on weekends. I arrived just after noon (it opens at 11) and got a seat but by the time I left at 12:30, it was completely full. But I loved my burger and fries and I cannot wait to go back and share with friends.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer S.
Reviews.Content: Where to begin!?! To start bartenders Lauren and Drew are absolutely amazing! We popped in on a Sunday night -expecting to have to hit the road because the wait was so long- but were thrilled to find 4 open bar stools in front of a huge flat screen tv! (We really wanted to watch USA Hockey! Big win for them and a big culinary win for us!)Our foursome tried the whole gamut from beef to turkey to lamb and even a friend egg on top of a traditional beef. Everyone was delighted by the taste and portion size.No. 2 - Chili-Rubbed Onion Strings, Great Hill Blue, Marinated Tomatoes, Chipotle KetchupNo. 10 - Grass-Fed Lamb / Sheep's Milk Feta, Olive Tapenade, Tomato & Onion Salad, TzatzikiWere two of the big hits!Not to mention the awesome parmesan and sweet potato fries and DLish bacon mac and cheese.As I mentioned the service was exceptional... Drew and Lauren treated us like royalty... giving us little tastes of specialty beers and cocktails and introducing us to the "to die for" ice cream sandwiches. If you have room go for the double chocolate espresso sandwich. It might change your life.Another MAJOR bonus... they pick a charity each month and donate a portion of the proceeds... DON'T MISS MARCH- They are donating to our own Chicago Public Schools!Hit them up in March, your stomach and CPS teachers and students will appreciate it!

Reviews.Author: Luis L.
Reviews.Content: I am definitely a new fan of this place. I REALLY like beef and I REALLY like a good burger, so this place was calling my name!One of my favorite burger places in the city is Hamburger Mary's, not because their burgers are particularly high quality, but because they're so creatively prepared. DMK, however, gives H. Mary's a run for its money, without having to go all out with their preparation (or the showmanship of female impersonators... or should I say show-womanship?)The beef at DMK is from GRASS FED cows, and if you're a more sophisticated meat eater, you might notice the difference in taste. It's distinctly more earthy, but also a bit richer or bolder. They don't season it much, which is a big distinction between their burgers and the burgers at H. Mary's. It's also something I really like! (I should add that the way H. Mary's prepare their burgers DOES actually enhance, as oppose to mask, the flavor of the meat, but it's great to get such good flavor, as you do at DMK, from the beef itself!)I believe fries are generally overrated, but also, I simply don't like fried food very much (anymore). I didn't order any fries, but I did order a greek salad, which was perfect.BTW, my burger was the number 4. It had on it some roasted green chiles (from a place called Hatch, in New Mexico), a fried farm egg, sonoma jack cheese, and two thickish, yet short, strips of bacon.I may not like fried food, but I will have a SMALL bite of bacon. These two strips of bacon, however, were a bit too thick for my liking. I guess if I were to have eaten the bacon on my burger, it would have been fine. But I got the bacon on the side, and only ate a SMALL bite off one piece. That was MORE than enough.I had a couple of glasses of a Pinot Noir too, which was very juicy, and went fine with my burger.The interior of DMK is set up like a bar; tables along the wall and a bar with stools, and a seating large area in the back, nicely arranged in a lofty, and loud, space with TVs near the bar and plenty of room to walk throughout. The environment is good mix of casual and stylish. Also, the staff was VERY pleasant, polite, and prompt.Excellent experience on my first try. I'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Author: Matthew G.
Reviews.Content: I was first introduced to DMK in the summer of 2010. Coming from the suburbs, the chances of finding a gourmet burger spot is slim to none. After hearing about DMK a few friends and I decided to try it out late one night after spending the day in the city. We got there a little past dinner rush, but it was surprisingly empty, even the bar area. First off, great service. Workers are super friendly and chill; no, not the fake friendly like you get at Chick-fil-A either.Secondly, the fries are legit. We started out with a small order of Sea Salt & Black Pepper fries, just to make sure their most basic fries were worth it. ON POINT. Then we upped the ante to the Sweet Potato Fries with Lemon Tobasco Aioli. Again, ON POINT. Talk about the perfect combo of sweet, sour, with a slight touch of spiciness. My personal favorite was the Parmesan fries with Truffle Cream.  DMK does not fake the funk with the fries.Now, for the few times that I've been to DMK (about 6-8 times), I've gotten a burger on about 4 of those occasions and I've had the same burger every time. It is the #3: NY Pastrami, French Gruyere, Sauerkraut, and Leroy's Remoulade with, of course, the grass-fed beef patty. Flavor. Flavor. Flavor. And Pastrami AND a beefy patty? YES. The option to add a fried egg, adding to the flavor and juiciness of the burger, is always welcome. I can't say much about the other burgers, of which there are 8 more options with a beef patty and 5 more that are either turkey, lamb, salmon or veggie, but I do hear the Portobellow (#13) is just as flavorful as any beef patty burger. Mind you, the burgers are not "Kuma" sized but they're not sliders either. I'd say a perfect, medium sized burger, and defintely not over/underwhelming.After stuffing yourself with burgers and fries, what would you consider washing all that down with? Water? Sure. A coke? Why not? But there, down at the very bottom of the menu were 3 words that made my first DMK experience as memorable as it ever was: PEANUT. BUTTER. SHAKE. 3 words so simple, yet so interesting. What was so special about the PB shake, you may ask. All I can say is, imagine PB Cap'n Crunch, but in the form of a shake. yeah. Yeah. YEAH. That's right. It's THAT good, ehem, THAT GREAT. After the first, I had to try another. Yep, 2 Peanut Butter Shakes. It's what keeps me coming back to DMK.All in all, my first DMK experience was great to say the least. Great service, complimented with great burgers, fries, and the greatest peanut butter shake you could ever have. Luckily, DMK made it's way out to the suburbs in the ever-so-evolving Lombard/Oak Brook, area not too far away from me. The atmosphere at the Lombard location is totally different from the Lakeview one. Service isn't as good, but the food and drink certainly is. So whether you're on the northside looking for a late bite to eat or in the western-suburbs tired of fast-food, head over to DMK for a great burger, frie, and shake experience.

Reviews.Author: Tracey H.
Reviews.Content: DMK is incredible. I think they have the best burgers in Chicago. Go ahead...complain and argue all that you want that Kuma's is better. It is not. They do not even form their own meat patties anymore, have skimped on the toppings, and overall are just going through the motions. That said...DMK is incredible. I went a few weeks after they opened and thought it was a nice touch that Chef Kornick was seating & bussing tables. The burgers are incredible. The bleu cheese & bacon fries have my heart. The truffle fries are amazing too. I think it is very reasonably priced. Also, don't forget to the  chocolate malted milkshake & chocolate chip cookie sandwich. Both incredible. I will be back. And props to bartendress Safia for making a killer Manhattan!UPDATE: 5/16/10: DMK's Veggie burger is quite possibly one of my most favorite things to eat. I am not a vegetarian and I love my meat. I mean...I REALLY love my meat. But DMK's veggie burger is SO amazing it doesn't feel like you are missing out. Try it!

Reviews.Author: Janis W.
Reviews.Content: We went back the other night and sat at the bar.  Just drinks, no food.Delicious mojitos, and a very nice bartender.  I wasn't expecting either, so a nice surprise.

Reviews.Author: Jeffrey H.
Reviews.Content: It's hard to criticize this place. They serve good food at a good price in a good area with a good atmosphere. The burgers are great. They aren't too big and leave enough room for you to enjoy your craft beer and gourmet fries without feeling like you're going to have to go to the gym afterward.The service is always great. I've been there many times and requested additional seating, changes in drinks, answers to items on the menu, and the staff has always been courteous and forgiving. They don't take reservations, but the wait times are never ridiculous and there is usually space at the bar to hang out while they get a table ready for you.The atmosphere is relaxed but it's still feels sophisticated. The poetry on the bathroom walls is pretty entertaining and the overall decor is modern without being in your face. Overall a great place for a casual date, get together, or quick dinner.

Reviews.Author: Derk R.
Reviews.Content: I was specifically looking for natural, fresh, and tasty food after a long run and I found it. Even better, the beer selection is fantastic--some of the country's best craft breweries represented--and the bourbon selection is well curated and a fantastic value, given the generous pour. The vibe here was great too. The staff is friendly, knowledgable and fun, the decor is tasteful, and the music selection was spot on. (and no, it wasn't too loud.)Specifics: I started with a Great Lakes Dortmunder Gold. Great beer. Wedge salad was one if the best I've had--the tomatoes were perfect. Got the #1 burger with sweet potato fries (gratis with a foursquare checkin). All good. Had an Alpha King with the burger and finished up with an Eagle Rare 10yr bourbon. Really couldn't have asked for a better meal.

Reviews.Author: Jenna M.
Reviews.Content: I've been to DMK twice now and each time I have LOVED it. The #4 is very good if you like a little spice. The egg is the proverbial cherry on top that just oozes and makes all the flavors come together nicely. The blue cheese and bacon fries were PHENOMENAL. My boyfriend who doesn't like blue cheese could not stop stealing them from me. He got the Wisconsin cheddar and scallions which were a severe let down. I do not recommend them at all. He had the #1 sub Turkey burger and sans BBQ. It was delicious. The balsamic onions were amazing. $8 for a burger. $3 for fries that were great. If only the beers weren't $5.50+. Oh well. They do have a great selection of microbrews on tap and bottled. I don't know if it's daily but between 5 and 7pm there is a happy hour where you get free salt and pepper fries with your burgers. We got there a few minutes before but decided we wanted specialty fries instead. Thought that was kind of neat.

Reviews.Author: Ross N.
Reviews.Content: Yes, burgers are a-hopping in Chitown and you've got to be living in an igloo not to have noticed (not that there's anything wrong with that).  I agree with several other reviews that the burgers are good but lack the punch in the gut I'm used to for beef.  I had the green chile, egg, bacon #4 and it was tasty but I had to double up--which is fine by me, happy to pay for it.  Wifey had the Big Salad and enjoyed it.  Fries with the truffle cream, gobble gobble.  I ran out of stomach space to try the bacon infused shake.  Maybe next time.I'd go back but definitely some new places I'd like to hit before returning.

Reviews.Author: Kathleen M.
Reviews.Content: Yum, yum! Got the "BIG Salad" - Super delicioso! And since I was good with the salad, I decided to have an ice cream sammie. In a word: perfect! Soft cookie and soft ice cream - it is a MUST on the menu!Our service was wonderful - attentive, personable and gave great tips on the menu. Definitely check this place out!

Reviews.Author: Dan H.
Reviews.Content: Burgers were good. Beer was alright. It was Halloween yet the service was terrible. Service can make up more than half the experience at any restaurant. Thus, the three stars. Deviled eggs were good, but nothing fantastic. I got them because they were cheap - $2.I got the Bison Burger (#5). It was decent. I expected it to be something amazing and big. But it was small and it was quite anti-climatic. The fries (I got the Wisconsin Cheddar and Scallion) were alright. The cheese looked like nacho cheese. Looks can be deceiving. Cheese was actually decent. Also got the Mac & Cheese #2 - basically the mac-cheese with bacon. Again, nothing special. I've been to many other bar and burger places throughout the city. There are quite a few that have better food, beer and service.

Reviews.Author: Anant J.
Reviews.Content: We swung by here last night because I had heard good things and wanted to grab a quick dinner. The place was pretty crowded and loud, so we decided to get our food to go. I got the #2 (onion strings, Amish Blue, chipotle ketchup) as a turkey burger, and shared the sweet potato and truffle fries. The fries were both pretty good, each paired with interesting condiments, but I've had better fries in the area (they were a little thick for my liking). BUT, my burger was absolutely amazing! $9 is a bit steep for a burger, and no sides, but this was DEFINITELY worth it! Possibly one of the best turkey burgers that I have ever had! Everything worked together really well and it was a total treat to eat. I will definitely be going back here...the menu had a bunch of other super tempting items and it was quick and easy to order the food to go. Be sure to check this place out if you are looking for a great burger in the area!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer M.
Reviews.Content: What's not to like about this place? Maybe just the wait for the restroom.They host nightly, weekly and special events. This restaurant gives off a sports bar feel but it's really family friendly and good food for kids!The burgers, atmosphere and service replaces my desire for a Neurosis beef burger at the obnoxiously loud Kuma's Corner. Nah, I wouldn't go that far but it's close!We got really lucky on the day we arrived. The place was crowded but we managed to share the table attached to the bar with 3 gents who made room for us.We were able to order Bloody Marys and beer I've never heard of right away. They also have housemade sodas and shakes.My boyfriend loves Bison. This one is served with fresh goat cheese, pickled red onions and blueberry BBQ sauce. He loved it so much he ate two!I ordered the #1 with beef which is served with Artisan aged cheddar, smoked bacon, charred balsamic red onions, Rufus Teague's BBQ sauce. Sooo good!You can order an individual size or share portion of fries. We chose to share the Sweet Potato with Lemon Tobasco Aioli. I look forward to trying their onion strings or  fried okra & dill pickles.

Reviews.Author: Mary F.
Reviews.Content: #1 Burger...AmazingParmesan Truffle Fries....AmazingThree Floyds Gumballhead...AmazingCouldn't ask for a better combo.Love DMK.

Reviews.Author: Jason C.
Reviews.Content: People indicating this place has the best burger they have ever tasted must of either been drunk or mistaken that they were at DMK.  Average, average, average.  The patty is smaller than a cheeseburger at McDonalds.  Five Guys crushes this place and is half the price.  And, what's up with the small plates they serve the burgers on?  Too cheap to buy normal size plates??  The only positive are the fries - tried three different kinds and all were generally good.  If you want a real burger in Chicago, head to Kuma's.

Reviews.Author: Wyman T.
Reviews.Content: Just had lunch there with a friend.I love burgers and this place got some tasty burgers.  The burgers are a little smaller than I imagined(not sure about the big DMK), but the taste is exquisite, juicy burgers.  The number 1 burger was awesome, enjoyed the grilled red onions.Also ordered the truffle cream and Wisconsin cheddar fries, both were great, I recommend the truffle cream.

Reviews.Author: Caroline M.
Reviews.Content: With all the burger joints in town these days it's hard to choose, however DMK is my solid go-to. What I love so much about DMK is that their menu isn't overwhelming like most other burger establishments in the city. Here you're safe with whatever you order because the guys behind DMK know what tastes good - thus they don't allow you to build your own burger (Go to The Counter if that's your thing). Recently, I came here on a Sunday night for dinner with my sister and we were seated right away at the bar. Every other time I've come with one other person we've never had to wait longer than 15 minutes.  *Side note: Rick Bayless and his fam came in for dinner that same night and sat next to us. So if my review isn't convincing enough maybe a Top Chef Master's cred will add to it. And no, I didn't bother them ; ) I digress... The Burger: The burgers are an appropriate size so one person can easily finish one on their own, though with all the mouthwatering sides, fries and mac & cheese options, you may want to split with a friend. And all the burgers come on their freshly baked buns - a nice added touch. The Bar: Great Beer selection, a full page in fact, with clever descriptions for the amateur beer drinker - ahem, myself (check it out on their website). And a full bar and cocktail list. I highly recommend Greg's, one of the bartenders, signature drink - forgetting the name but it's similar to a mojito with a refreshing sage twist. My favorites: Fried Okra & Pickles - best breading hands down in the city Sweet Potato Fries - ask for a side of their House Ketchup - it's got a spicy chipotle kick! (it comes with the Chili-rubbed Onion Rings) #5 Burger: Bison, Goat Cheese and Blueberry BBQ Sauce?! Genius combo They also offer Milkshakes and Ice Cream Sandwiches (which I've never tried because I never save enough room by the end of my meal) but they always look great on the menu! You can also get them in to-go cups.

Reviews.Author: The Humane Choice S.
Reviews.Content: Without hesitation, DMK Burger Bar deserves five stars when it comes to sourcing humanely-produced ingredients for their sandwiches and sides. The food is also incredibly tasty, which is a major selling point.  We indulged in several of their burger and fry options, including the #2 (awesome chipotle ketchup) and the #4 (the roasted green chili gives it a nice kick). We also particularly enjoyed the parmesan fries with truffle dipping sauce. Even though the restaurant is relaxed and casual, its commitment to using organic and grass-fed ingredients is second to none.First and foremost, the burgers are made with Tallgrass Beef.  Tallgrass Beef is completely grass-fed and grass-finished, meaning that the cows are never fed grain. We have yet to find another restaurant in Chicago that only uses grass-fed beef in their menu items. This sets DMK apart from the competition.The rest of the ingredients are grass-fed, and in many cases also organic. Their bison meat comes from the North American Bison Co-op, an association of ranchers whose animals have never been fed hormones and thrive on a diet of natural, free-range grazing. DMK sources organic lamb from Black Earth Meats in Wisconsin. This farm is also certified by Animal Welfare Approved, an independent organization that certifies for excellent humane husbandry practices.The cheddar cheese that tops the burgers and fries is from Otter Creek Organic Farm and the turkey burgers are made from Golden Legacy Organic turkey. Otter Creek emphasizes rotational grazing and pasture-based living for their organic cows when the weather is hospitable. Eggs come from Milo's Organic Poultry.  In a recent report by the Cornucopia Institute, Milo's Organic Poultry provides ample outdoor space and encourages their birds to go outside.  According to the report, the farm offers the birds an excellent outdoor environment, often either rotated pasture or well-managed outdoor runs.If there is one area where DMK could improve, it would be to list their sources (brands and farms) on their website.  DMK Burger Bar should be very proud of their success in procuring and using grass-fed beef and other humanely raised products. Customers are interested in knowing where their food comes from, and would be impressed with the fine list that DMK has to share.   The Humane Choice is a project of Food Animal Concerns Trust (FACT).  This restaurant was reviewed by FACT staff members Larissa McKenna, Lisa Isenhart and Jacki Rossi.  FACT is a Chicago-based non-profit organization dedicated to improving the way animals are raised on farms.  For more information on our work and mission, please visit foodanimalconcerns.org.

Reviews.Author: Dave W.
Reviews.Content: I love this place!  Excellent burgers and a very good beer selection!  Although they are a tad bit pricey for drinks, I don't mind supporting small craft breweries.  I've tried at least 5 different burgers here and all of them have been superb.  On one occasion I brought up my slightly undercooked burger to a waitress and was brought another one immediately!  The only side I've ever ordered are the sweet potato fries, like the burger they are always spot on.  I have also been offered free drink coupons by more than one of the waitresses/bartenders.  Excellent customer service and consistently good food, no wonder this place is packed every time I visit!*edit* the marshmallow shake at Lakeview is awesome.

Reviews.Author: Chris O.
Reviews.Content: The basics, 2 out of 5 stars. Decent, room to improve, not a good value.I had the basic hamburger, #8 on the menu. With the hand cut fries. The burger itself was tasty but thin, on an artisan roll. The best part of the burger was the aged white cheddar. The fries are what you would expect, but what was surprising was the slightly spicy homemade Ketchup.Presentation left much to be desired. One would expect some flair for a $9 burger, but the small saucer could barely hold the sandwich. My companion David Gutowsky had the fried pickles, which I will recommend.One of the rules of thumb about a restaurant is that if it is loud with talking the food probably isn't the best, otherwise peoples' mouths would be full, eating. The first thing that strikes you about this place when you walk in, is how very loud it is inside. I do not understand why bars and restaurants insist on piping in music at rock concert levels to begin with, but it is very unpleasant to have to yell to talk to the person across the table from you. As well, a minor thing, but a personal pet peev, is servers who don't know how to place the drinks on a table. Drinks go on the right of the patron, not dropped all together on one side of the table.

Reviews.Author: Ruben K.
Reviews.Content: Best veggie burgers in town. The fried okra is delicious too. Their reputation as a gourmet burger place is well earned. The ambiance is that of a sports bar which is perfectly fine.

Reviews.Author: Nathan J.
Reviews.Content: Kane burger. That's the special. Get it dog!!!

Reviews.Author: Darby A.
Reviews.Content: Yum yum yumPost Marathon feast...pumpkin Sour ale and a "breakfast" turkey burger, covered with bacon, hash browns, fried egg, and maple aoli...perfect burger, still craving it!Staff very cool, Megan rocks, helped us find some boystown drinking spots after:)

Reviews.Author: Laura H.
Reviews.Content: I've really enjoyed my visits to DMK, though it's crazy busy on weekend nights. The burgers are tasty, fries delicious, and waiters are generous (especially when it's not busy). (I've had free things offered to me a few times).  It may be sacrilege in this neighborhood, but I also prefer these burgers to Kuma's, though perhaps not the atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Mandy P.
Reviews.Content: DMK has been on my list for awhile and I'm glad I was finally able to come. The service was incredible; definitely the best part. Someone overheard my dinner date saying he'd never had the blue and bacon fries in previous visits, so we were surprised with a small order. The burger options were great, delivered timely, and paired well with PBR. The extra order of sweet potato fries ordered guaranteed no room for a milkshake.

Reviews.Author: Jessica V.
Reviews.Content: I absolutely adore this place.If I could, I'd here here every day.We have been coming here since we moved to Chicago, and have NEVER had a single bad experience. The burgers are insanely good. My go-to is definitely the #4 Bison patty with goat cheese and blueberry BBQ sauce. DELISH! I order this EVERY time we come and I have never gotten tired of it. It's just sooo good! I think at this point we have tried every burger on the menu with the exception of the lamb burger, and love each and every one. The chili they serve in the fall and winter is incredible. They have 4-5 different kinds and it changes every few days. They're all amazing.I'd say this place is tied with Kuma's for my favorite burger in Chicago, but when we want a good burger without a 2 hour wait, we always come here.

Reviews.Author: Christie L.
Reviews.Content: Stopped for lunch on a Friday with a group of four. We had quick, friendly service. I ordered the Bison Burger (#5) with picked red onion and blueberry BBQ sauce. I also added fried egg. The burger was great...not the best I've ever had, but really good. The truffle fries were good too. At the end of the meal, the server brought us all a free sample of an alcoholic milkshake drink made with andes creme de menthe. I don't even like mint and I LOVED it.

Reviews.Author: Andy B.
Reviews.Content: Big fan of DMK. Have been 4 or 5 times now and the only downside I have experienced is the wait, although it has never been unreasonable. Even that has been alleviated for large (6-8) parties by grabbing seats at the portion of the bar which sticks out so you essentially have a table. Service has always been excellent and when we swung through for dinner during my bachelor party we received a couple plates of fries and one of everything on the dessert menu on the house. This was not a "Oh, don't tell everyone it's my birthday, I'm so embarrassed, why yes I would like some free cake" situation either; we never mentioned anything and we were not a good looking crowd (sorry guys), so we appreciated the generosity.I am sure some folks have burger places they like better, but I have really enjoyed every burger I've ordered here (big fan of the bison weekend special). While burgers don't come with fries, $4 gets you a huge plate of the sweet potato fries (my personal favorite) among other options, which is plenty for 2-3 people. Even dessert is done well, with the carrot cake (in cupcake or slice form) being the one I enjoy the most.  The beer options are plentiful and varied, so there should be something on the list for everyone. DMK also donates to a different charity every month based on items you order, so it gave my wife and I an excuse to drink for charity. The Jesuits would be so proud of me...I won't claim they have a better burger than Kuma's, but they also don't blast heavy metal, have an 60 min.+ wait nor are they hard to reach (steps from Wellington Brown line). I'm a fan.

Reviews.Author: Kerri M.
Reviews.Content: The caveat to this is that I am vegetarian, but as a vegetarian, I still appreciate a "burger" with all the fixins, and DMK allows for a veggie burger substitute for each of its specialty burgers (for $2 more). Since I was with visiting meat eaters, I figured we could each find some comfort food here.I ordered the number three with a veggie burger sub. It was...well, meh. dull. boring. The burger itself appears to be made in house, but it lacked any touch that makes it unique from something store bought (I've had better Amy's burgers, for instance), even with their spicy kick. To charge an additional $2 for something that doesn't pack much punch seems a bit egregious to me.We also ordered the chili-rubbed onion straws for an appetizer; the rub was a nice, spicy touch.My dad had a regular old burger--iceberg lettuce and tomato, and, yes, spice in the burger. Seems to be a pattern and one that isn't all that unique.I am thankful that the waitress did warn me that their fries are made in beef oil, so other vegetarians, make note.I have had far better "burgers" at places like Lockdown on Western Ave.

Reviews.Author: Cristen H.
Reviews.Content: LOVE this place! Excellent burgers, sides, beer, ambiance, energy level, desserts, service, crowd ... everything is applaudable! Stayed in the neighborhood while in town for marathon - we came for burgers and beers on day of marathon; returned next night for dessert; returned the night after that for drinks!! We just love this place!! First visit - server brought us a free appetizer and also a free round of shots (shots of cider). Second visit - bartender gave us all coupons for a free draft beer. Third visit - server brought us free fried pickles (YUMMY!!!). Crowd is young and music is entergetic. If I lived in town, I could see myself going here by myself - sitting at the bar - and making friends with the bartenders. Everything on the menu is delicious!! (especially the peanut butter milkshake... )

Reviews.Author: Stephanie K.
Reviews.Content: Came in at 2:00 in the afternoon on a Monday and it was pretty empty, besides a couple or two who we're enjoying their lunch. I had the Mac and cheese with bacon and caramelized onions while my boyfriend had the number one (burger with smoked bacon and onion). We shared the Parmesan fries and they were REALLY GOOD, some of the best fries I've ever had, really fresh. The meat on the burgers were delicious with a nice soft bun, compared to the substantial and much more hardier pretzel buns. The service was awesome and our waitress even gave us complimentary vanilla milkshakes, which I could have had a gallon of. The only reason I didn't give this five stars was because it was a little overpriced for the portions. But overall, really good place for a burger and awesome service.

Reviews.Author: Anisha A.
Reviews.Content: Perfect buns and beef. Thanks to DMK, grass fed cows and potato buns are now a permanent fixture of my fantasies. Soon they'll replace Fabio on the cover of romance novels.  The #4 is one of the tastiest and most reasonably priced burgers you'll find in Chicago- masterfully topped with jack, bacon, a fried farm egg, and the magical wildcard, a roasted green chile. Will also put out for the lamb burger (#10). Those are the two to bank on, some of the others disappoint. Of the fries, the sweet potato ones reign supreme. After some of the early kinks get worked out, eventually this place will join the ranks of Kuma's. While it lacks the tattoos and metal, it just may be more deserving of burger deity status.

Reviews.Author: Megan S.
Reviews.Content: Ugh, just fantastic. I had this buffalo burger and it was incredible. Plus they offer truffle fries and sweet potato fries.

Reviews.Author: Sarah S.
Reviews.Content: I live right around the corner from DMK and have been wanting to go there since it opened. Went with some friends last weekend.  We got there around 7:45 and had to wait about an hour for a table.  We were able to sit at the bar and have a drink while we waited, so we didn't mind. Now, I went to Kuma's Corner the week before and I will say that I liked DMK better. Yes, I said it. The burger I had at DMK is one of the best i've ever had.  I had the one with portobello and eggplant on it.  It was so juicy and full of flavor. We got a side of the truffle fries and sweet potato.  Again, they were delicious and cooked to perfection. I will definitely be going back to DMK and would highly recommend this place!!

Reviews.Author: Jon G.
Reviews.Content: Been here a few times and have been pleased overall. Nice selection of burgers (beef, turkey, organic, veggie, etc). Try the mac and cheese, which is very oily/tasty with chopped bacon sprinkled on top. Sweet potato fries are also always a winner. Only knock is that sometimes it is very loud and dark inside. So, basically a good place to take a date that is ugly and annoying.

Reviews.Author: Bill C.
Reviews.Content: Just spent a lovely evening at this establishment!  All around awesome, well run place - especially for the third day since opening their doors.  The menu is creative - it includes lots of items that aren't necessarily obscure, but are not typically found at a burger joint like this:  mac and cheese (several gourmet variations), deviled eggs, and ice cream sandwiches.  Needless to say the food did not disappoint.  My two roommates and I split three of their original burgers,  plus a side of truffle/parmesan fries and bacon/onion/guyere mac and cheese - all incredible. In addition to scrumptious food, they also offer an impressive beer selection. Lots of great craft brews that are hard to come by - two brothers, three floyds, victory, and great lakes to name a few. The service was friendly and sincere, unlike the attractive, yet ditzy and fake waitresses at similar bars in the area. The one gripe I have is the music playlist.  I respect Bob Marley, but I must have heard ten of his songs throughout the night, including "Jamming" four times. If I heard that song one more time I'd have had no other option but to roll a joint and sit back with a Red Stripe.  I'm sure the iTunes shuffle issue will be resolved shortly. Definitely work checking out!

Reviews.Author: Suzanne B.
Reviews.Content: Great Food. Great Service, Great drinks. I couldn't say anything bad about this place if I tried.I guess if anything they could turn the music down just a notch (that really comes from others I have talked to more than me)

Reviews.Author: Ted C.
Reviews.Content: I hadn't seen my friend  Scott for a while and was in the need for a Friday decompression. I went down to his house and since we were both hungry I suggested DMK. Scott had been there before, liked the food but didn't really like the atmosphere. Atmosphere doesn't really factor into my food consuming decisions so we went. I got the #4 burger, green chiles, egg, jack cheese and bacon. I asked to get it medium rare since I figured a place like this has good quality beef. I was a little disappointed to find out that all burgers are cooked the same-it kind of reminded me of the pretentiousness at this place in LA. I was surprised though to find the burger tasty juicy with the the chile being subtly spicy, not a kick per se but a little knee that mixed with the slightly medium egg and bacon. Kind of like a really kick ass breakfast with a burger in it.I ordered the salt and pepper fries, Scott got the Parmesan fries. Scott's garlic parmesan fries were the definite winner here but it was my mistake to get plain fries really. Their house made ketchup though was good, tangy but not overly sweet.I started out non-alcoholic with their blood-orange soda which was interesting. I saw our bartender Lauren make house made syrup with a seltzer and mixed-a little new school flavor with old fashioned technique.I definitely need to write about Lauren, our bartender. She was really friendly, knew her bourbon- she was even a member of the Bourbon Heritage Society, gave us a free order of sweet potato fries when my buddy and I decided on getting other fries. Not only that but my friend Scott was reluctant to get an order of bourbon and I started calling my Stacy and Stephanie and Jocelyn. Lauren even jumped in on it and Scotty's reluctance turned into, less reluctance and he got a glass of Elijah Craig with me-again a suggestion from Lauren and an excellent one. We settled out and she said to come by and see her again. Oh yes, Lauren we definitely will. Thanks for a great time and changing Scotty's mind about the place. Hopefully it won't be too long before we come by again.

Reviews.Author: Sara C.
Reviews.Content: Came here with a group of friends on a Friday night.  It was bustling and became quite packed before we left.The boy had the number 4 and I had the number 1.  He also had the Arcadian Ale and I had the blood orange soda.  Around the table were the lamb burger, sweet potato fries, and salt and pepper fries.  The sweet potato fries are incredible!  It was a bit of a wait for the food, and the fries came out after the burgers, but otherwise everything was very good.However, about half an hour afterwards my tummy was in distress, and we had to make several pit stops during our journey back to Wheaton, which definitely puts a damper on my enthusiasm for this restaurant.

Reviews.Author: Mark T.
Reviews.Content: "The Chicago Burger Bar with exceptional Quality, Grass-Fed Beef, Fresh Baked Buns, Artisan Cheeses + Love." After this place opened up two years ago, it has been on my list of restaurants to check out. I finally got the chance to today, albeit only for take out. Ordered the "Big DMK" burger: a triple decker treat with "special sauce", and a small order of Chicago fries. Let me tell you, for the most expensive burger on the menu, this thing was MASSIVE. Holy freaking smokes. Still, with my enormous appetite, I took that thing home and downed it in 10 minutes. The burger wasn't spectacular, but it was quite tasty. The "special sauce" looked/tasted like they just mixed catsup and pepper together (not so special now, isn't it?). Either way, it did give the burger a special kick. The fries were ok, thankfully I only had a small order.As I waited for my order, I scoped out the place. It was normal for a saturday afternoon crowd (family w/kids at one table, young group of girls at another,  and couples scattered around as well). I can olny imagine how it would be on a Friday night. Sort of a trendy place, but during certain hours. Service was fast too, which surprised me. I got my burger in about ten minutes. Would I go back? Maybe, just to capture the whole experience. Although I know what to expect, which helps.

Reviews.Author: Jeff J.
Reviews.Content: It's been awhile since I knew exactly what rating to give a restaurant after my final bite of food.  DMK is 5 stars hands down.  My bison burger with blueberry BBQ sauce and an egg was mind boggling delicious.  Each ingredient was purposeful, yet restrained.  The meat while seemingly thin, is just filling enough, moist, tender, and perfect.  The blueberry BBQ sauce (yes, blueberry!!) is actually bluish in color, and you can TASTE the blueberries.  It's not some gimmick where the blueberries are purportedly in the sauce, but you can't taste them.  And the blueberry flavor that shines through is actually of utmost importance to the burger.  And the egg-- what a suggestion by the waiter.  Just runny enough, didn't fall apart in the sandwich... We also got sweet potato fries (some of the best I've had, and an awesome aioli).  We did get a cheddar and scallion fries that I thought were a bit on the heavy side.  The burger made me go ooh, ahh, and mmm... with the noises I was making, I'm glad there were no children seated near me.  This place is the BEST burger place I've ever been to.

Reviews.Author: Marc R.
Reviews.Content: I walked in here after a friend of mine gave me a haircut and can say that on walking in the staff were very attentive and friendly girls. I think they have a uniform but I am not sure. Our server was a nice all American blond with ballet shoes. She was very attentive and nice. The set up is like a bar, but it is a kid friendly place where you can take the family or the parents for burgers. There were some cool wordplay (dare I call them poems?) in the bathrooms that seemed to be talking about West Town (Nelson Algren was mentioned). The burgers: We had a lamb burger and a regular with an egg on top. Both were solid. They were not as thick as other burgers and had a traditional bun - very drive in it seemed. The fries (we got regular) were also good. I would not class these among my top burgers in the city, but they were well done and yummy. The fries: These were better than most! Overall, if you find yourself in this hood and want a burger hook up, I would check it out.

Reviews.Author: Taylor O.
Reviews.Content: I've been meaning to stop by here since it opened; I was just waiting for the right time (when my ex-girlfriend moved away from this neighborhood).  I love burgers; I may name my future son Kobe and I'm not a basketball fan so I found myself on a rainy day here at Kuma's, which with it's dark glass looked like a river north modern furniture store closed for the evening.  I knew better and poked in to find a nice young clean, modern, atmosphere.  It was nice sitting at the bar in front of their pegboard menu, with the decent beer list including an quip about Amstel, "if you insist," listening to the staff's iTunes playlist.  I'm about the red meat only; burger and bacon.  The grass fed burger was perfectly cooked to medium rare and was of the steak burger quality.  I wish it was thicker but c'est la vie.  By the way, cows should only ever eat grass not grain not be finished on grain etc.  Trickier and less sweet but much more flavorful and definitely more healthy, Omega 3 and Vitamin K2 fans.  It was an awkwardly tiny plate though; what is this a slider?  You know I'll be back.  Definitely in part to it being super convenient to the recently refurb'ed Wellington Brown Line stop.

Reviews.Author: Thao N.
Reviews.Content: It's been about 4 months since I've written a review but, DMK Burger Bar, you have brought me back to Yelp because my experience at your establishment had been so pleasant. It was my first visit but it sure won't be my last. I brought my best friend here as one of the surprises I had planned for  his belated Christmas gift. When we arrived, we were promptly greeted by a friendly host whom stated it was a 15 minute wait. I decided to order the blood orange soda (Made in house, the old school way.) and waited at the bar. Five minutes hadn't passed when our host approached to say that a table towards the back was ready. Once seated, my friend looked over their selection of domestic beers. (Some were brewed right in the city saving on carbon footprint. Yay! for going green.)When it came time to order one of the many different grass feed beef burgers, I went with the # 1. Aged cheddar, smoked bacon, charred balsamic red onions, and Rufus Teague's BBQ sauce. (Oh my!) It was a great burger and it didn't have to try so hard. They don't ask you how you want it cook because they know how it should be cooked. I love it when the cook/ grill master can be cocky and back it up! Even the fries were in your face and didn't back down. From the first bite to the last bite everything was scrumptious.

Reviews.Author: Robyn T.
Reviews.Content: What a crowd! Glad my friend and I came *early* to nab a seat just before 7. There was a mix of families with young kids, a few dates, other groups of girlfriends and some guys at the bar. The hostess was SUPER friendly greeting us like long lost friends and giving us her undivided attention to recommend her faves on both the mixed drink and extensive beer menu. The crowds began to build and I can only expect that this place is going to be slammed on the weekends.Some people like big burger patties. Me? I actually prefer a thinner, juicy patty so this was my cup of tea. I could appreciate the delicious brioche style bun and the spicy hot sauce, blue cheese and onions that sat in my burger.Come for the burger but go hog wild on the sides. Mac & cheese with bacon and balsamic onions (that's m&c #2), the pepper fries and truffle fries were all recommendations I'd make. Deviled eggs were...deviled eggs. No surprises there but if it's not something you get to enjoy often then splurge the $2 and get the 3 eggs.I was too full for dessert and rolled out of here $20 (including tax & tip) later.

Reviews.Author: Margaret N.
Reviews.Content: *The Good*-Madame Geneva's Rhubarb Delight.... a gin-based cocktail and damn is it delightful!!!-Parmesan fries with Truffle Cream-A customer survey at the end of the meal, I get the impression these guys actually give a damn about what their customers think.- The beer list is creative and extensive, nice work!!*The Bad*- Cherry housemade soda = a giant glass of carbonated Dimetapp complete with medicine aftertaste... - Pricey!! I know this is LP, and I will pay the price for an amazing dining experience, but this just wasn't it. Also, my cocktail was 10 bucks, my burger 8 bucks... I think both should be in the 6 buck range for what it was.- I was full when we left, but 3 other people I was with complained of still being hungry.... Maybe I just have a freaky small stomach???*The Average*-The burger... I got a #1 with a turkey burger. Not very flavorful, very "meh." It satisfied my burger craving, but it was not the orgasmic burger I was expecting, especially for 8 bucks. Flub a Dub Chubs is still my burger go-to spot in the neighborhood.*The Weird??*- Our server was like 14 years old... Seriously, it looked like she just got her braces off yesterday. Wow, it felt weird to receive alcohol from her.... We all agreed she had to have been someone's daughter to get that job.Overall, I might give them another try someday, but there's nothing new or interesting about the place. As a Twin Cities native, I have two burger words of suggestion for these guys: Juicy Lucy. Now that's something that hasn't really hit the burger scene in Chicago yet, but it's something I think we desperately need! Get on it DMK!!!

Reviews.Author: Andrew T.
Reviews.Content: More of a 3.5 but someone said it best - a Kuma's for the LP set.  Went late on a weeknight, plenty of open tables (by the time we left, the bar had pretty much cleared out), the website says open late - i take that to mean 10:30-11.The lamb burger was good, reminded me of a gyro. The small fries are good sized for two bucks and the mac and cheese is good sized too although it is six bucks.  All in all a good burger joint and tasty sauces/flavors for the fries and mac n cheese.  The india pale ale was tasty too.

Reviews.Author: Abby Z.
Reviews.Content: Major letdown.This was our second attempt to come here - the first time was a Friday night where the wait was too ridiculous so we went next door to FishBar (also a 2 star experience).This time was a Sunday around 1 pm. We put our name down and were quoted around a 30 minute wait. Once 30 minutes had passed and we started noticing people who got there long after us were being seated we inquired with the girl (whose only job was to take names and seat people) as to our place on the list. Surprisingly, she had passed us by (even though we were standing practically next to her the entire time) and had gone to the next page after crossing us off. Whatever, we aren't too picky about stuff like this and she had a table for us once she realized we hadn't disappeared into thin air. But that was just the start to a bad dining experience.What we ordered:Patty MeltBurger Number 1 with bacon, bbq sauce, and aged cheddar cheeseFired Okra and PicklesSmall parmesan fried with truffle creamMilk Stout (the only thing worth returning for, poured well)All of it, including the service throughout, was dry and subpar. When they brought the fries, they came with no truffle cream so we we asked about it. "oh, yea, I can get some" said the server. Well yea duh you can, its stated as being part of the plate so it shouldn't be a request only sort of thing. That said, the fries had good texture and were crispy but not oily. Not so for the okra and pickles. These looked appealing on the plate, but were a soggy mess and the batter fell right off making it basically cooked pickles with one or two pieces of okra. The ranch dressing had no zing so this dish got a major thumbs down for bad texture and bland flavors.The burgers pretty much sucked. Can someone explain the hype to me? The burger itself was very very dry. We made no special requests for how it was cooked, hoping that however they have selected to prepare them is what is right. Maybe they effed ours up and cooked them to death but damn, they were so dry they were crumbly and had no seasoning to speak of. With that said, I really don't understand why in a city who loves meat so much so many people are flocking to a place charging 8 bucks for a dry patty. Not that I think thats expensive, but for something that sucks and is bland, I do.Maybe Im spoiled being from CA, land of In-N-Out, but I won't be returning here, theres far better to be had.

Reviews.Author: Charlotte F.
Reviews.Content: Loud and overpriced. Everyone in my party got the runs for 1-3 days. Why the hype? There are a number of better burgers in a one mile radius. Also, not sure they had actual truffle fries at some point, but when we visited it was normal fries with grated parmesan cheese and truffle dipping sauce.

Reviews.Author: Justin S.
Reviews.Content: I came here for their Valentine's Day special with my girlfriend. A #1 and #5 were ordered. Both were quite delicious. My #5 was awesome, even though I have intense hatred for salt and vinegar chips. The milkshake was great, the deviled eggs were good, satisfying from start to finish. I was expecting an overly well cooked burger, but maybe my ESP shone through because mine was at an ideal medium. I didn't sample the drink list beyond the Three Floyds Gumballhead that was offered with our meal, but their beer list is extensive. Craft beers from start to finish. I'd love to go back, try another burger, try the famed blood orange soda, and eat more parmesan fries with truffle mayo.And no, I won't compare this to Kuma's Corner.

Reviews.Author: Afton A.
Reviews.Content: Um, delish. - The #1 burger is my favorite: Bacon, balsamic caramelized onions, aged cheddar, BBQ sauce.- #4 - heart attack special (my name, not theirs), with a fried egg. - Fries. *Swoon* Parmesan truffle cream fries...a fat kid's heaven.- They make their own delicious soda.- We watched The 3 Amigos while we ate, FTW!If you don't feel like you need to be rolled out of the bar when you're finished eating to immediately slip into a food coma, you didn't do it right. ...Just sayin

Reviews.Author: Melody C.
Reviews.Content: Good burger - i prefer the glossy brioche buns - but what i ordered - i think it had the #2: Chili-Rubbed Onion Strings, Amish Blue (cheese),Spicy Chipotle Ketchup, and i asked them to add bacon and a side of bbq sauce.  it was SOO good.terrific sweet potato fries.you can add a fried egg on top - having already added bacon on top of the fried onion and cheese i decided to hold off on that one for next time.really good and large dish of gruyere mac and cheese - it had soft red onion baked at the bottom of the dish with bacon bits on top.  I LOVE BACON!i had the home made cherry soda - it tasted sort of like diet soda with less sugar.  maybe the other flavors are better.all in all, burgers are not my favorite thing in the world but a good burger like the one i had at DMK is TERRIFIC.  good enoguh to make me ignore all the guilt from gobbling down fatty mac and cheese and bacon and fried food.

Reviews.Author: Jerry G.
Reviews.Content: The aged cheddar and smoked bacon burger I had was underwhelming due to a lacking in flavor beef patty so I was a little sad that DMK couldn't provide anything worth comparing to Kuma's. Yet, the place was saved from getting a 2 star rating by how awesome their fries tasted in combination w/ their accompanied sauces. I would even suggest to get at least two styles of the fries when you eat here. Maybe consider passing on the burger to add a third style of fries (yeah they're that good).Must Have:- Any style off fries

Reviews.Author: John M.
Reviews.Content: My quest for the best burger in Chicago took us to DMK one saturday afternoon for lunch. DMK had been recommended by friends as a place a burger lover like me should definitely try. After previously suffering through two lousy recommendations (J. Wellington's and Longman & Eagle) I did not have high hope for DMK.We sat and examined the menu in the straightforward dining room. A lot of pre-built burgers. The Saturday special was the Bison burger with goat cheese. My girlfriend opted for the special to satiate her love of goat cheese and I, the purist, went with the #8 medium, which is a cheeseburger with American, LTMO. We also split an order of the cheddar and scallion fries.The burgers here are wide, smashed patties cooked on a griddle and served atop brioche-style rolls. The tell tale signs of a smashed patty are the irregular edge shape, flatter proportions, and a good crunchy crust. This is also the preferred cooking method of my holy grail of burgers, the Shack Double from Shake Shack.We got our food shortly with little fanfare. The burgers were served on small plates and looked deceptively big. I bit into mine and it gushed. The inside was pink throughout, almost medium rare. But with a patty this thin, the difference between rare and well could be only 30 seconds or so. The toppings were fresh and the cheese was perfectly melted. The beef had a good subtle beefiness about it, but was missing some of the more pronounced sirloin flavor the Shack Double has.Did I say this burger was juicy? I ended up with a plateful of grease and the roll was falling apart. I will give kudos to DMK for using a less bready version of the seemingly ubiquitous brioche, which would have sucked up a lot of the excess juice. However, had they toasted the inside of those buns, I think the roll would have stayed intact. Also, cutting back on the amount of fat in the beef blend would allow them cut fat an introduce more robust beef flavors.The bison burger did not seem to suffer the fat issues of the regular beef patty. However, the amount of goat cheese was overpowering. A little goes a long way. All in all it was good, but not as good as the bison burger from Bluebird on N Damen.We left pleasantly surprised with DMK. So far, it was the best burger we have had in the city. Hopefully they can correct some of the mistakes and it can get even better.

Reviews.Author: Julia D.
Reviews.Content: I want to go to there. All the time. Somehow I didn't know about DMK until recently (I need to get my burger radar checked, I think), but I want to move closer to it. One of the best burgers I've ever had. We waited awhile to sit at 2 p.m. on a Saturday, but that's fine. I understand the NEED for a good ass cheeseburger. We has a rockin' server who suggested great burgers and great drinks. I had the #1, the parmesan fries, and some lovely little rhubarb cocktail that I wanted a pitcher of. It came with a tiny spoon full of rhubarb jam. I love tiny things. I was sold on that alone, but it really was a great cocktail. Manfriend had the #4, some dark beer you could probably chew, and sweet potato fries. He was in love.For whatever reason we decided to come here and then go shopping for pants. Probably the worst plan of all time. The pants shopping was a total bust but the DMK portion of the day was a 4.0.My mouth is watering just thinking about it...

Reviews.Author: David M.
Reviews.Content: First visit today.  Probably picked a bad day for that since it is amateur hour (St Pat Day) but they did well anyway.  First off....excellent local based beer list....good (okay, not great) tap list but an excellent list of bottled beer.Second...also a good selection / menu of burgers, chili (really hot, excellent chili based chili...guess it changes more or less daily), mac and cheese...my chili was excellent and so was Todd's burger.Third...service....our bartender / wait person was knowledgeable and helped explain / recommend items on the menu....food came a little slowly but do have to remember the day and the crowd.We will be back....

Reviews.Author: Janet X.
Reviews.Content: Wow, this place is LOUD.  A friend and I were hankering for burgers and thought that this would be a good place to grab some and catch up.  Little did I know that I was going to leave the restaurant hoarse from screaming across our tiny little table.  The lights were also dim, making it feel like I should be here at eleven o'clock on a Saturday night rather than seven o'clock on a Sunday.The food itself was okay, I guess.  I had the plain hamburger with tomatoes, lettuce and some "buttered pickels."  Thankfully, it did not come with its own stretcher, but I cannot say with any assurance that it was less of a heart attack than anything McDonald's serves.  The sweet potato fries were very good, but the blood-orange soda was too much soda water and not enough taste.  Would I come here again?  Maybe eleven o'clock next Saturday, when I feel like a midnight snack.

Reviews.Author: rebecca g.
Reviews.Content: The communal bar seating is a bit weird, but service is prompt, attentive, and thorough.  (I think 3 different servers/managers? checked in on us during dinner).Foodwise, I was more impressed by the sides than the signature burgers...the parmesan fries with truffle cream were out of this world, and the sweet potato fries with lemon-tabasco aioli were a lovely second.  The bacon/caramelized onion mac-n-cheese wasn't bad, but definitely nowhere near as unique as the fries.  My friend and I split a turkey burger, which was good but kind of meager in size, and  I couldn't really taste the many condiments that were supposedly on it.  The house-made sodas are a nice touch; I tried the blood orange, which was a nice, not overly sweet flavor, but perhaps a bit too carbonated.I'd probably go back for beer and fries...great late-night bar snack food.ADDENDUM: January 2010 -- went back for a friend's birthday. Insanely long wait, but well-worth it!  Had a lovely seasonal gin cocktail served with a little spoonful of local rhubarb jam, another yummy turkey burger (sub. for one of the beef options on the menu), and everyone in our large group had a grand time sampling all the assorted fries, fried pickles, etc.  WIN!

Reviews.Author: Lauren G.
Reviews.Content: DMK! DMK! DMK! Just the thought of it makes me want to chant. What can I say? This loud burger bar is a place I want to take my mother. Not in a "she'll really appreciate this and think this is so darn cute" way, but in a "she's going to think these burgers and fries are damn good" way. DMK has come out on top as both a rowdy dinner stop as well as a chill afternoon bar-hopping post. The burger concoctions are just the right flavor. The french fries come in any taste you're craving. DMK! DMK!Oh, and did I mention the drinks? Bartender Gregg will whip you up anything that your heart desires. Let's just say, for my ".. make me something refreshing" request, G never failed to wow me with tasty sips of boozey drinks - including one of a kind rhubarb brews and deliciously muddled-and-sweet lemon licks. Mmm! And if DMK is your usual spot, be sure to grab one of their frequent visitor cards. Good food and prizes? Um, yep.

Reviews.Author: Linsey C.
Reviews.Content: Super impressed.Walked in on a Friday night around 5 and was seated right away by a super friendly hostess.  The service in this place is good, but a little overkill.  I know they are new and are still figuring things out but probably 4 different people stopped by our table a total of about 15 times to see if we were ok...I mean, I'm all for attentive service but that's just ridiculous!  Also, after all that checking at the beginning of our meal, we had to wave down our server to get the check...by this point they were pretty busy which generally means they want to turn tables quickly...not the case apparently.So, the food...I had the #1 burger-aged cheddar, bacon, onions and bbq sauce.  I'm not a big bbq sauce fan so I asked for it on the side...next time I'll just let them put it on the burger-it was delicious!  The buns are amazing and I was slightly worried about the doneness of the burger when the server said all burgers are cooked to medium+ (I'm generally a MW person) but it was perfect...slightly pink but not in a creepy blood on your plate, cold in the middle sort of way!  My dining partner had the classic burger (#8) and he loved it.  We got an order of the salt and pepper fries which had a little too much pepper for our taste, but were still delicious, and I don't really like fries all that much!The music wasn't too loud as others have commented, but I didn't like how close the tables were.  We sat along the back wall which is the half booth/half table thing and the tables were so close it was impossible to not overhear the conversation at the next table and pretty tricky to get out of the booth side without bumping into the person dining next to you.I hesitate with the 5th star because I feel like they are going to get even better and I want to be able to update my review when they do.  Also, hopefully after the initial opening period they will allow substitutions...would have loved me some avocado on that burger!

Reviews.Author: Laura M.
Reviews.Content: I was surprised in how good DMK was.  The fried Okra & pickles were excellent (I love friend pickles and they were the best I have ever had).  And the parmesan truffle fries were also outstanding!Well the burger wasn't the best I have ever had in my life, it was still VERY good (I personally didn't like the bun, but it wasn't bad).We will definitely be back!!Oh, I also thought the service was great.  We were seated immediately (on a Saturday at noon), they were quick and very friendly!.  The decor was also more upscale and nicer than we expected.

Reviews.Author: Jeff W.
Reviews.Content: Let me say the website is NOT the reason to come here-I can only imagine the scene on a weekend night at this must see and be scene new high end burger joint on North side. Great deviled eggs-nice beer selection-blood red orange soda also yum-i would avoid the other home made sodas. BEST sweet potato fries I have ever tasted-perfect crunch-not greasy -perfectly seasoned-also tasty the chili infused onion straws. Avoid so so mac n cheese; had 2 varieties and both are average. The burgers...YUM-2 of us had the pastrami burger with cheese and sauerkraut(I skipped special sauce). I f you are super hungry it may be worth getting double as the burgers are NOT huge, nor are the prices. 8 bucks a burger. My other friends had a lamb burger that looked very tasty and he loved it with a Greek flair. I will be back...

Reviews.Author: Rudra B.
Reviews.Content: This place has great servers, good beer and excellent burgers.  Many of my friends consider this the best burger in Chicago.The fries are excellent.

Reviews.Author: Matthew L.
Reviews.Content: Service sucked... some of the worst service I've ever had.  Couldn't get a bill or a drink refill and our server never even told us they had specials.The food is okay, the burgers aren't much better than other good burger places.  The drink menu is great and the best part of our meal was the side dishes.  But I still can't get over our service.Note to bar/business owners.  Just cause a girl is cute, doesn't mean she can/should waitress.  As one of the best movies states - "The world needs ditch diggers too"

Reviews.Author: Ron T.
Reviews.Content: The cab ride felt like an eternity and the anticipation was killing me!! I was getting close to eating my arm off in the cab but I told myself to wait because this is going to be so worth it and DMK did NOT disappoint!!! First impression, this is a burger joint?? So trendy looking but yet they are serving me an $8 burger.....I LOVE IT!! We had an hour wait but we were able to snag a spot right by the bar and dined there. As I glanced over the menu and had way too much salivation going on, I had to make the ultimate choice.....first time here, get the biggest burger they make, so I took on the Big DMK. Do I normally do this, no because my diet has changed over the years as I've gotten older but this one time being in the city and feeling young again, I took a step back into my yesteryear's. Along with it I ordered the Parmesan Fries with the Truffle dipping sauce, probably the best fries I've EVER had, without a doubt! The burger = HEAVEN and what makes it like this is the fact that all of the components with it create and work of art on a bun. Love, love, love the beer choices that they offer. I'm a fan!Overall, great atmosphere, great burger and fries, service was stellar and I just can't wait to go back!! Also, so happy they have one in Lombard close to me.

Reviews.Author: Burger Guide D.
Reviews.Content: The burgers at DMK Burger have a lot of ambition but it gets lost somewhere in the essentials. The beef patties are a little too thin, bun are too dry, but they have some creative and tasty toppings. My major problem with the burgers I tried was that the patties were too dry. This is probably a result of the patties being very thin, which can lead to easy overcooking on the grill. DMK has some great fries, drinks, and is in a fun neighborhood. Overall, the burgers are pretty good and the fries alone might be worth a visit.

Reviews.Author: Carrie M.
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty average - good for lunch if there's no wait but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back.We came here around noon on a Saturday and were seated right away.  Everyone working there was friendly, attentive, and VERY enthusiastic about the burgers, shakes, iced tea - pretty much everything.  It felt very cold and warehouse-like, which is probably what they were going for but to me it felt uninviting and uncomfortable.As previous reviewers have said, the burgers are on the thin side and, as we were told by our sever, inspired by In and Out Burger.  I got the classic without mayo or cheese and it was pretty dry and a bit on the bland side, although the bun was fantastic (and you can't forget how important a bun is to the entire burger experience).  I really wouldn't compare their burger to In and Out but can see how they tried.Sticking with the classics, I got the salt + pepper fries.  They were good and crispy with a mild smoky flavor and come with "house made" ketchup.  I was apprehensive about that part (let's stick to Heinz, please) but it ended up being pretty good for what I was expecting and did the job just fine.I didn't drink but the beer selection was impressive.  As for nonalcoholic drinks, expect a lot of craft sodas and no free refills.  Really, DMK?  No free refills on a $2 soda?  Overall,  I won't go out of my way to come back again but wouldn't mind if I'm nearby and a friend wants to try it.  This gets a big "meh."

Reviews.Author: Joey B.
Reviews.Content: This place is right around the corner from me, and it took me quite a while to go in.  From the outside, it's nothing special.  In fact, it looks more like a douchey bar than anything else.  However, once inside, I realized that this place has more to offer than standard bar fare and Miller Lite.For starters, the beer list is exceptional.  Plenty of local brews on tap as well as in bottles, and some impressive imports.  I enjoyed several Two Brothers beers, of which they had three different varieties on the menu.  Moving on to the hamburgers, I found the eclectic creations to be striking.  Many different styles of burger, as well as bison, turkey, salmon, and veggie options.  I hear they have a good mac and cheese, though no one in my party ordered it.I settled on the Italian-themed burger, complete with prosciutto, fontina cheese, roasted red peppers, pesto, and to top it all off, a handful of salt and vinegar chips.  The classic pothead move of putting chips on a sandwich made my decision easy.  The doughy Ciabatta bread it was served on combined with the crispy chips made for a very fun creation.  You don't need to be stoned to enjoy a sandwich this flavorful and packed with goodies, but it never hurts.I was also able to taste the patty melt, which came complete with cheddar, bacon, and grilled onion.  It would be damn near impossible to screw a sandwich with these things on it, so needless to say, it was good.  Several french fry options are available, our table ordered the sweet potato fries.  Quite good, I must say, served with some kind of flavored mayo.  I'm not a huge fan of mayo on fries, but I hear that Canadians are.  So if you're Canadian, you may enjoy this establishment.  Overall, the food was quite good, at a fairly reasonable price.  $8 burgers a la carte is not so bad for the area, but not great either.  A basket of fries will run you $4, and is plenty to share.  I would recommend DMK to anyone looking for an interesting burger, good beer, and Canadians.  Especially Canadians.

Reviews.Author: Liz P.
Reviews.Content: Food coma. I couldn't even write this review last night when I got home because I had eaten too much to even think about food post-dinner. We had a group of 6 and went at about 7:30 on a Tuesday night. Wait was about 20 minutes which was totally acceptable. Our waitress was fantastic and was able to keep up with my friends occasional inappropriate humor. She even participated in the boys' brainstorm of a bacon-ranch soup...Appetizers/Sides:We ordered the fried pickles to start - honestly, can you really go wrong with fried pickles [answer: NO]?! We then ordered three kinds of fries for the table to have with dinner [sweet potato, blue cheese and bacon, and truffle]. Personally, I'm a huge fan of the sweet potato fries...one of my friends wanted to drink the truffle sauce so I think those were also a hit.Burgers: I ordered the bison burger and was very pleased. The burgers are the perfect size to be able to order a few other sides on the menu [which is really how it should be done at a place like this].
