It came with goat cheese, pickled red onions, and blueberry bbq sauce. To be honest, blueberry bbq sauce made me a bit uncomfortable so I asked for it on the side just in case. I was worried it would be much too sweet especially when paired with the picked onions - not so. I ended up adding it back on the burger after the first bite and then even dipping the burger in for extras.Overall, everyone enjoyed their burgers. Beware: the number 2 apparently has a bit of a kick to it...as does the number 1 [according to my fellow diners]. The lamb burger was also given a thumbs up, but I cannot speak to it personally since I didn't have it.Desert: For some unknown reason, we thought we had room for desert so a peanut butter shake and an ice cream sandwich was ordered. Beware: the peanut butter shake has a LOT of peanut butter in it. Still delish, but very heavy. There are two types of ice cream sandwiches and we opted for the chocolate chip cookie with vanilla ice cream. Solid ice cream sandwich.Fun extra:Someone asked [jokingly] about the deviled eggs. We didn't order any but the waitress sent some out for us on the house - SO GOOD! If for some reason you have a craving...definitely recommend them. When we got the bill, it looked like we had been charge for the eggs until we went to the total and there was a deduction for "love" which totally made our day. Simply fantastic little treat to end a solid meal.

Reviews.Author: Janice M.
Reviews.Content: Stumbled on this during an afternoon in this neighborhood.We considered the Fish place next door (same owners), but opted for DMK.Sat in the bar "area" at the long, high top table.  Server came right over - discussed the beer offerings - and brought us out a few to try, since we couldn't make up our minds.  LOVE when places do this.She recommended trying a couple smaller portions of the fries -- which we did (the salt and vinegar and the wisconsin cheddar)Started off with the wedge salad.  Perfectly executed.We had the Bison Burger and the Patty Melt.  Both delicious.  Fries were really good, too.Overall, the food and service were top notch.  Good value - 2 salads, 2 burgers, 2 small fries, 2 beers -- $45 (before tip)However - if I could have given it 4 1/2 stars I would -- due to the noise level.  The music was soooooo loud -- to the point where we considered leaving during the first 5 minutes after being seated.  I actually asked our server about it -- and she said that it is the "vibe" that the owners are going for.  Hence "Burger Bar" -- Bar being the operative word.  While the place was not busy (we were there around 2pm mid-week) I could not imagine dining there during peak hours - when the place is packed.So - I will go back -- but will stay away on weekends and dinner hour.

Reviews.Author: Foodie B.
Reviews.Content: It is very hard for me not to go here every time I come to Chicago. One of my all time favorite burgers which is really saying a lot. Food, drinks and service are all on point!

Reviews.Author: Chay K.
Reviews.Content: Their burgers were good, but nothing out-of-this-world. I was expecting more, especially for a joint in Chicago.The one thing I did thoroughly enjoy was their fries.  In all fairness, if you are looking for a lighter burger that won't leave you overly stuffed, than this place will do. (This is coming from a 130 lb 20-something female.) Or, if you are going for a wide selection of beers that aren't too overpriced, this place will do.  Otherwise, I would head over to Kuma's or the like.

Reviews.Author: Jay W.
Reviews.Content: I was never a huge burger person but this place turned that around! The burgers are awesome, just the right size and the perfect bun/burger/topping ratio. I have only had the one with portabello mushrooms and brie because I can't bring myself to even try anything else! Fries also amazing.There are always people there but we've never had to wait and the servers are always very pleasant. It can be a little loud, but that goes with the "burger bar"  territory.

Reviews.Author: Irene W.
Reviews.Content: Awesome burgers! Must order the double patty = meat patty plus the portabello mushroom patty! I ordered #5 Bison patty with extra portabello mushroom patty..they are huge, well at least for me. Also ordered the mac n cheese #2, the red onion makes this mac n cheese different (in a good way). Been here twice and always go home satisfied and full.

Reviews.Author: Annie D.
Reviews.Content: YES, YOU ARE CORRECT.  I HAVE THE CAPS-LOCK ON.  WHY?  BECAUSE IT'S THE ONLY WAY OF APPROXIMATING THE VOLUME AT WHICH I WOULD HAVE TO SPEAK IF WE WERE HAVING A BEER AND A BURGER AT DMK RIGHT NOW.  I struggled with the rating.  It would have been only one star because of the sheer ungodly volume of the place.  But I added a star for the friendly server who's probably going slowly deaf, and another star just because I hate that Yelp uses the word 'Meh' to explain the two star rating. A word of caution:  ask for a side of earplugs with those fries.

Reviews.Author: Molly R.
Reviews.Content: This place is fabulous.  I can't stop thinking about it.  After just one visit last Thursday night, I am ready to declare this the best burger I've ever had.Let me start by saying I am so glad to have DMK Burger Bar in the neighborhood.  I live just two blocks away, and although we have plenty of great bars and fast food joints around, there's nothing as refined (yet affordable) in the Belmont/Sheffield area.  I told David Morton just that when he kindly came around to our table to ask us how our meal was.On to the food:  I ordered the Lamb Burger (#11) with feta cheese and olive tapenade. My burger was absolutely delicious- the meat just melted in your mouth and wasn't at all overwhelmed by the toppings.  I managed to snag a bite of two of my friends burgers- one with marinated portabella mushrooms (good but nothing to sing about) and the other with bacon & barbecue sauce (the sauce was really great- I'd order this one again if I can ever tear myself away from the Lamb Burger).  We all agreed that the Lamb Burger was the best on the table.We also ordered three kinds of fries: the original seasoned fries with house-made ketchup, the sweet potato fries, and the truffle oil fries.  The original & truffle oil fries were not crispy enough and we didn't really enjoy them. Everyone gobbled up the sweet-potato fries however, they were perfectly crisp and were served with a lemon aioli sauce.To top it all of was a short espresso milk shake.  I ate it all, I didn't want to share, and I could have ordered another.  There were crunchy bits in it- maybe chocolate covered coffee beans?  If you are a coffee lover like I am, order this one.  It's only $3 and the perfect size if you're drinking it alone.One more thing: about the crowd.  When we went last Thursday night around 6pm, our party of four was seated pretty quickly.  Last night I returned (around 8pm) to revisit the Lamb Burger I had been dreaming about all weekend, and another couple walked in right behind us.  There was a bit of a crowd waiting with drinks at the bar, and David Morton, who I recognized from my earlier visit, walked straight up to the other couple and sat them, totally ignoring me and my friend.  I was a little pissed off, until I looked at the couple and realized it was Alpana Singh from Check Please.  Minor Chicago Celebrity sighting!!  I'll give 'em that one, but when he returned and told us it would be a 35 minute wait, we decided to pass.  Go early to avoid the crowds!So there you have it:  5 stars for delicious burgers, shakes, and sweet potato fries- they make up for the crowds and the soggy truffle fries.

Reviews.Author: Marne O.
Reviews.Content: My friends and I tried to go to Kuma's while I visited Chicago but the wait was 2 hrs! So someone suggested DMK. GREAT IDEA (the wait was about 15 mins)! I had the #5 burger which has prosciutto and fontina cheese. it was delicious! The burger wasn't too thick like most gourmet burgers. It was a nice size but thin enough so it was easy to handle. I couldn't resist getting the battered pickles & okra with ranch dipping sauce. Fantastic! I'd recommend this joint to anyone in Chicago! They even serve a veggie burger which catered to my vegan pals! Yay!

Reviews.Author: Steven R.
Reviews.Content: Burger wars began after I moved to Chicago.  I'd heard of so many great places serving up meat n' cheese on a bun that I was determined to try as many as my cholesterol level would let me.DMK is kind of your great post-modern burger bar.  I feel there is a lot of style over substance.  DMK makes tasty concoctions but I can't help but feel that I'm really paying for the flavor and not the size or being truly full.  Don't get me wrong, the burgers are good but I don't know, there's just something missing here that keeps it from being an instant place that comes to mind when I want a burger.  Natural fed beef does make a different but it seems like the cooking of the patties is somewhat arbitrary as I've had one that was brown all the way and one with a whole loooootta pink.Also, I'm not sure what it is but this place seems to always have some group of insanely loud middle aged people going crazy at it.  The seating is close together too so you may catch more of other conversations that you want.  Thankfully the situation is ameliorated by a great selection of local beers and wines.  The wait can be a little nutty depending on the night, so keep that in mind.

Reviews.Author: Ashley B.
Reviews.Content: Loved it! We got in and out pretty quickly despite the fact that it was packed, and the food was great! I went with some die-hard burger fans and they loved it, but they still had some interesting choices for the non-conventional burger person like me. I had the lamb burger with tzatziki sauce and the works and it was delicious. Every burger was pretty much $8 and you could add sides for a few bucks more. Or, if you use foursquare, you can check in and get a free side of fries. We tried out the truffle cream and Wisconsin cheddar fries and they were so filling and rich it was ridiculous! I definitely recommend it for a nice lunch!UDPATE: Added another star. That's right. I went back here with my parents and boyfriend. My dad is a meat and potatoes kind of guy and was craving a burger. I mean I love their burger concoctions and sauces, but I was nervous that his plain, ketchup-only burger wouldn't impress him. I was wrong, he loved it and said the meat quality made that burger one of the best he's ever had, which, if you knew my dad, says a lot. Not to mention I came back and got the #2 and it was just as good as my previous favorite, the #11. Seriously, if you haven't been here yet, GO NOW.

Reviews.Author: Aaron T.
Reviews.Content: 1 star to start.Food (1 star):In the mood for hamburgers for lunch and stopped by this trendy spot.  Per the recommendation of my friend, I got the #4 (Roasted Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack, Smoked Bacon) and it was delicious!  The fried egg was the perfect complement and the burger was cooked to perfection.  The bun was also great and didn't get soggy or mushy like with other burgers, but definitely added some good flavor.  We also had garlic fries and sweet potato fries, both of which I would recommend.  We downed all of this with blood orange sodas, which are home-made, though this was probably the least tasty part of the meal.Service (1 star):The service here was pretty good as they get you seated quickly and check on you constantly.  Our waitress was very friendly and made some good recommendations, and shared a few laughs with us along the way.  They are very quick and you definitely feel the attentiveness here.Value (0.5 stars):Pricing was very reasonable here, though it would have been nice if the burgers came with a little something extra, like standard fries.  That being said, all burgers are $8 and are worth the price as everything about that screams fresh and high-quality.Experience (0.5 stars):When we first walked in, it was hard to tell this was a burger bar because of the dark interior and trendier atmosphere.  Seating is very open and spaced out.  I found myself craving for a bit more lighting inside but overall I enjoyed the simplistic and clean appointments.  I would definitely recommend checking this place out if you're craving a quality hamburger.Overall:1.0 - Baseline1.0 - Food1.0 - Service0.5 - Value0.5 - Experience=============4 stars

Reviews.Author: Kristy H.
Reviews.Content: Yuck.I would have given this place two stars (one for the interior design and one for the beer selection) had I not just been sick from it 3 hours after eating it.First, the beer selection is good. Not Hopleaf great, but good. My beer arrived in a red wine glass, which was kind of cool, but also kind of cheap. It definitely wasn't a pint. +1 starThe food is terrible. They are trying super hard to be cool and trendy. I can appreciate that. I mean, I love the kitsch at Eleven City Diner. Do your food right, then worry about the environment that goes along with it. My burger (the one w/ the sea salt chips) went half-eaten and I was starving. The meat was thin and served a bit cooler than medium. The parmesan fries w/ truffle aioli were uninspired. We asked for ketchup and even that wasn't good. The place was incredibly over-priced, too. They should charge $10 and give you your choice of fries; at least you feel like you're getting something for the value.Also, there should be some drink specials for weekends during the day. Every bar on Clark, Broadway, Sheffield, Diversey and Halsted had a special going on, from $2 PBR cans to $3 Goose Island drafts. DMK has to offer something to compensate for the food.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer M.
Reviews.Content: FOOD:GOOD, DELICIOUS quality burgers. You can definitely tell the difference in quality between these burgers and fast-food burgers. The meat is fresh, and the burger combos are original. Pretty reasonable price for them too. Their FRIES were pretty orgasmic, especially the sweet potato fries. I'm a sucker for them. 2nd best sweet potato fries I've had (next to Ruggles in Houston). ATMOSPHERE:Really chill and comfortable. Nicely decorated inside, kind of sexy, but not a dark sexy. More like a chic and modern sexy. Most of the time there's  a wait, but it's not too long and you can walk around the area while waiting.

Reviews.Author: Rachel S.
Reviews.Content: A bit out of the way for this Bucktown/Logan Square girl, but worth it.  One tasty grass-fed burger.I got the one with prosciutto and it rocked.  I can't wait to go back and try more!The only reason I had to bump this down from 5 stars was that the noise level was at 11.  Unlike many of my mid-twenties peers, I dislike noisy places.  Keep in mind, too, that I patronized DMK on a weeknight.

Reviews.Author: Grant G.
Reviews.Content: Went on a Tuesday evening around 8.30p with a friend and got a table right away.The good:- Fantastic burger.  The bun was surprisingly soft and just enough bread.  Everything came together perfectly.  No condiments necessary.  The meat was extremely savory, probably had a lot of sodium.- Fries were really tasty albeit a bit greasy.  When it comes to ketchup, I'm a die-hard Heinz fan but their house stuff was good, even with the slight chipotle flavor even given that I think chipotle is over-played.- Great beer lineup.  Wish there were some imports on the list though.- Our server, Marina Z, was fantastic in every way.  Perfect timing, demeanor and response!The so-so:- The tall chairs suck.  Too small and not the most sturdy.Summary is that they keep it simple and do it well.  Sit booth side if possible.  Wait worthiness:  less than 45 min.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie L.
Reviews.Content: Holla new burger joint!  For the first time, I was excited to go to a burger joint....because of my new found love of beef :)Well, this place was JAMMED on a Tuesday.  Not when we first walked in but by the time we left, there wasnt a seat in the joint!  Now, they must be doing something right.  So I have to admit, I can put away some food  and drink.  I slooshed down some hefeweizen....they have a pretty good beer list.  Which I was surprised by.I ate the fried pickles and okra & the #2 burger (yummy fried onions, blue cheese and sauce)....PERFECTION!  We also had the standard fries, along with the truffle fries and the sweet potato fries....we were celebrating ok....dont judge.  It was totally CHEAP too!  And surprisingly, I was just right as far as being full...wasnt stuffed and definitely not still hungry.   Service was just ok and they only have one bathroom per gender....with a packed house of people throwing back good beers and burgers...maybe want to reconsider that (minus a star).Overall, I would def go back.  I really wanted to try the lamb...alas, I had to go with the beef burger.  But next time, its a done deal.

Reviews.Author: Lia V.
Reviews.Content: Truffle Cream Dipping Sauce. I want to swim in a kiddie pool of this amazing substance. If you like truffles... you MUST get the Parmesan fries with truffle cream. I really don't have anything else to say except... oh ... that's right... their burgers are FANTASTIC. Bison Burger = heavenly... Portobello Burger = defreakinlicious and largest portobello I've seen in my life...Turkey Burger= fresh and phenomenal. But wait... I can go on... PACKED on a tuesday night... I mean what? I've lived down the street from this place for over a year and have never been. What was I thinking? DELICIOUS BEER! Amazing selection and they give out free beer coupons... I mean come on now... Hot bartender? Whaaat? This is like becoming my favorite neighborhood hang out!So basically I highly suggest this place.

Reviews.Author: Marjorie F.
Reviews.Content: This place has really grown on me.  I have tried almost of all of the burgers and have found a few favorites.  Top on the list is their Turkey Burger!  Haven't found another place that can beat it...Now that I have given up meat for lent I'm all about the mac n' cheese.  Not the same without the luscious touch of bacon, but I'll live!It has become my go-to place after work with friends.  Keep up the good work!

Reviews.Author: Liz K.
Reviews.Content: For some reason, I decided it would be a good idea to come here on a Saturday. Don't ask me why. The wait really wasn't terrible, though. The bar was extremely crowded but people were polite and made room. Beer list was decent, and everything was priced as you'd expect in Chicago.As for the food, though... First, they sat us at a shared table... Across from each other. And it was so loud I could basically not hear what was being said to me. Other than that, though, service was quick. Everything on the menu is decently priced... I had the #1 burger which was bbq, bacon, cheddar, and onion. To be honest, I couldn't really taste the cheddar, bacon, or onion... But it was still pretty tasty. They sort of drowned it in bbq sauce.Also, we had the amish blue & smoked bacon fries... And those were great. Overall, the food is pretty good here but as everyone says, it doesn't measure up to Kuma's (in portion size or taste).

Reviews.Author: Tina M.
Reviews.Content: My first bite was just of the burger and it was amazing. Add the other flavors with the rest of the sandwich ingredients, and I was happy. Definitely over-filled my stomach and was far too full for the rest of the night.First went here on Saturday night at 8pm and the wait was 1:30-1:45. Came back the following day at 5pm and the wait was quoted 20-30 minutes but ended up only being 5 minutes. The food was really good, but I'm glad we didn't wait for over an hour on Saturday night! Our waitress was really cool and seemed to be excited about the food. The beer menu is also pretty good, although they only have the breweries on the wall - not the beers - so you need to get the menu from someone.

Reviews.Author: Ehow C.
Reviews.Content: My friend and I ordered an awkward takeout of truffle fries during our wait for Fish Bar. The fries had a good consistency, but lacked a little salt and any sort of truffle flavor. Not worth the $4.Whomp, maybe we'll sit down and order something next time.

Reviews.Author: Charles H.
Reviews.Content: So if Kuma's is the #1 burger spot in Chicago then perhaps DMK is #2. The dining experience was fabulous!  I ordered a #1 - aged cheddar, smoked bacon, charred balsamic red onions, rufu teague BBQ sauce.  The beef was tender as advertised from being grass feed.  The only drawback was the over abundant amount of BBQ on the burger.For sides we ordered sweet potato fries with lemon tobasco aioli and the wisconsin cheddar / scallion fries.  Perhaps we got a bad batch of cheddar as the cheese taste was hidden.  The sweet potato fries rocked.  My buddy enjoyed his #4 - roasted hatch green chili, egg, sonoma jack, smoked bacon.  As with any good restaurant in Chicago there's wait for a table (no reservations at DMK) or first come / first serve at the bar.  Expect a 45 minute wait during a peak hour or come at 8pm for immediate seating.

Reviews.Author: Emily C.
Reviews.Content: Best burgers I've had in Chicago. I also admire their commitment to American beers. This place only serves domestic beers, and it really shows the customers how far domestic craft brewing has come in recent years. They consistently have 6 options on tap, as well as an extensive bottle list. I live right down the street, so I've tried almost everything on the menu. My three favorite burgers are: (1) the green chili burger with a fried egg on top -- note: the green chilis are delivered fresh from New Mexico!; (2) the patty melt -- the rye bread really brings out the meat's flavor; and (3) the Amish blue with onion straws -- strong blue cheese flavor with some added crunch.I'd also like to give a shout-out to the "Big DMK", which is actually a Big Mac in disguise.The macaroni and cheese is fantastic and often overlooked. It comes baked in a little dish with a hard crust on top. I like the one with grilled onions on the bottom. Even the salads are good.Whatever you do, don't forget to order fries for the table. All of them are fried in beef fat, which makes them extra-savory and delicious. My favorite are the sweet potato fries with lemon aioli.The only downside of dining at DMK is the food coma that inevitably follows. After eating a full burger and small plate of fries, I literally had to take the afternoon off last year in order to rest. So, take it easy, but don't let that stop you!

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: It's been 3 years since I've last visited Chicago. There were so many restaurants that I've been wanting to visit. As a regular visitor of aht.seriouseats.com, I read up on DMK and immediately wanted to visit. Truffle oil in juicy burger on fresh baked bun. WTF? How can I not want to have that.I went in Thursday afternoon during my visit for LOLLAPALOOZA. It had a nice ambiance in the restaurant. Dim with some jammin' music but not too loud to distract you from your burger and beer enjoyment. This cute yet articulate waitress named Arianna served me that afternoon and she recommended number 2.  Grass-Fed juicy beef on fresh baked buns with chili-rubbed onion strings, amish blue (strong blue) cheese and spicy chipotle ketchup. I also had a small order of russet potato fries with paramesan and truffle cream.I loved the burger. I love blue cheese, strong blue cheese. Having the amish blue on the juicy beef was fantastic. It sorely reminds me of having steaks at Ruth's Chris topping it with blue cheese. Maybe I'm easily satisfied. Maybe I have been craving for a delicious patty for WAY too long, but what I had and felt about the burger that day was awesomeness. I loved the chili rubbed onion string in the burger. That was a nice touch.The fries with the truffle oil cream and the parmesan was pretty good, but the juicy patty and the buns and the blue cheese stood out for me. Thinking about it makes me crave for another one. I wish there is a DMK out here in L.A. Nice beats, cute waitress, awesome burger... what more can you ask for? Thanks Arianna.

Reviews.Author: Evelina L.
Reviews.Content: I am ALL about perfect food bites and ratios.  So, in my book - DMK has it all and definitely delivers the meat to bun to toppings ratio!All 6 of us ordered different burgers and they were all FANTASTIC, since we all had to share the deliciousness and pass around the joy :)My bison/blueberry bbq sauce one was the best, of course, but I would take the rest of the ones at the table any day of the week.  Too bad the lines are so long and its not in my hood, otherwise I will be there waaaay too much.

Reviews.Author: Mary H.
Reviews.Content: I am still utterly shocked by how much I loved this place. Mainly because 1. I'm not a big meat eater and 2. I'd heard mediocre reviews about it, so was anticipating a let down. But I could not have more wrong! I demolished the Bison burger with goat cheese and blueberry BBQ sauce and it was absolutely delicious (and I never eat burgers). We also ordered the sweet potato fries and the salted fries, both of which were A-OK. They have an extensive (and reasonably priced) cocktail list with something for everyone. Perhaps I eat out too much, but I didn't find this place to be as pricey as many of the reviewers have said. $40 for two gourmet burgers, two orders of fries and two fancy drinks is a good deal in my book. I will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Troy D.
Reviews.Content: Visited here on a recent vacation, at the recommendation of some friends.  I'd definitely recommend it to others and recommend going back.Fair warning -- the place is going to be busy.  Guaranteed.  Thursday night wait was a little unusually long, but certainly not unbearable.The beer selection is pretty good.  A friend from Cleveland joined us, and he was able to order the Cleveland hometown specialty (Great Lakes).  And -- the prices were pretty reasonable.Food-wise, wow, they did a good job.  The burgers (in my case, turkey with bacon/cheddar/BBQ sauce) was pretty darned good -- the fries (one order of sweet potato and one order of truffle) accented things pretty well, and we had enough to go around.It's perfect for a casual dinner with friends.

Reviews.Author: Patricia S.
Reviews.Content: The best casual burger place I've been to my whole life, hand's down. 'Nuff said.The service is impeccable. They read our minds, literally. I mean, we walked out thinking they had the table bugged. We just start talking about our thirst and they come over and ask for our drink order. We order mac and cheese to share, and it literally gets put on the table as we finish saying "... cheese #1" AND it was on the house. For free! WHAT?? We start biting into our burgers and rave about how good it is and we mention ketchup to each other... The waitress comes over, with ketchup, and asks us how it's going. We say "Great!, but we'd like some ketch.." and she says "oh, did you want ketchup" and sets it down. Come. On... you have to admit all of that is ridiculous.The house veggie and grain burger was the best veggie burger (especially house) I've ever had in my life! And it had eggplant on top! My favorite vegetable. The bun is nice and fluffy. The chipotle ketchup is a perfect touch. I was partial to the Wisconsin cheese and scallion fries. My friends loved the truffle and parmesan. Oh and the mac and cheese is prefect. I didn't want to share!We didn't order alcohol, but I noticed that they paid homage to some of my favorite drink spots in NYC: Madame Geneva and Death & Co. They both have absolutely amazing drinks, so I highly recommend. Note: If you ask for ketchup, they give you the chipotle ketchup by default. Slightly sweet, smokey and spicy. The specialty sodas are flat and bit too sweet. Skip it.

Reviews.Author: Lauren F.
Reviews.Content: A solid 4 stars.  DMK is no Kuma's Corner but I think they've got a good thing going here.  Great beer selection, grass fed beef, and unique toppings set DMK apart from some of the other "burger bars" that seem to have popped up everywhere.  We started with some onion straws and the fried pickles and okra...who doesn't love  fried vegetables to dip in ranch or DMK's tasty House Ketchup?!  Our server also gave us an order of the Mac & Cheese #1, not sure why, but we were very appreciative-it was delish!As for my burger, I tried the Holy Guac-Aioli Burger and it was sooo good!  Chorizo, guac, sonoma jack cheese, chipotle aioli?  Yes, please!  We cleaned the plates of both the sweet potato and the parmesan fries with truffle cream, they were tasty.  We were so stuffed that we didn't get to try the Pumpkin Milkshake that they had on special-guess that just means that we need to go back and save a little more room next time!

Reviews.Author: Claudia D.
Reviews.Content: The husband and I like to drop by after out patient visits to Illinois Masonic.At our last "lunch", we received terrible service compared to that received in the past.We were happy that DMK was busy at midday, but we had to ask 4 times to get water to drink.Our waitress basically ignored us to wait on a large party of men.  The other wait staff and bus boys took care of us, as best they could when walking by.  However, she was very efficient in handing over the bill.I had a turkey burger fixed like the lamb burger and was very happy with it and a lemonade.  I convinced the husband to try the bison burger which he didn't enjoy nearly as much as his usual, the number 8.I hope that the service change in direction doesn't become a pattern, because if it does, we won't be continuing customers at DMK.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca N.
Reviews.Content: Awesome place! Very extensive beer menu and very interesting cocktailsPeople at our table got hot spiked cider (delish), tequila w/ honey/lime/tea cocktail (even better) and the rhubarb cocktail (the best!)We shared the bison burger, crispy protabella and the patty melt. All were excellent--my favorite was the bison burger! The sides are probably the most fun part of the meal--we split  4 (overkill but why not)1. truffle fries2. cheddar and scallion3. sweat potato fries 4. onion stringsi cant even say which were the best because i was obsessed with them all!I would definitely come back to try the lamb burger and holy guacamole burger

Reviews.Author: Emily B.
Reviews.Content: Whether you are looking for a casual date venue, are starving and want to dive head-first into a plate of fooooooood, or have a sweet potato fry fetish, sometimes all you need in life is a burger and a beer.DMK is a great option for that. Essentially they do a a few things (burgers, fries, beers) and they do them right. Contrary to other well-known buger places like The Counter, DMK gives you several creative options for pre-built sandwiches/toppings, with the option to sub 1-2 things.  The beef is grass-fed, but I went with a veggie burger because I'm a sucker for a good one and heard great things. Ultimately, you're getting a gut-busting burger...not a patty from Portillo's. Was it the best I've ever had? Not quite...but it definitely will do the trick if you have a craving.The downsides are that the place doesn't take resos, so you'll be standing for a while in a loud, full-of-20-something's joint for a bit before you are seated (I think we waited about 30 minutes on a Thurs night @ 7:45pm). It also took quite a while to flag the attention of the bartender to fetch us a brew while we were waiting, which was kind of a bummer. It's also not the most intimate place in the world, with a long bar, communal tables, and two-tops that are very close together as the seating options.Other things: Food comes out fast. Fries come with dipping sauces. Super easy to get to off the Wellington Brown Line.

Reviews.Author: Leslie B.
Reviews.Content: Regardless of how fantastic DMK was, I believe there's something morally wrong with waiting an hour and 45 for a burger. However, my party was well prepared for the wait, so we went to Kirkwoods for a couple beers and came back in time to be seated. Luckily, we were seated in the back, otherwise I'm not sure we would have been able to hear each other talk at all. Our server was great, she was attentive and helpful without being pushy. She also recommended that we order two large fries instead of small individuals, which was a good call.The only blip in the service was that we got our drinks right after our meals came. I think we all hoped to have our beers a little earlier. They do have a fantastic beer list though, really difficult to choose from! The food was awesome, but I was expecting more of a "wow factor" than I got. They weren't overwhelming huge or overflowing with toppings, but it was very tasty. I had the number 1 and was not disappointed at all. The toppings were flavorful and the bun was great. We had both the truffle fries and sweet potato fries. The sweet potato were some of the best I've ever had. Super tasty and the lemon tabasco aioli complimented them really well. They also brought us fried pickles and okra on the house for the long wait which I think is a great move on the management's part. Overall, delicious food and service (besides the crazy wait). Our server even gave us $5 off the bill for "Love" which was cute. Will definitely return, but during the week or at an off-hour.

Reviews.Author: Jenn G.
Reviews.Content: I'll get right to the point - it ain't no Kuma's.Great space, cool vibe inside, good drink selection and good food.  But definitely doesn't hold a candle to Kuma's, which is the golden standard in my book.The fries were the best part of my meal (we sampled both the sweet potato and the cheese and scallion varieties).   So much so that we almost ordered thirds!The holy guac-aioli burger was good, but just wasn't as flavorful and memorable as I had anticipated. If you can walk right in and get a table, definitely check it out.  If I have to wait an hour for a table, the only place I'm willing to do that is Kuma's!

Reviews.Author: Amy H.
Reviews.Content: We are faithful watchers of Diners, Drive-Ins & Dives so we were looking forward to checking out DMK after a Cubs game last Saturday and it did not disappoint.  We had a big group, but were seated right away.  We started off with a couple orders of the fries (regular and sweet potato) and they were some of the best we ever had.The menu offers some unique flavors, making it difficult to make a selection.  I opted for the Bison Burger with blueberry BBQ and goat cheese and it was simply amazing.  We also tried the Lamb Burger with feta and tzatziki and it was equally as good.Definitely worth a trip!

Reviews.Author: Karen C.
Reviews.Content: Finally hit up DMK on a Saturday night... party of 2... so the wait time wasn't horrendous (I think we waited about 20 minutes). We were seated by the wait-station, which always irks me, but it wasn't too shabby. Elliot Ness beers were on special for $2 a pop, which I decided was the best deal in the entire city for a Saturday night.And here's where I have to enter my disclaimer... I don't eat beef. So, I'm not comparing this place to Kuma's or to any other burger-oriented eatery. I had the Salmon burger (delicious, the slaw on top was great! I really liked the bun, too.) and my friend had the Santo burger. We both had the Parmesan fries with Truffle Aioli. Good, good stuff. Those fries were amazing. Also, our waitress, Carly, was super nice.The crowd was mostly mid-20-somethings, with sprinklings of their parents... I had to laugh because I saw no fewer than 3 people using their cell phones as flashlights to be able to read the menu, due to the darkness of the restaurant. Overall, it was a great experience & I'm glad we went!

Reviews.Author: Dan L.
Reviews.Content: This is a solid burger place. I don't know why anyone compared this to Kuma's, but I guess if you put anything other than the usual on a beef patty, you have to be crazy and compared to the best. I went here with my fiancee and my gluttonous partner in crime Bart. I forgot how many patties he actually added to their rendition of the big mac, but the waitress had to make sure he was ok with how big it would be, and he didn't disappoint. I had the special which was supposed to be spicy, but I'd have to call bullshit because the sauce wasn't that spicy at all. The fries were good and we all left happily full. Also had some good beers to finish the meal. Good times.

Reviews.Author: Anna A.
Reviews.Content: GREAT FOOD, GREAT SERVICE!!My boyfriend recently moved to the area and we walked past this restaurant that was super crowded on a Wednesday night and we knew we had to try it! The music was too loud but the hostesses sat us very quickly and were so friendly. The waitress was also very attentive and friendly, despite it being completely packed. The cocktail/beer menu was amazing, we ended ordering mojitios, and they were delicious! For food we split the parmesan truffled fries, macaroni and cheese, and a Number One burger. Everything was fabulous! We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Damian C.
Reviews.Content: Torn.  Like, I liked it, but is it the cat's pajamas?  I dunno.For starter's, the burger is 5oz.  So if you need to satisfy a raging hunger and are expecting a half pound slab or red-meat goodness, you're SOL.  If you're expecting a puffy brioche or dense and salty bun to hold together your beefy and condiment-y concoction, think again.It's all a la carte.  That $9/burger price tag?  Know that the standard sides are NOT included.If you want to delete an item, fine; if you want to substitute, fahgettaboutit.  Want to customize your burger temperature?  No bueno.  This ain't no disco.  And it ain't no Counter Burger, either.All that being said, the food was good.  I wasn't overly thrilled, but I wasn't a hater, either.  The service was fairly quick for a Saturday lunch and, though the tables were a bit too cozy, I was able to enjoy great lunch conversation.  The options were not overly plentiful but enough to satisfy most palettes.  The overriding reason for our trip here was for truffle fries (SERIOUS CRAVING), but when it came to the actual burger, I was on the fence between the #1 (bacon, cheddar, BBQ, sans onions) and the special (chicken caesar burger with garlic and other goodies); the waitress recommended the #1.  For $13, it was not a lot of food, but everything did taste great.  Honestly, my favorite part of the burger was the bun; fairly thin, super soft, just delicious.  If I could buy a bag of just those, I would be happy.  I also appreciated the side of truffle aioli that came with my fries; I spread a good portion of it on my burger to add some extra flavor!  Good?  Yes.  Overpriced?  A bit.  Maybe it's the neighbor's cat's pajamas.

Reviews.Author: Bobs C.
Reviews.Content: I had the Patty melt and Wisconsin Cheddar and Scallion fries and they were amazing! I took one of my buddies who was visiting from Tampa, Fla and he thought this place was Heaven! I would recommend DMK to anyone coming from out of town or local! I might have my wedding reception here hahah!10/10

Reviews.Author: Jessica H.
Reviews.Content: Get the sweet potato fries with the lemon tobasco aioli and know that you've found heaven.  Pair that with the #2 (chili rubbed onion strings, chipotle ketchup and amish blue cheese) and you've got yourself an amazing take on the traditional burger and fries.  I just wish I had tried the fried pickles and okra to round out my meal!  We had a great time here with great craft beer and delicious burgers.  It was fairly easy to get a table but we were here on a Sunday at an off time.  Our server was great and everything was cooked perfectly.

Reviews.Author: Kristin S.
Reviews.Content: If you want a gourmet, fantastic burger that you don't have unhinge your jaw to eat, look no further. I'm stopping just short of saying DMK is my new favorite burger place in Chicago, but I'm pretty sure they've taken the crown. We went on a Saturday night, so yes, there was a wait. No big deal for us at all. We just went down the street to have a couple beers at a less crowded establishment. I would say that I probably would have preferred to sit at DMKs bar with their interesting beer and soda lists, so next time, I'll come early or on a week night to avoid the crowds.The atmosphere is fun and lively with a great beer list and an amazing burger menu that includes about 8 different burgers, so you can be sure to find something fun without being overwhelmed by a laundry list of options. The french fry list is also fun to peruse and at $2 for a healthy-portioned single order, why not try them all? We went a little overboard and ordered a burger and fry for each person, plus an order of the mac & cheese. I had the Italian burger which had pesto, fontina cheese, roasted peppers and salt & vinegar potato chips. Yep, chips on the burger. It was marvelous. All the toppings stayed put while I shoveled it in. So fantastic. I also tried a bite of the burger with the peppers and the fried egg. Also delicious, but I think my Italian was just a tiny bit better. The parmesan truffle fries are a must, but the sweet potato fries with their citrusy dipping sauce seriously rocked my world. With so much food, we couldn't even touch the mac & cheese, but it was cheesy and delicious heated up for lunch the next day, so I can only imagine what it would have tasted like, fresh, crisp and bubbling from the oven. Overall, it was a great dining experience with helpful service, gourmet burgers and unbelievably cheap prices for the quality of food you receive. I'm already trying to find a time to head back.

Reviews.Author: Shaun S.
Reviews.Content: Finally got a chance to visit DMK this evening. My wife and I were in the city for an appointment and timed it just right. I've been to Kuma's and this is a much more enjoyable environment, quieter and less snarky.The burgers were much more reasonably sized, I got the #5, an Italian themed with proscuitto, roasted red pepper, fontina and basil pesto. Nice bun, great flavor throughout.  My wife's taste are tomato and ketchup only... yeah, I know! We added the salt and cracked pepper fries, very nice fries, crisp and full of flavor... I don't want to know how many calories I consumed! Our server was great, helpful and explained all our options very well. My wife has already given the "go back" thumbs up.

Reviews.Author: John S.
Reviews.Content: Ate some deviled eggs and Fried Okra and dill pickles. Delish.Had the Bison burger. I was kinda bummer there wasn't a pretzel bun, but got over it.Washed it down with a Great Lakes Dortmunder Gold Lager. Starched it up with Parmesan truffle cream fries and Amish blue and smoked bacon fries.Then washed all that down with a Vanilla Espresso Buttershake. I felt like a millon bucks after a visit here!

Reviews.Author: Molly L.
Reviews.Content: I've been to DMK 4 or 5 times, and every time I've been very satisfied with my overall experience.Drinks: They have a great list of beers to choose from, and they make their own pop, which is great.Sides: The parmesean and truffle french fries are my favorite.The Burgers: Amazing! Truly the main event at DMK. The quality of beef is excellent. I've also had the turkey burger, which is very flavorful. The combination of toppings is sometimes surprising (goat cheese and blueberry bbq sauce?), but you can trust that the chef knows what he's doing. No substitutions are accepted, but you can leave off a topping if you want. Did I mention that they run between $8-11? Practically a steal for such a high-quality meal.Overall, DMK is a great place to grab a fantastic burger and an off-the-beaten-path craft beer for a very reasonable sum of money. Minus one star for loud music and too-dim lighting.

Reviews.Author: Sherry F.
Reviews.Content: Seriously the best fries I have ever had! Never been here before, had a Tuesday off and stopped in for lunch. The two of us had the deviled eggs app, split a small cheddar and scallion fries, he had a #1 burger and I had mac and cheese #2.  All of it just great!  The deviled eggs were like a perfect spring picnic . About the fries, I really hate to over exaggerate something, but both my husband and I said, almost simultaneously, "best fires I have ever had!" Our server (pretty sure it was Jack) was exactly what you want in a casual place like this. Super helpful, not at all cheezie, no type of programed "up-sell" type of dialog, not that you would need to push their offerings.  If I owned this place, I would be glad to have this waiter representing it.Food, service and price all spot on. I so will be back

Reviews.Author: Gareth D.
Reviews.Content: The pastrami/Reuben burger is great - the tasty salt and fat from the pastrami melts into the burger making it even more tender and mouthwatering. The size of the burgers is very manageable, which is appreciated, and gives you a chance to try the fried pickles/okra and some of their fries. I'm not a fan of the cheese sauce for the fries, bc while it doesn't seem like real Wisconsin cheddar to me, they were very responsive and informative about the wiener circle inspired recipe. Service has been good. Also discovered my absolute favorite beer here- the Domaine Dupage by Two Brothers. Yumm.

Reviews.Author: Doe L.
Reviews.Content: I got a #4 burger based on some recommendations i found online. The green chile was a little spicier than i had anticipated but the burger was rather yum. The bread was super soft and felt very nicely proportioned to everything else.The fries were DROOL. we had the sweet potato and the parmesan. Very opposite choices.. one sweet, one rich and savory..  but i enjoyed both of them a lot. The cons of this place is that it's very loud and the wait kind of long during busy hours. There's not a huge selection for the menu but they have some interesting things here.well worth checking out at least once. more often if you live in the area and can come during slower times.NOTE: show the waitress you checked into foursquare for a free small fry. (salt and pepper only i think)

Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: It was at the Chicago World Fair of 1893 that the hamburger made its American debut and has since become an undeniable precept of American cuisine. However, sometime between its introduction and 2009 something went terribly wrong. Did you know a McDonald's burger comes from factory farms and is made from roughly 400 corn-fed cows hopped up on antibiotics and then doused in ammonia to kill the crap (literally)? Gross.Alternatively, if Ronald McDonald had grown up in Berkley, California wearing Birkenstocks instead of clown shoes, DMK is the type of burger place he would have opened. The Lakeview burger joint, a product of Michael Kornick (mk) and David Morton, offers 9 intriguingly topped grass-fed burgers priced at $8 though their uniqueness can be alienating. The potato bun is a worthy delivery vehicle for the burger; the texture against the juicy burger is exceptional and it doesn't disintegrate into your hands - who wants to fork and knife a burger? My 3 favorite burgers:#2 Chili-Rubbed Onion Strings, Amish Blue, Spicy Chipotle Ketchup#4 Roasted Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg#9 The Patty MeltCondiments align with the establishment's food philosophy and are all housemade. Kornick's signature parmesan truffle fries from mk also make an appearance on the menu and are highly addictive. While the bar is committed to craft beer, and offers customers straightforward descriptions, the 6 taps and 26 bottles do not rotate - perhaps my only knock against the place. Overall, come here for a burger made with ethically and sustainably raised beef and wash it down with a decent craft beer. No reservations.

Reviews.Author: Diana P.
Reviews.Content: Sorry, DMK you did not do it for me.  With that said, I'm a vegetarian so I had the veggie burger which was yucky-way too many means and you can taste them with every bite.  The thin onion rings were greasy and the fried ocra and pickles-don't both.  My husband had the most popular rated burger and he wasn't blown away but said it was just "good".  This is one of those places we've been wanting to try for a long time but will not be back.Service was great, bar-like atmosphere, however food needs to go up a notch. Def better places like this in the city.

Reviews.Author: Adam S.
Reviews.Content: OK, with a couple caveats.It's a little disheartening when the fries are better than the burgers. We were a larger group (5) so we got two large orders of fries, the WI cheddar/scallions, and the amish bleu/bacon, both of which were outta this freakin world. I'd srsly come back there just for the fries, they were amazing in every way possible.The burgers were good, but nothing too special. Also, they call themselves a 'burger bar' but only allow you to have you burger cooked medium, w grass fed beef? That knocks a star off for certain. It was also loud as f*ck inside, we were in the back, and it was nigh on impossible to hear conversation at a normal volume; cue yelling the entire time we were in there. That's not a big deal for me perse, it's just a little annoying when you've got outta town pals, want to show them a cool place you've heard about but never been to, and you can't freaking talk.All in all good, I'd like to come back, but there's no way I'm going to wait for an hour, not even for those fries.

Reviews.Author: Randy R.
Reviews.Content: Have you ever had the pleasure of being served an amuse of french fries with two dipping sauces (Wisconsin cheddar and truffle aioli)?  If you answered no, then you need to make your way here because this place is the perfect blend of comfortable cuisine with playful upscale twists. Food was almost uniformly excellent (the one exception was that neither I nor my wife cared for the homemade ketchup at all, which is saying something because my wife might love ketchup more than me). Very nice beer list provides perfect accompaniments to the food and help cut through the richness. Finally, friendly and professional service was on point.

Reviews.Author: Rachel Z.
Reviews.Content: I always have trouble giving 5 stars to a restaurant because a dining experience is never perfect in my opinion.  We found parking right in front of DMK burger bar which was great because we could see our dog, who we left in the car, from the window.**I rarely review parking availability because I travel solely by the CTA.So we sat down and ordered a couple of their house made sodas, careful no free refills here, so you will be charged for each soda.  But the sodas are great tasting and worth the cost.We tried the sweet potato fries and the fries served with truffle sauce which I did not enjoy, but I LOVE SWEET POTATO fries.  I enjoyed a burger (all burgers are cooked medium temperature)  with bbq sauce, fried onions, and bacon, my favorite burger, and it was cooked to perfection.  We came here with a large group and everyone enjoyed their dining experience.  We even got a free carrot cake cupcake!  Yum yum yum!  The tab was $80 for 5 people.   Nicely done DMK, I will be back!

Reviews.Author: Borracho G.
Reviews.Content: When did the upscale burger craze start? Just glad to see that there are more options popping up to go get a tasty burger other than Kumas. I mean Kumas is good but it's almost become a Chicago point of interest with it's wait times. DMK is definitely a hipper joint with good tunes playing continuously and the menu is straight forward with good bar options. While Kumas burgers are bigger in size, DMK offers some unique side items that make up for their smaller patties. Deviled eggs being one of those sides and a must to try if you don't mind eggs or reliving childhood memories when the fridge was full of them after Easter, at least in my childhood. Another awesome side that  I tried was the wasabi coleslaw, so simple and yet the kick in the ass that coleslaw always needed. The fries are great and I swear are made in a non-vegan way by cooking them with some kind of animal fat like Hot Doug fries. Oh, if you couldn't tell by now, this is not a place to start of a diet. My only negative about the place is that you can't choose how you want your burger cooked and no substituted toppings so your forced to choose their custom creations. You can take off toppings though, like leaving the fried egg off since you may have had 3 deviled eggs already.I did give this place a extra star because the green chile they used on the #4 burger comes from Hatch N.M. and if you know about Hatch chile then you know its some of the best tasting green chile.To sum it up, I say give this place a try and if you don't want to wait then go fairly early because they do not take reservations. It will get packed and when it does the waitresses, though cute and spunky, start to be less attentive and forgetful.

Reviews.Author: nicole h.
Reviews.Content: Hungover?  This is your spot.  It'll fill up your tummy with classic bar goodness...and you'll be inspired to live again because of the FREAKING FRENCH FRIES.You can tell the dude in the kitchen knows his stuff.  The menu presents burger after burger...each as unique as the next.  They can tailor your pick if you're a non-carnivore (and their veggie patty is awesome).  The milkshakes are PERFECT...but oh my GOD the FRIES.  Get the parmesan fries with the truffle sauce.  I'm in love.  I think everyone who's had them is too.Just one request DMK...if you're listening...please put a special twist on the bloody mary.  It's good...but I KNOW you can do it up right :)

Reviews.Author: Meghan P.
Reviews.Content: So you want to have a good burger, well I'd say its a pretty DARN good one.  I went during the week and we still had to wait a good half hour to get seated.  We did however enjoy some choice beers at the bar while we waited.  The place can get a bit crowded, but only due to popularity.  Service was mediocre, our bartender was knowledgable of beers and a pleasure to chat with.  Our waitress seemed a little overwhelmed and not as helpful as we woulda liked since we hadn't been there before.Burger quality was good, a few unique choices made it difficult to choose from... in a good way of course!  Fries were by far the highlight... they are ordered a la carte and they have some unique choices for toppings/seasonings.  Overall its pretty good, negative things that make it lose a star or me coming back is the wait, overall atmosphere is a little too wrigleyville, and I'd rather wait any day for Kumas.  Sorry doesn't measure up.

Reviews.Author: Anna P.
Reviews.Content: My search for the best burger and brew place in Chicago recently brought me to DMK, the last place on my list of the most popular and talked about joints in the Second City. Overall, I had a great experience... The beer list was excellent - on the rec of the bartender I tried a fantastic beer I'd never heard of called "Brother Theolonius" The service was good - our waitress was attentive but not annoying and everything was as we asked for it.The atmosphere is sparse and a bit industrial but comfortable, and it's convenient to the Red and Brown lines. The food was decent - I had a turkey burger with horseradish, arugula and tomatoes and my boyfriend had the lamb burger greek style. In general I wasn't super excited about anything on the menu, but the burger was good and juicy and the price is right ($8). We also split two orders of fries: sweet potato (my usual favorite), and parmesan with truffle cream. I was a little disappointed with the fries, I think the ones at the Counter are much better. I'd go back if I were in the neighborhood, but since I live downtown if I truck all the way out to this area again I'll prob just end up at Kuma's (AGAIN!). Yes, it's a sickness.

Reviews.Author: Pascal M.
Reviews.Content: I don't know if I can give a burger join less than 4 stars. The best I can do is explain WHY I gave this one 4 stars. The restaurant's cool, nice lighting, and pretty chill. The bar's long, so a few friends and i took a seat and ordered some craft beer.Props for having a decent craft beerlist. The selection of burgers is great, a solid bouqet of combinations. The french fry options are nice and different, so everyone can get something else. My only quarrel with the burgers were that the patties were a bit thin. I like my burger between rare and medium. This particualr patty is one I would order rare, since it's thin enough to simply sear quickly on each side to meet my personal preferance of texture. Other than that, it's a great choice to bring some friends to pre-game, catch a meal after a ball game, or just get a good burger without a long wait.

Reviews.Author: Christina F.
Reviews.Content: Yummmmm-o! Marie was our server and she was awesome. Exceptional service, great recommendations and fast. Try the vanilla ginger soda! We started with fried pickles and okra then moved to the #4 and #9 with a side of blue cheese and bacon fries. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Author: Rouzhna N.
Reviews.Content: Good burger spot, especially if you're a loads-of-different-ingredients-on-your-burger kind of fellow! The parmesan, truffle fries are good. I was actually surprised when the fries just came out with truffle oil (not actually fried with it...). MMMM and mac&cheese is muy bueno! They also have a good drinks menu. This place is nice for getting together with friends for beer and burger (their kitchen is open late, which is really nice!)

Reviews.Author: Amanda G.
Reviews.Content: Went to DMK Burger Bar the week it opened but just getting to writing the review.    I enjoyed the atmosphere of the place and luckily we just got here before the rush turned into an 1.5 hr wait.  Its good, but I wouldn't wait that long for it.We had the Green Chile Burger w/ Fried Egg and #2 Burger with onions and spicy chipotle ketchup.   Out of the two, the green chile burger was by far my favorite.  The fried egg on top made a great combo with the other ingredients. I thought that DMK beer selection was amazing. They had some great options on the menu to try although the table next to us recommended us not to get the martinis because the size of the martini was small with an $11 price tag.Also got the sweet potato fries. Not my favorite sweet potato fries ever, in fact, thought they were too salty for my taste.All in all, you can get a good burger here, so try it!

Reviews.Author: John W.
Reviews.Content: I've criticized other burger joints for throwing exotic toppings on a bun just to be 'the crazy burger place.' DMK doesn't do that. Everything on the burger is made to enhance the meat (and it's good eat to start with).A lot of people complain about the noisy space. I'm almost deaf thanks to a well-spent youth, but everyone I've eaten with says it's true. I didn't notice.Maybe I was just in a good mood tonight, but everyone from the host to the waitress was completely crush-worthy.

Reviews.Author: Frank L.
Reviews.Content: HIGH expectations not met...All burgers $8, with a $3 option to double up. The triple deck burger is $11.most french fries comes in $2 single serve or $4 table size.I ordered the #1, bacon, aged cheddar, balsamic vinaigrette sauteed onions and bbq sauce. Upon first bite, the meat and bun were perfect. However, something was really lacking from this bbq bacon cheeseburger. The aged cheddar was barely noticeable. But when you tasted it, it tasted like aged cheese. The bacon strips were two thick, and when you bit into a piece, you couldn't bite through it because it was so thick. The onions failed to offer anything positive to the burger. Onions on a burger is such a simple concept, but by making the onions "gourmet" and sauteed in some balsamic vinaigrette made the onions way too sweet in conjunction with the bbq sauce. call me crazy, but i would have loved some large raw onion rings on this burger.My fiance had a "crispy" portobello sandiwch. Crispy here means the portobello was battered and deep fried. One bite and you get a myriad of flavors, but you also get a distinct taste of "deep fried oil" because the mushroom has so much room to soak up that oil. After a few bites it can be tough to stomach the oily-ness of this sandwich.We tried the salt and pepper seasoned fries with spicy ketchup and the sweet potato fries with lemon aoli. Both were good. The lemon aoli was sweet and surprising. It is one of those things that you don't want to eat on a french fry, but once you dip it, you just want to keep dipping again.The ambiance was too much for us. The music was blaring so loud in the "bar-like" atmosphere that we could barely hold a conversation because we were screaming "what did you say" at each other all night.the "house sodas" I would avoid. I thought a cherry home-made soda would be really great - but it tasted like fizzy cough syrup. The waitress kindly switched it with a blood orange soda, but it wasn't all that much better.Check out DMK burger if:you want your burgers more gourmet than extra value and you want fries that can withstand even the fiercest "french" cuisine.Skip the DMK for the MCD's if:you prefer your $8 to get your more than a burger, and want to be able to enjoy your meal without shouting to your dinner companions how "fancy" your food tries to be.

Reviews.Author: Christine M.
Reviews.Content: The burgers in this place definitely live up to the name of it, if you're going to have Burger in the title of your restaurant, you better have a darn good one. Lo and behold, it was fabulous. I had the BBQ Burger (can't remember the name) and split an order of the Bacon/Bleu Cheese Fries. I have never tasted something so heart-attack inducing delicious. I'm not sure what they do to the Bleu Cheese, but somehow it's turned into almost a sauce on top of the fries. I could have just eaten a bowl of that.Atmosphere is good, seems more conducive to smaller groups or daters. Service was also good. I was a bit surprised (and a tad annoyed) that they dimmed the lights down as much as they did, was difficult to see my food they were so low. But, bonus points for having EXCELLENT music taste and playing really great, non-maintream tunes. Not once did I hear Lady Gaga --- props to that DMK Burger Bar.

Reviews.Author: Not Eileen R.
Reviews.Content: Really expected more.  love mk, so why not dmk burger bar? Here's why:some creative combos, some run of the mill.  I had the lamb burger with taziki - good not great.My husband had something with bacon - it looked very fast food.fries are a la carte, that's fine - but no onion rings??! what!no fountain pop = no free refills boo!the service - I get it, this place is minutes from DePaul (get ready for it...i'm about to be an age-ist) but does my waitress have to look 17yr old.  This has a hot spot feel, why have minors working here.I'm a big carnivore, so I want my burgers big and juicy.  Not some wimpy over worked flat patty.  idk!  Maybe I was in a bad mood, the weather was crappy the day I went.  I will try again solely for my love of mk, but seriously you know there have to be expectations, i.e. Daniel Bouloud has a burger and the salivation starts just at the look of it! not here!!  It's really good, but my socks were still on my feet if you get my drift.

Reviews.Author: Amy H.
Reviews.Content: I think my hopes were too high for DMK. I truly have no active complaints, the beer list is fantastic, the space is comfortably chic and the food is great. But for some reason I walked away feeling "meh". I ordered the first burger on the menu, which includes barbecue sauce, onions, bacon and cheddar. We also ordered a side of the famous truffle fries. Everything was delicious, but I thought the burger could have had a larger patty (fatty coment) and been a little juicier. I'd had the truffle fries at the MK restaurant a few years back, and this less-expensive version lived up to those memories. I'd definitely return to DMK to try one of their more creative burgers. I've especially heard amazing things about the greek-inspired #10.

Reviews.Author: Kyle P.
Reviews.Content: 4.5 but would be a 5 star if the crowd was different and it cost just a little less.Great burger and the bun is off the hook.  I actually like the fact they are not 3/4 lb burgers like everywhere else i go.  The service is nice but a little bit of a wait because of douche bags love this place because red eye and chicago magazine rate it and the 25 year olds come running....good food try it and you will be able to go out after instead of rolling home like most of the killer burger places i go to

Reviews.Author: Andi M.
Reviews.Content: Solid burgers: grass fed beef, turkey, lamb, veggie and portobello. I have had 6 of the 14 ways to have the burger and so far, no disappointment.   I loved the number 11 turkey with roasted chiles. The parmesan truffle fries are great. They blood orange soda is great as well.  Young crowd, but who cares, sit at the bar and talk and have a good meal. Most nights during the week they are not busy.   I ate here 4 times in one week.  I never do that. This is a burger place.  Love it for what it is.   Good meat, consistently good service and great beer/wine selection.  Simplicity, and deliciousness. Oh it's LOUD.  But I don't care.

Reviews.Author: Jackie L.
Reviews.Content: Best burger I've ever eaten, and I mean it.Had the DMK #6: marinated portabello, blue brie, griddled scallions, dijonaise, topped with an egg with a side of parmesan, truffle cream fries.

Reviews.Author: Katie M.
Reviews.Content: Not worth the hype at all.It was okay.  Average beer list.  Decent crowd.  Decent burgers, but nothing at all to write home about.  For some reason it bothered me that my $8 burger was served on an appetizer plate.  I sort of like the idea that you can buy fries separately, but I felt sort of cheated.If this were an upscale burger place in, say, the middle on nowhere Iowa, it would be top-notch.  But in a city with a place like Kuma's or (Urban) Burger Bar on Halsted, save you money and go to a place where you'll be totally blown away.

Reviews.Author: Kim A.
Reviews.Content: DO go here if you:- don't mind waiting over an hour for a table- enjoy cheese fries- appreciate delicious beers and yummy cocktails- are not on a diet, or don't mind breaking your diet- do not mind being kinda sorta smushed (and not in the Jersey Shore way) in a booth or tableDO NOT go here if you:- get cranky waiting- are not comfortable with consuming mass amounts of fried food/red meat- need a giant plate for your meal- are on a dietCame here with a group of 5 on a Saturday evening, so yes, we had to wait. While it isn't the ideal situation, it's a reality of going to a really popular place on a Saturday. When we were finally seated, it was a little tight, but not too bad. Our server was friendly, and the service was prompt. The burgers were good, not great. Not Kuma's. I question some of their combinations. I also think I made the mistake of ordering mine "turkey"... I guess I should have gone with the beef. I had the #2 which is "Chili Rubbed Onion Strings, Amish Blue, Spicy Chipotle Ketchup"... like I said, not Kuma's. Also, someone had the bison burger and said it was delicious... next time, I think I'll try that.But the fries, oh wow. Cheddar and scallion fries. I repeat CHEDDAR AND SCALLION FRIES. Get them. Devour them. Maybe share, but you don't have to. It was a fun place, for sure. I think it's best for coming in later, ordering food, and lingering and enjoying all their cocktails. I'll be back, but still waiting to be wowed by a burger.

Reviews.Author: Karyn K.
Reviews.Content: So DMK has certainly upped the ante since I last reviewed. The #9 is my favorite.The beer list is fantastic and if you'd like the cap from your Magic Hat #9 they can make that happen. Mine last night was "you get what you give, so don't forget to live." Thanks to the bartender and waitress that got that to me because it's an awesome cap!The fries are delicious and so are the shakes. Fun place to have in the neighborhood!

Reviews.Author: Sid V.
Reviews.Content: Decent place, good burgers and fries and a solid beer list.  Younger crowd epitomizes the Lakeview neighborhood.  So why only three stars?  I feel similar such places like Burger Bar and Bad Apple transcend DMK in food (slightly), beer list variety, (esp. Bad Apple), atmosphere (again, only slightly) and value.  So, I'd go again for sure if nearby but wouldn't seek it out.  Bonus points for offering a burger with Hatch peppers, although it was really messy.

Reviews.Author: Sadat A.
Reviews.Content: BOOM. A solid top burger spot in the city.DMK Burger Bar you had me at HELLO with Gumball head on tap.The waitress was awesome that we had today, very friendly and well educated on the menu. She had a fun attitude that made our party feel comfortable.  The menu was full of tasty creations that made it hard for me to choose from (good thing). Honestly I was looking for a burger that was unlike all the other burgers in the city. At DMK I found that burger today. The burger bun was perfectly made and different from other rolls. I ordered the Big DMK and it was amazingly tasty. The fries and tater tots were fantastic addition to the meal. I was a little sad about the burger not coming with fries but it was cool. Good beer selection on tap and bottles. There cocktail menu is super bomb and well priced.I will be back soon.

Reviews.Author: caroline e.
Reviews.Content: Geeze, I couldn't believe how full this place was early on a Thursday evening! They must be doing something right. They had a great beer menu, but some of it was a tad overpriced IMO. The food was really good, but not all great. I liked the mac & cheese (the one with the bacon) A LOT. and those fried pickles were super tasty too. We couldn't decide which fries to order, but eventually went with the sweet potato - so good. The waitress had told us that the cheddar cheese were her fave and ended up sending us a small plate of them on the house. That was really above and beyond and much appreciated. All in all I liked the place but prob wouldn't go out of my way to eat here. Definitely stop by if you are in the area though.

Reviews.Author: Audrey W.
Reviews.Content: Three words: SWEET POTATO FRIES OMG the sweet potato fries are probably the best I have ever eaten. Lemon aioli dip makes it even better! Perfect to pair with a nice cold beer and a good burger. It is a little too loud in the burger bar, but it seems to be the trend around Chicago. My buddies also didn't enjoy their burgers as much as I enjoyed my green chile, fried egg, bacon burger. YUM.

Reviews.Author: Kelli A.
Reviews.Content: We had lucky timing. My hubby and I showed up tonight and it was almost completely packed. There were 2 spots left. We chose the spot at the end of the bar. Shortly after we were seated a crazy number of people were there waiting for tables. This place definitely gives off more of a bar than a restaurant feel but don't be fooled, because the food is quite tasty. I got the bison burger with fresh goat cheese, pickled red onions and blueberry bbq sauce. Cooked to perfection, all of these flavors mixed very well together. It was so good I would definitely order this again. My hubby went with the beef burger with chili-fried onions, amish blue and spicy chipotle ketchup. It was a solid burger. It was cooked perfectly and the chipotle ketchup was delicious, almost like bbq sauce. We shared a large order of the amish blue and smoked bacon fries. These were super tasty. The melted blue cheese was a perfect match for the bacon and fry combo. They have a great selection of beers and spirits. Their bottled beer list definitely caters to the American craft brew palette. We had good service. We were seating quickly, approached rather soon, and every time our drinks were almost empty the waitress appeared.

Reviews.Author: Melanie H.
Reviews.Content: DMK Burger Bar,The next time I am in Chicago you can count on me to seek you out for another good buirger & brew. p.s. I hope you rotate your beers on tap.So, let me take a couple of steps back and tell you Yelp readers why I love DMK Burger Bar. I was in Chicago a couple weeks back and was looking for a place within walking distance of my hotel where I could have something tasty with a couple of good local brews. I stumbled upon DMK burger bar, looked at the beer list and thought "Not only do they have mid-western brews on tap, but they also have Allagash. Must be good." I took a seat at the bar and ordered myself a turkey burger (which came with free fries?!) and started with Half Acre's 'Daisy Cutter Pale Ale', it was hoppy, but not too much that it overpowered my turkey burger. After I finished my turkey burger I had a nice conversation with the bar tender about various craft brews. I was impressed with how knowledgeable he was about craft brews nationwide. After a couple of complimentary samples, I told the bar tender that I wanted to try something else that was local that I would not be able to get on the east coast; he said "i'll pour you something that i know you will like." His pick was Two Brother's 'French Country Ale.' It was rockin'.I went to the Allagash brewery in Portland, ME the following week and since then have been telling every craft beer connoisseur about this new and upcoming brewery out of Warrenville, IL called 'Two Brothers.' I'm even following them on Twitter!Windy City/DMK Burger Bar/Lincoln Park/ Two Brothers- #winning

Reviews.Author: Sandy N.
Reviews.Content: Went for dinner with some friends a few weeks ago on a Wednesday night. The annoying thing was that we were waiting for one more person out of a group of 4, and the hostess wouldn't seat us. And 60% of the tables were empty. WTF? Anyway, it turns out the 4th person was just sitting at the bar, so then we got seated a minute later. But seriously though, that was lame.We all ordered different burgers and cut them into quarters to share. We had the bison burger, the big DMK (triple decker), the aged chedder burger (#1), and the crispy portabello. I definitely liked the bison, and the crispy portabello was really good, especially texturewise. We also tried the deviled eggs and the sweet potato and truffle fries. They have a loyalty card. I will never spend enough to get anything. Other than that, DMK is good for groups and burger-lovers alike.

Reviews.Author: Angelica S.
Reviews.Content: Went here for dinner with a few friends. I was really a fan. It is very different from Kumas so don't compare the two. The portions are smaller and they also have bison burgers (pretty good, must try!). But the style of their food is different, in a good way.I do love the fries. We had the blue cheese and bacon ones and the other were I think parm cheese with truffle cream. We got the second ones for free. We were debating which to get and went with our first choice. Our server came out with both. What a doll. I love places that do stuff like that.They have a nice beer selection. A lot of beers I've never heard of, but I love trying something new. Definitely need to come back to try some other burgers. I really enjoyed mine.

Reviews.Author: Annie K.
Reviews.Content: Got the number 4. It was a decent burger, but didn't exactly bring tears or anything.What WAS amazingly orgasmic though was their pineapple basil soda. Oh my... le drool. My prior beverage obsession was Native Foods' lavender lemonade, but that's starting to look like an old ex you want to forget. The pineapple basil soda has a very strong basil flavor, but I love that. Pieces of freshly ground basil and sweet pineapple with a tiny bit of fizziness. Super refreshing, especially when you're eating a greasy burger.Oh and...I did find a hair in my cheese fries which was doubly gross because it was all stringy with cheese, but the manager seemed very apologetic and took that right off our tab and gave us 2 drink cards. Meh. It happens I guess.It's also nice that they have smaller portions available for fries, so you can try a bunch of different ones!

Reviews.Author: Gigi Y.
Reviews.Content: Absolutely love this place! Can't go wrong with great quality burgers and astounding fried pickles and sweet potato fries! Their parm fries are good, but too much parmesan (and saltiness) for my liking.First time I tried DMK, i got their grass-fed lamb burger with feta + Tzatziki sauce; amazing! It's like having a gyro in a burger! (duh?) At any rate, it was delicious. My boyfriend had the Bison burger--blueberry BBQ sauce? Enough said.Next round I got the #4; although I'm a bit of a health freak, this burger didn't stop me; and it was sure well worth it! The smoked bacon (cuz bacon makes everything better) and roasted green chile was ridiculously awesome.What can I say? 4 stars--"Yay, I'm a fan." indeed.

Reviews.Author: Matt K.
Reviews.Content: The atmosphere in this place is awesome; the seating is interesting and almost forces you to meet people. The long table where everyone shares a seat reminded me of something like a beirgarten. Friendly people, good conversation and great food/beer is what you'll find here.The sweet potato fries are amazing and the portobello mushroom burger is fantastic. The pattie for the burger was very tasty.The servers are nice and the vibe is chill. This is a must go place for tourists like myself. If only to get a flavor of Chicago's hipster culture.

Reviews.Author: Kevin N.
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I went on a random Tuesday evening. The service was great and the food was even better. I ordered the Veggie burger (#15) and my girlfriend the the Greek burger (#11 we think). Both were extremely good and pretty unique. We plan on going back to try many other things on the menu that caught our eye. I strongly recommend!

Reviews.Author: Megan A.
Reviews.Content: Food is so delicious! #7 is a juicy big DMK burger that is well worth the $12 The truffle cream sauce with the Parmesan fries are awesome!I would definitely recommend going here!The only thing I wasn't too thrilled with was that it was too loud, you had to scream to talk to someone

Reviews.Author: Heather K.
Reviews.Content: Turkey burger was awesome. Truffle fries were fantastic.  Cupcakes were OK.I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Tu'ens N.
Reviews.Content: They make really good burgers and they are $8.50 which these days isn't too expensive for fancy burgers (half the price of rocket whose burger tastes like the embodyment of 2007, cheap Chinese truffle oil).  They are also kind of thin, which I really like.  The buns are really good -- soft and fresh.  The fries are also superb.  With various toppings (I tried the blue cheese something and the salt & pepper w home made ketchup).  And they too come in pretty small sizes (also come in larger ones) - so for $2 or $3 per type you can get a couple of different types and not end up with a lunch bag full of fries (like at Five Guys).

Reviews.Author: Irena A.
Reviews.Content: I went to DMK bar on a Friday night around 8. I was so happy that we did not have to wait to be seated. I wanted to try DMK because I wanted to compare it with the counter.. And also because the reviews on yelp were pretty good. My fiancé ordered the number 4 and he said he loved it! He really praised the bacon also. I ordered the veggie burger which left me kind of disappointed. The patty was fried and very greasy.. On a better note we shared the mac and cheese and that was perfectly creamy and cheesy!! We ordered to small sides of fries and they were OK. The sweet potato fries were not all that and the Parmesan ones just had Parmesan cheese sprinkled on top. Kind of bland...
