Service was OUTSTANDING! The waitress brought us a survey to complete and I really liked the sense of humor they used in creating the questions) We will definitely return.

Reviews.Author: E F.
Reviews.Content: Forget the yuppie-hipster atmosphere: the only thing that's truly AMAZING about this place is the fact that they serve grass-fed burgers, and their onion straws (THE best sh*t ever. promise!). In addition, I'm happy that they have decent cheeses (Wisconsin cheddar, hello??), the fries for those who like the fries--I don't, and some decent beer selections. However, at the end of the day, this is nothing but a burger place, and there's better options out there (who happen to not attract yuppie assh*les, by the way). BUT, DMK is at least trying and headed in the right direction with their grass-fed burgers.

Reviews.Author: Matt M.
Reviews.Content: DMK Burger Bar is a crowded, popular place that says they're a burger place.  While they do have some marginally innovative burgers, I think that the place is a 3-star joint.  Pros: great beer selection, *fantastic* fries (parmesan with truffle cream and sweet potato with tobasco aioli).  Decent burgers, if very small.  The portions on the sides make up for the smaller burgers a bit, though.Cons: there weren't really any, but given the hour wait at 8pm on a Thursday, there are definitely places I'd rather go.  Summary: Undoubtedly worth a try but not the return trip, and don't wait too long for a table.

Reviews.Author: Jessica G.
Reviews.Content: Sterile atmosphere, mediocre food, and sweet potato fries fried in beef fat.  No thanks.  My partner and I arrived before the rest of our table and so we were asked to sit at the bar.  Usually completely understandable, but seeing as the restaurant was more than half empty this seemed a little strange.  We both ordered a beer and when I asked if the total could be added to our table's bill I was met with some attitude.  So we paid our tab.  That was that.   I ordered the sw black bean burger and chili rubbed onion strings.  All just average.  Clumps of my onion stings were not properly fried---who wants wet batter in there basket?  Not me!  It is pretty obvious that the veg options here are an afterthought.  The only plus was our great waitress.  She was well versed on the menu,  treated our table to free fried pickles, and had a great attitude.

Reviews.Author: Shakeia T.
Reviews.Content: DMK - delicious. mmmm. *insert your own k word* :-)When I first walked in, I wondered if the D in DMK stood for dimly lit. This place is very cool, but it was just *really* dark. Like, strain-your-eyes-to-read-the-menu dark. The burger choices are great, but they do not allow substitutions. You can have items removed from your burger, but you can't switch it. It clearly states it on the menu. So, if you don't like the cheese on your burger, you can't switch to a different one. (I know, I asked.)  Substitutions aside, the burger & small fries was a great, filling portion. I also really liked the drink selection. DMK is definitely a cool, trendy burger spot.

Reviews.Author: Jen S.
Reviews.Content: Nice burger choices with quality ingredients. Took out a star because they don't allow substitutions. You can remove items from the burger, but you can't switch it with something else. The portions are fine. A few have complained about small portions but seriously, I think it's because everyone's used to gigantic portions in this country. Anyway, I recommend the Parmesan truffle fries. Nice drink selection. I feel that Kuma's has better burgers though.

Reviews.Author: Justin G.
Reviews.Content: The burgers are pretty delicious.  There were a few more things on the menu that I want to go back and try them.  Of course, I can't remember exactly what those are, or what was even on the burger I ate, but that's mostly because their burgers have numbers instead of names, and therefore make them difficult to recall.  The beer selection was good.  Not as good as Kuma's or the Bad Apple, but better than, say, The Counter.Some of the seating is a little close for my tastes, but that seems to be standard now when you're only dining with one other person.  Enjoyed it, will go again, and probably enjoy it again.After Kuma's, DMK is #2 for my Chicago burgers.  And number 2 to Kuma's is not a bad place to be at all.

Reviews.Author: Bonnie L.
Reviews.Content: Had the ever-popular #4, which has bacon, green chile, and fried egg served up on a pillow-soft bun. I really enjoyed it though my heart probably didn't.  Also had the truffle fries which were good too. We were there on a Wednesday and the place was packed. They looked like they were understaffed so the service was slow.On a side note, I don't get why people are so hung up on not being able to customize their orders. It's a burger, not world peace. If you want your burgers done your way, go to Burger King.

Reviews.Author: Mark F.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers and fries!  I had the lamb burger (#11) and it was wonderful.  We got two large orders of fries for the table and loved them.  Got the Wisconsin Cheese and sweet potato fries.  Yum.The only problem I had, which is a personal preference, was that I ordered a diet Coke and it came in a can.  When I go to a restaurant I usually expect a fountain Coke, which is always a treat.  If I wanted cans of Coke, I'd just open one up at home.Good night now.

Reviews.Author: Claudia C.
Reviews.Content: I was here on a Friday evening from about 7:30-9 and had a great experience. We didn't have to wait at all, got a table (well, end of one) for 6 of us, and were well-waited on by a kind staff. Their beer selection is very good (if not a tad overpriced, but for the quality of beer, I can't complain too much).The winners of the night were definitely THE FRIES. All of them. We had the truffle oil-parmesan fries, the sweet potato fries, and the onion strings (sure, technically not fries). They were all amazing.The burgers were pretty good. Nothing to write home about, but quality ingredients and interesting combos. If DMK weren't so far from the South Loop, I would probably be here a lot more.

Reviews.Author: Melissa S.
Reviews.Content: I just came home from watching one of my favorite bands play at the Vic. Correction. Having missed most of performance by one of my favorite bands playing at the Vic and spending the time instead in their basement bathroom barfing up my dinner, I just came home. Reason? DMK Burger Bar. WTF. How much grease is in this burger??? The bun was soaked through the center when I got it. I have weathered grease before, I am no stranger to it. But alas, my tummy and my love for this band were no match for the stomach wrecking destruction.And yes, I have been perfectly fine all the day. No sickness, nothing. And the only booze I had was, hey, my beer from DMK. But two stars because we had the bestest bartender/server lady. Super friendly, super patient, and super fast without being disingenuous. Now, all we need to work on is that ridiculously expensive stuff you guys dish out. A friend and I got between us a large fry plate, two burgers (all $8), and 2 beers... paid $34 without tip. Really, guys?EDIT:Boy says: "Any place that does NOT ask you how you want your burger done.... I mean.... Come on."

Reviews.Author: Julia R.
Reviews.Content: amazing burgers.  i'm a fan of burgers that arent 30 inches thick - so this place is perfect for me. They have a large selection of burgers including veggie if thats you're thing.   I've tried a few of their fancy burgers but overall my favorite is their classic plain ole' cheeseburger.  It pretty much blew me away for some reason.  There is something to be said when you can take a very classic thing and execute it perfectly.  I've never had to wait for a table here - but maybe i've not been in at peak times.  The servers are really nice and very attentive - and food always comes out fast.  Decor inside is trendy and music selection is always awesome.Last time I went I tried their ice cream cookie sandwiches - yum - i will be doing that again.Oh yeah - GRAVY FRIES GRAVY FRIES GRAVY FRIES.  so good.  so so good.

Reviews.Author: Jill S.
Reviews.Content: This place was hoppin'! It was a Friday night my boyfriend and I came to DMK. We got seats at the bar until our table was ready. At the bar we ordered beers (unfortunately they were out of the heffeweizen I wanted to try, but alagash was a great substitute) and the mac and cheese. DO get the mac n cheese, seriously great stuff there.We were seated pretty quickly. Tables are close together, and it's real loud in there so you will find yourself screaming across the table. We both ordered burgers... mine came with prosciutto and sea salt + vinegar chips, which was real good. I didn't realize however that there were chips both on my burger and on my side, because I also ordered sweet potato fries. Holy overload. My boyfriend's burger was a tad bit better than mine... It had green chiles on it that gave it a nice kick. A little disappointed that there are no choices when it comes to buns... but the bun was fine. The burgers are big... not thick, but big in circumference. Maybe expected a little bit more. Had wanted to try here for quite some time... but the burger was just alright. Think it's the toppings that make it. The service was great, really nice people! Seriously, don't forget to order the mac n cheese though...

Reviews.Author: Kelly W.
Reviews.Content: Listen, since becoming a yelper, I usually obsessively check up on a dining establish before for embarking on a food endeavor there. This did not happen in this case. A friend and I stumbled upon DMK and decided to give it a go for dinner. We were pretty convinced it was new and had just opened but apparently it's been around for just over a year.Anyway, I wasn't really sure what we were in for...We grabbed some seats up at the bar and explored our dining options while enjoying some two brothers (they have some great beers on tap, btw). After drooling over the options, I decided to go with the #2-- onion straws, blue cheese variety and chipotle ketchup. My friend did the #4 with the fired egg. And we added an order of sweet potato fries for good measure. I was digging the whole vibe of the place-- great old flicks on the tv and the BEST variety of tunes. Seriously. Al Green to Death Cab to Prince to Sting. Swoon. The burger was wonderful. I love that they do they more "diner style" thin patties-- really showcases all the flavors accompanying the meat, really well balanced. The guy next to me at the bar must have noticed my revelry because he tapped my shoulder and asked if I could confirm if I was indeed eating the #2. I did and he confirmed what his order would be. Oh! and the sauce for the sweet potato fries was heavenly.. as in, the fries could have merely been the vessel for the sauce to reach my mouth (but the fires were great too in this case).Really satisfying food, service and atmosphere. Will definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Mindy S.
Reviews.Content: DMK on a Saturday night, at 10:30pm was so busy! It certainly has become one of the neighborhood hangouts, which I am happy to see, since I was there about a year ago, and they were closing early due to lack of patrons.Chicago Grass Fed beef is their deal, and I have never had a bad burger here.  The stand-out dishes are fries - get any of the fries, just get them.  (the parmesean & truffle cream fries are mouth watering), and any of the burgers (particularly the #1, #2, #4).  The specialty drinks are nothing short of great, and I think their beer selection is worthy of a mention.I would definitely recommend DMK to get a fantastic burger/fries experience.

Reviews.Author: Claire M.
Reviews.Content: It is truly rare I travel into Lincoln Park for.. well, for anything.. but going for a burger? odd move.. but my friend had been told it was great so f it why not.The environment was, I guess what I would expect in lincoln park, "hip" and "trendy".. there was a big neon sign on the back wall that, to be honest, I dont recall what it said, but I do recall looking at it and then wondering 'why?'.. but as stated before, a burger joint in LP.. okee dokee..The burger. Thats the important thing.. Now i am a huge fan of Kumas.. I LOVE a good burger. capital letters love. my mouth drools. And for the burgers to be grass fed & organic pretty much makes me swoon.( Red meat, is not unhealthy people.. it can be exceptionally good for you... i digress..)My friend was starving and so we immediately put in an order for the mac & cheese #2.. gruyere and bacon. um, uh huh.. this is awesome..then the burgers.. To be honest, I was sort of hoping to have my burger jump off the page at me, but I kept wanting to combine different burgers.. in the end I decided with our amazing waitress's help.I got the number 6.. it had portabello, and blue brie, scallions and a dijonnaise .. it was the perfect size, it was perfectly cooked, I was thrilled..The friend got, i believe the #1, and it was devoured before I could suggest trying it.He also did the profoundly delicious thing of ordering a milkshake. A peanut butter milkshake.. Now, may I say.. holy shit. Thats a really good milk shake.So all & all, I liked it. Really good beer selection- they have an AWESOME beer selection. I only drink porters or stouts and they had several to choose from. Im usually lucky if a place has guinness.. and they were mostly, maybe all, small breweries. I was pleased and impressed.So I didnt like the decor.. it felt a little cold.. but man everything else was so very very worth the trip to an area I avoid.well done.OH! and we were told hours later by the friend that suggested it- the fries are insane. so... maybe 1 more trip to LP for some more burger.. Ill get some fries with that shake next time. (yeah, I totally just said that.. ugh.)

Reviews.Author: Andrew R.
Reviews.Content: Generally don't go with a full 5 stars for a place like this but I thought the concept, execution, ambiance and food was perfect for a hipster burger joint in Lincoln Park.  It was nothing fancy but it couldn't have met our expectations any better.  Exposed brick, chalkboard menu, good music and a packed house at 2pm on a Saturday.  The craft beer list was very impressive with many regional beers that are unavailable in STL.  Dogfish, Stone, Aligash, Two brother's and many more.  They even had many Goose Island products that we can not get our hands on.  It was packed but we were able to get beers and seated in a reasonable amount of time.  The list of burgers was extremely impressive and the quality and taste were right on.  I had the chili verde, bacon and fried egg burger and was in heaven.  It was messy but the bun held the contents in perfectly as to make it still enjoyable.  My wife's bison burger with goat cheese and blue berry bbq sauce was exceptional as well.  We had two different types of cheese fries for the table that were gourmet.  One had blue cheese and bacon and the other came with melted age chedder and scallions.  Thanks DMK, can't wait to come back.  Also thanks to Stone for making a great IPA.  And thanks for being extremely affordable.  Cheers

Reviews.Author: Andrea B.
Reviews.Content: I was hoping to write a review on a second visit, but since I haven't yet been back, I have to get it out of the way, and unfortunately, it will be a bit biased, but eh. My boyfriend and I love a damn good burger, so on our hunt for yummy burgers in Chicago, we came here. I was getting over a cold unfortunately, so my mind and attitude weren't completely down with the idea of eating red meat, but I figured I'd be fine as long as I could sit down right away and relax. Wrong. Why would I think that there would be empty seats on a Saturday night? We stood awkwardly by the front door with a few other parties while we waited for tables.  I was wobbly and really wanted some water; in all respects I should have gone home, but the plan was if we had to wait longer than 20 minutes or so, we were gone. ok fine. We were actually seated in about 10 minutes near the corner of the restaurant. If i weren't sick i would have had some beer, instead we got milkshakes which are thick and delicious, and I totally recommend them if you aren't of the beer persuasion. I ordered a basic cheeseburger with bacon and we also ordered fries. The food is meh. the atmosphere is meh. i couldn't hear a lot of what my boyfriend was saying because it was pretty noisy, which was to be expected. The burgers themselves aren't tastebud explosive, but in many respects they are good, just not Kuma's good (sorry...i have to compare almost everything to Kuma's; it's like my standard for analyzing burgers). I'm hoping that if i return here, I'll have a better update than this. We'll see. maybe if I get some beer in me, I'll be a bit more open to what DMK really has to offer!

Reviews.Author: Colt E.
Reviews.Content: I had heard a lot of good things about DMK. Only a few of those high hopes were met though. First off I can say that DMK service does an excellent job of flipping tables and keeping the line of people to eat moving. Our 20 minute wait went buy in a flash and the place was packed. Our waitress was very friendly and even though there was a slight mix up, she more than made up for it with a free dessert. The beer menu is great and exactly what you'd want at a burger place.But on the the burger...The menu wasn't quite as interesting to me as I had hoped, but there were a lot of good choices. I also applaud them for serving only grass fed beef and having turkey and veggie options. However, the burger patty was just so small...I feel like I could easily eat two burgers here. I guess that's why they're $8? If this place would double their patty size and increase the burger price a few bucks, my rating would immediately jump up to 4 stars. Oh well...back to Kuma's I go.

Reviews.Author: Sonia L.
Reviews.Content: Wow.  How convenient that this is placed at this prime location.  I came here drunk after the bar...and it was amazing.  I am not saying that either because I was drunk - I really do think it was amazing.  First of all, our waitress, Rene, was adorable!  Edward tried leaving his number for her, but that went to shit.  Anyway, the Bison Burger with Goat Cheese is phenomenal, and the Patty Melt with an egg on top looked good (thanks for sharing Edward).  We got sweet potato fries for the table, which obviously were scrumptious.  THEN!  Then Raymond, the manager, chatted us up for awhile, and gave us PB Vanilla milkshakes!  Delicious!  Cool!  One time I will come here sober.  Then maybe I can tell you a little something about the ambiance.

Reviews.Author: Sonal S.
Reviews.Content: Holy burger!  This place is amazing.  Not only does this place offer grass-fed beef burgers, but you can get bison here too!!  I recently became a huge lover of bison.  It's healthier for you and tastes so much better!  My bf and I shared a couple burgers that were so fresh and clearly hand made.  You can tell that the burger patties are made by hand.  Picking a side proved to be difficult because they don't just give you an order of fries.  You get to choose toppings!!  The parmesan & truffle oil fries were really good, but the blue cheese and bacon fries were SO ridiculous.  I couldn't stop eating them.  We also got a mac & cheese that was to die for that had bacon and gruyere cheese... YUM!!DMK also has an eclectic selection of beer to choose from!  So for all you burger and beer lovers, this is definitely a place you need to check out!  I think it was also recently checked out by Guy Fieri.  His signature was inked on one of the walls at DMK!  It's has been Food Network approved!

Reviews.Author: Manuel F.
Reviews.Content: Great service! Gregg the bar tender took great care.Excellent food too.  I thoroughly enjoyed the lamb burger that was unique.Looking forward to going back soon.

Reviews.Author: Genevieve S.
Reviews.Content: Although I don't eat meat, my husband and I love to check out burger places. Until we went to DMK, our favorite burger place was Captain Mike's in Kenosha- they also sell grass-fed beef. DMK seems to have a gourmet edge. The ingredients are purposeful and blend effortlessly without overpowering one another. The veggie and grain burger is out of this world! The fact that they sell grass-fed beef burgers and organic foods when possible puts them head of other burger places automatically! I love to support places that support sustainability.

Reviews.Author: Jason P.
Reviews.Content: Walking in on a Tuesday and sitting at the bar is an easy way to make sure that this place is not crowded at all.  Wearing Illini gear and talking to the bartender about the state of Illini sports got us a couple of free dishes as well, even though my vegetarianism did not let me enjoy them.  I went in knowing exactly what I wanted to order.  Veggie burger with eggplant and a decent helping of fries was calling my name.  The wrench was thrown in when the bartender informed me that the fries were made with beef fat.  Disappointed, I went for the mac and cheese as a consolation prize and it was ok.  Either way, I appreciated the heads up as well as the attempts at free food that my friend got down on.

Reviews.Author: Mike B.
Reviews.Content: D.M.K. Burgers ... stands for Da' Most Krunk Burgers.  This one is certainly worthy of the 5 star rating.  Great burgers, fantastic sides, good beer selection, a hoppin' crowd.  My experience was nothing short of amazing.  I am proud to add DMK to my definitive list of good burgers!Burgers - I got the #1, my mom got the #8 (yes, I treat my mom to epic burger meals0 [not to be confused with Epic Burger, which makes crappy hamburgers]+Both were really good.  The #8 is your traditional burger, but the #1 blew it away in my opinion.  +-NOTE:  both were on the spicy side.  I LOVED this, my mom didn't.  Take note of it, for what it's worth.Sides - Got the Fried Onions and the Sweet Potato Fries+The Fried Onions were very thin onion rings fried to perfection.  YOU MUST GET THEM+The Sweet Potato Fries were tasty and delicious.  A lot of places don't get the recipe right, and they end up being too sweet or tasting weird.  DMK nails it!+-Again, they were on the spicy side.  I loved it, my mom didn't.Drinks+Huge list of beers+Lots of good craft beers on tap-No prices on the menu - I HATE THISAtmosphere+The place was packed+Everyone was young+Everyone was having a good time+The wait was 15 minutes (Friday night 7pm)I WILL be back.

Reviews.Author: Sibi J.
Reviews.Content: Hands down this place is in the top 5 burger places in the city.. Generous portions, great craft beer and incredible burgers. What more can you ask for.. Since it is somewhat of a touristy area, the parking is harder to get, the service could use a little more attentiveness but apart from that this place rocks.Definitely worth a trip if you are in LP.

Reviews.Author: Dex Y.
Reviews.Content: Impressed on my first visit!Ordered lamb burger and Parmesan fries. Satisfied! The feta cheese in the burger definitely kicked it up a notch. The patty was juicy and flavorful. Buns were fresh and soft, but not macerated. The Parmesan fries was one of the best I'd ever had. Their food wasn't cheap at all, but I feel it's worth the prices.After a whole day of hangover I still remember the goodness. I think that says something.

Reviews.Author: Matt B.
Reviews.Content: Went here with a group of coworkers before we were going out for a night of drinking. Got in early, so they were able to seat our group of 8 pretty easily. The place filled up incredibly fast after we sat down. The staff were great and the service was quick. This was one of the best burgers I have had. I went with the champion (formerly named the Kaner), which is all based on Buffalo. This thing was awesome. Go get one. Also, the truffle fries were amazing. Will be going back here soon.

Reviews.Author: Anne L.
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I love this place. It is right around the corner from where we live so super convenient and we have only taken it to go cause they are usually packed. I always get the number 8 which is just an all American burger. It is always cooked perfectly and the meat is so tender and juicy. My husband on the other hand has ventured out and tried a few different burgers such as the number 5 the bison burger, number 9 the patty melt, number 11 the lamb, and the number 14 the salmon. He loved all of them and had no complaints. Fries are great and the special ketchup they make is delish. We love this place, need to actually eat in sometime!

Reviews.Author: Suzanne H.
Reviews.Content: GREAT food, very good service, wonderful ambiance.I had the turkey burger, hubs had the lamb burger.  Both were great, I liked mine better.  Only turkey burger I have had that is better was the hub's made at home.  It tasted like turkey--not some mash of mystery meat!We also had the fried pickles and okra--they were awesome.  I love fried pickles.  Very lightly fried, almost tempura like.  French fries--very good.One of the best things was something I have never had--the home made sodas.  Hubs had a ginger/vanilla one--it was good.  But I LOVED mine--it was strawberry/lemon and it was so refreshing  Wanted to try beer snow cone, but didn't........

Reviews.Author: Sarah M.
Reviews.Content: For my boyfriend and I, the key to getting seated right away was to go on the really freezing, snowy day last week at about 6pm. However, it did get packed shortly after we arrived. Fairly small place, but nice and cozy. The TVs "played" fireplace.Someone asked me "why does the vegetarian go to the new burger joint?" Well... they did have veggie options! I went with the grain-based burger. I did get it without tomato and eggplant... but hi, I do like lettuce. That would have been a nice addition... basic for burgers I thought? The burger was decent... the pesto mayo was tasty. Meat-eating boyfriend loved his burger and was done before I was. I like that you can get the french fry option as small portions or larger portions. We chose to get two small portions ($2/ea) which I felt were totally fine for both of us, plus we got to try each other's. The sweet potato fries were fabulous, and I don't even like sweet potatoes! I had the parmesan fries. Yay fries, boo weird truffle sauce that accompanied. The bar was good... tasty mojito, and a decent-sized beer list for the beer drinking, meat eating boyfriend.Beware... this does add up. Two burgers, two fries, a beer and a mojito ended up costing us $50ish with tip included in that.Boyfriend and I will go back... there's some mac and cheese waiting to be sampled by us both.

Reviews.Author: Alexander C.
Reviews.Content: This is NO Kumas.I have to get that out there right now.  If you are looking for the best hamburger please move on.  Even with Kumas now seemingly cutting a few corners (frozen patties?) it is still head and shoulders above this place.Maybe a bunch of under 25 kids from the sticks who just got to the big city think this is the "best", but hey there is a sucker moving here every day.  Getting by on your name and the location of the business will only last so long.  You will not be the new on the scene restaurant for long.Grass fed beef is a nice change, taste was good, excellent bun, it was "A-OK" but not the best or even in the top ten.  No soda refills is crazy.  Serving your small, "gourmet" burger on a 4 inch plate is funny.  Tasty sweet potato fries.  Two of us got out of there for $50 with two burgers, the small sweet potato fries, a so-so vanilla shake, and a couple of cocktails.I will say this after my visit.  It made me want to visit Kumas again.

Reviews.Author: Justin R.
Reviews.Content: After reading so much about this place, my wife and I finally tried it last night.  It's as good as advertised.  The burgers were terrific, as was the mac & cheese (#1) and the salt and pepper fries (although they had a bit too much pepper).  Make sure to try the carrot cake cupcake and double chocolate ice cream sandwich, if you have room. Probably the only drawback is the wait (but hey, the place is good so it's not a surprise), and the volume.  You're pretty much yelling at each other when it's crowded.

Reviews.Author: Unknown
Reviews.Content: The burgers in this place definitely live up to the name of it, if you're going to have Burger in the title of your restaurant, you better have a darn good one. Lo and behold, it was fabulous. I had the BBQ Burger (can't remember the name) and split an order of the Bacon/Bleu Cheese Fries. I have never tasted something so heart-attack inducing delicious. I'm not sure what they do to the Bleu Cheese, but somehow it's turned into almost a sauce on top of the fries. I could have just eaten a bowl of that. Atmosphere is good, seems more conducive to smaller groups or daters. Service was also good. I was a bit surprised (and a tad annoyed) that they dimmed the lights down as much as they did, was difficult to see my food they were so low. But, bonus points for having EXCELLENT music taste and playing really great, non-maintream tunes. Not once did I hear Lady Gaga --- props to that DMK Burger Bar.

Reviews.Author: Duane M.
Reviews.Content: Walking in, the place is darker than most burger joints, but not club-like. The atmosphere is comfortable, enjoyable, and... well they were playing a muppets movie on the TVs. I really enjoyed the decor and the hostess was really on the ball.We showed up at 6:30 on a Thursday and were seated immediately. Our waitress, Kelly, was very prompt and courteous. She wasn't flirty or using any of the 'classic' waitress moves, she was just genuine and pleasant which is refreshing. Our drinks were delivered within a few minutes. Speaking of drinks, the beer selection isn't extensive, but the beers they have are quality. There wasn't a single beer on the menu I haven't had, but I have enjoyed each and every one in the past. I might add a few to their list, but there's nothing I'd take off. As for liquor, they know their bourbon, but they seem to neglect their scotch. Not that there's anything wrong with that, just not what I'm used to seeing.The food ordering process was simple (tip: as of the time of this writing, you get a free small order of fries if you check in on foursquare) and well laid out. One of the things that caught me off guard was that the waitress never asked how we want our burgers prepared. Instead the came out somewhere between medium and medium well. At first I was a little taken aback, but then realized that this isn't your standard burger joint nor is it a steak house. They know how their burgers are supposed to be made, and each one is prepared to the chef's specs. It may be a little arrogant, but the burgers came out perfectly so they obviously deserve to be a little arrogant.We had three kinds of fries on the table - truffle fries, sweet potato, and cheddar. Of the three, the cheddar were my least favorite, but they were still great. The sweet potato fries were damn near perfect. This place is a bit off the beaten path for my typical commute or night life, but if I find myself in Lincoln Park and someone asks where to eat, we're going back to DMK.

Reviews.Author: Vicky L.
Reviews.Content: Positioned between the Belmont and Fullerton train stops (closest to the Wellington station actually), DMK Burger Bar is a good place to go if you are looking for a solid bite before attending a show, which is what my friend Brandon and I did yesterday evening. For a "burger bar" the alcoholic beverages seem to dominate the burger selection, so you get to choose among 14 burgers and I believe the small print at the bottom noted that subtractions, but not substitutions, were allowed. There goes an opportunity for disappointment.For me, I had a pretty good time. I enjoyed my fresh salmon burger with red Thai curry sauce and some other ingredients that I can't recall. The sea salt fries with black pepper were very tasty. The meal overall left me quite thirsty and I'm glad I stuck with just water. The atmosphere is obnoxious for its noise and it reminds me of the Clark and Addison intersection which I always keep out of as if it's pollution. The menu prices are not the friendliest--$8 every burger, $2-8 fries, I didn't look at the drinks. But as someone who finds it difficult to eat fast or even finish overwhelming portions of food, the size of the burger is easy to eat. I like it. It's worth returning back here once in a while, but I would make sure you're going for the food, not to enjoy any kind of conversation or anything. Eat, Pay, Leave.

Reviews.Author: A.J. M.
Reviews.Content: As far as the food and drinks go, I was impressed. I had the number 2, which I enjoyed very much, even though I am not a big fan of bleu cheese. But nonetheless, it was an excellent burger, but not the best burger I've ever eaten. It's hard to screw up sweet potato fries, and DMK sure didn't, cause they were tasty. The beer list was pretty solid, especially the tap selection. I can't deny that I am more than happy to come back here and try their other burgers. I'm curious to see how good they are compared to the #2. So that being said, I really enjoyed this place.10-17-2010 NOTE: I have been here again. The #1 was better than the #2 in my opinion. Regardless, I love that this place is close to my apartment. And only 8 bucks a burger? talk to me.

Reviews.Author: Lisa K.
Reviews.Content: If I could give DMK 3.5 stars I would.  Alas, I do not think DMK is worthy of 4 stars, so 3 it is.It's not that I disliked the food at DMK.  My burger, the #8, was very tasty and just the right size so that I didn't feel stuffed.  (And the pickles were amazing!)  We ordered a round of every type of French Fry on the menu so that we could taste them all.  The blue cheese fries are the way to go, in my opinion.  I had one of their homemade blood orange sodas.  I had an ice cream cookie for dessert.  The food was definitely tasty, but not mind-blowingly good.The noise level is unbearable.  At times I couldn't hear what the person across from me, or the person next to me, were saying.  As the restaurant filled up the noise just got worse and worse as everyone in the restaurant was screaming.  In addition to the horrible noise, the lighting was so dark.  Stupidly dark.  It's OK to have enough light to read the menu, DMK!So would I go back?  Probably not.  If I lived in Lakeview I would probably return to DMK if someone suggested it and I had no counter suggestions.  However, not living in Lakeview, I wouldn't make a return trip just for DMK.

Reviews.Author: Danielle L.
Reviews.Content: The food was amazing.  The burgers were tender and juicy, the buns were fresh (I understand that they are made at the restaurant).  Everything was bursting with sophisticated flavor.  I had the #6, a burger with a portabello mushroom, brie and scallions, the gruyere mac n cheese, and a couple of sides of fries.  Even the fries had amazing flavor!  The drinks were delicious and potent: I had the sweet tea and a mojito.The only drawback to this place is the noise.  FYI:  Despite the classy food, it is a very casual bar-like atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth S.
Reviews.Content: This is one of those I'd really-like-to-give-it-3.5-stars type of reviews. If my expectations hadn't been so high going in, I might be generous enough to give 4, but since this place is much hyped, 3 it is.Here's the fundamental flaw of this place, in my opinion: for a "gourmet burger" concept, it's much more about the toppings than the burgers themselves. I ordered a turkey burger (call me a wuss if you must), and the meat, while well seasoned, played second fiddle to the bread and toppings. It was a thin patty. I can be down with that at Mickey D's, but at a high-falutin' burger joint, I want the meat to be the star.The other thing I didn't like was that everything seemed VERY salty. And you're talking to the girl who has the world's biggest salt tooth. I would freebase it if I could. But the deviled eggs - too salty.As others have mentioned, it IS loud. But the decor, the atmosphere, all that - I liked. Service was good. But after all was said and done, we'd spent about $60, and felt like we could've gotten more delicious burgers at Rocks.

Reviews.Author: Linda G.
Reviews.Content: This was a good choice for a beer and an "ART" Burger.They have very creative burgers and a fine selection of craft beers.I might be an eager eater, I feel like the burger could have been 30% bigger and I'd've been happier. Next time we'll each order one and another to split. The atmosphere is Industrial-hip. We sat at the bar and our bartender was very pleasant

Reviews.Author: Amanda T.
Reviews.Content: Holy hamburgers! There's like...a lot of burgers here!  The burger list is quite extensive and it definitely took me a minute and a half to decide what I wanted.  And then it took me another minute to decided whether or not I wanted a beef or turkey (or crispy portobello).  I opted for the beef this time, but next time I think I'd get the turkey. I sampled it from one of my friends, and I actually think it tastes better.  The burgers are pretty good, especially with the fried egg on top.  What makes DMK great is the other stuff:  the long list of craft beers (yum), the onion strings (yum), the fried pickles and okra (yum), and the fries (oh my goodness YUM)!  I came here with six other people, and let's just say we may got carried away and ordered too much. We ordered three types of fries to share between the seven of us, sweet potato, parmesan with truffle cream, and the Wisconsin cheddar.  There was a food surplus, but it was worth it.  Everything was delicious.   The service was a bit slow, but it was a Friday night, so it was expectedly busy.  And it would be so much easier if they took reservations.  Prices are decent and not overwhelming.  DMK is definitely one of my new favorite places. My Spidey senses tell me there will be many more turkey burger adventures here in the future.

Reviews.Author: Charlie M.
Reviews.Content: The thing I like most about DMK is that, yeah, it's a burger place, but it's approach is much more about an entire meal than it is about the burgers themselves.You go to Kuma's or Moody's and you're sitting down for a big goddamn burger. At DMK, you're sitting down more of a meal with a great burger as the cornerstone. The difference boils down to two things: burger size and everything else on the menu. The burgers aren't small here, but they're not the mammoth "side effects include drowsiness, coronary blockage and sore arms" types that other burger places make. Sometimes it's kind of nice to roll in and know you're not only getting a great burger, but that you'll probably be able to make room for cheese fries, maybe some mac, a couple great salad options and a beer or three. Someone below wrote that their beer selection was "average," which it is not to the point where it's ridiculous to even say. A wide range of beer types are represented from pilsner to imperial stout, though it's smartly skewed towards hoppier options, perfect for cutting through greasy fries and quality red meat.DMK doesn't lack the appreciation for burgers you'll find at the other great burger joints in Chicago, but it just seems to understand that burgers can be better off playing a role in something a little more well-rounded.

Reviews.Author: Jayne K.
Reviews.Content: To be honest, IDK why I don't love DMK more. Been here on Sun, Mon and Thursday nights so far and all of them have been super busy so they must be doing something right but its far from my favorite burger place in the Chi.DMK has several good things going for it. The beer selection is large and boutiquey. Can't speak to the shakes but who can go wrong with chocolate, peanut butter and ice cream? And its one of few places in Chicago that's paleo friendly. The beef is grass fed and the fries, which are all off the chain, are all fried in beef fat rather than oil. For me, it's a decent choice when I'm tired of cooking at home and for all its boutiquey-ness its actually pretty affordable. But the same things that make DMK good also make it fail to stand out. I mean spit in Chicago and you'll hit at least 5 bars who cater to the craft brew afficiando. And any burger place worth it's salt is going to have a fried egg and bacon burger. DMK tries to distinguish itself with unique pairings and seasonal offerings but to me they pale in comparison to what Kuma's offers on the regular. And unlike Kumas or Twisted Spoke, the atmosphere does little to make the wait palatable. Like I said, its always packed but that means you're cramped when you're waiting, cramped when you're eating and cramped when you're paying your check. Also, good luck trying to hold a conversation above the music and crowd noise. Overall, I'll probably go back to DMK, particularly in light of my current carnivorous diet, and the bomb ass service from Arianna (She's the bestest!) But I'll be wishing I were at Kumas, Twisted Spoke or Pour on Ashland.

Reviews.Author: Jenna M.
Reviews.Content: Considering the location and reputation for long waits, I was pleasantly surprised with the service. We arrived at 6:30 Friday night to put our names down until my friend arrived to complete our party. Grabbed some chairs at the bar and watched Talledega Nights while drinking some beers. The hostess came up to let us know she hadn't forgotten about us, which I appreciated. The bartenders were surprisingly easy to grab for reups and our waitress was friendly, attentive.The food was fine - our table had the #1, #4, #6, Mac and Cheese #2, Parm Truffle and sweet potato fries. I wish I had the simplest burger there so the beef could stand out. The patty size (1/4 pound?) and bun (generic white) do not hold up well to the more aggressive toppings.I'm glad I tried it, but probably won't go back. Will add this to my "good if you live in the neighborhood, but won't make an effort to return" list.

Reviews.Author: Evan S.
Reviews.Content: I'm down with DMK. I really like what they are doing in general. Local beers, involved with local nonprofits, real food. It's clever.Sometimes it's a little too local. Case in point, you have to sit at long tables so while you may be out on your first date, the couple next to you could be breaking up...you all get to share in the moment! Hooray! (ok, that exp ample may be a little extreme but you get the point.) Another thing on the ambiance, I'm not entirely sure what they are looking to accomplish with their TVs. Avatar was on without sound. It was weird.They are burger joint so get the burger. Don't waste you time with the lamb burger or anything else, it's not worth it.Final thought: if you aren't a foodie, you may not LOVE this place.

Reviews.Author: Adam K.
Reviews.Content: I give DMK Burger Bar an 82 out of 100.Minus 18 points for being a hipster enclave that really makes you feel ridiculous about going to a trendy and fashionable bar with loud music and a clubby atmosphere and then sitting down and ordering.....A burger.  At the end of the day I just feel like Milton from the Miller High Life commercials would go there and revoke their Miller High Life privileges.Positive points for a well-priced awesome perfectly executed burger.  You really can't argue with the quality of the burger.Positive points for fantastic fries and their cheddar sauce is amazing on the cheddar fries.  Again, just awesome.Positive points for Chili that was terrific.  It was like Cinci Chili, minus the noodles.Positive points for a good beer selection served in the great low ball pint glasses.Positive points for a good atmosphere; good people; good music; good staff; good décor; good lighting.Positive points for relatively good service, no complaints.  Good waiter, good bartender.Positive points for the guy on his double date next to us that fell off his stool and into my brother.  Friggin' hilarious.  Second date chances after that little stunt = ZERO.Positive points for our party of 6 all having rave reviews of ANYTHING that we ate there.Other:  I think Milton would go there, revoke their high life privileges, but then as he's waiting for his guys to haul the high life out of the place he'd sit down and have a great burger served by nice people and he'd change his mind.

Reviews.Author: Kelcey K.
Reviews.Content: I think I ordered a number 10 - Turkey with smoked swiss, tomato, Arugula and Dijonnaise and we also shared a sweet potato fries. I loved my burger. The bun was crispy on the outside and ultra soft on the inside and when you bite into it, it still held up firm; it didn't crumble making it a mess to eat. Fabulous. The patty itself was juicy and yummy. I think what beat this burger though, was their sweet potato fries! That was simply awesome albeit I thought it was too salty and tried to shake the salt bits off before consuming it. It wasn't too greasy but it was crispy enough and the sweet taste of sweet potato was just heavenly! I'll be back DMK!

Reviews.Author: Jason B.
Reviews.Content: Epic. Got the number 2 burger and you can't go wrong think spices awesomeness with blue cheese - yum! We also had the sweet potato fries which were a wonderful spicy flavorgasm (just made that word up). Epic.

Reviews.Author: Yackisoba Y.
Reviews.Content: The burger = 100 percent delicious. The wait = 50 percent worth it.The noise level = 25 percent too loud.There's nothing worse than an overrated burger (ehm..Kumas), but DMK burger lives up to its reputation. This hipster-heavy dining establishment has a great menu that you don't have to make any alterations to (in fact, you can't ask for your burger a particular way -- they're all cooked the same, and there is no "rare" or "well done"). I've got the bison burger and the veggie burger. The bison was so juicy and ridiculously flavorful. The veggie burger, hands down the best veggie burger I've had in the city. It has eggplant on it and a spicy kick.The sweet potato fries are SO worth the calories (I know calories shouldn't matter if you're in a burger bar, but still, a calorie is a calorie). The one thing I haven't had yet but looks delicious is the chocolate milkshake. That's next on the list.The only reason this place doesn't get five stars is because of the noise level. We sat at a picnic style table across from each other and there were a lot of "What?"s and "What, who?"s. The wait is a little high (about 30-45 minutes both times I've been), but turn-over is fast -- it's just that it's a popular place. Overall, I rate DMK the highest on my list for a burger in the city at this point. Definitely take an out-of-towner there...

Reviews.Author: Johanna P.
Reviews.Content: Pros: Decent burgers, really good friesCons: Super loud, super crowded, slow service

Reviews.Author: Adam M.
Reviews.Content: DMK Burger Bar is solid. They have a very good selection of different burgers. I went with the #4 Roasted Hatch Green Chili, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack and Smoked Bacon Burger. This burger was very good. This place also has a bunch of different options for the fries which I think is great. I really liked the Sweet Potato Fries and was also a fan of the Parmesan and Truffle Cream ones. Next time I might have to try the Amish Blue and Smoked Bacon. The specialty burger area is becoming slightly crowded with many good options in Chicago, but the location for DMK makes it very convenient so I will be going back.

Reviews.Author: Jennie P.
Reviews.Content: Burgers! Burgers! Burgers! (that's me chanting and banging my silverware on the table at the same time).Where do I begin - besides saying this was close, if not THE best burger I've had.  The bun was soft but toasted a little, not too big and not too much bread which is the WORST.I had the Bison Burger with a blueberry bbq sauce and onions on top - my mouth is watering again as I type this.  It was amazing.We ordered a small fry to split for two people, their standard fries which were sea salt and pepper and it was the perfect amount for two people to share.My husband had the burger which comes with tomatoes, iceburg lettuce, pickles - but he had the double patty.  He was LOVING it and admitted he had to slow down in an effort to not devour the whole thing in a milisecond.Beer selection was quite extensive - I didn't have the attention span to read all of them and settled on an India Pale Ale which was good.Ambiance was cool, a little dark, but I liked it.  We were there on a Sunday and there seemed to be a lot of parents there with their kids.  After thinking about it, I actually think it's a great spot to bring family and/or friends.Trust me, you won't be disappointed.  I'm looking forward to the next time we go.

Reviews.Author: Helena G.
Reviews.Content: I loved the number 5 burger! It comes in a very thin bread so I could appreciate the juicy and tender meat. I also enjoyed the berries sauce and the cheese goat. I highly recommend this place!

Reviews.Author: Tone F.
Reviews.Content: DMK is my default Burger place on the north side, NO QUESTION. Grass-fed, hand formed patties with bread made in-haus. Don't event get me started on the fries! One word, Truffle! They also do great with the beer and adult beverage selection. The staff take care of you and the food is in front of you before you expect it. They also have a loyalty card that also works at the Fish Bar, right next store. They also have a featured item that benefits a local non-profit in Chicago land on a monthly rotating basis. Do note that DMK is no reservatoins, but they've seemed to figure out the flip rate of the joint. Go hear and you will come back again, and again!

Reviews.Author: Molly B.
Reviews.Content: So far, DMK is the best burger I've tried in Chicago. What do I love the most? The variety! They pick out the most incredible flavors (case in point: the guacamole burger!), and I also love that the sizes aren't too big. I'm not afraid of a large meal, but I never leave DMK feeling overwhelmingly stuffed.The secret ace-in-the-hole here are the french fries. The bacon bleu cheese fries are a personal favorite, but don't let that prevent you from trying the truffle oil fries, the salt & pepper fries or the sweet potato fries! They're all delicious.The last thing I'll mention are the monthly specials. If there is any doubt in your mind, let me clear it up for you: you want to order them. They're always fresh and new- once I had sweet potato tater tots, and they were soooooooooooo good I went back twice that month!

Reviews.Author: Vivi W.
Reviews.Content: LOVE LOVE LOVE their burgers and truffle friesThey have great cocktail tooHowever, wait can be long, i mean long. And the restaurant is very noisy and I always have to scream in order to chat with my friends.

Reviews.Author: Katie S.
Reviews.Content: Mmmm DMK.  I want you all the time.My personal favorites: the bison burger with goat cheese, pickled onions, and blueberry BBQ sauce (OMG IT'S SO GOOD AAAAHHH), onion strings, deviled eggs just like my mama makes them, truffle fries, mac n cheese and any of their amazing milkshakes.Also - beer selection is not to be missed, and they make a very swiggable cocktail.Service can be a bit spotty but overall is pretty solid.

Reviews.Author: maurice s.
Reviews.Content: This is a nice bar with some pretty good food, but it's far from a high quality burger joint.  As others have mentioned, they don't allow you to specify doneness.  That's ridiculous for a "burger bar."  In my case, it resulted in a substantially overcooked, dry burger.  That sin alone makes them ineligible for more than 2 stars.  Also, it's insanely loud and expensive for what you get.  On the flip side, the salmon "burger" was one of the better fish sandwiches I've ever tasted.  It's not really a burger, but that's a good thing in this case.  Also, nice beer selection and good sweet potatoes fries.

Reviews.Author: michael s.
Reviews.Content: best. turkeyburger. ever. these guys take burgers to 11. amazing, thin soft potato flour bun; flavorful turkey burger was perfectly crisped on the outside, moist & delicious inside; sheep milk cheese and some kind of heavenly condiments on top, just flat out delicious.

Reviews.Author: Jeff D.
Reviews.Content: DMK is without question my favorite burger in Chicago.  Every time I go I get a different burger, and every time I'm amazed at the quality. Not the giant burgers that you'll find at other places, just great quality ingredients cooked flawlessly.  I love the ciabatta buns, and you can add an egg to any burger for $1!! Beer list is good, the fries are fantastic, and they make their own craft sodas!  Anytime I have someone in from out of town, I take them here for a burger and they're always amazed.  Plus, they're open pretty late even on weekdays.  If you're any kind of burger fan, you have to check this place out.

Reviews.Author: Carrie C.
Reviews.Content: DMK is a great place for a burger & fries. I haven't had anything that isn't amazing there. The Amish Blue burger is my favorite with the truffle fries. It's reasonably priced and they have a wide drink selection. Definitely try the monthly milkshake. They're always out of this world!

Reviews.Author: Dustin P.
Reviews.Content: I got the number five with the shake of the month (cookies n cream base with peanut butter) and the sweet potato fries. My girlfriend got a burger I can't remember which.I enjoyed the service, incredibly friendly server. We would have gotten some of their drink specials but they were very pricey.The burger was flavorful and deliciously my only qualm with it was the size. I was expecting the type of burger that's a challenge to finish, this was sizable but not huge. Good quality all around. The sauce pairing with the sweet potato fries was great.I recommend going there and trying some of the extensive beer list. It would provide a more substantial meal than I had. Still, a very nice place with quality food.One more thing- it's pretty dim in here, I don't really go for dim dining atmospheres. Not a make or break for me though.

Reviews.Author: N.A. S.
Reviews.Content: Very nice spot! Often too loud and too crowded, also the musical selection is often a pity! But there is definitely something special there... The TVs will display the game you want to see but if nothing is on, they play stuff you won't see elsewhere on TV, from classics like Pulp Fiction to corny blockbusters from the 80's that will make you laugh!The crowd, and noise can become ridiculous, but if you finish work late like me, you'll find sitting for one or two and a noise level that will allow you to talk, unlike what is said in previous comments. If your concern is the noise, avoid early evenings and Saturday afternoons, it is nice the rest of the time!The staff also is very nice. The manager is a great guy and a couple of bartenders really like their craft and will discuss cocktails with you (as elsewhere, a few employees are "meh"... but who cares?).The drink selection is serious, the beer selection beats of a lot of places!The food also is amazing. The beef patties are not too big (so that you can eats burgers on a regular basis!), the fries are very good, and the milkshakes are to die for! Check for their monthly specials (Lucky Charms milk shake or Peaches'n'Cream milkshake this month!).Only drawback about food is that the guys in the kitchen only let you remove ingredients, not substitute, so if you want to remove something funny, you don't have much left. I don't eat pork anymore so the #1 burger (even though it is delicious) is a little bit too simple once you remove the bacon from the equation!The number 8 burger is the sure choice if you want nothing surprising in your burger and it tastes great. They are also renowned for their veggie burgers but I did not give it a try yet...If you like burgers you can't go wrong here, and if not you'll probably find something you like, starting with an unusual atmosphere!

Reviews.Author: Derek B.
Reviews.Content: I've only been here once, but it's a burger I still think about.  I'm a pescetarian, and the server was very knowledgeable about the menu and my options ("This is cooked in _____").   The two burgers on the menu that I could have were amazing.  I split them both with a friend, and we left happy.  The drinks are great, reasonably priced.  And it's a great location.

Reviews.Author: Becky C.
Reviews.Content: The burgers were great here, but the noise was a bit much.  However, not enough to keep me away.  I liked how thin the burgers were and the fact I could take an entire bite without making a huge mess.  I feel like so many of the good burgers now need to be cut in half and eaten with a fork, I could hold this in both hands, take a bite and the burger didn't fall apart nor make a huge mess. Good beer list and the fries were good too.  I would love to see them add a porch too as that might make up for the noise if outside seating was an option.

Reviews.Author: Maxfield R.
Reviews.Content: SO and I hit it up hard on their third night.  Burgers 2 and 3, a couple beers, a couple wines, truffle fries, sweet potato fries, short shake, deviled eggs.Wrecked it all.Lots of love for the cheap Big Red wine and burger combo.Great service from our maitre'd MK himself, to our cute charming server (Katie?).  There was a little chaos all around us being that it was night 3, but our service was spot on.Great beef flavor in the burgers.And how can you go wrong with deviled eggs.Shortcomings:  Chocolate shake made with lousy chocolate syrup.  What passes for a shake here would insult back home.  Burgers are not cooked to order, they arrived a lovely medium, but nobody asked.

Reviews.Author: Trey A.
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed this place. I tried it with a buddy of mine who lives right down the street and Wow what a treat it was!!! Originally I had my heart set on Panes (a sandwich place next door that I cannot get enough of), however he recommended DMK and I reluctantly agreed. We both had number 1's which were good. We had a few locally brewed beers (they do have a nice selection) which is always an added bonus. In addition, we had the cheddar mac and cheese which was solid and some sweet potato french fries which were also very good.Service was also very nice/polite and timely for being so busy!The only reason I did not give it 5 stars was because of communal seating. Sitting right on top of people sucks as I have stated in previous reviews. Anyway, I think its good. I would compare my burger experience to somewhere in between 5 Guys and Kuma's Corner. Prices are more like Kuma's.  Would recommend!

Reviews.Author: Lisa K.
Reviews.Content: As everyone has said: 1)  it gets really, really busy so get here early if you don't like to wait.  We ate at 6pm on a Wednesday and by 6:30 there was a wait.2)  burgers are amazing -- on the smaller side (which I prefer).  Buns are nice - I hate having too much bread and not enough burger.3)  fries are good...I tried three kinds!4)  service is great - the man at the door seemed sincerely happy that we came by to eat and the servers were attentive but not overly so.5) great beers on tap -- not a lot but enough to satisfy whatever you're looking for.I'll be going back for sure!

Reviews.Author: Chad S.
Reviews.Content: To compare DMK to Kuma's is like comparing apples and oranges - they're just not the same thing. At all.That said, give me a burger at DMK over Kuma's any day.That Lamb Burger is out of this world and tastes EXACTLY like a greek salad; its delicious and about half way through eating mine I wanted to order another. Bonus for the vegan buns.Good cocktail menu and huge beer selection.We ordered the Parmesan Truffle and Cheddar Scallion fries - they were good, but almost too flavorful and I found myself just wanting regular fries. The cooking and texture of the fries was so perfect they didn't need anything else.Do yourself a favor and order an ice cream sandwich for dessert. You might think that you won't be able to handle it, that it'd be too much, that it won't be that good - You'd Be Wrong.

Reviews.Author: Neil R.
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure how this place is getting such positive feedback on the burgers.  Maybe people haven't been to Kuma's?  I fell for the hype and stopped in for lunch.  It was a mistake.  I ordered the Chili- Rubbed Onion Strings burger and was informed that it came with no side.  I have a real issue with serving something all alone, but anyway, I looked over the selection of fries, which all sounded interesting, and went with the truffle fries.  When it all arrived I thought I was at Mini's (remember that joint at Halstead and Armitage?)  The burger was small.  I think the miniature plates are there specifically to distract you from the portion size.  "DAMN that's huge! It's as big as the plate!" One highlight was the beer.  They have a decent selection but that alone can't overcome the tiny portions, high prices, and unimpressive burgers.  Sorry DMK, FAIL!

Reviews.Author: Cassie B.
Reviews.Content: This place is pretty awesome.I have spent a large amount of time and money here.  The burgers are great.  I especially like the lamb one.  The Parmesan fries with truffle cream are delicious too!  There is an amazing selection of very interesting beers and the service is great.  The people here are super friendly and cool.  All in all, this is a great place to sit at the bar, drink good beer, eat great food, and chat with good people.

Reviews.Author: Derek M.
Reviews.Content: Arrived at about 1:30 p.m. to a pretty empty restaurant, which was nice because the two of us were able to hear each other just fine and the music in the background was great.  Perfect volume and style.  Okay let's get to the meat of this conversation.The burger I had was great.  I like my burgers served hot and this one was just warm.  Cooked to perfection, but just a little cool for my taste. The fries are amazing.  Lauren was our server and was awesome.  I wish Lauren worked at every restaurant in Chicago.  It's not often you get a kind, genuine, funny server in Chicago. (full disclosure: I've never met the girl before).  Waters came to the table right away without ice, which is perfect so you're not asking all the time for a refill and you don't have piles of ice falling in your face. Get Lauren as your server, and go get a burger here.  It is great.  Sure wish there was an outside on a nice day.

Reviews.Author: Chris L.
Reviews.Content: So let me preface this review by saying that there were parts to our experience that were worth of 5 stars and other parts that justify the 3 star rating.  So the wife and I went here after hearing all kinds of great things from friends and coworkers.  We arrived a bit early on a Friday night (around 6pm) since we had heard that waits could reach around 45 min.  Being that we have a needy puppy at home, we wanted to avoid that kind of wait.  Thankfully, we were seated immediately. We were greeted by our waitress...or who we thought was our waitress shortly after sitting down.  Shortly after that, we were greeted by another waitress.  I'm not one to complain about 2 people making sure things are going well, but it was a bit odd.  Wifey and I ordered a beer off of the nice list.  We were impressed with the selection.  I had an Allagash and she had a Great Lakes...I think.  On to the food...I ordered an #1 and my wife ordered a #2.  With those, we ordered the sweet potato and the parmesan fries.  The fries were the highlight of the meal.  The sweet potato fries were paired with a great lemon aioli dipping sauce while the parmesan were paired with a truffle sauce.  My oh my!  The fries were crisp, the sauces provided a perfect compliment.  Frankly, I could have made a meal out of the different fries!  As for the burgers, this proved to be a little disappointing.  Quite frankly, when "Burger Bar" is in your name, you should spend a bit more time on the burgers.  All in all, I would say that my burger was just OK.  It was DEFINITELY NOT worth the $8 I paid for it, though.  The wife seemed to like hers, but I am not sure if she felt that it was worth the price either.  Our recommendation would be to make the burgers worthy of the $8 price tag.  I know this is become the en vogue thing (having an $8 burger, that is).  But it's quite disconcerting.  Kuma's has $10 burgers, but it is worthy of being a $10 burger considering the amount, flavor and quality of the burger.  Others have noted that the music was loud.  They are correct.  It is really loud.  Ultimately, we would come back to give it another try.  However, I'd hope that we find a burger worthy of the price tag and critical acclaim.  As of this time, I find that it has lived up to neither.  Maybe DMK should become a "Fry Bar" since that is where they shine.

Reviews.Author: Liz L.
Reviews.Content: Yum yum yum. Stuff my face. Yum yum yum.I have to preface this review that the only way I will eat a burger is with nothing on it except bleu cheese.  Seriously.DMK is delicious.  Their #8 burger altered to be plain with just bleu cheese is awesome.  I usually like a medium-rare burger, but these patties are pretty thin so it was leaning more towards medium.  However, I could still taste how good the meat was and the delicious cheese on top made it perfect.  The bun was tasty too, not overpowering.As for the fries, you can't go wrong with the truffle parmesan or the WI cheddar.  Seriously, I would take that cheddar and smear it all over my face if it meant I got to keep eating it.  It's THAT good.My only complaint is the noise level.  We went at 7PM on a Wednesday and I could barely hear my friend across our 2-top table.  Plus, I couldn't tell if the waitress had heard my order correctly, because I couldn't hear her repeat it back to me.  Turns out she got it right, so no worries!The staff is all really nice, even if they do all look 16 years old.

Reviews.Author: A. A.
Reviews.Content: Eat it Kuma's.  DMK just Slayed you.  Great burger concoctions, fries that can easily become a vice to the weak willed (especially the parmesan truffle fries, watch out), and they're not total douche-bag tools.  Everything I had tasted GREAT.  Yes, the meat was maybe not how Graham Elliot would rock a burger, but for what you pay, and the toppings you get (which is what I think is being focused on here), it is pretty killer.My only issue with this place was the speed of service, and that wasn't even that bad.  However, when the server did come around the service was great, unlike some burger places (*cough* Kuma's *cough*).Good thing this place isn't close to where I spend any good amount of time or else I may frequent it so much I would own stock in the place.

Reviews.Author: Steph P.
Reviews.Content: I was told that DMK had the best burgers around so I went to try it out, obviously. Turns out that they don't just have the best burgers-- but they also have the best fries and an awesome beer menu.I am always down with a burger, fries and beer so I suppose I'll always be down for some DMK. Our waitress was Marina (or at least that's what it said on the receipt) and she was super nice and attentive throughout our entire meal. Good food, great service, fun atmosphere = good, great, grand.

Reviews.Author: Sophie S.
Reviews.Content: Just came back from DMK. It was a Friday night so the wait was 40 minutes but we walked around and came back. The atmosphere is very loud and some tables are communal.The food came in reasonable time (considering the night). The burger was great. The bread was pretty unique and the flour added a nice texture. Extremely filling but not in a bad, greasy way. We also got the sweet potato and Wisconsin cheese fries to share. The sweet potato had a nice salty alioli to go along with it.

Reviews.Author: Shawn K.
Reviews.Content: DMK has the best burger I have ever eaten (no, I haven't been to Kuma's and yes I know that is sad).The various menu options are put together really well. They also have turkey and lamb burgers if you want to avoid beef.The fries are excellent. They have several styles to choose from at really cheap prices.The drink list is excellent. They don't have as big of a selection as Cooper's but the list is a lot longer than most places of this kind. Most of the drinks are not served a lot of places so it is a great place to try new drinks.

Reviews.Author: Kenneth L.
Reviews.Content: I would like to open my review by stating that you can add a fried egg to anything (OMG!!!). Other customizations include x2 or x3 your burger patty. This is definitely NOT the "best burger (I've) ever had" - not even by a long shot. It's actually a little bit disappointing considering that this place is advertised/spoken of as THE burger joint. With that said, I found my burger to be OK. The setting lends itself to being a really loud establishment with the bare brick walls, concrete floor and other hard surfaces. I'm not kidding when I say it's loud - be prepared to yell a conversation with the person sitting across from you. Truly a bar feel (maybe due to the huge BAR). As far as seating is concerned, you will find counter height tables in the front, regular tables in the back and a full bar in between. Expect a fairly long wait to be seated. Service can be a little difficult to come by. Friendly staff but not enough people to satisfyingly attend to everyone. This place has a great selection on the menu and very creative burger combos. With a price of $8 a burger, I would definitely return to try other menu items. EATED:Cheddar fries - actually a salty salty cheese sauce. I'm beginning to notice that this cheese sauce seems to be very popular in the Chicagoland area and it's reminiscent of the cheese "spread" in handi-snacks. The jury's still out on whether I like it or not. #1 Burger - (Aged Cheddar, Smoked Bacon, Charred Balsamic Red Onions, BBQ Sauce). Please note that the ingredients list is indicative of a sure-fire winner so you can imagine my dismay upon finding the final product to be only ok. Grass fed beef patty was a bit mushy, and lacking in flavor. Bun was delicious but the burger was a little bit of a disappointment overall. Portabello burger - surprisingly very good. The mushroom was lightly breaded w/ panko crust. The burger had a fantastic balance with the horseradish, arugula, marinated tomatoes, and fontina cheese. Same delicious bun. As I said above, I would absolutely return but I find it difficult to leave Evanston when Edzo's is right around the corner from me. Nevertheless, I'm still looking forward to round 2.

Reviews.Author: Jessica S.
Reviews.Content: Realllly yummy. Pretty cool atmosphere, good-looking staff, huge craft beer selection, I dig it.All of the burgers are $8 which is cool, they don't come with fries or anything but they are pretty cheap to order on the side ($1-$4). My boyfriend got some interesting burger with prosciutto on it and said "it was the best burger I've ever had" (he also hadn't eaten all day, but still.) They have a good, interesting selection of items, and plenty of options that don't have meat (veggie burgers, portobello, etc.) I got a crispy portobello burger and it was delicious. We split some blue cheese + bacon fries which were A+++++++++.The beer selection was vast and interesting, although pretty pricy but it's whatever considering how relatively inexpensive the food is.

Reviews.Author: Brian S.
Reviews.Content: I'm not the sort of reviewer who often puts on the loud accoutrement of superlatives, but if someone forced me -- at gunpoint, preferably -- to name the best new restaurant of 2010, I might be inclined to name DMK Burger Bar. Sure, it's mostly just burgers on the menu featuring ingredients we're all pretty familiar with, but DMK's philosophy shines like a gold thread through the fabric of their restaurant. I typically review food before finances, but the reasonable price-points at DMK -- for MK-quality ingredients, preparation, and aesthetic -- is the real sell here. What's more, several of their avant-garde cocktails are listed with a high-end and middle-ground spirit choice, depending on your budget. That way, everyone gets to enjoy the craftsmanship of a well-made mixed drink without having to pay $11 for top-shelf booze.Flavor profiles are pleasantly unbefitting a neighborhood that features such culinary and drinking atrocities as Uncle Fatty's Rum Resort (which manages to stay in business despite promoting itself as "Lakeview's #1 cover band venue"). Sure, it's burgers, but these are thoughtful burgers -- burgers that defy ketchup (unless it's homemade, seasoned with chipotle peppers, and accompanied by blue cheese and house-made onion strings). For months, the best burger on the menu featured prosciutto and vinegar potato chips -- a righteous combination of flavors and textures. The rest of the burgers (I've had most of them) come with tender, high-rise buns, grass-fed beef, and generous portions of great ingredients. Sides and desserts are great fun, too: The parmesan truffle fries best similar offerings at higher-end restaurants. A more -palatable version of ranch dressing (for the Uncle Fatty's crowd, no doubt) comes with a plate of perfectly fried okra and pickle spears. Really, we haven't had a real miss in terms of sides, and we've nearly tried them all thanks to their generosity: Either we're the most polite or critic-looking folks around, but Daniel and I consistently get offered free sides with our meals. Last night, the gravy fries we debated over getting (choosing instead the creamy, fork-friendly bleu cheese and bacon fries) arrived at our table, on the house. (We liked them, too, but wondered where the rest of the poutinesque accoutrements were?)I give this place my heartiest recommendation. It's the best resto Lakeview has seen in years, and the best interpretation of the burger trend of 2010.

Reviews.Author: April S.
Reviews.Content: This was by far the BEST damn veggie burger that EVER hit my lips!  No lie!  And not only was it freshly made and not some frozen crap that has been sitting in the freezer for years..but they had more than 1 option for vegetarians!!! Very rare! Fresh cut fries with truffle sauce was also amazing!! Try a local beer! They were so good! And the bartenders were great at suggesting just what I wanted.  Def be willing to wait..but SOOOO worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Steven C.
Reviews.Content: DMK is a straight-forward take on the burger bar trend that prides itself on grass-fed beef. I've only had a few things that were truly outstanding, but I like the simplicity and have only good things to say about the food and the service.The decor is a bit dull, but the bar restaurant is lively and welcoming of all ages. I've been twice on Sunday nights and have never had to wait to sit down despite a solid crowd.The menu is a one-pager, so not too many tough decisions unless you like decisions, then you might feel limited. There are about a dozen or so burgers on the menu, 3/4 of which are traditional beef and the others range from turkey and lamb to vegetarian options. I've tasted the lamb burger which is treated exactly like gyros, which was kind of cool if you're looking for something non-traditional.The burgers are really the perfect size and most of the flavors on them are pretty rich, so don't be shocked when a Kuma's-like behemoth doesn't show up on your plate. My favorite thing here is the #2 with Amish blue cheese and chili-rubbed onion straws. It also comes with their chipotle ketchup, which is the only ketchup they serve and its really excellent. I would buy it if they packed and sold it there. My absolute favorite thing here is the sweet potato fries with the lemon tobasco aioli. I was told this was the place for parmesean truffle fries, but I found them disappointing and still don't get the truffle oil thing. Just get the sea salt and black pepper or sweet potato fries.The craft beer selection is among Chicago's most respectable here as well, so it will be hard to pass up a drink if you are a fan of all the popular craft breweries in Chicago, Michigan and Indiana.

Reviews.Author: Steve W.
Reviews.Content: Sweet potato fries. You need them. Now, beyond that, the burgers are delicious. At first glance, the bread overhwelms the meat, but you take one bite and your tongue tells you otherwise. The bread is light and fluffy - not bready and dense. The 4 oz. patties are so deliciously beefy that it just overwhelms your tastebuds. Now, your choice of toppings can overwhelm the burger - stay away from the pastrami - it's unsurprisingly a bomb of salt. I'm partial to the more simple preparations - lettuce, tomato, onion pickles - just because that beef patty is so delicious. I enjoyed the brie and portobello and the bacon and cheddar ones as well. Also, since you're partaking of fries and burgers anyways, you might as well inhale a milkshake. The vanilla malt I had was delicious. Thick with that malty tang that you just need to have. Your body will forgive you. Come on, it was my first shake in at least a year.

Reviews.Author: Melissa W.
Reviews.Content: No, I will not wait over an hour for a burger in an odor intense, should-to-shoulder packed place where I need a megaphone to converse with one sitting 12 inches away.  This decision in combo with a recommendation from a friend took us to DMKBurger.  I've been here twice and foresee many more visits.  Why you ask?Food:  love, love, love.  Seriously, the burgers are yummy and the truffle fries makes your inner fatty cry out for more.  This is coming from someone who isn't a burger person yet who now randomly craves the loveliness that exists on DMK's menu.Beer:  Wide ranging and delicious.  We sat at the bar both times .  My boyfriend tends to be rather verbose with all. He was filling the ears of both the bartender and the manager with his chatter of beer brewing.  To his credit, we were directed to some rather tasty and obscure beers.  I thoroughly enjoy a good beer menu.Vibe:  DMK isn't pretentious while remaining upscale and energetic but comfortable and...chill? When we came in the second time, the manager (I think he's the manager) recognized us and told the bf about a new beer on the menu that he thought he'd like given his love of all things hoppy.  I was impressed that he made the connection.  The guy has some social superhero strengths.  And we appreciated the free beer card that he gave us from our first visit.  People can make or break a place.  He adds value.

Reviews.Author: Peter H.
Reviews.Content: I am surprised this place only has 3.5 stars.  I think it's the best burger joint in Chicago.  5 stars because:1) has a great beer list2) wait is not bad (atleast when I went there on a Thursday evening)3) burgers that you can actually eat without a fork/knife 4) awesome fries and a variety of them 5) fair prices for quality of food

Reviews.Author: Kate P.
Reviews.Content: The burgers here are great. My only knock, aside from how constantly busy it is, are the descriptions on the menu. They don't specify that each burger comes with a hamburger patty and everything listed is extra. For example, we wanted the mushroom blue cheese burger but weren't sure if that was a veggie burger.  Either way the food was great! We had the fries which were delicious and great for sharing. I have not had the mac 'n cheese but it always looks tempting when I see people get served it.The drinks are fantastic as well.  Wide variery of cocktails but ask for the list. They don't always offer it up and the chalkboard does not list drink descriptions.

Reviews.Author: Keith C.
