Reviews.Content: -Drinks; Good craft beers and margaritas were good too-Appies:  Fried okra - why have I never experienced you before DMK...this was my favorite thing about DMK.  -Dinner: Wife loved the grilled cheese. My buddies and I did family style with a few burgers.

Reviews.Author: Eli S.
Reviews.Content: Good ambiance and decent burgers with really interesting combinations. I tried they're blu cheese burger equivalent with fried onion rings. Pretty good, though the burgers weren't that big. The buns were really good. They were very busy so we weren't doted on by our server, but it wasn't too much of a botherThey also had a really great looking beer selection.It won't be my new go to burger joint place, but for a weekend night out eat, it would be sweet every once in a while.

Reviews.Author: Maggie M.
Reviews.Content: Disclaimer: I'm a vegetarian. We started with the Parmesan truffle fries which I have to say were amazing. Pretty much anything with truffle oil is fantastic. I ordered the House Veggie and Grain Burger and wasn't disappointed but was not impressed. The patty fell apart quickly, it was difficult to eat, and wasn't the delicious veggie burger I was looking for. From what I saw the "real" burgers looked very impressive and I highly encourage the meat-lovers out there to dig in! However, if you're a vegetarian I would maybe opt for one of their salads or the portobello mushroom burger.

Reviews.Author: John Z.
Reviews.Content: I had the Bison Burger with Goat Cheese, it was great. I also had the fries with Wisconsin Cheddar, they were good, very cheesy. Also a good selection of local brews. The place is not very big, and there can be a long wait, but it's worth it. I will be back.

Reviews.Author: matthew S.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers, great sides, great beer. In the class of burger bars, this is as good as gets. The place is always busy and it is often very loud, but mostly in a good way. DMK is fully ADA Accessible as far as I could tell.

Reviews.Author: Lauren C.
Reviews.Content: I like this place better than Kuma's. The proportions are much more feasible and they still have creativity with what they serve.I like that they do not have standard beers on their list and they make you get creative with what you order.I also like that they periodically give you free beer coupons to use on your next visit.This place is a win!

Reviews.Author: k E.
Reviews.Content: love love love this place!Inventive combinations.  Great prices!  The truffle fries are amazing.

Reviews.Author: Kristin S.
Reviews.Content: I'll be honest, after seeing DMK Burgers profiled on Diners, Drive Ins & Dives I was interested in checking DMK out, but didn't want to put my hopes up too high. Well....was I wrong. This place blew out any burger place (sorry Umami Burger) I've been to in a long time. First of all, the bison burger with blueberry bbq sauce and goat cheese smear -- let's all just agree it should be illegal. If I lived in Chicago I would be like 500lbs from heading to this place every chance I get. That burger alone would make me throw out my "I should step away from red meat" tendencies. My friend and I also ordered a small order of fries -- which were phenomenal, and big enough for the two of us.Another highlight was how great the waitstaff was -- our waitress was so sweet and very accommodating as I asked her for suggestions and then about Guy's visit. She also awarded us for my obvious tourist awkwardness with free Shamrock Shakes -- mint chocolate chip ice cream shake with....ready for this?......Lucky Charms sprinkled on top. That officially did me in.....other than, "I need to walk this off" -- I had no words after that. If you didn't get it from this review -- definitely check DMK Burger out. You don't be disappointed -- I'm already planning my next trip to Chicago so I can try the salmon burger.

Reviews.Author: Alicia D.
Reviews.Content: I ordered my food for carry out, and while the food itself was well made... it was cold. Cold burger and fries is never that good. Not to mention that whoever took my order had the worst customer service i've ever experienced. Kelsey was it? I have dietary restrictions that make it so I needed to modify my burger, only after I got the "well HONEY, that is our menu so thats how it is" did I explain that she could do whatever she needed (i.e. charge more for sides or whatever) so that I could order a meal that I could actually eat. When I picked up the food I didn't get any enthusiasm or smiles from the gentlemen that rung me up, but nonetheless my food was good considering the temperature. (and yes, I arrived at the quoted pick-up time)Will I return? probably on occasion, only because I live a block away and their burgers are better than 7/11's. Here's hoping its hot and friendly next time.

Reviews.Author: J F.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers.  I've always been a simple burger on starchy white bun guy (think Melons, PJ Clarke's) but this place does them differently and does them right.  Great beer selection and every burger I've had was delicious.  Even though I'm basically a meatatarian the salads and fries are really very good.Also, it takes a lot for me to say this but I think the milkshakes might be better than the burgers.  I think they add a little malt at the bottom of the glass which adds such a nice touch.

Reviews.Author: kamila O.
Reviews.Content: This place was oh so good! I fell in love with the guacamole burger! I'm still dreaming of this divine burger! The service was great but the place was super loud for dinner I would turn the music down just a notch so I can have a conversation with the person sitting right next to me.  Regardless loud music or not I will be back:-)

Reviews.Author: Hector M.
Reviews.Content: The best burger? Start with the #8. It is the classic iceberg Lettuce, tomato and pickles. It's good. Add Gruyere. Then, add a breaded Portobello cap. Truffle fries. Then report back. Keep it clean please.

Reviews.Author: Jason J.
Reviews.Content: There's a debate to which is better DMK or Kumas, but I say why both have kickass burgers but are different. The smartest thing I did here was to try two different burgers in my first trip by splitting them with my buddy. The blue cheese and onion strings burger was awesome, lots of blue cheese and pulled with chili dusted onion strings. The bacon, BBQ burger with the balsamic grilled onions was an orchestra of flavor, and although the burgers are thin they do pack in a ton of flavor and the fresh made buns were the icing. The cheddar scallions fries also rocked. Our bartender gave a few samples of beer, and also the chili which was real tasty as well as packing a punch. Service was excellent and the place is clean and very laid back, overall a great experience I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Tom D.
Reviews.Content: This is a great burger bar; in fact, most burger bars should visit DMK to see why each night this restaurant is packed with a good-looking crowd. It's important to have friendly staff and this place has an incredible lineup. Burgers taste as described, so if you're looking for a spicy patty or a sweet, tangy sauce, have no fear! You will find great variety in the one-page menu. Try the sweet potato fries!

Reviews.Author: Arde H.
Reviews.Content: I was a little thrown off by the unconventional buns and the thin patties, but the burgers were GREAT.  I especially liked the turkey burger (I'm typically a beef guy).  My favorite was the "Kane" burger (in honor of the Blackhawks recent Stanley Cup victory) which was a spicy buffalo burger.We got the spicy onion rings which were great, and the special of the day which was french fries with ranch dressing, bacon, and chives.  It was FANTASTIC.  They also have a lot of great beers on taps.Finally, the wait staff is super nice.  Only complaint is that they only have one women's and one men's restroom, and they're "onesies."  Makes for a long wait to go pee!

Reviews.Author: Theresa V.
Reviews.Content: The only reason they get a two stars was because the fries saves them.   The meat patties are tiny.  I'm very disappointed.  I was expecting more.

Reviews.Author: Matthew G.
Reviews.Content: Lacking a good vegan variety, they already have everything they need though to custom make great stuff

Reviews.Author: Samantha E.
Reviews.Content: Came by with my family for lunch one weekend. While it is not my favorite burger in Chicago, it is still pretty high up there. They have some really unique burger options and some amazing fries! Although it was really busy, our server always kept tabs on our table and made sure everything was going well. I can't wait to come back and try out a breakfast burger!

Reviews.Author: Ripley W.
Reviews.Content: Yes. It is loud.  Expect to yell across your table and have trouble hearing what anyone is saying.  I guess it's called 'Burger Bar' because it is a bar that serves burgers.  Clever.Besides the noise, this is a great place and I'll definitely be back.  We were told it was a 90 minute wait, which ended up being 20 minutes. Not bad for 7p on a Friday.  I think it would have been cool to get the communal table, but we had a standard 4-top in the back.  It was noticeably 'quieter' back there, so that's a bonus.  There were 4 of us for dinner and we totally over-ordered:  Wedge Salad, Fried Okra & Pickles, Mac and Cheese, Truffle Fries, Salt and Pepper Fries, The #1 bbq sauce and bacon,  #2 fried onion and bleu cheese,  #4 - chile, bacon, and a fried egg, and the #11 veggie.  Key points:The fried okra and pickles is, in fact, 2 pieces of fried okra and a huge mess of pickles.  We ordered them specifically for the okra and would  tolerate the pickles.  We were disappointed to say the least.  Mac and Cheese is not creamy or rich.  It had a nice Parmesan crust but it's really not good.  Unless you don't like rich and creamy mac and cheese, in which case you're crazy anyway, so I'll save my breath.Burgers rated from best to worst:1: BBQ and bacon2: Chile with bacon and fried egg (the chile gave it a kick and the egg was nice and runny!)3:  Veggie (it has pesto and eggplant, nice.)4:  Fried onion and bleu cheese.We each had a beer with dinner, and the grand total for 4 without tip was $86.  That was pretty sweet, especially considering we ordered too much.  Tip: Dont say you're going to "share" the fries.  If you do, you'll get a "sharing" portion (large.)  Order the small portion.

Reviews.Author: Jules H.
Reviews.Content: Sooooo glad our stand by was closed  for the holiday today... forced my friend and I to venture outside our norm and try DMK.  First off, I have no business being here on Christmas Eve when I'm about to have a huge meal wth the fam tonight, but my friend and I needed a place to have a drink and exchange gifts. WOW! Drew was a gracious bartender. Very friendly and insightful, no recomendation went unappreciated. I love that this place uses grass fed meat and much thought goes into the ingredients.  My friend had the #4 burger with green chili's, which they ship in from New Mexico.  I tried the deviled eggs and sampled the sweet potato fries and truffle fries. LOVE it! We were lucky that we didn;t have to contend with crowds going for super early lunch on a holiday, I heard this place gets super busy!

Reviews.Author: Todd N.
Reviews.Content: We couldn't get in without a long wait a few weeks ago but had the chance to go right before Christmas. We were prepared to wait but got a table right away (it was on the early side - maybe 6:30 or 7 the Wednesday before Christmas). Service was pretty good (although we never received water we requested, which was mentioned in a couple of other reviews).The food was very tasty. We normally don't like "fussy" burgers with too many toppings but the burgers were good and the fries were very good. The vibe was great. We're very happy to have DMK right around the corner.

Reviews.Author: Maria V.
Reviews.Content: First time here and I am so excited about the explosion of flavor I experianced after my first bit of number 11.  That's a grass-fed lamb burger with feta, olive tapenade, greek salad and tzatziki.  Oh an by the way the Parmesan, truffle cream fries are outstanding!

Reviews.Author: Jake M.
Reviews.Content: At here with 3 friends of mine on a Friday night. Was busy bit I didn't think the wait was too long. Burger I had was delicious and beer selection was pretty good. We ended up ordering two large fry plates to split between the four of us and with each of us ordering a burger that was more than enough.One of the fry plates was a truffle fry plate. I would highly recommend this.

Reviews.Author: Julia L.
Reviews.Content: I went here on a whim today with a couple of my friends, and let me just say this. DELICIOUS. I was pretty surprised at the burgers because after Kuma's, I definitely raised my standards on burgers. DMK did not let me down. I ordered the number 2, with chipotle ketchup and spiced onions with what I think Gruyere cheese. The buns were also delicious too, with the perfect amount of fluffiness, not too dense, and just the right amount of toasted edges. My friends also ordered the number six, with portobello mushrooms and a cheese that they could not figure out, but raving about, and they were just as ecstatic about their burger as I was with mine. My other friend ordered the bacon with fried egg, and he savored every minute of it If you decide not to order an alcoholic beverage, they also have the homemade blood-orange, cherry, and lime sodas, which we also ordered, and those drinks were the perfect complement to our burgers. A must have when ordering the burger, since it only comes with the burger, are their french-fries. We received complimentary fried onions, and ordered Parmesan, cheddar and chives, and sweet potato fries. My favorite was the cheddar and chives, but the other fries were just as good. We were all very satisfied, and it was not over-the-top full like how you get at Kuma's. I live within walking distance from this place so DMK is definitely going to see more of me in the future.

Reviews.Author: Coco O.
Reviews.Content: Delicious!   Minus one star for the unbelievable volume of the music and the extremely high price for the beers.  I had the #11 - lamb burger - and it was wonderful.  Incredibly moist and juicy - just the right size patty - topped with olive tapenade, feta, greek salad fixings and tzatziki.  It was definitely a little better than my husbands burger with fried onions, blue cheese and a chipotle ketchup.  We also enjoyed the truffle and parmesean fries (small was big enough for us to share) and the fried pickles and okra.  I consider myself a fried pickle officianado (weird, I know) and these were certainly top-notch.  We'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Author: Lexi F.
Reviews.Content: This place was wonderful. To drink I got a Metropolitan Krankshaft and my friend got an Allegash White. I got the #2 burger with chipotle ketchup, onion strings, blue cheese, and added a fried egg. My friend got the italian burger that has prosciutto The only thing is that they don't ask how you like your burgers cooked. After I realized this - I tracked down my waitress and she told me that they cook all burgers to a medium. However, I like mine medium rare. She said that the medium would be fine for me since the burgers are thinner than average.We got our burgers, pretty quickly, as well as a large order of parmesan fries with a truffle aioli. Everything was delicious, and I did notice that my burger was much more pink than my friends, so I bet the waitress told the kitchen to make mine more of a medium rare.Everything was great and I will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Author: Denise F.
Reviews.Content: I went to DMK just a few days ago for a late dinner with my husband and a couple of friends. I have very few complaints about the place...I'm torn between 4 and 5 stars. We started with the sea salt fries and the truffle fries (split for the table) which were both delicious. The homemade ketchup was really something special. It was spicy, and there was just something there that was amazing. I ordered the #1 burger, and the hub (and friend) ordered the #2 burger. We were all very impressed! The meat was juicy, and the toppings were creative and fresh. Definitely one of the best burgers I've had in Chicago, and the prices were pretty good too. I wasn't impressed with their draft beer list, but they had a great selection in bottles, so that's alright.

Reviews.Author: Alessandra M.
Reviews.Content: HANDS DOWN, #1 BURGER BAR IN CHICAGO!!!!This place is absolutely impressive, from their beer selection, to their food, and atmosphere. For having attractive employees, it's not a pretentious place either. I come here all the time, and every time it's phenomenal! I've had just about everything on the menu, and i've like it (no joke). But, I think I can eat their lamb burger and parmesean truffle fries everyday, and not get tired of it. I usually hate veggie burgers, but DMK's veggie burger is to die for! It's also a great place to take guests from out of town, who aren't used to eating gourmet burgers. But what makes this place so great to me, is that I can eat and eat and eat, and not feel one bit guilty, because all their meat is grass-fed, which makes a HUGE difference!If I could be DMK's mascot, I would!!!

Reviews.Author: Geoff S.
Reviews.Content: My brother and I went here after floating in a sensory deprivation tank (but that's another story). The burgers were amazing. I had the burger with fried egg, bacon, and green chilies. Thinking about it now makes me want another...and it's 9:00 a.m. You could tell the ingredients were fresh and the patty was handmade. We shared a couple of baskets of fries -- sweet potato and the parmesan fries with truffle dipping sauce. I had a blood orange soda and my bro had a peanut butter shake. I honestly have no complaints. Everything was amazing. So many different flavors going on...We got seated right away. Our waitress was very helpful and responsive. All good. Absolutely one of my favorite burger places. Maybe my favorite. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: Tristan C.
Reviews.Content: Everything about this place was good. Not amazing, but some things were pretty getting close. We had a little bit of a long wait for our table of 6, but nothing out of the ordinary, we thought. However, when we were seated, (and it might be worth mentioning that much of the seating is on elevated large tables, so you sort of squeeze in between other groups of people), anyway, when we were seated, they apologized for our long wait and gave us two different appetizers on the house! They were delicious. Most other places wouldn't have given it a second thought, probably.The beer menu was good, but I have seen more extensive ones, not that it really would have mattered, they had my favorite, and they had it in 22 oz. The food was good, yummy burgers, truffle and Parmesan fries. One thing perhaps worth noting, the burgers were not overly large. Also, I would not say that they are the BEST burgers, but they are VERY GOOD.My friends liked their milkshakes. I got a cupcake for dessert, which was just the right size after everything else. Another friend ordered one of their ice cream sandwiches, it looked amazing: all homemade chocolate chocolate chip cookie with espresso ice cream. Yeah.It's a little out of my way, but I would go back again, definitely. They have some other things I would like to try. It had everything I wanted, and they were friendly. Summary:Food: delicious!Service: awesome, and the wait not too badAmbiance: like a bar!

Reviews.Author: Neil G.
Reviews.Content: Food:  4Service:  3Atmosphere:  4Value:  3You might be asking why someone who doesn't eat meat at non-kosher restaurants went to a place like this.  Well, burgers happen to be one of my favorite foods and I have slowly grown to enjoy a good veggie/tuna/portobello "burger."  Like most red blooded American males, I'm also a sucker for anything deep fried--french fries and onion rings in particular.  Anyone can make a good burger, but making a great veggie burger takes real talent.  Having enjoyed an excellent meal at MK last year, I was excited to try this place out.I went with a friend on a Tuesday night around 7:30 and while the restaurant was crowded, there was no problem getting a table.  My friend does not keep kosher so he went with the #3 (Burger with Pastrami, Gruyere, Saurkraut, and Remoulade) and I had the #12 (Veggie Burger with Cheddar, Eggplant, Tomato, and Pesto Mayo).  We also ordered a side of Mac N Cheese and Parmesan Truffle Fries.The Veggie Burger was a beautifully constructed, colorful masterpiece.  The cheese was melted perfectly and the bun (somewhat of a potato roll, I believe) was just the right size and thickness to hold everything in place when you took a bite.  The burger tasted incredibly fresh, and what made it unique was that it had a slight crisp, the way a charred hamburger might have on the outside.  The eggplant and pesto mayo also gave it a hearty, rustic feel.  As for the sides, the Mac N Cheese was baked on top, which is not my favorite preparation.  It was crunchy and a little dry on top but creamier underneath.  Although I much preferred Handlebar's (see my review) because it was creamier and simpler, this is still a solid option if you enjoy a more refined Mac.  The Truffle Fries were also pretty good, but nothing spectacular.  They were crispy and had that nice buttery taste you get from truffle oil, but were a little heavy on the parmesan.  I would definitely opt for a different fried side next time.Although I couldn't eat it, my friend called his burger "amazing," and by the look of it, I don't think he was mistaken.  I've also had a few burgers with fried pastrami/beef fry in my day and they have always been delicious.  Overall, I would recommend trying it, but it probably won't become a staple in your dining rotation.  You're mostly paying for the MK name and the trendiness, but if you're really in the mood for an upscale burger topped with fresh, unique ingredients, it may be worth the price of admission.  [Thanks for reading my review and be sure to check out my other reviews on Yelp.  My mission is to find restaurants that have great vegetarian, kosher, and vegan fare.  On every review, I rate food, service, atmosphere, and value on a 1-5 scale to give you quick and easy overview of the restaurant.  I love cooking, eating, and doing both with my friends and family.  I always welcome your questions, comments, and suggestions so contact me on Yelp or Facebook if you want to share ideas.]

Reviews.Author: Tyrell C.
Reviews.Content: This is the place for Burgers in Chicago.DMK just GETS IT.  You don't need GIANT burgers.  You don't need crazy amounts of fries.  You don't need wacky names.  You can't make up for bad burgers with 100's of beers. DMK burgers are just about perfect.  Lean grass-fed beef.  2-4 toppings in great compliment to one another.  A wonderful selection of gourmet fries.  And a solid beer list.  There is literally not a bad burger or fry on the on the menu (I've tried just about every one).  Prices are also decent. My personal favorites:- #5 Prosciutto, Fontina, Pesto, Red Pepper, Sea Salt & Vinegar Chips- Sea Salt & Black Pepper Fries- Fried Dill Pickles and Okra (possibly the best appetizer at any burger place)And you don't have to wait 3 hours in line to get in.  DMK you're the best!

Reviews.Author: Gregory H.
Reviews.Content: I have been here three times and had the #4 each time. Great burger! I brought my friend here for lunch and we had some good food, nice atmosphere and good service. I like DMK...Thumbs up! and here comes the butt.... Guys do something about the greasy chili. The idea of having brisket in the chili was great but, man, the bowl was covered in grease much like the gulf of Mexico in oil. Thank goodness for the sponge like toast on the side of the plate or I would not have found the tasty brisket....

Reviews.Author: Lidia L.
Reviews.Content: Holy Moly! This place was GOOOOOD. I ordered the #2 which had BBQ sauce in it.  I forget what else but everything just tasted so good! We also ordered a small side of truffle cream fries and man were we wrong to have ordered a SMALL.... WE SHOULD HAVE GONE FOR THE LARGE ORDER! They were so delicious with a lot of truffle flavor. I am a truffle fries kind of girl and Chicago has the best ones. We also ordered the #2 mac and cheese which had bacon and other things in it. That was just as tasty! I also ordered a vanilla milk shake as I got my meal and it was yummy as well. It was a nice dessert like drink to top it all off.Eat in, the aura is great. Nice and busy. But get there before the rush.  The service was wonderful and we got our food right away--- good thing too because we were hungry for burgers! I will definitely come back when I'm in Chicago!

Reviews.Author: Lindsay D.
Reviews.Content: Checked out DMK yesterday for the first time. Being a vegetarian, it is difficult for me to find a burger spot that's accommodating and tasty. DMK was able to follow through on both accounts. Not only was my veggie burger delicious but I got to end my meal with a decadent espresso shake. I would highly recommend this place for meat eaters and vegetarians alike. Not only do I want to try their other flavored shakes and the portabella burger, but their mac and cheese looked fantastic. Hopefully I will be back soon!

Reviews.Author: Omar G.
Reviews.Content: Took the wife here as part of her bday since they serve turkey and vegan burgers. I had already looked up the place here in yelp first so I kinda got her excited to go. All I can say is that we both really enjoyed our burgers an fries. She order a turkey burger with arugula, dijonaisse ,tomato and i think munster cheese. I had the bison burger (which im gonna ask for double patty next time) with blueberry bbq sauce with goat cheese. As for fries we order a large one that came with parmesan cheese an truffle. Which was soooo delicious. Me and the wife plan to go back soon an try different burgers an fries.

Reviews.Author: Jonathan T.
Reviews.Content: Great casual dinner location, cool interior. Creative burger toppings, all of which can be substituted for turkey or chicken. Decent beer selection and great fries. Also pretty cheap for the city ($8/burger, $2/fries).Not quite on the same level as Kuma's for a burger joint, but definitely a good place catch dinner in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: Jeff N.
Reviews.Content: After the hype in the Trib earlier this week about the best Veggie Burger anywhere, I had to try this place.  Took wife and younger daughter there today.  Great and attentive service (thanks Austen!).  The veggie burger melted in my mouth.  Very, very tasty. Mac N Cheese #2(with gruyere and bacon) very good as well.  Sweet potato fried (ordered by my daughter) very good.  I didn't want you to think I am a total pig by getting Mac N Cheese AND fries.  Wife had the BIG salad which was also very good.  Place is noisy, as mentioned in other review.  I will definitely go back.  As far as the Trib article proclaiming this Veggie Burger 'clearly the best', I can't say I have had enough of them to agree.  But I know the Veggie at Citizen Bar and the Veggie at Atwood Cafe are in the same league..

Reviews.Author: Mayu N.
Reviews.Content: There were definitely a lot of mixed reviews that I had read, which made me rethink my decision to go here, but it was late and we were hungry, and we didn't want to trek it to Chinatown. Yes. It is loud in there. Was I surprised? No, I knew what I was getting into. The staff (the hostess and our server) was great. They were nice, they were informative and were attentive. We ordered the chili that was either the special of the day, or the special of the week, the number 3 and number 6, and a large fry with parmesan and truffle cream, and two beers. HOLY MOLY! The chili was amazing. It wasn't your average tex-mex chili, it was almost light and refreshing (is that possible?), it was probably the best chili I've had in a very long time. The number 3 with pastrami and sauerkraut was okay, it wasn't my personal favorite. The number 6 on the other hand was A-M-A-Z-I-N-G! The fries were good, but the truffle cream is what made them to die for. My boyfriend and I were talking about how the beef was grass-fed, and their motto is "grass-fed beef makes the difference!", and he thought that maybe the other ingredients may be covering up the taste difference. I pondered it for a bit, but I didn't care that much because I devoured my entire burger. The buns were toasted warm! I love that! Yes, the patties do seem a little thin, but hey, not everything should be 1/2 pound and $2.00. The beers were great, and before we left we were given two business cards that were each good for one free draft beer! Yea, it's expensive for the burger/fries/beer meal, but is it worth it? I think it is.

Reviews.Author: Liz A.
Reviews.Content: Went back here with a friend on a random Saturday around 3pm. We got seated immediately, which I was very happy about given my last go round here.We split two burgers - the Bison Burger w/ goatcheese & blueberry bbq sauce & some other one, which I don't remember. I don't remember because all I remember is the blueberry bbq sauce. It was so good. We were very happy with our experience.

Reviews.Author: Sarah I.
Reviews.Content: I had very high expectations for DMK after hearing a lot of friends talk about it. It was super crowded but we got sat right away since we had a smaller party. The tables are kind of close together....a waitress was serving a sauce or aioli to the next table and she dropped it so it went all over the bottom of my pants and shoes as well as the guy next to me. I was a server in grad school so I understand when things happen so I wasn't upset about it but I would have asked my manager to take something off the bill. She apologized but I was surprised that she didn't take something off or offer us something...oh well.I really enjoyed the interior/decorations of DMK. I went with the #4 Roasted Hatch Green Chili, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack and Smoked Bacon Burger...it was pretty good. I've had better burgers. What made it was the delicious bun...so yummy! The fries were ok...I prefer Burger Bar's burgers and fries.

Reviews.Author: Kevin C.
Reviews.Content: I set the bar higher than I should have with DMK.  People I know have had nothing but good things to say about it.  Food was pretty good but not sure that I'll be back.  I think I was immediately turned off when the waitress asked if we'd been there before....we hadn't.  So the first thing she says is "Well, we cook all our burgers the same way, a little pink in the middle, that's the only way they come.  Second, there are no substitutions.  What it says on the menu is the way you get it.  So if you want to leave a cheese off a certain burger, that's the only change we'll make.  No adding or subtracting toppings."-I guess I don't understand why leaving off some onions or mushrooms would be that much of a problem???I ended up getting the bison burger with some sort of blueberry BBQ sauce.  It was really good, but it didn't really fill me up all the way.  Made me realize why the burgers are $8.Pros: Great tasting burgerGood selection of beersFRENCH FRIESDecently priced foodCons:Burger was really smallVery loud for dinner at 6:00pmDisinterested wait staffNo adding or subtracting garnishesNo choice in how the burger is cookedFrench fries are a la carteFood served on these mini plates

Reviews.Author: Federica L.
Reviews.Content: Very good burgers and sweet potato fries with lemon tabasco aioli are the best!Nice place and awesome playlist!

Reviews.Author: Tal C.
Reviews.Content: This place has really great burgers, great beer, and reasonable prices. Keep in mind though, this is NOT the place to go have a quiet romantic evening. This place is loud, probably one of the loudest restaurants I've been to in Chicago, even at lunch time. So just keep that in mind if you hate noise or not really being able to hear your dining partner.If you're coming here for dinner, expect to wait. Sometimes spots open up in the bar (where they serve their full menu), but generally the wait is long, with nowhere to really sit or hang out, so wear comfy shoes! One thing that I actually really like about this place is that there are often people alone at the bar, drinking a beer and having a burger while watching a game. It's so loud and everything is so packed and close together that nobody really notices if it's a Saturday night and you're alone- definitely a place I'd go if I wanted a burger last minute and had no one to go with.Their burgers are all pre-created by the chef, so you can't build your own burgers. No substitutions, but you can take certain things off your burger. I'm generally a beef lover, but I have to say, the veggie burger here is SO GOOD... I probably go about half and half between the veggie burger and a beef burger. The bison burger is also delicious, but of course it is, because there's goat cheese on it. My favorite part of eating here though, is the fries. First of all, I will say, I think the fries here are made to be eaten with the sauce; that is, the flavors don't really work unless you dip each fry into the sauce it comes with. The fries alone are good, but with the sauces, it all comes together. The parmesan truffle fries with truffle aioli are to die for- I crave them all the time. The sweet potato fries with lemon aioli are also really good. Those are my favorites. Mac and cheese is also great, very thick cheese. The prices are very reasonable- $9 for each burger, except the Bison, which I think is $11. I usually end up with about $20-25 with burger, fries, a drink, and tax/tip, which is really not bad for the amount of food you get.

Reviews.Author: Tom R.
Reviews.Content: Extensive 5 oz burger menu with unique and seemingly excellent combinations. Fries are ordered separately and also include many different options - salt and pepper, sweet potato, parmesan truffle, etc. The beer list is large and somewhat expensive as is their list of signature cocktails. The food we ate was all really great. Burgers were cooked well, fries were delicious, beer was cold.All of that being said, I was annoyed that they play really good music but it's so loud that it's difficult to carry on a conversation across the table.

Reviews.Author: Jarret H.
Reviews.Content: This place is consistent. Every time we go we try a different burger and a different set of fries..holy-guac-aioli burger was awesome and you have to either get the sweet potato or gravy fries.  Great beer selection and prices are well set..no pretentious 16$ burgers here.

Reviews.Author: Phillip T.
Reviews.Content: Went here for lunch with my family. I ordered the Patty Melt, or the number 9. We also tried out the truffle fries and the sweet potato fries.All the burgers were pretty decent. Both of the fries came with their own sauce and both of the fries were good as well, although it was a bit dry for me. My brother didn't like his and said it was too greasy for him. However, my biggest gripe was the size of the burgers. All of the burgers cost $9 and for a 9 dollar burger, they were pretty small. If you don't mind the quantity, then that's all right, but for someone like me, who likes getting more bang for his buck, it was offsetting for me. However, they are filling.Loud music and dimmed lights accurately depicts the environment. I don't really like loud music, but if that's your thing, then go for it.There is also a full bar, but I didn't try any of alcohol this time.

Reviews.Author: Tom K.
Reviews.Content: Awesome burgers! Creative selections and perfectly cooked. Loved the sweet potato fries, too. And the service was exceptional.Ask for Kelly. She's a sweetheart! And if you like beers, they offer a huge selection of artisanal beers which the staff know a lot about. Had the Lagunitas PILS from California. Great taste but not as cold as I would have liked.

Reviews.Author: Sherlock A.
Reviews.Content: Very courteous and friendly staff.  The burgers are done right. Loved the breaded deep fried pickles.  Good variety of drinks from beer, wine and custom mix drinks. Can't wait to come back. Had a good time :)

Reviews.Author: Anna H.
Reviews.Content: I love this place! Burgers are great, and it's  even better that they're grass-fed. I love the bison option, which I highly recommend that. Good selection of craft beers. The sweet potato fries are great, I wouldn't get the larger portion for just 2 people next time, though.. Too big! Overall great place.

Reviews.Author: Mike T.
Reviews.Content: Four stars for the food, two stars for the noise level which makes any conversation absolutely impossible. So the result is three stars. When we got in, it was a bit difficult to understand who we had to talk to to get a table. But although it was a Saturday night, and it was pretty packed, we got a table for three in 35 minutes. Very good. The burgers are DELICIOUS, and they are not as heavy as the menu description might have you think. We also had French fries with truffle cream (also delicious) and sweet potato fries (not so good). Good selection of beers, and a few good cocktails (we had the "Geneva" one, which was all right)  . Would I go there again? Not sure: the noise was really impossible. And to top it off, they even put very loud music. They need to do something about this, if not, they won't have any more of my business.

Reviews.Author: ML T.
Reviews.Content: Dined here on Saturday, 11/14.  The BF and I were greeted by a very friendly hostess who took our name and said the wait would be about 20 minutes.  We went to the bar and ordered drinks; notably the 'Madame Geneva's Rhubarb Delight'...I highly recommend it and I don't even enjoy Gin!  The bartender, Drew, was also very friendly and knowledgable about the drinks and liquors.  We were seated after about ten minutes.  We ordered the #1, #11 (Lamb), Sweet Potato Fries, Mac 'n Cheese #1, Chocolate Chip Ice Cream Sandwich and Dutch Chocolate Shake.  Everything was VERY good!  My lamb burger was one of the most delicious and yummy things I have had in a long time.  The Mac 'n Cheese wasn't my favorite; not very creamy but that didn't stop me from devouring the entire thing!  The desserts were very tasty as well.  We went back to the bar after dinner and continued to chat with various staff memebers; everyone is so nice and friendly here!  We will definitely be back SOON!

Reviews.Author: Jenna M.
Reviews.Content: This place is right around the corner from where I live so sometimes it's nice to go on Sunday night when it's not too crowded and it's convienent. It looks like a night club from the outside and the seating set up is odd to me which I still haven't figured out. We usually just sit at the bar and talk to the friendly bartenders. They have a nice beer selection - it's not filled with all those shitty beers that are all the same. I've only tried one kind of burger and it was tasty, although I'm not sure why they have burgers listed on their menu that are "coming soon"...what a tease. The macaroni is terrible, but the fries are good.

Reviews.Author: Denise E.
Reviews.Content: One word can really describe DMK, average. The fries are good and yes the mac and cheese is yummy but DMK does call itselfs a burger bar so how are the burgers. The answer my friends is average. If they are trying to compete with bruger joints like Kuma's Korner they they have missed their mark about a mile and a half. Service was fine, the atmostphere was also nice and the food just ok. If you are in the area and need somewhere to eat the place is fine, I just would not go out of my way for DMK.

Reviews.Author: Angela P.
Reviews.Content: I'm definitely a fan of DMK.  Food:  Burger - Fantastic.  Really juicy, great flavors.  Not the largest sized burger I've had, but I much prefer quality over quantity.  They don't allow substitutions of items on the burgers, but mine was so good, I would trust them to try any combination.Truffle fries - YOUMUSTHAVETHEM.  Soooo good.  I wish I had ordered more and taken them home.  I also can't wait to try the sweet potato fries.  The prices were reasonable for the burgers & fries, but I thought it was a bit ridiculous to not have free refills of fountain sodas.  I also am not a big fan of the large community table.  I called a few weeks ago for a carry out order (more truffle fries of course) but they said they didn't have it going yet.  I'll be excited when they get it going since this will be a great dinner option for me on busy days.  Overall, the food is really good.  I look forward to trying some of the other options.

Reviews.Author: Megan G.
Reviews.Content: I've been to DMK twice now since it's opened and both times got a turkey burger. The burger was great the best part of it is the bun. It's the perfect amount of bread. The fries are also pretty good although the cheese on the cheese fries was not what you would expect. I like my cheese baked on the fries, this was more like a cheese sauce. The beer on tap is great! Very different. I like it because it forces me to try new beer instead of falling back on my usual plain light. They have a great bottle selection as well. The bartender will even let you taste the beers on tap!Lastly, the staff here is amazing. Both times the server was extremely nice and attentive. Even when it is super busy they are great!

Reviews.Author: Kellyn W.
Reviews.Content: I'm a gal who loves to put an onion ring on a burger, so the fact that the #2 came with chili-rubbed onion straws was a major selling point for me. I like my burgers to be medium -- exactly the way that DMK prepared them -- but beware that you can't specify how well-done you'd like it to be cooked. Portion size was perfect (although plate size was oddly small) and my roommate and I shared small orders of the fried pickles & okra, sweet potato fries, and parmesan truffle fries. The fried pickles were by far the standout side dish -- the sweet potato fries were standard fare and the parmesan truffle fries left a little something to be desired. It's good to note that they do have a few solid vegetarian burger options, though the fries are prepared in beef fat. Not my favorite burger place in the city, but I'd definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: David P.
Reviews.Content: DMK offers a wide range of gourmet burgers and fries (reasonably priced too!).  The space is long and narrow creating that iconic loud bar noise throughout the restaurant, which kinda makes a fun atmosphere.  In addition to the variety of burgers, they have a large beer selection too (just stay away from the cocktails, they are on the smaller side and a little over priced).I get the #5 ($8) which consists of a burger with prosciutto, fontina, pesto, red bell peppers and salt & vinegar chips.  To pair with that I get the parmesan and truffle oil fries ($2), which are to die for.  My buddy gets the #14 which is a salmon burger with ginger, scallions, asian slaw, and a curry sauce - I will definitely be getting it next time.Aside from the loud shouts of the sports loving male Lakeview crowd, this place is fantastic.  I've gone three times, and every time I have to get the same burger and fries.  Perfect for a group of friends or a significant - just don't expect an intimate dinner, have fun.

Reviews.Author: Kate G.
Reviews.Content: This place is AMAZING. My dad found this place and took the whole family there and I'm really glad he did. I'm a very picky eater and when it comes to burgers I usually just go for the classic with regular toppings. When I saw the unique menu I was a bit nervous. My family agreed to each order a different burger so we could taste them all, so I picked the number 3 knowing I wouldn't have to eat it if I didn't like it. This burger had pastrami and sauerkraut on it. This is something I never would have ordered on my own.Long story short, after taking the first bite, I guarded that thing with my life. It was possibly one of the best burgers I had EVER. I didn't want to share it anymore. It was delicious. We also had cheese fries and fried pickles as appetizers and both were very good. I can't wait to go back to this place. I highly recommend it to anyone...even picky eaters like me! :)

Reviews.Author: Jeremy S.
Reviews.Content: Since I support grass fed beef I gave this place a try.  It's a sleek lounge-like type of bar.  The place was surprisingly busy for a late afternoon lunch on a weekday.  It must be a cool place for young professionals to have a beer with lunch.  I wasn't impressed with the beer selection, but I like my beer cheap.  They had a decent selection of micro brews, but since they didn't have Busch, I had a coke.FOOD: They have lots of unique gourmet burgers, but I ordered a plain old cheeseburger.  It was yummy.  Didn't taste too different than corn fed beef, but the i guess the juices were not as thick.  The toasted bun was what really made it though.  It makes my top 3 burgers of all time, and it better, because it was 8 bucks before the fries.

Reviews.Author: Chris M.
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome! First time trying it on a whim, canceled reservations at a restaurant downtown to come here, and we were not disappointed. We started out with deviled egg appetizers which were outstanding. My wife has the expresso shake and she said it was the best shake she had ever had...and she has had a few!! She had the salmon burger and I had the #1 and we ordered both the Parmesan fries and sweet potato fries and both had great taste. I would highly recommend this, especially for lunch where it wasn't crowded, but there were plenty of people having a great time!

Reviews.Author: Eric G.
Reviews.Content: I had a nice meal at DMK this past Sunday. Aside from the mouthwatering burger, the best part about my experience was not having to wait for a seat. I went with the number one. All the flavors played together nicely. As I looked over my shoulder to catch the score from the Bears game, I noticed the chalk board by the bar saying that the burger special was a Bison Burger. It was too late to change my order but I want to try that if it is available the next time I return. It sounded delicious!

Reviews.Author: Brendan M.
Reviews.Content: I was running errands in the area and remembered driving by this place.  I had to check it out.  Walking in I noticed the nice modern design and was greeted pleasantly by the staff.  Although I did not have any alcoholic beverages on this lunch trip, I was very impressed with their beer selection.The bartender was extremely friendly and helpful, and recommended I grab the #1 with their sweet potato fries.  I have eaten many great burgers in Chicago, and DMK is one of them.  Great all around experience.I will be back for more.

Reviews.Author: Fiz H.
Reviews.Content: DMK, you are overall a great burger place with amazing sweet potato fries and good mac n cheese.your meat is also really good (and your cheese). i loved the lamb burger as well!BUT, some people love spicy shit on their burgers and you are greatly lacking in this category. your green peppery sauce or whatever was super bland and kind of disgusting. MY ONLY COMPLAINT IS THAT YOU GOTTA GET SOME JALAPENOS ON THEM BURGERS; that would make my burger perfect.

Reviews.Author: Brandon L.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING food. I'm not much of a burger guy, but this place is the truth! Any thing that you can dream of going on a burger, they do it- with the most amazing combinations you could think of...Also, they have several different style fries to choose from.The service is great, I've been there multiple times with different servers and each one knows the food and drink menu so well.

Reviews.Author: Michael P.
Reviews.Content: 2010, the year of the "Burger Bar" in Chicago. To be completely honest, my first experience at DMK burger was not a positive one. I hated it actually. I went when it first opened and it was a mob scene to get in. After over an hour wait for a table, we had ordered a variety of burgers and pretty much all the fries and sides available. Nothing seemed worth the trouble it was to get seated.After many conversations with other people, and my consistent bitching to their praises, I decided to give DMK another shot. I couldn't be happier that I did. I tend to go elsewhere after I have a bad experience in a restaurant. There's over 10,000 places to eat in the city of Chicago, and I work too hard to throw my money away in any of them. I don't know if the food and service improved after time or the fact that the longest you'll wait to get a table is now 15 minutes since the hype died down, but DMK has been a great go-to place for a burger and a beer after work or on the weekend for lunch.With a pretty good variety of different burgers and fries, you can go back many, many times before you've had everything on the menu. But my biggest pleasure at DMK is their special shakes. Not quite sure when it started but as of last October when they started pushing a special "October" pumpkin shake, I've tried to get in there at least once a month for whatever shake is being served. The pumpkin shake is one of the best I EVER had. Packed full of pumpkin flavor and topped with pumpkin seeds it was like pumpkin pie in a glass, I only wish it were available year round. I must have gone in 5 or 6 times for that shake in October, and just when I thought I had the best shake ever made, they introduced the Gingerbread cookie dough shake in December! I'm pretty sure there was crack in it cuz I went back time and time again until New Years Eve. I can't wait to see what 2011 brings.The food is great, the service is friendly and it's not too bad on the wallet either. Now that the trendy crowd has moved onto whatever's next in burger places, DMK is a great place for a burger and a beer.

Reviews.Author: T.R. M.
Reviews.Content: I like this place.We were looking for a place to have a late lunch, that was cozy with comfort food and was outside of our own hood.  We needed a change from our usual spots and I remembered our waitress at one of our other local spots telling us that her roommate worked at DMK Burger Bar. aaaand she mentioned that they had sweet potato fries too - this enticed me.. I suggested it to the hubs and he quickly agreed.It was nice bc we could watch the Bears game, and it wasn't too loud or too crowded - so we could actually enjoy lunch.We started off with a wedge salad to share. AWESOME bacon  - but next time I'm gonna ask to go easy on the dressing.Then I ordered a #2 and he ordered a #4 - with a small sweet pot fries to split...then he added Mac and cheese #1 at the last minute.  I am not sure if I am happy that he ordered the Mac n cheese or upset with him, because it was DELICIOUS!  but with each bite I was envisioning every extra lunge and crunch I had to do with my trainer the next day to work off my moment of weakness!The burger satisfied my need for comfort food, blue cheese and crispy onions- yummo.  He loved the mix of toppings on his - especially the fried egg and hot peppers.  The fries were great too.  We were stuffed and had to box up more than half of the mac n cheese.  It was a nice side with our dinner the next night - and still just as delicious as before!I had a 3 Floyds beer, a nod to our last name and my hubby's hometown.    Our ONLY request - please add some non-alcoholic beers to the list.  With such an extensive beer list, can't be too hard to add 1 or 2.  Even non- drinkers enjoy a burger and a Bears game. oh well - hubs had to settle for a diet coke ;)other than that -  4 thumbs up!

Reviews.Author: Joe G.
Reviews.Content: This place had very tasty burgers.  I really liked the burgers and the sides.  Next time I go, I want to try the drink list.  As it was, I was about to hit the road to drive for a few hours, so I chose not to drink.  Anyways, here are the basics:Food: We had the Mac & Cheese (second option, with bacon and onions).  It was very tasty and was great to share between 4 people.  I'd definitely recommend it.  We also shared the Parmesan, Truffled Fries.  Also delicious.  The dipping sauce with those was amazing.  Of the regular burgers, I had the #2, a burger topped with blue cheese and crispy onions  (amazing and would go back just to eat it again) and my wife had the #1, a burger with bacon and BBQ sauce (again, she thought it was amazing and I'd probably try that one next time).  The couple we were with had the Sunday specials.  He liked his (the non-burger option), but she thought her turkey burger had too many spices going on a distracted her from the flavors of the other parts of the meal.  This was the only complaint anyone had about the food.Ambiance: I loved the space.  It was very well done and felt appropriate for the food we were eating and definitely made us feel like this was the experience they wanted to have.Anyways, I'll definitely go back for more!

Reviews.Author: Ricky B.
Reviews.Content: This burger place is amazing.  Most all burgers are $8 and they are speciality at that.  I had the #1 burger.  Bacon, cheddar cheese and caramelized onions with BBQ sauce.  The customer service was impeccable and the host staff visited our table several times!  There are 5-6 different kinds of fries there and it was hard to choose from. I finally chose after much debate between two kinds.  I chose the Parmesan fries with truffle sauce.  When then food was delivered the wait staff included a free side of the other fries i was choosing from,  cheddar cheese fries and scallions!  The service is amazing and the food is effin awesome.  Even better is that everyday they take some of their portions of proceeds and donate it to local charities!  That just screams awesome to me!Awesome job DMK Burger Bar!

Reviews.Author: John R.
Reviews.Content: I think the atmosphere is kinda lame. But that totally depends on the person. It is kind of club-bar feel, which I think is lame for a burger joint. But whatever.My burger was good and the fries were pretty tasty. Would I rather have this place than the Counter? I think the Counter takes the edge.

Reviews.Author: Joshua H.
Reviews.Content: DMK is a good spot for a burger.  Two things keeping it from being 5 star: 1. Price for quantity.  2. Atmosphere/ServiceKeep in mind that 3 stars is a "good" rating.  The burgers are good, but nothing that will blow your mind.  Fries are also good.  Ice cream cookies are a pretty good way to wrap up dinner.  It is hard to beat a place like Kuma's Corner as a burger joint.  I would compare DMK to The Counter, but a bit more louder (literally it is loud in there).I always feel like they try to rush you from your table once you finish your last bite.  I get it.   The place is small and they are busy.In short, I think it is worth a try, but isn't a place I die to go back to.

Reviews.Author: Sarah G.
Reviews.Content: I'm shocked this place only has 3.5 stars, but it's okay by me because if it keeps this place from getting too popular and keeps me waiting no more than 10 minutes for my table, I don't care!BEST BURGERS.Kuma's is great, but I'm sorry; I'm put-off by the hugeness of the burger. I can never finish mine and when I do, I regret it. My mouth isn't big enough.At DMK, it's all done just right. The patties are thin, but not ridiculously so. I say it's just right because I can actually fit the thing in my mouth! The fries are to DIE for (hand cut, dontcha know!), too.I've had almost every burger on the menu and I have NEVER been disappointed with the very rare exception of their breakfast burger (turns out I don't like egg on a burger).But the service is always speedy no matter how busy it is and every server I've ever had has been friendly, accommodating, and all-around awesome. The bill by the end is always reasonable and I love their beer list!How can you NOT love this place?!? I've been there AT LEAST 10 times and I'll keep coming back!

Reviews.Author: Chris B.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers here, loved them, but not quite the best in town. I love the many options they give you for making burgers, and they have grass fed beef (look it up it's better for you than corn fed).Atmosphere was different, I don't know if it was hipster or trendy but seemed to be one of those kinds of places. We sat at the bar (lunch on a Saturday) and ordered there. The bartenders were nice always attentive.

Reviews.Author: Dan A.
Reviews.Content: 5 stars for food. 3.5 each for value and atmosphere.I recently moved to Chicago (6weeks ago) and decided to try DMK after a friend recommended it. I've now been back three additional times... Twice in one weekend while my girlfriend was visiting. I took her here for a burger on a Friday night and she loved it so much that when I offered to take her out for a 'nice' dinner on Saturday she instead demanded that we go back to DMK! (ironically, "see you tomorrow!" appears at the bottom of the receipt).Flavorful, gourmet-ish, grass-fed burgers, an above-average beer list, and speedy, friendly service.Understandably busy on the weekends, so keep that in mind. We waited 20-30min each night. Also, not the best burger joint for for a date... It's remarkably loud due to the hard walls/decor and minimal space between tables.

Reviews.Author: Kelly M.
Reviews.Content: I would live here if they let me.  First off, cutely decorated, kind of minimalist but they get giant kudos from me for their logo: a burger designed inside the Chicago flag; it warms my heart.  Secondly, the staff is always super-polite, always smiling and happy to serve you, and just generally nice people.  The bartender once gave us deviled eggs on the house while we were waiting at the bar for another friend to show up to be seated.  Doesn't hurt that the bartender is nice eye candy ;)Moving on to most important part, the food.  I have been to this place so many times, yet can still spend 30 minutes or more just staring at the menu, trying to choose just one option.  These burgers are unlike anything else.  They are not the giant bad-ass-mama-jamas from Kuma's that practically require you to unhinge your jaw to take a bite out of, but nor are they your typical pub burger.  They're all really creative with different flavors and toppings you're unlikely to see anywhere else (my favorite is a bison burger topped with goat cheese and blueberry BBQ sauce. Yeah, blueberry BBQ sauce = amazing).  Unadventurous people who think burgers should only be topped with cheese, lettuce, pickles, onions, mustard and ketchup should stick with going to Wendy's, because you'd be wasting these nice people's time.  The burgers are a bit on the smaller size, which means for me, totally realistic to actually finish them unlike other burger places.  All the meat is grass-fed beef, which makes a world of difference.  I'm not sure what type of bun they use (I usually prefer a pretzel bun), but they're quite tasty and add the right amount of texture.  Lastly, the fries. OMG the fries.  I dream about their parmesan fries paired with truffle mayo.  Truffle is like crack, it will be the best thing you've ever tasted.  The sweet potato fries  with lemon tabasco aioli are another favorite.  I'm not a huge ice cream fan, but I've heard from many sources that their ice cream shakes are amazing as well.  Their beer list is pretty expansive as well, and includes all of my local favorites like Half-Acre, Two Brothers, and Goose Island.I'd recommend coming here on a weeknight, and the earlier the better.  It's pretty popular and can have a really long wait time later in the evening, and especially on weekends.  Well worth the wait though.

Reviews.Author: J V.
Reviews.Content: DMK tries too hard to be Kuma's.  Yes, the ingredients used in their burgers are very fresh and I like that they serve milkshakes (!), but the weird community tables, especially if you sit next to the rudest, pickiest, dramatic couple like we did, makes the experience incredibly uncomfortable.We ended up at DMK on Halloween because Kuma's Corner was closed.  Like I said, the food is very fresh tasting, but a lot of the burgers are very, very similar to Kuma's corner, but not in a good way.  In a worse way.  If  a restaurant is going to try to one-up one of the best burger places in the city,  it needs to be 3 or 4 times better than what we had.  The burgers are sandwich size and the meal in general ends up feeling like an expensive snack, not a meal.  I had an espresso milk shake.  It was decent.  I did not like the onion fries that we ordered.  There is a decent beer list, too.We had 4 different servers and the server that was officially our server never actually brought us anything which was really confusing.  We also sat at this large community table.  The couple next to us was dramatic and rude.  It was uncomfortable for us to have to listen to and witness their theatrics about the food being bad, not having the condiments on the side in specific containers they requested, the server bringing them a huge, ice cream cookie sandwich for free and the couple complained about that, too, arguing about what kind of tip  they should leave, etc.   I don't really understand these type of seating arrangements unless you sit at a bar.  I give major props to the servers that helped this couple because the servers handled this difficult couple with a lot of professionalism.   Side rant:  No matter how bad the service or food is, I never throw a fit and also over-tip by at least 25%.  No matter what.  I have been a server and I know what it is like to deal with people who literally want everything for free and will be unhappy with everything no matter what.  I will probably not be going back to DMK because I don't think the food is worth it and I don't want to sit at a community table with divas again.  The ice cream cookie sandwich looked really good, though!

Reviews.Author: Vivian T.
Reviews.Content: I like to consider myself something of a veggie burger aficionado and HANDS DOWN, DMK has one of the best veggie burgers I've ever had. Easily. It was juicy and flavorful with texture and the right combination of ingredients.  Also one of my other favorite things in the world is SWEET POTATO FRIES.  Nothing makes me happier. DMK's were good and comes with a lemon tabasco dipping sauce.  My friend and I also shared the parmesean fries with a TRUFFLE cream sauce.  I don't need to say more... truffle?!? Yes, please.Great burger choices, great side choices, great french fries choices.  Atmosphere is clean and simple, nothing fancy or that cool or hip but it works I guess. If you like good food, then go. If you're looking for a fun atmosphere, might not be it.

Reviews.Author: Beth W.
Reviews.Content: Definitely my favorite burger spot in Chicago. The last 2 times I've been, my husband and I split the #1 and #2 burgers, because they're just so good we can't choose! I hear the lamb as well as the veggie burgers are delicious and need to try them. I just get there and my mouth starts watering for the first two! Also, the parmesan truffle fries will blow your mind. Love the sweet potato fries too! If you're with a group, get a few different kinds and share. Husband loves all of the beer selections - and I love the Sweet Tea Revisited cocktail. Great place to meet up with friends. They don't take reservations, and it's usually pretty busy - but be patient. Most of the time you can stand by the bar and grab a drink, snag a stool when one opens up and then you can go ahead and order. The bartenders are great at making sure you're taken care of if you want to eat dinner. Otherwise, enjoy the company of your friends over a drink or two and wait for your table. Only complaint is that the music is pretty loud so you usually feel like you're yelling to have conversations. And no, I'm not an old lady! :)

Reviews.Author: Reginice C.
Reviews.Content: Grass fed beef!I had a turkey burger melt and the fries with the truffle sauce.Yummm! It tasted oh so good!It was not a 5-star experience because the waitress we had was never there and did not check on us; we had to hunt somebody down.

Reviews.Author: Q M.
Reviews.Content: 1) Gumballhead on tap - yaes!2) The Holy Guac-Aioli burger IS that good. Get it. Unless you're not for spicy, because it kind of is.2b) The #1 Burger with the BBQ sauce and bacon was tasty. Compared to the Holy Guac, it was merely tasty, but I bet it was pretty good if I weren't comparing it to a delicious burger with chorizo and guac on it. Really, you can't top that. 3) Others have mentioned issues with the size of the burger and the service. a) My burger was a satisfying size. I didn't have to unbotton my pants after I ate, which is probably a good thing. b) Our service was just fine.

Reviews.Author: Dave S.
Reviews.Content: DMK gets four stars for the good service and great burgers (made from grass-fed beef!).  It's not a perfect restaurant, though.First, the tables are WAY too close together.  That plus the fact that the back wall is literally completely blank means that the person unlucky enough to not be sitting in the booth seat has nowhere to look other than directly at the person sitting across from them, which could make for a pretty awkward experience if you're on a bad first date or something (luckily we didn't have that problem).Second, the lights are really, really dim.  Combine that with the fact that the menus are printed on brown paper, and you get a menu that is comically difficult to read.  I was practically cross-eyed by the time I figured out what I wanted to order.Lastly, the salt and pepper fries were waaaay overcooked.  I like crispy fries, but these were just plain burnt.As I said, though, the burgers are fantastic, so I can definitely see myself going back, especially if they turn up the lights and buy a few posters to put on the wall.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie M.
Reviews.Content: Went on Sunday night at ten o'clock and the place was PACKED. Service was great, I explored the menu a little more than I usually would this time for whatever reason. We started with the deviled eggs (which I won't be getting from here again, but I was curious!), I ordered the #4 burger, we each got an order of fries; my friend got the truffle fries, and I, the blue cheese bacon fries, we ordered the mac and cheese #2 between us, and we each got the cinnamon toast crunch milkshake to take away. I love this food. I love these owners. These two concepts of Fish Bar and DMK are both just how I believe neighborhood restaurants should be.  So fabulous.

Reviews.Author: Jacqueline O.
Reviews.Content: so disappointed in their burgers.  While their fries were great but with Burger in their name, I expected better burgers.  Love the options, but the patty was lacking.  Could not order it rare or medium rare....they only cook it one way.Music was much too loud.

Reviews.Author: Natrina C.
Reviews.Content: AWESOME burgers!!!! Did I say AWESOME? Yep, just that awesome! I ordered the #1 on my first visit (burger with aged cheddar, bacon, onions *I eliminated the onions* and BBQ sauce on a perfect potato bun). I ordered a turkey burger on another visit. Both times I added half order of sweet potato fries and half order of parmesan. Can you say foodgasm? With all of the traveling I do, my palate has enjoyed some really great burgers. Well over a year later, this is the burger that I think about and compare all others to. Five stars, indeed!

Reviews.Author: K W.
Reviews.Content: This were featured on Food Network and the burgers looked amazing. My friends and I ate dinner here and I didn't think the burgers were all that good. I've definitely had better burgers.

Reviews.Author: Will S.
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, good taps, and a great bottle selection. I had the day's #15 which nailed it on flavor but visually left something to be desired. Fries were a bit thin and left me wanting more, but the onion straws were on point: delicate, light, crisp. I imagine weekend and prime night waits are lengthy, like the majority of reviews here say, but sit at the bar on a weeknight and you'll be rewarded handsomely for your off-peak visit.

Reviews.Author: Denise S.
Reviews.Content: This place has the best burgers in the city. The burger menu is creative, great selection of fries, and there is a wonderful selection of beers. Try the fried pickles and okra - great appetizer!

Reviews.Author: Kerry H.
Reviews.Content: I'm really surprised at the abundance of sub-par reviews. I think the burgers here are fantastic! My only qualm with it was the noise level. The music was really loud, good selection of tunes, but just too loud for my late lunch taste. Aside from that, the food was terriffic and the service was great! Our server was very knowledgable and friendly. Also very quick and efficient. My husband had the bison burger with pickled onions, goat cheese and a blueberry BBQ sauce. I was going to order it too but was not really feelin the idea of a blueberry bbq- i was so wrong! That burger knocked it out of the park! Flavors like crazy! The meat was so juicy! I ordered the grass fed beef burger with bacon, balsamic onions and cheddar- amazing! The bun was really nice (not a pretzel bun and not a brioche, more like a soft ciabatta) but could have been a little more substantial- it got  soggy pretty quickly, but even a slightly soggy bun couldn't detract from the overwhelming awesomeness of these burgers. We also got an order of the hand cut fries with wisconsin cheddar and scallions- so good. Still able to be crispy under what felt like a quart of homemade cheese sauce and sliced scallions. I do have to say, yes it is a higher priced burger than i would normally get, but here you're not paying for quantity, you're paying for quality. The grass fed beef has such an amazing clean flavor and it definitely gets enhanced -not covered- by it's toppings. Overall great experience at DMK, we will be back!

Reviews.Author: Billie R.
Reviews.Content: Loved, loved, loved it! I could have eaten my weight in fries with Parmesan and Truffle Cream. The mac n cheese with carmalized onions and bacon was superb, and my burger- holy moly! I got the burger with Pastramie and Gruyere cheese, I usually have food envy, and my friends burger looked good- but I couldn't be happier with mine. Also had the deviled eggs- they were okay- but mac and cheese came at the same time, so I couldn't really give them much of my attention. Can't wait to try the Holy Gauc-aioli burger next!

Reviews.Author: David G.
Reviews.Content: I gave this place a second chance after a very mediocre first visit and DMK delivered.Service. 5 stars.The primary reason this place is receiving 4 starts instead of 3 is the service. It was OUTSTANDING. Read my previous reviews, my biggest complaint about Chicago restaurants is the typical garbage service. DMK completely bucked the trend. Granted, it was an off peak time period (Monday night), but it genuinely felt like the staff was grateful for your business (I know, a shocker in this city). During our dining experience, the service was attentive, generous, accommodating, and helpful. I honest to God can't believe I am saying this but, 5 stars for the service.Food. 3 stars. The fries are ridiculously good, best part of the meal hands down. I typically don't enjoy sweet potato fries but these changed my mind. The dipping sauce that accompanies them is fantastic. The onion strings were also a surprise. Very thin, crispy, and tasty. The burgers are average. It is almost like the burgers need more seasoning or something. Even with bacon, a fried egg, and green chilis, my burger was still rather bland. If you are a normal size dude, get a double ($3 extra) or you won't be full. The bun is not a pretzel bun but is an excellent change of pace from it. There are better burgers in the city, without a doubt, especially given the price.Drinks. Be aware, they serve their soft drinks in a can. No refills. As for the beer, I didn't have any but the rest of my party seemed pleased with the list. Bottom line: Excellent service, slightly above average food, but will not become a regular place for me.

Reviews.Author: Sam M.
Reviews.Content: Best burgers I've had so far in Chicago and an awesome atmosphere. Great location and good staff.  Nothing bad to say about this place, but get here early on a Friday or Saturday.  Having a beer while waiting for a table isn't the worst thing in the world though.  If you're coming to Chicago, go DMK Burger Bar!

Reviews.Author: Joel M.
Reviews.Content: This place gets really busy on the weekend so definitely keep that in mind. Quite a few of us went here for a friend's birthday and the burgers were great and the beer selection was very interesting as well.  I'd definitely go back again.

Reviews.Author: Mike D.
Reviews.Content: This place was highly anticipated and I think Michael Kornick got it right. I went here for lunch the second day it was open and right from the start I was greeted by Kornick himself. The menu is well crafted and I had a hard time deciding which burger to choose, but I went with #2; a burger with chili onion strings, blue cheese and chipotle ketchup. My girlfriend got the turkey burger and we got the cheddar fries and parmesan truffle fries. My burger was cooked to perfection and each ingredient blended well. The buns especially were a nice touch as they are toasted and perfectly sized for the burger. The turkey burger was good as well, but they really shine with their beef. As for the fries...if you are familiar with the truffle fries at MK these are very similar and amazing. I was not as impressed with the cheddar fries which were very reminiscent of Weiner Circle cheese fries. With at least 5 different fries to choose from it leaves numerous options for mixing and matching.  Another thing DMK does well is drinks. They carry Boylan's sodas as well as a few they make themselves. I tried the cherry and blood orange of which the blood orange really stood out. The beer list is also very appealing with some really good local craft brews and the cocktails sounded quite intoxicating. I will say the wait staff was not the most attentive and service was quite slow, but hopefully that will improve the longer they are open. I will definitely come back to DMK again and will make a point to try dessert as their shakes and ice cream sandwiches looked devilishly good. At $10-$15 for a gourmet burger and fries it's not too expensive at all and you will leave feeling satisfied.

Reviews.Author: KO B.
Reviews.Content: I live right around the corner and finally got around to trying the Burger Bar today.  Really interesting place.  Its on the brink of being a really awesome place.  Great atmosphere.  There were a lot of tables, but we weren't jammed in despite the place being completely full.  It was very loud, but I like it that way.  You wouldn't want to go there for a quiet meal.The menu was very big, but doesn't have many food options.  Lots and lots of beer, which is good.  Cocktails and wine too.  They have a cocktail called Chase the Green Fairy which features absinthe, which is cool.As for the food, very good.  My girlfriend and I ordered a shake and a homemade cherry soda.  I'd like to see them call it pop since we are in Chicago, but that's a small detail.  The shake was great, the pop was very bland.  They had a couple other flavors, but I won't bother again.  We started with an order of fried okra and pickles.  Came with a dill ranch dipping sauce.  I loved these, my girlfriend wasn't impressed though.  We also each got an order of friends.  This is what shined most.  The fries were fresh cut and very tasty.  I had the WI cheddar fries and my girlfriend has the sweet potato fries.  Each was a very good size, but they should be since the burgers don't come with any sides.  If I were coming here for a few drinks I could order just the fries.We ordered number 1, which was a bacon, onion, bbq burger with cheddar.  I asked for it medium since I was sharing.  I was told they only cook them one way and its medium plus.  I didn't argue, but next time when its my burger I will push to have it done medium rare.  You can't tell people you are a burger joint and then not cook it the way they want it done.  I'm sure they will bend on this before long.That's pretty hyper-critical for a 4 star review, I know, but it got 4 stars because I will definitely be going back.  They are trying to be trending a cool, and they have done a good job.  Its a cool place that is lots of fun.

Reviews.Author: Kate L.
Reviews.Content: Yummy yummy yummy!  The bubs stumbled upon this place late last week & we stopped by for lunch this afternoon.  The burgers were tasty - I had the standard #8, lettuce tomato onion pickles & mayo.  Truffle fries were, well, truffle fries: at every new spot that pops up in the city, but delicious nonetheless.  We ended the meal with an ice cream sandwich.  The individual components were good, but the cookies were too hard for us to be able to get both cookie & ice cream in one bite.   A few thoughts:1. The music is loud.  We went during lunch, when it was busy but not packed, and still had a hard time hearing each other. 2. Our waitress was friendly, knowledgable, and attentive...and completely ignored personal space boundaries.  I'm not exaggerating when I say that she touched me during every single visit to the table.  Its one thing if you're my best friend or my grandma, but having a woman rub my back during lunch is just...strange.Keep your hands to yourself and your music at a reasonable volume, and we're in business :)

Reviews.Author: Christopher E.
Reviews.Content: DMK was a lot of fun and had very good burgers. Absolutely try it out. We started out with the fried pickles and okra. They were crispy, not too oily and crunchy. Nice job. I had the #1 burger which is red onions and BBQ sauce. Really great burger. The style of this burger is a very thin patty which was fine by me because you can eat the entire burger without feeling too full after (unlike other recently opened burger places). The flavor was great, bun was excellent. Don't miss the cheese fries. All in all, this place is a great time with very good burgers in the thin-patty stiyle. Well done. Try it out and have a great time.

Reviews.Author: Melissa W.
Reviews.Content: And I had such high hopes...Service: Poor.  The bartender (whom we visited to get through the 30 minute wait) did his job well, with a very no-nonsense attitude.  As in, no smile, no 'hello', no 'enjoy'...just - "what do you want" and "here's your tab".  The waitress was on the border of rude and arrogant.  Had little time to discuss the menu at all and couldn't spare a moment to check back on us throughout the entire meal (as in, no water refills, no 2nd round of drinks...).  It wasn't busy enough to justify this type of poor service.  And when asked to REMOVE an item from a burger her canned response was "No Substitutions".  The food took 35 minutes to come up - which to me is way too long when they only have 30 other customers and nothing can be modified on the menu at all.Food: If you are going to call yourself a burger bar, then you had better bring it w/ the burgers...
