They didn't.  The burgers are cooked to one temp only "medium" which turns out to be well, unfortunately.  The patties are pretty thin w/ little seasoning.  The buns are overwhelmingly bready.  The toppings are lack luster and uninspired.  Been there done that and had it a million times better.  I would venture to say that the burgers at Red Robbin are more lovingly crafted.  On the other hand, the side dishes were fantastic.  Fried okra - awesome.  Cheese fries - awesome.  It is the side dishes and the drinks that took this from a one star to a two star place.Value: Poor.  For what it is, this place is over priced.  I would not recommend and will not return.

Reviews.Author: Tim R.
Reviews.Content: I would rate this a B/B+ burger.  I had the #2 with fried onion strings and blue cheese.  For a thin patty style burger I thought is was well cooked (you do not order temp but it was not over cooked).  The parm/trufle fries were awesome.  I also tried my friends sweet potato fries and they were great as well.Service was a solid B.My only issue was the fact that all burgers do not come with lettuce, tomato, and onion.  When my burger came with no lettuce or tomato I did not want to wait so just ate as is.  Also no mustard or ketchup on the table.  Final WTF.  We ordered the chocolate chip cookie ice cream sandwich (B, but how do you screw this one up) and a couple people ordered coffee, but they do not have any hot beverages.  What?  Get a coffee machine DMK.  Also had the fried okra and pickles which were very good.Overall good burger and fries but I did not love the a la carte menu including $1.75 can of coke.

Reviews.Author: Andy S.
Reviews.Content: I went here for dinner with a couple friends on a whim, as none of us had been there before, and they were looking for burgers. We went on a Friday night around 9 and got seated immediately. It was however extremely loud inside, and difficult to hear each other or the server.On it's own merit, the meal was good; the burger was a bit thin for my taste (I prefer a thicker juicier cut, these are flattish though flavorful), and the fries were quite good (5 varieties are available). However, I feel compelled to compare it to other burger focused restaurants, and on that front I think it falls short. Both Kuma's and Bad Apple have a better burger (thicker, more flavor), offer a pretzel roll (my favorite kind of bread for a burger), and have a much larger selection of beer (in brewery as well as type).

Reviews.Author: Ash K.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic from start to finish. Loved every minute of it. From the freshly baked bun to the well cooked burger and the truffle parm fries. I went here on a Sunday night and my party of 4 was seated right away. Started with the Orange soda (Also made inhouse) and ordered the Lamb burger. Others on the table ordered the #2. Burger was moist and very tasty, it went by too fast. Next time, I am going to add a patty just so I can be full. The girls however were stuffed with jus the single patty.My lamb burger was moist and exactly how a lamb sandwich should taste with Taziki and lots of olive oil. I also tried their "regular" burger, and it was just as tasty. Next time I am going to order a burger and add an extra patty. They dont have refills here plus that much orange soda cant be good for ya - so i opted for Diet coke. Overall, I wouldn't compare this to Five Guys burger as this is a higher quality burger and definitely one of my favorites. I have yet to try Kuma as the long wait times turn me off! Some suggestions would be:-  to keep a Ketchup bottle on every table -  increase the qty of table fries -  lets customers add more toppings with little or no upcharge-  free refillsPeace and love

Reviews.Author: Darragh B.
Reviews.Content: Great place. Stopped in last night with our 2-year-old. Ended up sitting at the bar and we're glad we did. Food came fast. Service was great. They even brought the little one out a cupcake:)Burgers were pretty amazing. Got 2 different kinds of fries and the onion strings. We liked everything. Beer selection gave me a headache...not last night, but this morning.We'll definitely go back.

Reviews.Author: Becca K.
Reviews.Content: Very much enjoyed it.I split a #1 & #4 with a friend, also got two sets of fries (Wisconsin cheddar & scallions + Parmesan & truffle cream). Both burgers were really juicy, but not too heavy -- which I prefer and probably has to do with the fact that their beef is 'grass fed'. They're a lot smaller than you'd expect but still very filling. The buns are really soft. Yay :)I'd go back to try the other burgers for sure. You can also add on a fried egg or chili or etc for a little bit more -- which is nice. They're also coming out with a breakfast burger starting the 8th of January... I def wanna see how that plays out.

Reviews.Author: Celeste C.
Reviews.Content: I was underwhelmed to say the least.  If I wanted a mediocre burger that was somehow soggy and flavorless, I would have stayed home and made my own burger.  But I didn't.  I went to DMK.  And then I regretted it,  The wait was long, the music was way too loud to even hold a conversation over, and the food was mostly overpriced but mediocre.  Except I give props for the cheese fries.  Unfortunately,  it's gonna take more than cheese fries to win me over.  I think at one point during dinner I legitimately pouted.  Like a child.  You want a burger, you go to The Counter.

Reviews.Author: Sj S.
Reviews.Content: DMK...yum.  I've been there five times since it opened so I feel comfortable reviewing. Good: a)  Food, delicious and reasonably priced.  Burgers are WAY more interesting than a typical "burger joint."  My favorites: #4 and $9.  The ability to add a fried egg to any burger for $1?  YES, PLEASE. THE SWEET POTATO FRIES ARE SO GOOD.  So crispy and sweet/salty. So are the Wisconsin cheese fries.  Parmesan and truffle are...fine.  Highly recommend the onion and bacon mac&cheese.  The ice cream sandwich...amazing...I'd go there just for that.  b)  Drink selection.  Every beer you could want.  Good cocktails too.c)  Nice, friendly, funny staff.  I've never been unhappy with service.  Bad:a)  Very, very crowded and they don't take reservations.  If you're hungry this isn't a good last-minute place to go because you will have to wait.  The place is pretty small so it can feel cramped. b)  Loud music = loud talkers = screaming across the table.  Definitely not a place for large groups.

Reviews.Author: Diana C.
Reviews.Content: My in-laws took me here for an early lunch, and though I was concerned by the description, I had the breakfast burger with turkey sausage, poached egg, potatoes, and maple aioli.  (I was concerned about Maple syrup + mayo, but it turned out just to be maple syrup)  It's suppose to come with bacon, but I ordered mine without.It was so delicious.  I personally love the sweet and salty combo, so this breakfast burger was amazing.  The fries and onion strings were good as well.I was a little annoyed they don't serve coffee, since I didn't really want a milk shake or a beer with breakfast.  I don't mind the no substitutions policy, though there were a few burgers that looked good except for the blue cheese.  (I don't like stinky cheeses.)

Reviews.Author: kay m.
Reviews.Content: Patty melt was wonderful- not too big, just enough. Order with a side of sweet potato fries. Great beer selection. Our server was helpful and made great recommendations for us. We left happy and satisfied. It was actually refreshing not to feel stuffed, not to feel like we just ate a side of beef and had to be rolled out the door.  Great burgers!Atmosphere, a bit loud for my liking, and dining neighbors a bit to close.  A short wait, but worth it. Looking forward to my next burger.

Reviews.Author: Rahul G.
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic.  Maybe 5 of the burgers looked amazing and I could only pick one.  I got the triple DMK because I was feeling zealous and it was fantastic.  My server was awesome and friendly.  They have a HUGE selection of beer and a full bar.  They were playing lion king on their big screens for most of my dinner and who doesnt love lion king?  So that was a huge plus.The burger itself was phenominal.  We got these breaded pickles of some sort -- fantastic.  Just ask a server about them and Im sure they will know what you are talking about.  I fully recommend this place and plan on returning time and time again.

Reviews.Author: George A.
Reviews.Content: A friend and I went for the first time last night. We were really hungry and wanted something quick. Considering it is not a fast food place we decided to try it out anyway. I was surprised at how soon we got our food. The burger and fries were great! But what I was really impressed with was the service. Everyone was incredibly nice and welcoming. We sat at the bar and both bartenders were always checking in with us. As we sat there, a waitress who was waiting on drinks for her table asked how we were doing. We were kinda taken back because at most establishments no one cares about you if you're not tipping them. During our meal, another waitress brought us extra condiments and didn't seem bothered by it. Staff at other places would seem annoyed if someone from another 'section' would dare stop them for something. Overall the food was good, not the best, but I would definitely come back for the service alone. Although one thing I would suggest: turn down the music. It's a bit too loud.

Reviews.Author: Ashley D.
Reviews.Content: I went to the DMK in Oakbrook today.....I walked in and was immediately confused. I was expecting over the counter service, instead we got terrible table service. All of the servers looked like they just rolled out of bed and threw on some hipster outfit for work. I've never been to a restaurant or any business for that matter where there wasn't SOME type of professional uniform. There were girls in jeans and a guess top to guys in black pants and a button down. They all had tattoos that were in plain view and blinded you- should probably be covered up at work. I am pretty sure the 4 families that were in there regretted bringing their children there for lunch. Never been in a restaurant where all of the female servers walk around with their hair flowing all over the place. Probably the reason why I found one in my patty melt. As I soaked in the gloomy, confusing decor- I started to look at the menu. You pay $8 for just the burger... reasonable only because they claim it was grass fed beef. But the fries- I paid $4 for like 15 fries that had parmesan and parsley on them- FANCY. Oh and they came out 8 minutes after our burgers did. The food was good, but nothing special and definitely not worth $12. The restaurant resembles an underground train station or trendy retail space with some clubby looking booths and spooky lamp shades. Between the blaring music and all of the servers hanging out in their street clothes, it was hard for me to imagine this restaurant lasting longer than a year in Oakbrook. Especially with Labriola across the street.

Reviews.Author: Renne H.
Reviews.Content: Ate there this weekend, and while the food was great, the service was lacking.  I joined my party late, and when the server noticed I was an addition, she did come over and asked if I needed a menu or a drink, and I said yes, and that I'd have a glass of water.  She cam back wi a highball glass of warm tap water.  I looked on either side of me, and people had pint glasses of ice water, and I looked at my friends and we started laughing.  I ordered the Mac and cheese #2, which was great, and then I asked the server for a tall glass of ice water and she gave me a "how dare you" kind of look.  It's not like I asked her to fly to France and get me Evian from the tap.Like I said the food was good, but the service, and this server, we're subpar.

Reviews.Author: Ken Z.
Reviews.Content: GREAT burger! I had a double patty, cheddar, balsamic onion, bacon, & bbq. Very juicy. Full of flavor. One of the best burgers I've ever tasted. Sweet potato fries were good. Though, you can get those anywhere. Place had a cool vibe, friendly bartenders, and fun drink menu. But really, it's mostly about the burger. Just damn tasty!

Reviews.Author: Amanda M.
Reviews.Content: Prefer this place over Kuma's. Much tastier and unique flavors. Their assortment of fries are also delicious.

Reviews.Author: Christine M.
Reviews.Content: I went for dinner Saturday night.  This is my 3rd time so I decided to write a review.  I really enjoy the burgers.  The service is good and friendly.  My problem and why I am giving only 3 stars is the ambience.  It was hard to read the menu because it was too dark and the server could not hear our order because the music was blaring.  Too night clubby.

Reviews.Author: Ellie R.
Reviews.Content: Delicious. Amazing. So worth it. This is one of my favorite places to visit when I have something to celebrate and want to commemorate with a tasty burger.  I'm a gross creature of habit and I've only ever eaten the Holy Guac-Aioli burger, but it is DELICIOUS and the perfect mixture of burger and pseudo Mexican food that I love.  The sweet potato fries are also delicious.

Reviews.Author: Joanna P.
Reviews.Content: This place is just...okay. There's nothing terrible about it, I've just had better mac, burgers, and fries in Chicago (see "Fatty's" and "Villains").PROS:- Very good peanut butter milkshakes.- Nice beer selection- Portion control (if you're watching your weight, all their burgers are 5 oz.)- Everything is organic- Servers are nice (but a little spacey)CONS:- Burgers and fries come separately. In other words, if you want burgers and fries, expect to pay $15 for your meal alone.- Underwhelming/tired concept: this place is the light version of Kuma's/Kuma's Too. You have the same tattooed waiters/waitresses, same punk/heavy metal feel, same types of burger combos, same ungodly long wait, yada, yada, yada.- Wisconsin Cheese Fries = disgusting. There's something gross about the sauce that I just can't put my finger on. It just...doesn't taste very good. (I was also hoping for shredded cheese instead of cheese sauce, but that's my own problem.)- The burgers were dry and too small for the buns. Maybe I've gotten used to other burger joints that serve burgers the size of my head, but each burger I've gotten from DMK has thrown me back to those old BK commercials with the old lady who yells, "WHERE'S THE BEEF?!" It could also be compared to what girls experience after they move on from a guy who's really well endowed to a guy who...isn't. Uh. Oh.- Mac and Cheese no. 2: the sauce was grainy, the bacon was overcooked, and there were onions at the bottom of my mac and cheese. This may be a flavor preference, but the whole combination of onions + yellow cheese sauce = gross. And bacon?! How dare you OVERCOOK bacon?!My friends love this place, but I think I'm going to stick with what works for me. Will I come back here again? Yes, but only for a beer or a milkshake.

Reviews.Author: Andrew W.
Reviews.Content: DMK and Kuma's Corner are probably the two best burgers I've had in Chicago. The biggest difference is portion size and levels of messiness. Kumas will give you a beastly burger that you have to jam down to take bites of, DMK is much more simple, a more reasonable size, and more simple combinations for the most part. The Bison Burger with Blueberry BBQ sauce is the best burger I've had at DMK. Diners, Drive In's and Dives brought me here and pretty much ever Lakeview resident knows DMK. Place is a no brainer if you're craving a good burger.

Reviews.Author: Kevin K.
Reviews.Content: Some of the best burgers on the north side - and all of them taste great. They have a huge beer list with some great choices.

Reviews.Author: Anna W.
Reviews.Content: I have been to DMK several times, and each experience is better than the last. If you can handle the wait and a relatively crowded space, it is definitely worth it! They have a great beer selection (both taps and bottles) and honestly the best burger I have ever had. My favorite is the lamb burger with feta (I think it's the #11?) - I studied abroad in Greece and it always takes me back to the nearly 100 gyros I had there. You also have to get an order of sweet potato fries - they have some kind of aioli dip that is amazing. The food is one thing, but the service is probably the best I have experienced in Chicago. Nothing is worse than having a server that seems to be bothered by your presence, or on the opposite side won't leave you alone. Every waiter or waitress I have had there has been friendly and accommodating, but not in a fake way. The hostesses are equally great. On one occasion our party had to wait an hour and the hostess gave each person in our party a card to get a free beer. We weren't even upset about the wait, but both she and our waitress were sincerely apologetic and made the effort to ensure the rest of our experience was great. If you haven't been here yet, you HAVE to go. It is a place I will go again and again and not get tired of it. It has the relaxed and friendly atmosphere of a burger joint but the food and service of fine dining!

Reviews.Author: Magen M.
Reviews.Content: okay, so i'm updating this review because of a policy that I wasn't aware of when i previously dined. I guess it didn't really apply then, so it wasn't brought up. But they WILL NOT substitute ingredients. They don't really even have a regular old cheese burger there. They're all specific with BBQ sauce or blue cheese or some other pairing that some may like, but I'm a plain cheeseburger type girl. i find it downright rude that they wont put cheddar cheese instead of blue cheese on my burger. i mean.... not everyone likes blue cheese? it's extremely unaccommodating. if i'm paying $10 for a burger i want it the way i want it. I'm really a stickler for customer service coming from a family that owned two businesses growing up (pharmacy/old fashioned gift shop and "drug store" and a diner) and this is a real downer. I probably won't go back due to this "policy".

Reviews.Author: Susan K.
Reviews.Content: I went to DMK for the first time this past Friday evening with 3 friends... There's a spot at the bar where you're literally AT the bar but are still sitting across from each other as if at a table -- Very cool seating arrangement for our lucky party.The bartender, Drew, heard us say we hadn't been there before.  After we ordered some beers, a waitress brought over chili-rubbed onion strings and told us it was "compliments of the bartender."  Shortly after, the same bartender poured shots for everyone sitting at the bar, again on the house.  At the end of our evening, we were handed 4 cards, each good for 1 free drink at DMK.  Pretty cool!Drew was probably the nicest bartender I have ever had - His customer service skills were clearly amazing, when talking to our group he looked each of us in the eye as he spoke, and I will definitely be heading back there soon!

Reviews.Author: Johnny T.
Reviews.Content: DMK, why do you make me sad? If you glance down below this update, you'll see that I was a fan from nearly two years ago. While DMK had its detractors, I wasn't one of them. I spoke well of them and implored people to give them another chance in the face of bad service and shrunken portions. It looks like the joke was on me.I came here with a large birthday party. Prior to coming, my party called ahead (days in advance) outlined the number of people, needs and expectations. Knowing that DMK doesn't take reservations at all (really not a fan of this trend), I knew it would be a crap shoot. I also expected, however, that the management would speak openly and honestly about realistic wait times with that number of people (in their experience) and whether or not the restaurant could, realistically, handle that kind of crush. If so, cool. If not, no worries. They could handle it. Wait time would be approx. 30-45 min, provided our party arrive at the set time.Getting a bunch of [redecated] folks to arrive anywhere en masse on time is nothing short of a Christmas miracle but wonder of wonders, it happened! We arrived on time, told the hostess we were here and bellied up to the bar to get some drinks. I settled on a sweet tea cocktail that was disappointingly weak. Adding insult to injury, I was overcharged for it before I addressed the matter with the bartender. She 'forgot.' Mhm. I guess she also 'forgot' how to add any liquor to it as well. Things were not starting off well. Our party was big and a few other large parties wandered in as well. The place was uncomfortably crowded and hot. What ever could rectify this situation? Oh, right. Reservations. Anyhoo, 50 minutes passed and I went to get the hostess to check on our table. She was going to "look into it.' 15 more minutes passed. Still looking. After ten more minutes, she informed me that part of the section she was to place us at had four folks sitting there. They'd already paid and finished, but they were having a conversation? Really? On a busy Saturday night after satisfying the bill and finishing the meal, it's a good idea to keep a large party waiting for a half hour longer than expected (1 hr, 15 min wait so far) so people can take up real estate and not turn over to new paying customers?Huh? I wanted to leave but I was there for a birthday and that wasn't my call. Fifty minutes later (that's right, over two hours of waiting... at DMK... after calling ahead days in advance and discussing needs and expectations), we were sat. My appetite was gone. We received an order of onion strings and pickles for our troubles. That sounds nice before you take into account the size our of party. Not once did the management ever come up to us to apologize or explain the situation, despite us asking for them. Not once. Unacceptable. On the way to the rest room to wash my hands, I nearly slipped and busted my bodacious butt. Neither here nor there but it happened and added to my frustration. My #4 (turkey) tasted like a Bob Evans sausage patty and my draft beer was served in a stemless wine glass, rather than a pint glass. Huh? I got a wine pour-sized beer for draft prices? Ugh. Whatever, at this point. I was done. I'd been done for a while (hours, actually and literally) but I was definitely *done* now.With as much money as we threw down at DMK, I didn't feel accommodated or taken care of at all. In fact, I felt unappreciated and unwanted. My money was taken (full price, y'all) but no consideration was given. The night was frustrating but moreover, it was disappointing. Happy birthday, indeed.

Reviews.Author: Caroline M.
Reviews.Content: Forget having cake/cupcakes/other trendy things at my wedding.  I want to serve peanut butter shakes from DMK!!!!

Reviews.Author: Dane K.
Reviews.Content: I'm totally on the fence of "give it another shot" and "way too much attitude to go back" with DMK.  I'll probably give it another shot, but overall the first experience here had so many undesirables the second visit had better be great.Food:-Potentially great, but their menu is... weird.  There were two burgers on the menu that said "coming soon" ... Don't tell me what I can't order.  At first I was confused if the name was what they were trying to decide, but when I asked they said no, they were still "working on" those burgers.  Either way you're reprinting the menu, stop teasing me.-You can't substitute and the ability to "make your own" burger just does not exist.  So if you want something other than the combinations they've chosen, you're SOL.  You can't even add bacon or something simple.-You can't order your burger cooked how you want.  They cook everything 'medium plus' which to me sounds like a way to cover-up for a potentially too busy kitchen.   More problematically, IMO the burger I got was too well done.  It's grass fed beef, but might as well have been the ammonia soaked crap everywhere else serves.  This stuff had no flavor because it was just too far cooked.  My dining partner's was even more so well done, at least mine had 1 or 2 morsels where it was slightly pink, but overall it was grey matter.  I cook grass fed beef almost weekly and if I had made the same burger at home I probably would've hoped I had cooked it two minutes less.  Don't open a fancy high end burger bar and then not allow customers to order it medium or medium rare. Especially if you're using higher end beef, it's a waste.-They have an extensive beer list but their only cider option is Crispin. Not a huge fan. They were out of their house red zinfandel?  They have an extensive beer list, a few wine options, and a few cocktail options.-The burgers were OK. again they had not a ton of flavor... the #2 condiments were decent.  I appreciate that they make their own ketchup!-We ordered a side of fried pickles and okra.  It was really delicious, perhaps the best thing we had.  We also shared cheese & scallion fries "for 1" and they were like pub cheese fries basically.  Not overly gourmet but good.Atmosphere:-It was packed on Saturday afternoon for a late lunch. There was a 15 minute wait or so.  Michael Kormick himself was handling the list.-The attitude level of the place is a notch or two too high.  The music is so loud it gave me a headache in the 15 minutes we were waiting for a table.  The sound system is obviously over-designed with speakers literally every 2' along the ceiling perimeter.  So of course, if the music in one area is too loud it's too loud everywhere.  The place was packed and people were probably having to scream to be heard, which made it even worse.  During some songs the music was soft and perfect, but some others it was so loud I couldn't hear anything unless I stuck my head halfway across the table.  -The napkins they use were bar towels, but apparently not washed enough... I left and literally looked like it had snowed all over me and my face--I was covered in lint.The service was pretty good. She was really busy and things weren't super fast at times, but it wasn't her fault at all.  (She did, however, ask us how our food was before my dining partner had even touched his burger, then never came back..).  When she finally brought the check, I just handed her my card, not wanting to wait any longer... She brought back my credit card authorization but threw the itemized receipt out, kind of annoying.They left a comment card w/ our check, which we filled out.  Michael Kormick picked it up as we were leaving.  Hopefully things improve a lot next time.At $10-13 for a grass fed burger/fries (depending on which fries you choose) it is a pretty good value even notwithstanding the cooking mishaps.  I'll give it another shot, but I think next time I think I'll wait for a calmer afternoon weekday, not 2pm on a Saturday.

Reviews.Author: Lauren P.
Reviews.Content: dined here on a chilly thursday night around 9:30 - no waiting. we ordered: appetizer: deviled eggs sigh. nothing special about these eggs. i could have made them myself. kinda disappointing. but kudos for having them on the menu.main entrees (there were three of us): #2, #6, mac 'n' cheese #1 salt and pepper fries, sweet potato fries, parmesan truffle fries the real star(s) of the meal were the fries, with salt and pepper leading the pack. i appreciate that dmk makes all of its own dips and ketchup, but the sweet potato dip was just... off. it tasted mostly like sour cream. not the best compliment to the fries in my opinion. the mac was chock full of bread crumbs and dry as a bone. where was the ooey gooey cheese? that's what mac 'n' cheese is about! now, if you have the word "burger" in your name, in my opinion, you should be hitting them out of the ballpark. dmk burgers are more like pop up flies. first, they don't ask you how you want your burger cooked. what? my boyfriend got lucky - his came out perfectly cooked, nice and pink. mine was well done. yuck. the patty's pretty thin, so i think it'd be easy to do. i also didn't care for the bun, which made up for the majority of the burger. that being said, i'd suggest getting a double. i ordered the #2 because of the amish blue cheese that was supposed to be on it. turns out, there wasn't much to be found, except for a small dab in the middle. i was really hoping to be wowed; instead, the burgers came off as very lack luster. also, the "coming soon" burgers on the menu are a waste. i don't want to see it if i can't order it. dessert: chocolate cookie / coffee ice cream sandwich chocolate chip cookie / vanilla bean ice cream sandwich the chocolate chip cookie tasted like there was cinnamon in it, which was a turn off. the ice cream was good. overall, the sandwich was pretty messy and hard to eat. since the cookies weren't soft, ice cream shot out the sides every bite.i really wanted to love this place, i did. but i ended up coming away with an "ehh" feeling. i don't know if i'll visit again. they did have a great beer selection, so i could see myself coming back for beers and fries. prices were pretty reasonable too. but in all honesty, duffy's burgers absolutely kill this place. something tells me mk doesn't care.side note, the music went from blaring passion pit to smooth jazz while we ate. weird.

Reviews.Author: Frank L.
Reviews.Content: Burgers were delicious and unexpectedly fast for a Saturday Night. Service was friendly. Drinks were great and they had a limited edition baklava milkshake that will haunt my dreams. Will definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Paul C.
Reviews.Content: Do yourself a favor.  Visit this place in 3 months and see if they don't have the kinks worked out.  I found the bar itself unpleasant as it didn't seem to know if it wanted to be a hipster restaurant or a casual burger bar.   Sports on flat screens with the sound off so I can listen to flavor of the month indie tunes.  Pick one or the other guys.  I hate the indecision.  The burgers were nothing special.  No option on how it's cooked.  Quite assembly line.  The buns were the clear highlight.  They've the perfect amount of bread to meat ratio and don't fall apart in your hand.  Unfortunately nothing between the buns was worth it.  I hope this place improves as it shows promise.  But right now it's no fun to be at and the food is not worth the visit.

Reviews.Author: dave s.
Reviews.Content: A lot of people were telling me about this place, so i finally made it over there tonight and I have to say it is NOT great. It is trying SO HARD to be The Counter (which is amazing) but just isn't. I got the #1 burger and my wife got the veggie burger and we also ordered seasoned fries and sweet potato fries. #1 burger was small and the bun and onions were too burnt. The Veggie burger was just average I have had better at almost every place i have ordered one. Fries were good, but it is hard to mess those up and like the burgers I have had better.Dont waste your time.

Reviews.Author: Athena A.
Reviews.Content: The bacon cheese burger & the vegetarian burger were amazing! The wait was a little longer than we were told & our waitress was not on point that night but the burgers were fab!

Reviews.Author: Emily W.
Reviews.Content: Blue cheese & bacon fries are the only thing that stood out about this place. Our server was slow and took forever to come back and take our order and to check how our food was after we received it. My friend and I both ordered the #4 burger and were not impressed. It was spicy and needed some sort of sauce on it. By the time we finally got the attention of our server, our food was cold and we ended up sending it back. I might try this place again but, honestly, the ambiance of the restaurant along with the service was just not my cup of tea.

Reviews.Author: Casey M.
Reviews.Content: A Roasted Hatch Green Chile Burger, Fried Okra & Pickles, Margaritas and Micheladas all served up around 11pm on a Sunday night? Yes! DMK Burger Bar. Your burgers and service were a great beginning to a great Sunday night.On a late Sunday evening some coworkers and I had a hankering for some good burgers. But what burger joint is open late on a Sunday night? DMK is and is open everyday until 12am for us late night burger cravers. This burger bar is dimly lit with a clean and modern façade. The interior is fresh with a great creative feel far beyond any traditional burger joint. The beer menu is extensive and the burger menu looks simple, but with everything from a bison burger to a homemade veggie and grain burger it is sure to please every palate. Upon being seated promptly in a giant party table in the middle of the dinning room we quickly ordered our drinks with the courteous and cute server. We ordered margaritas and some Goose Island Sofia served in interesting stemless beer glasses. I guess without the stem our hands will slightly warm the beer to release some of the beer's nuances? The margaritas were great. With a great mix of El Jimador, Triple Sec, citrus and Lagunitas Pilsner (Pilsner? you heard me right) all round this great margarita.We all ordered burgers as well. I ordered the Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack, Smoked Bacon Burger and the Fried Okra & Dill Pickles served with Herbed Ranch. The burger was cooked perfectly with slightly piquant smoky chiles, jack cheese, smoked bacon all topped with an over easy fried egg. Deliciousness. All this goodness was served between a dinky bun. What gives? I understand the burger and accoutrement are really the pièce de résistance, but I feel the bun is lacking. The Fried Okra and Dill Pickle were really great. Crispy and well seasoned chicken fried pieces of pickle and okra served with a great ranch dipping sauce. There were a lot more pickles than okra, but that was fine with me. I love pickles. I finished the meal with the Gringo Michelada; PBR, fresh lime, spiced tomato juice with salt rim. All served a la carte so you get to mix each ingredient at your leisure.The overall meal and service was really great. Although it was nearly closing time I felt we were all treated with utmost respect and care. The burgers were great, the drinks were very satisfying and quite frankly I see myself going back to DMK Burger quite soon.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay B.
Reviews.Content: Awesome food! I had the salmon teryaki burger. OMG! SO GOOD! My boryfiend had this burger with the blueberry barbecue sauce, also delcious! Most amazing sweet potatoe fries! Typical popular Chicago restaurant experience--dark, close to people seating, modern feel, but pretty laid back attire. The service was very fast and quick to serve us. Their was a full bar with quite the beer list! Apparenlty, during the day I have heard it turns into a little bit of a hypster joint.(So I have heard). All in all I tell people to go here al the time!

Reviews.Author: Eugene H.
Reviews.Content: wouldn't come here for industry night unless you'd like to be questioned about being in the industry. have your pay stub ready if you do not have a business card. food is meh.. wouldn't make a trip over to have it again for sure. way overhyped...

Reviews.Author: Brent G.
Reviews.Content: Went to lunch here with a group of colleagues recently and really enjoyed it.  Very nice combinations of ingredients for each burger variety plus tasty sides and salads.  I had a salmon burger because I'm in a no meat phase and it was scrumptious.  I really appreciate being able to mix and match patty types with the different burger combinations.  The fired okra, onion strings, and sweet potato fries were all excellent. The waitress was funny and the service was prompt so good all the way around.  I will be back and try to provide more details.

Reviews.Author: Courtney W.
Reviews.Content: I go here about once per week. It is usually crowded, unless you go during the week around 5 or 5:30. The service is excellent. The bar is first come first serve and the bartenders are friendly and generous. The food normally comes out super fast which is nice. I always start out with a blood orange soda which is excellent and house made. Then, I order the number three burger which has pastrami and saurkraut on it. Excellent, the best burger I have ever eaten. I have had dessert there, including their excellent shakes and ice cream sandwiches. Nothing bad to say about this place.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie B.
Reviews.Content: The wait was kind of long. We went here Saturday afternoon and I think we waited something like an hour to be seated. According to my co-diners, the burgers were good (one had bison, one had the regular). The fries were really good. I couldn't partake due to not liking meats, but I trust their word.The veggie burger was good, but I'm not sure if it was $9 good. It had a nice texture and the toppings were actually a GREAT pairing. The bun was a bit lackluster and I'm not so keen on the 'no substitutions' rule.  I'm also not sure why this place has waiters and waitresses- Seems like it might go faster if you could order at the counter. No matter, I won't bash the owners for creating jobs.

Reviews.Author: s r.
Reviews.Content: Hyped up. Nice bar. Overcooked burgers. Don't treat grass fed beef like a mcdonald's patty. They don't offer you a selection of meat temperature. Guy said something about "chef driven" or something. I can't see why that apparently makes overcooking them ok.

Reviews.Author: Alfred T.
Reviews.Content: Just had dinner at DMK- the newly opened burger bar by well known chef Michael Kornick of MKs.  We live in the neighborhood and thought we'd give it a try.The room is warm and comfortable with exposed brick, nice lighting and good music. We were seated right away (it was early in the evening and the place did begin to fill up by the time we left). The first thing we noticed is, that although very friendly, the our wait person seemed a bit naive. We ordered a Northshore vodka martini, dry with a twist. They came out in highball glasses and were "dirty". We sent them back and out came two more that were properly mixed but maybe contained a shot and a half of vodka (the same meager amount) now in a v-shaped unstemmed glass.  The cost $11 a piece.  Now I've lived in this neighborhood for a few years and most establishments around here serve a decent sized martini for $11.  We felt ripped off.  I think the manager came over and was apologetic and brought out 2 more. We were not charged for them because we complained, but others my not have such luck. To be fair, the beer selection was extensive.On to the food. For a starter, the fried pickles and okra. We got maybe eight pickles and 2 pieces of okra. The flavor was good with a good dipping sauce and crispy crust. We both ordered the burger with green chili and a fried egg. The meat is grass fed and was tasty but the patty was probably 6 oz at best.  We ordered the parmesan fries with truffle cream dipping sauce.  The sauce was great but the fries were limp.Now I understand that this is a newly opened restaurant and there are usually a few bugs to work out, but Michael Kornick is a pro and I guess we expected more.PS this place is also way to hetero. My partner and I began to feel like we were sticking out.  How but a few gay boys in the wait staff mix?  Maybe MK is shooting for a certain population? For our money we can have a great martini and burger with fries at Jack's on Halsted (straight or gay)!

Reviews.Author: Chrissy P.
Reviews.Content: I'm about to divulge something that makes me feel slightly gross about myself...I've consumed every burger on the DMK menu. Every. One. They are all delicious. You can't go wrong, this is a spot that all my out of towners demand to return to time and time again when visiting Chicago given the variety of food, bevy's and incredible atmosphere. I do wish they would bring back the original number 5, you know what I'm talking about MK, but am just as happy to consume the 6, 3, Ron Santo and 9 burgers (in that order of preference) with a side of sweet potato fries. Save room for the ice cream sandwiches and/or shakes, you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Author: Shannon K.
Reviews.Content: DMK Burger Bar is the real deal. I have lived in Chicago less than a month and I am already familiar with Michael Kornick's reputation in the food industry. I haven't been to any of his other restaurants, but based on DMK I certainly plan to! The space is great; not overstated, but sleek and hip. It's a place I would hang out just to drink their fine beer selection. I sat at the bar and I like a bartender who is informative and knowledgeable. I'm interested in local brews and I asked Matt about them and he walked me through their beer selection and told me about a lot of the breweries; I love that kind of thing. Well done Matt! He even gave me a couple sample tastes. And a card to get a free draft on my next visit. Now that's how customer service should be done. I went to DMK on National Cheeseburger Day (forreals); I figured what better day than NCD to check out a new (to me) burger joint. I love lamb burgers, and I love Greek gyros so when I saw the lamb burger with grass-fed Lamb, sheep's milk feta, olive tapenade, Greek salad, and tzatziki I was sold! Wow, the bun was exceptional; it was soft and warm and thankfully not huge. The burger was juicy, cooked perfectly and so fresh tasting. The Greek condiments were outstanding and flavorful (a little less feta though, it can be overpowering). I also ordered the sweet potato fries with lemon Tabasco aioli - shut the front door - that's a great combo! Again, it was a small, normal person sized order. I appreciate this; quality over quantity. Don't get me wrong, you will be full after a burger and fries here, it's just not that ridiculous size Americans have wrongfully become accustomed to in recent years. Good start to my Chicago burger experience. I will be back to try out the great brews (there are so many) and other burgers! Can't wait.

Reviews.Author: Sandra G.
Reviews.Content: Wow.... just the type of burger I've been wanting! Burgers are YUM! Sweet potato fries are yummy! And the gringo michelada was good... The only drawback in my opinion was that the bun seemed kinda wimpy. But by no means will that stop me from returning. I will be back! They also have an awesome pumpkin beer right now.

Reviews.Author: Rob L.
Reviews.Content: Ohhhh gosh darn it and dag nab it!It was not the best of days for me when I came here. Sulky about life a little and needed a little pick me up. Luckily, I had three friends that were able to join me for that pick me up. I had been wanting to try this place, (um hello burgers, fries and malts... um yum?), and everyone in the group was good to go and try this place out. Sweet. Day is looking a little better already.I saunter in, first to arrive which meant first to get a table. The place at 1pm was pretty hopping. The tables were full, the patrons were munching away, no one with a nasty face on, sounds promising. The girls serving, (if there are any male servers here, I apologize, I just didn't see any.), were very friendly and upbeat. Not one with a smile  on their face. They said a few minutes for my table of four. While I waited, one member of my party showed up and a minute later we were sat. As we chatted and waited for the others, I scanned the menu. As others have said, I see no point to tease me with unknown burgers. Teasing me in to coming back? Hmmm you are setting the bar high doing it that way. The burgers better be phenom if you are teasing me with combos that I can't get already. When the rest of the foursome showed up we chatted some more before we got down to business. The menu, (besides the unknown burgers), is pretty straight forward. You choice of burger, you can sub for turkey or veggie, (I did turkey for mine), also you can add a fried egg, plenty of choice for sides from mac and cheese, fries to salads.I went southwestern on mine with cheese and chilies and slightly healthy with turkey. I got a large order of the fries with Parmesan and truffle dipping sauce. I really like some of the combo's they have for their fires and mac and cheese. If I had more room, perhaps I would have asked if those around me wanted to share and got a side. In the end I liked my turkey burger, but wasn't super excited about it. It was good, not too dry, but it didn't blow my mind. I feel like they need to take the extra step and push the limits a little more. The bun was good, soft and homemade feel, but there is that little extra kick I think it could use. The fries were really good with the truffle dipping sauce, they were hard to resist. They also come on these small plates, barely bigger than the burger itself. Why? I don't know. I still ask this question to this very day. I know you are getting just the burger, but its nice to have just a little extra room. I do like the ala cart system and how you can separate everything, burgers here, fries or mac and cheese, which ever, and its not all on the same plate. I did notice strangely that they never asked how the burger wanted to be cooked for the beef burgers my friends ordered. Strange. For a place so highly prized on their burgers and how well they separate everything, I would think they would also want to make sure they customer got everything they wanted just right. In the end, I wouldn't fuss about coming here again. The service was great, up beat, friendly and helpful. The sight of the place was interesting, blending dark woodsy feel with a modern twists here and there and over by the bar. The prices are fine. They have a good selection of items for sides, more than I can choose for one sitting, but really, if I was craving a burger I don't know if I would be running back to this place for it. Considering there are so many places in the city with a good burger, I don't know if I would rank this one high on the list. It wasn't bad, but certainly not my top pick.

Reviews.Author: Elaine C.
Reviews.Content: If you ain't hurd, you better axe somebody.

Reviews.Author: David R.
Reviews.Content: Tasty burgers, great beer selection, nice sides, and friendly service.   Started with the deviled eggs (yes better than mom's), and then moved on to the #2 burger with chipole onion strings and blue cheese.  The burger was cooked and seasoned perfectly, and the crunchy rings gave it great texture.  Service was great and the beer recommendations were terrific.   My only complaint was the slaw, which had way too much mayo.  Looking forward to working my way down the menu at DMK over the new year.

Reviews.Author: Samantha H.
Reviews.Content: I went at a very down time, which is why I likely had a better experience than many.  I also hate the no reservation trend, but my friends just moved in around the corner so we decided to walk over after a Bears game.  Yes, it was about 3:30 so completely off time.  Thus, we were sat immediately but even at this off time, within 20 minutes the place was full.  Given this, I likely would not go here during a peak time.  That being said, my experience was quite enjoyable.  We were sat right away.  The server was actually pretty attentive, nothing spectacular.  Now, I know this is a burger place but it is an upscale spot and 'red wine' and 'white wine' as the only choices is rather annoying.  We were with another couple, one of which got the patty melt, which she gets there all the time and loved.  Her husband got the special.  Because it was close to Thanksgiving they had a Thanksgiving leftover burger where the proceeds went to feed homeless.  I got the #8 and my husband the #1.  What I loved was the size of the burger.  You can actually get a whole burger and not feel like you gained 14 pounds.  The burgers themselves were solid; not the best I've ever had but definitely above average.  The standout and reason for 4 stars are the truffle fries.  These were the best truffle fries I've ever had where the truffle flavor actually came out quite nicely whereas many places that market 'truffle fries' end up with fries that taste, well...like fries.  The sauce that comes with that and the sweet potato fries also were solid.  Overall would go back but not during peak period.

Reviews.Author: Samuel M.
Reviews.Content: Update: Went back to DMK tonight for a friend's birthday dinner. The hostess was horrendous. My friend put our name on the list at 7 tonight for a party of four and then left for awhile before returning. The hostess was fine with this, and indicated no problem. I was there at 7:20, sipped a beer no less than 15 feet in front of the hostess, and heard no name get called. When my friend came back with the rest of our party (7:35), we checked in with the hostess who informed us that DMK "has a policy of not seating incomplete parties", and had called our name to no reply (which is a crock, because I was standing there the entire time and heard nothing). As a result, she put our name ON THE BOTTOM OF THE LIST after we checked in this second time; rather than (as is customary for a party that is incomplete when called at any other place that doesn't seat incomplete parties) putting us at the next 4-top available after the rest of our guests arrived. We had to wait around half an hour extra due to these shenanigans. They're crowded, so I understand suboptimal hosting. They still make the best fries in Chicago, if only to accompany slightly above-average hamburgers, and I'll definitely be back for them. Having said that, I feel that I would be doing the Yelp universe a disservice if I did not report tonight's debacle!

Reviews.Author: Eames E.
Reviews.Content: the bathroom here has mirrors that give u a good view of your lower bod which is sweet bc u can watch urself piss. probably the most integral part of any meal imho

Reviews.Author: Gina F.
Reviews.Content: Went for lunch today (our 2nd visit) and everything was great.  My husband had the burger with the chili-rubbed onion strings & chipotle ketchup & I had the crispy portabella, and both were great.  We also had salt & pepper fries, sweet potato fries, and deviled eggs. Everything was very well-prepared.  I also reommend the rhubarb cocktail (tho I subbed vodka for gin).  The service was pleasant and attentive.

Reviews.Author: Annie N.
Reviews.Content: It's really late at night, yet I can't sleep. I'm laying awake partially cause of the coffee I drank late, but partially because I can't stop thinking about the luscious burger I got couple days ago at DMK.I've been well aware of the normal long wait at DMK, I live bout five minutes away. So I've been trying to avoid mentioning it to my friends, in case they go nuts and drag me here. I mean, how good can a burger get? But then this one friend of mine came visit from Boston, and I hadn't seen her in more than 2 years (yes, we are really friends), so I gave in and took her here (more so she was uber excited when she found out I live really near by - turned out DMK is famous even to a Bostonian). But luckily, we went during lunch so the wait was not an issue.I ordered a burger with brie and portabella mushroom (#6) while my friends got the turkey burger (#10) and #3: with Gruyere and sauerkraut. Their burgers don't come with fries, and some don't even come with lettuce and tomatoes, so we ordered a plate of sweet potatoes fries and Iceberg Wedge to share. The food came out momentarily. At first look, I was slightly disappointed with my burger. It looked rather empty - the brie and mushroom were both on the skimpy side (but I guess that's normally how they do it). And then I took a bite and Ooooh Emmm Geee I died! That thing was perhaps one of the best things I've ever eaten. The meat was well seasoned, tender and juicy enough. Their buns are not too crisp, not too stale. The cheese and mushroom were just perfect!!! Everything blended together sooooo well. I mean, how good can a burger be, right? NO ---- NOT right. A burger at DMK can seriously destroy your hope to give up meat; it can temp your boyfriend to not be a gentlemen and compete with you for the left over; it can cause you to tear up when he win; it can cause insomnia; and in my case, all of the above happened! The fries and the lettuce were both phenomenon as well. I actually prefer sweet potatoes fries at the Counter (they have skinnier fries), but I was for sure not against them here! Service was great and if you can, go for lunch to avoid the long wait. I'll probably run into you there because I've determined to come back and try every single burger on their menu 3 times!

Reviews.Author: Rah Rah C.
Reviews.Content: After eating the most disgusting microwave Thanksgiving meal ever, I thought I am going to treat myself to a good, juicy burger on Black Friday!  Went alone and sat at the bar.  The music was a bit too loud and the lights a bit too bright (had to ask them to turn down the spotlight before I began sweating) but the staff were very friendly and the place was clean!  I ordered the No. 8 beef burger - Gruyere cheese, Iceberg Lettuce, Tomato, Raw Onion, Bread & Butter Pickles, Mayo, and chipotle ketchup.  Also ordered the white truffle fries and a Boylan's cane cola!  Food was warm, presented well,  and savory!  I will definitely return;)

Reviews.Author: Lissette A.
Reviews.Content: I'm reading these reviews and I'm thinking "these people don't know a good burger". I understand that the appeal of DMK in this Lincoln Park neighborhood is going to bring out a type of crowd but trust me don't bother with this place.  You're paying for a burger $8 and then on top of that fries? And they don't even give you enough fries...and then you have to deal with the over priced drinks. The burgers are a joke..Where's the Beef? You get more bun this burger. Real Chicagoans won't go to this place. Its crowded because all of the Lincoln Park trixies are there with there Volkswagen driving boyfriends who all originated from the burbs. And the waitresses were wearing sequins...umm reminder this is suppose to be a burger place Bottom line. Don't bother with this place and save your money.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer H.
Reviews.Content: I have to say I'm less than impressed.  I've been wanting to come here for a while since I've heard good things about this place.  My step dad is working on our house and saw this place on a food network show and really wanted to come, so we came.I'm a big four square user and checked in to be pleasantly surprised they had a free small fry with first check in.  I was quickly unimpressed when my free small fry was 4 fries on my burger plate.  Thank good I ordered other sides.We also ordered the Parmesan truffle fries (small order) which was a tiny order of fries as well and was missing the truffle.  In addition we ordered the pickle chips and fried okra which was just OK.Next came our burgers which I was surprised how small they were and I found them to be OK.  Nothing special, there's actually another bar close by that has outstanding burgers (same high quality) that are much bigger and for the same price.If looking for a burger place, skip here and try another in the neighborhood, service, food and price is way better.

Reviews.Author: Allen B.
Reviews.Content: Nice place overall, however, I guess I've just had better burgers in my life. I'd go there again, but probably just for a drink.

Reviews.Author: Desi C.
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome! The service was out of this world. We sat at the bar and our bartender was Matt Kennedy. He was fantastic and made our first experience fantastic! From his thorough knowledge of the menu to the complimentary desert AND drink cards to use next time, you couldn't ask for a better server/bartender! We will definitely be coming back! The food was great and the shakes were AWESOME! See you again real soon!

Reviews.Author: Midori C.
Reviews.Content: Love this place! The staff is great and very friendly. The fries and burgers are delicious! Parking around the area is not ideal...would love to see valet there :)

Reviews.Author: Tom T.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic burgers.  I lived around the corner for a number of years and do miss the Green Hatch burger.  Also Salmon burger was a nice change.  I'm getting hungry just thinking about the food.  Though the burgers could be a little bigger...

Reviews.Author: Charles C.
Reviews.Content: Delicious burgers and fries. Try the sweet potato tots and the #4. Usually has a wait.

Reviews.Author: i.am.a A.
Reviews.Content: Fun place for a casual burger. Good for a lazy weekend afternoon, post-drinking night meal. Go here and have the fries. Some good looking servers too.

Reviews.Author: Laila C.
Reviews.Content: truffle truffle truffle fries!!! I wish I could buy a big jar of that truffle mayo...but that would also mean I wish I could gain 3 more chins.The chipotle ketchup that came with the salt & pepper fries were also bangin'!The burgers were...good...but nothing I'd hip hip hooray over. The beef might be grass fed but it was thin and overcooked (since they don't let you pick how you like your meat). I had the #4 with green chile, bacon and fried egg. They skimped little on the bacon but the green chile added a slight bit of heat and the creamy, runny egg countered it very well. Tried a bite of everyone else's burger. The lamb was ok, but I don't really like greek flavors on a burger. The prosciutto and salt & pepper chips was crunchy and delicious. #2 was also tasty but seemed like it was lacking some more depth.Overall, DMK is good..but there are plenty of other burger joints I'd pick over it.

Reviews.Author: Carolyn L.
Reviews.Content: I finally got to check out DMK with my good friend the other night and I'm kicking myself for not getting a milkshake! But no worries, I live pretty close and I plan on going back soon. So I tried the burger with marinated portobello mushroom, blue brie, griddled scallion, and dijonnaise. And of course, because it was an option, I got a fried egg on top. I just can't say no when that option is thrown in front of me! We both had a couple of 3 Floyds Gumballhead White Ale, which was delicious. But like I said, I will be getting a milkshake the next time. And I'll walk home just to make up for the extra calories. Oh and we split the truffle fries. They were a bit on the too-salty side, but delicious nonetheless.

Reviews.Author: Kristine N.
Reviews.Content: Came here after a Bulls game one night and the burgers were typical, nothing extraordinary, but we ended up leaving with a $110 bill. Fries are good though, but that's not enough for me to come back.

Reviews.Author: John L.
Reviews.Content: I'd lean towards giving 3 stars since my burger was just kind of average tasting to me but my wife proclaimed that hers was the best burger in Chicago she'd ever had. So, I'm a bit confused.  We'll go with 4 stars. The sea salt fries were excellent and they've got a great beer menu. Overall a pretty good experience though. Couple of things of note that were a little aggravating but certainly not annoying enough to keep me from coming back: The music was very loud for some reason. Not bar-level loud, but just loud enough to make it kind of difficult to have a conversation. There was only one toilet in the men's room which meant that I had to wait in line for a while. Our server, although extremely pleasant and helpful, didn't write down the order while taking it, which while that might impress some, it usually also means that something will be forgotten. The forgotten item just happened to be my beer which I didn't get until I was able to grab her attention half way through my burger. She apologized and promptly went and got the beer. In her defense though, she appeared to be the only server working the room and I thought that she did a hell of a job managing that because the place was somewhat busy. DMK will do if you're just looking for a decent burger and a beer and a nice atmosphere. The music should be turned down just a tad bit though.

Reviews.Author: BB C.
Reviews.Content: A typical burger joint?DMK is not just another burger joint because it has its own creation of burgers. I love the burger and the service!

Reviews.Author: MR W.
Reviews.Content: Love this place. I live down the street so I'm partial to my local spots but this place consistently delivers quality. If you are lucky enough to get Matt at the bar he is great. Knows his beer and explains all the tastes well.  Staff like that make people want to come back. All around good experiences!

Reviews.Author: Nycole H.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good. I got a #1 burger without the onions. To me it was a regular well tasting burger, nothing really stood out. The sweet potato fries were good but I've had better. Everything seemed pretty subpar. The service was actually great, the girl was very nice. It was lunch so pretty empty. She recommended a Backyard BBQ drink which was actually good but for $9 it looked like a shot glass. I guess I just found my love when it comes to burgers and drinks at another bar and it'll be hard to live up to the Fifty/50

Reviews.Author: Zack R.
Reviews.Content: I like the atmosphere of this place and the food is good, but they don't like when you deviate from the menu. I haven't found a combo of fries that I really like a lot yet and the burgers are a little small compared to other burger joints that they are competing with. I have no specific complaints that would knock it down to a 2 or a 1 star though and I have never disliked a meal here. I was hoping it would be better when I heard DMK was moving in though. However if a friend of mine suggests DMK I never argue, so I keep giving them chances for that 4th star.

Reviews.Author: Tabitha G.
Reviews.Content: I don't understand this place - did someone really sit down and say "Burger places are all the rage lets do something different - lets make a place where you CANT get what you want on your burger!" Ridiculous. The burger was the same as you can get at any one of a numerous places that have grass fed beef - and they actually let you put what you want on it. It was also incredibly loud and I am not talking about the music -  I could not hear someone 12 inches away from my face. So great place to take someone on a date if you don't want to actually listen to them talk. The only redeeming thing about this place is the buns. They are to die for. The most amazing burger bun I've ever had in my life. Unfortunately, since I would never go back here I will have to relegate myself to bun dreams only.

Reviews.Author: Zachary W.
Reviews.Content: My favorite neighborhood burger bar in Chicago.  Unique and delicious burgers with a good selection of beers.

Reviews.Author: Ira L.
Reviews.Content: We tried to go to Kuma's last night and just couldn't stomach the line when we arrived.  DMK was offered up as an alternate since we were already up North.  Last night was my first time at DMK.  The burger was excellent.  The staff was really friendly and quick.  The sides were tasty and I didn't have to wait to get a table at 7pm on a Monday.  My only negative was that they served their Coca Cola in a can so drink refills cost.  Bars usually give free soda refills.

Reviews.Author: Mr. C.
Reviews.Content: One word, SMUG. I go here thinking it's just your run of the mill burger joint, but instead it turns out to be the most pretentious burger joint I have ever been to in my life. Your telling me I cannot add a single slice of cheddar cheese to a burger because it would risk its carefully constructed culinary integrity? It's a effing burger for heavens sake! I can assure you this was not even close to being the holy grail of burgers, rather I got a overcooked, dinky, under seasoned beef patty with tasteless crunchy onions and a wad of ketchup... and your telling me I can't add cheese to it? What has this world come to.Alas they so unwillingly bring me a slice of cheese, which they refused to melt on my burger, but offered non the less on a cold plate. Never again.

Reviews.Author: Katherine M.
Reviews.Content: The sides are very good, and *my* burger was excellent. My other dining companions were underwhelmed, but they did not have beef or bison. The beef/bison bragging (by this establishment) was deserved BUT the actual showcased food items are only part of a restaurant experience.So the food gets a 4, but management gets a 2 so the overall rating is 3I've been to 4 dozen of bars-serving-burger cuisine in Chicago, maybe I should rate all of them when I get around to it. I am rating this one since this is about the best potential for a great longstanding place of any I have been to but This establishment is in need of a couple changes to enhance the dining experience so it doesn't become just another bar that serves burgers--it will, if it doesn't make some improvements. 1) This establishment is not a nightclub--the volume of the sound system was painful--it may have been the settings just for that night, but I could not have a conversation at the very broad tables without shouting. If my ears are going to be blown I better be seeing Metallica in their prime.2) Wait-staff need to check on tables. The guy delivering the food was checking more than wait-staff. You do need to stop by sometimes! Dude delivering food, younger fella, was conscientous. If he hadn't been there would have been a very tiny tip. 3) Bar service SLOW. Need another bartender or have current 'tenders Talk Less with patrons. I should not have to wait 8-10 min for a drink. Crazy times. Friday/Saturday is always busier--put more staff on.I would like to go again soon and try another burger--it will be my last time if I get another clearly inexperienced waitress/waitdude and my eardrums are blown out.

Reviews.Author: Ziyan C.
Reviews.Content: I have had the pumpkin pie milkshake and now I can die a happy woman.

Reviews.Author: Rebecca H.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers and beer selection! I have gone back multiple times.

Reviews.Author: Nick K.
Reviews.Content: We went here for lunch and I think I have found the BEST burger in Chicago. Wow was this delicious. The truffle fries were phenomenal as well.They also have specialty milkshakes available. On the day I visited they had a baklava shake and I figured I would give it a shot. It was GREAT! Had a big chunk of baklava right in the middle of it.Service was fantastic and timely as well. Very helpful in deciding what to order.DEFINITELY coming back!

Reviews.Author: Robin C.
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing!  Some of the best burgers I have had in the city ever.  I love the fried pickles / okra.  All of the different sides are awesome.The beer selection here is pretty great as well.  It covers the spectrum of what you would want.  Whenever I have come here all of my friends always find something they like.The last time I was here I was here with some friends just celebrating after a long week at work and the manager, Michael Short, came over and just checked on us.  He bought us a round of shots as well.  This guy is awesome.  I recommend this place to anyone for a good burger, to watch a game, to catch a beer, and to experience good service.

Reviews.Author: Zach T.
Reviews.Content: One Sentence review:DMK is Kumas for the Lincoln Park Set.  By comparison, it's not nearly as good as Kuma's, but I love the spirit of this place; the quality of the menu and that which makes it up.If I could go with Yelp here, I would (3.5 stars as of this writing).Service is excellent.  Hostess and Waitstaff (no waiting at 6:30 on a Wednesday).  The beer list is likewise excellent, representative of a good palate.  I had a Half acre.The Burger (reason for being there).The burger is small for an $8 burger.  I heard many complaints about not being able to have your burger cooked to order; most particularly from the TOC review by Heather Shouse, but I will say that my relatively thin patty was still cooked medium, showing some tasty pink.  However, it may be telling that there's not one "plain" burger or even just cheeseburger on the menu.  You can certainly order them that way, but the numbered choices are all dressed up.  I ordered the 1 with bacon, cheese, bbq sauce and onions.  As such, I could not taste the meat hardly at all (Grass-fed Shmass-fed.  Does it taste good?).  One of my dining companions took the bun off to get rid of the BBQ sauce.  It was good but there was way too much of it.  Overall, the flavor was good.  (By comparison again, a Kuma's burger is a synergystic experience, where you can taste all the parts and their superior sum). Fries were separate.  $4 for a table-sized order and $2 for individual.  I ordered the plain not knowing the tastes of my fellow diners, and found them unremarkable.  I'd love to try several of their dressed fries.The space is clean and trendy.  Very much like the Bristol or Revolution brewing.  Thoughtful decoration and lighting.  With a touch of Epic Burger's design thrown in.  I'll likely only go back if someone I'm with wants to try it.In sum, it's tasty and innovative.  It's a trendy space.  It's pricey for what you get.  I'll stick with my one-sentence review.

Reviews.Author: Carter G.
Reviews.Content: Had lunch here today with my mom. The burgers were good and the price was right at $8 for any burger on their menu. My mom was a big fan of the buns. We had the deviled eggs for an app which were good along with the onion rings. I would pass on rings as they were very thin with not a lot to them. They make their own soda there which was good. I had the blood orange soda. The reason I gave this place three instead of four stars was b/c they do not allow substitutions on the burgers. I wanted to get their #2, but I didn't want blue cheese. They told me that each burger is the chefs creation and you could not substitute. ALL I WANTED was CHEDDAR and I would of been happy. I ended up with the #5 burger which had some Italian cheese, prosciutto and peppers on it. It was good. We also had the garlic fries and sweet potato fries. They were both good, but note they are not included with the burger. If you're in the mood for a little bit higher end of a place where the prices on the burgers are fair, check this place out. Just be careful as they get you to pad the bill with all the extras which is probably brilliant on their part.

Reviews.Author: Ryan G. S.
Reviews.Content: My first visit to DMK started off on the right foot with an outstanding wedge salad. Then, it got even better when the fries arrived with an unexpected, complementary dish of mac-and-cheese (a kitchen error in our favor?). Unfortunately, I was not as impressed when my burger arrived: a #1, which has BBQ sauce on it. I must have been so caught up in the euphoria of the wedge salad and the other delicious things that I forgot my  rule: never order burgers with BBQ sauce. It overpowered the other flavors, and I was sad. But, I cannot wait to go back and try a different burger. And order another wedge salad and more truffle and/or sweet potato fries.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy G.
Reviews.Content: Best grass fed burger in Chicago, hands down. Reasonable prices. Fries with bacon and bleu cheese=ridiculosity. I only with they had a location in Andersonville :) Oh and around Halloween / Thanksgiving, the pumpkin pie milk shake is a must! Grass fed is the only way to go. Love the DMK, please stay!

Reviews.Author: Ang R.
Reviews.Content: Loud.  So Loud.  But worth braving every once in a while for the really tasty burgers and sides.  One of the better, fresher burgers in Chicago, for sure.  And the bun!  The bun is what really puts this burger over the edge; it's clearly made in house, and the tastiness was almost too much to believe.  I'm a believer now, in these buns!  I had the basic burger, with BBQ sauce and bacon, and it was good, but I think I might have to go more basic still next time, because the burger is stand-alone good enough.  My bf had #4, and he was blown away by how good the egg, cheese and burger were.  He's had other egg burgers before, but this is now his favorite.We also ordered onion strings, which were addictively awesome, and especially awesome when dipped in the homemade herb ranch (SO DELICIOUS, the ranch).  The salt and pepper fries were also good, but the house ketchup was not my favorite.  I'd happily try other fries though.One last thing--go early, because by 7 pm, the place WAS JAMMING.  I mean, it would have been a wait, I imagine.  Small place, big crowds.

Reviews.Author: Eric M.
Reviews.Content: DMK may have toppled Boston Blackies as the best burger place in the city for me. DMK does what a good restaurant should which is not worry about size but taste. Sure the patties here aren't 2.5 lbs, but they're juicy and topped with great flavors. I enjoyed the burger with chili rubbed onion rings and blue cheese. My wife had the green chili burger with a fried egg. Both were outstanding. The burgers aren't all that kill here either. The sweet potato fries are great and the parmesan fries with truffle butter are so rich a small serving is all you'll need. I'm also in love with a place that has a beer list large enough to fill it's own page on the menu. Had a great time at this place that's a nice, modern setting, great staff and good prices. Can't wait to try more and more.

Reviews.Author: Hope W.
Reviews.Content: Yum,  I love this place! Great beers, great food, great atmosphere, great service... All around pretty fantastic. I've never ordered something I didn't like. Just tried the veggie burger and it's one of the best I've ever had (lots of veggies mixed w/ brown rice and formed into a patty)! The sweet potato fries are delicious and somehow not greasy at all. Also appreciate their use of grass fed beef.

Reviews.Author: Coleman B.
Reviews.Content: I love DMK and am not even a big fan of hamburgers.  They have so many different types of burgers and meats, that you can try something new every time you go.  Everything is so inventive and tasty that I really can't recommend this place highly enough.  I LOVE the parmasean fries with Truffle oil, and the other options for fries, and the beer selection is incredible.  If you're going for just drinks, its a great choice, and they have bar bite size food in case you get hungry.  However you can also go food dinner if that's the type of experience you want.  Really this is one of my favorite places in the city, and the prices are very reasonable for the product and experience.  Go get it quick!

Reviews.Author: FoodLover Z.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic burgers and vibrant environment. My only complaint is that the home-made sodas need to be better.

Reviews.Author: Mike C.
Reviews.Content: Been here a few times and enjoy it. Can't say I crave it but it is a convenient meeting place with friends a business colleagues. Beer selection is good although I wouldn't mind seeing a few more new selections of crafts on there. Service has always been great whether from the bartender or servers. Very friendly and attentive. I've had the regular burgers and the turkey burger. Both are good, doesn't blow me a way for me to say "greatest ever!" but it's solid. The sweet potato fries are a great addition as is the Parmesan fries. We usually get 2-3 small size fries and share.

Reviews.Author: Andrew S.
Reviews.Content: We appreciate the prompt service, delicious and creative burgers, and the Wisconsin cheddar fries!

Reviews.Author: terry h.
Reviews.Content: hello amazing!  came in on a tuesday night and it was pretty busy but not crazy.  the bar was full but you could probably have squeezed in if you tried and there were a few tables empty at 8:30ish.  the options for drinks were definitely more than enough.  I got the honeycrisp cider and it was amazing!The food was incredible.  we started w/the fried okra and dill pickles and they were great.  I'm not a huge okra fan but I actually preferred it to the pickles.  Then we got a on the house side of the onion strawas which were incredible.  perfect amount of spice and deliciousness.  I got the veggie burger, which I would say is definitely in my top 5 all time favorite veggie burgers.  The consistency is a little mushy but the flavor was great and it wasn't so mushy that it was hard to eat or anything.  My friend got the lamb burger and said it was fantastic as well.  We finished the night with an ice cream sandwich of chocolate cookies around espresso ice cream.  perfect end to a great meal!the reason only 4 stars instead of 5 is because the fries aren't vegetarian!  They all sounded and looked amazing so I was sad I couldn't try any of them.  When I told the waitress I was a vegetarian though she pointed out the vegetarian options for sides, which was very nice!  I'd definitely go back and bring more people here...

Reviews.Author: Bryan G.
Reviews.Content: There was nothing wrong with the food at DMK.  My burger was cooked perfectly on a baby soft bun (maybe a potato bun).  It was topped with some grilled pastrami and a sweet remoulade.  The burgers come a la carte but they gave me a side of their salt and pepper fries for happy hour.  It was just enough food and not really that expensive for a quality burger.  My issue lies with the service.  My bartender was too preoccupied with training the new guy to notice my empty drink or remove my empty plate.  The twenty dollar bill I laid next to the empty plate, glass and crumpled napkin might have given her the impression that I was finished.  I'm not really sure.  There was a slight attitude that came with the service as well; like I was an inconvenience.  Everyone has a bad day but other reviewers had a similar experience.

Reviews.Author: Chris S.
Reviews.Content: I've been a couple times. Lamb burger? Check. Okay I got the lamb burger every time. It's a really good burger, and the truffle fries are a requirement. I cannot emphasize this enough. One thing: just know before going that it's crowded and kind of loud.

Reviews.Author: Frank V.
Reviews.Content: Inexpensive, amazing food, great beer selection, awesome service....top notch! This place needs more than 5 stars!

Reviews.Author: Josh K.
Reviews.Content: I like the idea behind their burgers, grass fed beef, good flavor combinations, but if you're going to be a great burger you have to cook a great burger and that it where DMK has dropped the ball in my experiences. Not looking for my super quality grass fed beef to be cooked medium well or even well when I'm not asking for those temps. There are more than a couple great burgers places in Chicago, but this is not one of them.

Reviews.Author: Sean F.
Reviews.Content: DMK was a disappointment and I will probably never visit again. First and foremost you cannot even select how you would like your burger cooked??? The burger was a decent sized however this may have been misleading because of the appetizer sized plate it can out on??? This place won't last there is too much competition for burgers in the city. Go KUMAS.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey O.
Reviews.Content: A tad bit overhyped .. There was nothing magical about the burger. It was an 'ok' burger and pretty good fries. We had a #1 - aged cheddar, smoked bacon, charred balsamic red onion, BBQ sauce and a #14 grass fed lamb,feta, olive tapenade, Greek salad, tzatziki, and split sweet potato and truffle fries ... Not the best, not the worst - just an ok meal. I think this restaurant is more geared for men to come in for a drink with their buddies. They have a full beer and whiskey selection that I could see as appealing. I like beer and whiskey, but I was hoping for a mind blowing burger ... Again - not so much

Reviews.Author: Kerry S.
Reviews.Content: After a recent visit to DMK we are in love! Awesome salads, burgers, fries and beer.
