The only thing not giving this a 5-star was the incredibly loud music the while time we were there. I understand the atmosphere, but shouting conversation throughout a 2-person meal was just not ideal. Be sure to try this place, we will be back!

Reviews.Author: Ashley S.
Reviews.Content: It's worth all the hype! Ill be back! The burgers are amazing, and service was great too! Go here now!

Reviews.Author: Rita W.
Reviews.Content: I see that a lot of yelpers have been comparing this place to Kumas.  Now let me preface this review...I have not been to Kumas..GASP I know I know..it's definitely on my list but the rumors of long lines have deterred me thus far.  I have been to the Counter though, and DMK is definitely much better than the Counter!  Even though the Counter is closer to me, I would trek the extra mileage to go back to DMK.To be honest, I wasn't expecting much, especially when I read about how they cook every burger medium to medium well, but I was pleasantly surprised.  Our waitress Lauren was friendly and very helpful with describing the menu to us.  I ordered the #9 which was the turkey burger with portebello and eggplant and blue cheese coleslaw.  I don't like blue cheese so I ordered the slaw on the side.  I tried the slaw hoping that maybe the blue cheese description would not be true but nope it was pretty blue cheesy.  I give it credit though, it wasn't overly cheesy or over mayoed and if I liked blue cheese I would have liked it.  Anyways I was impressed with the burger, its hard to make a turkey burger without drying it out or making a turkey with flavor but this turkey burger was both perfectly moist and seasoned!  I could almost eat this burger without any ketchup at all, and if you have ever seen me with ketchup, you would understand that this is a pretty high compliment.  I also really liked the burger bun, most bun don't have the strength to stay with your burger and usually disinegrates while you eat it (5 Guys anyone?) but this one was nice and fluffy and definitely held its ground.We also shared a large order of the truffle fries with truffle mayo..I could have used more truffle oil on the fries and the portion seemed smaller than I assumed a large order would be, but it was probably better for my stomach that the portion was what it was.  It came out piping hot with sprinkling of parmesan cheese, and they were the perfect fry size, not too big, not too small, and cooked perfectly crispy on the outside and a little mushy on the inside!   We also order a side of the regular mac and cheese, it was good but nothing specatular and we agreed that it was less cheesy than we thought it would have been.  We also shared the chocolate chip cookie ice cream sandwich which was two pretty sizable thin chocolate chip cookies with vanilla ice cream sandwiched inbetween. You can't really go wrong with that combination and it was a perfect way to end our delicious meal.   If I am in the mood for a good burger and fries, I would be back at DMK.

Reviews.Author: Lupe d.
Reviews.Content: I was hoping to like DMK, I really was.  I was looking forward to this visit and since we were in the neighborhood, decided to drop in for lunch.  I maxed out the meter because I thought for sure it was going to take a while to cook these burgers..  I had the #1 Cheddar/Bacon/BBQ/Balsamic glazed Onions, and my BF had the #4 Green Chile, Egg, Jack cheese, bacon.  We ordered some Gravy Fries and Cheddar fries as sides.  We were a little baffled at the "triple" burger listed on the menu, and I asked my BF if he wanted to pay the extra $$ for a double.  He said he didn't think he could handle a double.  At this point I figured we would be waiting a loooong time.... within less than 10 minutes our orders arrived - no lie.  When I looked at the size of of the patty, I was really disappointed - and I am not a big meat eater, but I guess my expectations were more on the Kuma's side that the Burger King side, especially when all the burgers were $8, not including sides.  So I tried to move past that and dug in... I will say, that despite the thin-ness (is that a word?) of the patty, the taste of the overall burger was pretty good - now keep in mind that includes the cheese, bacon sauce, onions, yummy bread (i liked the bread soft and warm)...but for the first time I wanted MORE meat because I didn't really taste the beef, I tasted everything else - again I don't even really like red meat.    My BF really liked his burger, but also commented that he wished he had ordered the double.  The fries were pretty good, I liked the gravy fries more than the cheddar fries, were they worth $4 each...I think the gravy fries were...the jury is still out on the cheddar fries.I can see how throwing alcohol into the mix can make people think that these burgers are divine... we were on the clock, so no alcohol, but I did like their iced-tea...pretty tasty!So why a 3 star?  Our host and server were very nice and I always appreciate good service!  Will we return?  Probably not but I am glad that I tried DMK...good, but not great...IMO.

Reviews.Author: Zach Y.
Reviews.Content: Best most creative burgers I have ever had. The atmosphere is awesome, the drinks are unique and the wait staff usually gets me all hot and bothered.  There sides are equally as good as the burgers, Love the fries and onion strings

Reviews.Author: Maddy K.
Reviews.Content: As a vegetarian I was not pleased when we decided to eat here. Lots of restaurants serve microwavable boca burgers and pass them off as homemade burgers, but this place was the real deal. It was probably the best veggie burger I have ever eaten. The onion rings were good but I didn't care for the fries. Usually I don't like onion rings so I was very impressed with these. Everyone I was with enjoyed their meals, especially the bison burger.The only downside was that it took a long time to get our beverages and the waitress did not ever return to refill them; I had to ask someone else to do it. I definitely recommend DMK and I intend to return.

Reviews.Author: Christina G.
Reviews.Content: This place is fun and plays the Bulls games right now if you care about that.  The wait on Friday night for a table was 60-75 minutes but we found seats at the communal table in about 15, and personally I like that anyway.  The burgers are good but not amazing--but I do really like that they only have grass-fed beef.  Gotta grab bits of health where you can.  They also have Gumball Head on tap, one of my favorites!  Sweet potato fries and mac n cheese are excellent.

Reviews.Author: Nitesh M.
Reviews.Content: Love the burgers and the beers here. Friendly staff is a plus.  Recommended to all friends and colleagues.  Take out of town guests here all the time.

Reviews.Author: Matthew H.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers and addictive truffle fries plus a top notch beer selection. I.M.O, you cant get much better than enjoying great food and drinks while Talking Heads and Wilco play in the background. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Louise P.
Reviews.Content: Amending my previous 3-star review at my significant other's request. We dine here bi-monthly, the food is consistently delicious, and the staff is swell. Sorry for not initially giving you that 4th star that you so obviously deserve, DMK!

Reviews.Author: Matthew H.
Reviews.Content: Great food, but WAAAAAAAAAAAAAY too loud. Are you a shitty Wrigleyville bar or a restaurant?

Reviews.Author: Jonathan M.
Reviews.Content: I want to give this place 4 stars but if that was the case I would see myself going back here sometime. When I went here nothing bad happen, the service was good, the food didn't take to long and it wasn't bad. I really liked the burger with pastrami and green chili on it, and the fries were great. I feel that the space felt a little cold but it's an open concrete room. Honestly I think the reason that DMK only gets three stars is because it's just not Kumas Corner.

Reviews.Author: Lauren H.
Reviews.Content: We came to this place because it was our last resort because we couldn't decide where to eat.  The burgers were OK, I wasn't so fascinated by it.  It is different because they have different burgers with each having different topping on it.  The parmesan truffle oil and sweet potato fries would be my reason for going back!

Reviews.Author: Jim C.
Reviews.Content: We had a great & fast lunch here on a Saturday at 1pm.  Burgers & fries were awesome.  We'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Ellen O.
Reviews.Content: split the burger with pastrami & kraut with an order of the regular fries. the burger was ok...but tasted more like a pastrami sandwich that happened to have a small burger patty on the bottom. the best part of the whole experience was the homemade bun. the fries were fine. i probably won't go back, just because there are other burger places i like much better.

Reviews.Author: Em M.
Reviews.Content: BEST PORTABELLA BURGER I'VE EVER HAD, IN MY ENTIRE LIFE!!I want to be here every night. Their sides are amazing.The atmosphere is great but good luck getting a table. The wait is worth it for the food.Prices are good, too.If you are a vegetarian, this is a top-notch place to go as a group if there a mix of veggies and carnivores. You'll all leave satisfied.

Reviews.Author: Amy L.
Reviews.Content: With the plethora of burger places in chicago, it's kind of hard to stand out. DMK definitely does that. They have an awesome bar menu with lots of fun cocktails. I always get the bison burger because it's so good and I don't want to risk getting something that I don't like as much. ha. The sweet potato fries are amazing, but not as a amazing as the fires with feta on them. nom nom

Reviews.Author: Samuel C.
Reviews.Content: Way too much going on with these bugers. I prefer the KISS strategy to burger creating. Focus on quality ingredients, not funky ingredients. Management were unpleasant, to say the least.

Reviews.Author: Colleen F.
Reviews.Content: hmm... I don't seem to agree with the other posters here.  I had assumed from my experience and the decor that this place just managed to stay open thanks to college students.  Don't get me wrong the food TASTED good.  It just didn't live up to most of the burgers I've had at other places.  First of all the burger is small, maybe a 1/4 pound.  They look big when you first get them until you pick it up and realize that it's about 70% bun.  It really reminded me of a Stake and Shake Burger for those of you in the know.  It seemed to be cooked on a flat-top too which isn't my preference.  The burgers are not cooked to temperature (why? this usually makes me think inferior meat) and you are limited as far as building your own (strange when they have all the ingredients).   So for one burger with fries it ran us about $14, yikes.  Despite the hefty price my husband and I ended up ordering another burger to split because we were still hungry.  I did like the bun they put the burger on and I give them credit for having Crispin Cider.  I also thought that the service was fast even though our server was extremely inattentive.  I hate having to flag people down after ordering just to feel like you're bothering them.

Reviews.Author: Alex B.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers, fast service, nice beer selection

Reviews.Author: Chuck T.
Reviews.Content: Come on, it's an f'ing mediocre burger. Not enough meat, a disappointing bun and a much weaker beer selection than the bartender bragged about. The bartender was a highlight however, he did a good job. The space is generic and very bright. Kuma's is far more fun with a better burger and beer list. Twisted Spoke has a better burger and beer list. I will not return, too Lincoln Parkey, the restuarant lacks character.

Reviews.Author: Kris C.
Reviews.Content: Can I just say, They really know how to make a burger taste like butter... So juicy and so flavorful, every bite keeps making you want more and more of its delightful indulgence.... Add the fried pickles and you are set!!!! If you want a great burger experience, come here!!!

Reviews.Author: Jonathan H.
Reviews.Content: Heard great things about this place expecting a fantastic gourmet burger.  The fact that they didn't cook a burger medium rare or understand why a burger would be cooked medium rare was a huge downer.  The Wisconsin cheddar fries were passable at best, the cheese tasted very powdered and processed.  However, the staff was very friendly, they have a great beer selection, but a great burger is what would've propelled this place into a higher rating.

Reviews.Author: Jessica G.
Reviews.Content: Came to this location for lunch today  One star off for the noise level, which is the same as in the Lombard location - too loud!  The burgers are excellent and I liked the Ron Santo that I tried today.  It had some pretty tasty giardinera on the burger and perhaps some other meat besides just the burger patty along with some rather delicious cheese.  I also liked the shake - this one was chocolate and espresso combined and the server was kind enough to have it split into three glasses so I and my dining companions could share without having to swap cooties.  Good service - maybe verging on aggressive but I guess at lunch, even though the place wasn't packed, they wanted to move people through.  Our orders were taken in a timely fashion and drinks were brought out rather quickly, as was the food.  Same extensive beverage list as at the Lombard location.  Very good stuff.

Reviews.Author: Khadijah K.
Reviews.Content: Juicy burger. YUMMY espresso shake. I've had better fries.SUPER loud music--def made us leave a lot sooner than we wanted.

Reviews.Author: Dancer  Dreamer T.
Reviews.Content: Late Sunday afternoon, wasn't terribly busy, but steady. Our waitress Kate was very sweet. Promptly bussed and wipe down choice table for us to sit at. Articulated the menu making sure we understood all our burger options. Promptly brought over drinks, decent drink selection.  Loved the Lamb burger, it rocks, so does the brioche bun it comes on. Finish with the ice cream sandwich it truly is delicious. Cheers to DMK

Reviews.Author: Maggie C.
Reviews.Content: Love this place!  Went before a show at the Vic and the waitress was super-friendly and great about getting us in and out.  Great beer selection... wished I could have stayed longer and tried some more.  As for the food... the mac and cheese was good and the #4 burger was *absolutely* delicious!

Reviews.Author: Cole L.
Reviews.Content: Of course when you talk burgers in Chicago, you have to talk about Kuma's. I think Kuma's having the vanguard spot in Chicago is a sad testament to the quality of this city's burger scene. I really enjoy DMK. I've been half a dozen times so far and have never had to wait. The burgers are very good, better than Kuma's in my opinion. The quality of DMK's meat far surpasses the much larger and much more plain burger at Kuma's. The ingredients are paired better, of the four different burgers I've tried, I'ved loved them all. If you feel the patty is too small you can order a double burger, which I've done several times. The decor is a spacious modern industrial that I happen to like. A nice escape from the blaring sludge metal, which I love but can't stand when its distorted and pummeling my ear drums at Kuma's.DMK bills itself as a beer place as well, which I think it falters at. The beer list is OK. Of course its better than an average burger joint, but if beer is a part of your sale, then you should try to impress anyone with anything over a cursory knowledge of beer. Every draught I've had there has tasted watery and underwhelming. I figured it was my own fault for ordering Goose Island there twice. What can I say, I know their beer is awful, outside of Matilda, but I continually give my local brewer the benefit of the doubt. The bottle list is completely what one would expect. It is a spattering of local and the few large national craft brews that Chicago's absurd liquor laws actually allow. So you will find your ubiquitous Allagash White, Dogfish Head 60 minutes, Lagunitas and Sierra Nevada Pale Ale. Nothing interesting, but different from most burger bars in that it doesn't run on miller chill and Budweiser golden wheat.

Reviews.Author: Mark Z.
Reviews.Content: It should be called DMK fry bar.  Their fries are better than their burgers.  Sure the burgers are very creative, but the fries steal the show in my opinion.  Gotta have the truffle sauce.  mmm mmmmExcellent selection of brews and other specialty drinks.

Reviews.Author: Eric G.
Reviews.Content: Any restaurant that mentions Nelson Algren and Simone de Beauvoir in the men's room will win my heart, but throw in some of the best gourmet burger and fries, and an excellent beer selection and you've got a favorite!The burgers here are numbered, not by rank, but to simplify the awesomeness presented. How can you truly define these burgers except by the list of ingredients? The burgers are cooked per the chefs design and served on a bun that understands it belongs to a group of ingredients and isn't the MAIN ingredient. I've eaten everything on the menu at different times and haven't been disappointed once. The sides are perfect: mac & cheese, fired okra, deviled eggs (!). By far the fries are what's not to be missed: the Parmesan Truffle Cream fries, the Amish Blue and Smoked Bacon, Wisconsin cheddar and scallion, etc. All recommended. Desserts are excellent too, the icecream sandwiches or the shakes are the perfect belly busting finish. DMK also boasts an ample beer menu, offering a good selection of craft brews by bottle and tap.Highly recommended!

Reviews.Author: Heather C.
Reviews.Content: Before I begin I just want to say that I do not enjoy writing a bad review on a business especially in this economy. However I believe that it is just as unfair to have a bad dining experience and waste your hard earned money ....especially in this economy, as well and I certainly feel like people should be made aware of the pros-and cons to make an informed decision based on THEIR tastes.As a few reviewers on here mentioned DMK definitely gets an A for effort. I wanted to love this place largely in part to their quality ingredients and grass fed meats as well as variety of choices for vegetarians, turkey and lamb burger lovers. However that's pretty much where the A grade stops. The AtmosphereYes it was loud and crazy. However that does not bother me as much. I definitely do think that whoever planned the seating in that space should have allowed for more space between the tables. In some areas of the restaurant you sit so close that it's like going to a benihana when it's just you and one other person sitting at an 8 top table. This is something that can be annoying but if the food is good I will eat standing up if I have to. LOLThe FoodNow this is where the problem comes in. The burgers were extremely small, thin, watery, greasy, and I think that you should definitely be able to choose the temp that you would like your burger cooked. Everyone is different so how can you not offer different temperatures to fit your customers needs. Also would be nice if we were told this up front so that perhaps we could go with something else. The burger was not tasty, and very mushy as another reviewer mentioned. The burger buns are huge (Making the burger appear much bigger than it is) but if you are looking for a half pound burger boy have you gone to the wrong place. The side salad (Almost Greek) was very good however I nearly broke my molar biting down on the olives since they were not pitted. Now that really pissed me off and also Who does that!? Oh and the guacamole.......................gross and I can't confirm for certain but it almost tasted fake although it could just be seasoned badly and over processed in their blender..........it was not authentic guac for sure. Which isn't a bad thing because guac is not what they specialize in anyway. Just wanted to give you a heads up.The ServiceThe service was not that great...but with that being said they were very busy. The server seemed annoyed at questions and did not check on us hardly at all. In fact I don't recall even getting a drink refill once.The ExperienceAll in all it was not a good dining experience. It was over priced for what you get. Service was less than stellar and seating was awkward at best. The shakes and desserts looked yummy as did the fries however I can't confirm that and will never be able to because I don't plan to go back. Hope this helps.

Reviews.Author: Michael N.
Reviews.Content: It was my first time there and my girlfriend and I always wanted to try this place out.  So we decided to bring 2 friends along so we can order more food to taste. I got the Breakfast burger which is a special. AMAZING! Turkey burger with a fried egg, hash brown and maple syrup! My girlfriend had the number 2 which was the classic. Grass feed beef patty, Amish blue cheese, crispy onion strings with spicy chipotle ketchup!One friend ordered the Mac and cheese number 2 which had Gruyere, smoked bacon, charred balsamic red onions. It's enough for 2 to share if you're not having a burger. Great for 4 people if you want to share for the table. The Parmesan fries with Truffle cream is AMAZEBALL!!! Sweet potato fries are always a favorite. A large order of Fries are perfect to share for two. Their homemade sodas are great too! We ordered the Blood orange. Atmosphere is friendly and clean and the Bathrooms as well. (Always a plus!) Oh, and we cant forget the other guy's order. Ben went with his heart and ordered the DMK Burger! Made it a double!! Let me tell you this, I'm not kidding when I tried this burger. It felt like a Big Mac on drugs! I loved it! I'd come here again and again!!!

Reviews.Author: S T.
Reviews.Content: When I'm craving a really good burger, I go to DMK. I am a big fan of a classic burger and DMK's #8 is the best. I love butter pickles, so that may make me love the burger even more... =)The burgers here are juicy (not greasy!) and flavorful. My friends have had the #1, #4, & #9, which they all enjoyed.The sweet potato fries and Mac & Cheese #2 are always ordered when I visit, both of which are delicious.On my most recent visit, I had a pork shoulder chili. It came topped with cheese and a side of tortilla chips. It was a little on the spicy side for me, but really tasty and I liked that it had hominy in it.It gets busy and noisy, but it's worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: Keri W.
Reviews.Content: Great beer selection.  Had to go after seeing the delish food on a show on the Food Network.   The burgers and everything was good.  I sort of expected more, but wasn't disappointed.  I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: Elina S.
Reviews.Content: Finally made it out here and I'm not going to compare it to Kumas, because I haven't been as I'm not too fond of this whole 2 hour wait for a burger concept...maybe someday. We came to DMK at like 9pm on a Tuesday night and got in right away, aka 0 minute wait time, score! We were a little overwhelmed at how loud it was but then again, after a few drinks, and we're in the same pace as everyone else. We ordered two bison burgers served with pickled onions, blueberry bbq sauce and blue cheese. After first bite, I was like, wow this is good. It was very good, but overall it wasn't my favorite burger that I've ever had because the sauce was a tad too sweet for my taste, and although I usually like the balance of sweet and salty, I guess I don't love it on my burger, and the goat cheese is not my favorite component on a burger. However, the bison was cooked perfectly and it was tender and juicy and everything right. The winner of the evening were there amazing sweet potato fries (and we had to get the large portion) served with a lemon ailoli and they were absolutely delicious. Perfectly crispy and the sauce was to die for...I should have just asked for that sauce on my burger. Overall, the place is definitely worth trying, but not my favorite burger ever. However, maybe I'll come back and get some more sides . We left full and happy, although we didn't love the fact that online the menu says the bison is $10 but at the restaurant it's $11, not a big deal, but I think it should be updated.

Reviews.Author: Greg M.
Reviews.Content: This place rules, pretty hard. Well at least the food does. The crowd this place attracts has a little diversity with age, however most of the people who enter this facility appear to be yuppies. But this is a result of it's location. The decor is nice, almost has a slight high end vibe going for it. Their beer selection is excellent and so is their house made fountain soda. However, if you do decide to get this get the Blood Orange flavor. I got the cherry and it was a little disappointing, but my gf got the Blood Orange and it was delicious. I ordered the Number 3 with a fried egg and it was absolutely delicious. My gf ordered the number 1 also with an egg and it slayed. If you love burgers, definitely give this place a shot. The atmosphere may not win you over, but I can guarantee you the food will.

Reviews.Author: John G.
Reviews.Content: I was so excited when I saw Black Butte porter on the menu! It's my favorite beer and I have never had it outside of Oregon. That alone put them on the road to five stars, add in the food and the great server and you get to where we are today. Ill be back!

Reviews.Author: Tommy O.
Reviews.Content: Of the 3 burgers I've tried here only 1 has been absolutely amazing (the chorizo one, forget the name). The others have been good, not great. Decent beer selection. worth a try, but the place is a little overpriced/overrated, especially given the line out the door every weekend.

Reviews.Author: Gretchen O.
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best burger I will ever have in my life! I recommend #5 The Bison Burger!

Reviews.Author: Char Y.
Reviews.Content: The burger was ok, but everything else was great! We had the mushroom burger, sweet potato fries, Parmesan fries, #1 mac and cheese, and an ice cream sandwich.  Everything was good except the burger. it was just average. I absolutely loved the ice cream sandwich thought, cannot wait for cookie bar to be open!

Reviews.Author: Kris R.
Reviews.Content: i know what you're thinking - no, it's not as good as Kuma's. it was more than deece, though.  my husband and i went there on a saturday night at 6p, which we thought was geriatric time, but not at DMKs.  it was packed.  the host said we'd have a 15 minute wait, though it turned out to be 25 minutes.  no big, we came in early for a reason (no, we're not over 65).  we had the mac & cheese #1 as an app, which was phenomenal.  i had the #2 burger sans the Amish blue cheese - they would not substitute it w/ cheddar.  it's annoying when restaurants say they can't sub anything because they're busy.  i also had the sweet potato fries.  he had the #4 and the truffle fries.  those truffle fries were AMAZING as well, but what's not amazing when there's truffle is all up in it?  we ended it w/ a choc shake and a cookie sammy.  both were great.of course, we didn't finish everything, but sometimes we splurge when we try new places.  got the mac & cheese wrapped up in a doggy bag, and next day it was still amazing.i would come back.   maybe we'll hit it up at 4p next time.

Reviews.Author: Amy D.
Reviews.Content: Two years ago when we came to Chicago we attempted to eat at Kumas Corner but left because of the 2 hr wait and the noise level didn't help either.  When we decided to come back to Chicago, we knew we wanted to go back, instead we stumbled upon DMK, and truly witnessed greatness.  They are very much what Kumas was a few years back.  They both were featured on DDD's, they both serve a young, hip foodie crowd.  It seems from many reviews that i have read that DMK is Hot, and Kumas is Not.  We came for lunch, and were surprised that we didn't have to wait.  Upon being seated we knew ordered their featured flavoured milkshake which was toasted marshmallow. We were going to split it ourselves, but our server was nice enough to do that for us.  The milkshake was out of bounds, it tasted like a campfire, and they include whole chunks of toasted marshmallow, so good.  For our burger it came with caramelized onions, cheese, bacon and BBQ sauce, it was perfection.  I ate at Holeman and Finch's last summer, and they claim to have the best burger in the states, but i guess food critics haven't tried DMK's because this burger is the bomb.  If i had to fault them on anything, my bacon was too crisp, and it kinda shattered upon being bitten into.  We also had the fries with truffle aioli, i love how they come with cracked pepper and parm grated a top them.  They were crisp, well seasoned, and the aioli was top notch.Overall, DMK was the first restaurant we came to on our Chicago trip, and it set the bar really high, i cannot wait to come back.

Reviews.Author: Angela S.
Reviews.Content: I'm a huge fan of this place. However, I've been here 3 times and I have yet to try anything other than the mac n cheese and the standard burger.

Reviews.Author: Jenna C.
Reviews.Content: It wasn't that much of a step up from something I can make myself at home. Also, I don't like that it doesn't automatically come with fries - what kind of burger place doesn't include fries with their burgers?? Amateurs... definitely NOT nearly as good as Kuma's.

Reviews.Author: John F.
Reviews.Content: Not impressed.  It's a good burger compared to a fast food joint, but as far as burger bars in Chicago?  This doesn't even make the top 20.  Burger was thin and crumbly and you have to order a side separately... really?!  That burger is NOT worth 10 bucks by itself.  However their mixed drinks are pretty good, otherwise it would have gotten one star.

Reviews.Author: Adam M.
Reviews.Content: I actually really enjoy the simplicity of the menu as it highlights the complexity of each burger.  Plenty of great options and typically good service.

Reviews.Author: Aprill C.
Reviews.Content: i've been dying to try this place out after watching an episode of DDD. i came in for lunch today expecting the place to be packed but surprisingly i was able to snag a spot at the bar no prob. (my preferred spot).i ordered a lagunitas IPA on draft, the bison burger w/ goat cheese & blueberry bbq sauce & a large order of the parmesan truffle fires. i got the large because many reviews on yelp complained that the portions were small. oh boy...my food arrived about 10 minutes later. the fries were bone cold. i told the bartender, Drew, and he quickly took them away. After listening to him apologize profusely and reassuring me that he was going to take them off my bill, i got into my burger. the bun-to-burger ratio was perfect. again, lots of reviews complaining that they are way too small but not in my opinion. and i eat a lot! cant say that i could detect the blueberry in the sauce but it was tasty none the less.finally fries #2 arrived! hot, crispy and HUGE! they were delicious & as i am a truffle whore, these completely hit the spot. even with the truffle cream, it was all i could do to eat 1/2 of the order.my bill arrived and sure enough, Drew not only comped the fries but gave me a card for a free draft beer next time i visit! trust me, I'll be cashing in on that free beer very soon.excellent food and superior customer service. sit at the bar. trust me.

Reviews.Author: Roy A.
Reviews.Content: I thought whether I should give this 3 or 4. The burgers are good. But the options are not too many as of now. Also there are way too many non-beef options. Seriously, 1-2 turkey options and maybe a veggie (portobello) is enough. If I remember correctly, there were 7 or so beef ones and 4-5 non-beef. They even had lamb. That's fine to have 4-5 non-beef options if you have 20 or so beef varieties. But when about 35% of the burgers are non-beef, I get upset. Anyways, I went with 4 stars because it certainly has the potential and the fry sides are quite good I really was a fan of that. This place is obviously no Kuma's and I don't know if they're trying to be honestly even though they have a bunch of beer and burgers. It's a different atmosphere than Kuma's and one worth checking out--especially if/when the menu expands.Oh, I should mention that I asked the waitress if she was gonna ask me how I wanted it cooked and she said something about the patties are too small to have different temps so they are all medium well or something like that. Also, annoyed me. I like it med rare or med at worst. But, I'll still give it 4 based on potential and this can clearly change as I visit it more often.

Reviews.Author: Laura L.
Reviews.Content: I just can't say I loved this place.  Was it good, sure.  Was it close to the train, yup.  Was the environment acceptable, yup.  I love it that it provides sustainable meat and microbrews.  It's really great to see somewhere covering both.  And green chile options that actually taste good are rare outside of the southwest. It also had gravy fries which is always, always a good sign to me.  I had the Green Chile Burger, Gravy Fries and a cocktail (can't remember the name).The food was good.  The burger, I would describe as a high quality McDonald's burger.  It didn't really leave me full but it did taste good.  The fries were great.  The cocktail was undrinkable.  It was like straight whiskey (and I'm a whiskey girl) and only half of the glass full.  I looked around to other tables, their drinks were full.  I don't know if they forgot the mixer or what but when I asked for soda in it because it was really strong, it still came back only about - generously - 2/3 full.  I had to pour water in to make it drinkable...and barely still.For a burger, fries and 1 drink I was mildly satisfied and it cost me $20 just for that.  Everything was fine, but for the reputation this place has and what I experienced, it is wholeheartedly average.

Reviews.Author: Heidi S.
Reviews.Content: One of the best burgers in Chicago.  Super loud busy place....

Reviews.Author: Joanna B.
Reviews.Content: DMK Burger Bar was all I hoped it would be and more! After noticing a blurb about it in Bon Appetit magazine (a guaranteed trusted source of food literature) I asked my boyfriend to join me for a Sunday night dinner. LET ME TELL YOU, SON.The beer and wine lists were encyclopedic, but our server was as sweet as pie, and helped us (mostly my indecisive b/f) decide. I mentioned the fact that I was a line cook at a near by restaurant, and she mentioned that we were lucky to have come on a Sunday, because it was industry night. "Industry night??! Cool, what does that mean?" I asked."Half off everything on the menu, girl!" She answered.Then, my brain started to really sizzle.The two of us ordered two sides, two beers, two burgers and a milk shake at the end. The total should've been about 60 bucks, and ended up being just over 30 with tax. We could not have ASKED for a better deal. It was mind-blowing. But seriously, the FOOD:*The fries were good, but not stellar on their own. I work at a restaurant that serves really good hand-cut fries, and I know how easy they are to make, so I allow little room for error. I am a fry elitist. The sauces and seasonings were GREAT, but I would like to try a salad or mac 'n' cheese next time. *The burgers were not HUGE, but they had integrity. The meat was so flavorful, all on its own. SO BEEFY and just, real. Loved the burgers, loved allllllllll the combinations of toppings and house-made condiments. I want to try every single one. One claim-to-fame is their grass-fed natural beef, and it's for real. The burger was not as FANCY as I was expecting, but the taste was truly legit.*The milkshake was SPOT ON. We ordered a Vanilla malt, and honestly, it was just perfect. SO good after a meal like that. We could barely walk home, per usual for us, but we didn't even care.*The beer list is ROCKIN'. I would really like to take a beer-y kind of friend with me next time I go, so I could really enjoy it and try some awesome brews. My advice: Go with someone you love who works in the industry (Chef, server, bartender, etc) on a Sunday night after 9pm, which is actually a really cool time to go 'cuz it's not crazy-busy, and ENJOY. Get a few burgers and a few sides and share, share, share. Thank you, DMK. You are so cool, not gimmicky, and delicious.

Reviews.Author: Audrey S.
Reviews.Content: Very good burgers.  Not thick, but wide, which is what I prefer.  The fries were good, but not the best I've had.  The bartender was really friendly and they make very good cocktails.

Reviews.Author: Miles M.
Reviews.Content: You can't give this place more than three stars if you're a true burger lover. As Anthony Bourdain put it, "Any place that refuses to sell you a burger under medium temperature... is basically on the side of the terrorists."

Reviews.Author: Amy R.
Reviews.Content: Burgers were delicious but nothing extraordinary. Onion straws were a goopy, greasy mess. I enjoyed the fries. I would rather a Kuma's, Lockdown, or Rockit burger any day though. Mac and cheese was good but the portion size wasn't worth the money.

Reviews.Author: Dan M.
Reviews.Content: I think the ambiance is nice and of course location.  But the burgers just aren't that great.   If I am going to a burger place then I should be able to order a burger to a temperature that I like, medium , medium rare/well etc.  DMK is selling burgers that I would get from a chain like steak and shake.   So what is the point of going to burger place that doesn't feature the burger.  Anyone can put various toppings on anything.   I guess where's the beef applies here.

Reviews.Author: Sarah C.
Reviews.Content: Ordered The #4 -- Burger with Roasted Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack, Smoked Bacon, the Holy Guac Aoli, Parmesan and Truffle Fries, and Wisconsin cheese fries and shared it amongst friends. I liked the #4 burger bc the beef tasted softer and the bread is quite soft, but I still think Kuma's or Bad Apple's burgers are more juicy and the meat is much thicker. Truffle fries were probably the best thing I ate there, and the wisconsin cheese on the fries tasted like fake cheese.

Reviews.Author: Anthony E.
Reviews.Content: My favorite burger place in Chicago! Great food, great beer and a great staff! I have dreams about the parmesan truffle fries! If you love burgers and live in Chicago, this place is a must!

Reviews.Author: Sarah Beth B.
Reviews.Content: When DMK first opened, I was super excited to have a burger place to close to my house -- especially when I started hearing awesome things about the sweet potato fries -- but it took me until this weekend to finally try it.  I was definitely pleased!  The menu is pretty straightforward, and you've gotta order exactly how the item is listed, but that's probably for the best, because the toppings all work really well together. I ordered the number 2 (blue cheese, fried onions, chipotle ketchup), and it was awesome. I would have liked a little more ketchup, and I think I might ask for more next time.  I also got the sweet potato fries, which come with a lemon aoli which is delicious. I'm southern, and I love mayo AND sweet potatoes, so this was like heaven.  I was with a girlfriend who got the number 1, with bacon and cheddar and bbq, and the truffle fries. She loved hers, too, but I thought the truffle fries tasted just like... normal fries, so I think I win. My only complaint-- and it registers a full star off-- is how loud this place is. We were fully yelling by the end of the meal. Granted, it was a saturday night, but I've eaten at plenty of bars on a Saturday and been just fine, while this was  primarily a restaurant-- and just too loud.  I'll be back for sure, but probably on a weeknight.

Reviews.Author: John O.
Reviews.Content: Once again BYOB comes through with a great Chicago food recommendation.  Super tasty burger and fries complimented with a good selection of micro brews.  The service was friendly and enthusiastic.  I enjoyed the #2 burger and look forward to trying some of the other menu items.

Reviews.Author: Michael H.
Reviews.Content: I'm gonna start with some Pros/Cons since this place has gotten like 225 review in 6 months---UNHEARD OF!!!Pros:1. Well Laid out Space, don't judge it by the outside!2. Good Beer List/Well laid out simple menu3. Quality Ingredients/Flavorful FoodCons:1. SKIMPY Portions2. Expensive3. Weird Music/No paper towels in bathroomThat being said, obviously this is not a Half Pound behemoth like Kuma's-we all know that. These burgers are like 1/3 pound grass fed beef creations of their chef. Every product they use in the preparation is high quality. I had the #4-Hatch Green Chiles/White Cheddar/Smoked Bacon/Fried Egg-- It had GREAT flavor but I just felt like each "condiment" on the burger was "Skimpy" -- PUT SOME ON THERE!! Had a few "CHILES" on the bottom, some SMALL bacon pieces? Come on, just lay it on there, I wanna taste the different flavors! Then the fries? Russet Potatoes/Wisconsin Cheddar/TONS OF SALT--They were great! Quality Stuff but again, maybe TEN Fries on the LITTLE plate? These guys have it down to a science, believe me-- you are paying like $11-13 for a burger with fries-- PERIOD!!  What is this The Four Seasons? Lets not even get into the "Temperature" thing--Charlie Trotter couldn't cook this thing Medium Rare..One more thing- you have to "Ask" for everything... I had no Salt/Pepper or Water- Had to ask for Ketchup? Guess what? A Ramekin about 1/3 full!! Go Figure... Beer selection? Standard Craft's--nothing out of the ordinary--midwest breweries. I'll be back to try the other burgers for sure, I just hate feeling like your get skimped at all angles!!

Reviews.Author: Mehran F.
Reviews.Content: burger: 4/10onion rings: 3/10 (where were the onions?)service: 8/10. polite, attentive, accommodating.

Reviews.Author: Eric S.
Reviews.Content: People struggle with the fact that DMK doesn't let you choose the temperature of the hamburger. I say Get over it. In fact, I really like it when competent chefs make executive decisions. He thinks that medium-well brings out the flavor of the beef best. I prefer rare beef, but I admire his stand. You know what else I admire? Beef fat french fries. Pro tip: split a burger with someone in order to reduce the chance of cardiac arrest. That would be a heart attack with a smile.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer C.
Reviews.Content: I don't know if I'll be back, because they will not customize any burger to your liking. For example I wanted the #2, but I don't like bleu cheese on my hamburgers so I wanted to substitute another cheese but I was informed that they do not substitute cheeses. I ended up getting the #1 which was pretty good albeit kind of greasy, my husband got the #2 which he enjoyed. We were not asked how we would like the burgers to be cooked, and neither of us thought about it at the time so our burgers were cooked rarer than we would have liked. For sides we had the bleu cheese cole slaw and the parmesan and truffle fries. The coleslaw was ok and the fries and especially the dip were good. Its actually pretty good food, but there's just as good burgers elsewhere who actually will make burgers to your specifications.

Reviews.Author: Kaman T.
Reviews.Content: I've been here a few times and I wasn't very impressed the first few times but I went there again today and they seem to have updated their menu a lil bit. I tried the Salmon burger with ginger slaw and red thai curry and it was one of the best salmon burgers I have ever ate. The salmon was MOIST and NOT dry at all. It's not very thick, but full of flavor. You can taste the freshness of the fish. Usually salmon burgers I've tried before are dry, thick, and bland, but DMK's is very unique. The slaw and ginger has a tangy flavor that compliments the fish very well. I also had the sweet potato fries with lemon tabasco aoili. Delicious! The fries were very crispy and the taste of the lemon tabasco aoili is delicious. Ask for a side of their house ketchup too. It goes very well with the fries as well. The bun for the burgers are very well made. Its light and fluffy so it doesn't override the taste of the meat itself. Personally I hate it when I get a burger and i get a mouth full of dense bread and can't even taste the meat.One thing I'm disappointed about is that i didn't see the Madagascar Vanilla Milkshake on the menu anymore!!!! That was definitely the BEST milkshake I have ever had and I don't even like milkshakes! The service here isn't bad. It's a young staff and the bar offers a pretty good selection of beer.

Reviews.Author: Heather M.
Reviews.Content: I will say that I'm not totally in love with the "all burgers cooked medium" thing. I like a rare, still-mooing burger - I didn't get it here. That said, the burgers were all tasty. The one with the egg was good - probably (definitely) would've been better if it were rare. The barbecue one, also excellent. Bacon mac and cheese is to die for, and I really like the truffle fries, even though I typically prefer thin fries. They gave us a peanut butter shake on the house for dessert - I would go back just for that. Mmmm.

Reviews.Author: Anne C.
Reviews.Content: I've been to DMK a few times and have not been disappointed yet.  I'm not a huge fan of beef, so the option to swap a turkey burger in for any of their signature burgers is fantastic!  I've always gone with a pretty good sized group and we love to order a variety of their a la carte fries-- I especially like the sweet potato fries.  On my last visit I went rogue and didn't even order a burger-- had a great wedge salad (to share) and AMAZING mac and cheese with bacon and balsamic onions.  Delicious!

Reviews.Author: AV G.
Reviews.Content: the place has 500 reviews.  Whatever your current favorite burger place is , DMK will not replace it.  Very nice place, totally together on how they handle things. Nothing special--everything is good--Drinks are very expensive--food is at  market price, but very small portions.  Do NOT get the blue cheese fries--Dont bother unless you collect restaurants--Pompei across the street is MUCH better.

Reviews.Author: Melissa M.
Reviews.Content: Pretty good beef for their burgers - nothing too special in my opinion though. Fried pickles were great though!

Reviews.Author: Cecil S.
Reviews.Content: Really great burgers, loved the #13 Portabello w/ turkey. Lose one star for dirty silverware

Reviews.Author: Kensey W.
Reviews.Content: so i've been meaning to try this place for a while and i'm glad i finally made it! the atmosphere is a typical bar and really loud. and even on a wednesday night, we still had to wait a few minutes for a table.they have a lot of different burgers. i ended up having the lamb, which was pretty good, but not as juicy as i usually like my burgers. i did really like the tapenade and tzatziki though. that was a delicious touch on a burger! the bread is also soft and not so dense, which i like.but the highlight of the meal were our sides. the parmesan truffle oil fries were delicious! they were hot and crispy with plenty of cheese sprinkled on top. the mac and cheese (guyere, bacon, and red onion), was soo good. it was hot and melty and gooey and delicious. the only complaint i'd have about those two dishes would be that they were really really salty. but i guess that's to be expected considering the type of foods they were. the miracle was that they were even good as leftovers.oh i also tried their vanilla-ginger soda. it was disappointing and not that fizzy. think a super-sweet cream soda with a slice of ginger in it. that brings me to a story that will be boring for you but i'm still grudging about. i said to the person who brought us our food, you don't do refills on the sodas, do you? and she said she'd ask our server. a few minutes later a glass of soda shows up at the table and i assume they do do refills. but they don't! i was charged for the soda, which is fine because it's only a few dollars, but the part that makes me angry is that i would have gotten a beer if i was going to pay for my next drink. not a mediocre soda i'd already tried that was mostly a glass of ice anyway. so missing out on my beer, i left grumpier than when i was eating.still, i'll probably be back to try some other burgers. you can't tell with a lamb burger how good a place's real burger will be.

Reviews.Author: Irene G.
Reviews.Content: Went to DMK on a weekday night.  There wasn't a wait which I liked very much.  However, we were seated too close to other customers which to me is a turnoff because you almost feel like you have to keep conversations at a minimum.  The place and overall ambience is casual & comfortable. Servers were attentive and not overbearing.On to the reason why we came here:The burgers here are awesomely good!  I liked that it didn't completely fall apart immediately after the first bite.   I ordered the number 4: Roasted Hatch, Green Chile, with Fried Egg and bacon and it was delicious!  Any burger with a fried egg on it gets major points in my book.  I was tempted to make it a double burger, but thought better of it.  The regular burger is actually filling enough.  We also had the Mac & Cheese with Parmesan Crust which was very tasty.I still prefer Kumas over DMK because I do love me some pretzel buns.  Plus Kumas burger is bigger and the burger comes with fries.  DMK burgers do not come with fries-you must order them separately.

Reviews.Author: Rob J.
Reviews.Content: Love that you can basically make your own burger and the toppings seem endless (e.g. fried egg=perfection). The choice of fries is nice too. Wish you could make a reservation b/c like Fish Bar next door it can get crowded fast. But that's the only thing I would change...oh, and sign up for their rewards card, you get 1 point for each $1 spent.

Reviews.Author: Darren F.
Reviews.Content: the place looks pretty small from the outside and surely it was small inside also.. this is my second attempt coming here.. the first time me and friends came here, it was too busy and we didn't want to wait...so yesterday i found the time to come back here with a friend and we got seated without any wait.. it was still very busy too.. the service was good..i ordered the the #1 which was aged cheddar,smoked bacon, charred balsamic red onions with rufus teasgue's bbq sauce and added a second patty for an additional $3... also ordered parmesan truffle cream fries to share...sadly i was kind of disappointed on how small the burger was.. the burger tasted good tho.. the meat patties tasted fresh and it was tender.... the buns was warm and soft.. i really like the bbq sauce they used on the burger.. the parmesan truffle cream fries was just ok.. I'm a big fries fan and after reading all the reviews about their fries, i just had to come try it myself... but i was let down.. the fries itself was good tho.. i would prefer just dipping their fries in ketchup instead of spending the extra on parmesan cheese and dipping it in cream..overall i think DMK is just OK... not bad and nothing to b wow'ed about..  but for the price.. i do think the burger should be bigger!

Reviews.Author: Katie K.
Reviews.Content: Man!! This place was great, I loved the burger and the fries were good too.  The waitress was really nice and bought our table a some fries, thought that was nice.  I had the number 1, it was quite divinely delicious.  I enjoyed the bbq flavor mixed in with the balsamic onions.  YUM.  The fries were great too, top of the notch.  I am not sure how you could not love their burgers.  They cook them medium and if you aren't a fan of that, all you have to do is ask them to cook it longer.  Definitely on my short-list for good burger joints!!!

Reviews.Author: Katie R.
Reviews.Content: I just can't give this place 4 stars.  I want to, because my burger was amazing, but the rest of it was disappointing.  first, i'll complain about something not in my control, which was the service.  maybe we were on an off night, but it took a good 20 minutes to pay the check, and the table waiting next to us waited for even longer for a side of ketchup.now, the things that are in my control, but still sad to admit were contributing factors to my disappointment.  alright, here it goes, i'm a picky eater, and by that, i mean a vegetarian.  with that said, i totally get that they don't even have to have veggie options, but some things seem unfair.  their veggie patty looked amazing, but i just wanted to have slightly different toppings (WHY are all veggie burgers made "healthy"?  dammit us vegetarians want to be fat too), which really meant adding BBQ sauce and red onion instead of pesto and eggplant.  well, that's a 2$ extra charge.  usually that sort of thing doesn't bug me, but the menu is all one price (9$, FYI), so it doesn't make any sense at all to me.  it costs extra to substitute something for something else that is the same exact price really..?.  lastly, and just a bummer but not affecting my rating, the fries are cooked in beef fat.  i totally understand and am so ever grateful that our waitress let me know.  yes, i loved mcdonalds fries when they were cooked in beef fat too, so i get why it's done.  she offered some other fried foods that i just wasn't totally up for, as they were fried in canola oil, and i just wonder to myself if fries can't be fried in canola oil too?  i honestly don't know, which is why i'm not deducting for it, but i wish it was possible.  sigh.NOW.  for the positive!  my burger was awesome.  my dining companion had the old fashioned regular burger and loved it.  the bun was fantastic, and as much as i love pretzel buns, i'd opt for this one because you don't leave feeling like you are going to explode.  it was slightly crispy and just.. so delish.  the drink i had was good and i suspect the others are as well.

Reviews.Author: Randall K.
Reviews.Content: Great outing.  Took family (4 from teens to toddlers).  Very nice.  Just get there early in evening as the place was turning from restaurant to happening hot-spot.  Everyone loved their food.  The service was OK, but server seemed a little busy.  Only the 6 year old didn't like the food.  I would take everyone back.  Great place for adult dinner if we want to mingle with a younger crowd.  Hip place and easy on the wallet.  Fed family of 6 for $125.00.  Some private tables and some shared tables.  No reservations, but did not wait.

Reviews.Author: Phillip K.
Reviews.Content: 4 of us went to DMK on Saturday night after a comedy show.  I'd been hearing great things about DMK for a while, that it's a top tier burger joint in Chicago.  I ordered the Holy Guacamole burger, and my sister in law got the bbq burger.  We split large Wisconsin Cheddar and scallion fries.So, first off, everything is ala carte, so the burgers don't come w/ french fries.  Not a complaint, but worth noting, as the $9 burger seems cheap until you realize that to add the $3-4 for small fries makes it not so cheap.The food.  Honestly, it was just okay.  Very thin beef patties.  The toppings definitely dominated the burger.  I couldn't really taste the meat.  I tried the bbq burger too, and it was just so heavily sauced.  The bacon was delicious, but any signs of the burger in there were lost.  The fries were okay, but portioned pretty small.  We bought a large for $5 and it just wasn't enough.  The best part of the meal was my beer.Overall, I'm glad I went, but wouldn't ever go back.  For people looking for a great burger, but not the Kuma's line, I'd suggest Bad Apple, or Lockdown.

Reviews.Author: Aaron B.
Reviews.Content: Being one serving of veggies a day shy from being a carnivore, I take my meat consumption seriously, and boy, does this place deliver. Everything is perfect: it's wide open floor space that somehow doesn't ever feel too cozy or too large, the beer menu is not overwhelming but something I couldn't possibly digest after even a visit or two, and the burgers and fries are sublime. I would definitely go with the #3 burger (sort of a burger done reuben-style). None of the ingredients over power any of the others, and the potato bun doesn't melt under the weight of the burger which is a major pet peeve of mine. The fries, especially the salt and pepper and the sweet potato, are about the closest to the ambrosia of Zeus that I will ever get, but to go for a truly Olympian endeavor it is definitely in the fried okra and pickles; it's like a dance party on my fungiform papila. Boom. To top it all off, their homemade sodas, which are placed in the afterthought location at the bottom of the menu are also quite awesome, especially the vanilla/ginger, which is what the streams of the Big Rock Candy Mountain must taste like. But with all good things there are some problems, albeit only one I can think of. If it's a weekend or anything where you'd expect people to be going out to dinner that night, expect to wait a couple minutes. This is not necessarily a total negative, because it's testament to the cuisine on hand, but is definitely annoying. Other than that the waitstaff is amazing, and extremely helpful. I recently took my little sister here on a school night in an attempt to win Brother of the Year, but when things were looking to run a little late our waitress, Kiley, was more than helpful in helping us get our food and was extremely attentive. If you're in Chicago for a night, I would definitely direct you here for something that I consider one of the better restaurant experiences in the city.

Reviews.Author: L. D.
Reviews.Content: Actual visit was 9/22/11 - Turkey Burger, Parm Truffle Fries.  I enjoyed the burger more than the fries.  It was an A-OK meal but I have no need to rush back.

Reviews.Author: Amy X.
Reviews.Content: it's winter, and i'm trying to save some money on heat.  solution?  eat more burgers and fries.  roommate and i decided to grab some food and bond over the universal social equalizer: heavy, fattening american food.  however, we also wanted to bond over sandra bullock, so the decision was made to order to-go.we both order the #5 (prosciutto, fontina, pesto, red pepper, sea salt and vinegar chips) and share an order of parmesan truffle cream fries.  a heads up, dmk does not allow you to substitute ingredients.  as a self recognized high-maintenance orderer, this does not bode well.  WHY can't i switch my fontina for blue brie?  i'll pay for it.  i'll even come back in the kitchen and do it myself.  please, i just want some pungent cheese.but no cigar.  all in all, the meal was meh.  we weren't asked how we would like our burgers, so both of our patties were cooked well done.  if you would like your burger a bit bloodier, i would speak up as it doesn't seem like the default.  salt and vinegar chips were store-bought.  truffle cream was good, but honestly, the deliciousness did not exceed what would be expected from the sum of the two parts.  at the end, roommate and i were more enthralled with the movie than the food.  at least we had sandra bullock to ease the pain?

Reviews.Author: Katie R.
Reviews.Content: Good prices and interesting combos! I've been a couple times now, and have had a turkey and a lamb burger. But beware, Diet Coke lovers, no refills here.

Reviews.Author: Cynthia E.
Reviews.Content: Had very high hopes, which were dashed. The service was great- friendly and efficient.   The French Country Ale was crisp and slightly rich.  The wasabi slaw was the bomb, and the fried okra and pickles were among the best we've had.  The burgers were disappointing and actually needed salt, although everything else was perfectly seasoned.  We had the lamb burger which would have been tasty, but the feta (which was terrific, BTW) overwhelmed the flavor of the lamb.  The most disappointing, though, was the burger with Hatch chiles.  Hatch chiles are hard to find in this neck o' the woods, as was evidenced by their scarcity on my burger, which arrived dry and overcooked with an over cooked fried egg-BOO-hardly a Hatch chile in sight, and the meat tasted of liver, which is a dead giveaway that the meat was old.  For $9.00?  And a la carte, at that?  Give me Bop n' Grill ANY day.

Reviews.Author: David L.
Reviews.Content: Can't believe how great these burgers, fries, beer, desert are. Great experience everytime (and I've been here a lot) I go.

Reviews.Author: Joshua N.
Reviews.Content: I'm really starting to fall in love with the insane beer list and the awesome burgers. I think I've had about 4 of the burgers so far. So I have some work to do for sure. Really like that (unless there is a big game on) they play a Chicago based movie. Cool stuff.

Reviews.Author: Sean M.
Reviews.Content: Eh, it was ok. Nice inside but food isn't that great. Staff is slow too. Won't be going back....I'll go to Kumas!

Reviews.Author: Sunil D.
Reviews.Content: Two of the best burgers I've had in town (and yes, I'm a fan of their "rockstar" competitor on Belmont). Before I get to the food, the service was phenomenal. We sat at the bar for our meal and literally had 3-4 people making sure we had everything we needed, without being overbearing or intrusive. Everyone was really friendly and it was one of those rare times that the service really elevated the meal experience for me, especially for a place that brands itself as a "Burger Bar". The food was great from top to bottom. I started with a Caesar salad which had the quality of something I would expect from MKs or another high end restaurant. A whole romaine head with anchovies and a great dressing, it was on par with the version at David Burke's Prime for literally 1/4 the price. As for the two burgers (half of each), I can't choose a favorite. The pastrami with sauerkraut and russian dressing (basically a reuben on top of a burger) was phenomenal. As heavy and greasy as it sounds, the burger (5 oz) manages to be flavorful, juicy and satisfying without being overbearing. If I had to choose a favorite though, the lamb burger would take the slight edge. Basically its a gourmet, upscale version of a gyro. Lamb patty with tatziki sauce and a greek salad (instead of the standard LTO). The bun they used was unusual (in a good way), not your standard burger bun, more like a fresh baked artisinal bread (not sure if it is or not), it was firm enough to keep the burger intact (which is also aided by the thin patty) and had a great texture.  The fries (parmesan with a truffle based dip) were also a big hit. To top everything off, the beer selection was top notch one of the few places in town that have Dortmunder Gold on tap.The atmosphere was somewhat lacking and it was a little too dark for my liking, but I was so heavily distracted by the quality of my meal I could have cared less.

Reviews.Author: anita m.
Reviews.Content: My momma always taught me if I didn't have nice things to say to not say anything at all. Luckily I don't have to worry for DMK. For starters, the menu is very straight forward - all burgers are $8 and fries are couple bucks additional but definitely worth the money! If there is anything that I will go back to DMK for it would be the Parmesan, Truffle cream fries! Seriously, those alone have the power to lull me back there. As for my burger -which is presumably what they are known for- was a tad bit dry. Must have been a bad day... I assume. I look forward to my next visit- the turkey burger seems pretty safe.

Reviews.Author: Emily S.
Reviews.Content: I've been back to DMK several times, and I have really loved everything I've eaten.  New favorites include the fried pickles and okra, the salmon burger (SO GOOD), and the sweet potato fries with lemon aioli.  Drinks are a touch on the pricey side, but the rest of the menu is pretty reasonable.  Snag seats at the bar for the best service.

Reviews.Author: James Michael S.
Reviews.Content: Had the veggie burger based on reviews from the trib and it had all the right moves! Went in on a Sunday night and it was packed, I can definitely understand why.

Reviews.Author: Kevin M.
Reviews.Content: I LOVE DMK. Burgers are so good. Every time I've been there the waiter will give my table something for free... Not sure if this happens to everyone though, ha! Great selection of beers too.

Reviews.Author: Ashley R.
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend here for a mid week date, and am very glad I did. It was pretty packed for a Thursday night but we waited and grabbed drinks from the bar. The bartender, Matt grabbed us and gave us two seats at the bar. He was super friendly, knowledgeable and not over the top. He gave us great suggestions and even bought us an appetizer. He also brought out his favorite ketchup, which was amazing, and was genuinely caring. We were very impressed overall. The service is what will bring us back. Matt was great and made our experience.

Reviews.Author: Stacie K.
Reviews.Content: I don't like burgers.  But DMK Burger Bar makes me like burgers.

Reviews.Author: Diana T.
Reviews.Content: Overall, I feel like my experience is pretty similar to other reviewers. Burgers are decently good, but def not awesome. Fries are tasty. Service is good. Environment is okay. But the drinks are way too expensive, especially when you want soda. But this place is still pretty packed so patrons must love it!

Reviews.Author: Brandon V.
Reviews.Content: Overall, had a pretty good experience here, but first I'll address the things that could have made it better for me:- They don't take reservations, and given that they have very limited seating space, this led to our waiting over an hour for a table on Saturday evening.- The system they use for seating once you do arrive is pretty screwy.  Just a girl walking around with a clipboard who takes your name and gives you a (low) estimate of how long your wait may be.  There is no announcement of names when there's space for you and your name comes up.  There is no vibrating, lighted coaster that alerts you that it's your turn, either.  The plan is to simply walk around every few minutes after your estimated wait time has passed, try to find the "hostess" again, and ask if you can sit down yet.  Just weird and not customer-friendly at all.- Since there is limited space, you are basically going to share a table with people you don't know once you are seated if you go on a busy night.  Actually, it may be a different table, but there will be only be about 12 inches of space between it and the next one.  This, coupled with the noise level, means this isn't a place to have a private, intimate dinner.Otherwise, food was very good.  Probably one of the better burgers I've had. Service once we reached the table was more than adequate, and I was surprised by how quickly the food came out after we ordered.I might try this place again on a slow Tuesday afternoon and see if adding another star may be in order.

Reviews.Author: Scott H.
Reviews.Content: A pretty damned good burger in a great neighborhood!  My only complaint is that the toppings seem to somewhat overpower the actual burger.  Fries are great.  The beer list was extensive!

Reviews.Author: Sourma K.
Reviews.Content: I had the Grass-fed Lamb, Sheep's Milk Feta, Olive Tapenade, Greek Salad, Tzatziki and that will probably be the best lamb burger I will have in my life. We also had the fried okra and pickles which was my first time trying and wasn't disappointed. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Author: William R.
Reviews.Content: Good veggie burger, just wish the fries were not cooked in beef fat. Great beer selection, cool atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Suana W.
Reviews.Content: this place satisfied my burger craving and offered up an interesting selection of beers to boot. i only tried one, the two brothers coffee beer that was available only for one day, but definitely want to come back to try the regular two brothers on tap and the milk stout. how did anybody ever come up with the idea of putting milk in beer?!!but, i digress. i came here at 8:30PM on a wed evening with three coworkers and the wait was about ~20 minutes, not as horrible as i expected. i got the burger with the green chile and egg, while the others got the lamb burger and the guacamole aoili burger. the lamb burger got rave reviews. we also split a few fries for the table: my favorite was the truffle parmesan. i'd definitely go back to try the lamb burger and the other beers.

Reviews.Author: Marissa S.
Reviews.Content: Yummy, yummy, yummy.  I've liked everything I've tried here from the regular burgers to the turkey burgers.  Fresh bakery buns and high quality toppings.  The service can be a little spotty and its definitely too loud, but we keep coming back for more.

Reviews.Author: Larry B.
Reviews.Content: One of the best burger meals I have ever had. Great bartenders, a truly good lamb burger, out of this world sweet potato fries, and a draft IPA that was one of the best I ever tasted. Will definitely return. People should make the pilgrimage if they have not already been.

Reviews.Author: brian b.
Reviews.Content: Yes, we ate a lot of burgers in Chicago this trip. Burgers at DMK were very good. Buns were crazy fresh. It definitely all works together and these guys have their act down pat. The July special Toasted Marshmellow shake needs to a become a regular item - killer. Very nice selection of brews, but stock it up with more locals folks. You got to get those wonderful brews from Ale Syndicate, Wild Onion, Revolution, and 5 Rabbits going! The Half Acre was nice. Parmasean fries were good and complemented the burgers well. Server had to be new because my order was wrong, then we were charged for 3 burgers not 2 (since he had to put in a new order for my correct burger) and didn't catch it till we were on the subway. Just as much my fault as his for not checking the bill.  I'd still be back. Right off the Purple line.

Reviews.Author: Gregory L.
Reviews.Content: Day 1.  Walking into a dim lit, chic, 50s music burger bar was a little bit confusing to me... at first. Being welcomed by owners David morton and Chef Michael Kormick changed that within the minute.  Their fleet of the fast paced hard working servers and bartenders are always at your service, no matter how packed it is.With a bar owned by such a reputable pair, the ingredients are no less than top quality.  Their buns made specially for DMK and delivered fresh daily by Highland Baking Co.  The meats, cheeses, beer, wine, condiments and produce are second to none.Ok ok, so enough fantasizing, lets get down to business.  I walk in with my brother, sit down at the bar and order the big red wine.  It is exactly that.  A special blend of grapes selected by Michael Kormick.  (The even bigger is supposed to be available soon.  It is comparable to a petite syrah, and I hear very good things.)  Then we order burgers, fries and a caeser romaine salad. I chose the Grass-Fed Lamb burger with sheep's milk feta, olive tapenade, tomato & onion salad, tzatziki.  All the flavors of the classical greek gyro with a twist and eruption of flavor.  I can't believe I'm saying this, but it paired perfectly with the wine!My brother ordered the Roasted Hatch Green Chile burger with fried farm egg, sonoma jack cheese, smoked bacon. Along with a chocolate shake.  The green chile and jack cheese gave off a nice pickled, spicy kick, and was then mellowed out by the smoky bacon.The shake looked like it was prepared with their chocolate ice cream, malt and chocolate syrup. I didn't try it, but my brother seemed to really enjoy it.Now for the french fries.  We ordered the truffle parmesan fries, and the bacon bleu cheese fries.  The truffle cream sauce is certainly a winner. Not too tangy and overpowering with parm, can't go wrong with them.  The bacon and bleu cheese were a nice change.  The bleu cheese has a mellow sharpness, and was melted over the fries, topped with bacon.  I mean it's bacon, of course it was good.  The fries are cut in the standard pomme frites shape, with their skins left on. They are seasoned plentifully with salt and pepper.  It's the toppings that really make themDay 2.  I live across the street, and couldn't wait to go back.  I went their for lunch this time.  I ordered the big salad with chicken(choice of chicken or imported tuna (the chunk style I believe)), the deviled eggs, and my brother ordered the #1Aged Cheddar, Smoked Bacon charred balsamic red onions, rufus teague's bbq sauce (Michael Kormick's favorite bbq sauce from a place near st. louis) The salad had mixed greens with fennel and artichoke hearts on it as well.  Just enough to fill me up.  The deviled eggs are the standard deviled eggs. Good, cheap, nothing special.  I preferred the prior burger choices over this selection.  The onions just didn't have as much flavor from the balsamic as I was hoping it would.  However, the barbeque sauce is a great sweet thick sauce to compliment the bacon and cheddar.The one difference I did notice with these burgers is that the toppings are actually strategically placed on the bottom of the burger, so that it hits your tongue's taste buds accordingly.  They are not too big, and if you do want them bigger, you can always order a double.  I will definitely back to try the rest of their selection.

Reviews.Author: geri s.
Reviews.Content: DMK welcome to Lakeview!  I am so happy to have you in my neighborhood.  I feel like you guys did everything right.  The staff was very attentive and friendly.  One of the  owners was on sight hosting.  How awesome is that?  The burger selection is amazing.  The prices are more than reasonable. I'm obsessed with the truffle fries.  I had them for lunch today and I am considering going back for dinner.  I live within a block of Counter Burger and Select Cut and have to say that this place blows them away.  5 well deserved stars.

Reviews.Author: Jaime E.
Reviews.Content: excellent burger. stellar buns. just enough fries. i had the burger with marinated portobello, cambozola blue, griddled scallions, dijonnaise. mc had the roasted hatch green chile, fried farm egg, jack cheese, smoked bacon. we each got our own portion of fries (regular and truffle - i think it would have been more impressive if i got one of the fries with a fancy cheese but i thought they were fine plain & simple).went back not too long ago and got one of their malts (thick!), the deep fried pickles & okra (very nice!) and tried the veggie burger, which was texturally interesting (and appealing) but didn't have your run of the mill black bean base. and it seemed deep fried for an external crunch. which was nice. and not greasy as you may be picturing. to beat crowds, i probably would only go for an early lunch on the weekend. i hate to wait! even for really good burgers.

Reviews.Author: Lindsey W.
Reviews.Content: While my fries were the most amazing thing I've ever had, I felt that my turkey burger was a bit plain. Even after trying the beef burgers I felt that they left something to be desired. Great bar setting, just too crowded on a Saturday night if you're looking for a good dinner. Expect long waits and shared tables.

Reviews.Author: Shannon M.
Reviews.Content: So I was really craving a (veggie) burger and fries and so I texted 'veggie burger Chicago' to Google and DMK Burger Bar (great way to choose a place, I know) so The Boy and I headed over. I should mention that it just happened to be the Saturday before St. Patrick's Day so it was crazy. Therefore, I won't gripe about the 30 minute wait that led to us eating at the bar instead of waiting even longer for an actual table. But even though it was crazy, it didn't take much effort/cleavage to get the attention of the bartenders (that Whirling Tiger drink on their menu is dangerous and the Lemonade was really good too).Now, about the food. I will admit that I wasn't expecting to enjoy my food all that much because I am generally weary of places that don't let me choose my food options/toppings so I wasn't happy that I could only get the #12 (I don't like portobello mushrooms so I really did have only one veggie option). But OH MY GOD I will never doubt them again! I had a foodgasm of epic proportions. It was so good that a guy came up behind me to ask about my burger - and when The Boy went to the men's room later, he ran into the same guy who said his wife ordered the same thing and loved it also. It was made perfectly with the eggplant being an excellent complement to the texture of the burger and the black pepper and sea salt fries were just what I was looking for. The Boy, a meatatarian if there ever was one, loved his burger also (don't remember what was on it but I think it was the #1) but the cheese on his fries tasted funny (I blame Wisconsin for that). The only problem was that there wasn't more of it (especially the fries - I ended up ordering some additional sweet potato fries and The Boy ordered some additional mac & cheese also).Oh and I should add that The Boy was really happy about the bill, considering how well we ate and drank that night.So thank you DMK Burger Bar for setting me straight and quelling my hardcore craving. I am definitely a fan now.

Reviews.Author: Karen L.
Reviews.Content: There has been a lot of hype about DMK so I was expecting a burger that rivals Kuma's burgers, but I did not think that was the case at all...Maybe I wasn't in a burger mood, but I thought the burger felt a little flat. I actually had a hard time deciding what burger to get since there was something that I didn't like in each of the options, which I know you could take out, but then it just seemed like a burger that was too plain. Ended up getting the burger with portabello mushroom and dijon. The burger was just okay... it was really salty for my tastes, though. Also ordered the salt and pepper fries with the truffle cream sauce. The sauce was good, but the fries were way over-fried and way too salty. They could have potential. And I would also suggest them to have a plain garlic aioli sauce, too. I don't know what places are trying to go so fancy with lemon aioli because it is just not that good. Try different herbs or something! They do have a nice beer list and their blue cheese/iceberg lettuce was decent. It is also very loud in there so hard to hold a conversation.

Reviews.Author: Gabe L.
Reviews.Content: This is a pretty good spot- the burger selection is very intriguing.  For my first visit I went with the turkey burger with swiss, tomato, arugula, and dijonaise.  It was very tasty- bun was a nice buttery brioche bun.  My one gripe is that the patty was very thin (probably 6 oz?).  Definitely smaller than you'd expect from a place called a "burger bar."  I got a single order of the salt and pepper fries- they were pretty standard but tasty.  I will definitely be going back here- I'm excited to try some of the beef burger offerings!

Reviews.Author: Tiff H.
Reviews.Content: I have to admit...DMK is one of the few things that will get me to go to Lincoln Park nowadays. Love is such a strong word and I'm not sure if I want to commit myself to use it when it comes to my relationship with this place as of yet...it's too early.I've been here twice now...and here's a breakdown of the highlights...and the lowlights:-Turkey Burger #9: Amazing. Not usually a fan of turkey burgers but the eggplant and the portobello combo with the blue cheese cole slaw was just heaven. Yes, I've ordered it twice.-The truffle fries and parmesan fries are nothing special...in my humble opinion.-Kitchen Caesar Salad: I felt like Brutus when it came out...my companion and I literally sat there for about 5 minutes trying to figure out why on earth would someone serve a salad like that.
