Basically, all of your ingredients are served on top of uncut romaine lettuce slices. It was pretty good once we figured out how to tackle it.-Fried okra & pickles: This isn't mama's southern style...the entire vegetable is lightly fried...(no little balls...hee). It was delicious...however, I was sad we got more pickles than okra.-Meat in general: Yes, I've tried my companions' burgers. Delicious. So...good. -Service: Excellent all the time, friendly, and speedy.-Atmosphere: The music is just so damn loud.-Drinks: I'd stick to the beers on draft. My cocktails were either way to sweet or just not what I even remotely expected.-Price: 2/3 beers + 2 burgers + a couple of sides + 20ish% tip = $50ish.Verdict: Honestly, the 4th star is purely for the burgers and good service. I'll be back...but only if I have a reason to come back into the Lakeview/LP area...and, hopefully, that reason will be moving to my side of town soon. You'll see me there again before summer is over...may as well get as much out of this fling while I can.

Reviews.Author: Fuffie G.
Reviews.Content: I went back last week to try a real burger since I did not love my veggie burger last time. We got there at 6:45 on a Tuesday. If you don't care that your eating a little early, that's the time to go. No wait!!! There were three of us in our party. We all ordered a different burger. I had the #1. Delicious! The meat was so flavorful and the bacon they use was cooked perfectly. We also ordered a side of Parmesan fries and cheese fries. The Parmesan fries are definitely my favorite with the aioli dipping sauce. I am not a big fan of cheddar fries but they too get a thumbs up. I cannot wait to go again for another great burger. My only complaint, which I know is a complaint to many that have posted reviews is that the music is a little loud.

Reviews.Author: Dina L.
Reviews.Content: Good food. Not the best burger in Chicago. Shakes a little too rich and thick for me. Turkey burger has been my favorite so far, and I've been 3 times.

Reviews.Author: Liz P.
Reviews.Content: This place was great--gourmet burgers for $8? Can't beat a deal like that. I got the #2, with onion string crisps, bleu cheese, and chipotle ketchup and it was absolutely DELICIOUS. Some friends and I shared their Parmesan fries with cream truffle sauce and as one of the group put it, one could easily eat a whole plate of Parmesan truffle fries by them self. So good. A cold, hard cider paired perfectly with my burger. I can't wait to go back and try other burgers on their menu, as well as their mac & cheese. The only complaint I have is our server was pretty horrible at her job....but otherwise, the food more than made up for it.

Reviews.Author: amanda g.
Reviews.Content: oooo yum. i have to say that i think dmk is as close to kuma's goodness as i've found. and i didn't have to wait at all to eat. it's not quite as good, but definitely close. its also a completely different atmosphere. very polished feeling but not pretentious. great casual atmosphere. i went there with max and a friend at about 730 last night. we were seated immediately.we had deviled eggs and the chop salad for apps. for my meal i tried the lamb burger with feta. wow. just wow. i am not usually a member of the clean plate club, but i definitely finished my entire burger. amazing.i also tried max's egg burger and it was great too. we had the parm truffle fries too. so good. so bottom line, if you're in the mood for a great gourmet burger and don't wanna wait 2 hours for kuma's, you'll probably satisfy your craving with a delicious DMK burger.

Reviews.Author: vivian c.
Reviews.Content: I'm a sucker for grass-fed beef, and the truffle CREAM fries are identical to the bigger brother MK's.  the greek burger is delish, as is the burger with bacon.  YUM.  expect to wait up to an hour if you go for dinner; we've gone in the late afternoon on the weekends and not had to wait forever.

Reviews.Author: Katie C.
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome and cheap.  I had the bison burger ($10) with a side of sweet potato fries with tobasco aioli.  It was killer!

Reviews.Author: Steve G.
Reviews.Content: I went here for a mid-afternoon lunch with my infant daughter. It was a very good experience, as the servers were all very friendly, personable, and accommodating. Very pleasant modern interior, fun vibe, etc. The burgers are delicious, made with grass-fed beef. The beer and cocktails list is solid and interesting. I imagine it gets crowded in the evening, so maybe go during the day for lunch or brunch. I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Kerry M.
Reviews.Content: So, I had hopes for DMK but wasn't hugely impressed. It was good, but I probably wouldn't go out of my way to go back. The restaurant was packed, and my friend and I grabbed a couple seats at the bar where we stayed for the duration.  There is a good beer selection, but the food was just alright. We ordered quite a few things to share, and everything came out really greasy. The service was good, no problems there. Overall it was a decent meal, but it's certainly not the best burger I've ever had. If you're in the neighborhood, it might be a fun place to stop for dinner. Just wouldn't go out of my way for it.

Reviews.Author: John T.
Reviews.Content: So I got the #4 with a fried egg and thought that it was delicious! My one and only complaint is that the egg itself was kind of burnt and tasted funny, but the place was great.  Everyone in there seemed to be happy and that is saying something in the Windy City! I recommend that people get the Sweet Potato Fries because they were awesome!!  Great place to go and grab a burger, and not break the bank.

Reviews.Author: Rick J.
Reviews.Content: I've eaten here 3 times so far and will keep coming back to work my way down the numbered list.  Each meal was excellent in every way.  I really like how DMK focuses on its quality, not size and quantity of food.  What may look like a modest-sized burger for Chicago's gourmet burger restos will end up being perfectly just right, juicy and satisfying  -I promise.  Love their chunky blue cheese or other cheese topped fries!  I've enjoyed their shakes (mmm..peanutbutter) as well as their solid beer selection.  Nothing but kudos to the chef and the cool servers.

Reviews.Author: Kevin O.
Reviews.Content: Do I even need to review this place?  Probably not, but I like it so much I will.  Great burgers, left hand milk stout on tap, pretty girls, wisconsin cheddar fries to die for.  DMK is the BOMB.

Reviews.Author: Jason P.
Reviews.Content: DMK delivers a solid burger with pretty amazing fries, and ultimately, that's what you can ask for.  All these burger places tries to amp up the experience by providing unique burgers and fries, weird combos and specialties throughout the restaurant, but DMK doesn't try to act like that.  They provide good meat, great buns and probably some of the best fries I've tasted.

Reviews.Author: Edward M.
Reviews.Content: decided to take a hiatus from the pre-thanksgiving diet to stop by DMK. the best things about this place are its drink list (great beer selection), service (super friendly, helpful and CUTE) and atmosphere (pretty hip without being intimidating or pretentious at all). plus the portions are pretty big and the prices are very reasonable. but i thought the food was good, not great. ordered the onion strips (under-seasoned, a bit greasy, huge plateful), fried pickles and okra (delicious), #1 burger (solid), the truffle fries (probably the best out of them all), bacon blue cheese fries (close second), sweet potato fries (good), and another kind of fries (i forgot, except had cheese that ended up congealing), and mac & cheese (standard). everything was pretty good but HEAVY (burger without lettuce tomato etc, a bunch of fried stuff). generally i'm pretty good at meals without non-potato vegetables, but i had trouble getting through here. maybe next time i'll get one of the sodas (blood orange? intriguing)so yeah, a decent place. i dont think i'll be craving it anytime, but i wouldn't mind coming back to try whatever else i didn't try. just after thanksgiving though

Reviews.Author: Jeremy T.
Reviews.Content: After two visits, DMK has shown they make the best burger in Chicago (in my view). They also feature a very strong (and unique) beer selection, as well as cool atmosphere and friendly service. On a side note, the "Truffle Fries" are a must!

Reviews.Author: wesley w.
Reviews.Content: Been here a few times for lunch and had no problem getting a table. In fact had rock star parking. But what else could I expect?One time sat at the bar and had nice chat with the bartender. He tried to inform us why DMK overcooks all the meat. Really? There's no choosing your tenderness. It's all overdone. The bartender mentioned the health reasons which is a bit far fetched if you're truly using top grass fed beef. But the burger had an awesome home cooked flavor-- only cause my mom used to over cook everything too. But a grass fed burger and tallow fries aren't offered everywhere so we found our way back just yesterday. Had better service sitting at a table with a waitress. My wife ordered a sidecar and it arrived at the table almost full. Seriously? Use a smaller glass if you can't fill it up. For $12 either use better liquor or fill it up. My draft beer was tasty but again.. small glass. I'm just used to getting a pint off draft. Oh, for all I know it was a pint but in a little roller glass. Maybe it's one of the optical illusions. Good fries. Good eggs. Stay clear of the sweet potatoe fries if you like that sort of thing, they're as bland as the decor at DMK.

Reviews.Author: Jon L.
Reviews.Content: Go for the burgers. Pay 8 dollars. Leave happy.  Nuff said.

Reviews.Author: Sarah F.
Reviews.Content: They were great!  Amazing!  Delicious!  Juicy!  I loved everything about the burgers, buns, cheeses and toppings on these burgers!  Just can't beat a homemade floured bun.  I also appreciated all of the types of fries you could choose, all with their own dipping sauces.  This place has managed to produce the FIRST crispy sweet potato fry I've ever eaten -and the best!  So crunch & delicious with the most addicting tobasco/lemo aioli.  Also, a nice cockail, wine & beer list.  I will be back  A LOT!

Reviews.Author: Phil T.
Reviews.Content: DMK = Delicious meaty or Knot Burger Bar!!!  Ok I had to make it work knot = not...  :)Meaning if you want beef, turkey, or veg this place has it and I tried all of them were sooo good.  5's are hard to give but when giving thought.  All of the burgers were great, the fries excellent, wait staff, and ambience were up there.  I obviously went with the #12 (veggie burger) w/ the blue cheese and bacon fries.  Yes I know that has meat, but come on how can you turn that down plus I know other friends ordered the sweet potatoe fries(my 2nd choice) so why not!  :)  Hands down they were the best fries out of the ones ordered, sweet potatoe w/ lemon tabasco 2nd , and fries w/ parmesan truffle really good but 3rd..  To me there is one item that makes the burger really stand out from anyone else, dont worry Felipe will release the secret to everyone.  Its the bun yoooooo's!!   You can put anything in the middle of a fresh warm bun and it will make the sandwich, like today meat, turkey, or veg whatever the item is, it was truly enjoyable!  I tried all 3....#12 - veg, so much flavor sooooo tasty very fresh tasting, #5 - basically an italian burger, very yummy, and then #9 - turkey burger w/ an egg,  come on throw a fried egg on anything its going to be good.  I can honestly say though every burger was top notch w/ flavor, taste, deliciousness no matter the meat!  Even better, each burger and order of fries was the perfect portion size.  Attended here on a sat during smack dab in the middle of lunch and it was only a 5-10min wait.  The only possible knock which didnt bother me that could to others for basically burger and fries it was like $15 including tip.  Me myself would rather pay for the freshness and quality, so if you want a $6 greasy 1/2 lb burger joint go somewhere else and ill come here happily.  :)

Reviews.Author: Patrick C.
Reviews.Content: I live very close to this place and think I'm pretty damn lucky because of it. Very good burgers, sides and drink list. I have no complaints at all. Service is great. Prices are reasonable. I highly recommend their take on the big Mac called the big dmk

Reviews.Author: K C.
Reviews.Content: I like the #3  I like their ideal of House Lab Drinks sadly...  I didn't like the taste.  It's all good.  Service was nice and quick.  I would stick to H2O next time I come.

Reviews.Author: Igor Z.
Reviews.Content: Friend about the sweet potatoe fries dipping sauce, "if cum tasted like that there would be a lot more gay guys...". Nuf said.

Reviews.Author: Michelle D.
Reviews.Content: While there weren't many beers on tap, there were a lot of good botlted beers to choose from.  Several burger, mac & cheese, and fries options.  I had a burger with aged cheddar and smoked bacon.  I split the onion straws and sea salt/pepper fries.  Great ambiance.  Will definitely be back soon.

Reviews.Author: Fallon D.
Reviews.Content: Went over to try this place bcause I'm a gal who likes craft beer and burgers. The beer selection is good, but nothing particularly fantastic. You can find these beers just about anywhere I frequent. It is nice to not have to deal with Bud and Miller though. Their cocktail menu is fantastic. Well thought out and inventive without being pretentious. The Rhubarb Delight was spectacular (and I don't like gin, but Hendricks is in a class of it's own), The Whirling Tiger was tasty and it made me giggle with their version of a Michelada (PBRMEASAP).We went there when there were free fries and that made me pleased. They were VERY good and the ketchup was great. I just wished I had gotten the truffle fries. The deviled eggs were ok, mine are better, but it was sad you only got three (think of people sharing!)The mac and cheese was boring, bland, and kind of gross. Almost an afterthought to the menu. They should add some smokey cheese, corn, green onion, tomato, and then it might be something.Our burgers were pretty good. The bread was soft and a nice complement to the burger. The bison burger with pickled onion and blueberry bbq was quite tasty and something I would get again. The lamb was pretty good on first bite, but by the time I finished my half my taste buds were worn out. It was just too much salt, cheese, tzaziki. Just too much. Glad we shared and I only had to eat half. Not sure I could have eaten anymore. Service was competant and nice. I was well-pleased. The thing I didn't like was how the place was designed. Too industrial without having the space to do it. Cold (in temperature). I hate community tables and these were not set up to give a diner enough room if all are occupied. If I wanted to eavesdrop on random conversations I'd sit at the bar. This is a place I'd make a point to bring a 3rd wheel just to get a table. Also, there were like 6 kids running around the place. Not what I expected and just kind of weirded me out. And I also wish they would cook their burgers medium rare.Overall, pretty decent, but I'd probably just want to get take-out and I don't think this food would do well with any time in to-go containers. The drink menu of this place rules.

Reviews.Author: Matt P.
Reviews.Content: As far as burger bars go in Chicago ... sure, there's other places I like better.  That's not saying DMK is bad, because it's really good, especially their patty melts, and 6 varieties of fries, not to mention their deviled eggs.  But even better than their food is the staff, especially Drew ... that guy is awesome.

Reviews.Author: Rocky H.
Reviews.Content: Yeah----I'm sorry I went to Kuma's Corner yesterday. That place has you beat by the most ridiculous landslide even if your clientele is more my style. Sorry! More than happy to give you another whirl when I know you improve your burger (by a lot).

Reviews.Author: Peter P.
Reviews.Content: In short, if you DON'T want to wait for Kuma's Corner and prefer a B- burger experience without waiting too long, go here.  It's very clean ambience, more like a corporate lunch hour area and a good date place.  My beef with the joint is, their burger meat doesn't taste that great.  And their portion for their appetizers and such are way too small for my hard earned money.  Is it palatable?  Of course, otherwise this place would have closed within a month.  Is it as comparable as Kuma's burger?  NO.Beer is decent enough though, although too pricey in my opinion.  I know I shouldn't compare this place to Kuma's but honestly, if you're trying to compete gourmet burgers, Kuma's set a benchmark as far as I'm concerned.  In fact, Five Guys has better tasting burger for cheap than DMK.

Reviews.Author: Becky K.
Reviews.Content: this rustic little joint is jus the kind of burger place i was lookin for..lets start with the food first:its all grass-fed beef, which i cant REALLY taste the difference, but hell its good :)i had the #1 burger (they go by numbers, not names) which had an interesting BBQ sauce and juicy, thick slices of bacon--the bad? too many onions, and i love onions.i tried the #8, which was a regular cheeseburger pretty much and it was pretty good too.**sea salt and black pepper fries with house ketchup.....oh.em.gee. love love LOVE the house ketchup! kudos DMK!**mac and cheese #2..oh.em.gee. x 2. i love love LOVE that they have gruyere cheese (not a lot of places have it and its my most recent discovery of cheeses--yum!)inside DMK:like i said before, rustic and trendy...could go casual or dressy, but i figured if youre going for burgers and beers, dress down and get dirty.full bar (which is ALWAYS nice), with a cutie little bartender that was distracting me from observing the rest of the place :X

Reviews.Author: Pavan G.
Reviews.Content: I had the Date burger which was a special of the day. It was, hands down, one of the best burgers I've ever had... Ever. It was not too big and the sweet potato fries were  a great compliment to my meal. I liked that the fries were crunchy. I order sweet potato fries quite often at different establishments and they are almost always soft and soggy, but not here. I will definitely be back here if I ever get another opportunity. The beer selection is great too! Love me some craft brews :)

Reviews.Author: Steven M.
Reviews.Content: Very good quality, as well as interesting ingredients in the burgers, I always have a great meal at this burger joint.  Parmesan truffle fries are a must, i'm glad it is dark in there because I'd bet that I look real piggish scarfing them down.

Reviews.Author: Jaclyn C.
Reviews.Content: If I were giving this place a review solely based on food it would be 4.5 however, when I yelp I review everything. Went last Saturday night with the husband and knew there would be a long wait, we were told 1.5 hours. Which was fine cause we were planning to have a few rounds at the bar beforehand. After squeezing our way through the masses of other people waiting/eating at the bar and getting the bartenders attention we finally ordered our drinks. Why on earth would any place staff only two bartenders for the entire restaurant/bar area, especially this place which boasts a great beer/cocktail menu. The rhubarb drink was amazing but I feel like you could spend $50 before you ever felt you were even drinking alcohol. Unless you like mint and liquorice, DO NOT get the mint julep, it was horrible. We got two rounds with a semi decent wait but the third round, it took literally like 22 minutes to order. Finally this a waitress turned bartender saw us and got us our beers quick. Now onto the food. Good thing is that everything comes out quick. We started with fried pickle/okra and #2 macaroni. The friend stuff was really good and the okra seemed pickled. The noodles in the mac were a little over done and needed some salt but we still ate it. Onto the main event, we ordered the blue cheese/chipotle ketchup and the friend egg/bacon burgers. Both were good but I think the fried egg was more unique, if it didn't have as many green chiles, it would have been perfect. The parmesan and truffle fried are to die for, just like MK's. Yes, this is a ton of food for 2 people and we ate everything, even saved room for an ice cream sandwich which is amazing. I'd definitely come back to try the still "coming soon" burgers. I would have given a better review had they been better staffed. If you are gonna make people wait to be seated and they are willing to buy drinks in the meantime, put the staff needed so we can drink and spend money. We could have had more drinks but oh well.

Reviews.Author: Andrew M.
Reviews.Content: Food: 8.5/11: Better than most in Chicago. I've been there twice and ordered the barbecue burger the first time and the turkey eggplant burger the next. Both were good, thin patties. Plenty of toppings as well as perfectly matched buns. I would have to say the highlight is the mac and cheese and the sweet potato fries. I finished both of these off in a hurry--barely giving my girlfriend the chance to score a bite. I also tried the salt and pepper fries. At first I thought they were hella spicy, but as my girlfriend pointed out, it wasn't the fries that were spicy, it was the ketchup. In order to quell what I thought were spicy fries I was smothering them in what I thought was standard ketchup. Wow. I'm an idiot. But anyways, all in all the food was solid. So solid that there was no room for dessert... Not that I would have eaten them anyway. For the record: vanilla bean ice cream is NOT the same as regular vanilla. It is much, much worse.   Drinks and Bartenders: 9/11: The best thing about the drinks are the price. Great beer selection and good cheap wine options. Perfect for a nice weekday meal, or even a good place to go on weekends with bigger groups. Service: 8/11: Everyone was very nice, but that doesn't take away from the fact that they could have been more attentive. I was having a spicy ketchup issue and water was being consumed at a faster than normal pace. They were, what seemed, exceptionally slow at refilling it. I don't even think  there was water on the table in first place. But, again, they were very nice so you still get 8/11 because I'm nice and you can't be mean to nice people. And yup. My scale goes all the way to 11. That's one point better--one point more comprehensive than scales that go to 10. And Yelp? Really? A scale that goes to 5? C'mon.

Reviews.Author: Dan P.
Reviews.Content: Definitely a place will be going back to. The place was packed, but turnover seemed to be quick and we didnt have to wait very long to get a table - in fact, the bartender wasnt even done pouring my drink when the hostess came up to usher us to our table.  The service is not exactly speedy, but then again, I have no issues with taking my time to enjoy dinner in good company.  If your idea of service includes having Speedy Gonzales as your server, come prepared with an extra dose of patience. Or better yet, get one of the excellent cocktails and relax.As far as the food goes, I thought the sides were excellent (Mac & Cheese, sweet potato fries) and the burgers were satisfying.  The burgers are normal sized, so if you like gargantuan burgers, go for the double meat and dont be left wondering where the meat went. I guess I can understand how some reviewers were dissappointed by the burgers - by american standards, they do lack size and blood; however, I like the feeling of being able to breathe without unbuttoning my pants after having a meal, so it was perfect for me.Finally, I thought the drinks were pretty good.  It would be nice if they went for the same concept (fancy cocktails, extensive beer list) in a more loungy place with only a small selection of tapas-styled dishes.

Reviews.Author: Van D.
Reviews.Content: Nothing stands out with this place.  Different varieties of burgers but nothing unique about the ingredients.  Burger pattie good but not great.  Sweet potato fries were excellent though.  Would rather go to the Counter which is just a few blocks down and you can pick your ingredients.  This place is not even in the same league as a Kuma's

Reviews.Author: Allison C.
Reviews.Content: Met 3 girlfriends at DMK on a Tuesday night and the place was jumping. If we would have gotten there 10 minutes later we wouldn't have gotten seats! This a burger joint, upscale, but still a burger joint, don't expect a big wine list. Expect a good selection of beer AND homemade sodas. My preggo friend said her blood orange soda was yummy! My 3 girlfriends had bacon cheeseburgers and I had a turkey & swiss burger and we could not stop raving about how good they were. I am tempted to say it was the best dang turkey burger I have ever had. We shared mac and cheese and truffle fries, they were both scrumptious. The sides were more than big enough to share! My only regret was that we did not have enough room for dessert, I have heard the ice cream cookie is the best! The only reason this place doesn't get 5 stars is because I felt rushed to leave. The bar area (where we were) offers communal seating and the people standing near the bar, waiting for seats, were eyeing us up! Plus, I am just not a big fan of communal seating...period. I can't wait to take my hubby to DMK, we will go early, and request a table for two!

Reviews.Author: Diane S.
Reviews.Content: I have eaten here twice now and enjoyed my burger both times. However, this place is not a greasy indulgent type of experience like Kuma's or Five Guys. The burgers are cooked a little more than I'd personally like - you don't get the option.The fries are very tasty too and you can split a small for only $3. I have had the sweet potato, salt and pepper and the Wisconsin cheddar. All were very good!I don't enjoy the seating...everyone is very close together or at a communal table and it's very loud in there. Just not ideal in my opinion.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay D.
Reviews.Content: Loved the beer and drink selection, and of course, most importantly, their burger selection. I ordered the vegiie burger, no cheese and the flavors were awesome, little spicy, little crunchy. I'll make this one sweet and to the point, I want to try everything there!! A+...I'll be back for more!

Reviews.Author: L R.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers at a great price, the service is aight.  If you are lookin for an option to Kumas Corner, check this place out.

Reviews.Author: Asha M.
Reviews.Content: I dream about you often. Since we have met over a month ago, I can't stop thinking about your mouth watering flavor! We need to get together soon!

Reviews.Author: Bridgette K.
Reviews.Content: This will be the new Burger joint, since I'm scared to eat Kuma's Corner after getting food poisoning. The fries are by far thee best sweet potato fries I have ever ate. The DMK margarita is very fresh and strong. The decor is very trendy and modern. But the seating is very close to each other and not a lot of room to move around. I will be back for more!

Reviews.Author: Celtic B.
Reviews.Content: I went back to DMK for another burger and I gotta say, I was impressed.  I had the Sonoran with a side of sweet potato fries and a Daisy Cutter.  The burger was hot and juicy, with a great proportion of burger to bun to toppings.  The sweet potato fries were incredible, I've never had better and doubt you could do much to improve on them.  And of course the beer list is most impressive.  I can't wait to go back and try some more of the burgers.

Reviews.Author: Jesselyn E.
Reviews.Content: Burgers were AMAZING, great selection of local beers too.

Reviews.Author: Mike D.
Reviews.Content: This is a review for Takeout.  I had the Barbecue Burger and the Parmesan/Truffle Cream fries.Burger was cooked to order which is nice, as most places give you medium as though it were well done, even when I got home, the burger was still warm and nicely cooked.  The onions were fantastic, well cooked, but not mushy.  The barbecue wasn't spectacular, but it was tasty nonetheless.The fries were okay, I'm not overly excited about them.  They were really heavy, but the spices were good.  I think I just wasn't a fan of the Parmesan or the truffle cream.  I'm definitely going to have to try this place again, but I may not go back too soon.

Reviews.Author: Kim T.
Reviews.Content: I admit it, I have a slight obsession with grass-fed beef burgers. Did you say house ketchup and mac+cheese too? Yes, please. And the dessert is tasty too. What more could a girl want?

Reviews.Author: T J.
Reviews.Content: This is probably the best burger I've ever had, I can't remember the name of it since it's been about 2mos, but it had a spicy ketchup and onion strings on it that had me smacking my lips. Me and the BF also aren't huge red meat eaters and rarely choose a burger joint to dine, in fact we were trying to get a seat at the adjoining seafood place but the wait was atrocious so we picked DMK. He had some type of burger with portabello mushroom, added truffle and sweet potato fries, a beer and a shake and we were in heaven. We're still talking about the place. Also had a very nice, patient and attentive server who even put my leftover shake in a to=go cup since my eyes were bigger than my stomach that night.We're planning to go back to the place every few months.  Only complaint is parking in that area, which of course they can't control.

Reviews.Author: Melissa S.
Reviews.Content: Two things you should know about the food - It's simple, really just burgers.  But their burgers are very good and they have some unique delicious choices.  I had a lamb burger with feta, tsaziki etc.... yummm. As far as drinks - they have lots of good beer choices.  But my husband is one of those huge Miller Lite fans so it's important to know if you're like him that they don't have it.Overall - simple and delicious!

Reviews.Author: Eazmg C.
Reviews.Content: Pretty legit burgers.  Thin-steak burger style, get the double if you are craving something "thick".  The truffle fries are outstanding and i always enjoy the variety of high quality canned beer, $3 a pop from fat tire to Modus Hoperandi.  Needless to say the draft selection is good.

Reviews.Author: Kathy K.
Reviews.Content: Went here for lunch with a friend. I got the patty melt and it was fantastic!!! I highly recommend it. My friend got a standard cheeseburger and it was tasty but a little small for the price. They use high quality ingredients and the menu is diverse. This isn't your traditional burger place but it is very tasty.

Reviews.Author: Joe L.
Reviews.Content: Not a huge burger fan, but I have to say the number 2 on the menu was one of the best burgers I've ever had. Good service too.

Reviews.Author: Layne S.
Reviews.Content: "Look at you, you have a baby... In a bar."Went early as this place is always packed.  It was LOUD.  I could scream across the table to my gf "WHAT?!" (joking around) and no one seemed to notice.  We got seated at a small table next to a couple who seemingly couldnt get a baby-sitter - there was a baby attached to mom and a roaming tiny one next to us.  No real issues there other than bad parenting observations.  We both got the BBQ burger and both realized the toppings were too much.  A plain cheeseburger would have been a better choice.  The mac & cheese was delishus.  The deviled eggs were ok.  I've been craving deviled eggs all summer and they hit that spot for sure, so that was a relief.  Service was pretty good, yet the noise was bad.  I never like noisy places to eat.  Kumas plays metal and it's an enjoyable experience (other than waiting an hour to get in the door) - meaning a place doesn't have to be loud to be good.  It seemed like much of the clientele were trying really hard to be hip and all I wanted was  good burger.  Will not be returning.

Reviews.Author: Nirali S.
Reviews.Content: I went here for lunch on a Thursday and it was nice and quiet.  I ordered the #1 (aged cheddar, bacon, onions, BBQ sauce) and it was really tasty.  My friend had got the #13 (portobello, arugula, fontina cheese) and he was a big fan of it.  We also split the sweet potato fries and the Wisconsin cheddar fries, both were pretty good.  He ordered the blood orange soda which was good, but just needed a tad bit of sugar.  For dessert we had a mix of the shake which was chocolate and peanut butter, it was super thick and awesome, definitely hit the sweet tooth spot!  I think this place lives up to the hype easily!

Reviews.Author: Faye S.
Reviews.Content: Bison burger and fries were delish. Server was not very attentive but service was decent. The atmosphere was nice. They have full bar with lots of mixed drink and beer on the menu. The tables seem a lil too close but it is a burger place after all. I would definitely go back to try other burgers soon.

Reviews.Author: Alexa H.
Reviews.Content: Sweet potato fries!  Go eat them.  Best ever.  Wait can get long, it is extremely loud but the food is yummy and it comes out in an instant.  Not my absolute favorite burger but the fries, oh the fries!  Good price.  I might go back, try a fancy soda and just eat french fries.  But if you're in need of a burger, the toppings are really well thought out.

Reviews.Author: Brynn M.
Reviews.Content: The burger here was pretty good and the fries were delicious, but it was REALLY crowded and loud. Great place to go on occasion to meet up with friends, but I thought it wasn't worth all the hype.

Reviews.Author: Jaye L.
Reviews.Content: What can I say that hasn't been said already? Yes, it does get very busy and noisy. Seating is limited at times and you generally are almost rubbing elbows with your neighbors, but there is a reason for that.  The burgers are world-class. Don't come here for a greasy bland-burger with cheese. Granted, they have it, but go elsewhere for that. This is the place to let your guard down and try things you wouldn't normally think of. Or better put, let the chefs get creative, and just put whatever is on your plate in your mouth...it will be delicious. From Lamb Burger to the Holy Guaca-oly Burger, it is all good.  Even the ketchup is spicy and unique. Beer selection is long and diverse. If you live in the neighborhood, pick up the DMK card so you can build points for free t-shirts and stuff. Just a groovy little place right off the El in Lakeview.

Reviews.Author: Jen D.
Reviews.Content: I just LOVED the veggie burger.  It was one of the best that I have ever had...and huge!  I was able to bring that and my cheddar fries home for a second meal.  But the absolute best part was the Shamrock Shake with mint ice cream and Lucky Charms.  Really enjoyed my first time, and can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: Tony G.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers!   The fries are ridiculous!   Wisconsin cheddar, truffle and sweet potato...more please!!!

Reviews.Author: Shonnie M.
Reviews.Content: A-mazing!!  I had the lamb burger and husband had the bison burger... both were very good, but he will be ordering the lamb burger when we go back!  It's a little noisy, but you are there for a burger, not a romantic dinner.  Go! Oh, and I had a GREAT milk stout beer!  Sounded strange but so glad I tried it!

Reviews.Author: Andrew K.
Reviews.Content: Sweet potatoes fries were amazing and I consider myself an expert in pizza, burgers, and of course fries.  I liked the decor, but I thought there wasn't that much space between tables.  Burgers were good, but when the fries are the best thing in the menu there are problems.  Good once, but won't be heading back anytime soon.

Reviews.Author: Frances A.
Reviews.Content: Order the bison burger. Bartender drew had great beer recommendations. Truffle fries may be the best in the city.  Add a shot to whichever wonderful shake you order for dessert.

Reviews.Author: Sorrell G.
Reviews.Content: Well the food is good. Depending on where you are in the city you might not want to drive over. Staff are polite. Be prepared to wait a long time on the weekends. No parking. Place is very loud you might want to get it to go if you don't drink alcohol.

Reviews.Author: Paul T.
Reviews.Content: You gotta love a place that serves a great grass-fed burger and super fries. Really nice beer selection. Very friendly and knowledgable staff. I keep wanting to try a lot of their burgers but I can't resist the burger with Chili-Rubbed Onion Strings, Amish Blue Cheese, and Spicy Chipotle Ketchup. Great milk shakes.

Reviews.Author: Patrick C.
Reviews.Content: Good burger. Loved the grass-fed meat aspect since I'm fairly health-conscious. Fries are separate, which I kind of like since I don't feel like I have to eat everything on my plate. Portions are slightly smaller than other places I've been to, but still worth a visit.

Reviews.Author: Kanae O.
Reviews.Content: This place was a little underwhelming. I went there on Saturday night at 7pm-ish and wait was 30-35 min. The line got even longer around the time when we were seated. The ambiance is nice with dim light and you don't feel that it's overcrowded even though a lot of people are waiting near the door. However, as some people mentioned in the review, the music was loud and it was hard to enjoy the conversation. About the burgers, my boyfriend ordered #2 Chili-Rubbed Onion Strings, Amish Blue, Spicy Chiptole Ketchup and I ordered #11 Grass-fed Lamb, Sheep's Milk Feta, Olive Tapenade, Greek Salad, Tzatziki. The ingredients sounded very good for all the burger options but what disappointed me when I actually tried was that the taste of non-meat portion overwhelmed the meat flavor. Both burgers had the same problem. Particularly, I didn't enjoy the sourness that greek salad and tzatziki had in my lamb burger.  We also had Wisconsin Cheddar & Scallion fries as a side. Again, the name sounded intriguing but it didn't meet the expectation. They were just soggy fries with melted cheese and scallion on top. Maybe we should have ordered sweet potato fries instead of normal potato fries.They have a wide selection of beer if you are a beer drinker. We didn't get any as we wanted to try one of their shakes. Peanut butter shakes turned out to be pretty good. The portion was good for two people to share.

Reviews.Author: Jonah B.
Reviews.Content: The best burger in town, when you leave you'll feel full and satisfied but not the classic 'too full' feeling you get after a normal burger. At DMK the friendly servers and diverse menu will definitely leave your taste buds, stomach, and your wallet satisfied

Reviews.Author: Luis O.
Reviews.Content: While their burgers are good, a good restaurant needs more than just good food. We were there twice recently on  busy weekends and they were totally overwhelmed and unable to manage the flow of people. The host was a mess,  she was just way over her head..very incompetent and unable to give people a reasonable answer as to how long the wait was going to be. Both times, after waiting for more than an hour (we were 3) and hearing other people complain we ended up going to another great burger place nearby - there are quite a few in our neighborhood. Bad, uncaring customer service, slow table service  - not coming back.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie D.
Reviews.Content: I was visiting from out of town and seeking a good mid western burger place, something that I could not find in the west coast. Insert my visit to DMK, the service was great, they even gave us a free order of deviled eggs, I ordered the #4 which was amazing( it had bacon and green chile, nom) and the sweet potato fries were to die for. Definitely will go back there whenever I get a chance.

Reviews.Author: Mark S.
Reviews.Content: Good stuff.  Burger (#1) was great.  Salt/Pepper fries were fantastic.  Nice beer selection.  Cupcakes were very good as well.  Nice to see a place focus on quality and not quantity.

Reviews.Author: Ben W.
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Great location, low dinner prices (gourmet flavors for $8 a burger!), fantastic beer selection (with some great in-house commentary on the menu), and the service has never let me down (friendly and knowledgable service)Cons:  Overpriced but tasty desserts.4/5 stars, deservedly.  It's absolutely a bi-weekly visit for us

Reviews.Author: Gina R.
Reviews.Content: This place is by far one of the best iv ever had! It's newer so I feel people don't know about it . GO they have a bakery who makes theyr buns specially! And they r always fresh and it melts in ut mouth!! Y-u-m. #1 is SO good!! And the fries but if u get the Wisconsin cheddar ask for the cheese on side it's allot this coming from a girl who's fridge is 90% cheese! Enjoy:) I order carry out all the time that's HOW good it is! And they have shakes vanilla chocolate tastes weird :/ but could of just been me 5 stars! Not sure about he whole theology on 4 stars anywho enjoy!!!!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer A.
Reviews.Content: I have been to DMK burger bar twice and I highly enjoyed it both times. The burgers are delicious, thick and juicy with a lot of flavor. I have ordered a regular burger as well as the bbq burger that comes with bacon and bbq sauce. The fries are delicious, we tried the parmesan truffle fries as well as the cheese fries. I am not a huge fan of cheese fries, but my boyfriend loved them. The parmesan truffle fries were amazing. The beer menu is also very interesting. I tried a peach beer that I really liked and there were a lot of unique craft beers. The service is excellent. The only reason for not giving it 5 stars is that it is very loud in the restaurant. It is difficult to have a conversation.

Reviews.Author: Sherri M.
Reviews.Content: The food here is amazing. I particularly like the number 1 and 5 burgers, which are truly delicious. Alyssa, my hostess on friday, was particularly helpful and charming. In fact, the service overall is commendable. I would recommend it to anyone who enjoys a good burger and beer.

Reviews.Author: Alex T.
Reviews.Content: Overall a good burger place.  However, not the best. The burger is decent, doesn't quite live up to hype.  The mac and cheese is phenomenal, may be the best I have ever had.  The beer selection is also great.  The service can be hit or miss, I have had great servers, and then had horrible.  I live right next to this pace so I go more for convenience than the food.  Don't get me wrong, there is nothing wrong with the food, just doesn't live up to the hype.

Reviews.Author: David E.
Reviews.Content: Not many places 'wow' me with simple food... But DMK did as I randomly stumbled by it a few weeks ago! The burgers are AMAZING! Save the 2+ hour wait at Kuma's and try this place for a burger just as tasty. Don't get me wrong Kuma's lives up to the hype but if you want a better atmosphere and service then go to DMK, you won't be disappointed!

Reviews.Author: Kate M.
Reviews.Content: Our 12 person group arrived right after work on a Thursday and we got the big, center wood table.  We started off right by reviewing the awesome beer list and we each selected something new and fun.  The beer list along with the wine and cocktail lists are inventive and fun, but not overwhelming or too muddled.  All of the selections were great and the server offered great recommendations based on what we liked/described.Next came the items we shared - onion rings (super thin and crispy), parm-truffle fries (need I say more, but they do these justice), sweet potato fries (crispy perfection), fried pickles and okra (surprisingly delish, my first time) and THE DEVILED EGGS.  The menu says "need I say more" regarding these little gems and that is exactly right - a great treat, the best consistency and oh so tasty. And, the sauces that came with each of the above items were so great, thoughtful and the perfect complement to each of the items.  Well done.Then, the burgers.  For $8, the selection is awesome.  The variety of toppings, sauces and choices - I was left trying to decide between some amazing options, but went with the #3, WOW.It was just enough of the other ingredients, cheese, sauerkraut, and pastrami, where they were perfectly tasty, but did not overwhelm the actual burger - amazing considering this is where a lot of other burger places fail!  The balance was perfect and the tangy, salty and juicy burger and toppings were just perfection.  Everyone at the table got different burgers and everyone's reactions were the same - just awesome.At the end, the service became a little sporadic as the place started to get busier - which is to be expected on a Thursday night.  But, overall the ambiance was great, low-key and the music was a great mix.  And considering that all of us have still been talking about our burgers and what we want to have next...I have a feeling we will be returning some time very soon...cannot wait!!

Reviews.Author: Landis F.
Reviews.Content: Everything was good -- burgers (I had the #4), truffle fries, Mac #2 -- until I found hair in my Ice Cream Sandwich. Gross.

Reviews.Author: Amanda D.
Reviews.Content: I have to upgrade DMK to 4 stars simply because I have been there so much and I am never disappointed.  My favorite is the #10 turkey burger with sweet potato fries.  And a good beer...which they have a pretty decent selection of.

Reviews.Author: Ron S.
Reviews.Content: DMK has quality burgers and an awesome beer selection. I suggest trying the truffle cream fries because they're simply delicious. I have heard great things about their mac & cheese too so don't be shy. This place isn't cheap and the burgers they have aren't the best but it is still definitely worth checking out.

Reviews.Author: Chang L.
Reviews.Content: Ordered a crispy Portobello burger which was delicious, though overpriced in my opinion. The truffle fries were also pretty good. Dim place with good ambience, nice place to eat with friends later at night.

Reviews.Author: Sarah N.
Reviews.Content: I thought this place was good. It was crazy busy when I went here on a week night, we ended up waiting an hour because we had a group of 8. Our waitress was nice enough to bring us free tater tots and sweet potatoes fries, so that was nice.  I wish you could substitute the veggie pattie on any of the burgers, I'm generally not a fan of portabella burgers.  I thought the veggie burger was fine, but slightly over priced. The service was good, and I know my meat eating friends enjoyed their meals.

Reviews.Author: Jake D.
Reviews.Content: Barreled in and split a #1 and #2. BOTH just delicious. Great beer, hip ambiance, Bomb burgers. Cant beat it.

Reviews.Author: Will B.
Reviews.Content: #8, beer, & fries! Best burger bar in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: Nancy Z.
Reviews.Content: I really enjoy this place... I have had the #1 which is pretty much a regular burger, I have enjoyed the lamb burger, and the big salad is amazing.  I also think the bar has a great selection at fair pricing.  The food is very good and the servers are impressive as they are always very nice.  The place is always clean as well and I have never had to wait to be seated.

Reviews.Author: marc f.
Reviews.Content: dmk burgers are thin patties - all cooked to the same temperature (medium - medium rare).  if you like your burgers thick, juicy and BIG TIME rare (like me), this is not the place to get a burger.if i judge dmk by thin patty standards, i'd have to say 'meh'.  sure, it's better than fast food chains (it better be!), but maybe not as good as burger baron, which is surprisingly good for a diner kind of place.      i recommend lock down bar & grill.  kuma's, too, if you're cool with the wait and the scene.

Reviews.Author: Chris P.
Reviews.Content: Good burgers, good fries, good onion straws, good beer, good service...what more can one want?

Reviews.Author: Sergio R.
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were CRAVING a burger this past weekend, and decided to try DMK, first because of the name (famed chef), and this new buzz on burger bars.  I have to say, after eating Kuma's and Lockdown's burgers, these were far less superior in taste; you couldn't even compare.  Burgers were much thinner, bit too salty, and they can only cook to 1 temperature.   I tried the double to get the REAL burger taste, but didn't work.  My wife got the single, and felt cheated.  For the price an product, I truly prefer 5 Guys.  On a positive note(s), I did love the onion strings and sweet potato fries; plus great beer choices, and I do appreciate the grass fed beef.

Reviews.Author: Shawn J.
Reviews.Content: Just an average burger. Nothing too fancy. Super friendly staff, decent beer and cocktail menu. The burgers are grass fed, which I think is their gimmick, however I thought the beef was just okay and had no flavor. I want to love it, great concept and decent menu, but for the same price I would probably go somewhere different. Willing to give it another shot though!

Reviews.Author: Ane P.
Reviews.Content: Loved the burgers. The service was kind of slow but overall it was a good experience. The fries were fantastic as well. Will go back

Reviews.Author: Dave B.
Reviews.Content: Burgers, fries, food and service is all fantastic. Their beer selection is also very good. I'd have given 6 stars if they brought back Dragon's Milk...For the naysayers out there that truly want to pick their own ingredients, nearly any bar in Chicago should suffice and be more than willing to fulfill your request.

Reviews.Author: Jason T.
Reviews.Content: Add another entry on the always growing list of amazing Burger joints in Chicagoland.  This place should be commended for their unique and experimental menu, a lot of good twists thrown in to make these burgers stand out.   The wide variety of French fry stylings were also impressive, my girlfriend and I were sad we couldn't try more.  The beer selection was also fantastic, especially the drafts.  The business should also be commended for trying to use local ingredients and for donating all proceeds from their milkshakes (which was so rich and delicious by the way) to a rotating charity.   Oh, did I mention the burgers are almost all 8$?  Only reason I didn't 5 star this place is because of the long wait to be seated (service after seating is quick and efficient though), but who can blame all these people for wanting to eat here?

Reviews.Author: Alejandra G.
Reviews.Content: Great Burgers and Fries!!! The reason I love this place is because the burger size is just perfect not too big and not too small. They are cooked perfectly, I love the BIG DMK burger, we usually split it because it can be a bit on the big side for just one person. The Parmesan fires with truffle cream are to die for just like their #1 Mac N Cheese. We had tried one of their special shakes and the best so far has been the Roasted Marshmallow Flavor. One of my favorite burger places so far in chicago!!!

Reviews.Author: Steph L.
Reviews.Content: Just as good as I was expecting - perhaps even better! We went on a Thursday night around 7 and only waited 5 minutes. I was expecting more of a wait so I was pleasantly surprised we were seated quickly. The hardest part is choosing which burger to get! The blue cheese fries we got on the side were delicious - a little heavy on the sauce for my liking, but a half-order was more than enough for me and my date. I will definitely be back to sample more of the menu!

Reviews.Author: Johnny G.
Reviews.Content: Not the best burger place, but one of the best. You can't effectively rate any other burger restaurant without trying this. The best fries I've ever had and well proportioned burgers.

Reviews.Author: Willie B.
Reviews.Content: Easily the most overrated, overhyped burger place in Chicago. A burger is about the patty and the bun and then the toppings. DMK has got the toppings down. Simply doesn't sniff Kuma's, not even in the same league. It's nice to see people love DMK's vegan burgers, but that's not a burger. That's just a mushroom on bread. I do love DMK's fries. Fun place with creative food, but not a burger that you will remember.

Reviews.Author: Scott G.
Reviews.Content: DMK is located right around the corner from my place and I've been there a few times. Each time I go, I am never disappointed with the food or service. The first time I went, my friends and I received free shots of Jameson to welcome us to Chicago. My favorite burgers are the Patty Melt and Bison Burger. I recommend washing it down with a Gumball IPA and you're set.

Reviews.Author: Kevin B.
Reviews.Content: Burgers were awesome, everyone seemed to be very happy with their food, the servers were great, and they even brought out an extra beer for the table to share (along with shot glasses for us to pour the beer into in order to divvy it up among 6 of us) due to the fact that they were about 1 minute late with our mac and cheese dish, which wasn't a big deal at all, but clearly a nice gesture.  I had the southwest burger or something and it was HOT but very good.  Beer menu is good and the burgers are great.

Reviews.Author: Ginger L.
Reviews.Content: OMG!!!!   AMAZING!!!   Every time I come I get something different and Every time is the best time!!!

Reviews.Author: Cary M.
Reviews.Content: I was really looking forward to eating at DMK's.  We were greeted by a very friendly staff and sat right away.  I was simply disappointed with the food and not really comfortable with the room.  The burgers are quite small and just okay.  We had #1 and #4, #4 would have been so much better with a couple of strips of bacon and not just one lonely piece.  The fries were good, but again small pieces.  The tables and chairs were also really small.  Unfortunately the bill didn't end up being very small.

Reviews.Author: Robert E.
Reviews.Content: Very good selection of high end burgers using a variety of different meats from beef to turkey to lamb and veggie too.  Great beer selection.  Service is okay and the space isn't that great but the burger and the beer are definitely going to be a weekly staple.

Reviews.Author: man i luv pizza p.
Reviews.Content: Went here during lunch and surprisingly it was very busy.  The space is kind of low key modern, fairly comfortable, except for this strange open space near the door.  I ordered the classic burger and sweet potato fries.  Burger was very good, although the presentation of the food was burger and plate, it did not look appetizing.  The burger bun is a home made powdery one, which wasnt too bad.Overall would i go back, maybe if i was in the area, but it was nothing special.  BTW, I love MK, so it was slightly disappointing.  However for two burgers and friens, our bill was $22, which is unheard of.  I would stick to The Counter for a better experience and tastier burger.

Reviews.Author: Mark H.
Reviews.Content: I was there on a Wednesday night with some friends and I have to say... What's all the hype about?This is purely a burger joint, so I am assuming the burgers are going to be amazing.... Nope.  First, my biggest beef with the place is the cooking.  When I go to a nice steak house I order my steaks medium rare.  My wife orders her's medium.  I even have a friend who orders his filet well done, why?  Because that's how he likes it.  Its nice to have a choice on how you want your meat cooked.  Not here, you get it how it comes, barely pink.  Now if that's how you like it then perfect, but if you like it any other way, your out of luck.Second, its suppose to be an upscale burger joint, where's the upscale?  There was nothing at all special about my burger (i had the #1).  It came with BBQ sauce, cheddar cheese and saute onions (onions were done perfectly though).  So that's what was on my burger, okay, lets class it up a little bit with the bun.... Nope.  Just a plain bun, no bretzel, no kaiser roll, no nada, just what appeared to be an unassuming bun.  What gets me was they had 8 or 9 burgers to choose from, okay, that's a good selection, but 2 of them were "coming soon".  Why are they even on the menu?  Put something in there that someone can choose until the 2 new ones arrive.  I'm not trying to put anyone down but how hard is it to come up with 2 burger concoctions for only 3 weeks.  My guess, not hard.One touch I did like and that I got on , my burger was the choice of adding a fried egg (which they clearly got from Kuma's Corner, best burger in the city).Two things they did have right at this place was the fries and beer selection.  I ordered the blue cheese and bacon fries as well as the Parmesan truffle fries.  Both were excellent, 2 days later I was still tasting the truffle aoili and it tasted great.  The second thing that this place has done right was the beer selection.  Some of the other reviews I have read said it wasn't that great.  In my eye's it was pretty good.  Could it have been better?  Well, yes, everything can be better (like this place's burgers) but the selection was good.One last thing, this is an upscale burger joint, when you walk inside you can tell.  The decor was nice the lighting was good and the wait staff was pleasant.All in all it wasn't bad but it didn't blow my mind either.  Would I go again?  No, that's why I am off to Kuma's Corner for the best burger in the city right now.

Reviews.Author: Nancy M.
Reviews.Content: i liked this place. a lot. cool atmosphere, friendly service, great food, awesome local beer selection. the burgers are quite tasty -- although i do think that it's a little strange that they don't ask how you'd like them cooked. i'd heard they came well done, but mine came out medium to medium rare.i got a number four and it was delicious, but there were a lot of great-looking burgers on the menu. i'll definitely be back to try the non-beef burgers -- the lamb and veggie burgers are next on my list.our group of five also shared the mac and cheese, which i thought was kind of overrated and underseasoned at first, but it had really grown on me by the end of the meal. we also got two large orders of fries: one order of the cheddar cheese fries and one order of the sweet potato fries. both were delicious. the cheese fries do seem to have more of a cheese "sauce" than melted shredded cheese, but it was all good.the only downside was that the place is really loud. but everything else is really great. keep up the good work, dmk!

Reviews.Author: Dan M.
Reviews.Content: The good - the burgers were awesome. They had a large variety of burgers with some interesting toppings. I'm excited to go back and try more of them. The onion strings were really good too. And I kind of liked the environment.The bad - The prices, but I don't think I should hold them to the same standards of other places I get burgers from. I mean, it's their specialty and they do a damn good job at it

Reviews.Author: Jenna K.
Reviews.Content: I love gourmet-type burgers, so actually, I thought the prices were really reasonable.  $8 for any type burger (way better than the prices for the Rockit famous $19-$21 burgers, or even Kuma's $10-$12 burgers)  The burgers were good sized, but not nauseatingly huge.  (I have that problem with Kuma's, though I do love their burgers, I can never finish one without feeling like I never want to eat again).  Here's what we got:  I ordered the No. 4 (Roasted Hatch Green Chile, Fried Farm Egg, Sonoma Jack Cheese, Smoked Bacon) and my boyfriend ordered the No. 10 (Grass-Fed Lamb / Sheep's Milk Feta, Olive Tapenade, Tomato & Onion Salad, Tzatziki), and we split them, so that we each ate half of each.  I can say that both were delicious.  I was expecting mine to be slightly spicier, but I still loved what I ate.  And the Lamb burger was awesome.Our friends ordered the No. 1 (Aged Cheddar, Smoked Bacon, Charred Balsamic Red Onions, Rufus Teague's BBQ Sauce) and the No. 3 (NY Pastrami, Grand Cru Gruyere Cheese, Sauerkraut, Leroy's Remoulade) and they both loved, and I mean LOVED, theirs. We all dug the fact that the beef is grass-fed.  And we all loved our fries, which are a la carte.  We got one order of the french fries with truffle cream, and one order of sweet potato fries with tobasco cream to split between the four of us.All in all, delicious.  We can't wait to go back.Oh and other random logistics:  They don't normally take reservations.  We went there around 8pm on Valentines day, however, and they were doing reservations for just that day.  We didn't have any reservations, and were still able to get in after about 15 min wait.  Also, many of their tables are communal style seating.  I'm not the biggest fan of this, however, it seems to be a growing trend (hello Publican, Purple Pig, Urban Belly, etc).  I usually find it to be awkward. But the tables were spacious enough that it didn't bother me as much here.Anyway, I would say that this is one of my favorite new places.

Reviews.Author: Larisa B.
Reviews.Content: We came here after the Shamrock Shuffle this year trying to stay away from the huge March Madness crowds. I had heard when they first opened the food and staff weren't the best but had heard better since. We both started with a bloody mary each - I like to think of myself as a connoisseur of them and these were good but not at the top of my list, especially for $8 on a Sunday. I got the #5 which comes w/ Prosciutto, Fontina, Pesto, Red Pepper, Sea Salt & Vinegar Chips (which are actually on top of the burger) and we shared the Amish Blue and bacon fries. I don't have a bad thing to say about either. The burger was cooked exactly how I wanted it and all of the fixings were great. I want to try all of their french fry options. If you like burgers, this place is definitely one to try!

Reviews.Author: jessica m.
Reviews.Content: i've wanted to try dmk burger bar since i first heard that it was in the works, but everything i've read on here has mentioned that it's not a good place for kids, which makes it difficult for me to get out and enjoy.  i decided to bite the bullet and call to see if they had high chairs available, which is my strategy for deciding whether it's a place that i can bring my kid to, and also to kind of give the restaurant a heads up that a child will be entering their establishment.  i was pleasantly surprised when i was told they indeed had high chairs and yes, were "very kid friendly."  i packed up the babe, hopped in the car and headed over.i had burger #4 : a grass-fed beef patty with roasted green chiles, smoked bacon, sonoma jack cheese and a fried egg to top it all off.  it was a like a little slice of heaven in my mouth. the burger is a perfect size.  not too massive (a la kuma's, et al) where you feel like crap after eating it, and not too small where you're still hungry afterwards.  it really was the perfect size.  my little guy had their basic macaroni and cheese (they had 4 different offerings!), which was so good that i'm glad he has a tiny stomach so that i can eat the leftovers for dinner tonight.  the fried okra and pickles were also delicious.  i washed everything down with their house-made blood orange soda.we'll definitely be back.  i don't think i'd bring the little one during dinner hours, but it was a great spot for lunch.  i'm looking forward to working my way through the extensive beer and cocktail list and, of course, the rest of the burgers!

Reviews.Author: Angela Z.
Reviews.Content: I'm a burger lover and I have to say that thing that really sets the burgers apart at DMK from other places is the flavor quality of the meat.  There really is something to that "grass-fed" aspect that adds just a nice rich juicy flavor to the ground beef that I love.  It's nice to eat a burger and to actually taste it and have it complimented and not overpowered by just a mess of toppings and a bun.I got the basic burger here and I added an egg, YUM!  The bun is nice, not too thick or thin.  But I will say it falls apart a little too fast to support the ingredients.  The fries here are good but I wouldn't fall all over myself for them.  However the sauces they come with are quite tasty and different.  Love the smokey ketchup too.  I've had no problems with service here either.  The price for the burger is decent, although I wish it included the fries as well.  Overall a good place with a good product.

Reviews.Author: Dave C.
Reviews.Content: It was thoroughly decent. Nothing bad at all, but not worth the hype. Let's go bullet point style:- No wait for 2 on a Wednesday night at 7, but within 15 minutes there were tons of people waiting to sit down- Service was fine, no complaints there- Drink menu was comprehensive- Sweet potato fries were ridiculous. If I go back, I'm ordering nothing but beer and sweet potato fries- The Greek salad was good- The mac and cheese was better, but not outstanding- The burgers were a disappointment. For a place that calls itself a Burger Bar, they really should be able to do better than this. The toppings were tasty, but overall, they were complete meh.Long story short, not a bad place, but I won't go back.

Reviews.Author: E D.
Reviews.Content: Ive tried this place 3 times and the burgers just aren't very good. They are trying to be a gourmet burger place but it's no better than average bar food. Kirkwoods next door makes a better burger. The Counter on Diversey or 5 Guys are way better

Reviews.Author: Chris H.
Reviews.Content: Happening place, great staff, amazing food.  #4 is my favorite (with the turkey burger when there for brunch), shakes will move you and sweet potato & parm truffle fries are a must.

Reviews.Author: Katherine M.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic food!! The food came out quicker than it took to wait for a table. House wine was pretty good too. Very veggie friendly.

Reviews.Author: Matthew N.
Reviews.Content: I've only had one meal here so far. I took my girlfriend on a date before she left for a 3 and a half week trip.To put it plain and simple, the waitress was great and I think I had the #3 (it has sauerkraut on it), and I can not wait to have my way with that burger again. SO GOOD!

Reviews.Author: Allison T.
Reviews.Content: First off, let me start off by saying I'm a vegetarian, so when my friends suggested we go to DMK Burger Bar for dinner one night, I thought maybe they were starting not to like me very much anymore.  But it turned out they had checked out the menu and there were lots of veggie-friendly options, including a couple veggie sandwiches, a whole section called 'cheese with things', and several salads.  So I was more than happy, as were they, given the creative list of what I would call 'meat with things' that they had to choose from.  All of the burgers were from grass-fed beef and everything started at $8 unless you went with some sort of upgrade, such as switching to bison, making it a double, or yes, adding a fried egg.  We started off by choosing from their extensive list of craft beers, and found we had a lot of great options.  Both of my friends ordered the patty melt, and I had the veggie burger.  We were also VERY excited to try all of their fries and ended up ordering way more than we needed.  My veggie burger was great, not a boring frozen patty like some places offer as their veggie option, but just as creatively done as all the burgers on the menu, so I didn't feel slighted in any way.  My friends were happy with their choices and the fries were excellent.  We left happy and full.  The one complaint I really had was that it was super-loud and really hard to hear a thing that anyone said, but it was a packed Friday night, so not a big deal. I was excited to go back with my boyfriend and we did last night.  This time, I again ordered the veggie burger since it was so awesome the last time.  I went to order the sweet potato fries because they were my favorite of all the fries we tried.  That's when the waitress asked me if I was a vegetarian or just trying to be healthy by ordering the veggie burger because the fries were fried in BEEF FAT.  Ummm, seriously?  Even McDonald's gave that up in like the 70's, but okay, that's their perogative.  I was quite bummed and had to order the onion straws which sort of sucked, at least compared to their fries.  Their onion straws ARE cooked in vegetable oil, so what gives?  Then I remembered how I ate the damn fries last time and there was no warning about the beef fat.  Given how many vegetarians are in this town, it wouldn't be hard to put a little description underneath the fries, like 'hey, sorry to disappoint you tremendously, especially if you've eaten these fries before and loved them, but they are fried in beef fat', or something to that effect.  It's not life and death, but I'm a vegetarian for many reasons and I wouldn't have eaten them if I would have known.  Lesson learned, I guess.  Our waitress actually ended up giving us a free dessert, just because she felt bad about it, even though I wasn't exactly stomping my feet, throwing a fit.  So anyway, vegetarians beware, the next time I go there, they'll probably say surprise, the veggie burger is fried in beef fat too.That issue aside, the place is pretty cool and there's definitely something for everyone.  The beer list is great, they have a really creative menu and the staff is friendly and attentive.

Reviews.Author: Stephen P.
Reviews.Content: Been there several times and everything I have had has been amazing!  This past weekend I had - what i consider - the best thing i have ever eaten!  It was a Breakfast burger = heaven on a bun!  It was a turkey patty with Hash browns, a fried egg bacon and a RIDICULOUS maple syrup aioli!  This place is ridiculously, insanely delicious!

Reviews.Author: Colleen K.
Reviews.Content: DMK just gets better and better with time. Perfect location right off the Wellington L stop.  Super friendly staff that does their best even when it's packed to get you fed and on your way. I love their Turkey burgers as a #8 and their parmesean truffle fries are to die for. I definetly can't eat here all the time or I would weigh 200 pounds, but it's a great place for a fun casual group dinner.  Sometimes it can be a little overwhelming to get a drink and wait for a table, but the bartenders are pretty good at noticing you and getting you served quickly. Will definitely being going back.

Reviews.Author: Bobuzzi C.
Reviews.Content: Are you a human? Do you like food? Do you love burgers and fries? Then visit this place!! DMK serves up some of the best burgers and fries. Their menu doesn't offer a ton of selection, but what it does offer, it makes very very well. We had the classic bacon cheeseburger! And their variety of fry choices and accompanying dips DO NOT disappoint. Go there and enjoy. Just leave yourself some time. It's always busy and no reservations are taken.

Reviews.Author: Lauren C.
Reviews.Content: I waited to write a review on this but it has come time. I went once and loved it but it was my birthday so I thought maybe it was just a great mood. Went another time and it was also fantastic but I was starving. Went a third time and I began to dream about the burgers. So, I had to go again because of my dreams and they all came true. Bison burger - awesome. Blueberry sauce - who would have thought?Turkey burger - awesomeThe big "DMK" - get it? AwesomeThe one with green chilies and a fried egg - awesomeThe FRIES?!?!?!? - AMAZINGJust go there. Who cares if they are smug. Their burgers are $8 so get over it and eat them.

Reviews.Author: Thomas K.
Reviews.Content: One star since it was edible.  Really below expectations.   Horrid burgers, small servings, and no comparison to even some lower end burgers.   Don't do it.

Reviews.Author: Laura C.
Reviews.Content: Amazing! The parmesan truffle fries were the best around.  And the DMK Burger tastes like a Big Mac on steroids. The wait was only a half hour on a Saturday afternoon and it was well worth the wait. Parking can be a bit hard but if you drive around a bit, you'll find something. I can't wait to go back and try other burgers at DMK.

Reviews.Author: Ana F.
Reviews.Content: Great veggie burger! After reading some previous reviews, I feel it necessary to state that their fries are cooked in beef fat. After the waitress pointed that out, I ordered the chili-rubbed onion strings, which were also tasty. The only reason I'm giving four stars instead of five is because I was looking forward to the fries with Wisconsin cheddar and scallions and I could not have them.

Reviews.Author: Katy H.
Reviews.Content: Yes, yes, yes! My roommate stopped in after a show at the Biograph as I had been craving a good burger and really wanted to try DMK, and boy, I was not disappointed!  My second visit was not as great, but I didn't order the same thing and that made all the difference.So far I've ordered the #1 and the #2. The #1 was okay, though I'm not a huge cheddar fan. The #2 was amazing!! This is one of my favorite burgers in Chicago, hands down!  You can really taste the difference in the meat as it is all grass fed beef.I've also had the fries. Both times they were just okay. The truffle cream fries were my favorite, but the fries were really just a conduit for the cream! The Wisconsin Cheddar fries were very cheesy!They also have a pretty decent beer selection to accompany your meal. The service is average. Last time I asked repeatedly for water and never got any.  I definitely think this place is worth the trip, the burgers are great!

Reviews.Author: Erin H.
Reviews.Content: I cannot wait to go back! Atmosphere left something to be desired, a little too "sterile trendy" for a burger joint, but the service and food delivered!We shared parm truffle and sweet potato fries --both came with excellent dipping sauces and the server tossed in some free fried okra and dill pickles! A smart move as I would go for the pickles and okra over the fried potatoes any day, now. Might as well have some green in there if you're indulging in fried food, right?I ordered #6, Marinated portobello, Blue Brie (A combo I need to find out where to buy!!), with griddled scalions, dijonnaise and, of course, a beef patty. The bun was perfectly toasted and held all the ingredients together nicely. Ketchup wasn't necessary. Did you hear that? NO KETCHUP NECESSARY! It was so delicious! This from a girl who would put ketchup on cereal if it were socially acceptable; I love that stuff. Large variety of brews, fast bar service.The chocolate chip cookie sandwich for dessert was delicious to share ways but didn't have any chocolate chips in it, so that was strange.

Reviews.Author: Jim O.
Reviews.Content: I dropped in with a friend after work.  It had a trendy vibe (pro or con depending on the mood).  They had a fairly extensive beer list and a lot of good food options.  I had the #3 (pastrami/gruyere), and we split an order of the Wisconsin cheddar fries and the Parmesan with truffle cream fries. The burger was kind of thin (consider a double if hungry), but it was really tasty!  I would definitely come back.

Reviews.Author: Patrick K.
Reviews.Content: I saw this place on the Food Network Channel on " Diners, Drives and Dives." Also, I pass this place everyday on the redline and I have always wanted to try it. I had big expectations, but it was just alright.  There are better burgers in that neighborhood.These gourmet burgers were very flavorful, but were nothing spectacular. I ordered a side of sweet potato fries and they were actually really good. However, they served a dipping hot sauce sauce that did not go well with the with the fries. DMK, a solid restaurant, but I expected more.

Reviews.Author: Max S.
Reviews.Content: A great twist on burgers and fries. Really didn't have to wait long for a table and the bar selection is fantastic as well.

Reviews.Author: Paul S.
Reviews.Content: Did I like it?  Yes.  Would I recommend it?  Yes.  Do I see myself going back anytime soon?  Not really.  I had decent expectations and they were met, but there are a few other burgers in Chicago I'd rate higher.  FYI - The Lucky Charms in their Shamrock Shakes are such a good idea, I can't believe I've never come across it before.

Reviews.Author: Brian O.
Reviews.Content: Great burger spot with an extensive beer list.  Heard they might be opening a new location in Little Italy and can't wait! Turkey burger and Parmesan fries are superb!

Reviews.Author: Ryan M.
Reviews.Content: I have now been here twice. the first time was better for some reason. got the #1 both times, with bbq sauce, grilled onions and cheddar. i do have to say tho, the burger is super tasty! hence the 4 stars. but the fries add proibably one and a half stars to the score. some of the best cheddar fries i have ever had. the cheddar is similar to weiner circle, but is on point all the time. weiner circle would be better but more than half the time their cheddar is not being heated to acceptable temps, and probably will get you sick. refer to my weiner  ircle review that is in process.

Reviews.Author: Priya A.
Reviews.Content: This place is absolutely awesome.. the burgers are amazing and the sides are amazing.. it's a really great place with fabulous food

Reviews.Author: Hatidza Z.
Reviews.Content: Their veggie burger is so good! Good consistency, great taste! I hate it when my burger falls apart, so I'm glad I had zero issues with my burger here. It's sucks that their fries are not vegetarian, but at least they're nice enough to inform of this fact. I will definitely be going back, just not during the evening on a weekend because you can expect a long wait and I know that takes away from the good food experience for many.

Reviews.Author: Raphael D.
Reviews.Content: First I'll state that I'm a pretty serious foodie. I do however appreciate a good to great burger (Kuma's corner, Epic Burger, In & Out burger). This place however isn't nearly in the same league as those places! I appreciate how juicy the burger was but after that it's all downhill. The fires didn't taste fresh cut to me though the bartender said they were. After watching the DD&D on this place perhaps I should've tried the bison or salmon burger and skipped the fries. I'll head back to Epic before repeating.

Reviews.Author: Keisha S.
Reviews.Content: Very good burgers

Reviews.Author: Sollie F.
Reviews.Content: DMK cooks all of its fries in BEEF FAT without labeling it on the menu.  Only found out last night- after eating there multiple times- when my waitress told me as I ordered the portabello burger.  Unacceptable, especially for a place that serves veggie burgers.

Reviews.Author: Laura W.
Reviews.Content: I want to start by saying that I do not give out "5 Star Ratings" easily... It takes a lot to impress me. However, my boyfriend and I found ourselves in Chicago (after a drive from Milwaukee) starving and soon to be late for a show. With 20 minutes to grab a bite, a man who is a bit picky, and Chicago traffic/parking, I had high planned for the entire night to fall apart. DMK Burger Bar saved the entire night...and I am not being dramatic.Entering the burger bar, I was a bit nervous since it looked quite busy. "Oh great, it'll be at least 25 minutes before we even get our food" I whispered to my date. But we were both very hungry, and decided to hope it would all work out. We sat at the bar and were greeted by a very knowledgeable and helpful bartender. She picked out a cocktail for me (which was The Summer Passage- DELICIOUS) and I told her we were in a hurry. She smiled and took our order. Me: the turkey burger with tomato, arugula, etc. Man: a burger with a fried egg, guacamole, chorizo, chipotle aioli, and more...
