I cannot remember the creative name :( my apologies. After we ordered, it was less than a five minute wait before our burgers were staring us in the face!!! How phenomenal!! And let me tell you... No pun intended but HOLY COW, were they delicious! As I was happily working on my phenomenal turkey burger with a homemade bun, I glanced at the signs around the bar, reading "Beer Sno Cone" ... WHAT?!? I laughed and said out loud, "Babe! Look! A beer Sno cone! How cool!" It was one small comment that's made while happily digesting my burger, and thought nothing of it. That is, until, I had a man delivering a beer sno cone "on the house" to my boyfriend and I. Say what?!? I was full of smiles. Turns out, one the thoughtful bartenders overheard my interest and curiosity, and had one delivered to us! So- let me explain that for me to rate a restaurant with 5 stars, it must be the whole package... Great service, phenomenal food, and an exciting ambience. And allow me to say that if there were more stars, I would award them. This place has EVERYTHING, and even more. Keep it up DMK Burger Bar... I cannot wait until I am back in Chicago to visit again.

Reviews.Author: Marilyn P.
Reviews.Content: I went there with a group today for lunch - the burgers were great, the service was fast and friendly, and the string onions and truffle fries also very tasty. I hear that the place can get awfully crowded at times but it was very open for lunch and I would recommend highly.

Reviews.Author: Jake B.
Reviews.Content: Walking into DMK I wasn't sure if I was eating burgers or sushi.  The interior was way more posh than a burger joint should be.  Regardless, the burgers are very tasty.  The hamburger meat itself is fantastic.  However, the soft buns are unappealing and a pretzel roll would be a much better compliment.  They make their own ketchup and this is a good thing as the "truffle cream" leaves much to be desired.  There is a draft beer selection that is lacking in quantity but high in quality and the service was much to be commended.  Kuma's Corner has set a high standard in Chicago and DMK just missed the bar.

Reviews.Author: Kent S.
Reviews.Content: If Michael Kornick and David Morton are involved, chances are that they will, in theory, come up with a pretty tasty burger.  As the name implies, it is a bar which serves burgers.  They have a number of interesting beers and hard ciders on tap which all go well with the food.  On a Saturday night at least, it is a pretty busy scene and as they do not take reservations, expect a wait for a table.  We ended up waiting only about 20min or so.  Compared with the wait at a place like Kumas, not bad.Now to the important stuff:  The Burgers.  As you may have heard, they offer many different incarnations of the burger, including turkey, lamb and portabello, but we were there for the beef, baby!  My wife ordered the bacon cheddar burger which was delicious.  The patty was cooked perfectly given its thickness.  Medium well, but still juicy.  The balsamic glazed red onions gave the burger a wonderful flavor without overpowering the flavor of the beef.  I had the green chile and egg burger which was also fantastic.  The flavors of the egg and chiles   were a perfect complement to the burger as well.  At least for the two we tried, they paired the flavors of the toppings exceptionally well.  This is what a gourmet burger should be, unlike some places which just slap the work "Kobe" in front of the name and expect people to pay more for that.  As for sides, the sweet potato fries were very tasty, although ours was a bit over-salted.  The standard mac and cheese was excellent as well.  The price is right and the service friendly.  Definitely check it out.

Reviews.Author: Stacy D.
Reviews.Content: Update:  Have been able to go back a few times since the original visit.  Great food, great atmosphere.  Very popular spot so be prepared to wait at key times.I walk by here everyday to get to the el and always think, I need to stop and check this place out.  So today, I was craving a burger and thought I'd stop by on my way home to pick up one for take out.  I was sadly mistaken to think they had take out.  They don't.  I was told it *might* be a possibility at lunchtime when they were less busy, but at 6 p.m. when I walked in, they weren't even close to busy.  I like to support local neighborhood establishments, but I'm not sure I'll be back anytime soon.  If/when I do, I'll update my review.  My first impression isn't a great one though.

Reviews.Author: robert a.
Reviews.Content: yummy burgers and incredible sweet potato fries. I had the lamb burger. I don't like beer, but the selection seems vast.  I'll definitely return

Reviews.Author: A A.
Reviews.Content: DMK Burger Bar is a decent place to grab a burger with friends.  Pros: I ordered the veggie burger and it was great.  I also got the sweet potato fries which were out of this world!! The rest of the people I went with all ordered regular burgers and said the beef was very good Cons: The wait is always long...expect to wait atleast a half hour on weeknights and over an hour on the wkends..personally i don't think the burgers are worth that long of a wait they don't allow ANY substitutions.  I was the only one who liked my burger because the other people i went with wanted to substitute the cheese in the #2 and weren't allowed to and lo and behold when they got their burger what did they not like about it...the CHEESE! i can't deal with places esp a burger place that doesn't allow any substitutions..its not like its some 5 star fine dining place so i don't get why they're so anal about substitutions don't think i'll go back unless they expand and the wait isn't as long. also personally I prefer The Counter because the seating situation is much better and you get to build your own burger

Reviews.Author: Mag W.
Reviews.Content: Food - Reasonably priced at $8 for a burger and $5 fries (with delicious toppings like Parmesan and truffle cream).  I agree with the review below about the veggie burger - it's fantastic.Drinks - Great beer selection.  The best part is that the bartenders aren't beer snobs and they'll let you sample just about anything before you order it.  Service - Quick and Friendly.

Reviews.Author: William G.
Reviews.Content: Great atmosphere great food.  They have a great beer list and some of the best truffle fries I've ever had.  Would def recommend the bison burger as well

Reviews.Author: Lanny S.
Reviews.Content: We were very disappointed in the burgers. They were very thin and the toppings were sparse. The fries were OK but just OK. The value for what you get was poor. The pictures on line of what theburgers look like had to be taken at another restaurant.Lanny

Reviews.Author: B F.
Reviews.Content: This tiny burger joint is definitely a hidden gem.  My burger was cooked to preference and the toppings were fresh and tasty (including the fried egg on top). The beer list is decent.  I can't wait to get back so I can try a different number on their list.

Reviews.Author: Corey G.
Reviews.Content: I tried DMK for the first time last night. It was great! My friend got the peanut butter milkshake. To die for...they, I think, make their peanut butter and it is really something to talk about! I should have ordered one, it was amazing. I got the #4 green chile hatch and made it a turkey burger without the bacon. It had a little kick and was totally satisfying. Now there is a great debate amongst lovers of french fries, like myself. Some prefer real cheese others like fake cheddar. DMK's cheddar and scallion fries are amazing. Real cheddar cheese and the fries are so good, cooked just right! My party also got the truffle cream and parmesan fries- also amazing. I used some of the truffle sauce with my turkey burger. All in all, really great.

Reviews.Author: Mark C.
Reviews.Content: Don't be afraid to upgrade it to a double, the burger size is not overwhelming.  Overall really tasty and the best burger bun, I have ever had.  Only downside is it is quite loud and difficult to converse even at a 2 top.

Reviews.Author: Stephanie S.
Reviews.Content: The burgers are good; they have a lot of options; and the service is really quick.  But the burgers are way too greasy.

Reviews.Author: Monkey M.
Reviews.Content: DMK is relatively new in the Lakeview area.  It has a great airy atmosphere inside with high ceilings, plenty of seating and kept really clean.  Choices include a list of specialty burgers which are numbered.  You can also go with the plain old cheeseburger if you're not the adventure type.  I have tried a select few and all have been great.  If you feel like getting really unhealthy you can get a fried egg on any of them.  I had never tried this before and wish I hadn't because it was delicious.  The best though are their specialty fries with various dips.  I really recommend the truffle fries which are unique and rock.  Only downside that the burgers are a bit on the smaller side but given most burgers you get other places barely fit on the plate they likely represent a 'normal' human serving size.

Reviews.Author: DeeDee B.
Reviews.Content: Um Yea, I don't like to write bad reviews for any place, but this place was just a very very bad experience for me.  DMK is probably the most over rated burger joint in the city of Chicago.  It really could be a great place, but I feel it's being done all wrong.The interior is dark, unwelcoming, pretentious, and not cute.  The burgers are really bad.  I mean REALLY BAD.  5 oz patty, on a dry ass crusty really disgusting bun,  only cooked at medium (which isn't true cuz our burgers were well done, ugh) and are $8 without fries.  When I came here with my boyfriend, we got 2 well done chewy burgers, 2 fries and 2 glasses of water.  Our tab was $30.00.  It was a Tuesday at 6pm, the weekday specials are a free order of fries with your burgers between 5pm-7pm.  We didn't get the special because we didn't ask about it, WTF? Really?  and NONE of the specials were offered to us by the server.  I know that they're trying to upsell, but that just pisses off the customer.  We left there disappointed and with painful stomach aches for the rest of the night.I will say that the fries are good, the staff is very friendly and our server was very nice and attentive too.I really wanted to love this place, I did.  DMK could really be a cool joint, but they just need to do a few things differently.  I hate saying this, but you could probably get a better burger at McDonald's for much cheaper and without a stomach ache.  Well, maybe a little stomach ache too lol.

Reviews.Author: Abby R.
Reviews.Content: Good beer, a great burger (I had the burger with fried egg, bacon, and green chilies.), great fries (bacon and blue cheese) and great service (Safia).

Reviews.Author: Allison B.
Reviews.Content: LOVE this place. #1 is very good and the truffle fries are delicious!

Reviews.Author: Brian T.
Reviews.Content: Am I missing something here? Yeah, about half the burger meat.The first thing we noticed instantly was how obscenely loud the music was. We looked around to see if there were any tables that weren't underneath a speaker (no chance). They must have bought out best buy. My boyfriend is deaf in one ear, so we spent the entire meal without conversation. What we did say to one another was mostly complaints about how loud it was (and that was shouted).I ordered a diet coke, #10 turkey burger and shared a plate of Mac 'n cheese. When the CAN of diet coke arrived I knew all was going to go down hill from there (I haven't been to a burger joint that doesn't offer unlimited refills on soda!). Second, the burger arrives on a small tea cup plate. Okay, so I thought the burger was going to be so outstanding that I wouldn't care that it was on such a small plate sans fries. I lifted up the bun only to find myself thinking "Where's the beef?" (well, in my case, turkey). Thirdly, I noticed that the burger was fried. Maybe I haven't realized that other burger places fry their burgers because the meat patty and buns were exceptional--not so in this case. Small burger, big airy tasteless bun. I will say one positive about the burger--it wasn't overly stuffed with toppings (but the meat should have been a lot more substantial).Also positive--the M'nC was passable...I've had better, but I've also had much much worse.I probably will stick to my favorite joints for burgers next time...

Reviews.Author: Kathryn C.
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with DMK.  Burgers are a good size (not small and not too huge) and the fries are fantastic! I really like the regular sea salt and pepper fries.  The cheddar fries were not all that good because they use the liquid type of cheese rather than actual melted cheddar.  Good portion size on the fries too.  Quick service and decent prices.  If you want to order food to go, I suggest going there and waiting rather than calling it in.  I tried to call it in once and it was so loud that (a) I had to scream into the phone so the lady could hear me, and (2) my order was not corrrect.  It is just too loud for them to hear you on the phone unless you call in very early when they are not busy yet.

Reviews.Author: Collier T.
Reviews.Content: Best milkshakes ever.....fabulous fries, especially the parmesan truffle variety...and well of course the burgers are wonderful. The restaurant has a great upbeat atmosphere (low key modern chic) with an equally energetic and fun wait staff....I highly recommend for teenagers and adults!

Reviews.Author: A-train R.
Reviews.Content: I finally made it 2 the DMK this week. I ordered a Bison burger with a fried egg on it  and Wisconsin Cheddar fries. My friend had an Original DMK with gravy fries. At first i saw my burger and fries and thought " thats it" I paid $9 for that? then i took a bite from my Bison burger with the added yolk oozing out of it and it took me to another world! It was SO good. On some days burgers are just burgers unless they are huge then they seem much tastier, but this one didn't need to be big to be good, it was just damn good. Then, aside from the food the customer service really did me in. There were at least 3 different people who asked if everything was cool, but never annoying. Also, my friend had ordered his burger without onions but they gave him onions. Just as he pulled the onions out of his burger our waitress saw and asked if he wanted another one. He said it was totally fine he'd just pull them out. About 3 minutes later one of the servers came out with a side of gravy fries on the house. Sometimes you go to a place that you feel really cares about customer service/satisfaction. They don't come around very often especially when they are taverns or burger joints. DMK was everything I had heard about and more. The only things i would say that may be a little negative about this place is that the portions are small which is something that you don't want if you go to a burger joint, but it is well worth the money and also they have an option to "double size" the burger.  The place was small and it was a little cozy but cozy like a place to hang out with friends, not really like to take a chick out on a 1st date. Also, the drinks are a little expensive, but they have a good selection of beers although they don't have cheap selections. They are all $5 and up and nothing like a miller lite or budweiser to choose from.

Reviews.Author: Matt K.
Reviews.Content: Burger bars are all the rage and DMK does it really well.  Loud atmosphere so tough to hear yourself talk but that's all part of the vibe so be prepared.  Went a little off the beaten path and had the salmon burger which had a lot of flavor, but it just didn't do it for me and wouldn't recommend. But the sweet potato fries were absolutely the best I've ever had and highly recommend.  The fried okra and pickles were also a great surprise and the crispy onions albeit greasy were really good too. Great selection of beers and the burgers were solid (although not crazy good like Umami in LA or elsewhere) but you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Michelle T.
Reviews.Content: I still think about this burger and it's been months.  Had the #4 (egg, green chiles, bacon, jack) & french fries with the aged cheddar sauce and chives.  Unbelievably amazing.  The meat was wonderful and juicy and the potato bun was fluffy.  And the egg goops out all over, it was a mess.  An incredibly delicious mess.  The aged cheese sauce was also delicious and would have been the star at any other restaurant but the burger won out at this place.

Reviews.Author: Annika v.
Reviews.Content: The best burgers in town, hands down. Don't miss the truffle fries. If I could eat it everyday without gaining a million pounds I would...

Reviews.Author: gretchen b.
Reviews.Content: We live in the area and have been meaning to get into DMK, as I love me a good burger!  Went on a Tuesday night, around 7:45 -- it was pretty crowded!  We waited about 15+ minutes.  Here's the thing - the place is LOUD.  Like, you have to speak up just to talk to the person across the table.  That is the one major downfall.  So, I wouldn't take a date or a group.  BUT - if you're up for it, the food is worth it!  Their beer list is great - not the boring norm.  I enjoyed a 3 Floyds Gumballhead.  Love it!  We started out with the deviled eggs, $2 for 3 little halves.  They were tasty - very creamy.  Yum.  All the burgers are $8 (a la carte), with exception of some biggies.  I went for #1 - bacon, BBQ, balsamic red onions and cheddar.  All burgers come "pink in the middle."  Perfect.  My friend ordered the mac and cheese.  It's a giant order and no way you could eat it all - soooo rich and creamy.  We split a single order of the cheddar and scallion fries.  They were quite awesome.  Not sure what was so special, but the cheese was glorious.  It didn't get all clumpy.  Soo good.All in all a beer, soda, eggs, burger, mac cheese & side of fries came to $30.  Great deal in my book!  I really enjoyed DMK and would go back.....just wish they'd turn down the volume a tiny bit.

Reviews.Author: Will M.
Reviews.Content: Burgers were awesome - I had a number 4 which has an egg and green salsa on it.  It was actually pretty spicy - which I like.  My wife and I had an argument about the fries.  I wanted just the plain ones with salt and pepper - she wanted gravy fries.  So the waitress brought us the gravy fries on-the-house. We looked on the bill and the line item said "-$4.00 for Love".  It did take a while to get the bill at the end, but since our waitress was so awesome I'm gonna let it go this time.  Oh, forgot to mention, the beer selection is great too.

Reviews.Author: Shari M.
Reviews.Content: DMK is seriously the ultimately COOLEST place to be! Just this afternoon, i was in for a bite to eat with my friend Jonathan (yes, THAT hockey hunk!) and we were saying that DMK is not just a place to get amazing food. (I challenge anyone to find a better looking staff!! Bunch of hotties!) DMK is the totL package! Best burgers are just the beginning!!! Today I tasted the most creamy amazing avocado soup! I am pescatarian so this is a major excitement for me! Also making an amazing debut today was a bursting-with-freshness Gazpacho! OMG I didn't think I liked Gazpacho until I had this heavenly masterpiece. Seriously, I could go on for days but let's talk about the shakes! Milk shakes?....you say, "What's so special?" AGAIN I challenge anyone on the planet to make a better shake. The shakes are super thick and so yummy! The peanut butter shake is so out of this world but if you like coffee, order the espresso. It will blow your mind!!! No, really it will  BLOW YOUR MIND!!!! If you want the best beer, hottest staff and amazing eats, come to DMK! I will be blogging from the bar, downing the soup, veggie burger and sweet potato fries! (Wait, did i mention the beer is so awesome and original!!)Tell them your friend Shari sent you!! Really not to be missed!!!!

Reviews.Author: Michael H.
Reviews.Content: OVERRATED!  I had high hopes for this place given Michael Kournik's rep and the five-star reviews on Yelp.  But I can honestly say this place is so overrated!  The beef might be 'grass-fed' but it is poor quality and so greasy you will burp it up hours later.  The patties are pressed really thin (think McD's quarter pounder) and tasted like fried on a griddle - no special flavor at all.  Trust me... you can make better burgers at home on the grill!!!  The fries were good but nothing unique... who doesn't sell sweet potato fries or parmesan truffle fries these days?  Oh, and super-greasy.  I really wanted to like this place and gave it the extra star because of its prompt and friendly service.  But do yourself a favor - save $20 and skip this place.

Reviews.Author: H R.
Reviews.Content: Visiting my brother last week who told me about the best burger place around.  He had had only heard great things about this place and so we went.  We left the restuarnt with him apologizing profusely for taking us here without first eating here first.  Good things about the restaurant:  fries and gravy (you rarely see this anymore), no wait. the buns, onion rings,  good beer list.Bad things: Hamburgers, service and volume.I love grass fed beef and buy it at home from the local farmers market.  It has great flavor and since i am in the red meat capital of the US I expected more basic knowledge.  Grass fed beef is leaner than normal beef and thus needs to be cooked rare to medium rare to still be juicy.  All 6 of our burgers were overcooked (medium-medium well) and dry as the sahara.  The cheese covered barely half of my burger and i had maybe a  1 1/2 inch strip of bacon on it. Our server couldnt have been ruder.  We were talked down to, told we could make no substitutions, then when she brought 5 burgers for 6 people acted if one of us didn''t order dinner.  Oddly enough, my 12 year old son loved it.  Of course his favorite burger is the McDonalds quarter pounder.

Reviews.Author: Hillarie R.
Reviews.Content: DMK, you are all that is right in the burger bar world. The blue cheese burger with onion crisps on top with a side of truffle oil fries- one of my favorite burger meals in the city. BF and I always come here for lunch when he is in town. Great beer selection and nice waitresses. I have never had that ice cream cookie sandwich thing that looks zomg so good (mostly because I insist on eating a plate of mac & cheese meant for 2) but it will make it into my belly next visit. Can't wait to try Fish Bar next door, but putting them so close together is starting to give me whiplash.

Reviews.Author: k B.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers and fries and beer!  Atmosphere was good.  Great selection of some different burgers.  I had the bison burger which was great.  Their buns are very fresh and soft.  Loved that.  Got there during happy hour so the fries (salt & pepper) were free with a burger.  Topped it off with a nice cold Crispin on ice.  Only weird thing.....all water came without ice???A definite recommend.

Reviews.Author: Brian H.
Reviews.Content: Great dining experience. Food was fresh, fast and priced right! Great service with nice people. Excellent dining experience!  I will be back!

Reviews.Author: Claudia R.
Reviews.Content: Yummy. Loud. Sometimes long wait.  Worth it.

Reviews.Author: James B.
Reviews.Content: Burgers served on fresh-made buns, and great extras, like onion strings, amish blue cheese, house-made ketchup, etc.  Just can't go wrong with the burgers in this place! And, the fries and house-made ketchup are simply delicious! We sat at the bar and were treated very well.  The bartender told us about their current promotion to benefit a local charity.  Very high-quality apple-pie milkshake! YUMMY! Go here... you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Author: Chris T.
Reviews.Content: Amazing!!!

Reviews.Author: Jay G.
Reviews.Content: We stopped in for a light lunch on Saturday afternoon.  The decor is great.  Love the vibe in the place.  Service was a little slow, but adequate.  I ordered the fried pickles and okra for an appetizer.  I love fried pickles, and had never had fried okra.  The breading is very good, but its hard to tell between the pickles and the okra.   The okra was fine, but I was looking forward most to the pickles.  I think there were one or two pickles in the whole order.  The ranch that came with them was pretty standard ranch dip.  My wife and I split a burger and fries.  We had the number 2 (onion strings, bleu cheese, ketchup), and salt and pepper fries.  The burger was excellent.  The bun was excellent.  The fries were very well done fresh cut fries, but I've had better.  Neither of us were huge fans of the house ketchup.  Overall, very satisfying burger and fries.  Reasonably priced as well.

Reviews.Author: Mike M.
Reviews.Content: After having friends rave about DMK since I moved to the city I finally went yesterday during the Bears game.  Got two seats at the bar and ordered right away.  Ray was very friendly and overheard my friend and I talking about truffle fries we had somewhere previously so he gave us a free order when our meal came out.  Later when my friend and I were talking about the beer we were drinking, he gave us free samples of beers on tap.  Turns out Ray runs the beer program at DMK.  It was a great experience and a great meal.  To top it off, when we paid our bills he gave us free drink tickets for next time we are in.  I will definitely be going back to DMK, an $8 burger never tasted so good.

Reviews.Author: Lee T.
Reviews.Content: Meh. I could take it or leave it. I only give this place 3 stars because our server gave us a card for a free beer on tap.I had their #6 burger that had "blue brie" on it, and damn was it a stinky cheese. My fault my fault. Other than that, the burger was alright, and the cheddar fries were overly salty. Ambiance is nice, and the wait staff was just whatever. Not super friendly, not completely obnoxious. I really didn't think she cared about anything ever, period.This place could really up their everything, or maybe I just had a bad experience. I don't think I'll go back unless I'm getting my free beer.

Reviews.Author: Hollie D.
Reviews.Content: Amazing!!!! Love the atmosphere, the music, and the burgers!!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Jennifer P.
Reviews.Content: DMK Burger Bar is DEEEELISSSSSH! It's exceptionally yummy and well worth the 45+ minute wait. My friend and I tried the Chicago favorite tonight for the first time after debating whether or not we wanted to wait almost and hour for a burger and fries. I'm glad we made the right decision and stayed. DMK burger offers more than your traditional burger and fry experience. This restaurant offers great food, period. My friend and I tried the HOLY GUAC-AOILI burger and it was pretty darn scrumptious, My only qualm was the guacomole; it is a bet bland, similar to that of some concoction of an avocado and water blend...weird! Other than that, everything was AH-MAZING!!!! The mac-cheese is brought to the table pipping hot, bubbling with gooey parmesean and cheddar cheese. The mac & cheese is pretty filling, large enough to share. We also tried the sweet potato fries, which were the best I've ever had. They're just right, crispy on the outside, soft on the inside! Additionally, the service was awesome. Our server was very thorough in explaining the menu options to us. She checked on us in a timely manner and made sure everything was going well. I give her 2 thumbs up!!!The only reason why DMK Burger Bar in Lakeview does not get 5 stars is because of their wait. DMK does not take reservations and they do not have the space to be super accommodating; nor do they try to be. The seating area is very congested and awkward.

Reviews.Author: Alisha O.
Reviews.Content: Everything on their menu is fabulous -- although #6 is my favorite burger.  Some of my other favorites are their sweet potato fries, espresso milk shakes, and their fried okra and dill pickles.  They have a great beer selection, and kids always seem to be welcome.  Their burgers are made from grass fed beef, and their buns are the best I've ever had.  Very soft, with a slightly crisp outer crust.. but somehow not "crusty."  Their burgers are always perfectly moist, and the amount of toppings always balances the burger just right.

Reviews.Author: Meg M.
Reviews.Content: Would love to be able to give 5 stars, even 10 for the food. wow!But if the food is so good, what is with all the over the top rediculously  loud music. Does DMK pay in advance for all of their employees impending hearing loss. Best Veg buger I've ever had, and I've eaten most of them. Thought about bringing ear plugs next time I come, but I probably won't be back. I like to enjoy the conversation and company of those I'm with and there is no way to do that over the noise. Has anyone measured the decible level at DMK's.

Reviews.Author: Katie T.
Reviews.Content: Went here on a double date. The burgers are amazing! I appreciate that they buy grass fed beef and they're the perfect size to eat in one sitting. I had the number 4 and loved it =) They have an excellent beer and cocktail selection as well and the food came really quick considering how packed it was on a Saturday night. The only issues I had were the noise (extremely loud) and our waiter wasn't around a whole lot. I had to ask a couple of times to get a refill on my water. Would definitely recommend!! But if you go on the weekend, be aware that you'll have to wait a while for a table.

Reviews.Author: Andrea W.
Reviews.Content: This place is 5 stars all the way.  The beer selection is awesome and the burgers and fries are even better.  We've tried pretty much everything on the menu and it's all fantastic.  If it's not the best burger joint in town, it's pretty close.  I don't see how anyone can be disappointed with this food.

Reviews.Author: R W.
Reviews.Content: AMAZING BURGERS, AMAZING FRIES. (I always order the #2 and sweet potato fries).My only complaint is that it gets so busy and you feel like you are sitting right on top of the people next to you.

Reviews.Author: Chad E.
Reviews.Content: More like 4.5I refuse to rate a place until I've been there a number of times, and now I feel I can actually give a consistent rating to DMK. I've been there half a dozen times from late afternoon to late evening and with a party of two to six and every single goddamn time the folks at DMK have been amazing. Sure, sometimes there is a wait and yes, burgers don't come out in four minutes, and oh-my-fucking-lord you can't order your burger to your desired doneness, but I honestly don't care at all. Their burgers are absolutely delicious without being over-the-top and their fries are phenomenal. I went after reading about them from Chicago Gluttons, and they still have the best review of DMK I've ever read.

Reviews.Author: Jared B.
Reviews.Content: Honestly don't like this place. You can't make your own burger and it's expensive. Fries are extra and also expensive. The burgers you have to choose from are not my taste. I go because other friends want to try it once they find out I live close to it but I've never enjoyed it. The only plus I have is that they serve Floyd's Gumball Head. Love that beer.  I've had better burgers at Kumas Corner or 5 guys.

Reviews.Author: Leah A.
Reviews.Content: I am absolutely shocked by the positive reviews of this place. I would never go back. I took 3 teenage girls for burgers and my bill was $62! Yikes... All the food was too salty; the place was too dark; the place was too noisy, and I had to ask every time I wanted a water refill.While the burgers tasted good they weren't worth $62...

Reviews.Author: Daniel G.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers, great beers, and very good fries.  Word is out though, so I would recommend going at a strange time after 9 or before 7.  As an example 7PM on a Saturday is usually at least a 45 min wait.

Reviews.Author: Rob M.
Reviews.Content: Love the food...the wait, not so much. Has one of the BEST turkey burgers and bison burgers I've ever had in my entire life!

Reviews.Author: Anna L.
Reviews.Content: I am wholeheartedly on the gourmet burger bandwagon. DMK knows how to make a darn good sandwich.I would try any burger on the menu-- maybe I should make this a new goal? The toppings are homemade, unique, and most importantly, really yummy. The best burger I've had there had chili-rubbed onion strings, blue cheese, and chipotle ketchup. The burgers are a good size, but not obscene. I've had truffle fries at a few places and the ones here are my favorite. Fries aren't included with your meal, which is odd for a burger place. Also, they have an interesting beer selection.The only (kind of major) complaint is that there's often a long wait to eat here, and the bar doesn't accommodate too many people hanging around to wait for a table. Also, it's really noisy.

Reviews.Author: Nimit P.
Reviews.Content: The Holy Guac-Aioli Burger and the Chorizo Burger are my favorites. Throw in the mac and cheese, hand cut fries, and anything from their rather generous beer selection and you have burger bliss on the north side. Positives are the food, service, beer selection, cozy vibe. Negatives are generally long wait times (especially on weekends), restaurant is small (good if you have table, not so cool if it's busy), and sometimes the host can be a bit disorganized. The Positives wildly outweigh the negatives at DMK, which is become one of our favorite burger spots along with Burger bar on the north side.

Reviews.Author: Christopher C.
Reviews.Content: Seat me at one of the dozen empty tables while I wait for friends. I might even buy more beer!The burger was underwhelming.  I love burgers, but I don't think that putting it on a Ciabatta roll really counts for anything.

Reviews.Author: Tony S.
Reviews.Content: I went to this place with my girlfriend on Friday (bad idea) and it was packed. We waited about 30 min to get a table but I was cool with that because I had been there before and wanted to have my gf try it. I love the food. If you love burgers and fries, this is the place to come. Not much of a selection of wines but a great selection of beer. I'll surely be going back.

Reviews.Author: Erica N.
Reviews.Content: First and foremost the food here at DMK was pretty amazing, my boyfriend got the #1 and we shared an order of the parmesan truffle fries and I ordered the Mac and Cheese #1. The mac and cheese was so good, it was perfectly gooey with a really good crust on top, and the large fries were plenty for 2 people to share. The drinks weren't bad either, bloody mary was pretty spicy and i got the Strawberry Fields, which I admit I wish it was a bigger drink for the $8 price tag, but it was good none the less.The food came out really quick, and the waitstaff seemed to be pretty friendly and actually normal (its kind of annoying to go into specialty restaurants like this and see big fake boobed girls wearing the lowest cut t-shirts possible and dudes in tight muscle shirts). For two meals, order of fries and two drinks our tab was $40 bucks, which I don't think is too shabby. I'd definitely recommend this place, and we plan on going back!

Reviews.Author: Andrew L.
Reviews.Content: For the second time in a week I've eaten at a new "burger bar," and I'm 2 for 2 with finding a great burger joint both home and away from home.  After some reservations fell through at a certain famous Chicago eating establishment, my wife and I were on a mission to find a new place to eat on a Saturday evening with little to no chance of an advanced reservation.  Being that we were heading to a concert at The Vic, we were pleased to realize that DMK (a place we'd been wanting to try anyway) was located right down the street from the theater.  We had about a 30-40 minute wait at around 5:30PM, so I can only imagine what the wait would be around 7-8.  Once seated, the service was great.  Whenever I visit a place that has a great selection of craft beer, I feel obligated to mention it and DMK definitely gets points for its terrific selection.  As far as the burgers go, they do not disappoint.  I went with the number one (basically a bacon cheddar burger with bbq sauce and onion) sans onion, and it was great.  Perfectly juicy and great quality meat.  I don't usually care for a lot of fixings on my burgers, so I was happy I didn't have to tell them to hold the lettuce & tomato & such.  My wife had a turkey burger which she also thought was great.  The parmesan fries were very tasty as well.  The only negative was that we were kind of looking forward to having a cookie ice cream sandwich as listed on their website, so we were kind of disappointed to find out they no longer offer them.  Otherwise, we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Author: Eldiva S.
Reviews.Content: They still have it! I heart this place- they should franchise these out - come to FL please!

Reviews.Author: Happiness L.
Reviews.Content: What a place!  Hurry and try the Girl Scout Mint Cookie Milk shake...so yummy and only there until the end of the month.   I ordered the delicious burger of the month topped with duck sausage, cheese, and onions soaked in something yummy...just forgot was it was.   Blue Cheese and bacon fries are rich and ok...I will try something else next time.   In addition to the yummy shake and burger the very best thing was the friendly staff.  The girl at the door and Dan at the bar were so kind and attentive.   The only recommendation is to offer more seating that is lower rather than higher.   Lower tables are in the back, just some people either have physical limitations where they can not get up so high or are uncomfortable at a higher level.   Offering more lower tables would be beneficial.    I am looking forward to coming out again with friends.  I was very happy here.

Reviews.Author: Shin M.
Reviews.Content: I got the Patty Melt, Parmesean Fries, and a Milkshake. Yummy!

Reviews.Author: Alf O.
Reviews.Content: Trendy ambiance, but doesn't take itself to seriously.  Good addition to the neighborhood.  Food could be a little bit tastier.  Best for an early 20s crowd.

Reviews.Author: Peggy G.
Reviews.Content: DMK makes my favorite burgers in the city.   My two favorite burgers are the #1 (aged cheddar with bacon and BBQ sauce) and the #2 (Chili-Rubbed Onion Strings, Amish Blue, Spicy Chiptole Ketchup).  I come here just as much for the burgers as I do for the fries.  I can't decide which one I love the most:: the parmesan truffle cream, the sweet potato fries with lemon aioli, or the blue cheese with smoked bacon fries.  I recommend you go with friends and get all three.  They have a great beer selection as well.  I highly recommend you check it out.

Reviews.Author: Tom M.
Reviews.Content: DMK is that special type of neighborhood hole in the wall, with a subtle facade barley indicating what type of establishment lies inside.  After a night of heavy drinking my Wrigleyville crew voted DMK as the best place to cure a hangover with burgers, fries, and more drinks (naturally).  Entering DMK you find yourself staring down the type of long retail slot you would see anywhere.  It's populated with just enough tables, and has one long bar on the side wall.  The staff was excellent, immediately bringing small glasses of steaming hot turkey chili to try; something we were thankful for as it was a biting 25 degrees outside.  Our server was helpful, very friendly, and got drinks/food/refills out to us promptly.  Overall, the amenities and staff were excellent.  The grub, of course, is what truly defines any eating establishment.  DMK did not disappoint in the slightest.  All burgers have multiple elements; principally the bun, patty, and toppings.  I got the #6 Chorizo, Guacamole, Sonoma Jack, Chipotle Aioli, Cilantro, Onions ($11).  The meat was just the right taste, size, and flavor.  The bread, I'm guessing they make in house, was perfect for a burger.  A soft, spongy consistency, with a niced baked crust that kept the sandwich from becoming a soggy mess like so many other burgers devolve into.  The price point is high, as $11.00 doesn't include fries.  DMK is not your everyday indulgence however, and should best be saved when you're hosting out of towners, or nursing a hangover.  It's an indulgence, a treat, a meal to savor.  I'll definitely be coming back to DMK; they've cooked up one Helluva concept.

Reviews.Author: Eric L.
Reviews.Content: mac and cheese is the best thing here. burgers are a 3. fries are a 3.  burgers and fries are sooooo easy to do better than a 3, yet the crowds don't demand it, so most kitchens don't do awesome. toast my bun. make my fries come out hot and crisp. you know how to do it. i undersatnd that it's hard to do at volume/scale. maybe it's just not economical to do it right?

Reviews.Author: Nikole H.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers and onion strings.  Sat at bar and service was amazing!  Bartender Andrew went out of his way to make sure our first visit was amazing!  Thanks!

Reviews.Author: Geoff M.
Reviews.Content: Kuma's for the non-skinny jean crowd with better fries and manageable decibel levels.

Reviews.Author: Jaimie S.
Reviews.Content: wow - this was the WORST experience I have ever received from a new restaurant!  I have been anticipating the opening of DMK for awhile now, I live just a few steps away and anxious for a new restaurant to open in the neighborhood.  However, I will NOT be going back - EVER and we didn't even eat.First off, the owner, Michael Kornick is extremely rude and didn't seem to want our business and didn't care when we left.  Sadly, I will not be visiting his other restaurant, MK because of this reason.  The atmosphere is very strange - is it a bar, restaurant, club???  The set up doesn't hold very many tables and the bar is really small with an odd counter jetting off the end - I am not sure what the benefit of this is??  You may have to eat with strangers because they have huge tables and will fill them up with 2 tops, 4 tops, etc. until the table is filled.  As I stated earlier, we didn't end up eating because of the horrible treatment we received from the owner.  Unfortunately, I will never experience the food here.  Save yourself a headache and go to The Corner just down the street on Diversey.

Reviews.Author: Robert B.
Reviews.Content: Lamb burger with greek fixings, mmm mmm good.

Reviews.Author: Brianna N.
Reviews.Content: The huz and I stopped in here yesterday after working up a monstrous appetite, post a morning of thrift shopping (and bar hopping).  We were rav-en-ous.  And when I hear the words "Burger Bar", I envision the wondrous concept at Mandalay Bay in Vegas - huge selction of meats, breads, accoutrements and fries...create your own dream burger concoction.  While this isn't the concept at DMK, the chefs have indeed created some remarkably simple and delicious flavor combinations.  We shared an order of the parmesan-crusted mac'n'cheese as an appetizer, and it was piping hot and cheesy delicious.  I had the #10 turkey burger with swiss, arugula, tomato, and dijon-aise and a small order of the sweet potato fries, all washed down with an Alagash White.  I thought the burger was perfection, the fries tasty (though it's accompanying sauce strange), and the beer impeccably cold, but small (could have sworn it was served in a stemless red wine glass).  Alex N., a sucker for anything with a fried egg and bacon, ordered the #4 and the Wisconsin Cheddar and Scallion fries...both yummy, though as Wisconsintes, we were in agreement that their cheddar was questionable.  Service was okay.  The whole place seemed a little too cool for school.  Nice beer selection and tasty food would probably bring me back next time I'm in the area.   Definitely worth a try!

Reviews.Author: Maya J.
Reviews.Content: I will keep this review plain and simple.  The burger was GOOD!  The fried pickles and friends were GOOD!  The service was EXCELLENT!  I am a stickler for good service.  I mean I absolutely abhor bad customer service.  The place was packed for a rainy and cold Wednesday, so we ended up sitting at the bar.  The bartender who took care of us was awesome.  Again, I am a sucker for good service.  I will be back.

Reviews.Author: Jeremy K.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers. Reasonably priced. Good atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: nate m.
Reviews.Content: Fantastic burgers, slaw, fries and frickles! And equally fantastic service. Recommend!

Reviews.Author: James W.
Reviews.Content: The food and service were great. There burgers and fries are delicious. The atmosphere is cool unless loud music bothers you. This place is my favorite burger spot in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: Amanda Z.
Reviews.Content: Went back to DMK on Sat for early dinner around 5:30p with a big group - half kids, half adults.  I didn't expect this place to be so packed that early in the evening!  However, the hostess/waiters were more than happy to accommodate us, and quickly, so that was great.  We had the #4 burger again cuz it's just the best thing ever, we couldn't resist, but we also got the #12 veggie burger which was by far the BEST veggie burger i have EVER eaten!  i couldn't believe how tasty it was!  The only think i didn't care for too much were the Wisconsin cheddar fries - the cheese was too thick or something, it just completely took over the flavor of the fries.  The sweet potato fries were yet again, sensational.  The mac n cheese #1 was a hit with all the kids (and pretty good to me too, although nothing special). Tried a fab hefeweizen at the recommendation of our waitress and loved it.  They are always good about recommending beers when you're unfamiliar or indifferent.  I will keep coming back to DMK and strongly recommend it to anyone for any occasion!

Reviews.Author: Lauren P.
Reviews.Content: my favorite burgers in chicago, particularly the #5 (bison burger with blueberry bbq sauce, goat cheese, and pickled red onions). the truffle fries and Wisconsin cheddar fries are a must! there are also tons of delsih beers and sometime if your lucky enough, you can get a drink card for a free beer next time your in!

Reviews.Author: Chanel W.
Reviews.Content: Amazing service and great food.  I sat at the bar and the bartender was very attentive and patient. He explained the different beers in detail and helped me make a great selection. I had the veggie burger and cheddar fries. Yummy.

Reviews.Author: Lauren F.
Reviews.Content: First off, they use Grass-fed beef which is the only kind I like to eat, so points right there. I got the #1 with bacon, onions, bbq sauce, and cheese. The bacon was well done, onions cooked to perfection, bbq sauce was not overwhelming and a tad bit if spice. The burger was cooked about medium which is what I like, but be aware they only cook it this way; no special ordering. No typical lettuce, tomotoes, onion on top and it didnt need it. Only slight complaint was the bun was a bit soggy but I didnt hold it against them. They make their own sodas; we got the lime which was really good, like a homemade sprite but better! We shared 3 small orders of fries which between 2 people was more than enough. Parm truffle was rich and yummy, sweet potatoes were sweet & crispy, and the cheese fries were good but Im not huge fan due to the soggy factor. If that wasnt enough we split a chocolate peanut butter cupcake. The frosting was so delish, not too sweet, and had good pb flavor. You can tell all of the food is fresh and high quality...a little pricey for burgers and fries ($17 per person) but totally worth it!!

Reviews.Author: Mrs. E.
Reviews.Content: While the atmosphere was fun and sleek, the burgers did not live up to the hype.  The flavor combinations are interesting, but the burgers themselves were too well done.  The fries were good but not notable in any way.

Reviews.Author: Theresa D.
Reviews.Content: I've been wanting to check out this place since it opened and finally I did last night.  The place was pretty busy and it was st. pat's weekend so I'm not sure how normally busy it was but it was a Saturday night. It was about 8pm when we got there and it was about a 30 minute wait for 2 people.  We waited by the bar and looked at the decor, pretty fancy for a burger bar.  The drink menu was pretty great, it looked like they had a thing for whisky, bourbon, rye, etc.  We waited for maybe 10-15 minutes and 2 seats at the bar opened up we took them.  I ordered a Crisin Honeycrisp Cider beer.  I'm weary of cider beers sometimes because they can be too sweet but this was one was delicious and served over ice.  And it gave me a buzz fast with a 6.3 alcohol content.  I ordered a turkey burger with swiss, arugula and dijoinaise and we ordered the fries with parmesan and truffle cream.  The burger melted in my mouth and followed by a fry dipped in truffle cream made my mouth and belly very happy.  I really can't wait to check this place out again and try their ice cream sandwiches.  Oh and the hostess and bartenders were very nice, so good food, great decor, great service gets this place a 5 star rating from me.

Reviews.Author: k E.
Reviews.Content: phenomenal sworn service!!!!!

Reviews.Author: Jonathan S.
Reviews.Content: Went back on March 21st with a group of 4 and everything we had was great. From the deep fried pickles to the fries to the burgers. Service was perfect this time...we drank a lot and she kept us full.

Reviews.Author: Mark G.
Reviews.Content: When dining out, I think it's natural to ask yourself after the meal, "Was this meal and experience worth my time and money?"  The answer is no.  Obviously everyone has different expectations and will respond differently to any given restaurant, but when it comes to going out for a burger there needs to be something special or the value has to be so enticing to cause you to pay for something that you can easily do at home.  With the backgrounds and resumes of the chef owner and his co-owner, I expected they would understand that basic idea and really give the reigning champions of special Chicago burgers - Kumas - a run for their money.  Not even close.  DMK offers you a 6oz burger for $8.  You don't order by temp; your burger comes out MW to W.  Why? My guess is that the patty's too thin for anything else.  Options like fries are ala carte.  Once you add a small order of fries at $2 you are looking at $10 for a burger.  In summary, don't waste your time and money going to DMK wondering if you're going to find another option for going out for a great burger.  DMK is Five Brothers with higher prices and alcohol.  I gave them two stars because I'm not too cruel and I'm trying to be realistic.  Two stars is suppose to be "meh, I've expierence better," and that seems appropriate.  I didn't walk out hating the meal - just didn't like it all that much.  It was adequate, service was fairly good, but the ambiance was a bit ill (lame music, character-less space with a bunch of cookie-cutter white people sitting around - sorry but I could be taken as one of those too sometimes - we could have been sitting in Naperville but maybe that's to be expected in LincolnPark/Lakeview).

Reviews.Author: Andrea E.
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to try this place. I was surprised how busy it was on a Tuesday night, especially since the weather was so sucky. One of my friends arrived before me so luckily, I did not have to wait to long for a table. I got the #3 a burger which has NY Pastrami, Grand Cru Gruyere Cheese, Sauerkraut and Leroy's Remoulade. It was very tasty, I couldn't really taste the hamburger, the pastrami overruled it, but it was really good pastrami. The burger Patties are thin but I thought the burger was filling. We also ordered fries for the table. 1 large order of the parm fries with truffle cream and 1 large order of the sweet potato fries (can't remember the sauce). Both dipping sauces were good, but the fries were extremely salty. Even my friends who like salt more than I do thought so. The rest of the table got another #3, the green chili and bacon burger, and the portabella mushroom burger. Thumbs up on the green chili burger, but my vegetarian friend was not impressed with the portabella burger. It is deep fried, so most of the time she just tasted grease and breading. Just because it's not meat doesn't mean you need to deep fry it! I bet it would have been a better burger if they just grilled the mushroom. The beer selection was good, the whole table enjoyed there selections. At $5-8 a bottle I don't think I would have more than 2 beers here. Now the service, it was pretty slow. Waitress would disappear a lot, and we had to ask for water, I hate that! Also I though the water had a weird metallic taste, almost like they got it out from a hose outback. We were debating having another beer here but the service was so slow we decided to go to another bar instead. If service improved and they expanded their menu a bit I would be interested in returning, but right now I'd rather check out other burger places in the city then come back here.

Reviews.Author: Elizabeth V.
Reviews.Content: Mediocre burgers, at best.  I was so hoping for better but didn't get it.  The burgers are small, not that well seasoned and the toppings are scant.  Overall they were dry and we were both still hungry.

Reviews.Author: Kyle D.
Reviews.Content: I just went to DMK for dinner a few nights ago and I would say it was alright.  The menu had some pretty cool choices on it, and my choice for the evening was a burger that the server described to me was a reuben on a burger.  Although, the burger was too small of a portion for 8 dollars, it was quite nice.  The burgers don't come with a side, so I ordered the regular fries and the were cooked and seasoned great, and were served with some pretty good, house made ketchup.  In addition to the fries, I also ordered a macaroni and cheese gratin dish with onions.  It was nicely cooked, but it seemed as though whoever cooked it forgot to add any salt.  It tasted completely unseasoned.  For my drink I ordered a house made blood orange soda.  I sent it back.  It didn't really taste like orange soda, or really anything else for that matter.  It was very bland.  I decided to  just stick with water.  Overall it was ok, but for a burger dinner, most people probably don't expect to spend 20 before tip.  I am one of those people.  I don't think I'll be returning, not because I didn't like it, but because there are plenty of burger places that are better in Chicago, and none of them require 20 bucks to grab some grub.

Reviews.Author: Johnnie F.
Reviews.Content: Given the look of the website and burgers on same - I expected an experience (food+ service) on par with the top burger places in town.  Forget it.  I sit at the bar and the bartender gives me this look like I'm bothering her for sitting at the bar (yeah it was 1130 - early - but she's the frickin' bartender for God's sake) ... when she tells me the burgers aren't cooked to order - this automatically triggers a red flag - why?  It means they are most likely frozen patties.  The "blue cheese" sauce on the burger I had was literally no different than "Ken's Blue Cheese dressing" out of a bottle - and I would have bet money that it, in fact, was.  Fries were boring ... every single thing about this place and the staff just spoke that they were more interested in yuckin' it up about their Friday night rather than do their jobs well.  OH, and of COURSE when it came time for me to pay my tab, the bartender broad was SUDDENLY all smiles and very nice to me.  Jesus.  Folks - there are better places to have burgers.

Reviews.Author: Philip P.
Reviews.Content: DANG MAMA! Parmesan truffle fries and a bison burger? Yes, please! Pretty loud but atmosphere has a good vibe and the staff is attentive. More than satisfied the bison burger craving we had!

Reviews.Author: John G.
Reviews.Content: This place is solid!  I have been here twice, and the second time was definitely better than the first.  Crowded, but the wait isn't bad, and you can grab one of the great craft beers they have on tap while you wait.  Had a burger with sauerkraut, NY pastrami, and an excellent remoulade.  My buddy and I shared some sweet potato fries which were solid! Also, the prices are very very reasonable.

Reviews.Author: David H.
Reviews.Content: The food and service was great.  I enjoyed their selection of items.  It is very very very loud, but I would go back.

Reviews.Author: Alan R.
Reviews.Content: Not sure why I didn't give it 5 stars but the food and drinks are awesome. It'd be nice if it was bigger but the food is worth waiting for.

Reviews.Author: Joe E.
Reviews.Content: Every loves a good burger... right?  DMK is a burger bar that was opened by two great chefs of the city.  This restaurant offers not only the grass-fed beef burger, but also some of the more exotic meats like lamb and bison.  I have also heard it has one of the best, if not the best, veggie burgers in the city.  Anyway,  I found this restaurant to be more of a gourmet burger bar... The toppings are unique, organic, or both.  The price tends to be a little steeper than others with the portions being significantly smaller and the sides at an a la carte price.  The atmosphere is definitely fun; there is a huge communal bar and a bunch of smaller tables.  It always seems very busy; even on Tuesday nights there might be a long wait.  Overall, the burgers are delicious enough to make DMK the talk of the city for a while now, but the price and portions are starting to scare people to the other burger joints in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: Donielle M.
Reviews.Content: Went there last night for the Bears game.  Beer was good.  I had both of the Pale Ales on tap.  Apps were good.  We had the fried pickles.  However, I don't understand how you can be a place that specializes in burgers, but only serve them one temperature -- medium well.  I couldn't eat mine because it was too well done.  There explanation was that it was much more efficient to serve them that way.  They had a lot of fancy toppings, but I would have rather just had the burger the temperature I wanted it.

Reviews.Author: Saahir K.
Reviews.Content: This place has the rare combination of great service, relaxed atmosphere, and amazing yet inexpensive food.  They serve $8 gourmet burgers and $2-3 specialty fries with a great beer selection.  Although I've heard it's often packed on weekends, we didn't have a problem getting a table at 9:30pm on a Saturday.  The waitresses were incredibly nice, the atmosphere was fun with music and enthusiastic parties but not too loud or crowded to carry on a conversation.  I'd highly recommend this place to anyone looking for a great burger and a good time in Chicago.

Reviews.Author: Terry H.
Reviews.Content: Well at last went to DMK last night for dinner. Burgers were great and loved all the sides, mac and cheese great.  Wait staff was great.  We are in our late 60's and do not love sitting on top of the people at the next table and also the noise level is horrible.  We had our 20 year old grandson and his date and even they complained about the noise.  Does the music have to be that loud?

Reviews.Author: Rach T.
Reviews.Content: Love. Watched Good Burger on tv this morning and had to have a cheeseburger. I like the thin patty better than super big Mondo burgers :) and their buns are great. Only down side is the creamy coleslaw needed salt, which is not on the table, and they were too busy to flag someone and ask. One more con, no fountain pop=no refils.

Reviews.Author: Tom I.
Reviews.Content: My buddy Drew works here and, though I hate to tell him this, DMK is a great place with awesome burgers. The mac and cheese is ridiculously good and every burger I've had here has been incredible. Great meat quality, many great burger choices, and they have a decent beer selection. My only advice: get the fried egg on whatever burger you get, makes it so much better. Stop in and ask Drew if you can see his unicorn tattoo.

Reviews.Author: John D.
Reviews.Content: Meh.  Nice combinations and decent fries with dipping sauces, but these burgers are for teenage girls.  They are tiny!!!!!  That is all I have to say about that.

Reviews.Author: Lisa C.
Reviews.Content: Best burgers and fries!  My favorites are deviled eggs, burger with green chilies, and truffle fries.  They also offer a great variety of beers.  There is always a long wait, so be prepared.  It's totally worth it though!!!

Reviews.Author: Amanda G.
Reviews.Content: I just went here and I didn't like it at all. The hostess was unorganized and we waited an extra 10 minutes while there were three empty tables, one already bussed. The waitress was fast, but the burgers were thin, bland and uninspired. I expected more, the burgers tasted like decent fast food burgers, I'd rather have gone to Five Guys. The whole place was loud, so much that I couldn't hear my companion. Overall the whole experience was mediocre and not worth the trip.

Reviews.Author: Lyn B.
Reviews.Content: I went with my husband for dinner, and we sat at the bar.  I loved the atmosphere here- it was like a really nice bar and grill.  Everything we ordered was good!  The burgers themselves were outstanding, as were the fries.  Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Author: jenni k.
Reviews.Content: burger and atmosphere were sub-par. the food: waitress didn't even ask how we'd like our burgers done. boyfriend's burger came out pink in the middle but he likes his meat well done. the bun. oh the bun was really sad. it was floppy and couldn't support the burger, even though the burger was not big at all. our burgers were just average, if even that. we had the winter greens salad to start and that was a decent salad. the atmosphere: super loud and so dark you couldn't read the menu. tables are wide, so if it's just two of you, you can't hear the other person from the other side of the table, especially over the obnoxiously loud music. the crowd there is super yuppie and lame.

Reviews.Author: SAW W.
Reviews.Content: Alright, so I am a all American burger lover. DMK was recommended by my boss so I had to check it out. My boyfriend and I went on a Sunday night and it wasn't crowded but it was full. Our waitress was very nice and helpful. The atmosphere was more of a sports bar but I was expecting a restaurant/grill environment. They have flat screen televisions and a bar. I got the regular burger and my boyfriend tried the bison burger. We got a side of Parmesan fries. The burger was juicy and flavorful however it was very thin. Ive had thicker pancakes. The bun was awesome. It looked big but it was as soft as cake. I had a bite of the bison burger and it was okay. Im not a fan of the sweet sauce that comes on it. The fries were good. I love ketchup and they didn't have regular ketchup. Their ketchup was spicy...that was a negative for me. They won't allow any substitutions to their burgers. The table next to us was pretty upset about that. Overall I would have to say the food was good but it definitely wasn't anything I would brag about. Oh yeah prices were average.

Reviews.Author: Leah C.
Reviews.Content: fried pickles and okra...you must order!  you won't regret!  promise!i can't quite pinpoint what they are battered in - it's not your typical onion ring or mozzarella stick coating.  it's almost panko...breadlike.  whatever it is, it's GOOD and not greasy!  oh yeah... they serve burgers here too!  i enjoyed my vegi burger - it was hearty and of the "mushy" type not "meaty".  it was topped with an eggplant slice which complimented it well and was a nice change from your usual tomato slice.  husband got a burger with egg and bacon and had nothing bad to say about it.  i struggled with the "saucer" that the burger was served on.  it was not a plate but a saucer as in "cup and saucer".  not sure if they were going for the tapas feel but they really need to be more forgiving with the mess we are sure to make.i'd like to try the alleged "fried green tomato burger" that i see on this menu floating around chicagoist.com/2009/10/1….  it was not [yet] available on the actual menu when dining in but the menu did also read something to the extent of "please no substitutions while we work out the kinks"...

Reviews.Author: Triphena W.
Reviews.Content: In a nutshell: fantastic burgers, magnificent french fries. Friends and I visited DMK Burger Bar this weekend, and everyone agreed this place was excellent. The burgers are well conceived and well executed. My favorites were the #1 burger with aged cheddar, charred balsamic onions, bacon, and bbq sauce as well as the #4 burger with roasted green chile, fried egg, bacon, and jack cheese. I would order either of these again. I like the buns DMK uses; they're soft but substantial, far from your conventional tasteless, spongy buns. The burgers aren't thick like Kuma's Corner, but I really enjoyed the crisp exterior achieved on these griddled patties. One friend ordered their cheeseburger with an additional patty and was very happy, but four of us thought our single patty burgers were nicely balanced between bun, meat, and toppings. We shared 3 large orders of fries and demolished them. The Wisconsin cheddar and scallion fries were delicious; however, the parmesan fries with truffle cream and sweet potato fries with lemon tobasco aioli were phenomenal. These fries are probably my favorite fries next to Edzo's Burger Shop (truffle fries and garlic parsley fries) and Longman & Eagle's. We also ordered the fried okra and fried pickles. The batter fell off most of the pieces. Skip. Saturday afternoon the restaurant was packed and started taking names for seating around 12:30pm. Despite every table (individual tables as well as communal tables) being occupied, the food came out within minutes of ordering. Everyone from families with toddlers to couples to groups of friends were eating at DMK Burger Bar. Easy street parking. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Author: Deb M.
Reviews.Content: Great food, great service, but the music is turned up so loud it is impossible to have any conversation at all with your lunch or dinner-mate. So go with someone who you don't want to talk to each other - at all. Even when the place is not crowded they crank up the music so loud  you cannot converse with the person sitting right across the relatively small table from you. When you ask them if they will turn down music slightly I think they actually turn up louder, so that does not work.

Reviews.Author: Chuck W.
Reviews.Content: Food was outstanding but atmosphere was horrible, unless you like it loud. It was so loud we could hardly hear each other talk.

Reviews.Author: Dan B.
Reviews.Content: I have been eager to try this place since I first read about it and I was hoping to be blown away. Needless to say I wasn't, but I did have an enjoyable experience nonetheless. The decor is modern and stylish without being over the top. The service was fantastic, and our waitress even offered a sample of the beer I was considering which is always a nice touch. I had the lamb burger which was unique and a great combination of flavors. I did think the patty was kinda small for $8 without fries, but the beef burger my buddy had seemed bigger so maybe it was just the lamb. We split the truffle cream fries and blue cheese bacon fries and both were stellar. If I had to choose one condiment for the rest of my life it would be that truffle cream, I find myself thinking about it and imagining that earthy creamy amazingness over and over again. All in all this is a great addition to the neighborhood and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Author: Izabella d.
Reviews.Content: this is a hard one folks -- as a burger bar.. it does not shine, but i had a great cesar salad, amazing french fries and a delicious milk shake. my main beef with the burger (sorry can't help my love of puns) is that the patties are on the small side. when i imagine a great burger from a non-fast food joint, im thinking thick juicy patty .. and here, you don't get that. you can always order a double - but the 2 patties can never equal the greatness/ juiciness of one bigger patty. we ordered the number 1 (double) and the greek lamb burger. the toppings had nice flavor, but it failed to compensate for the patty. the parmesan truffle fries were great, sweet potato were crispy and served with a citrusy mayo.. i would come back again -- but in times of real burger cravings,, you'll find me at Kumas...

Reviews.Author: andrew c.
Reviews.Content: Parmesan fries with Truffle cream??  Yes please.  Walking into DMK Burger Bar the decor was telling me  to expect an aloof hostess to ignore me for 5-10 minutes, then be bothered when I asked for a table for 2.  It was quite the opposite, I forgot this is not Los Angeles, the staff was extremely friendly and we were sat right away.  The menu has plenty of options, for all different palates and dietary restrictions.  Grass fed beef, Bison, Veggie, Salmon, Turkey, all looked very tempting.  As delicately as these burgers were crafted they are quick to make or suggest  substitutions... But who am I to tempt fate?  I went for the Signature burger, no substitutions.  Grass-fed Beef, Aged Cheddar, smoked bacon, balsamic glazed red onions and secret bbq sauce.  My only complaint was the burger was on the smallish side.  I could have easily eaten another one.  The fries were handcut and masterfully paired with a sauce to compliment their toppings.  A well paired IPA (the name of which has left me), made a great meal.

Reviews.Author: Sarah E.
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to be a substitute for Kumas since the wait was too long but I had no idea that I would be so disappointed. I get the whole $8 hamburger thing since the beef is grass fed etc but I didn't even get to order it medium rare. When the hamburger came, it was like a thin patty like McDonald's and came with butter pickles, iceberg lettuce, onions, and 2 tomato slices. The bun was very flimsy and easily fell apart. This was sans ketchup and mustard so I had to wait like 5 minutes to get my condiments. In addition to that, I had to wait like 10 minutes to get a refill on my drink. My boyfriend was not happy with be served a diet coke in a can and then us being charged like $1.80. If I lived close to this place or was visiting an ailing relative at Masonic I might consider going back but I wouldn't recommend this place to anyone and I'm kind of pissed off that someone recommended this to me.

Reviews.Author: Lindsay A.
Reviews.Content: Went to DMK Burger Bar around 6pm tonight with 5 people.  We immediately got seated (at sort of a small table for 5 people) near the back of the restaurant and got to work looking at the menu.  I was with 4 people from new mexico who were dually impressed that there was Roasted Hatch green chile on one of the burgers (apparently this is some super authentic stuff.)  We ordered off the extensive beer menu, then turned our sights on the excellent burgers that were zooming past our hungry eyes to nearby tables.  I had seen a picture of the veggie burger in my tasting table email and knew I had to have it... i'm a sucker eggplant, and this burger has a big ole honkin slice of it right on top of the burger.  Boyfriend was pretty miffed that at a BURGER joint they didn't ask him how he wanted his burger cooked, and I mean come on... that is pretty ridiculous.  When he finally got his burger, it was WELLLLLL well done... i'm sure thats not how Michael Kornick or Sir David Morton had envisioned their burgers being served. If I had ordered an actual burger I would have made sure to mention that i wanted it medium rare, but I always do that anyway.  The tastes on the Green Chile burger were excellent together, very spicy and yummy... if only that burger had been cooked right.... ho boy. I'll give them a "we're two weeks old" pass on that.  Next time I go in I'm deffffffinitely trying on one of the milkshakes, which they mix to perfection on a super old milkshake machine.  All in all it was a great experience... we'll definitely go back as I imagine this place will keep getting better!

Reviews.Author: Nick C.
Reviews.Content: My experience at DMK was a very good one. I had planned on eating lunch at Kuma's that day with my girlfriend and her two sisters, but the girls were not ready on time, and by the time we arrived at Kuma's, there was a solid 2 hour wait. I brought up the idea of giving DMK a shot, it had just opened, so I figured there wouldn't be much of a wait, not to mention it is only a 5 minute drive from Kuma, so we gave it a shot. We arrived at DMK and we were seated right away. I cannot remember our waitresses name, but she was awesome. They had a great beer list, which she knew inside and out... I went with a Russian Imperial Stout that was very good. We were trying to figure out which of the fries to order when I cam up with the only logical choice, order every one of them and take advantage of the small and large portion sizes, and we did. All of the fries were very good, but the best were either the cheese fries (I cant believe it either, I usually don't enjoy cheese fries) or the sweet potato fries, the best sauce was the truffle sauce by far. The only fry I wouldn't order again were the blue cheese fries... they are very very blue cheesy and a bit overwhelming. I only had two or three and they were great, but my palate couldn't handle any more than that. Now onto the center of attention, the burger. I went with the classic burger, but added a fried egg. It was excellent, and the bun held up well considering how juicy the burger was.  The girls all order more exotic burgers, and they all enjoyed them very much. DMK is great burger place and I would definitely go back... the atmosphere alone makes it worth the trip, not to mention the great burgers and fries.

Reviews.Author: Chi N.
Reviews.Content: seriously amazing are the mac and cheese and the espresso milk shake at DMK!

Reviews.Author: Chris C.
Reviews.Content: Burgers were good but not great. Beer list was very good. Nice atmosphere, very friendly servers, music a bit too loud for conversation with a group.

Reviews.Author: Jen P.
Reviews.Content: parmesan fries are a must!!  wait for a table was long...so we ate at the bar.  bartender was super nice, made us a chocolate milkshake on the house.  :)  and they sponsor really cool community fund-raising activities for different causes.  will definitely go back!

Reviews.Author: Gary O.
Reviews.Content: I've been here twice now, and both times the burger (tthe #8) and the cracked sea salt fries were fantastic. the food actually seemed better the second time around. The waitress tells you that the burgers are served medium, slightly pink in the middle. When it comes to ground beef, I want it cooke medium-well at the very least (don't like undercooked pink ground meat). Both trips here I ordered my burged well done, and they had no problem cooking it a little long. I went on a Saturday night around 7pm, so it was a little crowded and I had to wait about 20 minutes for a table, but nothing unusual. The service is good and the food is great. It's probably the best burger I've had in Chicago. I can't compare it to Kuma's Korner (the place everyone says is the best burger in the world) because I have tried to go there twice and didn't feel like waiting. But this didn't stop me from writing a review of Kuma's so please read that too. My one complaint about DMK is that they commit one of my huge pet Peeves, and that is serving CANS of Coke instead of a fountain Coke. If I wanted to drink a can of Coke, I would go to Jewel and buy a 12-pack and drink it at home. So DMK if you're reading your Yelp reviews, PLEASE get a fountain soon! Oh yeah, they also have a good beer selection. Well, only six on tap, but many different varities in the bottle. It's one of the few places that serves Grand Teton Sweetgrass beer, which I love. Anyway, good service, a GREAT burger, and good beer selection, and right next to the Brown Line Wellington stop. I will be returning there soon.

Reviews.Author: Nick C.
Reviews.Content: good burger

Reviews.Author: Anthony M.
Reviews.Content: The burger was ok. Nothing to rave about. I love a good burger but these were just above average.

Reviews.Author: Patrick R.
Reviews.Content: If I wrote the review right after I went there, I would have given it a 4. But since then I've had better. Really, it's a 3 1/2. Their fry selection is awesome and their burgers are good - but there are definitely better out there. If I lived near here, I'd be there all the time. But it's not worth making a trip for. Not that I'm one of those people that gives bad reviews because some place is far from me. But there are places you go to multiple times because it's great. And there are places you go to multiple times because it's good and convenient.

Reviews.Author: johnny b.
Reviews.Content: good burger but stick to basics

Reviews.Author: C C.
Reviews.Content: Good one to try.  Yes, it's trendy these days to make gourmet burgers so that's a little annoying, but this restaurant is better than the grey-ness of the 'in' crowd.  Lots of options of burgers (of course!), but also turkey, salmon, veggie, and mushroom options as well as about five types of fries, grilled cheeses, macs and cheese, salads, shakes, fried okra and other oddities, which I appreciate the creative touches.  I even had a rhubarb cocktail complete with a spoonful of rhubarb jam on the side- I felt like I was in my Gram's garden (minus one star; it was $11=overpriced).

Reviews.Author: John R.
Reviews.Content: Came here on a Friday night in February with a friend. Waited about 90 minutes for a table and ended up leaving. It wasn't even that busy.  I have no problem with waiting. I've been to plenty of places that are more popular and more busy and not had to wait that long (i.e. Chicago Pizza & Oven Grinder, Piece). The three hostesses looked lost.

Reviews.Author: D P.
Reviews.Content: Great burger.  Juicy with a variety of toppings.   Loved the parmesan fries

Reviews.Author: Brian R.
Reviews.Content: This place is fine, but frankly I don't understand the hype.  Everything was good, but there was nothing I am clamoring to get back for.  Fried okra was ok, cheese fries were ok, onion rings were good, mac and cheese was rather disappointing; my burger was decent, but not more than that.  Try it to check it off your list, but don't wait for too long and don't set expectations too high; it's a decent burger from a bar, but not more than that.

Reviews.Author: R. S.
Reviews.Content: Tonight was my second time eating at DMK Burger. Our server was friendly and efficient (and also beautiful, but don't harass her, slimeballs). I had the #6 burger (it has chorizo and guacamole, so I was sold) and we shared a side of fried okra and dill pickles. I highly recommend the burger, my favorite so far. Everything was hot and fresh. My only complaint is not enough breading on the pickles and okra. I love the lightness of the breading but it was missing in several places. The Wisconsin cheddar and scallion fries are so yummy and seem to be the most delicious looking of the fries, from what I can tell. The blueberry and lemon soda was tasty, but not enough blueberry flavor. The basil pineapple soda I had last time was unbeatable. They have an extensive craft beer list and some interesting sodas.
