Overall, their food is delicious and thoughtful and the pricing is just right. I love that you can get small orders of the fries or a larger order for sharing. More places should do this! Great service with a smile (real ones, not fake and annoying) and it seems like the staff likes working there. Great for a casual date before seeing a show at The Vic. I shall return with more friends!

Reviews.Author: cathy c.
Reviews.Content: Went back again last night, had the lamb burger with tsatsiki, feta and Greek salad.  OMG, perfect combo of flavors.  And the sweet potato fries were terrific.  Can't wait to continue to work my way through the menu.

Reviews.Author: Mikie B.
Reviews.Content: Not sure this was worth the 45 minute wait. The blood orange soda I had while waiting was awesome, but as a lot of other people noted, all burgers at this burger specialty restaurant come medium well. The thin, overcooked hamburger patties make DMK rival Steak and Shake, and that pretty-well ruined it for me.

Reviews.Author: Lizz Y.
Reviews.Content: Good friendly service, amazing parmesan truffle fries, and great burgers (turkey and beef)... what more do you need to know? btw I like the burger with an egg and green chilies (number 4 I think?)

Reviews.Author: Tony G.
Reviews.Content: Finally tried DMK a couple weeks ago and I wasn't disappointed.  They have a great beer selection and many different burgers to choose from.  I would recommend this spot to anyone looking for a great burger and a beer.  I actually liked it so much we got takeout a week later.  The number 2 is my fave.

Reviews.Author: Jen H.
Reviews.Content: I have been wanting to try this place for a long time... After finally making it here I was disappointed. The burgers were okay but there are so many other burger places in the area. The blue cheese fries were pretty good but in my opinion a sandwich should come with a side when you are already paying $8. Next tine I think I'll wait for Kuma's!

Reviews.Author: marisa f.
Reviews.Content: delicious burgers and unique fries.  Deserves a great rating

Reviews.Author: Mary M.
Reviews.Content: DELICIOUS FOOD! I tried every one of the fries over the few times I have been there and the parmesan truffle are my favorite.  The guacamole burger is to die for if you like a little bit of spice.  The problems with this place is that they do not take reservations and the lines can be very long, especially on Friday or Saturday nights.  They really could fix that by adding more tables but I guess that is not of their concern.  Also, we were sitting at the bar drinking while waiting for a table, and the bartender (politely) asked us if we could move so that a couple could eat at the bar.  That turned me off a bit.  Overall, the food is delicious and a must-try for anyone that likes burgers.

Reviews.Author: Mitchell S.
Reviews.Content: great food, awesome service. always so so busy! but love going here.

Reviews.Author: Rachel N.
Reviews.Content: I still love DMK!! Soooo good - every single time I go in or order something to-go.

Reviews.Author: genevieve c.
Reviews.Content: Yum- if I lived in chicago I would get so fat with this place around. I loved the gauc-aioli burger- very different- I think the chorizo is what makes it so fantastic. I also had the portabello and blue brie burger which was also delicious- I am not usually a huge burger fan when they put so much stuff on it you can't get it in your mouth, but here the bread and topping ratio was just right. The fries are also great- my favorite was the sweet potato. Then they also have a great list of draught beers and some amazing cocktails. I didn't even think I liked gin anymore but am now a fan of the bubble gin and madame genevas rhubarb delight. It always seems packed in here but I have always sat at the bar and found the bartenders to be very attentive even when it is crazy busy.

Reviews.Author: Anne A.
Reviews.Content: The food was fine, not fabulous. However, the restaurant was SO LOUD that I couldn't wait to get out of there. I had to scream at the person across the table from me until my throat was sore. So if you want to chat with someone you haven't seen in a while, this is NOT the place to go.

Reviews.Author: Brendan F.
Reviews.Content: This is a really solid spot for such a new place. The burgers were great (even if they weren't temped) the sides, not as much but ok. Nice small production bar selection. I'm not sure what has yuppie couples bringing young kids and strollers to a bar, but be warned this is not a child- free zone.

Reviews.Author: Jen W.
Reviews.Content: Went here on Tuesday night and really loved it!  Great atmosphere - love the beer selection and the burgers were really creative and tasty.  Price point is perfect too.  Will definitely be back - and love that it is in Lincoln Park and not downtown!

Reviews.Author: laura e.
Reviews.Content: Loved everything here!  Big salad has really fresh ingredients, beef and turkey burgers are delicious.  Shakes are super rich and thick.  I will be back for more soon!

Reviews.Author: Jason B.
Reviews.Content: Great Tasting food, Excellent Service, Great Beer List, all for an affordable price.  One of my favorite places in the city.

Reviews.Author: Jeff C.
Reviews.Content: I have now been to DMK Burger Bar twice.  I'm going to make a bold statement.  This is the BEST burger I have ever had, and it is the BEST burger place around!.  Their fries (and the various combinations of toppings for them) are absolutely outstanding!  The mac 'n cheese they offer is equally amazing!  To top that off, they were playing the Beatles the entire time I was there the first time, and more excellent music the next.  I LOVE THIS PLACE!! Please do yourself a favor and check this place out.  You will LOVE it too!!

Reviews.Author: Nick C.
Reviews.Content: Let me just start by saying I really really wanted to give this place 5 Stars. The food at DMK is always great. Every burger I have had has exceeded my expectations and the drinks are just as great. The Martinis are dangerous in the fact that they are so smooth that you might end up drinking far more than you should have.... if you have to work the next day. Food aside the reasoning for the 4 stars was purely based on the fact that when I was just in there recently, unfortunately so was the General Manger. From the minute we walked in and sat at the bar he was getting every server there in a tizzy. "Who stacked these cups?",  "Read the drink recipes", "Make that again!" I hate being in an establishment where the micromanaging person in charge creates a bad environment. Abrasive management aside, the place is amazing, even when being ruled by an iron fist. Food and service A++

Reviews.Author: Alec T.
Reviews.Content: This is my first review simply because my experience here was excellent regarding our waitress.  I ordered the michelada, which was good considering it's not a Mexican restaurant.  The other person I was with ordered a beer, but she forgot to bring it, we forgot to remind her about it until she reminded us when she brought the bill.  She did not charge us and apologized profusely, while giving us both 2 cards good for a free draft beer and let us have a dessert item on the house!  It was incredibly kind of her.  Oh, and the burgers and fries are excellent too.

Reviews.Author: Hilary G.
Reviews.Content: Went with 2 friends on a Sunday night. We had to wait 10 minutes for a table. We read the online reviews on here before we went and I have to report that the reveiws were correct, it is a little loud in there. The burgers were good, but not amazing you know? I mean I've had some good burgers and these burgers were mediocre. The ideas surrounding them like the toppings and flavors were excellent, but the burgers themselves....so so. I know I know, these burgers are healthier like pasture fed or something of that sort. But still...you get what I'm saying. I used to live in this neighborhood right by Sheffield and Wellington and I think this place is a little pricey for it's location. I think you are paying for location not necessarily for food you know? I mean Kirkwood is just a few store fronts down and that's a sports bar, but they have good beer selection and good food. I would say...slightly overpriced for what you yet, but definitely okay for a sunday dinner.

Reviews.Author: Vernon P.
Reviews.Content: Know this going in, DMK is more of a upscale bar than a restaurant. Lets just call it an upscale bar that happens to sell good food. I got there expecting an experience like that of an upscale burger restaurant but instead found myself in the midst of a type of place I was trying not to go to. It can be a family oriented establishment in the daytime. When I got there, it was just before sunset and there were a few families there at the tables, enjoying a meal together. I was hoping for a better restaurant experience as this place is billed firstly as a burger bar but don't be fooled, this place is primarily a bar. As for the burgers, they were as advertised, very tasty. The place was packed and if the other reviews are any indication, the place is always packed. There are better places to get a burger in Chicago but if you are craving some good booze with some really good food, then this place is kinda hard to beat.

Reviews.Author: Mike T.
Reviews.Content: Marinated Portabella, Blue Brie, Griddled Scallions, Dijonnaise with Parmesan Truffle Cream Fries....Mmmmmm and worth the wait!

Reviews.Author: d b.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers and inventive french fry options. The space was a little tight and I wouldn't go if you want a table without reservations.  It's not a sports bar but it has tv's

Reviews.Author: Fahad A.
Reviews.Content: Heavenly. The Beef patties look, smell, and taste heavenly!

Reviews.Author: Lulu L.
Reviews.Content: This flexitarian will be back to get my 3rd burger of the year fairly soon. Sorry Mr. Cow but you are delicous.  I had the plain old burger (#8) and my husband got the #4 which ended up being a little too spicy.  Truffle fries were o.k, and cheese fries were too rich. Will probably try the sweet potato fries and salt n pepa fries next time.

Reviews.Author: Seth G.
Reviews.Content: Burger was very good and was a good portion. I was not too stuffed to move after eating it, but that being said I thought $10 for a burger of that size and no fries is a bit much. I had the Parmesan, Truffle Cream Fries were also delcious. Our waitress was attentive and went out of her way for us. So the food and service was good, but not for the price. My other issue is the pretentiousness of the whole place. I hated the atmosphere.

Reviews.Author: Dan K.
Reviews.Content: The food was modern, slightly unexpected, fantastic and inexpensive. The entire staff was friendly and helpful. The 20 something hip professional crowd was delightful as well. It is my new favorite restaurant!

Reviews.Author: LeAnn L.
Reviews.Content: I went at a pretty quiet time and the service was very fast and the burgers were super delicious! It is a bit pricey, but stay away from extras and you can get out of there on a decent budget.

Reviews.Author: Christine K.
Reviews.Content: DMK has really great burgers, fries, macaroni and cheese, shakes, and last but not least the cocktails!  We all really liked everything we tried, I think?  I can only assume because everything was eaten, actual conversation was difficult.  Really do we need the music to be that loud in a hamburger bar?  Went with my husband, 18 year old son and 3 of my son's friends.  ALL said it was too loud, not hearing that the other people had already said the same thing.

Reviews.Author: Alisha A.
Reviews.Content: Sides are decent and the toppings for the burger are good.  The one area that leaves you wanting more is the actual burger.  It's pretty small (6oz) by restaurant standards, especially if you are going out specifically for a burger.  They only offer this one size and one particular way of ordering it.  If they want to opt for this churn and burn style, they shouldn't be touted as a burger bar.  Unless they make these improvements and offer a few more things on the menu, I don't see myself or others going there repeatedly.  Really sorry to say this as I was so excited for a new, hip restaurant in the area.

Reviews.Author: Jeff D.
Reviews.Content: The blue cheese and bacon fries were amazing.  Great beer list.  My major complaint is the burger:  fantastic creations, but not cooked to order.  Why waste such wonderful ideas on well done meat?  I asked for my burger medium rare and the waitress informed me that all of the burgers are thinner and cooked the same.  My burger was tasty, but would have been 10x better if it was cooked to order.  If I wanted a medium-well to well-done burger, I'd go to Five Guys.  I expected more from a Morton-MK collaboration (both amazing restaurants).  Unless they change, I will be going to The Counter and Rockit, where I can get my burger medium rare.

Reviews.Author: Annie H.
Reviews.Content: Delicious food and excellent service. My friend and I loved our own burgers. Mine was the hamburger with green chile, a fried egg, jack cheese and bacon, and hers was the lamb burger with the olive tempenade and feta. We shared an order of fries with parmesan and truffle butter, delicous, although we could have done with the smaller portion and been just as satisfied. We both appreciated the extensive beer list, (what's better than a delicous burger with a refreshing beer?) As a former server, I appreciated the attentive and friendly service, without feeling as though she was hovering. I will definitely go back there to try another burger and the sweet potato fries!

Reviews.Author: Katie L.
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went her on a weekday night around 8:30ish. I walked into put our name down while he parked the car, except I couldn't find a hostess. So I walked to the back, then back to the front, then to the back, then to the front again, until finally I spotted someone with a clipboard and gave her my name. A few min later spots opened up at the bar. We sat down and decided to eat there, except none of the bartenders acknowledged us. So about 8 min later we decided to get up from the bar, since we still hadn't been acknowledged. Luckily a few min later our table was ready. We ordered the #1 and #2 burger, the truffle fries and some mac and cheese. Everything was good, but nothing was as good as I had expected, or good enough to go back and risk being ignored again.

Reviews.Author: Carlucci R.
Reviews.Content: We have been making our way around the city, searching for the best burger and DMK has risen to the top of our list. We loved this place! Went on a Sunday around 3 and it was not too crowded. Out waitress was very friendly and knew her stuff. The patrons were also very friendly. The best part was the food. Outstanding burgers! The bun alone is to die for but the combination of ingredients is unlike any other I have ever experienced. I had burger #1 and would get it again. Would like one right now actually. And the fries...(my eyes roll back just thinking about them). Try the sweet potato and the truffle oil parm. fries. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Joe K.
Reviews.Content: please please trust me when i say this.this place is NOT like kumasDMK is the opp. of Kuma. 1- burgers are the bomb. they actually taste good.      kumas? its big ill give them that but its no where near as tasty as   DMK's    pick any burger, they all taste great2- plenty choices of beers, i suggest you avoid dragons milk, even tho the name might tempt you to try it once.. tastes a bit like irish carbomb w a lot of jameson esp when its not as cold... its ok just too strong of a beer for my taste :)3- side dishes, omg. SO GOOD    try their mac and cheese w bacon and grilled onions    fries w blue cheese and bacon, truffle friesif you go w a friend order the sides and share, you wont regret iti only wish there was another location, sometimes parking can be a pain but its def worth trying. if you were not a fan of kumas and didnt buy into the hype, give DMK a chance.avg tab for burger, side and soda will run you a little less than $20 w tip.i also suggest you go on a weekday, wait will be around 15mins? weekends? mmm i wouldnt want to find outdont wait 2hrs to eat at kumas!!! :)  EAT HERE instead!!!you wont be dissapointed

Reviews.Author: Meg K.
Reviews.Content: The burgers were pretty good as were the deviled eggs appetizer. They also have a good beer selection. The thing it's hard not to compare the DMK and Kuma's and Kuma's wins hands down. For people in Lincoln Park/Lakeview, DMK is far superior than The Counter on Diversey, so if you want to stay in the neighborhood, go to DMK. If you want to venture away from Lincoln Park/Lakeview, go to Kuma's.

Reviews.Author: E G.
Reviews.Content: Didn't realize until the burgers came that the server hadn't even asked how we'd like them cooked.  How is that possible?  Of course they were totally well done, and not how I and most people would like their burgers.  Also the shape of my burger was appalling.  It was very thin and in 2 separate small patties that didn't even begin to cover the bun. I really couldn't believe it for a place that advertises itsself as a burger joint.  On a positive note, the fries and mac and cheese were very good, but since you go for the burger, it gets a low review.

Reviews.Author: Tom B.
Reviews.Content: I went there early on a Thursday evening (6:30) and the place was half full. I sat at the bar until the person I was there with met me. Nice selection of beer. Sat down and was promptly served. Ordered the number 4 - green chile, fried egg, bacon and pepper jack cheese. The burger hit the spot. Not too big, not too small. We also had the sweet potato fries - my favorite because of the spicy aioli that came with it. We also tried the Wisconsin cheddar fries which were very good. All in all, good service, good burger, happy customer. If this was here when I lived in the area, I'd probably go there once every 2 weeks.

Reviews.Author: Brandon K.
Reviews.Content: Parmesan/Truffle cream fries are delicious and DMK is worth going back to just for those.  The burgers were ok but not special, definitely better than fast food but not as good as, say, The Counter.

Reviews.Author: Jaz B.
Reviews.Content: Delicious Burgers! I am not too much of a red meat fan but an occasional burger is always delish! I went with a couple of friends and will definitely go back.  I had a turkey burger w/ smoked swiss, tomato, arugula and dijonnaise with a side of sweet potato fries. It was so good, very filling, the meat was well seasoned and simply amazing.  The fries were good, that is if you like sweet potatos, if not stick to their sea salt and black pepper fries which are delightful!  I couldn't resist and had to take a bite of my friend's burger, she ordered the triple DMK burger---AMAZING! Service was great, very nice waitress, I cannot remember our glasses ever being half empty.  The only thing I did not like too much was that we had to sit at the bar since the wait was around 45 minutes to an hour.  The place itself is not so big, a bit loud, be prepared to yell so the waitress can hear you....but the food is so worth it! Parking wise...take the train or bring quarters for metered parking. Four stars just because I was yelling to order and couldn't really carry on a conversation with my friends since it was so loud.  Great burgers, you won't be sorry!

Reviews.Author: Tony L.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers and fries, the truffle fries are amazing just like the ones at their higher end restaurant MK.  They also have a great selection of beers.  My only complaint would be that the music was way too loud, I was barely able to hear the people sitting across from me.  If your an older person or have a hearing issue your not going to be able to hear a thing.  The decor is very simple.  All in all though the burgers are great as are the fries and I would for sure go back.

Reviews.Author: Jen C.
Reviews.Content: Went to DMK on a Sunday afternoon after viewing a football game at a nearby bar.  The place was dead - we were surprised after hearing such good things from our friends about the food...but we were not disappointed with the grub, however the atmosphere was lacking.  I had the #4 and my husband the #8 (both phenomenal), with chili rubbed onion straws (yum), and fries with wisconsin cheddar and scallions (fine, but would not get again).  I am happy to read the other reviews on the website because it sounds like it get busier in the evenings but when we were there, I couldn't help but thinking that the atmosphere was aweful and that DMK needed to choose between being a bar and a restaurant to survive.  I will look forward to going back one evening for dinner when perhaps the crowd picks the atmosphere up a little bit - although may be then yearning for our slow Sunday afternoon when we could hear each other talk and didn't have to wait for a table.   BTW, the peanut butter shake is HEAVEN.

Reviews.Author: andrew s.
Reviews.Content: I moved in around the corner and had read about this place a couple months ago, so i decided i would try. great beer selection. good burgers but they were a thinner style which was not what i was suspecting. fries were bomb. Verdict: they had me a beer and cheese. That really all i left remembering.

Reviews.Author: melinda h.
Reviews.Content: Dmk has the best burgers in chicago and awesome awesome fries, especially the sweet potato.  Can you just turn down the music?  Please?

Reviews.Author: Mary Jo M.
Reviews.Content: Yum Yum Yum!  We went here on a Monday night and had no wait.  Service was prompt and friendly.  Great selection of craft beers from local/regional breweries that you won't find at every place.  We tried several of the fries and I had the turkey burger with a Crispin Hard Cider.  The bun was amazing, the burger was on the thinner side. The Mac and Cheese wasn't fabulous but the shakes were.  Great selection of classic 70's rock- a bit loud but I'll be back.

Reviews.Author: MR. F.
Reviews.Content: just ok!

Reviews.Author: Reva l.
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place!  It was busy for 5:30 (which is good), but seating was cramped since we needed a high chair.  The milk shake was wonderful, truffle parmesan fries were great, burgers and mac and cheese were really good too.  My husband was impressed with the beer menu, but they didn't have wine.  The server was very good with my son.  I would go back!

Reviews.Author: Nyuu M.
Reviews.Content: Great burgers. Didn't expect it to be as good as it was. The truffel fries and the sweet potato fries were amazing. Place is a little small and not many tables but worth the wait.

Reviews.Author: Shayna W.
Reviews.Content: 1 star off for eating there several times before someone tells me that the fries are cooked in beef fat, so a word of warning to all you awesome vegetarians and vegans. It would have been 5 because the portobello burger is so delicious that my coworkers are annoyed at how often I want to get lunch from here.

Reviews.Author: Jim M.
Reviews.Content: I've gone here a couple time and am a huge fan of their burgers and specialty fries so far. The first time I had the BBQ burger and then just recently had the green chili burger with a fried egg and bacon. Both were amazing. The burger itself isn't thick but it goes well with the toppings and bun (which also doesn't dominate the burger). The fries were great. Eating with friends we've tried them all. The Parmesan fries in particular were my favorite. The place is not well lit but it's setup well and probably doubles as a bar at night. We felt a bit rushed eating there since there were people waiting to get seated both time we were there. Waitress just brought over the check after we finished eating and didn't ask if we were finished ordering and didn't offer another beer or refills of our water (both empty). Overall a great place to eat though!

Reviews.Author: loves f.
Reviews.Content: Burgers are like crack for me.....this is the best burger I have had since I left LA.  Juicy, well seasoned, DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!  I didn't want my experience to be over so I ate the second half of my burger slowly.  I can't wait to go back there.  This is the only place that can rival Juicy Burger & 8oz Burger Bar in LA.  Yes i've been to Kuma's but this is more of my speed (not really into to death metal music while I dine).

Reviews.Author: Dave K.
Reviews.Content: TWO BROTHER'S DOMAIN DUPAGE! That alone is almost enough for a perfect review. But ther burger was a little bit on the small side. I got the Santo burger which was topped with Italian beef and mozzarella, Delicious. The ONLY reason they don't get 5 stars is because I like a big, thick, meaty burger, and DMK wasn't.

Reviews.Author: K L.
Reviews.Content: Loud and packed... be prepared to wait.  Great burgers & fries.  Not for the health nut!

Reviews.Author: Julie B.
Reviews.Content: Went here the other night after hearing great things.  I thought it was okay, nothing special.  The bison burger was a little plain, and the truffle fries aren't cooked/tossed in truffle oil, they just come with a truffle aioli.  My friend said the veggie burger was excellent, but next time I'm going back to Burger Bar at North/Clybourn, which has amazing burgers.  And the best truffle fries I've had in Chi are at Big & LIttle's.

Reviews.Author: R J.
Reviews.Content: The burgers are OK.  The fries are good.  I expected higher quality and more quantity for the price.  I prefer 5 Guys.

Reviews.Author: Steve L.
Reviews.Content: The burgers were just ok for a burger bar. Selection was so so as well. There are too many good burger spots to go to, wouldn't wait for a table here again.

Reviews.Author: Sean C.
Reviews.Content: Love the sweet potato fries!  Burgers are great.  You can really tell the difference when you eat grass fed beef.  The restaurant does get quite loud, though.  Usually have to get takeout because we have small children.  Great spot.

Reviews.Author: Wyatt H.
Reviews.Content: The food is phenomenal and the fries are incredible as well. Even the items that sound questionable like the bison burger (comes with pickled red onions, goat cheese and blueberry bbq sauce) are incredible. Im convinced pretty much anything on the list is at least good (i hear the veggie is fire). All their specialty fries are tasty and they have some killer sweet potato fries. The  beer selection is pretty good. I wish they had more drafts but the quality of selection compensates for the lack of quantity. The service here is absolutely wonderful and generous. As a matter of a fact the reason why I got to try the bison burger was because I had expressed how interested yet hesitant I was about the meal. I ended up ordering the #1 instead and she brought it out to us anyhow... on the house! That servers name was Austen and she was such a nice girl. I also had another server recently named Kelly who noticed it was my birthday and gifted me a beer. The service here is great and the food is right up there with the service. This place serves up the best burgers in Lakeview. Do not sleep on DMK... you're missing out.

Reviews.Author: Jennifer B.
Reviews.Content: The staff is great and the burgers are excellent!  Great beer list and the mac and cheese is TO DIE FOR!!!!  Awesome place!

Reviews.Author: Alexander E.
Reviews.Content: Easily one of the best Burgers in the city of Chicago. I have tried many places and this was by far the best. The burgers are huge and will fill you up. I also had gotten the hand cut fries, which were amazing. The food is why I am giving this place 4 stars. The only reason I did not give it 5 stars was because of the loud music, which makes it had to have a conversation. Other than that, they have an extensive beer list and great service. I recommend that everyone go here and try out their burgers. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Author: Courtney B.
Reviews.Content: I was seated right away, even though it looked like there might be a wait. They really cram people in. I had about a 7 inch space to suck it in and slide in between two small tables to sit in the booth side of the tables that were all lined up next to each other. So, if you're looking for privacy, forget it. I heard every word of both conversations of the tables next to me. But it's quaint. I liked how simple and straight forward the menu was.  Each burger has a number - #1 - #13, no substitutions. Each one has different ingredients. And each one is $8. Fries are extra- but these aren't just ordinary fries. We're talking parmesan truffle fries, sweet potato fries, sea salt and pepper fries or bacon & blue cheese fries.  You can order a small or a group order. I thought a small would have been fine to split between 2 people. The larger order will have you just waiting for a gripper. I had a #13 which was a portabella burger (meatless) with arugula, horseradish and marinated tomatoes. It was light and lovely, although I wish I had known the mushroom came fried. I would have preferred to have it grilled, but then there's that "no substitutions" rule posted on the menu. Maybe after they get their feet wet they'll be able to handle someone asking for a change. They have a nice beer selection as well. The food came out quickly. Our bill for 3 beers, 2 burgers and 2 small fries was $48. So, not cheap, but not just ordinary burgers either. I'd like to try some of their other selections another time. They had some "coming soom items" listed that had me curious and interested. Very nice staff and comment cards to boot. Good neighborhood addition!

Reviews.Author: michael b.
Reviews.Content: tastier burgers than kumas, with better service similar prices and more innovative menu

Reviews.Author: Jill G.
Reviews.Content: Went today for lunch and loved every bite!  We got the #1 and #2.  #1 had carmelized onions, bacon, aged cheddar and BBQ and was amazing.  #2 had onion strings and amish blue.  Both were so delicious that we could not decide which one we liked better!  The burger was the perfect size - not too big but not small either.  Buns were super tasty too.  With our burgers we ordered the sweet potato fries and the truffle parmesan fries.  They  brought us the salt & pepper fries on accident  but we didn't say anything b/c those looked so good and I secretly wanted my husband to order those anyway!  The fries were good but a little too salty for us and I have had better sweet potato fries.  Not bad by any means but we'll try the other types of fries next time.   We wanted to try dessert but were too full so next time we'll try to go in hungrier!   Will definitely be back to this place!  Staff was super friendly too - always a plus.  We thought the value was great too - burgers were only $8 and small order of fries (which is plenty) was only $2 or $3.

Reviews.Author: Kathleen B.
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had dinner here for the second time last night.  We'd originally visited the week DMK first opened and we really enjoyed it then but our second visit was absolutely fantastic.  My husband had #2 (burger with fried onion strings, blue cheese, and spicy ketchup), I had the #7 (burger with grilled portabello mushrooms, blue cheese, and dijonaisse), and we both ordered fries, salads, and drinks.  Our total bill was only around $50!  For a fanastic dinner for two with drinks that is a very reasonable price, as we'd spent $60 at the Mayan Palace the night before and the quality of food at DMK is much better.  My husband's only small complaint was that he ordered the greek salad and while the menu indicated it would have olives the salad that was served to him had none.  I'd highly recommend a visit to this place if you're a burger fan, and if you're trying to eat healthy they serve turkey burgers as well.  While it's a little loud and you might have to wait, it will definitely be worth your time.

Reviews.Author: Dan L.
Reviews.Content: DMK Burger Bar was excellent.  Everything from the interior style, music and environment, to the wait staff and management, to of course, the delicious food.  I tried a couple things last night and each one was well done.  The onion strings were very peppery, but in no way over powering.  Those came with a simple, tangy ketchup that complimented the pepper very well.  The parmesan and and truffle cream fries were spectacular.  The fries themselves were fried perfectly and you could truly enjoy the quality potatoes.  The truffle cream that accompanied it was not too strong and was the right amount of punch.  I definitely recommend burger #4 - a beef burger with green chiles, a fried egg, jack cheese a smoked bacon.  I wouldnt have changed one thing about the burger, and I usually hate the buns that burger restaurants have.  To finish the night, I tried the vanilla bean milkshake which even though I was stuffed, was too enjoyable to pass up.  You could taste real vanilla and the milkshake itself was crafted to perfection.  In addition to all of this, DMK is a great spot for a beer, as they have a truly great selection.  Stop in a try the Scotch Ale that they have right now, great for a wintery night!  I cant wait to go back and I recommend it to everyone.

Reviews.Author: Ann B.
Reviews.Content: I got there around 8 on a Friday night, it was crowded and noisy. The hostess said the wait would be 20-25 minutes, and she would "find me when my table was ready". I went to the far end of the bar, ordered a beer, and waited... After about 30 min, I went to check and she said there were still a few names ahead of my party of 2. Very good, the place was thinning out, should be any time, I thought. After about 20 add'l minutes of waiting, I went up again and gave her my name.  "Oh, I sent my manager to find you and we thought you left". Funny, I didn't tell her I was leaving when I checked on my table just shortly prior to that.  My name was crossed, and they had moved on.  She got the "manager", some 30 year old jackass, who said he looked for me based on a "visual description by the hostess". I explained the situation to him, how I had only moved from my spot at the end of the bar twice, both to go to the hostess. After a half-ass apology, he showed us a seat in the middle of a "community table", right between 2 larger groups. I had noticed this spot about 30 min prior and told him so. He said "I've already apologized 6 times, you can either sit down here or leave, and I can try to make this more pleasant" (he sure didn't sound pleasant, or like he was trying to recover poor customer service). I figured I couldn't give the place a bad review without trying the food. The manager never came back to see how things were, we got sent complimentary deviled eggs and onion straws, a lovely $7 value.  They were ok. My BBQ burger was thin on a boring bun. The fries were ok.  Probably the best thing was the spicy onion straws.....I won't be going back, I recommend the counter on diversey instead!
